(You breathe out, trying to keep your anger close to your body.)
(You'll shake from it, but it's fine.)
(You dust yourself off, and exit the bathroom.)

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: King
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: Time Craft......? I suppose I am.

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: But, if you're using Time Craft... How did you manage to control it?

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: King
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: Ha......!

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: King
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: Yes, it is true...... I could not have harvested Time Craft on my own.

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: King
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: So...... I had some help.

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: Help? Who would...?

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: King
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: Ooooh, ooooooh......     Isn't it obvious?

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: King
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: The Universe would.

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: King
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: Ah, aaaaaah! I only had to wish for it......

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: King
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: And the Universe delivered.

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: "The Universe"...? Who is that? A person?

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Isabeau
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: Nah, it's, it's...

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Isabeau
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: Wow, it's on the tip of my tongue, but I can't seem to remember.

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: It's... What's beyond this plane, correct? What's in the sky?
(You clench your fists.)
(You do not react.)
(The King sobs.)

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: King
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: Oooh, oooooooh......!!!

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: King
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: Aaaah!!! I knew Vaugardians were ignorant of it...... But I did not think travelers from other countries were, too......!

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: King
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: How......     How could you have......

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: "Vaugardians", huh...

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: Interesting choice of words. Are you not from Vaugarde yourself?

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: He isn't, madame Odile... I feel like I've seen an article about it somewhere recently.

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: I saw it today... Where was it again?

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Isabeau
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: So you're not from Vaugarde, but you still want to freeze it in time?

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Isabeau
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: Where do you call home, then?
(The King flinches.)
(He does not answer.)
(You shake your head, and breathe out.)
(An article about the King, somewhere...)
(If Mirabelle remembers it, you might've seen it somewhere too. Could it be somewhere in the House?)
(You do not react.)
(Some papers.)
(They seem to be various newspaper articles about the King.)
(...You should keep those in mind for later.)
(You never looked at them very closely before, have you?)
(You take a step forward.)

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: Oh... So many articles about the King!

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: His conquest was slow enough that the Vaugardian press had time to write about him, I remember that...

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: But there's no one to write them now.
(You all start reading random articles.)

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Isabeau
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: This article is about his slow march to Dormont's House...

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: This one is about him probably being from another country than Vaugarde...

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Siffrin
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: (Huh?)

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: Oh, apparently not.

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Isabeau
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: This article says there's no record of him anywhere... Up until he appeared out of thin air sometime in his adulthood.

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Isabeau
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: Looks like he lived in the city of Corbeaux for a few years before he became the King...

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Bonnie
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: So he was a traveler? Like Frin and Dile?

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: Please don't compare us to him, thank you.
(That's right... He did talk about "Vaugardians" before.)
(The way he phrased it... It did seem like he thought of Vaugardians as people other than himself.)
(And...  He said he thought of Vaugarde as "welcoming".)
(Always willing to welcome people in, even someone with no name, no home to speak of...)
(You should go and ask the King where he's from, later.)

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Isabeau
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: This article is about his fashion sense.

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: Huh?!?

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: From what I've heard, he does have a very distinctive hairstyle.

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Isabeau
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: This article is more about his armor, actually!

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Isabeau
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: They even included a sketch, look.

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: Hm... Well, it's very...  Shiny?

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: I suppose.

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Isabeau
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: Very imposing!
(There's something that caught your attention though...)

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: That IS a very tall crown!

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Isabeau
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: Very king-like.
(You're missing something.)

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: Pauldrons, Siffrin.

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Bonnie
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: They're so big!!!

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Isabeau
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: The pauldrons are big, and he is also very big... One pauldron might be bigger than all of us combined!

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Bonnie
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: Pauldron house...

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Isabeau
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: Pauldron house...

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: Pauldron house...

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: Stop.
(You're missing something.)

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Isabeau
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: The patterns? On his chest and gauntlets, you mean?

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Bonnie
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: It's just a weird losange. What's so weird about that?

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Bonnie
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: Stars?

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Bonnie
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: What's a star?

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Isabeau
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: The dots in the sky! Sif and I were looking at them yesterday, remember?

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: The dots in the sky, correct?
(You nod.)

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: ...  Is that so...?

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Bonnie
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: Oh.

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: This article here does mention his speech mannerisms...

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: Stars and sky-related things seem to be something he comes back to often.

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Isabeau
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: Stars, huh...?

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: What could be interesting about them?
(Stars.)
(Is there somewhere in the House where you could find out more about them?)
(A big window.)

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Bonnie
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: Stars!!!

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Bonnie
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: Those are... Stars, right? I remembered just now.

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: But don't they only appear at night...?

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: We left early in the morning, so it should still be light outside...

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Isabeau
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: I've heard it's always night time, near the King. Maybe this is his influence?

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Isabeau
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: It was dark around the House yesterday too, remember?

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: Hm...
(The stars...)
(Stars, like the King's armor. Stars, like the King keeps mentioning.)
(Stars, like...)
(You should remember them. Something in you tells you you should.)
(Every time you raise your head and look up at them, you feel like it's something you've done dozens, hundreds, thousands of times.)
(But you can't remember any of it.)
(You can't remember what you were even trying to see, looking up at them.)
(The King... Every time you face him, he asks you the same question.)
("Do you remember?")
(Remembering is not something you're very good at.)
(There's so much you can't remember.)
(You're a very forgetful person, after all.)
(You can't remember basic items.)
(You forget where you're going half the time.)
(You can barely remember people's names.)
(You've noticed you're starting to forget whole loops.)
(You can barely remember anything that happened before you started looping in time.)
(You can  barely  remember  anything  that  happened  before)
(before)
(before)
(before...)
(You   breathe out, and unclench your fists.)
(What you can and can't remember doesn't matter much now, does it.)
(The King... Does he want you to remember something?)
(Does he...)
(You should go and ask the King what he wants you to remember, later.)

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Isabeau
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: Sif? You okay?

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: Lost in thought, Siffrin?
(You open your eyes, smile, and shake your head.)
(You have to keep going.)

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: King
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: !!!!!!

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: King
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: . . . . . .
(The King looks straight at you.)

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: King
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: ......  What about you, bright one......

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: King
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: Where are you from?
(You flinch.)
(You do not answer.)
(You cannot answer.)
(You hear the King laugh.)
(Every single time you face him...)
(He asks if you remember.)
(There's something he thinks you should know... Should remember... But...)
(You ask again, but you know, you know, you know.)

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: King
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: ......

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: Does it really matter, Siffrin? He could just be trying to confuse you.

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Bonnie
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: Yeah!!! Speaking in riddles to Frin!!!

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Bonnie
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: Stop trying to confuse him! He hasn't forgotten anything!!!

(But you have, haven't you?)
(You try not to think about it, but... But...)
(You know, you know, you know.)

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Siffrin
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: "What have I forgotten?"

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: King
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: Forgotten?

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: King
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: Oh, bright one, bright one, why...... Why would you ask......

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: King
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: Don't you know at this point what you've forgotten? Haven't you always known?

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: King
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: Can't you see the hole it has left behind, if not what used to fill it?

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: King
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: Don't you feel it? Its absence?

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Isabeau
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: What the crab is he--

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: King
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: ALL OF IT!!!!!!

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: King
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: YOU'VE FORGOTTEN IT ALL, BRIGHT ONE!!!!!! THEY ALL HAVE!!!!!! WE ALL HAVE!!!!!!

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: King
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: No one can say it!!! No one can even remember it!!! It escapes us, it will keep escaping us!!!

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: King
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: Ooooh, why don't you remember?! I can tell!

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: King
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: Everything, from your accent, to the way you use Craft, to the stitching on your cloak and hat, to those pins you wear--

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: King
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: You should remember!!! You and I, of all people standing here, should remember!!!!!!

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: King
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue:
Bright one, please, please!!!
Just remember it!!!
Say it!!! Make it real!!!

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: King
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue:
Please......
If you can remember, then......
Then maybe......

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: King
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: ......
(...)

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: What is happening? Is he okay...?

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: Something we've all forgotten...?

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Bonnie
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: I haven't forgotten anything, stupid!!!
(Something you've forgotten.)
(Something everyone has, even if they don't pay attention to it.)
(The hole it has left behind.)
(Something bigger than just the stars.)
(What you're trying to remember doesn't exist anymore, but...)
(But someone might still have written proof it existed, haven't they?)

(You know,
you know,
you know.)

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: Oh, this one looks fairly recent!

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: We could read a little bit... Like, a tiny bit.
(You probably should, right now.)

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Isabeau
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: Aw, boo...
(You get away from the diary.)

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: We do not have time...

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: ...Is what I would usually say, but I'd also love to think about boring, mundane, everyday problems for a bit.

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Isabeau
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: Dear diary, save us from thinking about our problems!

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Bonnie
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: Belle, pick a page!!!

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: One page, and then we're going.

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: I, I'm reading again? Okay, hmmm...
(Everyone huddles around her.)
(Mirabelle takes a deep breath, and opens it straight in the middle.)

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: Okay...

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Diary
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: "Mom told me to clean my room today."

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Diary
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: "I HATE CLEANING MY ROOM!!! MY ROOM ISN'T EVEN DIRTY!! WHY DOESN'T SHE UNDERSTAND!!!!!!!"

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Diary
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: "Urgh. Also, Dad noticed no one can say the name of the island north of here anymore?"

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Diary
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: "I tried to say it yesterday and I got like the WEIRDEST headache for HOURS."

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Diary
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: "Might trick my friends into saying it tomorrow."
(The rest is just doodles of a little girl laughing uproariously.)

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: Ah, the island north of Vaugarde... I remember when it happened.

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: Well... "Remember" isn't the right word, is it?  We all just know something happened.

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: An entire stretch of land disappearing from people's minds doesn't happen often, does it?

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Bonnie
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: I think, I think my village was really close to it!!! My sister said it was all everyone could talk about for weeks!!!

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: That's so frightening... I'm glad that whatever happened, she didn't get caught up in it!

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Bonnie
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: Oh... yeah...

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Bonnie
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: Still...

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Bonnie
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: That country's name... What was it's name again?

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Isabeau
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: Oh, I think it was something like--

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: DON'T

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: SAY IT!!!!

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Isabeau
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: CRAB!!!!

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Bonnie
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: NYEHEHEHEHEHEHEHEH!!!!!!!!!!
(Huh! What an interesting diary entry!)
(You open your mouth, but no sound comes out.)
(The name of this country...)
(You try to remember, remember, remember.)
(Only silence answers you.)
(Is this... What the King wanted you to remember?)
("Just remember it... Say it... Make it real...")
(You can't say it, you don't even want to try, but...)
(You turn to Isabeau.)
(You turn to Isabeau.)
(Maybe this time?)

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Isabeau
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: Huh, but whyyyyyyyyyy ? It's just gonna give me a heada--
(Isabeau looks at you.)
(Something about your expression makes him reconsider.)

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Isabeau
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: Well... Sure, Sif! I'll say it!

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Isabeau
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: That country's name was. . .

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Isabeau
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: Was. . .

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Isabeau
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: You know, I had it before, but now that I'm actively trying to remember it, nothing comes to mind?

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: Huh, is that so?

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Bonnie
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: You're dumb, Za, I know it! It's. . .

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Bonnie
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: Weh? But...

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: Wait...

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: Huh?! What's...

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Isabeau
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: Can't remember it either, yeah?

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Isabeau
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: When you asked me, answering you felt automatic, like if you asked me what 1 plus 1 makes, but trying to remember it now is more like...

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: Like calculating 72 times 89!!!

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Isabeau
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: Nah, that's 6408, I have a brain and I know how to use it.

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: WHAT?

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: ISABEAU?

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Isabeau
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: Nah, it felt more like...

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Isabeau
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: Asking me to remember my first steps.

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Isabeau
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: How can I remember that!!! I can't remember that!!! How can you expect me to remember that!!!

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: What a terrible analogy.

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: But I can't seem to remember it either... When we were talking about it, I could think it clearly, but trying to remember it now, let alone say it...

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: I can't remember the country itself, either! I just remember it was an island, north of Vaugarde...

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: And... And it had a different belief than the Change belief, didn't it? Something about the sky...?

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Siffrin
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: (You know.)

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Siffrin
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: (You know, you know, you know.)

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: That's right! The Universe!

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Bonnie
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: Oh yeah... Like, stars and stuff.

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: We also know that people could remember that country clearly, before.

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: And. . .

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: Urgh, my head is killing me.

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Bonnie
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: And we know that trying to remember stuff makes our brains hurt.

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: Let's stop here. It'd be bad to fight the King with a raging migraine...

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Isabeau
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: Yeah...

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Isabeau
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: Sorry we couldn't say it, Sif!
(You don't respond.)
(Stars...)
(So the King is from that country as well.)
(The country no one can remember.)
(Your country. The country you were born in, raised in, spent your entire childhood in.)
(And yet...)
(Even now, thinking about it, what it may have looked like...)
(You can't even imagine it.)
(For a long time now, you haven't been able to remember anything about it. You forget it even exists, half the time.)
(Anything linked to that country has just stopped existing for you.)
(Your childhood, your parents, your life, your language, your culture, your faith, the stars, the constellations, the Universe.)
(It's all gone, forgotten.)
(The King... He was from there, you're sure of it.)
(And then, something happened, and the country disappeared without a trace, unable to be remembered by anyone.)
(No one can remember what made everyone forget about its very existence... But something must've, right?)
(But... If it happened... If he's so attached to it, he asks you if you remember it every single time you see him...)
(If he's so attached to that country... Why would he be so obsessed with Vaugarde, then?)
(Why would he decide to freeze it all in time?)
(You can't figure it out quite yet, but there must be something somewhere... Something that's similar to his goal...)
(Who cares, who cares, who cares.)
(A mirror.)
(You and your [allies/family members] are reflected in it.)

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Bonnie
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: That's a big mirror.

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: Massive, even... And there's not really anything else of interest in this room.

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: I don't know anything about it... Before the house shifted around because of the King, it was in a part of the House I didn't often walk by...

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Isabeau
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: Hm.
(Isabeau is looking for the switch.)

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Isabeau
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: If it is what I think it is, then... It should be...

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Isabeau
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: Ah HA!

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Isabeau
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: Everyone, say "FROMAGE"!

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Bonnie
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: Froma--

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Bonnie
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: Wh-WHAT WAS THAT?!?

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: Oh, look! Something's on the ground...

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: A piece of paper...?

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Isabeau
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: Ehehehe... BEHOLD!!!

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: Oh!!!
(It's a picture of all of you.)

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: It's us!!!

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: This is lovely.

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Isabeau
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: Isn't it? It's a crafted mirror that takes pictures!!!

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Isabeau
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: I heard rumors that someone was creating one, but I didn't know this someone lived in Dormont's House!

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Bonnie
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: We look so surprised!

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: Hehe, only Isabeau knew this was coming!

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: Pictures are so rare... It's nice to have one of us.

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: Thank you for telling us about it, and for taking a picture, Isabeau!

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Isabeau
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: Oh!

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Isabeau
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: Hehe... It's nothing!

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: What should we do with it?

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: Hm...
(Odile looks at you.)

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: Would you keep it safe, oh one with all the secret pockets?
(You nod.)
(You got the MIRROR PICTURE!)
(You put the picture in your pocket along with your Souvenirs.)
(You're glad to have the picture back. It's proof.)
(Proof that you're here on this journey, proof that you were with your [allies/family members], proof that you love them.)
(Even if you forget, and you forget a lot... It's proof that you and your friends existed.)
(Proof that you were happy.)
(Proof that this moment happened...)
(Perfectly frozen in time.)
(After the country was forgotten, the King was welcomed by Vaugarde, wasn't he?)
(Welcomed, helped, and loved.)
(To the point where he sees Vaugarde as "perfect".)
(But... No one knows why the country was forgotten.)
(What's keeping Vaugarde from being forgotten the exact same way?)
(Wasn't it his duty, as thanks for welcoming him, to make sure such a fate would never befall Vaugarde?)
(What else could he do  but make sure this perfect country was preserved in amber forever?)
(How could he ever let go?)
(. . . You understand the King more than you'd like to.)
(But... But still, he's...)
(You want to talk to him again.)
(This feels important... But you'd still like to talk to the Head Housemaiden during this loop, while you're so close to your family members.)
(Are you sure you want to ask the King about this now...?)
(You open your mouth.)
(You shake your head.)
(You can ask him later.)

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Siffrin
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: "Where are you from?"
(Will he say it if you ask?)
(Can he say it?)
(Someone asked you this exact question before, and you couldn't answer, you couldn't say anything, you forgot it all, but... But...!!!)

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: King
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue:
Where......
Where I'm from......?

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: King
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue:
Oooooh......
Bright one.....
If you're asking, with such a look in your eye......

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: King
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue:
Do you remember, then?
Can you see it?
Can you picture it?

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: King
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue:
Bright one. Bright one, please, you can't......
You have to remember......

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: King
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue:
I know you can, we both can......
We're the only ones present here who can!!!

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: What...?

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: Siffrin, what is he talking about?

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Isabeau
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: Sif? Sif, are you okay?

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: King
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: Bright one......

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: King
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: . . . . . .

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: King
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue:
No.     You're trying, I can tell.
But the knowledge keeps escaping you, doesn't it...... Slipping through your fingers......

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: King
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: It is the same for me.

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: King
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue:
But we have to try to remember, bright one!!!
I see flashes of it, of what was!!!

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: King
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue:
The mountains!!!
The sea!!!
The lightless sand, dark like the night sky!!!

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: King
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue:
Our country, bright one!!!
Our country!!!
Our home!!!!!!

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: King
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue:
We have to say it!!!
We cannot let oblivion win!!!
Our home!!!!!!

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: King
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue:
We can rebuild it, together!!!
Your power and mine!!!
We just have to wish for it!!!
We just have to ask!!!!!!

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: King
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: WE JUST HAVE TO SAY ITS NAME!!!!!
(NGH...!!!)

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: AH!!!

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Isabeau
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: SIF?!

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: King
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: AH!!!!!!

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: King
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: No, no, no......
(You heard it, he said it, he tried to say it! Your country's name, your home, your--)
(No, no, it's gone, it's gone!!!!!!)
(Did he say it, all of it?! Did he say it?!?)
(You couldn't hear it, can't remember it, can't--)

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: W-What's happening?!

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: The King is attacking Siffrin... Everyone, protect him!!!

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Bonnie
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: Stop talking, King!!! Leave Frin alone!!!

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Isabeau
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: Sif!!!
(Your head, it feels like it's splitting in two--)
(Your country, your home!!!)
(You can't remember it!!! It's gone, it's gone, it's gone!!!)
(gone from your past   gone from your mind   gone from the very planet you stand on and it was yours!!! It was yours!!!)
(It was yours and it's gone and you can't even say its name!!!)
(But if he--     If the King could, then maybe--)
(MAYBE...!!!)
(You have to say it!!! If he couldn't do it, maybe you can! Maybe you both can!!!)

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: King
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: Bright one, please, please!!!!!!
(You inhale, you try to grasp it, grasp its name--)

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: King
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: NO!!!!!!
(Your throat... Your head......!!!)
(It hurts, it hurts...)
(You spit blood, you hack up, you have to get it out--)

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: King
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: Bright one, I-- Almost heard it, I......!!!

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: King
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue:
Please, again!!!
Once again, we have to try......
Together!!!!!!
(Your entire body hurts...!!!)
(You can't hear it, you can't remember it, it's useless!!!)
(Let it die, let it be forgotten! You don't need it, you don't need to know--)

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: King
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: BRIGHT ONE!!!!!!
(No, no, no, you can't, you won't.)
(Hands clutching your head, you take a step back, then another.)
(Everyone lines up before you.)

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Isabeau
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: Sif, what's happening?! Talk to us!!!

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: Don't listen to the King, Siffrin!!! We'll protect you!!!

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: King
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: BRIGHT ONE!!! SAY IT!!!!!!

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: Don't look at him, you're fighting us right now--

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Bonnie
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: Go away!!! Stop hurting Frin!!!

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: King
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue:
PLEASE!!!!!!
IF WE SAY IT TOGETHER, TWO PEOPLE OF THE SAME COUNTRY, I'M SURE WE CAN--

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: King
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue:
WE CAN REMEMBER IT!!!
PLEASE!!!!!!
(Your entire body hurts...!!!)
(Your head is killing you!!!)
(But you have to try, you have to--)

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Isabeau
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: We have to stop the King...!!!

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: Siffrin, whatever he's telling you to say, STOP!!!

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Bonnie
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: FRIN!!!

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: SIFFRIN!!!!!!
(But you have to, but you have to!!!)
(What do they know, anyway? What do they understand, anyway?! )
(The pain of not remembering your own blinding country!!! Your own home!!!)
(The King is right, you have to get it back, you HAVE TO GET IT BACK...!!!!!!)
(You inhale...)
(Someone is screaming)
(You realize     it's your own voice)
(your throat   feels raw    your head feels like    it's splitting in two      your stoma ch    feels   like a    bl ack   hole--)
(the scent of   sug ar   is all    a rou nd you,    so   th   ick   yo   u    alm os t    ga g   o n    it)
(yo   u      c   a n    '   t
h o    l      d      o    n    t o     a  n   y   t  h    i n   g
a   n     y     m     o     r     e)
(     y     o      u

(You won't,
you won't,
you won't!!!!!!)
(You shake your head and cover your mouth!)
(BETTER KILL THE HOPE BEFORE IT GETS CRUSHED!!!)

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: King
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: BRIGHT ONE!!!

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Siffrin
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: "I WILL NOT, I CANNOT!!!"

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Siffrin
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: "Our country is gone, King!!! It's gone and buried!!!"

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Siffrin
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: "What good will it do to remember it?!?"

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Siffrin
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: "We don't need to remember! We need to let it go! We HAVE to let it go!!!"

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Siffrin
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: "Let it die! Let it DIE!!!! LET IT DIE!!!!!!"

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: King
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: No, no, no, aaah......

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: King
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: NO......!!!!!!
(You hear the King scream)
(You feel wind on your face)
(And t h e   n)
(Ah!!!!!!)
(Ah, ah, aaaaaaaaah......)
(You cough, cough, cough.)
(You cough until you can't move or even breathe anymore.)
(Your throat hurts.)
(You   couldn't say it.)
(You couldn't say it.)
(You cover your mouth with both hands, and try not to breathe, try not to make a single sound.)
(You can't say it.)
(Even now, you can't say it, because you know, you know, you know...)
(Something terrible will happen if you try. Something has to.)
(That's the reason you won't try to say it, will never try to say it, that's the reason, the only reason.)
(Hope is for braver people than you are!!!!!)
(You gasp loudly.)
(And breathe in.)
(And out.)
(And in.)
(And out.)
(And in.)
(And out.)
(Couldn't even stick to it.)
(You should have tried to say it twice.)
(It would've worked, if you said it twice, it would've worked, it would have, you just know it would have.)
(See, if you say it now, it might work! You might be able to say it! Just say it! Just say it!!! JUST SAY IT!!!!!! )
(No sounds come out of your mouth.)
(What was the point, anyway? What was the point of saying its name? What was the King thinking?!?)
(It's gone.)
(Your home is gone, and has been for a long time.)
(There's nothing you can do to bring it back. Doesn't the King see that?)
(Doesn't he see that you have to let it go?)
(You start laughing.)
(Will you ever take your own advice?)
(Ha.)
(You need to go and talk to the King.)
(One  last  time.)

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Siffrin
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: "Let's stop fighting."

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: SIFFRIN?!?

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: What are you--

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: King
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: ......
(You don't need to fight anymore, do you?)
(You understand what the King wants! How he feels!)
(If only you could make him understand...!!!)

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Siffrin
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: "We don't have to fight..."

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Siffrin
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: "We're looking for the same thing!!!"

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: King
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: ......!!!

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Siffrin
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: "I know! I understand why you're doing this!"

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Siffrin
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: "But this isn't the way to do it!"

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Siffrin
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: "We can protect this country another way! You don't need to freeze it forever!"

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Siffrin
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: "Do you really want it all to end?"

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: King
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: ......

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Siffrin
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: "Let's just stop fighting! Leave this country be!"

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Siffrin
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: "We don't need to keep holding onto it..."

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Siffrin
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: "Let's just... Let it go..."

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Siffrin
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: "We have to let it go, King..."

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: King
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: . . . . . .

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: King
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: . . . . . .

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: King
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: ......  I......

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: King
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: ......

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: King
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: ......  Perhaps you are right, bright one.

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Isabeau
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: HUH?!??

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: WHAT?!?

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: King
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: Let us stop this battle.

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: King
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue:
Let us talk to one another......
As people from the same country......
(The King has stopped fighting you.)
(You lower your dagger.)

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: Siffrin...!

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Bonnie
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: Is... Is this it?

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Bonnie
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: You're gonna stop, just like that?!

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: Boniface...

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Bonnie
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: You destroyed my home, froze my sister, froze all of Vaugarde in time...

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Bonnie
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: AND YOU'LL JUST STOP, JUST LIKE THAT?!?

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: King
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: Ooh, ooooooh......

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: King
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: I will.

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: King
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: I have fought for long enough.

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: King
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue:
And......
I'm starting to realize that even if I did win......

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: King
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: My victory would be short lived.

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Bonnie
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: Because you'd be frozen in time yourself, maybe?

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Bonnie
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: Stupid.

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: King
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: ......

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: King
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: Perhaps.

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: King
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue:
But......
If someone from my own country is the one asking......
Then, shouldn't I listen......?

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: King
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: Oooh, ooooooh......

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: King
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue:
After all......
Only a fellow compatriot would understand my pain.

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: You said... You and Siffrin are from the same country...?

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Bonnie
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: We... We don't know where Frin is from, so...

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Isabeau
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: What happened?
(The King cries out.)

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: King
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: Ooooh, oooooh......

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: King
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue:
But that's the problem, isn't it?
That's what we'd like to know as well, isn't it......?

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: King
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue:
If I mention it......
You might be able to remember it, for a brief second......

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: King
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: ......The fate of the island, north of Vaugarde.

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Isabeau
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: An island north of Vaugarde...?

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: Is it perhaps... The one we can't say the name of?

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: The one no one can remember anything about...!

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: King
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: The very one.

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Bonnie
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: That's where you're both from? So then, what happened?

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: King
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: ......
(The King sobs.)

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: King
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: I suppose your story might be similar to mine, bright one......

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: King
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue:
One day......
I just woke up on a beach, on a coast north of Vaugarde.

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: King
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: I woke up slowly, as people sometimes do, expecting to remember where I was, what I was supposed to be doing that day......

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: King
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue:
But......
Nothing came to mind.

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: King
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: And as I realized nothing came to mind, I also realized......

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: King
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: I could not remember a single thing.

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: King
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: What I was doing here on this beach, what chores I had to do on that day......

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: King
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: How I got here, why I didn't recognize my surroundings......

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: King
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: My past, my family, my name, the language I spoke, the alphabet I wrote with, the stars, the country's inhabitants, culture, beliefs, its very name......!!!

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: King
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: I could not remember anything!!!!!!

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: King
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue:
Because all my memories, everything even slightly connected to the country I came from......
Just......

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: King
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: Cannot be accessed easily, anymore.

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: King
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue:
And......
It makes sense, doesn't it?

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: King
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: No one on this planet can remember our home as it was.

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: King
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: Most people from outside it, who had limited ties to it, only forgot the country's existence.....

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: King
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: Maybe forgot a friend from there, or a distant family member......

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: King
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: But for someone who had ties to it.

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: King
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: Who was born there, lived in it, breathed it day and night......

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: King
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: There would be nothing to remember.

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: King
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: There would just be......

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: King
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: Emptiness.

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: King
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: I was cut off from my very existence.

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: King
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue:
My entire past, my entire identity......
Erased.

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: King
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: ......Memories make up the core of who we are, don't they?

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: King
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue:
They're proof that we existed.
That we are real.

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: King
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: Can you be certain of anything, if you do not remember how you learned it?

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: King
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: And if you do not remember your past......

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: King
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: If you only know it has been erased from your memory, because something happened to your home......

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: King
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: And if SOMETHING happened, but no one remembers what, or why......

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: King
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: Then . . . . . .

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Siffrin
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: "...Then, what's stopping it from happening again?"

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: King
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: What if we forget it all?

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Siffrin
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: "What if we lose it all, once more?"
(The King sobs.)

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Siffrin
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: "And you had to make sure it wouldn't happen again."

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: King
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: At any cost necessary.

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Siffrin
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: "And if the Universe led you on this path..."

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: King
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: Then it must be what the Universe wants.

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: King
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: "The Universe......"

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: King
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: "We can only......"
(..."Follow".)

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: King
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: Hahahaha......

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: King
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue:
Oh, oooh......
Even if you don't agree with my methods, bright one......
I can tell you understand.

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: King
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue:
No matter what......
I could not let this happen again!
I could not!!!!!!

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: King
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: NOT TO VAUGARDE!!!!!!

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: King
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: NOT TO VAUGARDIANS, WHO HOUSED ME, CARED FOR ME, LOVED ME!!!!!!

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: King
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: I DO NOT WANT TO FORGET IT ALL, NOT AGAIN!!!!!!

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: King
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue:
I WILL KEEP THE THINGS I LOVE CLOSE TO ME!!!!!!
I WILL MAKE SURE THEY CAN KEEP EXISTING!!!!!!

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: King
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: SO THAT THEY CAN BE REMEMBERED, FOREVER!!!!!!!!!!!!

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: King
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: ......

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: King
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue:
That was what I thought.
This whole time.
This whole time......

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: King
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: ......

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: King
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue:
But, ah......
I can see that I was mistaken.

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: King
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: You're right, bright one.

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: King
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: We can find another way to protect the people we love.

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: King
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue:
So......
Please, while I still can......
Let me change my mind.

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: King
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: Let me help you.

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: ...  Change...

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: Mirabelle...

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: Madame, if he truly means it...   Shouldn't we try?

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: Or are we deciding he cannot change?

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: I can't believe that... I want to believe... That even the worst person can change...!

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: Hm...

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Siffrin
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: "Odile..."

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Siffrin
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: "Please."

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Siffrin
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: "We have to try."

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Isabeau
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: ...  I'm with Mira and Sif!

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: ...Fine.

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Bonnie
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: Okay. I'll follow you, Frin, but...

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Bonnie
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: I dunno, I...

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Bonnie
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: I'll trust you all. I can't... I can't do anything anyway.
(You breathe out.)
(If you can end this loop without fighting...)
(If you and the King can come to an understanding...)

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: King
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: Ooooooh......

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: King
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue:
Then......
Bright one......
Siffrin.

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: King
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: Won't you stand next to me......?

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: King
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue:
I can bring everyone back.
Make sure they'll all move again.

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: King
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue:
We can save this country......
Together.

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: King
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue:
But......
I cannot break the Curse on my own.

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: King
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue:
Creating the Curse was easy, but unravelling it......
Asks for more power than I possess.

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: King
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue:
But with the help of someone else......
Someone who truly wishes for the Curse to be lifted......

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: Is that how it works...?

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: King
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: It does, if someone wants it enough.

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: ...Siffrin... Should I do it?
(If all that's needed for the Curse to break is your help...)
(You're the one who made the King change his mind. The least you can do is help.)
(You start to walk over to the King.)

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: King
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: ......

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: King
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: Haha......

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: King
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: HAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHA!!!!!!

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: King
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: Oh, bright one......

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: King
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: Not that bright, after all.
(Something's wrong.)
(Why would the King agree to help you so easily?)
(Something's wrong. Something's wrong. Something's wrong.)
(You do not move.)

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: King
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: ......

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: King
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue:
Hahaha......
It is of no matter.

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: King
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: You're all close enough.
(NGH...!!!)
(No, no, no, why?!?)
(The King froze your bodies in time!!!)
(You can think and move your head, still, so it's not over, but...)
(You can't move...!!!)

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Isabeau
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: NO, NO...

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: KING, YOU--!!!

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: I-I can't move... Why can't I move?!

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: King
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue:
Bright one.
Siffrin.

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: King
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue:
Is this really all I needed to do?
To make you trust me?

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: King
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: I just needed to listen to your empty words, to tell you how sad I am, to make you think I was pathetic, to be pitied?

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: King
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue:
You should have told me sooner.
Killing you like this is easier than fighting.

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Isabeau
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: WHAT--

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: NO!!! EVERYONE!!!

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: King
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: What was it you wanted me to do......?

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: King
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue:
Let go of my goal?
Let go of my wish?

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: King
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: LET GO OF THE WISH THAT KEPT ME GOING ALL THOSE YEARS?!?

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: King
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: I WILL NEVER LET IT GO!!!!!!

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: King
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue:
VAUGARDE!!!!!!
OUR COUNTRY!!!!!!
I WILL MAKE SURE THEY ARE KEPT PERFECT FOREVER!!!!!!

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: King
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue:
Because, ooooooh......
I can tell, Siffrin.

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: King
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: This isn't how it should be.

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: King
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue:
I saw it all, you know.
I saw the signs.

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: King
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue:
The way you came in to face me.
Like you knew exactly what you were about to fight.
The way your companions all flinched, hearing my voice, but not you.

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: King
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: The way you knew about my home, the way you can keep it at the forefront of your mind, like you've practiced as I have.

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: King
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue:
Yes......
Oooooh, ooooooooh, I can tell!
I can tell, Siffrin!!!!!!

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: King
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue:
I SHOULD'VE WON!!!!!!
I SHOULD'VE WON LONG AGO!!!!!!
But something went wrong, didn't it?

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: King
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: VICTORY KEEPS ESCAPING MY GRASP!!!!!!

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: King
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: Siffrin.

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: King
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue:
It's you, isn't it?
The one who's keeping me from winning?

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: King
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: HOW MANY TIMES HAVE YOU KEPT ME FROM VICTORY, SIFFRIN?
(!!!)
(You can't breathe.)

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Isabeau
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: What is he talking about...?

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: What...

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: King
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue:
Hahaha......
I can tell......

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: King
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue:
I can feel it......
This scent.....
This overpowering sweet scent......

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: King
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: I can taste the power of Wish Craft on you.

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: "Wish Craft"...?

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: King
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: I can tell, Siffrin.

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: King
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: IT'S YOU!

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: King
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: YOU'RE THE ONE KEEPING ME FROM TOTAL VICTORY!

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: King
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: YOU'RE THE ONE KEEPING ME FROM MY PERFECT ENDING!!!!!!

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: King
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue:
IF ONLY......
IF ONLY YOU WEREN'T HERE.....!!!!!!

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: King
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue:
But, ah.
A quick death would be too easy for you.

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: King
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: You'd just come back anyway, won't you?

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: King
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: I just need to make sure that today......

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: King
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: You learn your lesson.

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Bonnie
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: Ah...!
(THE KING GRABBED ONTO BONNIE!!!)

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: BONNIE!!!!!!

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: NO!!!!!!

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Isabeau
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: CURSE YOU, KING, LET THEM GO!!!!!!

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: King
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: Hah....

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: King
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue:
Bright one.
Siffrin.
Look at me.

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: King
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: You need to learn to not cross me again.

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: King
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue:
I will kill this child.
And your Housemaiden.
And your Fighter.
And your Researcher.

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: King
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: I will kill them all, one after the other.

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: King
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue:
I will kill them all now, and make sure you remember .
I will force you to watch.

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: King
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: So you will learn.

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Bonnie
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: FRIN...!!! AH!!!!!!
(The King is tightening his grip...!!!)
(BONNIE!!!)

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: NO!!!!! PLEASE, NO!!!!!!

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: COME ON, STUPID BODY, MOVE!!!!!!!!

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: BONIFACE!!!!!

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Isabeau
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: NO, NO, NO, NO, NO, BONBON!!!!!!!
(NONE OF YOU CAN MOVE...!!!!!!)
(Your whole body hurts, you can't move, but you have to do something, save Bonnie!!!!)
(You need to find a way to loop back somehow, you need to die, a tear, anything--)
(JUST LOOP BACK!!!!!!!)

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Bonnie
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: Help me...!!!! I'm scared!!!!!

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Isabeau
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: JUST LET THEM GO, PLEASE...!!!!
(Not Bonnie, please...)
(Your stomach feels like it's caving in on itself)

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: CURSE YOU, KING!!!! CURSE YOU AND YOUR WHOLE COUNTRY!!! CURSE YOU AND EVERYTHING YOU STAND FOR!!!!!
(You taste sugar on your tongue)

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: BONNIE!!!!!!! AAAAAAAAAAAAH...!!!!!
(You have to loop back)
(loop back loop back loop back loop back loop back loop back loop back loop back loop back loop back loop back loop back loop back LOOP BACK)

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Bonnie
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: FRIN!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: King
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: When you come back, bright one......

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: King
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: Remember this.
(LOOP BACK)

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Bonnie
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: F  R  I
(AH--!!!)
(Stars, no, no, no, no, no--)
(You clutch your chest and try to catch your breath and forget!!!)
(It's fine!!!)
(You looped back!!! It's fine!!! It's fine!!! They're fine!!! Bonnie is fine!!!)
(Looping resets everything!!! Everything that just happened has been erased!!! Everything is back to normal!!! Bonnie is back to normal!!!)
(Just go and see them!!! They're fine!!! They're fine!!!)
(THEY'RE  FINE!!!!)
(They're fine.)
(They're fine.)
(You're fine.)
(A whimper escapes you.)
(No, you're okay, Bonnie is okay, everyone is okay.)
(They have to be okay)
(Just breathe.)
(breathe breathe breathe breathe breathe breathe)
(Bonnie)
(Bonnie is      okay.)
(You're okay.)
(Ha, see, because of the way loops work, they won't remember anything. They're not hurt, everything is back to normal.)
(There's no reason the loops would work differently this time.)
(Just breathe, and stand up, and make sure.)
(Get back to the stage.)
(Follow the script.)
(You have to make sure Bonnie is okay.)

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: Siffrin! You're--

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: Oh Change, you look...

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: You look really, really tired! I thought you were taking a nap! D-Did you not sleep well?

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Siffrin
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: "Not really, haha!"

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: Oh no... I'm sorry to hear that...

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: I was going to tell you something, b-but forget about it! Go on and do whatever you need to today!!!

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Siffrin
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: "Sure."

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Siffrin
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: "Do you know if Bonnie is okay?"

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: Bonnie...? Why wouldn't they be?

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: I saw them near the fields earlier, to the East, if you'd like to talk to them...?
(You nod.)

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: O-Okay...

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: I-I'll leave you alone... Make sure to rest up, and we'll meet for dinner at the Clocktower later!
(You nod again.)
(Habit takes over, and you tell her about the CARROT method.)

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: W-Wait, how did you know about--
(...And wink.)

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: O-Okay...
(Mirabelle learned the Craft Skill "Adorable Moving Shield" again.)
(You need to see if Bonnie is okay.)
(Bonnie is here, alive and whole.)

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Siffrin
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: "BONBON..!!!"

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Bonnie
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: H-Huh?! What did you--

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Siffrin
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: "Bonnie."

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Siffrin
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: "How are you?"

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Bonnie
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: ...I'm... Okay?

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Siffrin
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: "Good."

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Bonnie
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: And... How   are you...?

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Bonnie
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: You look bummed out. What's wrong?

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Siffrin
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: "Nothing is wrong at all!"

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Bonnie
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: ...Okay.

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Bonnie
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: Well. Um.

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Bonnie
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: What do you want?
(Nothing.)
(You have to go and see Loop.)

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Isabeau
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: Si--

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Isabeau
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: Woah, what's wrong?

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Siffrin
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: "I need to do the Favor Tree thing."

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Isabeau
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: Oh. Do you... Need me to leave?

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Isabeau
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: Sure. But let's talk later, okay?

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Loop
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: Hey--

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Siffrin
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: "Stop."

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Siffrin
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: "Just say 'I told you so', and we can move on."

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Loop
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: I TOLD YOU SO!!!

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Loop
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: Teehee, what a stupid idea you had!!! Thinking the King could be turned good!!!

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Loop
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: He's the King!!! He's probably the reason you're here, or related to it, at least!!!

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Loop
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: And all you had to do was find out he shares your tragic backstory for you to feel pity for him. He didn't have to lift a finger!

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Loop
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: And because of you... Bonnie was--

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Loop
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: Anyway, I told you so.

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Loop
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: But... What he said back then...

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Siffrin
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: "He mentioned something..."

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Siffrin
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: "Something about 'Wish Craft'."

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Loop
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: He did.

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Siffrin
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: "What's 'Wish Craft'?"

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Loop
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: I don't know.

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Loop
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: Wish Craft... Crafting wishes? That sounds impossible, and way too convenient.

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Loop
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: But he seemed to imply you were using it? That's what it felt like to me.

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Siffrin
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: "I've never heard of Wish Craft before."

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Loop
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: Me neither. I wouldn't even know where to find information about it.

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Loop
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: But... That IS new information.

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Loop
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: So, as stupid as the whole "making friends with the King" was...

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Loop
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: You did find something new.
(Was it worth it?)
(Every time you close your eyes, you still see a hand, tightening.)

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Loop
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: I'm also wondering... The way you looped last time, wasn't it...

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Loop
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: Whatever, it's not like your Kid will remember whatever just happened anyway!

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Loop
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: Just put it behind you!

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Loop
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: And this whole thing gave you something else, didn't it?

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Loop
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: Another Memory to equip.
(Oh.)
(You didn't even notice...)

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Loop
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: You'll always remember this, after all.

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Loop
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: Let me do the usual.

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Loop
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: [You got a MEMORY OF MEMORIES. When equipped, Memory of Memories allows you to read books you couldn't before!]

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Loop
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: The ones written in that language that just gives you a headache. The ones from your country.
(Oh, how useful and neat, to be able to read your own blinding language.)
(You might as well read any books you find, before you forget again.)
(Like you do everything else.)

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Loop
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: And, if you can read that language...

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Loop
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: Maybe you can explore the House a bit more.

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Loop
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: Don't despair, stardust. There's still a path to follow!

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Loop
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: ...You should talk to me about the loops, too. I can help you figure out what to do next.

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Loop
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: In the meantime, though...

acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.speaker: Loop
acts/act3-4/kingquest.html.dialogue: How can I help you on this wonderful new loop?

acts/act3-4/loophangout.html.speaker: Siffrin
acts/act3-4/loophangout.html.dialogue: "So."

acts/act3-4/loophangout.html.speaker: Loop
acts/act3-4/loophangout.html.dialogue: Sooooooo?

acts/act3-4/loophangout.html.speaker: Siffrin
acts/act3-4/loophangout.html.dialogue: "Got any theories about the loops I'm trapped in?"

acts/act3-4/loophangout.html.speaker: Loop
acts/act3-4/loophangout.html.dialogue: Why would I?

acts/act3-4/loophangout.html.speaker: Siffrin
acts/act3-4/loophangout.html.dialogue: "Your name is LITERALLY 'Loop'."

acts/act3-4/loophangout.html.speaker: Loop
acts/act3-4/loophangout.html.dialogue: Oh, stars above, it is! Teehee!
(URGH.)

acts/act3-4/loophangout.html.speaker: Loop
acts/act3-4/loophangout.html.dialogue: But just because I call myself "Loop" doesn't mean I know anything! I'm just bad at names!!!

acts/act3-4/loophangout.html.speaker: Loop
acts/act3-4/loophangout.html.dialogue: But I'll see what I can do. What's your question?

acts/act3-4/loophangout.html.speaker: Siffrin
acts/act3-4/loophangout.html.dialogue: "Do you know anything that could help?"

acts/act3-4/loophangout.html.speaker: Loop
acts/act3-4/loophangout.html.dialogue: Such a broad question, stardust!

acts/act3-4/loophangout.html.speaker: Loop
acts/act3-4/loophangout.html.dialogue: As I've told you before... I know as much as you do, right now.

acts/act3-4/loophangout.html.speaker: Siffrin
acts/act3-4/loophangout.html.dialogue: "How can that be?"

acts/act3-4/loophangout.html.speaker: Loop
acts/act3-4/loophangout.html.dialogue: What do you mean?

acts/act3-4/loophangout.html.speaker: Siffrin
acts/act3-4/loophangout.html.dialogue: "Aren't you here to help me?"

acts/act3-4/loophangout.html.speaker: Siffrin
acts/act3-4/loophangout.html.dialogue: "Why don't you know more about the loops you're supposed to help me with...?"

acts/act3-4/loophangout.html.speaker: Loop
acts/act3-4/loophangout.html.dialogue: Tee--

acts/act3-4/loophangout.html.speaker: Siffrin
acts/act3-4/loophangout.html.dialogue: "Don't you 'Teehee' me."

acts/act3-4/loophangout.html.speaker: Loop
acts/act3-4/loophangout.html.dialogue: Awwwwwwwww.

acts/act3-4/loophangout.html.speaker: Loop
acts/act3-4/loophangout.html.dialogue: I still don't have a good answer for you, stardust!

acts/act3-4/loophangout.html.speaker: Loop
acts/act3-4/loophangout.html.dialogue: Isn't it already nice that you have me to talk to about those loops?

acts/act3-4/loophangout.html.speaker: Loop
acts/act3-4/loophangout.html.dialogue: You could be alone, stuck with only your tiny brain for company, with no one to talk to!

acts/act3-4/loophangout.html.speaker: Loop
acts/act3-4/loophangout.html.dialogue: Okay, okay, okay...

acts/act3-4/loophangout.html.speaker: Loop
acts/act3-4/loophangout.html.dialogue: Well...

acts/act3-4/loophangout.html.speaker: Loop
acts/act3-4/loophangout.html.dialogue: Why don't we summarize what we know about those loops? We might find something out!
(You sigh, and nod.)
(Nothing better to do, you suppose.)

acts/act3-4/loophangout.html.speaker: Loop
acts/act3-4/loophangout.html.dialogue: Soooooo...

acts/act3-4/loophangout.html.speaker: Loop
acts/act3-4/loophangout.html.dialogue: You're currently stuck in a time loop, for some unknown reason.

acts/act3-4/loophangout.html.speaker: Loop
acts/act3-4/loophangout.html.dialogue: The loop starts when you wake up in Dormont, and seems to end when you talk to the Head Housemaiden...
