acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Loop
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: ...Come back next loop, stardust!
(You just walk away.)
(You don't want to talk to Loop right now.)
(A journal with a star on its cover.)
(It looks very old. Feels like it'd break apart in one touch...)

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: I want to read it so bad.

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: Please, let's stop wasting time and reading every book we come across.

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: NO.
(You'd rather not have to read anything about stars right now.)
(Thinking about the stars right now is like touching a hot stove.)
(Maybe after you finish helping your [allies/family members].)
(If the book has a star on it, it must be important, right?)
(You get closer to the book.)

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: Urgh, fine.

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Isabeau
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: Let's do it! Be careful handling it, though...
(Mirabelle carefully takes the book in her hands, and flips through the pages.)

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: Hm...

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: It's a little long. Seems like it's the diary of a very sad person...

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Bonnie
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: Why sad? What happened to them?

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: They don't actually say... It just feels like they lived through some hard times, and everyone around them seems to brush their worries aside...

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: Everyone is acting as if everything's fine, when this person continues to suffer.

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Isabeau
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: Bummer.

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Bonnie
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: More like "boring". Read a passage!

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: Um, sure... Well...

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Sad Diary
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: "No one can understand what I've been through. Not my friends, not my family, no one."

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Sad Diary
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: "If no one can understand me, if I'm doomed to never be truly seen by another..."

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Sad Diary
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: "If I'm the only one who can understand what I've gone through..."

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Sad Diary
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: "Then, couldn't I just create another self? Another me?"

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Sad Diary
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: "Someone I could talk to, who could understand?"

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Bonnie
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: Huh?!

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Isabeau
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: Oh, interesting! NOW we're getting somewhere!

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: Talking to another self, to come to terms with what they've gone through...

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Bonnie
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: But in the end, they'd still be alone, right?

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Isabeau
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: Sometimes, you just need a voice that answers back, Bonbon!

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Bonnie
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: Hm...

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: It would just be an echo chamber, though. You'd never get to any good conclusion, talking to yourself endlessly...

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: I suppose they felt so alone they saw no other recourse, though.

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: But tell me, Mirabelle... Do they get a rude wake up call, as they realize creating another self is absolutely impossible?

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Isabeau
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: Yeah... Using Craft to change a body is already hard enough...

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Isabeau
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: Creating a whole new one, AND identical to another, AND one able to talk back? That's just impossible.

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: Um, they spend a good chunk here trying to figure out how to do it...

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: It's a lot of complicated theory. Their writing seems to be getting more frantic, too... It's barely legible, in places.

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: Of course. Realizing this can't be done.

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Isabeau
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: That's kinda sad.

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: Oh...? This page... It only has a few words, but...

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Sad Diary
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: "I've figured it out. How to create another me."

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Sad Diary
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: "Body Craft didn't work. Crafting clay didn't work. Nor wood, or marble. Nothing worked."

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Sad Diary
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: "But one thing could."

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Sad Diary
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: Wish Craft .

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Sad Diary
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: "Wish Craft will make my wish come true."

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Sad Diary
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: "I just have to do it."

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Sad Diary
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: "I just have to ask."
(Wish Craft!!!)
(The King mentioned Wish Craft before, didn't he?!)
(He seemed to imply it was used to trap you in this time loop, didn't he!!!)
(So it IS real...)
(It's real, it's real.)
(You hide your smile by covering your mouth.)

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: Siffrin?

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Siffrin
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: "And then? And then?"
(Wish Craft...)

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: Oh, and then...
(Mirabelle turns the page.)

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: Oh!

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Sad Diary
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: "My wish came true."

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Sad Diary
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: "I will always be understood, now."

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Isabeau
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: Huh!

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: Happy for them, I suppose.

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Bonnie
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: So they did it? They created another them?

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Bonnie
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: Wish... "Wish Craft"? What's Wish Craft?

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: Surely a type of Craft they invented for this tale.

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: As we've said, it's impossible to create a copy of yourself.

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Isabeau
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: Interesting premise, though!

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Isabeau
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: And making this fictional tale look like an old diary was interesting.

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Isabeau
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: Too bad Wish Craft isn't real, though. I'd wish for stuff, too!

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: With Wish Craft... Interesting that there's another book mentioning it, here.

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Isabeau
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: It is, isn't it?
(But it is real. It has to be.)
(It has to be!!!)
(You have to tell Loop about this!!!)
(But it is real. It has to be.)
(You smile.)

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Loop
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: Hi stard--

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Siffrin
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: "Loop!!!"

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Loop
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: Woah! Y-yes?

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Siffrin
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: "You heard it, didn't you?"

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Loop
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: Heard what? You know, I don't actually spy on you all the ti--

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Siffrin
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: "I found it, Loop!"

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Siffrin
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: "Wish Craft!!!"

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Loop
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: Wish Craft...? The thing the King spoke of?

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Siffrin
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: "I found it in a book, Loop!"

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Siffrin
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: "The writer said they wanted to create a whole new body, and used Wish Craft for it!"

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Siffrin
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: "Wish Craft made their wish come true!!!"

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Loop
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: Create a whole new body?! That's--

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Siffrin
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: "Impossible, right?"

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Siffrin
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: "But they did it, with Wish Craft!"

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Siffrin
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: "It's real, Loop, it has to be!!!"

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Loop
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: A Craft that allows you to do the impossible... Like creating a body...

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Siffrin
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: "Like looping in time!"

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Loop
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: Like, maybe... Freezing people in time, as well?
(That's right...)
(If the King knows about Wish Craft, could Wish Craft be how he got the power to Craft time?)
(Did he use Wish Craft to be able to use Time Craft?)
(It makes sense, doesn't it? Doesn't it?!?)

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Loop
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: Huh...

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Loop
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: Ha! Stars, that's something, isn't it? That's a new lead!!!

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Siffrin
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: "Finally, right?"

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Loop
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: Finally, indeed!

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Loop
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: Well. You know what to do, don't you, stardust?

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Siffrin
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: "Find more information!"

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Loop
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: Indeed you do.

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Loop
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: Not to send you on another book chase, but...

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Siffrin
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: "Book time."

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Loop
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: Book time.

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Loop
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: You can read those weird books now, can't you? Maybe one of them might mention it...

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Loop
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: Alright! Now that you're here, though...

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Loop
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: How can I help you on this wonderful new loop?
(The bookcase is filled with many books written in many different languages. Vaugardian, Poterian, Mwudu...)
(One of them is written in a language you cannot read.)
(Just looking at it is giving you a headache...)
(But you could read it, if you remembered the Memory of it, wouldn't you?)
(The bookcase is filled with many books written in many different languages. Vaugardian, Poterian, Mwudu...)
(One of them is written in your language.)
(You can read it, now...)
(It seems to be a theoretical essay about how to use Wish Craft...!)
(Wish Craft! So it is real...!)
(...This essay seems too complicated for you to understand right now.)
(You should find more information about Wish Craft elsewhere, and come back to this later...)
(Since the King is the one who told you about Wish Craft... You don't want to ask him anything, but is there someplace that's related to him?)
(One of them is written in your language.)
(You can read it, now...)
(It seems to be a theoretical essay about how to use Wish Craft...!)
(Wish Craft! So it is real...!)
(You've read the Wish Craft book before, but it wouldn't hurt to get a refresher...)
(You start flipping through it.)

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: Siffrin? What are you looking at?

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Isabeau
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: Wish Craft? What's that?

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: Do we really have time for this right now?

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Isabeau
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: Oh crab!!!

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: This would be... Very very very useful to know, wouldn't it?!

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: Interesting... May I see?

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: ...How are you even reading this.

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Bonnie
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: Letters bad.

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Isabeau
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: I can't read it at all...

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: I've never even heard of Wish Craft. Are you sure it's even real?

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Isabeau
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: Worth a try! Since you can read it, can you translate what you can, Sif?
(You nod furiously.)
(You start reading, and translate as best you can...)
(You translate again...)

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: ...I'll leave the thinking to you all.

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Bonnie
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: I am a child. I have a lot on my mind. I cannot help.

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Isabeau
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: Understandable.
(Isabeau and Odile listen intently, while Mirabelle and Bonnie start playing some kind of game in a corner.)
(You keep translating...)
(After a bit, Odile nods.)

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: Hm, I think I understand.

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: Wish Craft, as the name implies, is the art of Crafting wishes. Of making whatever you desire come true.

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: According to this, there seems to be no clear limit on what kind of wish you can make come true...

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Isabeau
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: A big part of it seems to come through just believing very strongly that you wish will come true, huh?

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: So by Crafting some specific rituals, in conjunction with a powerful will for your wish to come true, people can seemingly make any kind of wish come true...

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: Um... Okay...

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Bonnie
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: You used the word "congestion", so now I'm confused.

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: "Conjunction". It means--

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Isabeau
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: The same way we use Craft and certain knowledge and will to make figurines move, there's a way to use Craft to make your wishes come true!
(You nod, you nod.)
(Bonnie raises their hand.)

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: You have a question, Boniface?

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Bonnie
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: Um, so, um...

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Bonnie
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: Can it make any wish come true if you ask?

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: Yes, but the way the wish comes true seems a little more complicated than that, from what Siffrin translated.

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Isabeau
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: Yeah, depending on what you ask, your wish might not come true, but you might get the MEANS to make your wish come true!

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Isabeau
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: So like, let's say... Let's say you wished to win a Rock Paper Scissors tournament.

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Isabeau
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: Instead of just having it come true through pure luck... You might get SOMETHING to help make it come true.

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Isabeau
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: Like, maybe you'd get better at reacting, and you could see your opponent's hand in slow motion as it falls, so you can change your own hand!

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: Or maybe you'd get the insight to tell what they'd be playing, based on their body language...

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: Or you'd just get the power to see the future, so you know what hand your opponent will play beforehand.

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: Oh! Or maybe, you could meet a powerful Rock Paper Scissors master, who'd be willing to teach you through the goodness of their heart!

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Isabeau
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: Maybe!!!

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Bonnie
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: But what if your opponent also made a wish to win? What do you think would happen?

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: Hm... Maybe the wishes would cancel each other out, and the match would end in a draw.

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: Or maybe their wishes would both be considered null, and it'd be anyone's game.

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Bonnie
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: Or maybe the wishes can't work because it's two opposite wishes, so they'd both explode!!!!! And destroy the whole world!!!!!

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: Oh no!!!

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Isabeau
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: But neither of the wishes would come true, then! So maybe...

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Isabeau
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: Maybe they'd both get to win somehow. Maybe they'd go to different tournaments.

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: Or share a medal!

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Isabeau
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: Cute.

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: Hehehe!

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: ...This is fascinating.

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Isabeau
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: Makes you wanna go into wish-ology, huh?

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: Hah! Almost.

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: So, if Wish Craft is how the King got his powers...

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: ...What did he wish for, then?

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: ...I don't know, but...

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: Maybe his power to freeze people in time might not be what he wished for, but it's the means to make his wish come true.
(To make Vaugarde perfect.)
(A perfect picture.)

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: OH!!! But then...

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: Um, question, I have a question!!!

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Isabeau
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: Yes, Mira! I give you permission to speak!!!

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: Thank you!!! Um, Siffrin, you think the King could've gotten Time Craft powers by just wishing for them, right?
(You nod.)
(Considering he's the one who told you about Wish Craft in the first place...)

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: So then... If wishes can be that powerful...

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: Wouldn't anyone making a wish at any time be... Kind of dangerous?!

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: We'd be living in a very different world, wouldn't we?! If someone wished to be the strongest person alive... Or a kid wished for a million ponies!!!

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Bonnie
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: We can do that...? Wish for a million ponies...?

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: OH NO!!!

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Isabeau
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: To answer your question, my dear Mira...

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Isabeau
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: It seems that just wishing for things does hold a little bit of power, but like, not enough to actually make anything come true.

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Isabeau
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: But like Sif said, over time, people figured out specific ways to do Wish Craft, to increase their chances of the wish coming true!

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: And it depends on the wish, too. Some wishes are easier to make come true.

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Isabeau
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: It also depends on the strength of the wish! Like, how much you want it to come true!

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Isabeau
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: Although, it seems the strength of the wish isn't as important as the whole ritual part.

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Isabeau
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: You can wish as hard as you want for something, but if there's no ritual, it's very likely that nothing will happen.

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: Hm... "I wish I won this single game" wouldn't ask for much belief, or for a lot of rituals...

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: But in theory, you could prepare rituals and wish for something much larger, like "I wish I could win this world tournament"...

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Bonnie
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: ...Or "I wish to get enough power so I can freeze a whole country in time", right?

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: ...Right.

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: So the King knew how to do Wish Craft, then? That's what this means?

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: Wish Craft could account for his mastery over Time Craft... And so, he must have known specific rituals to make his wish come true...

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: Where could he have learned them...?
(Does it matter?)
(Because that's it, isn't it! That's it!!!)
(Wish Craft is the art of making wishes come true... Wishes that could bestow immense power...)
(A wish must be what is trapping you here!)
(That's it, that's it, that's it!!!)
(You can't help but smile widely.)
(Finally, a hint! Finally, a real path you can follow!)
(Something you can do!!!)
(You try and calm your breathing.)
(Phew...)
(Okay.)
(...Specific rituals, huh...)
(It's a long shot, but there might be another book about Wish Craft somewhere... Something you couldn't read before...)
(The bookcase is filled with moldy old books.)
(No familytales.)
(One of them is written in a language you cannot read.)
(It has a big, sparkly tree on the cover.)
(Just looking at the title is giving you a headache...)
(But you could read it, if you remembered the Memory of it, wouldn't you?)
(The bookcase is filled with moldy old books.)
(One of them is written in your language.)
(You can read it, now...)
(...Actually, you can't.)
(There's a lot of hard words in there... You don't know what this is even about.)
(Maybe you should go back to it later...)
(One of them is written in your language.)
(You can read it, now...)
(...It seems to be a book on different rituals to Craft wishes!)
(You could read it now, but you haven't read the previous Wish Craft book with everyone, back on Floor 1.)
(You might miss some precious insights, if they don't understand what you're talking about... You should come back after reading the first book again.)
(One of them is written in your language.)
(You can read it, now...)
(...It seems to be a book on different rituals to Craft wishes!)
(You flip through it...)
(You've read the Wish Craft rituals book before, but it wouldn't hurt to get a refresher...)

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Isabeau
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: Oh, another wiggly headachy book.

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: Is this another book on Wish Craft?
(You nod.)
(You start translating as best you can...)
(The book talks about many different rituals to Craft wishes, from the correct way to pick up 4 leaf clovers, to calling out to shooting stars the right way, to...)

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Bonnie
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: Favor Tree what now?

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: THE FAVOR TREES CAN GRANT WISHES?!?!?

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: FAVOR TREES LIKE THE ONE IN DORMONT?!?!

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Isabeau
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: THE ONE EVERYONE ASKED THINGS TO?!?
(It makes sense, it makes sense!!!)
(You even vaguely remember thinking about it, a long time ago!!!)
(Asking a higher power for a favor is no different than making a wish, isn't it? Isn't it???)
(So, could someone's wish to the Favor Tree have trapped you here? Whose?)
(What)
(What did you wish for, at the Favor Tree, again?)
(You think and think and think, trying to remember what you even wished for.)
(It was so far back!!! Such a long time ago...)
(You wished...)
(Was that all?)
(You think so.)
(Oh.)
(It can't... It can't be because of your wish, then.)
(You haven't even gotten farther than beating the King, let alone leaving the House to make that wish come true.)
(Your wish can't come true until you escape the loops...)
(So then, maybe...)
(Your wish isn't what's trapping you here.)
(You know what they all wished for, but might as well ask again...)

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: To the Favor Tree, you mean?

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: Well, I mentioned it earlier, but I... Wished... To win a coin flip.

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: A wish that didn't come true, by the way.

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: Well, I might have done the correct ritual, but I didn't put any belief in it, did I?

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: A wish that came true, now that I think about it.

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: I didn't put any belief in it, but the rituals are supposed to be the important part, aren't they?
(But you know her wish doesn't come true on every loop...)
(Some loops she wins the coin flip, some loops she doesn't.)

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Bonnie
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: I... I asked for my sister to be okay.

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: I-I wished for all of Vaugarde to be safe from the King!

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: ...What about you, Isabeau?

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Isabeau
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: I, um, didn't wish for anything.

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: What.

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: What?

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Bonnie
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: WHAT?!?!?

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Isabeau
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: LISTEN!!! I just didn't know what to wish for!!! I'm an indecisive guy!!! Leave me alone!!!

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: I can't believe this...

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Isabeau
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: Oh, m'dame "I'm gonna wish to win my next coin flip" is gonna judge me now?!

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: I didn't think anything would happen!!! At least I wished for something!!!

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: That's too bad...

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Isabeau
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: Haaah... Yeah, I'm kinda bummed I didn't wish for anything now.

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Isabeau
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: Why didn't I clap my hands and wish for something...

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Isabeau
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: Uh, yeah?

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Isabeau
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: That's how you ask a favor to the Favor Trees.

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Isabeau
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: You look at the tree, and clap your hands once, and say aloud whatever you ask for.

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Isabeau
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: Um...
(Isabeau looks at everyone else.)

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Isabeau
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: Is that... Not correct?

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Bonnie
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: No, it's what I did.

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: Me too. This is how you taught me, Isabeau.

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: That's also how I learned it at school?

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: Siffrin, did you... Not do it like that?

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: What?
(They're all looking at you!!!)
(You've only wished at a Favor Tree that one time, but it just makes sense!!!)
(You try to explain...)

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: Uh huh.

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Isabeau
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: So, a link between you and the Tree?

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Bonnie
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: So, the stars and stuff? They're the ones who make your wish come true?

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Bonnie
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: ...What's a--

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: Keep going, Siffrin.

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: Three times?
(It's about which number feels right.)

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: ...I suppose so???

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: That... Kind of makes sense, I suppose.

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: But that's so many details to remember...

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: And that's not how we were taught at all... It's something we learn as Vaugardians, and I've never heard anyone do it differently...

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Isabeau
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: But then, the Favor Trees are more of a superstition, aren't they? No one really takes it seriously.

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Isabeau
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: Well, except lately, where everyone started taking it super seriously just in case.

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Bonnie
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: So... So...

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Bonnie
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: So did everyone in the country mess up their wish?!?
(Odile starts laughing.)

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: Wh-Why are you laughing???

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: Sorry, sorry. It's just funny.

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: This could have been a way to save Vaugarde if everyone somehow wished for it, but no one knew how to do it correctly, so... Ha!

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: Hmf...

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: And the only person who knew how to do it wished for... ...

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: What DID you wish for, Siffrin?

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Siffrin
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: (It's embarrassing, so...) "I wished for croissants to be eradicated."

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Isabeau
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: What.

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Bonnie
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: What!!! No!!! Not croissants!!!

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: And since Siffrin knew the ritual, croissants might actually be...!!!

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: Oh nooo. I sure hope this specific wish doesn't come true.

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Isabeau
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: But yeah, no one except Sif knew the right ritual, but...

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Isabeau
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: Rituals are only one part of it, right? Belief is another!

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Isabeau
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: If enough people wish for the same thing, maybe it can make a difference!

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: Heh... A drop of belief in an ocean of nothing.

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Isabeau
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: Boo.
(So... Mirabelle wished for Vaugarde to be saved, Odile wished to win a coin flip, Bonnie wished for their sister to be okay, and Isabeau didn't wish for anything.)
(You don't think any of those wishes could've trapped you here.)
(So... Maybe someone else's?)
(The King probably wished for Vaugarde to be perfect or something, so you don't think it's related to you...)
(Is there a way to know what people in Vaugarde wished for?)
(You should ask the villagers in Dormont what they wished for...)
(You need to ask...)

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Big Boulanger
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: I asked the Tree to save my daughter.
(You need to ask...)

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Bored Librarian
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: What I asked the Favor Tree?

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Bored Librarian
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: Um. I don't actually believe in that stuff... So I didn't ask for anything.

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Bored Librarian
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: I did help the Head Housemaiden with it. She was asking everyone what they asked for. I don't know why.

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Bored Librarian
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: ...Why are you asking?
(You need to ask...)

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Castle-Loving One
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: What I asked the Favor Tree?

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Castle-Loving One
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: Ha... Do you even need to ask?
(You guess not.)
(You need to ask...)

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Cool Jeweler
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: ...The Favor Tree, huh...

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Cool Jeweler
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: I asked it to save my wife. Make her move again.

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Cool Jeweler
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: I could've asked it so save everyone, but... I'm selfish like that, I suppose.
(You need to ask...)

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Daydreaming One
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: ...Hm? Are you wondering what I asked the Favor Tree?

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Daydreaming One
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: Hehe... It's a secret!
(You need to ask...)

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Fishing One
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: ...Hm? What I asked the Favor Tree?

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Fishing One
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: Heheheee... I asked for Vaugarde to be saved, so I can catch some more fish.
(You need to ask...)

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Running One
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: Huh? If I asked the Favor Tree for anything?

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Running One
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: I asked for Vaugarde to be saved, of course!

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Running One
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: What an interesting question! The Head Housemaiden asked me the same thing, before the House fell!
(You need to ask...)

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Small Boulangère
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: The tree?

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Small Boulangère
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: I-I asked for...

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Small Boulangère
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: I asked for a pile of croissants!!!
(You need to ask...)

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Smug One
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: ...The Favor Tree?

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Smug One
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: I asked to be able to go back to Poteria soon.
(You need to ask...)

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Story-loving Shopkeeper
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: What I asked the Favor Tree?

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Story-loving Shopkeeper
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: For the Change God to keep protecting Vaugarde, of course!
(You need to ask...)

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Stylish One
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: Oh, oh, I asked the Favor Tree to help Mirabelle on her journey!

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Stylish One
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: I don't really believe in that stuff, but the Head Housemaiden does, so I thought I'd give it a shot!
(You need to ask...)

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Tutorial Kid
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: Huh? What I asked the big tree?

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Tutorial Kid
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: I asked... To win my next Rock Paper Scissors fight.
(Of course.)
(You need to ask...)

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Old One
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: The Favor Tree...?

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Old One
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: I asked it... That if the end was coming, to make it fast.
(You need to ask...)

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Beautiful One
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: The Tree, huh...

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Beautiful One
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: I asked for everyone in Dormont to have a good time, tomorrow.
(You need to ask...)

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Blind One
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: If I asked anything to the Favor Tree?

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Blind One
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: I did! I asked for everyone in Vaugarde to be saved. Pretty boring, huh?
(You need to ask...)

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Flower Growing One
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: What I asked the Tree?

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Flower Growing One
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: ...It's private, isn't it?

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Flower Growing One
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: I didn't tell the Head Housemaiden, so I don't see why I'd have to tell you. Sorry.
(You need to ask...)

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Frog-loving kid
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: T-The tree? Um...

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Frog-loving kid
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: I asked for a big frog to come in and punch the King in the face.
(You need to ask...)

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Sky-loving kid
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: The Favor Tree?

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Sky-loving kid
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: ...I asked for everyone to be okay tomorrow.
(You need to ask...)

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Wizard-loving kid
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: Huh? Who cares about some stupid tree?

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Wizard-loving kid
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: I didn't ask it anything.

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Wizard-loving kid
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: I-It's your job to save us tomorrow anyway, isn't it?!
(Some paper and ink.)
(On the paper, you can see a spreadsheet of some kind.)
(There's two columns, one filled with names, while the other only has one or two.)
(The first, full column is titled "Save Vaugarde".)
(The second, near empty column is titled "Other".)
(And then, you realize...)
(This is... A list of people who wished to save Vaugarde!!!)
(You look around her desk, trying to find out more.)
(Why would she record the people who wished to save Vaugarde?)
(It's a little notebook, jammed between random boring paperwork...)
(In it, the Head Housemaiden talks about Wish Craft... How in the days before the King attacked, she noticed everyone was wishing to the Favor Tree for the same thing:)
(To save Vaugarde.)
(And she started wondering if this wish could be the key to the King's defeat, somehow...)
(So the Head Housemaiden knew about Wish Craft!!!)
(...A wish for Vaugarde to be saved...)
(Reading this... You start to wonder whether this wish could be related to your loops.)
(Have you been looping this whole time... To save Vaugarde?)
(If you think about it... It somewhat fits.)
(You and your friends are the only ones who can save Vaugarde, so if you died...)
(The wish could activate then, making sure to loop you back to before your death, so you could try again?)
(Maybe the wish manifested itself by giving you the power to loop back in time?)
(Without this power, you would've failed and died, and the King would never have been defeated...)
(Making the wish impossible to fulfill.)
(So maybe that's it...? You're here because of this wish?)
(But Vaugardians shouldn't know the correct rituals to wish... And rituals are the most important part. The wish shouldn't have come true without them.)
(Could their belief in this wish be enough for it to come true? If a lot of people wished, on a country-wide scale?)
(And... Why is this wish centered on you? Why not everyone in your party?)
(And, and! If that's the case, if this wish is why you're here, then why are you still here?)
(You've beaten the King already, haven't you?)
(If that wish is why you're here, the loop would've stopped after you beat the King, right?)
(Did you do something wrong...?)
(The pieces don't completely fit yet, but...)
(There's no doubt in your mind that Vaugardians' wish to "save Vaugarde" is why you're trapped in this loop.)
(You're getting closer.)
(You smile.)

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: Siffrin, is something wrong? You've been staring at this notebook for a while...

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Siffrin
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: "Just lost in thought!"

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: O-oh, okay! Shall we get going, then?
(You nod.)
(...The Head Housemaiden...)
(She's the one who wrote this. She knows about Wish Craft.)
(She knew something was wrong, this whole time.)
(She might know... How to...)
(You should go and talk to her as fast as you can!)
(But first, you have to go talk to Loop! You have to tell them what you've found!!!)

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Loop
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: ...Heya, stardu--

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Siffrin
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: "LOOP!"

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Siffrin
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: "I figured it out, Loop!"

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Siffrin
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: "Everyone's wish-- It's probably the reason I'm here!"

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Siffrin
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: "Everyone's wish to save Vaugarde!!!"

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Loop
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: ...Huh?

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Siffrin
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: "It makes sense, Loop!"

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Siffrin
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: "I'm looping and not dying so we can beat the King!"

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Siffrin
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: "Everyone has been wishing for Vaugarde to be saved from the King!"

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Siffrin
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: "And if I die-- The King can't be beaten, Vaugarde can't be saved!"

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Siffrin
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: "That's why I can loop back in time, Loop! THAT'S why!!!"

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Loop
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: What? But then, why--

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Siffrin
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: "This whole time-- I might be trapped because Vaugarde wished for it!"

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Siffrin
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: "Vaugardians don't know the ritual for the Favor Trees, but their belief and hope alone might have been enough!"

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Siffrin
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: "An entire country of people wishing for the same thing should be enough to make the Universe listen, isn't it?"

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Siffrin
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: "And the Head Housemaiden knows this! She made a list!"

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Siffrin
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: "And she knows about the loops, at the very end, she always notices!!!"

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Siffrin
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: "So she knows about Wish Craft, about the wish that brought me here..."

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Siffrin
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: "So she'll know! She'll know how to fix it!"

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Siffrin
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: "I just need to ask!!!"

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Loop
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: ...Is that so? But, didn't you already--

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Siffrin
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: "It is so!"

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Siffrin
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: "I might be able to break the loop, somehow!"

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Siffrin
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: "You know, it might just be that I need to make everyone's wish come true! And everything will be back to normal!"

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Siffrin
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: "If I talk to her, she'll know, she'll be able to tell me what to do..."

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Siffrin
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: "If I can just talk to her...!"

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Loop
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: ...But, stardust, you already tried, and...

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Siffrin
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: "It's all thanks to you, Loop."

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Loop
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: W-What?

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Siffrin
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: "If you didn't push me to keep going, if you weren't there, I wouldn't have gotten this far."

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Siffrin
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: "So, thank you, Loop!"

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Siffrin
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: "After I talk to her, I'll see you, right?"

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Siffrin
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: "I'll see you, in a brand new world!"

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Loop
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: Sure, stardust.
(You smile.)
(Loop seems to smile back.)

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Loop
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: ...But, stardust... Before you go and talk to her...

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Loop
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: I had a theory, while you were gone.
(A theory?)

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Loop
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: ...How do I put this...

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Loop
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: The times when you loop back on your own, and not because of your death...

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Loop
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: I was thinking the reason why might be linked to your emotional state.
(Huh?)

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Loop
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: Emotions are often high, when you loop back in those moments, aren't they?

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Loop
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: So maybe you don't loop because you die... But because you feel like there would be no reason to go on, maybe?

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Loop
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: Something that, to you, feels on the same level of hopelessness as death? On the same level as the world ending?
(You think about a House, exploding in lights.)

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Siffrin
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: "Something like the death of my family members, you mean?"

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Loop
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: ...Yes.

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Loop
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: But wouldn't that fit? Wouldn't that explain it?

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Loop
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: Loop (serious2): You can't continue, because your party is dead.

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Loop
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: You can't continue, because the Kid is crying and hates you.

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Loop
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: You can't continue, because the Fighter rejected you.

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Loop
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: You can't continue, because you killed a Sadness in a way that makes them scared of you.

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Loop
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: You can't continue, because you all saw a ghost of yourself and they're reacting like nothing's wrong.

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Loop
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: You can't continue, because your Researcher has found out about your loops and hates you for keeping them secret.

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Loop
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: You can't continue, because the King has beaten you, and the Kid is about to die.

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Loop
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: You can't continue, because, somehow, you know this is the end.
(Maybe that's the case, but...)
(But why would time loop back just because of how you feel?)
(You didn't wish for any of this, did you?)

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Siffrin
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: "What about the Head Housemaiden?"

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Siffrin
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: "Why do I always loop back when I talk to her?"

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Loop
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: ...I don't know, yet.

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Loop
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: I don't know if what happens with the Head Housemaiden is even related to that. It could be that this is the loop's natural end, or something.

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Loop
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: But if it is linked to your feelings...

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Loop
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: Does something happen when you see her that makes you feel like this is the end?
(You
(Loop sighs.)

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Loop
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: Heya stardust! How can I help you in this wonderful new loop?
(Talking with everyone again made you think.)
(Made you think that maybe... Maybe you could keep this going for a little bit longer.)
(Live in the loops for a little while longer, keep the play going for a little longer.)
(If you wanted.)
(You can always talk to her later, and escape the loops another time, can't you?)
(You could keep looping for a little longer... Or ask the Head Housemaiden about Wish Craft...)
(No matter what, it's all over if you talk to her!!!)

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Euphrasie
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: Traveling one!

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Euphrasie
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: Are you done talking with your companions? Yes, wonderful, wonderful!

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Euphrasie
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: I'd like to thank you for accompanying young Mirabelle this far. I'm very grateful.

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Euphrasie
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: Siffrin, yes? If there's anything I can do to thank you, please don't hesitate to let me know!

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Euphrasie
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: I know you will go back on your travels soon, but I do hope you'll keep in touch, if only for young Mirabelle...

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Euphrasie
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: But no matter what, know that Dormont will always be open to you! Please come back--

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Siffrin
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: "I know about Wish Craft!"

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Euphrasie
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: Wish Craft...?

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Euphrasie
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: Oh, Wish Craft! Yes, it just so happened that a lot of people in Vaugarde wished for our country to be saved!

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Euphrasie
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: I did not think it would work, but if you're here, perhaps it... Did...

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Euphrasie
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: Oh... Oh no. Oh no, no, no, no, no...

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Euphrasie
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: Oh... Siffrin...!

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Euphrasie
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: I'm so sorry! There's no way we can stop it now...!

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Euphrasie
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: I'm sorry! You'll be going back! Back when everything started!

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Siffrin
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: "But you can fix it, can't you?!"

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Euphrasie
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: I know you thought your quest was over, but it can't be!

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Euphrasie
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: Something's broken, something's failing, rotting!!!
(No, no, no, she's repeating the same things still!!!)
(Why is she always repeating the same thing, over and over and over?!)

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Siffrin
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: (You just wish she would ANSWER YOU!!!!!! ) "Now that you know, now that I know, you can fix it!!!"

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Euphrasie
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: Fix it?

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Euphrasie
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: No. It's too late, Siffrin. It's always been too late.

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Siffrin
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: (What? But...) "But if you know about Wish Craft... You must know how to--"

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Euphrasie
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: Oh, Siffrin...!

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Euphrasie
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: It's true. All of Vaugarde wished to the Favor Tree, wished for us to be saved.

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Euphrasie
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: We wished for a savior. A way for us to win against the King.

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Euphrasie
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: And Wish Craft gave us the means to do it, didn't it? Made sure it'd work?

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Euphrasie
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: Somehow, Wish Craft gave us a savior, able to use Time Craft... Able to retry, as many times as it took! So you could beat the King!!!

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Siffrin
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: "Right! So--"

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Euphrasie
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: But... But something went wrong, didn't it?

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Euphrasie
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: Something goes wrong, every time!!!

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Euphrasie
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: If you're here now, asking about Wish Craft, then something must be wrong, isn't it? This isn't the first time you've gotten this far, isn't it?!?

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Euphrasie
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: It shouldn't be like this... Why does time loop back, even though the King has been defeated?!?

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Euphrasie
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: The only answer I can find... Is it's because we did it wrong.

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Euphrasie
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: I don't know what happened! But we must've done it wrong!!!

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Euphrasie
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: None of us in Vaugarde knew the exact ritual, but-- But we must have done it so wrong, it broke, and it doesn't answer to us at all anymore!!!

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Euphrasie
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: Or maybe-- Maybe someone wished for it, wished for our wish to fail!!! Wished for this!!!

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Euphrasie
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: Something made our wish break, made it fail, made it rot!!!

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Euphrasie
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: O-Or maybe the wish can't come true anymore, somehow!!! Maybe the King wasn't defeated the right way-- It'll forever remain incomplete, and Wish Craft, the world, will not abide it!!!

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Euphrasie
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: I don't know, I don't know, I don't know!!!
(You can't move.)
(You can't breathe.)
(The wish... Is broken?)
(She can't help you, even now?)
(You're stuck here forever?)

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Euphrasie
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: If only... If only we had fought back against the King, instead! If only we didn't wish for such a thing!

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Euphrasie
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: If only I knew this would happen, if I had noticed it sooner, I would never have let people wish at all!!!

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Euphrasie
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: To know you'll be trapped for all eternity, Siffrin... I am so sorry!!!

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Euphrasie
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: It's our fault, all of Vaugarde, that you have to suffer like this!!!

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Euphrasie
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: I just hope that one day...

acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.speaker: Euphrasie
acts/act3-4/loopquest.html.dialogue: You might learn to forgive us!!!!!!
(Just a little longer...)
(Just a moment longer, a minute, a second longer...)
(Before the curtain falls.)

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: (You need help on how to...) "...help everyone."

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Loop
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: Hm, well...

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Loop
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: Sounds like your Housemaiden wanted to talk to you, didn't she? You might as well talk to her this loop, before you forget.
(Mirabelle is here, sitting on a bench and looking at papers.)
(She wanted to talk to you, didn't she...?)

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: Oh! Siffrin...

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: Um, sorry to bother you while you're so busy, but I REALLY wanted to make sure you were okay...

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: You... You'd tell me if anything was wrong, right?

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Siffrin
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: (Where is THIS coming from...) "Of course I'd tell you!"

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: I'm  not sure you're telling me the truth here.

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: I don't want to force you to do anything, but you have to know I want you to be happy.

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: And I know this is a stressful moment for all of us, but the only way we can get through this is if we talk to each other! If we share our worries!

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: S-So, um, I guess what I'm trying to say is, if you need help with anything...!

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: I-If you need help with anything, I'm, I'm here for you!
(Hm, okay, weird.)
(Why is she telling you this...?)
(Ah, you know why she's asking you this.)
(Poor Mirabelle can't just say it, so you'll have to do it for her...)

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Siffrin
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: (Clearly what's happening is...) "Do YOU need help with something?"

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: Huh? HUH? HUH?!?

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: NO! That's not why I'm--URGH!
(Mirabelle urgh'd at you.)

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: Sigh. You can be such an oblivious person sometimes. Anyway, I--
(AND she sigehd! And called you names! Who is this!)

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: --don't need help. Not at all.

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Siffrin
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: (Okay now that's a lie.)"Not even with those papers of yours?"
(She's been looking at those for every loop you've been in. Clearly there's something wrong with them.)
(You poke the papers to make your point.)

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: HUH?!? NO! NOT AT ALL!!!

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: Do not look at the papers, the papers are irrelevant, do NOT LOOK AT THEM SIFFRIN I SEE YOU LOOKING AT THEM
(You arch an eyebrow, smiling.)

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: Urgh!

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: Alright, YES the papers are giving me a lot of trouble and I hate them.

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: But I'm only looking at them now to get worried at something other than, um, tomorrow? They aren't that big of a deal.

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: If I have to be worried I'd rather be worried about the thing that won't kill me.

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: There's even more in my dorm room in the House... Those stupid papers have been following me since before the King stuff even started...
(There's more in her dorm room...? The one on Floor 3?)

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: So... If we're done talking about my papers...

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: If there's nothing I can do for you, Siffrin...?

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Siffrin
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: "Nah, I'm good."

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: Sigh...

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: I'll see you later, then...
(Sounds like you could help Mirabelle with her problems if you went snooping a bit...)
(...If she needs help, maybe everyone else does too?)
(You should ask everyone and see if you can help them with anything.)

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Siffrin
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: Siffrin : "Can I help you with anything?"

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: Help? Me? With anything?
(She hugs the papers she was looking at closer to her.)

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: I, um. Do not need help with anything. And definitely not those papers.
(Sounds like you need to figure out what those papers are.)
(She said she had more in her dorm room in the House, didnt she?)

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Siffrin
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: (You need help on how to...) "...help everyone."

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Loop
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: Which one, stardust?

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Siffrin
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: (Which ally...) "Mirabelle."

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Loop
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: So your Housemaiden is hiding something? Some papers?

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Loop
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: She implied at the time that she has more of those papers somewhere in her dorm... Maybe you should go and take a look!

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Loop
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: Be careful, though! She might be watching you closely, since that's her room. You might have to be sneaky about it!
(Mirabelle's dresser.)
(Back in Dormont, she seemed worried about whatever was inside, wasn't she?)
(You'd like to look inside, but...)

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: ...Don't even think about it, Siffrin.
(You step back and smile awkwardly.)
(You won't be able to look inside as things are now...)
(Is there something in this room that could distract her somehow...?)

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: That's my roommate's bed...

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: Do you think she's okay...?

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Isabeau
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: What is she like, this roommate of yours?

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: She's the worst I really don't like her.

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Isabeau
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: Oh???

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Bonnie
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: I didn't know Belle could hate people...

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: She doesn't clean her side of her room ever, and she leaves her experiments and weird potions around everywhere, and she always sings way too loud!!!

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: And when I ask her to maybe change songs and sing something I might like, she always tells me "No can do, princess"!!!

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: She's mean and has no respect towards others!!!

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: So, a normal roommate.

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: MAYBE!!!!

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: But... Even so...

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: Not seeing her around... It really worries me...

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: ...Positive... Gotta stay positive...
(Mirabelle's dresser.)
(Mirabelle looks sad...)
(She must be thinking about her roommate.)
(You feel bad taking advantage of this moment, but...)
(You open the drawer.)
(There's some pens, a brooch, anti-anxiety medication...)
(...And some papers.)
(Each paper seems to be a file about a different person...)
(Each has a picture of someone, their name, and what seems to be their answers to questions like "Where do you imagine yourself in ten years?" and "Do you want kids?")
(What are those papers...? She must've been looking at similar papers in Dormont. Is she choosing one person to do something...?)
(Either way, this seems to be what Mirabelle is worried about.)
(You should go and talk to her about it...)

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Siffrin
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: (You need help on how to...) "...help everyone."

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Loop
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: Which one, stardust?

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Siffrin
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: (Which ally...) "Mirabelle."

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Loop
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: You found some papers in your Housemaiden's room! The same as the ones she's always reading in Dormont! Mystery solved!

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Loop
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: Well, not really solved. They looked like files about different people, didn't they?

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Loop
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: Each file was about a different person, answering some questions like "where do you see yourself in ten years?" or whatever... I wonder what that's about?

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Loop
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: You should go back to Dormont and ask her about it!
(Mirabelle is here, sitting on a bench and looking at papers.)

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: Hi Siffrin! Do you need anything?

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Siffrin
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: (Questions...) "So, which one will you choose?"

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: Hm? Sorry?
(You point at her pile of papers.)

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: Wha--

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: WHAT

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: HOW

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: WHAT DO YOU KNOW

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: ANSWER ME!!!!!!!
(She has her hand on her rapier!!!)
(She gets her hand on her rapier.)
"Maybe I can help?"

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: Hm.

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: I... I suppose you must have more experience than I do...

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: Alright. I would like your help, if you'll give it.
(Experience...?)
(Experience.)
(You laugh silently.)
(Experience in fighting, sure.)
"Sure!"

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: Th-thank you, Siffrin!

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: But, um, this might take some time!!! So, um... Make sure you have time?

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: Oh! Okay!!!

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: Okay, how to do this... Sit down next to me, maybe?
[Wow, you're here again!]
[You don't REALLY have to go through this whole thing again. You can just zone through it, and skip it completely, if you'd like.]
[You'll even still get their cool skill! But if you do, the skill will be a tiny bit less useful. Your choice!]
(Zone out?)

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: Oh, it's fine... Let me know when you have time, alright?
(You sit down.)
(Mirabelle looks at you without saying a word.)
(She looks worried... Maybe you should take the lead.)
"So, what are those papers, really?"

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: Oh.

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: Um.

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: Bonding proposals?
(Bonding...?)
(Like, when you promise to stay with someone forever?)
(Is Mirabelle looking for a partner???)
(You try and act surprised.)

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: NO WAIT THAT'S NOT EXACTLY IT PLEASE STOP LOOKING AT ME

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: I-it's more like, um, dating??? Dating profiles!!! I-I'm not thinking about being bonded yet!!!
(Dating???)
(You didn't think Mirabelle cared about that.)
(You're still confused.)
(You try and act confused.)

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: Alright, well...

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: Before this all started, with the King... I decided I wanted to, uh, try!!! To date someone!!!

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: And so I asked a dating company, and they gave me a bunch of folders of people that I could meet, and that I could date... But I haven't gone through it yet...

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: So I figured I could at least get that done today. And look through all of them, and make a list?

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: Of people I could see myself... Dating.

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: And... I suppose I need help? I'm choosing someone I could spend the rest of my life with... So I'd appreciate another pair of eyes.

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: Or, um, just the one eye. As long as it's not my two eyes looking at this. Um...

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: And also I need a distraction from tomorrow very badly, so I figured I'd replace my anxiety about our possible defeat with, um. This.
(Oh!)
(Hm.)
(Choosing someone to date is a little out of your comfort zone, but you think you can try and find someone who would fit Mirabelle. Maybe.)
(You chuckle to yourself.)
(What a very Mirabelle thing to do.)
(You smile at her.)
"Let's have a look, then."

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: Alright! I have a few profiles right here!
(She removes an IMMENSE folder out of her dress pocket.)

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: Here's a few of them! So, um, we can-- You can go first! And tell me what you think! And I'll go after!!!

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: Um, so, w-well, tell me what you think about him!!!
(She shows you the file of a strong, buff looking man.)

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: He does, I suppose?

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: Yes, glad we agree.

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: Wh- Do you mean Isabeau?

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: Ew, you're right.
(Either way, sounds like masculine people aren't her type. Probably.)
(Maybe she would like someone more feminine?)
(Next...)
(Say the line, Siffrin.)
"Do you have someone more feminine looking?"

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: Hm...
(She looks through her files.)

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: ...How about her?
(She shows you the profile of a gentle looking lady.)

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: She does, I guess...?
(She shrugs back.)

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: Ew, you're right.
(So, well, not into feminine people either, apparently.)
(Next...)
(Say the line, Siffrin.)

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: Oh, I don't have a type! I like all kinds of people equally!
"But if you had to choose...?"

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
