acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: Ah, um...

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: Someone... Nice?
(You nod.)

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: And... Someone... Pretty?

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: And... Someone who... Likes me?
(You don't nod.) "Mira."

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: No no no no wait, wait, let me think a bit more!!!!

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: I want... Someone who...
(She thinks for an awfully long time.)

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: W-Well, what about you, then!!! What kind of person are you into, Siffrin!!!
(Well...)
(You think about how to answer this for an awfully long time, but then catch yourself.)
(You act like you're thinking for a little bit, and then answer.)
"Wait, are you just going to copy my answers?"

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: Okay, fine.

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: You got me, Siffrin.

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: I'm not... Interested in that dating stuff.
(Oh, that makes sense.)
(But then, why...)
"So then, why worry about it?"

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: You know, Siffrin...

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: The Change belief... Is very, very important to me.

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: It's all around changing! Changing with a capital C! Bettering yourself! Becoming a better, different person!

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: And one of the ways to change is to try new things, you know? That's part of the reason the House offers so many different classes, hehe...

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: And so, um, so, I'm trying! I'm trying new things!

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: And some are fun, and fulfilling, and easy, but you can't just go and only try new, easy things, can you?

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: Sometimes I have to try SCARY new things! Things that make me uncomfortable!

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: Th-Things I don't want to do, at all!!!
"Like... Dating?"

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: Yes, like dating!!!

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: B-but, but, you know, romantic love is one of the biggest ways to Change! It's supposed to change you, to bring you new experiences, a-and...

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: And so... I have to do it, right? To be a good Housemaiden, I have to do it...

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: I have to date, I have to love someone in a romantic way, I have to... Do things with them...

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: I have to bond with them I have to sleep with them I have to have children with them I have to love them in this very specific way

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: And... And...
"And you don't want to?"

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: And I don't want to...

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: I don't want to do it, Siffrin, not at all!!!

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: Dating, the idea of being in a romantic relationship, of being with someone like that, I hate thinking about it! I hate the idea of it! I really do!!!

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: The idea of it alone is just awful for me to think about...!!!

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: I can't love someone like that... In the way I should love them... It never happened, and I don't think it ever will!

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: And, I... I need this to change, don't I...?
(Oh stars, this is heavy.)
(You're not sure what to say.)
(Maybe... Maybe...)
(Alright...)
(Say the line, Siffrin.)
"Well, um..."
"...Why do you need to change...?"

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: BECAUSE, I HAVE TO, SIFFRIN!!!

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: I'm a Housemaiden!!! And I love it, I love helping people, getting to know them, I love learning new things, I love it all, but...

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: BUT I HAVE TO CHANGE IN THAT WAY, TOO!!!

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: I wish I could just, not do it!!! Not be with someone that way!!!

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: But, Siffrin, there is such a pressure to force us to do that!

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: And not only that, there's such intense pressure to force us to Change!

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: We have YEARLY FESTIVALS all around showing yourself as a new person, for crab's sake!!!

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: Most Housemaidens have completely Changed at least once, and I haven't! Isabeau isn't even a Housemaiden, and he's Changed! And I haven't!!!

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: And, and I don't-- I don't WANT to change! I'm happy with who I am! I'm comfortable with who I am!!!

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: I'm comfortable with the idea of not being with anyone! I'm comfortable with the idea of staying the same forever!!!

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: But we have to change and bring new things into our lives and change clothes and hairstyles and even part of our PERSONALITIES...

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: To appeal to a deity that...

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: That... That I don't know if they understand that sometimes, I'd just like to stay the same.

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: Or maybe they do. Maybe that's why they haven't...

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: And now... I have a list of people that I could meet so that I can fall in love with them, which I can't do...

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: ....And d-do things with them, which I will never, ever want to do.

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: All so I can change.

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: And it makes me feel like a mistake.

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: That I must be broken for not being able to want these things. B-because everyone else can.
(You'd never told anyone this before.)
(You wonder what made you tell her, at that moment.)
(You wish you didn't feel those feelings, sometimes.)
"Well, I don't know about the romantic part..."
"But I don't want to 'do things' with people, either."

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: Huh?

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: Why not?
"It's weird, right?"

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: Yes...
(Mirabelle takes hold of your hands.)

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: YEAH!!! Yeah!!! It's just weird! And gross! It's awful!!! I don't want it at all!!!

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: Oh, Siffrin, Siffrin!!! You mean it? You really mean it? You understand?
"Yeah, of course!"

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: Haha, hahaha!!!

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: Ha... What a relief... To have someone who understands this, at least...

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: ...But it doesn't fix anything.

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: I need to change... And dating... It's part of it, so...
(Mirabelle sighs...)

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: Siffrin... I know you don't follow the Change belief, but... Do you have something like this?

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: Something that brings you joy, and community, and faith...

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: But some other parts... You don't know how to follow? Some other parts, you don't know what to do with?

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: Some other parts just... Bring you grief?
(Something that brings you both joy and grief?)

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Siffrin
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: "It's more complicated than that for me, but...
"Yeah. I have something like that.

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: So you do, too...

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: How... How do you deal with it, then?
(You don't.) "I just try to not think about things that bother me in general, haha."

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: ...Avoidance, huh...

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: That feels... A little too cowardly, for me.

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: I-I mean!!! I'm sorry, I didn't mean to say--!!!
(You laugh.)
(You know she didn't mean it that way.)
(Of course not.)
(You didn't know Mirabelle held those feelings towards the Change belief...)
(She always seemed so passionate about it.)
(But the belief she loves so much is also the same belief that forces her into a box she doesn't want to be in...)
(Why doesn't she leave it behind, then?)
(...You suppose it's not that simple.)
(You smile.)
(You were wrong, the first time you talked to her.)
(Instead of telling her to change by not changing...)
(Couldn't she instead change the belief, instead of the belief changing her?)
(Why should she be the one to do the work?)
(Why couldn't the world change for her, instead?)
(You could tell her that.)
(But  changing the script is scary.)
(Say the line, Siffrin.)
(You try to smile.)
(She's right. You're just a coward who doesn't want to think about anything that could hurt you.)
(You're pathetic.)
(What do you know about belief, anyway?)
(What do you know about faith? )
(You believe in something you forget about half the time.)
(Remembering it brings you only pain and grief.)
(The Universe leads. You can only follow.)
(Say your lines, then.)
(Follow the blinding script.)
(Follow the script.)
"I don't know anything about your belief, but..."
"You could always game the system, right?

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: ...Game the system?
"Change things by... Deciding not to change?"
"If everyone changes in that way, then you'll change by not changing in that way."
"There's more than one way to become a better person, right?"

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: Changing... By deciding not to change?

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: Heh...

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: Hahahaha!!! Siffrin!!! That's not how it works!!!
"But no one needs to know."

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: Hehehehehe!!!

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: Ha...

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: Change myself... By deciding not to change...
"Sounds challenging and fun to me.
(Right now, you mean it.)
(Is it fun, you wonder.)
(Deciding not to change...)
(Isn't it just accepting that you're fine with everything staying the same?)
(But you're fine with it, still. You're fine. You're fine.)
(You're fine.)

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: It does.

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: It does sound challenging and fun!!!
(Mirabelle smiles at you brightly.)
(You smile back.)

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: Mirabelle : Thank you, Siffrin...

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: Mirabelle : Thank you! For talking with me!

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: O-oh!!! Look at the time... You probably had other things to do, didn't you?

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: Go, go, don't let me keep you!

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: I need... To be alone for a little bit.

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: I have a lot to think about.

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: ...I'll see you later, okay?
(You got a MEMORY OF FAITH!)
(You'll always remember this.)
[When equipped, Memory of Faith boosts all of your Housemaiden's stats by 30! Wow!]
[Your Housemaiden also learned the skill "Holy Care Shield"!!!]
["Holy Care Shield" is amazingly strong. When used, it creates a shield that makes everyone invulnerable to attacks for one turn!!!]

[It's so strong, you'll only be able to use it when you and your Housemaiden have had this exact conversation.  So if you loop back to Dormont, you'll have to talk to her all over again! Remember that, okay?]
[Your Housemaiden learned how to use "Holy Care Shield" again!!!]
(You nod to Mirabelle.)
(You wave goodbye.)
(You remember to wave goodbye to Mirabelle.)

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Loop
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: Which one, stardust?

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Loop
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: Had a nice time talking with your Housemaiden?

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Loop
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: So... She feels bad, because she can't love people romantically, and she feels like she can't do what's needed of her, as a Housemaiden...

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Loop
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: She feels like she can't change in the way that's asked of her, since she doesn't want to get in a relationship, ever.

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Loop
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: Must be hard. Having a crisis of faith like this.

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Loop
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: ...Sounds like talking to you helped her, though.

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Loop
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: And talking to her didn't help you, but it made her stronger, which is all you can ask for, huh?

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Loop
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: Don't forget! If you want her to get that special skill again, you'll have to hang out with her once more.

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Loop
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: Or, well, you could do it and zone out the whole time if you wanted to. But that's cheating!
(You sit down.)

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: Oh.

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: NO WAIT THAT'S NOT EXACTLY IT PLEASE STOP LOOKING AT ME

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: So I figured I could at least get that done today.

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: Um, so, w-well, tell me what you think about him!!!

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: I like all kinds of people equally!

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: I want... Someone who...

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: You got me, Siffrin.

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: You know, Siffrin...

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: --romantic love is one of the biggest ways to Change!

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: And I don't want to...

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: To appeal to a deity that...

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: Huh?

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: ...But it doesn't fix anything.

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: So you do, too...

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: Change myself...

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: It does sound challenging and fun!!!

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: Thank you, Siffrin...

acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/miraquest.html.dialogue: ...I'll see you later, okay?

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: (You need help on how to...)

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Loop
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: Which one, stardust?
(Which ally...)

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Loop
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: Her, huh...

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Loop
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: Why don't you ask her if she needs help?
(Odile is here, looking at what the shop has to offer.)

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Siffrin
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: "Odile."

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: Oh, Siffrin.

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: You look rested. Glad to see you this laidback on the day before the end of the world.

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: Anyway. How can I help you?

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Siffrin
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue:
(...)
                        "Can I help you with anything?"

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: Do I need help with anything? Are you THIS bored, Siffrin?
(Odile seems to realize you're genuinely asking.)

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: Ah, well. . .

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: ...  I'm looking for a certain type of book.

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Siffrin
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: "A 'type' of book? Not a specific book?"

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: No, not a specific book.

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: It's... It's a type of book called a "familytale". Have you heard of those?

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Siffrin
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: "Nope. What is it?"

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: It's a book filled with tales written by a single family, through generations. It's a tradition, in Vaugarde.

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: I've always wanted to read one. But, since each family has theirs, and it's something you're supposed to keep in one family and not show others...

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: I was never able to touch, let alone read one.

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: But I've heard that when a family dies off, the familytale might be taken by Houses. As a way to save those pieces of history.
(Huh, you didn't know that.)
(And so...)

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Siffrin
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: "So you'd like a familytale of a family that died off?"

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: Yes.
(Huh!)
(You never knew she was interested in that.)

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: ...Of a sort.

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: ...So, will you help me?

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Siffrin
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: "Yeah, of course."

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: ...Thank you, Siffrin.

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: Ha. Okay.

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: I was planning to look in Dormont's library, but I have to buy some supplies.

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: And I want to look inside Dormont's House, but...  Who knows if we'll have time to search, so...
(...So you should check the libraries at your disposal, and see if you can find a familytale.)
(So that makes... Dormont's library, the House's, and the House's secret library, at least.)
(Better start looking!)
(You need help on how to...)

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Loop
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: Which one, stardust?
(Which ally...)

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Loop
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: Ah, the researcher...

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Loop
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: She's looking for a sort of book called a "familytale", huh? Interesting.

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Loop
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: I've never heard of those... Maybe the librarian in Dormont might know something?

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Bored Librarian
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: Welcome to the library!

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Bored Librarian
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: Well. Our selection is kind of lacking. All the good books are in the House.

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Bored Librarian
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: But the House is. Well. Closed until further notice. Since the King. Took residence there. And froze. Everyone in time.

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Bored Librarian
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: ...Are you looking for a book in particular?

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Siffrin
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: (Are you?) "Any familytales?"

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Bored Librarian
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: Familytales...?

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Bored Librarian
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: ...Why would you even want to look at one? Aren't you from outside Vaugarde...?

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Bored Librarian
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: Well, either way, we, um, we don't. We don't carry those here.

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Bored Librarian
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: I'm not sure where you'd need to look for one... But I feel like I've seen one recently? It's weird.

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Bored Librarian
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: Either way, the library in the House might help?
(Looks like there's no familytale in this library.)
(The library in the House, huh... You should look around there, and explore the secret library while you're at it.)
(A pile of lists of books that have been checked out of the library.)
(Odile is looking intently at the list...)
(You take a look, too.)
(...Looks like one person checked out every single available issue of "The Cursing of Château Castle".)
(No one here seems to have checked out a familytale.)
(A pile of lists of checked out books.)
(Odile is looking intently at the list...)
(You take a look, too.)

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: Um, you two? We should get going...

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: Give us a second, Mirabelle.
(You look through the titles, mumbling each one under your breath.)
("Lost Inland", "The History of Pepper", "What To Do When You're Sad And There's No Chocolate Around"...)

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Siffrin
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: (Ah! Here, at the very bottom...) "Paperasse Familytale..."

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: Where.

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Isabeau
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: Pape-what now???

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: Who checked it out?
(Someone called "Charles Chouquette"...)

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: Charles Chouquette? Oh, that's the boulanger in Dormont!

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: Does he have a book you want, madame Odile?

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: So he has it...
(The boulangerie in Dormont, huh? They sold croissants, if you remember correctly...)

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: Hm...

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: ...Well, I'll have to check after we beat the King, and before I go away...

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: Hm?

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Isabeau
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: What? What are we talking about?

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: Hah...

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: What about you, Siffrin? You were looking around... Did you find the book you were looking for?

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Isabeau
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: Huh? A book? Are you both looking for a book?

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Siffrin
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: "I was, but it's fine."

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: Hey, are you ignoring us? What's happening? Is this another secret quest?!?

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: If you say it's fine, then it is. Let's get going everyone.
(Mirabelle and Isabeau look at each other, and sigh.)
(So the boulanger in Dormont might have checked out a familytale...)
(You should go back to Dormont and let Odile know!)
(You need help on how to...)

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Loop
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: Which one, stardust?
(Which ally...)

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Loop
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: Oh, her!

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Loop
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: So, she's looking for a familytale, and one such book might be owned by someone in Dormont...

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Loop
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: That's great news, isn't it? That there's one here, in the village?

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Loop
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: You should talk to your Researcher and let her know!
(Odile is here, looking at what the shop has to offer.)

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Siffrin
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: "Odile."

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: Oh, Siffrin.

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: You look rested. Glad to see you this laidback on the day before the end of the world.

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: Anyway. How can I help you?

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Siffrin
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue:
(...)
                        "Can I help you with anything?"

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: Do I need help with anything? Are you THIS bored, Siffrin?
(Odile seems to realize you're genuinely asking.)

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: Ah, well. . .

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: ...  I'm looking for a certain type of book.

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Siffrin
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: "A 'type' of book? Not a specific book?"

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: No, not a specific book.

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: It's... It's a type of book called a "familytale". Have you heard of those?

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: It's a book filled with tales written by a single family, through generations. It's a tradition, in Vaugarde.

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: I've always wanted to read one. But, since each family has theirs, and it's something you're supposed to keep in one family and not show others...

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: I was never able to touch, let alone read one.

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: But I've heard that when a family dies off, the familytale might be taken by Houses. As a way to save those pieces of history.
(And so.)

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Siffrin
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: "So you'd like a familytale of a family that died off?"

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: Yes.

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: ...Of a sort.

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: ...So, will you help me?

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: ...Thank you, Siffrin.

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: Ha. Okay.

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: I was planning to look in Dormont's library, but I have to buy some supplies.

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: And I want to look inside Dormont's House, but...  Who knows if we'll have time to search, so...

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: Wh-what?

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: What? What? Huh? Really?
(She doesn't seem to know how to react.)
(You look at her repeat the same words over and over.)
(You wait a bit for her to calm down.)
(You look at her repeat the same words over and over.)

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: ...Siffrin.

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: Will you come with me? To ask them if I can borrow it?

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: It might... Take some time. So make sure you have time to help me.

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: ...Thank you.

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: Let's go, then.
[Wow, you're here again!]
[You don't REALLY have to go through this whole thing again. You can just zone through it, and skip it completely, if you'd like.]
[You'll even still get their cool skill! But if you do, the skill will be a tiny bit less useful. Your choice!]
(Zone out?)
(You and Odile are now hanging out!)
(You should head to the boulangerie...)

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: O-oh, of course... Well, let me know when you have time.

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Big Boulanger
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: Hey there.

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: ...Hello. We've heard you may have a familytale...?

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Big Boulanger
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: A familytale?

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: Of a family called Paperasse. If you'd be okay with it, I'd like to borrow it for a little bit...

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Big Boulanger
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: Ah, the one I borrowed for my girl before the House froze.

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Big Boulanger
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: I'm not a very good writer, ha... So I figured reading another one would give me some inspiration for stories to tell my little girl.

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Big Boulanger
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: Do not.

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: What.

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Big Boulanger
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: Do you know Antoine, maybe? He lives at the east of town, in the house with no flowers, asked if he could borrow it.

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Big Boulanger
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: They knew the Paperasse family, you see.

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Big Boulanger
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: I couldn't really refuse. The Paperasse family died only a few years back, after all.

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Siffrin
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: (Well, that sucks.)

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Big Boulanger
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: I don't see why they wouldn't.

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: ...I have a sudden bad feeling about this.

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: The house to the east of the village, with no flowers, huh? Looks like we should go pay them a visit...

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Big Boulanger
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: My friend Antoine, who lives at the east of town, in the house with no flowers, asked if he could borrow that familytale.

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Big Boulanger
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: ...Good luck with the book.
(In a second.)
(Now.)

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Siffrin
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: "What about you? Do you know where the book is?"

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Small Boulangère
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: A book?

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: Siffrin, we've just heard they don't have it. Let's go see this Antoine person alrea-

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Small Boulangère
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: This is the only book I have!
(She happily shows off the Paperasse familytale.)

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: WHAT?

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Big Boulanger
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: WHAT?

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Siffrin
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: "Oh my!"

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Big Boulanger
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: . . .So you had it, Charline...

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Big Boulanger
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: Well, I suppose you two can borrow it now.
(You got the PAPERASSE FAMILYTALE! Finally.)

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: Siffrin, how did you...

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: Nevermind.

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: Thank you both. We'll give it back shortly.

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Big Boulanger
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: Take your time.
(Well, that saved you some time.)

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Beautiful One
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: Oh... Hello!

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: Antoine, is it?

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Beautiful One
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: That sure is me. And you're two of the saviors, aren't you...?

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Beautiful One
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: Thank you for all you're doing. Best of luck for tomorrow.

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: ...Thank you. We had a favor to ask...

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: Could we borrow the familytale you possess? For an hour, maybe?

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Beautiful One
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: ...Oh, the Paperasse familytale...

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: ...  I know this means a lot to you, so--

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Beautiful One
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: Oh, no, that's not the problem, I'd be happy to lend it to you. But, well...

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Beautiful One
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: I think one of the kids next door stole it from me?
(What.)
(This would've been so much faster if you asked the daughter beforehand.)

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: What.

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Beautiful One
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: O-oh, I'm not saying they're bad kids!!! They're very nice kids!!! Very nice!!!

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Beautiful One
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: They just. Well. You know the three kids outside?

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Beautiful One
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: A few weeks ago, they passed by to help me cook some things, and, well... The book is gone, now.

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Beautiful One
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: Good luck...?

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: Urgh. Let's just go, alright?

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: Kids.
(The middle kid with the small hat looks at you from their rock throne.)

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Wizard-loving kid
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: Adults.

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Wizard-loving kid
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: What d'ya want?

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: Siffrin, you handle this.
(WHY YOU?!?)
(You sigh.)

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: You're closer to being a kid than I am.

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: Good luck.
(Okay...)

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Wizard-loving kid
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: Are you saying we're THIEFES?

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Sky-loving kid
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: "Thieves", Manon.

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Wizard-loving kid
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: Are you saying we're THIEVES?

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: My associate misspoke. What they MEANT was...

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Wizard-loving kid
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: Yeah? What kind of adult doesn't know about familytales.

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Wizard-loving kid
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: Are you stupid?

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Frog-loving kid
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: Manon, you can't ask adults if they're stupid...

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Wizard-loving kid
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: Can't I? Look at him.

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Wizard-loving kid
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: They're short, and their hair looks unbrushed, and they look like they haven't slept in weeks, and that hat DEFINITELY looks stupid and not cool.

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: Siffrin, the kid is destroying you, do something.
(On principle, you don't get into fights with kids.)

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Wizard-loving kid
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: Ah...

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Frog-loving kid
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: Manon, I think he's asking about...

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Wizard-loving kid
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: Shut up. I got this.
(The middle kid looks at you as disdainfully as they can.)
(Which is a lot.)

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Wizard-loving kid
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: ...What if we do?

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Wizard-loving kid
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: . . .Trade.

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Frog-loving kid
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: A trade, a trade!!!

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Wizard-loving kid
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: We have something you do not. Knowledge. Offer us something in exchange.

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Wizard-loving kid
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: TWO silver coins.
(You sadly show the single coin you have in your possession.)

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Wizard-loving kid
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: What kind of adult only has one coin? Are you broke? DENIED.

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: URGH.

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: Here, have five.

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Wizard-loving kid
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: TEN silver coins.

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: Four, and I won't tell your guardians that you stole a book.

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Wizard-loving kid
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: Um, yeah, okay, deal.

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Wizard-loving kid
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: Who cares about your stupid flower? They're literally everywhere in the village.
(...But your [allies/family members] like it when you give them flowers...)

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Wizard-loving kid
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: No you don't.
(Ah, you don't actually have any on you this loop. Oops.)

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Wizard-loving kid
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: A pun?

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Wizard-loving kid
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: It better be the best pun I've ever heard.
(The kid leans a little bit towards you, interested.)

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Wizard-loving kid
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: I dunno. How?

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Wizard-loving kid
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: What? That's not the deal, tell me n--
(The kid's eyes grow wide, speechless.)

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Frog-loving kid
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: Manon... The wizard-looking adult, he said...

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Frog-loving kid
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: They said you're a wizard, Manon...

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Wizard-loving kid
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: Wow.

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Wizard-loving kid
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: I know you just said it because it's part of the joke, and I know I'm not a real wizard because wizards aren't real, but I felt something just now.

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Wizard-loving kid
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: I'll do whatever you ask.

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: We... Only need the book.

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Wizard-loving kid
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: Oh yeah!

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Wizard-loving kid
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: Um, okay, so, I--

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Sky-loving kid
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: Manon doesn't have the book anymore.

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: ...What.

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Wizard-loving kid
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: Listen, Charline was being really annoying about wanting it so I gave it to her so she'd stop crying, okay!!!

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: Who's Charline.

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Wizard-loving kid
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: Um, Charline Chouquette? The boulanger's daughter.

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: THE WHAT.
(HA?)
(You can't help but laugh.)
(You weren't going to laugh, but looking at Odile's face makes you snort.)
(You smile, still.)

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Wizard-loving kid
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: Heh, look at the old lady's face.

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: SIFFRIN.
(You jump.)
(You look at her, smiling.)

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: WE ARE GOING.
(You nod rapidly, and follow.)
(You nod, and follow.)

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Wizard-loving kid
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: Bye, adults! Let's play again soon!!!

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Small Boulangère
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: Hi--

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: HELLO.

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Small Boulangère
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: W-wah!!!

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Big Boulanger
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: Hey.  Please do not scare my daughter, madame.

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: HRHRHGGHGHHH.
(You get in front of Odile, and smile at the girl.)

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Siffrin
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: "Hi!"

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Small Boulangère
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: H-hi...

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Small Boulangère
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: A book...?

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Small Boulangère
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: Oh! Oh, oh, oh, yes!!! From Manon!!!

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Small Boulangère
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: Manon is so nice!!! She gave me the book!!! The book with the nice stories!!!

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Small Boulangère
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: Dad was reading it and now it's mine and I can read it all by myself!!!

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Small Boulangère
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: But it's boring. I want another book, Papa.

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Big Boulanger
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: ...Wait, which book are you talking about, Charline?

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Small Boulangère
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: This one!!!
(She shows you all a book with "Paperasse Familytale" written across it.)

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Big Boulanger
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: I'm so sorry.

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: IT'S FINE.
(You got the PAPERASSE FAMILYTALE! Finally.)
(You both find a nice, silent place to talk...)
(You go back to the middle of the woods.)

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: Haaa... I can't believe this took this long.

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: But...  Finally. . .
(Odile looks at the closed familytale book intently.)

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: ...They said I could keep it until I have to leave Dormont, so I have time, but...
(She's still looking at it...)
(The familytale book you spent so much time trying to find.)
(It seems important to her, but why...?)
(You let her look at it for a little longer.)
(Say the line, Siffrin.)

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: Sorry, what?

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: Ah... Hm.

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: Well. I suppose I've kept it secret long enough. Don't tell Isabeau, alright?

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: There is no research. I'm not researching anything.
(You try and act surprised.)

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: Sorry for not saying anything. Isabeau said I must be researching something, since I was a traveler here in Vaugarde...

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: And it felt... Easier. To not say anything.

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: Why did I leave Ka Bue, travel for years, all to find myself in Vaugarde, if not for some intellectual pursuit?

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: Hm. Well...

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: I'm actually here in Vaugarde...  To find out more about myself.

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: ...I suppose it's not very apparent to you, but...

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: My mother was Vaugardian.
(Oh!)

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: I've lived my whole life in Ka Bue. My father was Ka Buan, and my mother Vaugardian.

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: I have no idea how they met, he never told me, but all I know is that she never wanted a child.

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: She left very early in my childhood, and I never saw her again. Good riddance, if you ask me.

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: But she left, and didn't leave anything behind. No pictures, no letter, no family history.

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: But what does it matter, right? My father was a good man, and Ka Bue was my home.

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: I used to think I didn't need to know about my history, about Vaugarde. But still, a part of me was...   Curious.

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: And one day, a few years ago, a Vaugardian merchant showed me her wares. And this book, that she wouldn't let go of.

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: A book of tales, written by her whole family.

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: A familytale.

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: And she explained familytales to me. Generations of Vaugardian parents, writing stories for their children, and writing them down in a book.

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: So you'd end up with stories written by an entire lineage.

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: And she was explaining the way the book was written, the rules of this particular way of telling stories...

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: How friendly families shared their stories with each other...

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: And how it had been done for generations, how it brought her closer to her family, her ancestors, her culture.

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: And while she was explaining all this to me, she suddenly stopped,  and I was surprised to find out she stopped because I was crying.

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: I didn't even realize it.

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: Because I wanted this.  This connection that she had to a history that was also supposed to be mine.

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: But it was stolen from me, because my mother left. And I'd never have a link to this culture, ever.

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: Unless I went there.

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: Hm.

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: So I traveled to Vaugarde. And, well, the King took over shortly after I arrived, which did make things more difficult...

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: But during my travels with you all, I got to know many Vaugardians, and see many Vaugardian cities.

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: I got to learn more about the country, its culture, its faith... Its people.

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: And. . .

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: And I look, and I learn, and. . .

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: This is the country my mother came from, it's half of me, but... But still. . .

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: Even now that I'm here in Vaugarde, I feel no connection to it whatsoever.

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: I don't recognize myself here.

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: Isn't that strange? Half of me should be from here, isn't it? Shouldn't I see something of myself here, in the place that my mother came from?

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: Shouldn't it be like looking in a mirror? Like a revelation?

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: Shouldn't I see how Vaugardian people act, how they think, and be able to say, "Ah! So this is why I'm like this!"?

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: Shouldn't I be able to call this place mine?

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: But I can't.

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: And it feels awful, like...

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: Like my roots have been cut off without my consent.

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: Like my mother stole it from me.

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: Like I really don't belong anywhere.

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: But... This is why I'm here, still.

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: To know as much as I can about this country... And in the meantime, find out if it'll make me find out more about myself.

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: And I did find out more about myself during this journey, so I'm glad.

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: It is an interesting question, is it not? How much do you carry of your country, of a culture that should've been yours, but wasn't?

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: It may not seem so to you... But to Ka Bue, my features are foreign.

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: Just small things... My hair being slightly too thick, my brows too thin... Enough for me to look different, here.

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: I am other.

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: So...  What about Vaugardians? Would they see me as one of theirs? Would I find myself in them?

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: After coming here, I found out that no. Of course not. Why would I? I've never been here before this journey.

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: But at the same time, I am not the only one who is other.

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: In fact, Vaugarde is filled with people who also come from other lands.

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: Vaugarde welcomes people from all over the world, after all.

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: So, even if I did not find someone like me...

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: I have found Vaugarde to be full of people that are similar to me. And I am very grateful for that.
(Odile is half-Vaugardian...)
(You never knew.)
(She traveled halfway across the world, to find out more about herself...)
(Trying to see if she'd find herself in a country she has no memory of.)
(Coming to a country she has no ties to, but wanting to create those ties herself...)
(How brave. It almost feels revolutionary, to you.)
(You're  jealous.)
(Stars.)
(She's so lucky, to be able to just go somewhere to try to find out more about her roots.)
(So blindingly lucky.)

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: What about you, Siffrin? Are you finding out more about yourself, in Vaugarde?

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Siffrin
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: (Huh?)

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: Well, you didn't grow up in Vaugarde either, right? Do you have roots here? Or were you just passing through?

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: HA! Hm, my apologies. Forget I asked.

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: You didn't need to. Your face said it all.

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: Just because I'm telling you personal facts about myself doesn't mean you need to tell me anything in return. It was wrong of me to ask.

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: We can forget about it.
(She goes back to looking at the familytale's cover.)
(She'd probably be fine leaving it here, just baring her story to you and nothing else, but, but you...)
(What pushed you to tell her about your home, the first time?)
(You don't want to tell her, not anymore. It's yours. It doesn't need to be shared.)
(But...  You have to follow the script, still.)
(You don't want to tell her.)
(You don't want to speak of it.)
(It's gone. Dead and buried. It doesn't exist anymore, not even in your memories.)
(Talking about it makes it real.)
(You don't want to... You don't want to speak of it, but you have to.)
(You have to, because if the Universe made you tell her once, it must want you to tell her every blinding time.)
(The Universe led you here.  You can only follow.)

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Siffrin
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: "I don't remember much about where I'm from."
(Odile turns to look at you.)

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: Huh...

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: Were you too small when you left, or was it because there was nothing worth remembering?
(Everything was worth remembering.)
(EVERYTHING WAS WORTH REMEMBERING!!!)
(YOUR COUNTRY, YOUR FAMILY, YOUR CHILDHOOD, THE STARS, IT WAS ALL WORTH REMEMBERING!!!)
(AND YET... AND YET...!!! YOU CAN'T REMEMBER ANY OF IT!!!)

(WHAT DID YOUR MOTHER LOOK LIKE? WHAT WAS YOUR FATHER'S NAME? DID YOU EVEN HAVE EITHER? WHAT ABOUT SIBLINGS? WHAT DID YOU DO DURING THE DAY? WHAT WAS YOUR FAVORITE FOOD? WHAT DID YOU SEE IN THE STARS?)
(WHAT WAS YOUR LIFE LIKE?)
(IT ESCAPES YOU, YOU CAN'T GRASP IT, IT KEEPS ESCAPING YOU, IT'LL KEEP ON ESCAPING YOU UNTIL YOU DIE!!!)
(Is it any wonder you crave knowledge? Habits?!?)
(If it all keeps happening the exact same way every time, you'll never lose anything, will you? You'll HAVE to remember it all, because you're living it!!!)
(Forever living in memories you can't let go of!!!)
(You're so pathetic.)
(Telling the King to let go?)
(You can't even do that. Can't let go of it.)
(This  perfect  play.)

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Siffrin
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: "Neither."

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Siffrin
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: "But I can relate to you."

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Siffrin
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: "Trying to find pieces of yourself wherever you can."

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: Trying to find where you belong?

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Siffrin
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: "Trying to find how your roots might have shaped you."

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: Which parts of you you created, and which parts already were.
(You nod.)
(BUT YOU'LL NEVER KNOW.)

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: . . .  Siffrin...

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: I don't know what you're going through right now. I suppose that even if I asked, you wouldn't answer me, but...

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: But you know you're not only made of where you're from, right?

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: If that was the case, everyone in Ka Bue would be the exact same, and everyone in Vaugarde would be the exact same...

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: Where you're from matters, yes, but it's not the only thing that makes you "you".

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: That's what I realized during this journey, Siffrin. I'm Ka Buan and Vaugardian, in ways I do and don't realize...

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: And I am also myself.

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: One might say that's more important than being Ka Buan and Vaugardian, wouldn't you agree?
(You don't.)
(She's the one who doesn't understand.)
(What a privilege , to be able to think your roots don't inform your identity.)

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: Heh.

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: Ha, that's interesting...  I feel so much lighter now.

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Siffrin
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: (Hm?)

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: ...Yeeeees, and also because we talked, Siffrin.
(Oh!)

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: Hah!!!

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: Heh...  Thank you for listening to me, Siffrin.
(You blush, and nod.)
(You nod, and smile.)

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: Heh.

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: Now get out of here! I have a familytale to read before we all meet for our sleepover.

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: We'll talk later. Go have fun.
(Odile smiles at you mischievously.)
(You got a MEMORY OF SECRET QUEST!)
(You'll always remember this.)
[When equipped, Memory of Secret Quest boosts all of your Researcher's stats by 30! Wow!]
[Your Researcher also learned the skill "Craft Break α"!!!]
["Craft Break α" is amazingly strong. When used, it makes an enemy weaker to all CRAFT types for a few turns!!!]

[It's so strong, you'll only be able to use it when you and your Researcher have had this exact conversation. So if you loop back to Dormont, you'll have to talk to her all over again! Remember that, okay?]
[Your Researcher learned the skill "Craft Break α" again!!!]
(You get up and leave, waving goodbye.)
(You get up and leave.)
(You need help on how to...)

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Loop
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: Which one, stardust?
(Which ally...)

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Loop
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: Your researcher...

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Loop
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: So, she was looking for a familytale, maybe the whole time you've known her.

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Loop
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: Familytales are a Vaugardian tradition, and as half-Vaugardian, she felt like it would bring her closer to her roots...

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Loop
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: And that's why she came to Vaugarde, even. To find out more about herself.

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Loop
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: Being able to go wherever you want, and find more about yourself in the process...

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Loop
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: Well, that sure was interesting, wasn't it?
(You go back to the middle of the woods.)

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: Haaa... I can't believe this took this long.

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: Sorry, what?

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: I'm not researching anything.

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: I'm actually here in Vaugarde... To find out more about myself.

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: My mother was Vaugardian.

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: A familytale.

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: I didn't even realize it.

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: I am other.

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: We can forget about it.

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: Trying to find where you belong?

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: And I am also myself.

acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act3-4/odilequest.html.dialogue: Thank you for listening to me, Siffrin.

acts/act5/act5.html.dialogue: (You had a theory, and it was wrong.)
(You thought the Head Housemaiden would know how to save you, but she doesn't. That's all good. It's fine! It's all fine!!!)
(At least you know why you're here.)
(You're here because everyone wished for it!!!)
(Everyone in Vaugarde wished for your suffering! Everyone wished for you to be stuck repeating everything, to bE ROTTING HERE FOREVER--)
(No, it's fine, it's fine, it's fine.)
(People in Vaugarde wished for the King to be defeated, for Vaugarde to be saved, but no one knew how to do Wish Craft. No one knew the correct rituals.)
(Is that why? Is that why you've been stuck in this loop?)
(They wished for it, but wished wrong, and so the wish is breaking, folding in on itself? Because it was done wrong?)
(Or maybe-- Maybe!!! Maybe YOU did it wrong! They wished for it, for the King to die, but-- But he disappears, every time you win, and the wish revolves around you, so maybe--)
(MAYBE YOU'RE DOING SOMETHING WRONG EVERY TIME, AND THAT'S WHY YOU'RE STUCK HERE!!!)
(THAT HAS TO BE WHY!!! If you're still looping, after everything, after trying it all, then it must be that you're missing something!!!)
(You must be going against the wish's will without realizing, and that's why it brings you back, because you're doing something wrong!!!)
(You don't want to be here, so what-- What are you doing wrong?)

(Is it waking up?! Are you waking up wrong?!? Or, going to the House? But you have to, you have to go, you have to beat the King, save Vaugarde, because obviously, saving Vaugarde is why you're here--)
(Defeating the King is why you're here, and you do defeat him, you fight, you get his guard down, he talks, everyone talks, you attack all at once, and you defeat the King with your own two hands--)
(You DON'T defeat him with your own two hands.)
(Mirabelle. She's always the one who deals the final strike, isn't she.)
(You've never, even once, defeated him yourself.)
(...But, why do you, specifically, need to defeat the King, why would everyone's wish revolve around--)
(No, don't think about it, this is definitely it.)
(If they all wished for you to defeat him. And you're the only one stuck in this loop.)
(Then you need to do it yourself. Fight him and tear him to pieces and rip his hair out and reach into his chest and kill!!!)
(It always comes back to him, doesn't it!!! It's his fault you're here!!! It's his fault you can't escape!!! It's his fault so many people are suffering!!!)
(There you go, hahaha! That's a theory! That's a goal!)
(You just need to make sure Mirabelle doesn't deal the final hit! That's all you need! That's all you BLINDING NEED--)
(Aaah, but it's okay, right? It's fine, isn't it?)
(Even if the entire country wished for you to be here... It's okay, isn't it?)
(It's fine, as long as you're with them.)
(You can live with this, as long as you're with them.)
(You're fine, as long as you're with them.)
(But this thought... IS NOT ENOUGH FOR YOU TO GO ON ANYMORE!!!!!!)
(YOU WANT TO BE WITH YOUR FAMILY!!! NOT WITH THOSE FICTIONAL CHARACTERS THAT HAVE TAKEN THEIR PLACE!!!)

(THEY CAN NEVER CHANGE! THEY CAN NEVER FIND OUT! THEY CAN NEVER TRULY SEE YOU! THEY CAN ONLY REPEAT THE SAME LINES OVER AND OVER AND OVER, BECAUSE THAT'S ALL THEY CAN DO, BECAUSE YOU WON'T EVEN ALLOW THEM TO DO OTHERWISE--)
(IF ONLY MIRABELLE DIDN'T DEAL THE FINAL HIT EVERY TIME... IF ONLY SHE...!!!!!!)

(If only you knew if only the wish wasn't broken if only you could get to the king deal the final hit end it all and finally you'll be with your family forever and you'll be okay and you can just end it all you just need to get
to the king deal the final hit make the wish come true make sure it all loops around you kill the king rip him to pieces for making you remember for making you see for not understanding for killing bonnie for getting in your
blinding way every time you just need to kill him kill him kill him kill him kill him kill him kill him kill him kill him kill him kill him kill him kill him kill him kill him kill him kill him kill him kill him you just)
(and make sure everyone's wish comes true)
(You just need to defeat the King on your own.)

acts/act5/act5.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act5/act5.html.dialogue: Hehe, I thought you were napping, so I was just--

acts/act5/act5.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act5/act5.html.dialogue: Ah, yes! I'm... Sorry? I hope that's okay...

acts/act5/act5.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act5/act5.html.dialogue: W-Well, um... I had an idea for tonight, and I--

acts/act5/act5.html.speaker: Siffrin
acts/act5/act5.html.dialogue: "To all meet at the Clocktower for a sleepover."

acts/act5/act5.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act5/act5.html.dialogue: Y-Yes? Oh, did you have... The same idea?

acts/act5/act5.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act5/act5.html.dialogue: ...Okay... Well, I won't keep you, then...

acts/act5/act5.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act5/act5.html.dialogue: Um, let's all meet at the Clocktower later, then, alright?
(Yes, you need to kill the King before Mirabelle, but)
(you don't want  to be here  anymore.)
(You have to get to the King as fast as possible, get him close to death as fast as possible.)
(You need to make sure everyone else is strong enough.)
(You need  to make sure  they're all as powerful as they can be.)
(Sleeping, in the middle of a play?)

acts/act5/act5.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act5/act5.html.dialogue: Um, are you okay? Did you have a nightmare during your nap, maybe...?
(You have to deal the King the final hit instead of her, you're sure of it, but...)
(You need her to learn her shield skill. The one that protects you from anything.)
(Come to think of it, you forgot to tell her about the original shield skill, earlier.)
(The one you usually tell her about when you enter Dormont.)
(Oh well. The shield she learns when you help her with her papers will do the job just fine.)
(You need to get to the King)
(you don't have time you don't have time you don't have

acts/act5/act5.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act5/act5.html.dialogue: With my papers? N-No, of course not!!!

acts/act5/act5.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act5/act5.html.dialogue: Don't worry about them! They're not important at all, they're--

acts/act5/act5.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act5/act5.html.dialogue: I... I suppose I could use your help, Siffrin...

acts/act5/act5.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act5/act5.html.dialogue: Y-Yes, let's do it!!! It'll distract us both!!! From our problems!!!
(Mirabelle looks at you without saying a word.)

acts/act5/act5.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act5/act5.html.dialogue: Well, you know they're bonding papers, so I don't need to explain...

acts/act5/act5.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act5/act5.html.dialogue: B-But really it's more like, um, dating? Dating profiles... I-I'm not thinking about being bonded yet...

acts/act5/act5.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act5/act5.html.dialogue: Before this all started, with the King... I decided I wanted to, uh, try. To date someone.

acts/act5/act5.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act5/act5.html.dialogue: And so I asked a dating company, and they gave me a bunch of folders of people that I could meet, and that I could date... But I haven't gone through it yet...

acts/act5/act5.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act5/act5.html.dialogue: So I figured I could at least get that done today. And look through all of them, and make a list?

acts/act5/act5.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act5/act5.html.dialogue: Of people I could see myself... Dating.

acts/act5/act5.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act5/act5.html.dialogue: And... I suppose I need help?  I'm choosing someone I could spend the rest of my life with... So I'd appreciate another pair of eyes.

acts/act5/act5.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act5/act5.html.dialogue: Or, um, just the one eye. As long as it's not my two eyes looking at this. Um...

acts/act5/act5.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act5/act5.html.dialogue: And also I need a distraction from tomorrow very badly, so I figured I--
(Too long, too long, this is taking too long.)

acts/act5/act5.html.speaker: Siffrin
acts/act5/act5.html.dialogue: "You know, you don't have to be bonded to anyone.

acts/act5/act5.html.speaker: Siffrin
acts/act5/act5.html.dialogue: "If you're alone for your whole life, then that's just how it is."

acts/act5/act5.html.speaker: Siffrin
acts/act5/act5.html.dialogue: "Isn't it better to just come to terms with it now, rather than later?""

acts/act5/act5.html.speaker: Siffrin
acts/act5/act5.html.dialogue: "You don't need to be with anyone to be happy, after all!"

acts/act5/act5.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act5/act5.html.dialogue: How can you say such horrible things, Siffrin!!!

acts/act5/act5.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act5/act5.html.dialogue: I'll never be bonded with anyone? I'll always be alone?

acts/act5/act5.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act5/act5.html.dialogue: Change, what makes you think you can say such horrible things, Siffrin!!!

acts/act5/act5.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act5/act5.html.dialogue: Then HOW did you mean it, Siffrin!!!

acts/act5/act5.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act5/act5.html.dialogue: What's wrong with you today? You were weird when you woke up, you were walking around and not responding to anyone...

acts/act5/act5.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act5/act5.html.dialogue: ...You knew about my papers even though I didn't tell anyone, and now this!!!

acts/act5/act5.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act5/act5.html.dialogue: Is something wrong, Siffrin? Did something happen? Did you have a nightmare or something?

acts/act5/act5.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act5/act5.html.dialogue: Then what happened, Siffrin! Because clearly something did happen!!!

acts/act5/act5.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act5/act5.html.dialogue: Otherwise, i-if nothing happened, I'll have to accept the fact that I was wrong about you!!!

acts/act5/act5.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act5/act5.html.dialogue: And it's fine. Everybody does. I guess I have the kind of personality where it's easy to want to tease me.

acts/act5/act5.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act5/act5.html.dialogue: But I know people don't mean it. It's how-- It's how some people make friends.

acts/act5/act5.html.speaker: Mirabelle
