acts/act6/miraend6.html.dialogue: "A-And it came out wrong, it's just that before, in another loop, you said--"

acts/act6/miraend6.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act6/miraend6.html.dialogue: Ah, no, stop!!!
(You flinch, and stop talking.)

acts/act6/miraend6.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act6/miraend6.html.dialogue: Ah, sorry for yelling! S-Sorry, I mean...

acts/act6/miraend6.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act6/miraend6.html.dialogue: Um... It's just... I don't want to hear about that.

acts/act6/miraend6.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act6/miraend6.html.dialogue: About anything that happened with any past Mirabelles, I mean! And what happened with them for you to know, uh, stuff, yesterday!!!
(Oh.)

acts/act6/miraend6.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act6/miraend6.html.dialogue: I can guess what you must've talked about with them, and... I don't want to know.

acts/act6/miraend6.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act6/miraend6.html.dialogue: Even if it helped them then, I don't want to know!!!

acts/act6/miraend6.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act6/miraend6.html.dialogue: I want to figure it all out on my own, and not because you know, um...

acts/act6/miraend6.html.speaker: Siffrin
acts/act6/miraend6.html.dialogue: "...Spoilers?"

acts/act6/miraend6.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act6/miraend6.html.dialogue: Spoilers!!! Exactly!!! You know spoilers about me!!!

acts/act6/miraend6.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act6/miraend6.html.dialogue: I don't like the idea of you or anyone knowing things about me that I don't know about.

acts/act6/miraend6.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act6/miraend6.html.dialogue: So, um... I hope you can understand... That I don't want to hear about it?
(You hated it when everyone acted like they knew more about your feelings than you.)
(Of course you understand.)
(You nod.)

acts/act6/miraend6.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act6/miraend6.html.dialogue: Good!

acts/act6/miraend6.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act6/miraend6.html.dialogue: ...But all that aside, um...

acts/act6/miraend6.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act6/miraend6.html.dialogue: Quite honestly, Siffrin... A lot has happened in the last day or so.

acts/act6/miraend6.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act6/miraend6.html.dialogue: We looked for you, we met a star, we went up the House, we beat the King, you were sick and barely responding, the Head Housemaiden acted weird...

acts/act6/miraend6.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act6/miraend6.html.dialogue: We had to fight you, we saved the country, we decided to keep traveling again, I'm digesting Bonnie's snacks we just got, I'm sleepy...

acts/act6/miraend6.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act6/miraend6.html.dialogue: So many things happened, all with their specific emotions tied to them, from happiness to fear to relief...

acts/act6/miraend6.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act6/miraend6.html.dialogue: So, what you said to me yesterday is ranking pretty low overall on the list of things I'm thinking about.
(Oh.)

acts/act6/miraend6.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act6/miraend6.html.dialogue: But...

acts/act6/miraend6.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act6/miraend6.html.dialogue: But maybe, when I'll have had time to process everything that happened...

acts/act6/miraend6.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act6/miraend6.html.dialogue: Maybe I'll be angry then. At what you said.

acts/act6/miraend6.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act6/miraend6.html.dialogue: But, that's...

acts/act6/miraend6.html.speaker: Siffrin
acts/act6/miraend6.html.dialogue: "If you do, tell me."

acts/act6/miraend6.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act6/miraend6.html.dialogue: Huh? Um, alright, if you want, but why?

acts/act6/miraend6.html.speaker: Siffrin
acts/act6/miraend6.html.dialogue: "So you can, uh..."

acts/act6/miraend6.html.speaker: Siffrin
acts/act6/miraend6.html.dialogue: "Scream at me? I guess?"

acts/act6/miraend6.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act6/miraend6.html.dialogue: Oh, no...

acts/act6/miraend6.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act6/miraend6.html.dialogue: Siffrin, I don't want to scream at you, even if I'm angry!

acts/act6/miraend6.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act6/miraend6.html.dialogue: If I do feel angry, we can deal with it then, but please don't say things like that.

acts/act6/miraend6.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act6/miraend6.html.dialogue: Knowing you're expecting me to scream at you... It makes me sad...

acts/act6/miraend6.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act6/miraend6.html.dialogue: Is that how you see me? I'm sorry...

acts/act6/miraend6.html.speaker: Siffrin
acts/act6/miraend6.html.dialogue: "N-No, no, I just..."

acts/act6/miraend6.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act6/miraend6.html.dialogue: Well, I don't want to scream at you, even if I get angry. So I won't.

acts/act6/miraend6.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act6/miraend6.html.dialogue: And... And I can tell you regret what happened, too.

acts/act6/miraend6.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act6/miraend6.html.dialogue: And it counts for more than you think.

acts/act6/miraend6.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act6/miraend6.html.dialogue: And... I also... Feel bad. About what happened.

acts/act6/miraend6.html.speaker: Siffrin
acts/act6/miraend6.html.dialogue: (huh?) "Why?"

acts/act6/miraend6.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act6/miraend6.html.dialogue: I feel like... Since you were always so mysterious and cool, I didn't really try to know more about you.

acts/act6/miraend6.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act6/miraend6.html.dialogue: Because of the aura! The mystique! You look like you have secrets! Delicious secrets!!!

acts/act6/miraend6.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act6/miraend6.html.dialogue: And people probably ask you about them all the time... And I didn't want to bother you, when it's not any of my business...

acts/act6/miraend6.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act6/miraend6.html.dialogue: So I never asked you anything. About yourself, or how you were feeling.

acts/act6/miraend6.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act6/miraend6.html.dialogue: But... Everything that happened to you made me realize...

acts/act6/miraend6.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act6/miraend6.html.dialogue: You're someone who's actually very shy and introverted! Like me!!!

acts/act6/miraend6.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act6/miraend6.html.dialogue: And you wouldn't tell anyone anything they didn't ask for, because why would you tell them something out of the blue, right?

acts/act6/miraend6.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act6/miraend6.html.dialogue: It's better to stay silent and not tell anyone anything about you or how you're feeling, right...?

acts/act6/miraend6.html.speaker: Siffrin
acts/act6/miraend6.html.dialogue: "Right!!!"

acts/act6/miraend6.html.speaker: Siffrin
acts/act6/miraend6.html.dialogue: "I don't want to bother anyone with my problems, so..."

acts/act6/miraend6.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act6/miraend6.html.dialogue: So I'll keep my feelings here, until I die!
(You nod!!!)

acts/act6/miraend6.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act6/miraend6.html.dialogue: I-I felt the same thing, about the-- About the King!

acts/act6/miraend6.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act6/miraend6.html.dialogue: About being the chosen! About having to save everyone!!!

acts/act6/miraend6.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act6/miraend6.html.dialogue: Everyone was counting on me, so I didn't want to... Bother them with my problems...

acts/act6/miraend6.html.speaker: Siffrin
acts/act6/miraend6.html.dialogue: "But the problems still exist, even if you ignore them."

acts/act6/miraend6.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act6/miraend6.html.dialogue: Exactly!

acts/act6/miraend6.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act6/miraend6.html.dialogue: ...We're very similar in that way, aren't we?

acts/act6/miraend6.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act6/miraend6.html.dialogue: But... What I'm getting at is...

acts/act6/miraend6.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act6/miraend6.html.dialogue: You were dealing with so much, in the last two days...

acts/act6/miraend6.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act6/miraend6.html.dialogue: And I didn't insist enough, and...

acts/act6/miraend6.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act6/miraend6.html.dialogue: So, Siffrin! During this journey we're about to start together...

acts/act6/miraend6.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act6/miraend6.html.dialogue: W-We should talk more, the two of us! About things! About how we feel!!!

acts/act6/miraend6.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act6/miraend6.html.dialogue: So we can help each other out! And so we have someone to, um, hold us accountable! On feelings!!!

acts/act6/miraend6.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act6/miraend6.html.dialogue: I-If that's okay!!! Maybe you'd like to talk to Isabeau or Odile instead--

acts/act6/miraend6.html.speaker: Siffrin
acts/act6/miraend6.html.dialogue: "I'd love that, Mira."

acts/act6/miraend6.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act6/miraend6.html.dialogue: Oh!

acts/act6/miraend6.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act6/miraend6.html.dialogue: Hehehe, yay!

acts/act6/miraend6.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act6/miraend6.html.dialogue: Feelings buddies!

acts/act6/miraend6.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act6/miraend6.html.dialogue: "Feelings buddies."
(You nod firmly at each other, then grin.)

acts/act6/miraend6.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act6/miraend6.html.dialogue: Okay! I need to think about what we'll need to bring for this new journey...

acts/act6/miraend6.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act6/miraend6.html.dialogue: So go and talk to everyone! But you can talk to me later, too, if you want!
(You smile.)

acts/act6/miraend6.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act6/miraend6.html.dialogue: Hi again, Siffrin!

acts/act6/miraend6.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act6/miraend6.html.dialogue: O-OH!!!

acts/act6/miraend6.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act6/miraend6.html.dialogue: No, I couldn't have done it without everyone else--

acts/act6/miraend6.html.speaker: Siffrin
acts/act6/miraend6.html.dialogue: "You did it!!!"

acts/act6/miraend6.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act6/miraend6.html.dialogue: No, I--

acts/act6/miraend6.html.speaker: Siffrin
acts/act6/miraend6.html.dialogue: "You did!!!"

acts/act6/miraend6.html.speaker: Siffrin
acts/act6/miraend6.html.dialogue: "You did it!!!!!!"

acts/act6/miraend6.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act6/miraend6.html.dialogue: I did, didn't I...?

acts/act6/miraend6.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act6/miraend6.html.dialogue: I defeated the King...

acts/act6/miraend6.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act6/miraend6.html.dialogue: I saved Vaugarde...?

acts/act6/miraend6.html.speaker: Siffrin
acts/act6/miraend6.html.dialogue: "You saved Vaugarde."

acts/act6/miraend6.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act6/miraend6.html.dialogue: Oh Change...
(You smile.)

acts/act6/miraend6.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act6/miraend6.html.dialogue: I'm glad he's gone. And his curse has been reversed, now, too...

acts/act6/miraend6.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act6/miraend6.html.dialogue: But... Forgive me if I'm wrong, but it seemed like you and the King... Knew each other?

acts/act6/miraend6.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act6/miraend6.html.dialogue: The way he talked to you... I...

acts/act6/miraend6.html.speaker: Siffrin
acts/act6/miraend6.html.dialogue: (You take a breath, and say it.)     "We came from the same country, that's all."

acts/act6/miraend6.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act6/miraend6.html.dialogue: Oh!

acts/act6/miraend6.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act6/miraend6.html.dialogue: W-Well, I think that counts for a lot! Coming from the same place, sharing the same traditions, that counts for a lot!!!

acts/act6/miraend6.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act6/miraend6.html.dialogue: I just... He's frozen in time now, isn't he...?

acts/act6/miraend6.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act6/miraend6.html.dialogue: Should I... Should I not have--

acts/act6/miraend6.html.speaker: Siffrin
acts/act6/miraend6.html.dialogue: "No, it's fine."

acts/act6/miraend6.html.speaker: Siffrin
acts/act6/miraend6.html.dialogue: "It's probably better that way."

acts/act6/miraend6.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act6/miraend6.html.dialogue: Oh...

acts/act6/miraend6.html.speaker: Siffrin
acts/act6/miraend6.html.dialogue: (...) "He seemed happy, before he got completely frozen."
(Frozen the very moment he remembered it all...)
(He'll remember your country forever.)
(Lucky.)

acts/act6/miraend6.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act6/miraend6.html.dialogue: ...Your country, huh...

acts/act6/miraend6.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act6/miraend6.html.dialogue: Will you... Tell me about it, someday?

acts/act6/miraend6.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act6/miraend6.html.dialogue: U-Unless you already talked about it to any past Mirabelles!!! I wouldn't want you to repeat yourself!!!

acts/act6/miraend6.html.speaker: Siffrin
acts/act6/miraend6.html.dialogue: "I haven't."

acts/act6/miraend6.html.speaker: Siffrin
acts/act6/miraend6.html.dialogue: "And even if I did..."

acts/act6/miraend6.html.speaker: Siffrin
acts/act6/miraend6.html.dialogue: "I'd like that. To talk to you about it for a bit."

acts/act6/miraend6.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act6/miraend6.html.dialogue: Oh...

acts/act6/miraend6.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act6/miraend6.html.dialogue: Wonderful! I'll be waiting, then!
(She jumps in place a little, happy about the idea.)
(You copy her, and you both jump in place for a bit, grinning.)

acts/act6/miraend6.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act6/miraend6.html.dialogue: Hm? What about it?

acts/act6/miraend6.html.speaker: Siffrin
acts/act6/miraend6.html.dialogue: "I know you don't want to know spoilers about past you..."

acts/act6/miraend6.html.speaker: Siffrin
acts/act6/miraend6.html.dialogue: "But what about something that happened to you? Would that be okay for me to tell?"

acts/act6/miraend6.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act6/miraend6.html.dialogue: Hm...

acts/act6/miraend6.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act6/miraend6.html.dialogue: As long as it's not spoilers on me, specifically, I suppose?

acts/act6/miraend6.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act6/miraend6.html.dialogue: Why? Did something happen during one of your loops?

acts/act6/miraend6.html.speaker: Siffrin
acts/act6/miraend6.html.dialogue: (Well, then.)     "So, we met the Change God."

acts/act6/miraend6.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act6/miraend6.html.dialogue: Oh, okay! Like, one of the statues?

acts/act6/miraend6.html.speaker: Siffrin
acts/act6/miraend6.html.dialogue: "Like, the ACTUAL Change God."

acts/act6/miraend6.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act6/miraend6.html.dialogue: Oh, okay!

acts/act6/miraend6.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act6/miraend6.html.dialogue: Wait are you serious.
(You tell Mirabelle all about your encounter with the Change God.)

acts/act6/miraend6.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act6/miraend6.html.dialogue: Alright, I'm going to put this in today's pile of things I will need some time to process.

acts/act6/miraend6.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act6/miraend6.html.dialogue: Riiiight below "my friend was stuck looping through time for a long time".

acts/act6/miraend6.html.speaker: Siffrin
acts/act6/miraend6.html.dialogue: (Aw!) "I'm flattered!"

acts/act6/miraend6.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act6/miraend6.html.dialogue: Hehehe!

acts/act6/miraend6.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act6/miraend6.html.dialogue: Wait, you shouldn't be!!!
(You both stare at each other for a second, then laugh.)

acts/act6/miraend6.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act6/miraend6.html.dialogue: Oh no.

acts/act6/miraend6.html.speaker: Siffrin
acts/act6/miraend6.html.dialogue: (Ah, but you need to make sure!) "I-It's not spoilers since it's something that happened way before, isn't it?"

acts/act6/miraend6.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act6/miraend6.html.dialogue: No, it's not spoilers, but...

acts/act6/miraend6.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act6/miraend6.html.dialogue: Wh-What, will you tease me about it?!?

acts/act6/miraend6.html.speaker: Siffrin
acts/act6/miraend6.html.dialogue: "No, of course not!!!"

acts/act6/miraend6.html.speaker: Siffrin
acts/act6/miraend6.html.dialogue: "Even if it didn't end well, it's really nice you did it anyway."

acts/act6/miraend6.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act6/miraend6.html.dialogue: Hnrgh... Not really...

acts/act6/miraend6.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act6/miraend6.html.dialogue: It was a stupid idea anyway. I don't know anything that's worth teaching to people, so...
(Hm... If you remember correctly...)
(She couldn't say anything because she also felt like learning wasn't worthwhile on its own... But...)

acts/act6/miraend6.html.speaker: Siffrin
acts/act6/miraend6.html.dialogue: "But don't you think you learned a lot during our journey?"

acts/act6/miraend6.html.speaker: Siffrin
acts/act6/miraend6.html.dialogue: "And don't you think people would line up to go to a class taught by Vaugarde's chosen one?"

acts/act6/miraend6.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act6/miraend6.html.dialogue: Suddenly I'm filled with stress and fear.
(Hah!)

acts/act6/miraend6.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act6/miraend6.html.dialogue: Hehe...

acts/act6/miraend6.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act6/miraend6.html.dialogue: Hahaha!
(You laugh together.)

acts/act6/miraend6.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act6/miraend6.html.dialogue: ...But yes, I... There is a lot more I could teach people now, couldn't I...?

acts/act6/miraend6.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act6/miraend6.html.dialogue: But I feel like there's so many things I could do, other than teaching...

acts/act6/miraend6.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act6/miraend6.html.dialogue: You know, um... Don't tell anyone, but I've been thinking some parts of the Change Belief are... A little silly.

acts/act6/miraend6.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act6/miraend6.html.dialogue: I've been meaning to talk to the Head Housemaiden about it at some point...
(She did mention it before!!! That she felt like the Change Belief meant that people might not feel comfortable staying the same, might not feel comfortable being okay with who they are!!!)
(You have so much you want to tell her about, but you try very hard not to show it.)

acts/act6/miraend6.html.speaker: Siffrin
acts/act6/miraend6.html.dialogue: "Interesting idea!!!"

acts/act6/miraend6.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act6/miraend6.html.dialogue: ...    Did past me get the same idea.

acts/act6/miraend6.html.speaker: Siffrin
acts/act6/miraend6.html.dialogue: "...Yes, a little."

acts/act6/miraend6.html.speaker: Siffrin
acts/act6/miraend6.html.dialogue: "But she never got the chance to, um... To go farther with it."

acts/act6/miraend6.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act6/miraend6.html.dialogue: Oh! So... So this would be... New, to you? To me?
(You nod!)

acts/act6/miraend6.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act6/miraend6.html.dialogue: Oh!!!

acts/act6/miraend6.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act6/miraend6.html.dialogue: Hehehe, then, then I'll try it out!

acts/act6/miraend6.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act6/miraend6.html.dialogue: I'll have to talk with madame Odile! She would probably know how to help!!!
(Her smile is infectious.)
(You grin back.)

acts/act6/miraend6.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act6/miraend6.html.dialogue: Oh, okay!

acts/act6/miraend6.html.speaker: Mirabelle
acts/act6/miraend6.html.dialogue: Hehehe... Hi to you also, Siffrin!

acts/act6/odileend6.html.speaker: Siffrin
acts/act6/odileend6.html.dialogue: "Odile..."

acts/act6/odileend6.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act6/odileend6.html.dialogue: Oh, Siffrin... Is your fever better?
(You nod.)
(You feel a little lightheaded and weak, still...)
(But you don't feel as... Off, as you felt earlier.)

acts/act6/odileend6.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act6/odileend6.html.dialogue: Good.

acts/act6/odileend6.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act6/odileend6.html.dialogue: I'm glad you're feeling better. You really worried us earlier.

acts/act6/odileend6.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act6/odileend6.html.dialogue: We were...     Really, really worried for you, Siffrin.

acts/act6/odileend6.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act6/odileend6.html.dialogue: Oh, also, I'm going to repeat myself: One: I forgive you, out of the goodness of my heart, which means that two: you don't need to apologize.

acts/act6/odileend6.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act6/odileend6.html.dialogue: What's wrong?

acts/act6/odileend6.html.speaker: Siffrin
acts/act6/odileend6.html.dialogue: "I think everyone is taking what I did a little too well."

acts/act6/odileend6.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act6/odileend6.html.dialogue: What? Your time loops, or how much of a stupid annoying crab you've been?

acts/act6/odileend6.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act6/odileend6.html.dialogue: Don't worry. We'd tell you if we were mad.

acts/act6/odileend6.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act6/odileend6.html.dialogue: Maybe for some of us, the questions and anger will come later...

acts/act6/odileend6.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act6/odileend6.html.dialogue: But isn't it good that for now, we're okay with it all?

acts/act6/odileend6.html.speaker: Siffrin
acts/act6/odileend6.html.dialogue: "But you shouldn't be okay with it!"

acts/act6/odileend6.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act6/odileend6.html.dialogue: ...     Siffrin.

acts/act6/odileend6.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act6/odileend6.html.dialogue: Yes, you said horrible things yesterday, which made us all upset and angry...

acts/act6/odileend6.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act6/odileend6.html.dialogue: But then, we learned you went to the House alone, and went through it all on your own.

acts/act6/odileend6.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act6/odileend6.html.dialogue: And we learned that those horrible things you did... You did them because you'd been going depressed and insane...

acts/act6/odileend6.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act6/odileend6.html.dialogue: ...Because you were repeating the same two days for a very long time.

acts/act6/odileend6.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act6/odileend6.html.dialogue: A time loop that started because you wanted to stay with us so much you were, subconsciously or not, willing to trap yourself over it.

acts/act6/odileend6.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act6/odileend6.html.dialogue: Do you know how it makes us feel?

acts/act6/odileend6.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act6/odileend6.html.dialogue: Yeeeeesh.

acts/act6/odileend6.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act6/odileend6.html.dialogue: . . .I can't speak for everyone, but...

acts/act6/odileend6.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act6/odileend6.html.dialogue: But I think it's the cutest thing I've ever heard.

acts/act6/odileend6.html.speaker: Siffrin
acts/act6/odileend6.html.dialogue: "CUTE?!?!"

acts/act6/odileend6.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act6/odileend6.html.dialogue: Siffrin, Siffrin, Siffrin.

acts/act6/odileend6.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act6/odileend6.html.dialogue: You love us so much you used some forgotten Craft power to stay with us forever.

acts/act6/odileend6.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act6/odileend6.html.dialogue: That's cute.

acts/act6/odileend6.html.speaker: Siffrin
acts/act6/odileend6.html.dialogue: "THAT'S NOT CUTE, THAT'S--"

acts/act6/odileend6.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act6/odileend6.html.dialogue: Cute.

acts/act6/odileend6.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act6/odileend6.html.dialogue: Can't change my mind.

acts/act6/odileend6.html.speaker: Siffrin
acts/act6/odileend6.html.dialogue: "YOU, YOU--"
(You can't help but laugh.)

acts/act6/odileend6.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act6/odileend6.html.dialogue: Heh.

acts/act6/odileend6.html.speaker: Siffrin
acts/act6/odileend6.html.dialogue: "That's not cute, that's..."

acts/act6/odileend6.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act6/odileend6.html.dialogue: It's very cute.

acts/act6/odileend6.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act6/odileend6.html.dialogue: ...Siffrin.

acts/act6/odileend6.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act6/odileend6.html.dialogue: Sure, you might think you messed up yesterday. And maybe you did.

acts/act6/odileend6.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act6/odileend6.html.dialogue: But. . . And I'm sure I'm not the only one feeling like this...

acts/act6/odileend6.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act6/odileend6.html.dialogue: But I feel like I messed up yesterday, too.
(Huh?)

acts/act6/odileend6.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act6/odileend6.html.dialogue: I didn't talk to you. I didn't try to figure out what was wrong, even though something clearly was wrong.

acts/act6/odileend6.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act6/odileend6.html.dialogue: And...

acts/act6/odileend6.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act6/odileend6.html.dialogue: . . .     I just feel like I could've done more to help you, is all.

acts/act6/odileend6.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act6/odileend6.html.dialogue: Hah!     I can tell you disagree.

acts/act6/odileend6.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act6/odileend6.html.dialogue: That's alright.

acts/act6/odileend6.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act6/odileend6.html.dialogue: We can both feel guilty, and hopefully our guilt will cancel each other out eventually.

acts/act6/odileend6.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act6/odileend6.html.dialogue: But, please, remember this.

acts/act6/odileend6.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act6/odileend6.html.dialogue: We want to stay with you for a bit longer, too.

acts/act6/odileend6.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act6/odileend6.html.dialogue: Because we feel the same way you do.

acts/act6/odileend6.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act6/odileend6.html.dialogue: We care for you. We want you to be happy. We want to spend more time with you.

acts/act6/odileend6.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act6/odileend6.html.dialogue: And... I think it'd be nice to show you around Ka Bue, too.

acts/act6/odileend6.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act6/odileend6.html.dialogue: Have to make that wish of yours come true, huh?

acts/act6/odileend6.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act6/odileend6.html.dialogue: And... One day, this new journey that we are starting together... It'll end. It's inevitable that we'll all go our separate ways, eventually.

acts/act6/odileend6.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act6/odileend6.html.dialogue: But, even if we're not together... Even if we're in completely different places from each other...

acts/act6/odileend6.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act6/odileend6.html.dialogue: I know that I won't forget the times we've spent together.

acts/act6/odileend6.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act6/odileend6.html.dialogue: I won't ever forget you, Siffrin.     None of us will.

acts/act6/odileend6.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act6/odileend6.html.dialogue: I'll even say the dreaded L-word, if you're still not convinced we care for you, but don't push your luck.

acts/act6/odileend6.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act6/odileend6.html.dialogue: Okay?
(You nod.)

acts/act6/odileend6.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act6/odileend6.html.dialogue: Good.

acts/act6/odileend6.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act6/odileend6.html.dialogue: And really, Siffrin. If I got upset every time some child decided to be mean to me, I'd always be upset.

acts/act6/odileend6.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act6/odileend6.html.dialogue: Don't worry about it. Like I said, I've already forgiven you.

acts/act6/odileend6.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act6/odileend6.html.dialogue: I hope you'll forgive me for not trying harder to find out what was wrong, too.

acts/act6/odileend6.html.speaker: Siffrin
acts/act6/odileend6.html.dialogue: "...Okay."

acts/act6/odileend6.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act6/odileend6.html.dialogue: Okay.

acts/act6/odileend6.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act6/odileend6.html.dialogue: Now get out of here, and go talk to everyone else. This emotional talk tired me out.

acts/act6/odileend6.html.speaker: Siffrin
acts/act6/odileend6.html.dialogue: "Not the battles, or anything?"

acts/act6/odileend6.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act6/odileend6.html.dialogue: Of course not, silly. I have a body in peak physical condition.

acts/act6/odileend6.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act6/odileend6.html.dialogue: Go away now, Siffrin.
(She ruffles your hair, and pushes you away with a smile.)
(You smile back.)

acts/act6/odileend6.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act6/odileend6.html.dialogue: Hello again, Siffrin. How are you doing?

acts/act6/odileend6.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act6/odileend6.html.dialogue: Hm? For what?

acts/act6/odileend6.html.speaker: Siffrin
acts/act6/odileend6.html.dialogue: "For what happened to me."

acts/act6/odileend6.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act6/odileend6.html.dialogue: Ah... With your loops, you mean.

acts/act6/odileend6.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act6/odileend6.html.dialogue: Well. Do you want the short explanation, or the long one?
(You just want to put this behind you.)

acts/act6/odileend6.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act6/odileend6.html.dialogue: Alright, well, in a few sentences...

acts/act6/odileend6.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act6/odileend6.html.dialogue: Your wish to stay with us, and Vaugarde's wish to be saved, merged together into a Super Wish.

acts/act6/odileend6.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act6/odileend6.html.dialogue: Mixed them up, and made you able to spend forever with us, and also allowing you endless tries against the King.

acts/act6/odileend6.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act6/odileend6.html.dialogue: But when you'd beat the King, you probably subconsciously realized this was the end of your time with us, and so the wish would make you loop back...

acts/act6/odileend6.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act6/odileend6.html.dialogue: ...Back to a time where you are still with us.

acts/act6/odileend6.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act6/odileend6.html.dialogue: That's pretty much it. Makes sense?

acts/act6/odileend6.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act6/odileend6.html.dialogue: Hm.

acts/act6/odileend6.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act6/odileend6.html.dialogue: Urgh. Sure. So...
(You have to know...)

acts/act6/odileend6.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act6/odileend6.html.dialogue: Alright, well...

acts/act6/odileend6.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act6/odileend6.html.dialogue: First, Wish Craft is a thing. I'm guessing you know more about Wish Craft than we do, at this point.

acts/act6/odileend6.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act6/odileend6.html.dialogue: Not only because of what you've found out through your loops, but also because I believe you knew some of the rituals beforehand...?
(You nod.)
(Consciously or not, you've always known them.)
(Grew up with them, if you had to guess.)

acts/act6/odileend6.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act6/odileend6.html.dialogue: Hm. Well...

acts/act6/odileend6.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act6/odileend6.html.dialogue: Before your loops started, you made a wish to stay with all of us.

acts/act6/odileend6.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act6/odileend6.html.dialogue: A simple wish, but backed with rituals. It'd make sense for Wish Craft to hear your wish, and try to make it come true.

acts/act6/odileend6.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act6/odileend6.html.dialogue: Unrelated to this, people in Vaugarde wished for the King to be defeated, for people to not be frozen in time anymore...

acts/act6/odileend6.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act6/odileend6.html.dialogue: Wishes that boiled down to "we wish for Vaugarde to be saved from the King."

acts/act6/odileend6.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act6/odileend6.html.dialogue: Everyone in Vaugarde knows about the Favor Trees, but no one really knew how to Craft wishes from them.

acts/act6/odileend6.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act6/odileend6.html.dialogue: And rituals are more important than intent, when it comes to wishes...

acts/act6/odileend6.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act6/odileend6.html.dialogue: But that's when it's a single person doing Wish Craft. But an entire country, channeling their belief towards a single goal?

acts/act6/odileend6.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act6/odileend6.html.dialogue: No rituals needed. Just intent.

acts/act6/odileend6.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act6/odileend6.html.dialogue: And, in the end... Mirabelle, and every one of us... We had little to no chance of winning against the King on our own.

acts/act6/odileend6.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act6/odileend6.html.dialogue: Which would make Vaugarde's wish, filled with belief, and yours, supported by rituals, impossible to grant.

acts/act6/odileend6.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act6/odileend6.html.dialogue: And so... My theory is that Wish Craft merged those two wishes together.

acts/act6/odileend6.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act6/odileend6.html.dialogue: Mixed them up and made you able to spend more time with us, and also allowing you endless tries against the King.

acts/act6/odileend6.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act6/odileend6.html.dialogue: The intent to defeat the King, with the means to do it.

acts/act6/odileend6.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act6/odileend6.html.dialogue: So every time you died, you'd come back, to make sure you could save Vaugarde.

acts/act6/odileend6.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act6/odileend6.html.dialogue: But... I'm guessing that this isn't the first time you're here, right? In this room, having beaten the King?

acts/act6/odileend6.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act6/odileend6.html.dialogue: Knowing this is the end of your journey?

acts/act6/odileend6.html.speaker: Siffrin
acts/act6/odileend6.html.dialogue: "That we can't be together anymore."

acts/act6/odileend6.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act6/odileend6.html.dialogue: And if you're convinced you can't be with us anymore, that this is the end...

acts/act6/odileend6.html.speaker: Siffrin
acts/act6/odileend6.html.dialogue: "Wish Craft reacts..."

acts/act6/odileend6.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act6/odileend6.html.dialogue: And brings you back to a time where you're with us once more.

acts/act6/odileend6.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act6/odileend6.html.dialogue: Phrased like that, it kind of feels like you're to blame for your own suffering...

acts/act6/odileend6.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act6/odileend6.html.dialogue: But listen. I don't know everything that happened while you looped again and again...

acts/act6/odileend6.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act6/odileend6.html.dialogue: But the truth is, the first time we fought the King...

acts/act6/odileend6.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act6/odileend6.html.dialogue: We died, didn't we?

acts/act6/odileend6.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act6/odileend6.html.dialogue: Or maybe we even died before we even got to him...

acts/act6/odileend6.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act6/odileend6.html.dialogue: Siffrin...

acts/act6/odileend6.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act6/odileend6.html.dialogue: It's just conjecture, but I think that without you, everyone's wish to save Vaugarde would have been... Aimless. Directionless.

acts/act6/odileend6.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act6/odileend6.html.dialogue: Your wish gave everyone's wish direction.

acts/act6/odileend6.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act6/odileend6.html.dialogue: And without your wish, the King would've won.

acts/act6/odileend6.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act6/odileend6.html.dialogue: And what kind of ending would that have been?

acts/act6/odileend6.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act6/odileend6.html.dialogue: Indeed.

acts/act6/odileend6.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act6/odileend6.html.dialogue: ...     Oh, Siffrin...

acts/act6/odileend6.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act6/odileend6.html.dialogue: This experience... It may stay with you for a while.

acts/act6/odileend6.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act6/odileend6.html.dialogue: It may stay with you forever.

acts/act6/odileend6.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act6/odileend6.html.dialogue: But, I want you to know this...

acts/act6/odileend6.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act6/odileend6.html.dialogue: Mirabelle, Isabeau, Boniface...

acts/act6/odileend6.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act6/odileend6.html.dialogue: And I, too...

acts/act6/odileend6.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act6/odileend6.html.dialogue: We won't leave you alone so easily. Even after our new journey ends.

acts/act6/odileend6.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act6/odileend6.html.dialogue: And so. You have to promise to tell us if something's wrong, now. None of that "I'll keep all my feelings here and one day I'll die" stuff, got it?

acts/act6/odileend6.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act6/odileend6.html.dialogue: GOT IT?

acts/act6/odileend6.html.speaker: Siffrin
acts/act6/odileend6.html.dialogue: "I'll try."

acts/act6/odileend6.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act6/odileend6.html.dialogue: Heh.

acts/act6/odileend6.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act6/odileend6.html.dialogue: It's all I can ask for.
(Odile looks at you warmly.)
(You hesitantly smile back.)

acts/act6/odileend6.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act6/odileend6.html.dialogue: Linguini.

acts/act6/odileend6.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act6/odileend6.html.dialogue: I "linguini" you, Siffrin.

acts/act6/odileend6.html.speaker: Siffrin
acts/act6/odileend6.html.dialogue: (HAH!) "Odile..."

acts/act6/odileend6.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act6/odileend6.html.dialogue: Hm?

acts/act6/odileend6.html.speaker: Siffrin
acts/act6/odileend6.html.dialogue: "I feel very 'gnocchi' to know you, too."
(Yay, success, she laughed!!!)
(You beam.)

acts/act6/odileend6.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act6/odileend6.html.dialogue: ...I know it's only been two days, or even less that that...

acts/act6/odileend6.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act6/odileend6.html.dialogue: But I missed your stupid puns, Siffrin.

acts/act6/odileend6.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act6/odileend6.html.dialogue: I was very worried about you, today. We all were.
(You make a face.)

acts/act6/odileend6.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act6/odileend6.html.dialogue: Heh, you don't like it, huh? Being worried about.

acts/act6/odileend6.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act6/odileend6.html.dialogue: Feels gross, doesn't it?

acts/act6/odileend6.html.speaker: Siffrin
acts/act6/odileend6.html.dialogue: (It does!) "...I'm not used to people being worried about me."

acts/act6/odileend6.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act6/odileend6.html.dialogue: ...Is it...

acts/act6/odileend6.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act6/odileend6.html.dialogue: Is it because you don't remember it happening?
(You flinch a little.)

acts/act6/odileend6.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act6/odileend6.html.dialogue: ...Siffrin...

acts/act6/odileend6.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act6/odileend6.html.dialogue: I won't pretend to know I understand how it feels. To not remember your childhood, your country, anything.

acts/act6/odileend6.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act6/odileend6.html.dialogue: But I have two facts for you.

acts/act6/odileend6.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act6/odileend6.html.dialogue: One: we should talk about it, you and I. I might understand what you're going through better than most.
(Maybe.)
(It did help a bit, to talk to her about it.)

acts/act6/odileend6.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act6/odileend6.html.dialogue: And two...

acts/act6/odileend6.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act6/odileend6.html.dialogue: Just because you don't remember it happening, doesn't mean it didn't happen.

acts/act6/odileend6.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act6/odileend6.html.dialogue: You know, to be worried about someone, you have to love them.

acts/act6/odileend6.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act6/odileend6.html.dialogue: And you are very lovable, Siffrin. Whatever happened before, I have no doubt you were loved.
(Oh!)
(You feel very warm.)
(You try to hide your face by lowering your hat, but...)

acts/act6/odileend6.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act6/odileend6.html.dialogue: Hah, can't hide your face without your hat, huh?
(Hmf!)
(You both laugh.)

acts/act6/odileend6.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act6/odileend6.html.dialogue: Ah...

acts/act6/odileend6.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act6/odileend6.html.dialogue: By "everything", I suppose you mean your loops?
(You nod.)
(In a way, she even found out about how your wish was part of it, even before you realized it, let alone accepted it.)

acts/act6/odileend6.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act6/odileend6.html.dialogue: Hm.

acts/act6/odileend6.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act6/odileend6.html.dialogue: And what happened, after I found out?

acts/act6/odileend6.html.speaker: Siffrin
acts/act6/odileend6.html.dialogue: "I immediately looped back, of course."

acts/act6/odileend6.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act6/odileend6.html.dialogue: Of course you did.

acts/act6/odileend6.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act6/odileend6.html.dialogue: You and Isabeau. Two cowardly peas in a pod.

acts/act6/odileend6.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act6/odileend6.html.dialogue: I AM very proud of myself, though. Even through time, I can smell lies.

acts/act6/odileend6.html.speaker: Siffrin
acts/act6/odileend6.html.dialogue: (...)     "It was a little scary."

acts/act6/odileend6.html.speaker: Siffrin
acts/act6/odileend6.html.dialogue: "When you found out."

acts/act6/odileend6.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act6/odileend6.html.dialogue: Hm. Of course it was.

acts/act6/odileend6.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act6/odileend6.html.dialogue: If you had lied to me for an entire day, on such an important day, on something I could feel was important, I would've been angry.

acts/act6/odileend6.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act6/odileend6.html.dialogue: But... It probably didn't help, did it.
(Huh?)

acts/act6/odileend6.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act6/odileend6.html.dialogue: If I was... Gentler, when I found out... Maybe you would've gotten help earlier.
(Oh!)

acts/act6/odileend6.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act6/odileend6.html.dialogue: I know I can be a bit... Abrasive. So...
(No, it's not her fault, at all...)
(If you had talked to her then, instead of fleeing, then maybe...)

acts/act6/odileend6.html.speaker: Siffrin
acts/act6/odileend6.html.dialogue: "We're here now, aren't we...?"

acts/act6/odileend6.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act6/odileend6.html.dialogue: We are. Thank you, Siffrin.
(You smile.)

acts/act6/odileend6.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act6/odileend6.html.dialogue: Okay.

acts/act6/odileend6.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act6/odileend6.html.dialogue: Hi.

acts/act6/odileend6.html.speaker: Odile
acts/act6/odileend6.html.dialogue: Now go. I still have to read that familytale you found me.
(You smile, and go.)

events/bombquest.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/bombquest.html.dialogue: Was your roommate making bombs? Because with all the materials she has in here, it looks like she was learning how to make Craft bombs.

events/bombquest.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/bombquest.html.dialogue: I'm just saying. She has the materials to make a Craft bomb.

events/bombquest.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/bombquest.html.dialogue: Looks like she didn't finish it though, if that makes you feel better?

events/bombquest.html.speaker: Odile
events/bombquest.html.dialogue: How... do you know... how to make a Craft bomb...

events/bombquest.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/bombquest.html.dialogue: I-I learned it while I was studying to become a Defender... B-But isn't that just common knowledge???

events/bombquest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/bombquest.html.dialogue: I-I've never learned how to make a bomb!!!

events/bombquest.html.speaker: Bonnie
events/bombquest.html.dialogue: I know I'm a kid and you'd think I DEFINITELY know how to make bombs, but I've never learned either.

events/bombquest.html.speaker: Bonnie
events/bombquest.html.dialogue: We have to throw a bomb at the King.

events/bombquest.html.speaker: Odile
events/bombquest.html.dialogue: It would. What else do we need?

events/bombquest.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/bombquest.html.dialogue: Your roommate has some stuff already, so we just need...
(Isabeau starts explaining what you need with very confusing words!)

events/bombquest.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/bombquest.html.dialogue: There's already a short gizmo-gadget here, so we just need a long thingy-thing, and a secret ingredient.
(You put the short gizmo-gadget in your pocket along with your Souvenirs.)

events/bombquest.html.speaker: Loop
events/bombquest.html.dialogue: Do it, do it, do it, it's gonna be so useful.

events/bombquest.html.speaker: Loop
events/bombquest.html.dialogue: So you need... A long thingy-thing, a short gizmo-gadget, and a secret ingredient, huh?

events/bombquest.html.speaker: Loop
events/bombquest.html.dialogue: The short gizmo-gadget is in your Housemaiden's dorm room... I wonder where the rest is.

events/bombquest.html.speaker: Loop
events/bombquest.html.dialogue: When you have all three ingredients, just interact with one of them in your pockets to make it!
(A letter is laying on the barrel.)
(...You can only describe the item inside the letter as... A long thingy-thing.)
(You put the thingy-thing in your pocket along with your Souvenirs.)
(Don't you need this to make a bomb...?)
(She was the one who was getting ready to make a bomb in Mirabelle's dorm room, wasn't she?)
(...She's holding something tightly in her fist.)
(You put the vial in your pocket along with your Souvenirs.)
(You, uh, keep the bomb in your pockets. Wouldn't want Bonnie to carry it.)
[If you have this Memory equipped and loop back to the King, the Bomb will magically appear in your Pockets!]
(You kind of mess it up, but manage to throw the bomb at the King!)

events/bondingearrings.html.dialogue: (Someone frozen in time.)
(Someone looking for their partner, frozen in time.)

events/bondingearrings.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/bondingearrings.html.dialogue: Oh! This is...

events/bondingearrings.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/bondingearrings.html.dialogue: I don't know. I've seen them around, sometimes. I think they're someone's partner...?

events/bondingearrings.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/bondingearrings.html.dialogue: Someone's bonded partner, even.

events/bondingearrings.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/bondingearrings.html.dialogue: Look at their earrings. Aren't they bonding earrings?
(You look at them.)
(Their left ear has a beautiful dark dangling earring, and the right ear, a simple transparent one.)
(Are those bonding earrings? You're not familiar with what that is...)

events/bondingearrings.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/bondingearrings.html.dialogue: The earrings have different, but complimentary designs... How romantic!

events/bondingearrings.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/bondingearrings.html.dialogue: I wonder which half is theirs! I feel like the clear one represents them better, so maybe that's the one their partner made...

events/bondingearrings.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/bondingearrings.html.dialogue: Do you think we'll see their partner somewhere in the House?

events/bondingearrings.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/bondingearrings.html.dialogue: Yes... They might've been looking for each other when the King attacked.

events/bondingearrings.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/bondingearrings.html.dialogue: If we manage to beat the King, they'd get back to normal, and look for their partner...

events/bondingearrings.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/bondingearrings.html.dialogue: They'd start running, trying to find them...

events/bondingearrings.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/bondingearrings.html.dialogue: Flower petals in their wake...

events/bondingearrings.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/bondingearrings.html.dialogue: And then, they'd see each other from across a hallway, eyes locking...

events/bondingearrings.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/bondingearrings.html.dialogue: They'd take one step forward, hesitantly, wondering if this is real...

events/bondingearrings.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/bondingearrings.html.dialogue: And then...!!!

events/bondingearrings.html.speaker: Bonnie
events/bondingearrings.html.dialogue: And then they'd trip on a brick and BREAK THEIR NOSE!

events/bondingearrings.html.speaker: Odile
events/bondingearrings.html.dialogue: And their partner, seeing the blood, would faint in horror...

events/bondingearrings.html.speaker: Bonnie
events/bondingearrings.html.dialogue: And then they'd feel so bad they made their partner faint, they would exile themselves in shame!

events/bondingearrings.html.speaker: Odile
events/bondingearrings.html.dialogue: Ah, yes... How romantic...

events/bondingearrings.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/bondingearrings.html.dialogue: IT'S NOT!!!

events/bondingearrings.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/bondingearrings.html.dialogue: STOP CRUSHING OUR DREAMS!!!
(What's a bonding earring? You suppose it's not very important, but...)
(The bookcase is filled with some books about many, many random things.)
(There's a book about something called "bonding earrings".)
(Bonding earrings... Isn't that what the frozen person on the way to the library was wearing?)
(You pick up the book and flip through it.)
(...It's pretty dry. You'd rather not read it, actually.)
(You pick up the book and flip through it, waiting for Mirabelle to comment.)

events/bondingearrings.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/bondingearrings.html.dialogue: Siffrin? Are you curious about bonding earrings?
(You nod.)

events/bondingearrings.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/bondingearrings.html.dialogue: Do you not have those, where you're from?

events/bondingearrings.html.speaker: Odile
events/bondingearrings.html.dialogue: You don't? We have bonding earrings in Ka Bue as well.

events/bondingearrings.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/bondingearrings.html.dialogue: Let me explain it for you, Sif.

events/bondingearrings.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/bondingearrings.html.dialogue: You see, Sif, when people love each other very much...

events/bondingearrings.html.speaker: Bonnie
events/bondingearrings.html.dialogue: Oh, oh, I wanna know what happens when people love each other very much, no one's ever told me!

events/bondingearrings.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/bondingearrings.html.dialogue: ISABEAU.

events/bondingearrings.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/bondingearrings.html.dialogue: ...Many things happen, and then maybe they'll decide to get bonded, and spend a very long time together.

events/bondingearrings.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/bondingearrings.html.dialogue: When they do, they'll start making a pair of bonding earrings! They're supposed to symbolize the other person, so the design is very, very important.

events/bondingearrings.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/bondingearrings.html.dialogue: And if the bonding is between three or more people, you'd make as many earrings as there are people!

events/bondingearrings.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/bondingearrings.html.dialogue: And then you exchange earrings! So they'd each carry one of the earrings!

events/bondingearrings.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/bondingearrings.html.dialogue: I know it's not practiced everywhere, but it definitely is in Vaugarde.

events/bondingearrings.html.speaker: Odile
events/bondingearrings.html.dialogue: Not everyone does in Ka Bue, but it's popular there as well.

events/bondingearrings.html.speaker: Odile
events/bondingearrings.html.dialogue: Not my kind of thing, though.

events/bondingearrings.html.speaker: Siffrin
events/bondingearrings.html.dialogue: (Oh! So...)

events/bondingearrings.html.speaker: Siffrin
events/bondingearrings.html.dialogue: (Well.)

events/bondingearrings.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/bondingearrings.html.dialogue: Huh? What do you mean?
(You point at Mirabelle, Isabeau and Bonnie's ears.)

events/bondingearrings.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/bondingearrings.html.dialogue: NO?!?! THAT'S NOT WHY WE WEAR EARRINGS?!??! THOSE ARE JUST REGULAR EARRINGS!!!!

events/bondingearrings.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/bondingearrings.html.dialogue: Yeah, um, that's...

events/bondingearrings.html.speaker: Bonnie
events/bondingearrings.html.dialogue: My sister said I had to wear them.

events/bondingearrings.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/bondingearrings.html.dialogue: Well, it IS very common for people to wear earrings, but it's not... Related...
(Mirabelle, Isabeau and Bonnie all look at each other.)

events/bondingearrings.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/bondingearrings.html.dialogue: Is it related? I'm suddenly worried.

events/bondingearrings.html.speaker: Bonnie
events/bondingearrings.html.dialogue: I haven't met a lot of people without earrings, even if they're not bonding earrings!

events/bondingearrings.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/bondingearrings.html.dialogue: It's true that I know very few Vaugardians without earrings...

events/bondingearrings.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/bondingearrings.html.dialogue: Is this why we wear them? As, like...

events/bondingearrings.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/bondingearrings.html.dialogue: A way to get us used to the idea at a young age?

events/bondingearrings.html.speaker: Bonnie
events/bondingearrings.html.dialogue: A thing we gotta do because adults said so?

events/bondingearrings.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/bondingearrings.html.dialogue: EVIL MANIPULATION TO FORCE US TO GET BONDED AS WE AGE?!??!

events/bondingearrings.html.speaker: Odile
events/bondingearrings.html.dialogue: Hah. I suppose every country has its weird antiquated traditions...

events/bondingearrings.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/bondingearrings.html.dialogue: I guess so! It's kinda funny!

events/bondingearrings.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/bondingearrings.html.dialogue: EW EW EW EW EW EW!!!!!!!!!
(Mirabelle seems genuinely upset at the idea!)
(Maybe you shouldn't have brought it up...)

events/bondingearrings.html.speaker: Siffrin
events/bondingearrings.html.dialogue: (Say something!)

events/bondingearrings.html.speaker: Siffrin
events/bondingearrings.html.dialogue: (Say it again.)

events/bondingearrings.html.speaker: Siffrin
events/bondingearrings.html.dialogue: (Follow the script.)

events/bondingearrings.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/bondingearrings.html.dialogue: Aw, you think so...?
(You nod.)
(Isabeau hides his face.)

events/bondingearrings.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/bondingearrings.html.dialogue: A-Anyway, your earrings ARE nice, Mira! They make you look cute!!!

events/bondingearrings.html.speaker: Bonnie
events/bondingearrings.html.dialogue: I like my earrings because I can hang things on them.

events/bondingearrings.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/bondingearrings.html.dialogue: ...  Yes.

events/bondingearrings.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/bondingearrings.html.dialogue: My earrings do look nice.

events/bondingearrings.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/bondingearrings.html.dialogue: And they were expensive. I'll throw them away dramatically another time.

events/bondingearrings.html.speaker: Odile
events/bondingearrings.html.dialogue: That's the spirit.
(Maybe you could go see that frozen person again, in a future loop.)
(Ok, now you understand the context of this conversation.)
(Their fist is closed, as if they're holding something.)
(Could it be...?)
(You try to get it out...)

events/bondingearrings.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/bondingearrings.html.dialogue: Sif? What are you...
(Their hand is frozen in time, but you manage to get the item out.)
(...It's a dark earring, same design as the one they're wearing on their left ear.)
(You get the earring from their closed fist.)
(You got the BONDING EARRING!)
(You put the earring in your pocket along with your Souvenirs.)

events/bondingearrings.html.speaker: Odile
events/bondingearrings.html.dialogue: Oh my.

events/bondingearrings.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/bondingearrings.html.dialogue: OH!!!

events/bondingearrings.html.speaker: Bonnie
events/bondingearrings.html.dialogue: OH CRAB!!! THAT'S THE OTHER HALF!!!

events/bondingearrings.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/bondingearrings.html.dialogue: Th-They didn't give it to their partner yet?!

events/bondingearrings.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/bondingearrings.html.dialogue: We have to find their partner.

events/bondingearrings.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/bondingearrings.html.dialogue: And give them the earring...!!!
(Time to find their partner!)
(Time to find their partner.)
(Sure, not like you have anything to do anyway.)
(Someone frozen in time.)
(The pottery teacher, frozen in time.)

events/bondingearrings.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/bondingearrings.html.dialogue: Oh! That's--

events/bondingearrings.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/bondingearrings.html.dialogue: EARRINGS!!!!!!!!!
(Isabeau is pointing at a dark earring with the same design as the person from before.)

events/bondingearrings.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/bondingearrings.html.dialogue: SAME!!!! EARRING!!!!!!

events/bondingearrings.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/bondingearrings.html.dialogue: THE PARTNER!!!!!

events/bondingearrings.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/bondingearrings.html.dialogue: AND THEY ONLY HAVE ONE EARRING!!!

events/bondingearrings.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/bondingearrings.html.dialogue: WE HAVE TO GIVE THEM THE EARRING!!!!

events/bondingearrings.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/bondingearrings.html.dialogue: AND A NOTE SO THEY CAN FIND EACH OTHER!!!!

events/bondingearrings.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/bondingearrings.html.dialogue: AAAAAH!!!

events/bondingearrings.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/bondingearrings.html.dialogue: AAAAAAAAAAAAAHHHH!!!!!!

events/bondingearrings.html.speaker: Odile
events/bondingearrings.html.dialogue: Calm down, you two.

events/bondingearrings.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/bondingearrings.html.dialogue: SORRY!!! THIS IS JUST SO ROMANTIC!!!!

events/bondingearrings.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/bondingearrings.html.dialogue: WE'RE DOING THIS!!! WE'RE HELPING!!!!!!!

events/bondingearrings.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/bondingearrings.html.dialogue: SIFFRIN, THE EARRING, PLEASE!!!!!
(Stunned, you give Mirabelle the earring.)
(Smiling, you give Mirabelle the earring.)
(You already had it ready.)

events/bondingearrings.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/bondingearrings.html.dialogue: ISABEAU!!!! I HAVE IT!!!!

events/bondingearrings.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/bondingearrings.html.dialogue: Wait, where should we put the note.

events/bondingearrings.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/bondingearrings.html.dialogue: Um...

events/bondingearrings.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/bondingearrings.html.dialogue: Spear the note to their ear with the earring, maybe?

events/bondingearrings.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/bondingearrings.html.dialogue: Note earring?

events/bondingearrings.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/bondingearrings.html.dialogue: Note earring.
(They make a note earring, telling the frozen person where to meet their partner.)
(...They look a little silly, with their nice earring and a piece of paper attached to their ear.)

events/bondingearrings.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/bondingearrings.html.dialogue: ...  I'm getting a little emotional over here.

events/bondingearrings.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/bondingearrings.html.dialogue: Me too... I hope they'll find the note... And get to meet...!!!

events/bondingearrings.html.speaker: Odile
events/bondingearrings.html.dialogue: Considering how the note is attached to their ear, I think they'll notice.

events/bondingearrings.html.speaker: Bonnie
events/bondingearrings.html.dialogue: They look stupid.

events/bondingearrings.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/bondingearrings.html.dialogue: Looking stupid is nothing, in the face of true love.

events/bondingearrings.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/bondingearrings.html.dialogue: Isabeau, you're so right...!!!
(Love wins!)
(You hope you can beat the King, so they can meet again.)
(You wonder if they had time to meet each other, before everything around them looped back.)
(They probably never get to meet, do they?)

events/bondingearrings.html.speaker: Light-Haired Housemaiden
events/bondingearrings.html.dialogue: Do you know who I saw, earlier...?

events/bondingearrings.html.speaker: Light-Haired Housemaiden
events/bondingearrings.html.dialogue: The pottery teacher, giving a bonding earring to their partner!!!

events/bondingearrings.html.speaker: Housemaiden with Overalls
events/bondingearrings.html.dialogue: Oh!!! We should congratulate them!!! Where are they n--

events/bondingearrings.html.speaker: Light-Haired Housemaiden
events/bondingearrings.html.dialogue: Oh, they obviously immediately booked it to their bedroom.

events/bondingearrings.html.speaker: Light-Haired Housemaiden
events/bondingearrings.html.dialogue: Isn't love beautiful?!?

events/bondingearrings.html.speaker: Housemaiden with Overalls
events/bondingearrings.html.dialogue: I guess...

events/bonnieside.html.dialogue: (There's a space in between two books, like someone removed it.)
(...Ah, Bonnie seems to be reading it intently.)
(It has a very striking cover of a Mwudu clay figurine with large, sunken eyes and a screaming mouth.)
(Bonnie hides the book in their pocket.)

events/bonnieside.html.speaker: Bonnie
events/bonnieside.html.dialogue: N-nothing!!! It's nothing!!! Nothing at all!!!

events/bonnieside.html.speaker: Bonnie
events/bonnieside.html.dialogue: Shut up!!! It's fine!!! I'm fine!!!

events/bonnieside.html.speaker: Bonnie
events/bonnieside.html.dialogue: ...S-stop looking at it, stop looking at me!!! Shut up!!!
(There's a space in between two books, like someone removed it.)
(Bonnie took the book with the weird figurine on the cover with them, like they did the first time.)
(The cover with a Mwudu clay figurine with large, sunken eyes, and a screaming mouth...)
(You're curious. Can you find that book elsewhere?)
(You know which book Bonnie is reading, but...)
(You don't look at them, or at Bonnie.)

events/bonnieside.html.speaker: Loop
events/bonnieside.html.dialogue: A book with a scary figurine on it... They acted very defensive when they saw you'd noticed.

events/bonnieside.html.speaker: Loop
events/bonnieside.html.dialogue: But... Who cares? Is it that important to find out?
(Since Bonnie takes the book away before you can read it, you wonder if you could find that book elsewhere...)
(One of them has a very striking cover of a Mwudu clay figurine with large, sunken eyes and a screaming mouth.)
(Wait, isn't this the book Bonnie was looking at, on the third floor?)
("Life To Ashes: Death Rituals From Around the World.")
("Life To Ashes: Death Rituals From Around the World.")

events/bonnieside.html.speaker: Loop
events/bonnieside.html.dialogue: They were... And you found a copy of that book elsewhere.

events/bonnieside.html.speaker: Loop
events/bonnieside.html.dialogue: "Life To Ashes: Death Rituals From Around the World"...

events/bonnieside.html.speaker: Loop
events/bonnieside.html.dialogue: Why would... Why would they look at this book? What would make them interested in this...?
(You think you know the exact moment that made them think about this.)

events/bonnieside.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/bonnieside.html.dialogue: This room feels safe too, doesn't it?

events/bonnieside.html.speaker: Odile
events/bonnieside.html.dialogue: Maybe not. We might still have a lot to--

events/bonnieside.html.speaker: Odile
events/bonnieside.html.dialogue: How hungry are you for it to be this loud...?

events/bonnieside.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/bonnieside.html.dialogue: I don't get this swole by skipping meals!!!

events/bonnieside.html.speaker: Odile
events/bonnieside.html.dialogue: Urgh. Anyway, let's take a break for now...

events/bonnieside.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/bonnieside.html.dialogue: Bonbooooon, how much longer until the snacks are dooooone?

events/bonnieside.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/bonnieside.html.dialogue: So, um... We haven't brought it up yet, so um... I have a question?

events/bonnieside.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/bonnieside.html.dialogue: Ah, a secret adult conversation for adults no kids allowed?

events/bonnieside.html.speaker: Odile
events/bonnieside.html.dialogue: Do you not want Boniface to hear?

events/bonnieside.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/bonnieside.html.dialogue: Yeah... If we're sure they won't hear, then yeah...

events/bonnieside.html.speaker: Odile
events/bonnieside.html.dialogue: Oh gems, they actually did forget. Someone better tell them later...

events/bonnieside.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/bonnieside.html.dialogue: If any of you bites the dust, what should we do with your body?

events/bonnieside.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/bonnieside.html.dialogue: I'm sorry! I'm sorry to ask!!! I know it's not the best moment!!!

events/bonnieside.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/bonnieside.html.dialogue: B-but most of us have different beliefs, don't we? So, well...

events/bonnieside.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/bonnieside.html.dialogue: In case, Change forbid, one of us dies today, and the others are able to honor your body...

events/bonnieside.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/bonnieside.html.dialogue: ...Like, m'dame Odile, is there a Ka Buan way, or...

events/bonnieside.html.speaker: Odile
events/bonnieside.html.dialogue: Well... In Ka Bue, you'd burn the body and take the ashes to a Gemmaker to transform them into a diamond, but that won't be easily feasible, will it...

events/bonnieside.html.speaker: Odile
events/bonnieside.html.dialogue: But if that's not doable, you can donate my body to any House in Vaugarde. If Vaugarde is saved, I'm sure they'd have a use for the body of a savior...

events/bonnieside.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/bonnieside.html.dialogue: W-well, the House of Change recommends burying your body under a tree, so our body can nurture the nature around it.. Be part of Change and all that...

events/bonnieside.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/bonnieside.html.dialogue: Is it the same for you, Isabeau?

events/bonnieside.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/bonnieside.html.dialogue: I mean, I'd be dead, right? So I don't really... care that much about later.

events/bonnieside.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/bonnieside.html.dialogue: And for, well, Bonnie, what should--

events/bonnieside.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/bonnieside.html.dialogue: We won't allow Bonnie to die.

events/bonnieside.html.speaker: Odile
events/bonnieside.html.dialogue: Even if we're about to die, there are ways to use Craft to make sure Bonnie will survive.
(You all talked about your possible deaths, and then you saw Bonnie read a book about burial rituals... You didn't want to be right, but...)
(...But still, you have to make sure... Maybe... Maybe Bonnie isn't...)

events/bonnieside.html.speaker: Siffrin
events/bonnieside.html.dialogue: "Were you listening to us just now?"

events/bonnieside.html.speaker: Bonnie
events/bonnieside.html.dialogue: ...  I don't wanna talk about it...

events/bonnieside.html.speaker: Bonnie
events/bonnieside.html.dialogue: I don't wanna talk about it!!! I don't wanna talk about any of us dying!!!
(Oh no, why did you have to say anything.)
(Yeah, you had to say something, but they were listening all this time before and they were fine, right?!? Why did you have to say something?!)
(You should do something, you have to fix this--)

events/bonnieside.html.speaker: Bonnie
events/bonnieside.html.dialogue: You're all stupid for talking about this!!! Stupid, stupid, stupid!!!
(You remember that touch is useful to make people less upset, or so you've heard.)
(You approach Bonnie, and try to pat their head.)
(You don't even get close before Bonnie slaps your hand away, and--)

events/bonnieside.html.speaker: Bonnie
events/bonnieside.html.dialogue: Curse you, Frin!!! Don't come near me!!!

events/bonnieside.html.speaker: Bonnie
events/bonnieside.html.dialogue: I don't want you to touch me, I don't want you to talk to me, I don't want you to even LOOK AT ME!!!

events/bonnieside.html.speaker: Bonnie
events/bonnieside.html.dialogue: I don't want to think about ANY OF THIS!!!
(You know this isn't about you. They need your help right now.)

events/bonnieside.html.speaker: Bonnie
events/bonnieside.html.dialogue: NO!!! STOP, STOP!!! DON'T COME NEAR ME!!!

events/bonnieside.html.speaker: Bonnie
events/bonnieside.html.dialogue: If you like to talk about how everyone will die then you should just get it over with and die, Frin!!!!!! I don't care!!! I HATE YOU!!!!!!

events/bonnieside.html.speaker: Bonnie
events/bonnieside.html.dialogue: I hate you I hate you I hate you I hate you I hate you I hate you I hate you I hate you IhateyouIhateyouIhateyou I HAAAAATE YOUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUU!!!!!!!!!

events/bonnieside.html.speaker: Siffrin
events/bonnieside.html.dialogue: "Bury me somewhere. Can we talk about something else?"

events/bonnieside.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/bonnieside.html.dialogue: Oh, it's a serious business snack time. I'm listening.

events/bonnieside.html.speaker: Bonnie
events/bonnieside.html.dialogue: Snack times are always serious business, dummy.

events/bonnieside.html.speaker: Loop
events/bonnieside.html.dialogue: They were looking at a book about burial rituals, because you all talked about what you'd all do if you died.

events/bonnieside.html.speaker: Loop
events/bonnieside.html.dialogue: No wonder the Kid was upset about it.

events/bonnieside.html.speaker: Loop
events/bonnieside.html.dialogue: Pretty stupid of you adults to talk about that stuff where they could hear you!

events/bonnieside.html.speaker: Loop
events/bonnieside.html.dialogue: No wonder the kid hates you!!!

events/bonnieside.html.speaker: Loop
events/bonnieside.html.dialogue: Will you do something about it? Talk to your Kid about it after, maybe?
(You can't, you can't, you can't even think about it.)
(You don't know what to say to Bonnie, right now.)
(Bonnie was listening to you all talk about burial rituals, earlier...)

events/bonnieside.html.speaker: Siffrin
events/bonnieside.html.dialogue: "We like to think about every possible thing that could happen..."

events/bonnieside.html.speaker: Bonnie
events/bonnieside.html.dialogue: I don't know what you're talking about. I wasn't listening, earlier.
(AND YET, YOU LET BONNIE DIE.)

events/bonnieside.html.speaker: Bonnie
events/bonnieside.html.dialogue: I won't let anything happen, either!
[If the Kid has Memory of Promise equipped, they'll be more likely to buff everyone's stats during battle!]

events/bonnieside.html.speaker: Loop
events/bonnieside.html.dialogue: They were! A book about burial rituals, because you adults all talked about your death.

events/bonnieside.html.speaker: Loop
events/bonnieside.html.dialogue: Kids shouldn't be worrying about things like this... What a world we live in.

events/bonnieside.html.speaker: Loop
events/bonnieside.html.dialogue: ...I'm glad that you got the courage to talk to them about it. It seems like it helped you both.

events/bonnieside.html.speaker: Loop
events/bonnieside.html.dialogue: And... You made a promise, didn't you?

events/castlequest.html.speaker: Castle-Loving One
events/castlequest.html.dialogue: Y'know... The end of the world is fine and all... But I only have one regret...

events/castlequest.html.speaker: Castle-Loving One
events/castlequest.html.dialogue:
I WON'T BE ABLE TO KNOW WHAT HAPPENS
TO LORD JOSÉPHANDRE IN THE FINAL ISSUE OF "THE CURSING OF CHÂTEAU CASTLE"!

events/castlequest.html.speaker: Castle-Loving One
events/castlequest.html.dialogue: Did he manage to protect his castle to the very end?!? Did he finally find his friend Pierre-Jacques-Erneste, did he finally find more about himself?!?

events/castlequest.html.speaker: Castle-Loving One
events/castlequest.html.dialogue: Oh... I'll never know...
(Is that really what they're worrying about today...? A book series? Not their imminent death or anything?)
(Weird.)
(You didn't really care about their problem before, but...)
("The Cursing of Château Castle", is it? Interesting...)
(Maybe you could find the last issue for them?)
"There's this book fan..."

events/castlequest.html.speaker: Loop
events/castlequest.html.dialogue: Ah, that man living in the house full of books?

events/castlequest.html.speaker: Loop
events/castlequest.html.dialogue: He seems to be really into that book series your Housemaiden likes... "The Cursing of Château Castle", right?

events/castlequest.html.speaker: Loop
events/castlequest.html.dialogue: Didn't the last issue come out right as the King's Curse started freezing Vaugarde in time? It might be hard to find...

events/castlequest.html.speaker: Loop
events/castlequest.html.dialogue: If you find any issues, you should remember the issue number and tell him! Maybe you might end up finding the very last one!
(A book thief, frozen in time.)

events/castlequest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/castlequest.html.dialogue: Oh. Him.

events/castlequest.html.speaker: Bonnie
events/castlequest.html.dialogue: Oh?

events/castlequest.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/castlequest.html.dialogue: Oh???

events/castlequest.html.speaker: Odile
events/castlequest.html.dialogue: Please tell us more.

events/castlequest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/castlequest.html.dialogue: N-No, that's, uh, sorry, I mean--!!!

events/castlequest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/castlequest.html.dialogue: This man is another housemaiden, he's a scholar... He's working really hard on a project! It--

events/castlequest.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/castlequest.html.dialogue: Booooriiiiing.

events/castlequest.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/castlequest.html.dialogue: Why don't you like him?

events/castlequest.html.speaker: Bonnie
events/castlequest.html.dialogue: Was he mean to you?

events/castlequest.html.speaker: Odile
events/castlequest.html.dialogue: Should we... Do something to him?

events/castlequest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/castlequest.html.dialogue: PLEASE, DON'T!!! He is, um...

events/castlequest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/castlequest.html.dialogue: He is... A human man. That exists.

events/castlequest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/castlequest.html.dialogue: Okay. Listen.

events/castlequest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/castlequest.html.dialogue: I think he stole one of my priceless issues of "The Cursing of Château Castle".

events/castlequest.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/castlequest.html.dialogue: Oh no!

events/castlequest.html.speaker: Bonnie
events/castlequest.html.dialogue: A thief!!!!!

events/castlequest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/castlequest.html.dialogue: N-No!!! Forget I said that! I have no concrete proof! B-but...

events/castlequest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/castlequest.html.dialogue: ...But my issue disappeared shortly after he came to my dorm room to ask me something, that's all.

events/castlequest.html.speaker: Bonnie
events/castlequest.html.dialogue: A thief.........
(You look through his pockets.)
(...  There's a book inside.)
(The title reads "The Cursing of Château Castle", issue #3.)
(You wave it around.)

events/castlequest.html.speaker: Odile
events/castlequest.html.dialogue: Well, what do we have here.

events/castlequest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/castlequest.html.dialogue: SO I WAS RIGHT!!! THIS... THIS...!!!

events/castlequest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/castlequest.html.dialogue: HORRIBLE THIEF!!!!!!!
(Mirabelle got back her priceless copy of "The Cursing of Château Castle"!)
(She angrily stuffs it in her pocket.)

events/castlequest.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/castlequest.html.dialogue: Victory!

events/castlequest.html.speaker: Bonnie
events/castlequest.html.dialogue: IT'S BACK!!!!

events/castlequest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/castlequest.html.dialogue: IT IS.

events/castlequest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/castlequest.html.dialogue: ...  Sorry for badmouthing him while he's frozen in time. He is a very talented scholar, also.

events/castlequest.html.speaker: Odile
events/castlequest.html.dialogue: This was fun, Mirabelle. You should show your ruthless side more often.

events/castlequest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/castlequest.html.dialogue: N-no!!!
(Some medical books.)
(...And a volume of "The Cursing of Château Castle", issue #10.)
(...Issue #10? You should remember this number.)
(The bookcase is filled with novels.)
("Run, Child, Run!", "The Unrestrained", "The Cursing of Château Castle" issues #6, #12 and #24...)
(...Issue #24? You should remember this number.)
(None of those catch your eye.)
(A desk.)
(On it is an open issue of "The Cursing of Château Castle", issue #32.)
(...Issue #32? You should remember this number.)
(The bookcase is filled with various novels.)
("How To Not Make A Fool Of Yourself: A Journey", "Tick", "Soul Emperor IV: The Soulempering", and "The Cursing of Château Castle", issues #40 to #48.)
(...Issue #48? You should remember this number.)
(Some books on the House of Change.)
(...and an book from the series "The Cursing of Château Castle", issue #51.)
(...Issue 51? You should remember this number.)
(Horror books.)
(There's "The Cursing of Château Castle" issue #68, "Death Die Dice Maker", "One Hundred Ways to Die Horribly", "The Meat Slicing"...)
(Ah. That last one's actually a cooking book.)
(...Issue #68? You should remember this number.)
(An open book, stained by clay and dirty hands.)
(It's an issue of "The Cursing of Château Castle", issue #87.)
(...Issue #87? You should remember this number.)

events/castlequest.html.speaker: Castle-Loving One
events/castlequest.html.dialogue: Y'know... The end of the world is fine and all... But I only have one regret...

events/castlequest.html.speaker: Castle-Loving One
events/castlequest.html.dialogue:
I WON'T BE ABLE TO KNOW WHAT HAPPENS
TO LORD JOSÉPHANDRE IN THE FINAL ISSUE OF "THE CURSING OF CHÂTEAU CASTLE"!

events/castlequest.html.speaker: Castle-Loving One
events/castlequest.html.dialogue: Did he manage to protect his castle to the very end?!? Did he finally find his friend Pierre-Jacques-Erneste, did he finally find more about himself?!?

events/castlequest.html.speaker: Castle-Loving One
events/castlequest.html.dialogue: Oh... I'll never know...
(The last one you've seen is...)

events/castlequest.html.speaker: Castle-Loving One
events/castlequest.html.dialogue: No... Of course not. Why would I be into a series with only three issues?!?

events/castlequest.html.speaker: Castle-Loving One
events/castlequest.html.dialogue: No... That's the issue where Pierre-Jacques-Erneste made his big appearance, though. What a great issue...

events/castlequest.html.speaker: Castle-Loving One
events/castlequest.html.dialogue: No... That's when Lord Joséphandre ate his whole weight in donuts, transporting him to another world as like, some kind of filler plot?

events/castlequest.html.speaker: Castle-Loving One
events/castlequest.html.dialogue: It wasn't very good.

events/castlequest.html.speaker: Castle-Loving One
events/castlequest.html.dialogue: No... That's when Lady Irene-Janine-Karine finally joined the party, though! She's such a good character...

events/castlequest.html.speaker: Castle-Loving One
events/castlequest.html.dialogue: It wasn't very good.

events/castlequest.html.speaker: Castle-Loving One
events/castlequest.html.dialogue: It sucks. No one likes it.

events/castlequest.html.speaker: Castle-Loving One
events/castlequest.html.dialogue: No... That's when Pierre-Jacques-Erneste betrayed the whole party!!! What a turn of events!!! Oh...

events/castlequest.html.speaker: Castle-Loving One
events/castlequest.html.dialogue: No... That's when Pierre-Jacques-Erneste, in an act of self-sacrifice, destroyed his castle to save Lord Josephandre!!! Oh...

events/castlequest.html.speaker: Castle-Loving One
events/castlequest.html.dialogue: ...  Is it?

events/castlequest.html.speaker: Castle-Loving One
events/castlequest.html.dialogue: No, it's not. That was when Lord Joséphandre was about to reveal his true lineage.

events/castlequest.html.speaker: Castle-Loving One
events/castlequest.html.dialogue: And see!!! This is what I want!!! I want the rest!!! What IS his true lineage!!! Oh...

events/castlequest.html.speaker: Castle-Loving One
events/castlequest.html.dialogue: ...That's...

events/castlequest.html.speaker: Castle-Loving One
events/castlequest.html.dialogue: THAT'S IT!!!!! THAT'S THE ONE!!!!!!!!!!
(Oh!)

events/castlequest.html.speaker: Castle-Loving One
events/castlequest.html.dialogue: Oh, please tell me, what happens in this issue!!! Please, you have to tell me!!!!!!!!
(Oh.)
(You didn't read it.)
(You awkwardly smile.)

events/castlequest.html.speaker: Castle-Loving One
events/castlequest.html.dialogue: I will never forgive you for the emotional journey you've just given me.
(That's fair.)
(Time to go back and read it...)
"There's this book fan..."

events/castlequest.html.speaker: Loop
events/castlequest.html.dialogue: Yes, and you found the last issue of that book series they like!!!

events/castlequest.html.speaker: Loop
