events/castlequest.html.dialogue: Too bad you didn't actually open it when you found it. Better go back and actually read it...

events/castlequest.html.speaker: Loop
events/castlequest.html.dialogue: And then go and tell that book fan what the last issue is about! He'll be overjoyed!
(An open book, stained by clay and dirty hands.)
(It's an issue of "The Cursing of Château Castle", issue #87.)

events/castlequest.html.speaker: Siffrin
events/castlequest.html.dialogue: (...Ah, #87.) "That's the last issue."

events/castlequest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/castlequest.html.dialogue: What? No it's no--

events/castlequest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/castlequest.html.dialogue: OH, CRAB, IT IS!!!! OH!!!!!!!!!!

events/castlequest.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/castlequest.html.dialogue: Oh! The last issue of the Something Something book series?

events/castlequest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/castlequest.html.dialogue: "THE CURSING OF CHÂTEAU CASTLE"!!!

events/castlequest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/castlequest.html.dialogue: Do we finally get to learn about Lord Joséphandre's true lineage? What about Pierre-Jacques-Erneste, will he survive?! And most importantly...

events/castlequest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/castlequest.html.dialogue: DOES THE SIDE CHARACTER WHO APPEARED ONLY IN ISSUE #43 APPEAR AGAIN?!??!?!??!?

events/castlequest.html.speaker: Odile
events/castlequest.html.dialogue: High stakes, I see.

events/castlequest.html.speaker: Odile
events/castlequest.html.dialogue: I'll give you ten minutes to read it. See how generous I am?

events/castlequest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/castlequest.html.dialogue: SO GENEROUS, MADAME ODILE!!!!!!!!!!! I WILL FINISH IT IN THE ALLOTTED TIME!!!!!!!!!
(You all patiently wait while Mirabelle reads, and makes high pitched sounds every once in a while...)

events/castlequest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/castlequest.html.dialogue: Wow.

events/castlequest.html.speaker: Siffrin
events/castlequest.html.dialogue: "So?"

events/castlequest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/castlequest.html.dialogue: ...  Lord Joséphandre...

events/castlequest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/castlequest.html.dialogue: Isn't a Lord at all? His parents were normal everyday people?

events/castlequest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/castlequest.html.dialogue: This whole time, he was... Just a guy?

events/castlequest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/castlequest.html.dialogue: He wasn't chosen by fate, he didn't actually have a title, and he was... Just a guy?

events/castlequest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/castlequest.html.dialogue: They kept talking about how magnificent and incredible his family was, and how he was chosen for a reason, and he was... Just a guy?

events/castlequest.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/castlequest.html.dialogue: Didn't this guy like, save castles or whatever? So, like, he saved people also, I'm guessing?

events/castlequest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/castlequest.html.dialogue: He was a hero to everyone he met! And yet he was... Just a guy?

events/castlequest.html.speaker: Bonnie
events/castlequest.html.dialogue: And he wasn't a chosen one or an important person or maybe a prince?

events/castlequest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/castlequest.html.dialogue: No??? He was just a guy?????????

events/castlequest.html.speaker: Odile
events/castlequest.html.dialogue: Is this a letdown for you or not? I can't tell.

events/castlequest.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/castlequest.html.dialogue: I don't know??? I think I just need time??? To process this???

events/castlequest.html.speaker: Odile
events/castlequest.html.dialogue: Well, you can process while we walk. Let's go, everyone.
(So Lord Joséphandre was just a guy.)
(You should let the castle-loving one in Dormont know...)

events/castlequest.html.speaker: Castle-Loving One
events/castlequest.html.dialogue: Y'know... The end of the world is fine and all... But I only have one regret...

events/castlequest.html.speaker: Castle-Loving One
events/castlequest.html.dialogue:
I WON'T BE ABLE TO KNOW WHAT HAPPENS
TO LORD JOSÉPHANDRE IN THE FINAL ISSUE OF "THE CURSING OF CHÂTEAU CASTLE"!

events/castlequest.html.speaker: Castle-Loving One
events/castlequest.html.dialogue: Did he manage to protect his castle to the very end?!? Did he finally find his friend Pierre-Jacques-Erneste, did he finally find more about himself?!?

events/castlequest.html.speaker: Castle-Loving One
events/castlequest.html.dialogue: Oh... I'll never know...
(The last one you've seen is...)

events/castlequest.html.speaker: Castle-Loving One
events/castlequest.html.dialogue: What? No, that's a lie. I think you're lying to me right now.
(You explain the contents of issue #87, as best you can...)

events/castlequest.html.speaker: Castle-Loving One
events/castlequest.html.dialogue: What? Lord Joséphandre is just a guy?

events/castlequest.html.speaker: Castle-Loving One
events/castlequest.html.dialogue: That's...

events/castlequest.html.speaker: Castle-Loving One
events/castlequest.html.dialogue: THAT'S AN ENDING BETTER THAN MY WILDEST DREAMS!!!

events/castlequest.html.speaker: Castle-Loving One
events/castlequest.html.dialogue: He was just a guy... He was just a guy...!!!

events/castlequest.html.speaker: Castle-Loving One
events/castlequest.html.dialogue: He saved so many people, made the world a better place, and everyone thought it was because of who he was, of his past, but...

events/castlequest.html.speaker: Castle-Loving One
events/castlequest.html.dialogue: But he was just a guy...!!!
(Uh oh, tears are coming out!!!)
(Before you can try to figure out how to respond, they've already taken out a lovely handkerchief and blown their nose into it.)

events/castlequest.html.speaker: Castle-Loving One
events/castlequest.html.dialogue: Thank you. I... I'm so glad I got to know this, before...

events/castlequest.html.speaker: Castle-Loving One
events/castlequest.html.dialogue: Here, take this.
(You got the FIRST ISSUE!)
(You put the First Issue in your pocket for Odile to equip later.)

events/castlequest.html.speaker: Castle-Loving One
events/castlequest.html.dialogue: Here, take thi--

events/castlequest.html.speaker: Castle-Loving One
events/castlequest.html.dialogue: ...Huh?

events/castlequest.html.speaker: Castle-Loving One
events/castlequest.html.dialogue: Um, I wanted to give you something, but... I can't...

events/castlequest.html.speaker: Castle-Loving One
events/castlequest.html.dialogue: Knowing the final issue's contents must've shocked me more than I thought.

events/castlequest.html.speaker: Castle-Loving One
events/castlequest.html.dialogue: Now... Can you please leave? I need to lay in bed and think about this ending.
"There's this book fan..."

events/castlequest.html.speaker: Loop
events/castlequest.html.dialogue: So that's what the ending of that book series is about?

events/castlequest.html.speaker: Loop
events/castlequest.html.dialogue: Where the hero is from... What their history is... It doesn't matter?

events/castlequest.html.speaker: Loop
events/castlequest.html.dialogue: What a stupid series.

events/castlequest.html.speaker: Loop
events/castlequest.html.dialogue: Just go and let that book fan know if you haven't already.
(The bookcase is filled with books about culture.)
("Travelers Of The World", "The House: Monasteries Of The Change God", "Ka Buan Expressions"... Oh?)
(There's an old book stuck between the shelf and the wall...)
(You take the book out again.)
(You can read its title, now...)
(Your heart is beating, badump, badump, badump.)
(...A translated copy of "The Cursing of Château Castle", issue #2.)
(You start laughing.)

events/castlequest.html.speaker: Stylish One
events/castlequest.html.dialogue: Oh, I hope Housemaiden Mirabelle is okay!!!

events/castlequest.html.speaker: Castle-Loving One
events/castlequest.html.dialogue: Hah... Mirabelle.

events/castlequest.html.speaker: Stylish One
events/castlequest.html.dialogue: Huh? Huh? What's that sigh for?

events/castlequest.html.speaker: Stylish One
events/castlequest.html.dialogue: DO YOU NOT LIKE MIRABELLE, YOU MONSTER?!?

events/castlequest.html.speaker: Castle-Loving One
events/castlequest.html.dialogue: She owns the 3rd issue of "The Cursing of Château Castle".

events/castlequest.html.speaker: Stylish One
events/castlequest.html.dialogue: Yes? And--

events/castlequest.html.speaker: Castle-Loving One
events/castlequest.html.dialogue: First edition.

events/castlequest.html.speaker: Stylish One
events/castlequest.html.dialogue: What? The one that supposedly has a misprint that foreshadows something that happens in issue 63? Isn't there only ten of those in circulation in Vaugarde?!

events/castlequest.html.speaker: Stylish One
events/castlequest.html.dialogue: ...How did she--

events/castlequest.html.speaker: Castle-Loving One
events/castlequest.html.dialogue: She sent a letter to the publishing company that straddled the line between adorable and stern so well, the publishing company sent her a copy.

events/castlequest.html.speaker: Castle-Loving One
events/castlequest.html.dialogue: Along with an autograph from the author.

events/castlequest.html.speaker: Stylish One
events/castlequest.html.dialogue: Oh, Housemaiden Mirabelle... You're so cool...

events/colortheory.html.dialogue: "I saw a weird shade..."

events/colortheory.html.speaker: Loop
events/colortheory.html.dialogue: A weird... Shade?

events/colortheory.html.speaker: Siffrin
events/colortheory.html.dialogue: "When I was fighting the King."

events/colortheory.html.speaker: Siffrin
events/colortheory.html.dialogue: "A shade that doesn't exist."

events/colortheory.html.speaker: Loop
events/colortheory.html.dialogue: A shade that doesn't exist...

events/colortheory.html.speaker: Loop
events/colortheory.html.dialogue: Interesting. I wonder if you could find more information about it somewhere...

events/colortheory.html.speaker: Loop
events/colortheory.html.dialogue: Not that it's that important or related to the loops, but it's weird, right?
(The bookcase is filled with books about something called "Colors".)
(No familytales, but...)
(You need any help you can get.)
(You pick one at random...)
("Color Theory: What It Means For Us And Our Past".)
(Looks boring and dense...)

events/colortheory.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/colortheory.html.dialogue: Oh yes, color theory! Are you interested, Siffrin?
(You shrug.)

events/colortheory.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/colortheory.html.dialogue: Huh...

events/colortheory.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/colortheory.html.dialogue: What's a color?

events/colortheory.html.speaker: Bonnie
events/colortheory.html.dialogue: Hahaha, Za doesn't know what a color is!!!

events/colortheory.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/colortheory.html.dialogue: I really don't! Tell me!

events/colortheory.html.speaker: Bonnie
events/colortheory.html.dialogue: It's, um... Um...

events/colortheory.html.speaker: Bonnie
events/colortheory.html.dialogue: It's like weird shades.

events/colortheory.html.speaker: Bonnie
events/colortheory.html.dialogue: I learned it at school, but it wasn't very interesting so I crafted a drawing on my table instead.

events/colortheory.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/colortheory.html.dialogue: Wow Bonbon, you're so hardcore.

events/colortheory.html.speaker: Odile
events/colortheory.html.dialogue: They ARE weird shades, yes. This is a relatively new discovery, so I'm not surprised you haven't heard, Isabeau...

events/colortheory.html.speaker: Odile
events/colortheory.html.dialogue: ...But a very long time ago, we could apparently see shades called "colors".

events/colortheory.html.speaker: Bonnie
events/colortheory.html.dialogue: Yeah! They had a shade called "Bloo" and that's the sky's real shade, and one named "Grin" and that's what the grass looked like!

events/colortheory.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/colortheory.html.dialogue: I think the world around us still are those "colors", but we just, um, forgot how to see them?

events/colortheory.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/colortheory.html.dialogue: Or so researchers say... I think the House over in Corbeaux was researching it.

events/colortheory.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/colortheory.html.dialogue: That's...

events/colortheory.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/colortheory.html.dialogue: THAT'S SUCH BIG NEWS?!?! HOW DID I NOT KNOW THIS?!??!

events/colortheory.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/colortheory.html.dialogue: I FAILED YOU ALL...

events/colortheory.html.speaker: Odile
events/colortheory.html.dialogue: Oh, don't worry. We don't usually count on you to know things.

events/colortheory.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/colortheory.html.dialogue: ...Oh yeah! That's true!!!
("Colors"... Shades people can't see anymore...)
(It seems silly, but somehow, this knowledge feels familiar to you.)
"I saw a weird shade..."

events/colortheory.html.speaker: Loop
events/colortheory.html.dialogue: A weird... Shade?

events/colortheory.html.speaker: Siffrin
events/colortheory.html.dialogue: "When I was fighting the King."

events/colortheory.html.speaker: Siffrin
events/colortheory.html.dialogue: "A shade that doesn't exist."

events/colortheory.html.speaker: Loop
events/colortheory.html.dialogue: Like... A "color"?
(A "color"?)

events/colortheory.html.speaker: Loop
events/colortheory.html.dialogue: Don't you remember? I think you read a book about it somewhere...

events/colortheory.html.speaker: Loop
events/colortheory.html.dialogue: Maybe you should look at it again, try to find other books, if you wanted to find out more...?
(There's a book in Ka Buan open on the table.)
(You all look at Odile.)

events/colortheory.html.speaker: Odile
events/colortheory.html.dialogue: A Ka Buan book here in Vaugarde, how rare...

events/colortheory.html.speaker: Odile
events/colortheory.html.dialogue: The title translates to... "Colors Through Time"?

events/colortheory.html.speaker: Odile
events/colortheory.html.dialogue: It seems to be an essay about color theory.

events/colortheory.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/colortheory.html.dialogue: "Color theory"...

events/colortheory.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/colortheory.html.dialogue: Let's rea--

events/colortheory.html.speaker: Odile
events/colortheory.html.dialogue: WE DON'T HAVE TIME FOR THIS.
(But what if you did.)

events/colortheory.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/colortheory.html.dialogue: Ah, I know this face, Sif...

events/colortheory.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/colortheory.html.dialogue: "But what if we did?"
(Odile sighs and picks up the book.)

events/colortheory.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/colortheory.html.dialogue:
<small>
 Yes, I'm not the one reading this time...
</small>

events/colortheory.html.speaker: Odile
events/colortheory.html.dialogue: Heh.

events/colortheory.html.speaker: Odile
events/colortheory.html.dialogue: ...This book seems to go into detail about what could've caused colors to disappear...

events/colortheory.html.speaker: Bonnie
events/colortheory.html.dialogue: Something big must've happened, right? For everyone to not be able to see them anymore!

events/colortheory.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/colortheory.html.dialogue: And it was a very long time ago, so there's probably no records of why...

events/colortheory.html.speaker: Odile
events/colortheory.html.dialogue: There seem to be a lot of theories... A Craft experiment gone horribly wrong, the side effect of a Craft war...

events/colortheory.html.speaker: Odile
events/colortheory.html.dialogue: Whatever happened then, all colors disappeared from this world.

events/colortheory.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/colortheory.html.dialogue: But it seems impossible, right?

events/colortheory.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/colortheory.html.dialogue: It'd be like... Like if everyone stopped seeing shades all of a sudden.

events/colortheory.html.speaker: Odile
events/colortheory.html.dialogue: I do wonder what could've made that happen, yes.

events/colortheory.html.speaker: Bonnie
events/colortheory.html.dialogue: Weird...

events/colortheory.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/colortheory.html.dialogue: ...That Wish Craft thing, perhaps?"
(Oh.)

events/colortheory.html.speaker: Odile
events/colortheory.html.dialogue: Ah yes... If Wish Craft can really make the impossible come true, maybe that is what happened.
(You're still wondering about that weird shade you saw, while... Talking to the King.)
(Was that weird shade a "color"?)
(Ask again.)

events/colortheory.html.speaker: Siffrin
events/colortheory.html.dialogue: "Is there a way to see colors now?"

events/colortheory.html.speaker: Odile
events/colortheory.html.dialogue: Funny you should mention it... People have been known to see a "weird shade" during...

events/colortheory.html.speaker: Odile
events/colortheory.html.dialogue: Um... "Times of immense trouble"?

events/colortheory.html.speaker: Odile
events/colortheory.html.dialogue: They described this shade as... "Scary"? "Dangerous"? "Visceral", maybe?

events/colortheory.html.speaker: Odile
events/colortheory.html.dialogue: Historians think this "weird shade" could've been a color.

events/colortheory.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/colortheory.html.dialogue: A "visceral" shade?

events/colortheory.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/colortheory.html.dialogue: "Times of immense trouble"? What does that mean?

events/colortheory.html.speaker: Odile
events/colortheory.html.dialogue: Sorry, it's a little tough to translate... Moments before something "breaks", maybe?

events/colortheory.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/colortheory.html.dialogue: When something breaks...

events/colortheory.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/colortheory.html.dialogue: Like, during the end of something? Or something gets destroyed?

events/colortheory.html.speaker: Bonnie
events/colortheory.html.dialogue: Like the end of the world?

events/colortheory.html.speaker: Odile
events/colortheory.html.dialogue: Maybe so.

events/colortheory.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/colortheory.html.dialogue: If colors were an integral part of the world... Then the world rights itself right before the end...

events/colortheory.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/colortheory.html.dialogue: How poetic! Someone should write a novel about this!
(Colors appear when something "breaks", huh...)
(When the King tried so hard to say your country's name... Did something "break" then?)
"I saw a weird shade..."

events/colortheory.html.speaker: Loop
events/colortheory.html.dialogue: Yep, and you found two books about it!

events/colortheory.html.speaker: Loop
events/colortheory.html.dialogue: Hm, so it seems colors have always existed, but we can't see them anymore...

events/colortheory.html.speaker: Loop
events/colortheory.html.dialogue: And we get to see them again when... Something breaks?

events/colortheory.html.speaker: Loop
events/colortheory.html.dialogue: One color appears first, it seems...

events/colortheory.html.speaker: Loop
events/colortheory.html.dialogue: A... "Visceral" color? Does that match what you've seen...?
(It does.)
(Somehow, that color made you think of blood and bodies and horrible things.)

events/colortheory.html.speaker: Loop
events/colortheory.html.dialogue: Hm...

events/colortheory.html.speaker: Loop
events/colortheory.html.dialogue: Maybe it appeared because you tried to break whatever rule makes it impossible for anyone to say your country's name?

events/colortheory.html.speaker: Loop
events/colortheory.html.dialogue: That'd count as something "breaking", wouldn't it? Breaking a rule?
(Breaking a rule...)
(Maybe that's it.)

events/colortheory.html.speaker: Loop
events/colortheory.html.dialogue: Hm.

events/colortheory.html.speaker: Loop
events/colortheory.html.dialogue: But that's all speculation. And I doubt you'll be able to learn more...

events/colortheory.html.speaker: Loop
events/colortheory.html.dialogue: But good job finding that out! You're so smart and knowledgeable, stardust!

events/confession.html.dialogue: ("Sif! We did it!")

events/confession.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/confession.html.dialogue: Sif!!! We did it!!!

events/confession.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/confession.html.dialogue: We did it, Sif, we did it! We did it! We stopped the King! We can finally go back to our normal lives! Isn't it great???
("We did it, Sif...")

events/confession.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/confession.html.dialogue: ...We did it! We stopped the King! We can finally go back to our normal lives! Isn't it great???

events/confession.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/confession.html.dialogue: Yeah!!!

events/confession.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/confession.html.dialogue: I... Uh. I said. Do you remember what I said? At the Clocktower?
(That's right!!!)
(He wanted to tell you something after you beat the King, didn't he...)
(You remember.)

events/confession.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/confession.html.dialogue: Yes. Um... Yes.

events/confession.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/confession.html.dialogue: Okay. Phew...

events/confession.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/confession.html.dialogue: ...  Sif. Siffarooni.

events/confession.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/confession.html.dialogue: ...Siffrin.

events/confession.html.speaker: Bonnie
events/confession.html.dialogue: ARE YOU GUYS DONE TALKING ALREADY?????? CRAB!!!!!

events/confession.html.speaker: Bonnie
events/confession.html.dialogue: I wanna go so I can eat dinner!!! I'm super duper hungry!!!!!

events/confession.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/confession.html.dialogue: jkghsdafhjhkdsfhjkadfshjkadfsjhkdsfjkhdsf

events/confession.html.speaker: Bonnie
events/confession.html.dialogue: So are you done? Are you done talking?
(He didn't get to tell you what he wanted... That's too bad.)

events/confession.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/confession.html.dialogue: But, Sif, I'm glad this is over!

events/confession.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/confession.html.dialogue: I can't wait to go back to my old job, you know? Make sure to say hi when you're near Jouvente, 'kay?
(You nod.)
"At the end, Isabeau..."

events/confession.html.speaker: Loop
events/confession.html.dialogue: Ah, the thing he said he'd tell you at the end of your journey?

events/confession.html.speaker: Loop
events/confession.html.dialogue: He mentions he wants to tell you something, when you go and sleep at the Clocktower... That's probably it.

events/confession.html.speaker: Loop
events/confession.html.dialogue: But someone interrupted him just as he was about to tell you! How unfortunate!!!

events/confession.html.speaker: Loop
events/confession.html.dialogue: If only there was a way to make sure he wouldn't be interrupted, maybe you'd finally get to hear what he has to say...
(If you talked to Bonnie beforehand, maybe...)
(And it keeps happening, too.)

events/confession.html.speaker: Siffrin
events/confession.html.dialogue: (...Before you forget, though...) "Do you have some snacks left?"

events/confession.html.speaker: Bonnie
events/confession.html.dialogue: Oh, um... Well...
(Bonnie looks through their pockets.)

events/confession.html.speaker: Bonnie
events/confession.html.dialogue: WAIT I HAVE SOME PINEAPPLE SLICES LEFT???

events/confession.html.speaker: Bonnie
events/confession.html.dialogue: I won't give them to you, I'm super hungry.
(They just looked through their pockets, but they check again.)

events/confession.html.speaker: Bonnie
events/confession.html.dialogue: WAIT I HAVE SOME PINEAPPLE SLICES LEFT???

events/confession.html.speaker: Bonnie
events/confession.html.dialogue: I know you're hungry too, but I'll keep those for myself, sorry.

events/confession.html.speaker: Bonnie
events/confession.html.dialogue: That way I'll survive until I eat dinner!!! See, aren't I so smart?
(Very smart. But you're smarter.)
(You should make sure to talk to everyone you need to before talking to Isabeau...)

events/confession.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/confession.html.dialogue: EVERYONE!!!

events/confession.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/confession.html.dialogue: I'm so glad we managed to win!!! Can you believe it?

events/confession.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/confession.html.dialogue: I think this calls for a group hug!!!

events/confession.html.speaker: Bonnie
events/confession.html.dialogue: GROUP HUG!!!!!

events/confession.html.speaker: Odile
events/confession.html.dialogue: Pass.

events/confession.html.speaker: Bonnie
events/confession.html.dialogue: Of course you'll pass. You and Frin never join group hugs.

events/confession.html.speaker: Bonnie
events/confession.html.dialogue: Za, group hug, group hug!!!

events/confession.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/confession.html.dialogue: Group hug!!!

events/confession.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/confession.html.dialogue: Yay!!!
(You watch Mirabelle, Isabeau and Bonnie hug.)

events/confession.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/confession.html.dialogue: Doesn't matter.

events/confession.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/confession.html.dialogue: Doesn't matter at all, it wasn't that important!

events/confession.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/confession.html.dialogue: Come on, go talk to everyone! I have... Some thinking to do.

events/confession.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/confession.html.dialogue: But, Sif, I'm glad this is over!

events/confession.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/confession.html.dialogue: I can't wait to go back to my old job, you know? Make sure to say hi when you're near Jouvente, 'kay?
(You nod.)

events/confession.html.speaker: Siffrin
events/confession.html.dialogue: (...Before you forget, though...) "Can we group hug after I speak to the Head Housemaiden?"

events/confession.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/confession.html.dialogue: Oh, would you be okay with it??? I'd love to!!!
(You nod.)
(You should make sure to talk to everyone before talking to Isabeau...)

events/confession.html.speaker: Odile
events/confession.html.dialogue: Are you both finished? Please wrap it up so we can go.

events/confession.html.speaker: Odile
events/confession.html.dialogue: There's so much we have to do before we can go back to our lives. You two can talk later, okay?

events/confession.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/confession.html.dialogue: ...urgrhhshrhhjdshdsjhdsjhdshjkhjkdfargh.

events/confession.html.speaker: Odile
events/confession.html.dialogue: Oh gems. Did I interrupt...?

events/confession.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/confession.html.dialogue: It's fine. It's fine. It's all good.

events/confession.html.speaker: Odile
events/confession.html.dialogue: Are you sure? I'm...

events/confession.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/confession.html.dialogue: No problem! Don't worry about it!

events/confession.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/confession.html.dialogue: There has to be a better moment later. A better moment than... Saving the country...

events/confession.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/confession.html.dialogue: ...urgh.

events/confession.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/confession.html.dialogue: But, Sif, I'm glad this is over!

events/confession.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/confession.html.dialogue: I can't wait to go back to my old job, you know? Make sure to say hi when you're near Jouvente, 'kay?
(You nod.)

events/confession.html.speaker: Siffrin
events/confession.html.dialogue: (...Before you forget, though...) "Please don't interrupt."

events/confession.html.speaker: Odile
events/confession.html.dialogue: Don't interrupt? Interrupt what...
(She looks Isabeau's way.)

events/confession.html.speaker: Odile
events/confession.html.dialogue: ...Of course.

events/confession.html.speaker: Odile
events/confession.html.dialogue: I have to say I'm surprised, Siffrin. I thought you didn't know--

events/confession.html.speaker: Siffrin
events/confession.html.dialogue: "I'm going now."

events/confession.html.speaker: Odile
events/confession.html.dialogue: Hm.

events/confession.html.speaker: Odile
events/confession.html.dialogue: ...Good luck, I suppose.

events/confession.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/confession.html.dialogue: ...Uh, Sif? ...Is everything okay?

events/confession.html.speaker: Siffrin
events/confession.html.dialogue: "What?"

events/confession.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/confession.html.dialogue: You look... Kind of upset.

events/confession.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/confession.html.dialogue: What's wrong?

events/confession.html.speaker: Siffrin
events/confession.html.dialogue: "Nothing! What did you want to tell me?"

events/confession.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/confession.html.dialogue: No, it doesn't matter right now. You don't look good at all.

events/confession.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/confession.html.dialogue: Are you hungry, maybe? I can tell Bonnie to--
(STARS.)
(Oooooooooooooh, you want to scream. You just want to scream right now.)
(You did everything right. And he won't say it. He can't say it. The Universe won't let him say it!)
(You're not stupid. You know what it is! What he wants to tell you! You know!)
(But it doesn't count if he doesn't say it! It doesn't exist if it's not said!)
(In fact, you can't trust it even if he did say it! Maybe it's not even true! Maybe it is! Maybe it is and it's because you forced him to!)
(You did, didn't you? You forced him, you're forcing him right now!)
(Looping forwards and backwards, making sure no one can interrupt, making sure everything is perfect! Making sure you're perfect!)
(It's because you're looping, you're forcing him, manipulating him to say it! To think it!)
(Making sure he has to say it! Making sure he has no recourse!)
(It's not good! It's awful! He can't feel this way about someone like you!)
(SOMEONE DISGUSTING LIKE YOU!!!!!!!)

events/confession.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/confession.html.dialogue: --frin, Siffrin! Please stop gripping your hair, you're going to hurt yourself--

events/confession.html.speaker: Siffrin
events/confession.html.dialogue: "DON'T TOUCH ME--"
(You feel a tug on your stomach--)

events/confession.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/confession.html.dialogue: --everything okay?

events/confession.html.speaker: Siffrin
events/confession.html.dialogue: "Yep, all good!"

events/confession.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/confession.html.dialogue: Oh... Okay!

events/confession.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/confession.html.dialogue: Anyway, Sif, I'm glad this is over!

events/confession.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/confession.html.dialogue: I can't wait to go back to my old job, you know? Make sure to say hi when you're near Jouvente, 'kay?
(You nod, smile fixed on your face.)
(You got a MEMORY OF CONFESSION!)
(You'll always remember this.)
[When equipped, Memory of Confession makes your Fighter immune to Rock attacks.]
"At the end, Isabeau..."

events/confession.html.speaker: Loop
events/confession.html.dialogue: ...Pft... Yeah...

events/confession.html.speaker: Loop
events/confession.html.dialogue: HAHAHAHAHA!!! Yeah!!!

events/confession.html.speaker: Loop
events/confession.html.dialogue: Your Fighter... He was about to tell you, without being interrupted, and you had to ruin it yourself!!!

events/confession.html.speaker: Loop
events/confession.html.dialogue: How nice of him, to stop himself from saying it because you looked upset!!!

events/confession.html.speaker: Loop
events/confession.html.dialogue: But you just really wanted him to tell you!!! Even though you know!!!

events/confession.html.speaker: Loop
events/confession.html.dialogue: Because you know what he wants to tell you, don't you? You can be dense sometimes, but you're not THAT dense!

events/confession.html.speaker: Loop
events/confession.html.dialogue: ...Teehee, ooooh, you're so angry! I can see it in your face!

events/confession.html.speaker: Loop
events/confession.html.dialogue: Who are you angry at? At me??? But I'm just telling the truth, stardust~!
(And laughing about it.)

events/confession.html.speaker: Loop
events/confession.html.dialogue: Because it's just too funny, stardust!!! A blinding tragedy, and there's nothing you can do to change it!!!

events/confession.html.speaker: Loop
events/confession.html.dialogue: Hahahahahahahaha!!!
(You want to stop talking about this.)
(There it is again.)
(You try to keep your face neutral.)
(Or will a neutral face make him stop--)
(Oh, wait, you remembered. It doesn't matter what you do.)

events/confession.html.speaker: Siffrin
events/confession.html.dialogue: "Will this be quick?"

events/confession.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/confession.html.dialogue: I, um...  What?

events/confession.html.speaker: Siffrin
events/confession.html.dialogue: "I should go talk with everyone else."

events/confession.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/confession.html.dialogue: Oh, um...

events/confession.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/confession.html.dialogue: Yeah, sure, I... I understand.

events/confession.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/confession.html.dialogue: It wasn't important anyway! Go talk to everyone!

events/confession.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/confession.html.dialogue: But, Sif, I'm glad this is over!

events/confession.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/confession.html.dialogue: I can't wait to go back to my old job, you know?

events/confession.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/confession.html.dialogue: They probably missed me.

events/confession.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/confession.html.dialogue: Okay, go talk to everyone! Shoo!
(You nod.)
(Isabeau is here, probably pondering what favor to ask the Tree.)

events/confession.html.speaker: Siffrin
events/confession.html.dialogue: "Isa."

events/confession.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/confession.html.dialogue: Sif. Woke up on the wrong side of the bed? I get it.

events/confession.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/confession.html.dialogue: Anyway, I was just looking at the Favor Tree! Isn't this tree cool???

events/confession.html.speaker: Siffrin
events/confession.html.dialogue: (Cue joke.) "Yeah it is..."

events/confession.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/confession.html.dialogue: Glad you agree!

events/confession.html.speaker: Siffrin
events/confession.html.dialogue: "One could say it's a pretty..."

events/confession.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/confession.html.dialogue: Uh huh???

events/confession.html.speaker: Siffrin
events/confession.html.dialogue: "...TREE-mendous tree."

events/confession.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/confession.html.dialogue: HAHAHA!!!!! YEAH!!!! YEAH!!!!!! YES!!!!!!!
(You both laugh.)
(Laughing uproariously, he raises his hand towards your shoulder...)
(...but stops, and brings it to his side.)
(Didn't he do this before? What a weird gesture.)
(What's up with the hand???)
(Okay he did the hand thing again. You're too curious. You'll have to ask later.)
(You need to ask!!!)

events/confession.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/confession.html.dialogue: Haa... That was funny.

events/confession.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/confession.html.dialogue: The... hand thing? What?
(You do the same gesture he does every time you talk to him at this time.)
(Bringing your hand up towards his shoulder, then sharply taking your hand back.)
(Isabeau looks at your gesture, confused, then suddenly stills.)

events/confession.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/confession.html.dialogue: Ah. Um. Well.

events/confession.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/confession.html.dialogue: I'm. I was. Trying to touch your shoulder. As like.  A bro thing.
(Huh?)

events/confession.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/confession.html.dialogue: B-But I remembered you don't like to be touched!!! I remembered mid-move!!!! So I didn't touch you!!!! So it's okay!!! Sorry!!!!!!!
(He was trying to touch your shoulder?)
(You're not sure how to react to this.)

events/confession.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/confession.html.dialogue: Aaaah, see, this is why I didn't do it! Because you do that face every time people try to touch you! I'm sorry!!! I try to remember!!!! Sorry!!!!
(Okay, you're confused, but...)
(It feels like he thinks you don't want to be touched.)
(You  don't want to think about this anymore.)
(Laughing uproariously, he raises his hand towards your shoulder...)
(You get it now.)
(This is him  trying to touch you.)
(You freeze.)
(His hand is in the air.)
(And goes closer... Closer...)
(His hand  abruptly stops above your shoulder, and goes back to his side.)

events/confession.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/confession.html.dialogue: Haa... That was funny.
(Laughing uproariously, he raises his hand towards your shoulder...)
(You watch his hand get closer to you again.)
(Maybe this time...)
(Closer... Closer...)
(His hand  abruptly stops above your shoulder, and goes back to his side.)

events/confession.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/confession.html.dialogue: Haa... That was funny.
(You wait for him to touch you.)
(You're beginning to think he never will.)
(You look at his hand coming closer... Closer...)
(As expected, his hand stops above your shoulder.)

events/confession.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/confession.html.dialogue: Haa... That was funny.
(You wait for him to touch you. You wait for him to touch you. You wait for him to touch you.)
(He has to do it. You will never do it yourself.)
(But he won't touch you because he thinks you don't want him to.)
(And you can't say it. Because. That's embarrassing.)
(That's life-ending, even. Asking for someone's touch.)
(But please, you think. Please, please, please.)
(A flicker of movement makes you look at his face.)
(He looks  stricken. Sad.)
(Seeing you look at him, he laughs  and brings his hand down.)
(You wonder what face you were making as you were waiting for him to touch you.)
(You wait for him to touch you.)
(His hand stops above your shoulder.)
(Is it fun to go back here? To keep torturing yourself?)

events/confession.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/confession.html.dialogue: Haa... That was funny.
(You wait for him to touch you.)
(Why do you have to wait?  Why do you have to wait?  Why do you have to wait?)
(His hand stops above your shoulder.)
(Is it fun to go back here? To keep torturing yourself?)

events/confession.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/confession.html.dialogue: Haa... That was funny.
(Suddenly  you realize a very basic thing.)
(He will never touch you. He will never say it to you. You will be stuck here forever.)
(Stuck in your yearning.)
(Unless  you're the one who breaks the cycle.)
(You reach out.)

events/confession.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/confession.html.dialogue: Uh, Sif?

events/confession.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/confession.html.dialogue: Ah--
(He  pushed you away.)
(He

events/confession.html.speaker: Siffrin
events/confession.html.dialogue: "Hi Isa, I need to do the Favor Tree thing!"

events/confession.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/confession.html.dialogue: Oh! Sorry, I'm in your way then, aren't I? I'll get out of your hair, see you at the Clocktower!!!
(You take a step back.)
(He does not reach towards you.)

events/confession.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/confession.html.dialogue: Haa... That was funny.
(Isabeau's up ahead.)

events/confession.html.speaker: Loop
events/confession.html.dialogue: Stardust, you traitor!!! I thought what we had was special!

events/confession.html.speaker: Loop
events/confession.html.dialogue: But you didn't value me, did you, and I had to see you kiss the fighter, in front of my very eyes! The shock! The betrayal!!!

events/confession.html.speaker: Siffrin
events/confession.html.dialogue: "Shut up."

events/confession.html.speaker: Loop
events/confession.html.dialogue: And then you looped right back! Refusing to face the consequences of your actions!

events/confession.html.speaker: Loop
events/confession.html.dialogue: What were you afraid of? For him to finally see you? To see what kind of person you truly are?

events/confession.html.speaker: Loop
events/confession.html.dialogue: Maybe he would have accepted you, you know. Maybe you're not as disgusting as you think you are.

events/confession.html.speaker: Siffrin
events/confession.html.dialogue: "Shut up!"

events/confession.html.speaker: Loop
events/confession.html.dialogue: Or, stardust... Maybe you ARE that disgusting. Not letting the poor fighter make his own decisions! Who would do that! Or--

events/confession.html.speaker: Siffrin
events/confession.html.dialogue: "SHUT. UP."

events/confession.html.speaker: Siffrin
events/confession.html.dialogue: "I don't want to talk or THINK about ANY of this."

events/confession.html.speaker: Siffrin
events/confession.html.dialogue: "Especially not with YOU."

events/confession.html.speaker: Loop
events/confession.html.dialogue: But, stardust... Who else but me?

events/confession.html.speaker: Loop
events/confession.html.dialogue: Anyway, you got a Memory for your troubles. You can check it out later, I don't think you'd like me to tell you what it does.

events/confession.html.speaker: Loop
events/confession.html.dialogue: So! How can I help you on this wonderful new loop?

events/ghost.html.dialogue: "I've been seeing myself in the House.

events/ghost.html.speaker: Loop
events/ghost.html.dialogue: Yourself...? Like how?
(You tell Loop about how you saw yourself walking around the House a few times.)

events/ghost.html.speaker: Loop
events/ghost.html.dialogue: ...An image of yourself, walking around the House...

events/ghost.html.speaker: Loop
events/ghost.html.dialogue: Maybe they're... Reflections? Remnants of your past loops? I wouldn't know.
("Remnants"?)
(Odile uses the same word to describe the Sadnesses...)

events/ghost.html.speaker: Siffrin
events/ghost.html.dialogue: "Could it be a Sadness?"

events/ghost.html.speaker: Loop
events/ghost.html.dialogue: Ha! You see a copy of you walking around, and you assume it's a Sadness?

events/ghost.html.speaker: Loop
events/ghost.html.dialogue: Are you sad, stardust?

events/ghost.html.speaker: Loop
events/ghost.html.dialogue: I'm gonna go ahead and say they're linked to your loops.

events/ghost.html.speaker: Loop
events/ghost.html.dialogue: If they are, you might see them more and more as you loop through time...

events/ghost.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/ghost.html.dialogue: Ah!

events/ghost.html.speaker: Bonnie
events/ghost.html.dialogue: Look! Here!!!

events/ghost.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/ghost.html.dialogue: That's... That really looks like Siffrin, doesn't it?!

events/ghost.html.speaker: Odile
events/ghost.html.dialogue: Another one, huh...?
("Another one"?!?)
(You've been seeing these... Ghosts, whatever they are, for a while, but...)
(They could see them too? This whole time?!)

events/ghost.html.speaker: Siffrin
events/ghost.html.dialogue: "You can see them too?!"

events/ghost.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/ghost.html.dialogue: Yes??? Of course???

events/ghost.html.speaker: Bonnie
events/ghost.html.dialogue: Yeah! Weird Frin copies!

events/ghost.html.speaker: Odile
events/ghost.html.dialogue: This whole time I was thinking it was just my eyes... Or my mind, playing tricks on me... But...

events/ghost.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/ghost.html.dialogue: Hm...

events/ghost.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/ghost.html.dialogue: Well, I'll go and say hi!

events/ghost.html.speaker: Bonnie
events/ghost.html.dialogue: Me too... I wanna see the weird not-Frin!
(No, they can't!!!)
(You get chills just looking at it!)
(You don't know what they are, maybe they're dangerous--)

events/ghost.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/ghost.html.dialogue: Me three! I'm curious!
(You try to stop them, any of them, but...)
(You will not, cannot, go closer.)

events/ghost.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/ghost.html.dialogue: Hey Sif, buddy!

events/ghost.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/ghost.html.dialogue: Hello, other Siffrin!

events/ghost.html.speaker: Bonnie
events/ghost.html.dialogue: Why are you here, weird Frin? Why do you disappear sometimes???

events/ghost.html.speaker: Odile
events/ghost.html.dialogue: One question at a time, kids. We don't know if they can...

events/ghost.html.speaker: Odile
events/ghost.html.dialogue: See...
(...The ghost you disappeared...)

events/ghost.html.speaker: Bonnie
events/ghost.html.dialogue: That was weird.

events/ghost.html.speaker: Siffrin
events/ghost.html.dialogue: "What? What happened?"
(What happened? Why aren't they looking at you?!)

events/ghost.html.speaker: Siffrin
events/ghost.html.dialogue: (What did it do?!) "Did it have boils on it… or something? Haha..."

events/ghost.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/ghost.html.dialogue: N-no, they just...

events/ghost.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/ghost.html.dialogue: Ah--!
(Mirabelle started crying!!!)

events/ghost.html.speaker: Siffrin
events/ghost.html.dialogue: "What's wrong!!!"

events/ghost.html.speaker: Bonnie
events/ghost.html.dialogue: Belle!!!

events/ghost.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/ghost.html.dialogue: S-Sorry! I-I don't know why I'm crying...

events/ghost.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/ghost.html.dialogue: Hey, come on, it's okay...

events/ghost.html.speaker: Odile
events/ghost.html.dialogue: Siffrin.
(You jump.)

events/ghost.html.speaker: Odile
events/ghost.html.dialogue: You... You'd tell us if anything was wrong, right?

events/ghost.html.speaker: Siffrin
events/ghost.html.dialogue: "Of course!"

events/ghost.html.speaker: Siffrin
events/ghost.html.dialogue: "So tell me what's wrong!!!"

events/ghost.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/ghost.html.dialogue: Hm...

events/ghost.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/ghost.html.dialogue: Alright, I'll be on explaining duty!!!
(Isabeau takes you aside.)

events/ghost.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/ghost.html.dialogue: It's fine, nothing bad happened.

events/ghost.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/ghost.html.dialogue: Like Bonbon said, it was just weird, is all.

events/ghost.html.speaker: Siffrin
events/ghost.html.dialogue: ("Weird"?) "Did it do something?"

events/ghost.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/ghost.html.dialogue: Well, he, uh...

events/ghost.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/ghost.html.dialogue: Okay, so that other Sif was standing there...

events/ghost.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/ghost.html.dialogue: And we got closer. And it was strange, 'cuz he wasn't looking at us when we came to them, right?

events/ghost.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/ghost.html.dialogue: He was looking straight ahead, not moving.

events/ghost.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/ghost.html.dialogue: But as I called out to him... I could see he kinda startled, like he was surprised.

events/ghost.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/ghost.html.dialogue: And when we walked in front of them, they looked at us, and, they...

events/ghost.html.speaker: Siffrin
events/ghost.html.dialogue: "What?"

events/ghost.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/ghost.html.dialogue: Like...

events/ghost.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/ghost.html.dialogue: See, usually I'd be happy to see that, but here it was just, uh...

events/ghost.html.speaker: Siffrin
events/ghost.html.dialogue: "What? What???"

events/ghost.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/ghost.html.dialogue: Let me speak, I'm trying to understand it too!!!

events/ghost.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/ghost.html.dialogue: First he looked surprised, and then...

events/ghost.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/ghost.html.dialogue: Then he looked at us like he was so happy to see us, he was going to cry.

events/ghost.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/ghost.html.dialogue: Even more when they seemed to... Realize we were all here?

events/ghost.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/ghost.html.dialogue: He looked at each of us, and their smile got bigger and bigger every time. Blissful.

events/ghost.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/ghost.html.dialogue: But it wasn't... It wasn't nice or happy or anything. It was just...

events/ghost.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/ghost.html.dialogue: Sad.

events/ghost.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/ghost.html.dialogue: Why would you look at us like that...?
(That last sentence, said under his breath.)
(You're not sure you were meant to hear it.)

events/ghost.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/ghost.html.dialogue: ...So that's why! It was just a little weird, that's all.

events/ghost.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/ghost.html.dialogue: And Mira's super stressed right now, so that's why she cried, you know? She'll be fine, we're all fine.

events/ghost.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/ghost.html.dialogue: Yeah?

events/ghost.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/ghost.html.dialogue: Sorry for earlier... I feel better now!

events/ghost.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/ghost.html.dialogue: Are you okay too, Siffrin?

events/ghost.html.speaker: Bonnie
events/ghost.html.dialogue: I gave Belle some snacks so she's okay now.

events/ghost.html.speaker: Odile
events/ghost.html.dialogue: Let's put this behind us. That slowed us down...

events/ghost.html.speaker: Odile
events/ghost.html.dialogue: Let's get going.
("Let's get going"?)
("LET'S GET GOING"?!)
(Are they just going to put it behind them?!)
(That you all see visions of yourself in the House? Reflections?)
(Reflections that aren't you, that cry when they see them?)
(They're fine with it?)
(THEY'RE FINE WITH IT?!?)
(THEY DON'T CARE?!?)
(THEY DON'T--)

events/ghost.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/ghost.html.dialogue: Ah!

events/ghost.html.speaker: Bonnie
events/ghost.html.dialogue: Look! Here!!!

events/ghost.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/ghost.html.dialogue: That's... That really looks like Siffrin, doesn't it?!

events/ghost.html.speaker: Siffrin
events/ghost.html.dialogue: "I don't see anything."

events/ghost.html.speaker: Siffrin
events/ghost.html.dialogue: "There's nothing there."

events/ghost.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/ghost.html.dialogue: Huh? You don't see the--

events/ghost.html.speaker: Siffrin
events/ghost.html.dialogue: "Nothing at all."

events/ghost.html.speaker: Bonnie
events/ghost.html.dialogue: Oh.

events/ghost.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/ghost.html.dialogue: Well, um... I feel like I saw something, but...

events/ghost.html.speaker: Odile
events/ghost.html.dialogue: Is the stress getting to us that badly?

events/ghost.html.speaker: Odile
events/ghost.html.dialogue: Let's get going.
"I've been seeing myself in the House.

events/ghost.html.speaker: Loop
events/ghost.html.dialogue: Ah, yes, the copies of you walking around. And?

events/ghost.html.speaker: Siffrin
events/ghost.html.dialogue: "They could see them too."

events/ghost.html.speaker: Loop
events/ghost.html.dialogue: Your party could?

events/ghost.html.speaker: Siffrin
events/ghost.html.dialogue: "They all went to talk to one of them."

events/ghost.html.speaker: Siffrin
events/ghost.html.dialogue: "It smiled at them."

events/ghost.html.speaker: Siffrin
events/ghost.html.dialogue: "Mirabelle was really upset."

events/ghost.html.speaker: Siffrin
events/ghost.html.dialogue: "Why would me smiling at them scare her that much?"
(Isabeau said it had a blissful smile...)
(Like it was happy to see him... To see everyone...)
(So... It wanted to see them, and he thought it was...)

events/ghost.html.speaker: Loop
events/ghost.html.dialogue: Heh.

events/ghost.html.speaker: Loop
events/ghost.html.dialogue: It must really have been a disgusting smile, for your Housemaiden to react like this!
"I've been seeing myself in the House.

events/ghost.html.speaker: Loop
events/ghost.html.dialogue: I shouldn't have said that, earlier.

events/ghost.html.speaker: Siffrin
events/ghost.html.dialogue: (Huh...?) "What?"

events/ghost.html.speaker: Loop
events/ghost.html.dialogue: That the ghost... Or remnant of you, or whatever...

events/ghost.html.speaker: Loop
events/ghost.html.dialogue: That it probably gave them a disgusting smile.
(Oh.)

events/ghost.html.speaker: Siffrin
events/ghost.html.dialogue: "It's fine."
(It's probably true, anyway.)

events/ghost.html.speaker: Loop
events/ghost.html.dialogue: You really love them all, don't you? Even now?

events/ghost.html.speaker: Loop
events/ghost.html.dialogue: Enough for a reflection of you to react like this.
(Enough to make you want to cry.)

events/knifekey.html.dialogue: (Their face obscured, Their silhouette shrouded, Their expression hidden...)
(An intact statue of the Change God stands before you.)
(Everyone is lost in thought... Most likely sending their wishes to the Change God.)
(Join them?)
(Better than nothing.)
(You wish for victory.)
(You wish for victory.)
(You wish for rest.)
(You wish for eternity.)
(You thank the Change God for always giving you the KeyKnife.)
(Nothing to wish for.)
(Not yours, not yours, not yours.)
(He's looking at your clenched fists.)
(You  relax, and flash him an embarrassed smile.)

events/knifekey.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/knifekey.html.dialogue: ...Sif, are you--
(Wuh?)
(You're holding something...)
(You're holding the KEYKNIFE! (??????))
(You found the KEYKNIFE!)

events/knifekey.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/knifekey.html.dialogue: Siffrin??? Wh-what are you holding there???

events/knifekey.html.speaker: Bonnie
events/knifekey.html.dialogue: A KNIFE!!!!!!!!!!

events/knifekey.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/knifekey.html.dialogue: Did, did the Change God give it to us???

events/knifekey.html.speaker: Odile
events/knifekey.html.dialogue: Huh??? No, it can't--

events/knifekey.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/knifekey.html.dialogue: I think th-they did!!! With it, we can--

events/knifekey.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/knifekey.html.dialogue: WAH!!!!!

events/knifekey.html.speaker: Odile
events/knifekey.html.dialogue: What the--

events/knifekey.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/knifekey.html.dialogue: That's... Floor 3's entrance???

events/knifekey.html.speaker: Bonnie
events/knifekey.html.dialogue: The Change God beamed us there!!!

events/knifekey.html.speaker: Odile
events/knifekey.html.dialogue: That's...

events/knifekey.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/knifekey.html.dialogue: Well, at least we don't have to backtrack. I'm not gonna ask questions.

events/knifekey.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/knifekey.html.dialogue: Th-thank you Change God for this boon!!!

events/knifekey.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/knifekey.html.dialogue: Thanks Change God!

events/knifekey.html.speaker: Bonnie
events/knifekey.html.dialogue: Thank you!!!
(You and Odile look at each other, and shrug.)

events/knifekey.html.speaker: Odile
events/knifekey.html.dialogue: Thank you Change God, or Expressions, or whichever deity gave us this knife.
(You don't want to say thanks to it aloud.)
(The gate stands in front of you.)

events/knifekey.html.speaker: Bonnie
events/knifekey.html.dialogue: . . .You know, I was wondering...

events/knifekey.html.speaker: Bonnie
events/knifekey.html.dialogue: Like, the King clearly closed this door, and put the Tears in our way...

events/knifekey.html.speaker: Bonnie
events/knifekey.html.dialogue: But the... But the locked doors, weren't they...

events/knifekey.html.speaker: Odile
events/knifekey.html.dialogue: Yes... We were wrong.

events/knifekey.html.speaker: Odile
events/knifekey.html.dialogue: They were most likely locked by residents of the House.

events/knifekey.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/knifekey.html.dialogue: When the House was attacked, no one knew what the King's powers were...

events/knifekey.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/knifekey.html.dialogue: So they must've thought locking him in would have been enough to stop him.

events/knifekey.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/knifekey.html.dialogue: But by that time he'd already made sure Vaugarde would start slowly freezing in time...

events/knifekey.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/knifekey.html.dialogue: So... People in the House... Were trying to save Vaugarde, at the risk of their own lives...

events/knifekey.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/knifekey.html.dialogue: But it was all for nothing!!!

events/knifekey.html.speaker: Odile
events/knifekey.html.dialogue: It did get in our way more than anything else. But there's no way they could've known...

events/knifekey.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/knifekey.html.dialogue: ...They tried, and yet the King...

events/knifekey.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/knifekey.html.dialogue: This... This once-changed King!!! I'll... I'll--!!!

events/knifekey.html.speaker: Bonnie
events/knifekey.html.dialogue: Belle...

events/knifekey.html.speaker: Odile
events/knifekey.html.dialogue: We should get going.

events/knifekey.html.speaker: Odile
events/knifekey.html.dialogue: I'm predicting there will be a strong Sadness in the next room for you to cut into ribbons, Mirabelle.

events/knifekey.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/knifekey.html.dialogue: ...  Okay.

events/knifekey.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/knifekey.html.dialogue: Let's get going, everyone.
(You get ready, and slice the door.)
(The KeyKnife broke on impact.)
(Maybe it wasn't sharpened enough...?)
(That's too bad... You're sure you could've found a use for it elsewhere.)
(But at least the gate is opened.)
"Do you know how to fix a knife?"

events/knifekey.html.speaker: Loop
events/knifekey.html.dialogue: Oh, are you thinking about fixing up the KeyKnife? Smart, smart.

events/knifekey.html.speaker: Loop
events/knifekey.html.dialogue: I mean, don't you sharpen your own dagger? How do you do it?

events/knifekey.html.speaker: Siffrin
events/knifekey.html.dialogue: "Sharpening stone."

events/knifekey.html.speaker: Loop
events/knifekey.html.dialogue: And... Where is it?

events/knifekey.html.speaker: Loop
events/knifekey.html.dialogue: Ha!

events/knifekey.html.speaker: Loop
events/knifekey.html.dialogue: But then you don't have yours, huh.

events/knifekey.html.speaker: Loop
events/knifekey.html.dialogue: So just find one somewhere else!
(A big steel thing with a stone on it and an oven for weapons. Those things have a name but you can't remember what it is.)

events/knifekey.html.speaker: Odile
events/knifekey.html.dialogue: ...It's a forge and that's an anvil, Siffrin.

events/knifekey.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/knifekey.html.dialogue: And the stone is a sharpening stone!
(OH YEAH...)
(Oh.)
(An anvil, sharpening stone, and forge.)
(...Sharpening stone! For the KeyKnife!!!)
(Ah, then...)
(You pick it up.)
(You got the SHARPENING STONE!)
(You put the stone in your pocket along with your Souvenirs.)
(You should be able to sharpen the KeyKnife now... When you get it back, that is.)
(Sharpening stone, apply to KeyKnife.)
(You try and focus on sharpening the knife...)
(...It doesn't seem to be getting sharper.)

events/knifekey.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/knifekey.html.dialogue: Huh? Is that how you sharpen knives now, Sif?

events/knifekey.html.speaker: Siffrin
events/knifekey.html.dialogue: (Huh?) What do you mean?

events/knifekey.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/knifekey.html.dialogue: I dunno! Feels like you usually say something when you sharpen your dagger.
(Do you?)
(You can't remember.)

events/knifekey.html.speaker: Odile
events/knifekey.html.dialogue: Yes, something's missing...

events/knifekey.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/knifekey.html.dialogue: Doesn't Siffrin talk usually?

events/knifekey.html.speaker: Bonnie
events/knifekey.html.dialogue: They do!!! They mumble when they make things!!!

events/knifekey.html.speaker: Bonnie
events/knifekey.html.dialogue: Like, "mumble mumble mumble".

events/knifekey.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/knifekey.html.dialogue: A few weeks ago, you were carving a little wooden Odile, remember? And you were saying...

events/knifekey.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/knifekey.html.dialogue: ...Something? I can't remember.

events/knifekey.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/knifekey.html.dialogue: Hm... Can't remember either...

events/knifekey.html.speaker: Odile
events/knifekey.html.dialogue: Are we as forgetful as Siffrin now? This doesn't bode well...

events/knifekey.html.speaker: Bonnie
events/knifekey.html.dialogue: If I saw a piece of carving wood or some carving stuff I'd remember.

events/knifekey.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/knifekey.html.dialogue: Heheh, yeah!
(Could it be that easy?)
(Hm, carving, carving... Where can you find carving tools or something...)
(Gotta find carving wood, if only so you can remember what the stars you mumble when you're carving stuff.)
"Do you know how to fix a knife?"

events/knifekey.html.speaker: Loop
events/knifekey.html.dialogue: Still trying to sharpen that KeyKnife, huh?

events/knifekey.html.speaker: Loop
events/knifekey.html.dialogue: Using the sharpening stone you found on Floor 1 didn't do the trick...

events/knifekey.html.speaker: Loop
events/knifekey.html.dialogue: But when you tried, your party said you were doing it differently that you usually do? What do they mean?

events/knifekey.html.speaker: Loop
events/knifekey.html.dialogue: They said you usually mumble something when you sharpen your dagger, or carve wood.

events/knifekey.html.speaker: Loop
events/knifekey.html.dialogue: They might remember how you usually do things if they saw wood carving tools, wouldn't they? I wonder where you could find some...
(Some carving wood.)
(Looks like someone liked to carve during their break...)
(You wonder where your own carving tools went.)
(You haven't tried carving wood in forever.)
(Everyone mentioned you usually mumble when you sharpen your dagger, or carve wood...)
(Will you be able to sharpen the KeyKnife, if you remember how you usually do it?)
(You pick up the carving wood, looking at it from all angles, trying to remember--)

events/knifekey.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/knifekey.html.dialogue: Heheh...

events/knifekey.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/knifekey.html.dialogue: "Please don't look bad please don't look bad please don't look bad"...

events/knifekey.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/knifekey.html.dialogue: Oh, you don't remember?

events/knifekey.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/knifekey.html.dialogue: That's what you were saying! Last time you were carving something!

events/knifekey.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/knifekey.html.dialogue: You were carving a little Odile, and Odile said that if it looked bad...

events/knifekey.html.speaker: Bonnie
events/knifekey.html.dialogue: ...She'd ask me to cover your dinner with potatoes!

events/knifekey.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/knifekey.html.dialogue: So you were mumbling "please don't look bad" the whole time!

events/knifekey.html.speaker: Odile
events/knifekey.html.dialogue: You usually mumble things like this under your breath when you carve or sharpen your dagger or do something similar.

events/knifekey.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/knifekey.html.dialogue: "Please have symmetrical eyes..."

events/knifekey.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/knifekey.html.dialogue: "Please look at least a little bit like a wolf..."

events/knifekey.html.speaker: Bonnie
events/knifekey.html.dialogue: "Please don't stab me in the hand while I carve!!!"

events/knifekey.html.speaker: Odile
events/knifekey.html.dialogue: Feels like you're talking to whatever you're making, or to your tools. Did you never realize you were doing it?
(Do you really do this...)
(How embarrassing.)

events/knifekey.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/knifekey.html.dialogue: It's cute, Siffrin!

events/knifekey.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/knifekey.html.dialogue: And also when you do mumble, whatever you're carving does look really nice.

events/knifekey.html.speaker: Bonnie
events/knifekey.html.dialogue: It's when you're not mumbling that your stuff looks awful.
(Well. Sounds like you should try this sharpening thing again.)
(Sharpening stone, apply to KeyKnife.)
(You take the KeyKnife and sharpening stone, and mumble repeatedly the first thing that comes to mind...)
(You take the KeyKnife and sharpening stone, and mumble repeatedly...)

events/knifekey.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/knifekey.html.dialogue: Please be sharp,

events/knifekey.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/knifekey.html.dialogue: Please be sharp,

events/knifekey.html.speaker: Bonnie
events/knifekey.html.dialogue: Please be sharp!!!

events/knifekey.html.speaker: Odile
events/knifekey.html.dialogue: Well, it's sharp now.
(Woohoo!)
(You got the KNIFEKEY!)
(You put the Knifekey in your pocket to equip later.)
[Woohoo, you did it!]
[You are now the proud owner of a KnifeKey, a knife that can cut anything, ESPECIALLY the King.]
[Yes, you heard that correctly! When the KnifeKey is equipped, your ATTACK will be boosted when fighting against the King! Isn't that grand!!!]
[One thing though... This weapon isn't like the others. You can only equip it when you make it, which means you'll have to pick up the KeyKnife and sharpen it every time.]
[It's an important item, after all! You can't just HAVE it!!!]
[Unless...]
(You got a MEMORY OF KNIFEKEY!)
(You'll always remember this.)
[If you equip this memory, and loop back to the King, you will automatically have the KnifeKey equipped!!!]
[That's it, stardust! Bye!!!]
(You got the KNIFEKEY!)
(You put the Knifekey in your pocket to equip later.)
"Do you know how to fix a knife?"

events/knifekey.html.speaker: Loop
events/knifekey.html.dialogue: You know how to sharpen the KeyKnife now!

events/knifekey.html.speaker: Loop
events/knifekey.html.dialogue: Find the sharpening stone on Floor 1, find the KeyKnife on Floor 3, apply stone to KeyKnife.

events/knifekey.html.speaker: Loop
events/knifekey.html.dialogue: It'll probably make battling the King easier, now!
(The KnifeKey glows...)
(Your attacks will hit harder against the King[!/.])

events/mirafan.html.speaker: Stylish One
events/mirafan.html.dialogue: Big hat... Impossibly warm looking cloak...

events/mirafan.html.speaker: Stylish One
events/mirafan.html.dialogue: You must be one of the people traveling with Mirabelle!

events/mirafan.html.speaker: Stylish One
events/mirafan.html.dialogue: She's pretty well known around here. The chosen one, you know. Blessed by the Change God with the power to save Vaugarde.

events/mirafan.html.speaker: Stylish One
events/mirafan.html.dialogue: Plus, before all this, she was a housemaiden at the House of Change nearby. She'd take classes, help out with chores, help the other housemaidens with their studies and craft. Little perfect Mirabelle.

events/mirafan.html.speaker: Stylish One
events/mirafan.html.dialogue: Hmf... As for me...

events/mirafan.html.speaker: Stylish One
events/mirafan.html.dialogue: I THINK SHE'S THE MOST WONDERFUL BEING ON EARTH.

events/mirafan.html.speaker: Stylish One
events/mirafan.html.dialogue: No wonder the Change God blessed her, when she's this wonderful!!!

events/mirafan.html.speaker: Stylish One
events/mirafan.html.dialogue: I used to go to the House a lot for my classes, and she was always there, taking the class with me!

events/mirafan.html.speaker: Stylish One
events/mirafan.html.dialogue: I've never had a class I didn't share with her. She's so cool. So helpful. So driven. Honestly, we're kind of best friends.

events/mirafan.html.speaker: Stylish One
events/mirafan.html.dialogue: ...Even though I've never had a single conversation with her...
(Talking to people is hard, you get it.)
(You hope she'll get to talk to Mirabelle before tomorrow!)
(You wonder if she managed to talk to Mirabelle before you went to the House...)

events/mirafan.html.speaker: Stylish One
events/mirafan.html.dialogue: Big hat... Impossibly warm looking cloak...

events/mirafan.html.speaker: Stylish One
events/mirafan.html.dialogue: You must be one of the people traveling with Mirabelle!

events/mirafan.html.speaker: Stylish One
events/mirafan.html.dialogue: She's pretty well known around here. The chosen one, you know. Blessed by the Change God with the power to save Vaugarde.

events/mirafan.html.speaker: Stylish One
events/mirafan.html.dialogue: Plus, before all this, she was a housemaiden at the House of Change nearby. She'd take classes, help out with chores, help the other housemaidens with their studies and craft. Little perfect Mirabelle.

events/mirafan.html.speaker: Stylish One
events/mirafan.html.dialogue: Hmf... As for me...

events/mirafan.html.speaker: Stylish One
events/mirafan.html.dialogue: I THINK SHE'S THE MOST WONDERFUL BEING ON EARTH.

events/mirafan.html.speaker: Stylish One
events/mirafan.html.dialogue: No wonder the Change God blessed her, when she's this wonderful!!!

events/mirafan.html.speaker: Stylish One
events/mirafan.html.dialogue: I used to go to the House a lot for my classes, and she was always there, taking the class with me!

events/mirafan.html.speaker: Stylish One
events/mirafan.html.dialogue: I've never had a class I didn't share with her. She's so cool. So helpful. So driven. Honestly, we're kind of best friends.

events/mirafan.html.speaker: Stylish One
events/mirafan.html.dialogue: ...Even though I've never had a single conversation with her...
(Talking to people is hard, you get it.)
(You don't think she managed to talk to Mirabelle last time... Mirabelle would've mentioned it.)
(You should go and tell Mirabelle yourself!)
"Mira has a fan..."

events/mirafan.html.speaker: Loop
events/mirafan.html.dialogue: She does. That stylish woman in Dormont, right?

events/mirafan.html.speaker: Loop
events/mirafan.html.dialogue: You should tell your Housemaiden! It'll make her happy!

events/mirafan.html.speaker: Siffrin
events/mirafan.html.dialogue: "You have a fan!"

events/mirafan.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/mirafan.html.dialogue: I... I do?
(You nod and point at the stylish woman's house.)

events/mirafan.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/mirafan.html.dialogue: I... don't know whose house it is. A stylish lady?
(You describe the stylish lady as best you can.)

events/mirafan.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/mirafan.html.dialogue: Um... I'm sorry to tell you this, but stylish ladies aren't very rare in Vaugarde, haha.

events/mirafan.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/mirafan.html.dialogue: And I see a lot of people during classes... I'm not smart enough to remember everyone I see...
(Welp.)
(Maybe eventually you'll find a way to jog her memory...)
"Mira has a fan..."

events/mirafan.html.speaker: Loop
events/mirafan.html.dialogue: She does...

events/mirafan.html.speaker: Loop
events/mirafan.html.dialogue: But she doesn't actually remember meeting her fan, even though they shared classes together! How devastating!

events/mirafan.html.speaker: Loop
events/mirafan.html.dialogue: I wonder if there's a way to make her remember...
(A desk with an open notebook.)
(It has very lovely handwriting.)

events/mirafan.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/mirafan.html.dialogue: Oh! I recognize this handwriting...

events/mirafan.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/mirafan.html.dialogue: This is the seat of a very stylish very scary lady with amazing fashion sense!

events/mirafan.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/mirafan.html.dialogue: She often wore this very cool dress, and she always has her dark hair in a bun...

events/mirafan.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/mirafan.html.dialogue: We often had the same classes, but she probably doesn't know I exist. I'm a little sad about it, I always wanted to ask her for fashion tips...

events/mirafan.html.speaker: Siffrin
events/mirafan.html.dialogue: (Wait, this sounds like...) "That's the stylish lady I was talking to you about."

events/mirafan.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/mirafan.html.dialogue: Who?

events/mirafan.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/mirafan.html.dialogue: THE STYLISH LADY NEXT DOOR IN DORMONT

events/mirafan.html.speaker: Siffrin
events/mirafan.html.dialogue: (...) "Yes, her. Your fan."

events/mirafan.html.speaker: Bonnie
events/mirafan.html.dialogue: You have a fan, Belle?!

events/mirafan.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/mirafan.html.dialogue: Mira... Remember us when you're famous...

events/mirafan.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/mirafan.html.dialogue: So that's who you meant... Yes, I know her!!!

events/mirafan.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/mirafan.html.dialogue: But see, if you said she was scary, I would've known who you meant.

events/mirafan.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/mirafan.html.dialogue: She has a very intense glare, and she talks in a way where I never know if she's making fun of people or not...
(You make a face.)
(The stylish lady didn't look very scary when you talked to her...)

events/mirafan.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/mirafan.html.dialogue: If you see her again, look into her eyes. You'll know what I mean.
(You might try that.)
(Either way, you should go talk to the stylish lady and let her know that Mirabelle knows her...)

events/mirafan.html.speaker: Siffrin
events/mirafan.html.dialogue: "Mira has a fan..."

events/mirafan.html.speaker: Loop
events/mirafan.html.dialogue: She does! And the twist is...

events/mirafan.html.speaker: Loop
events/mirafan.html.dialogue: Your Housemaiden thinks she's kinda cool but mostly scary!!!

events/mirafan.html.speaker: Loop
events/mirafan.html.dialogue: You should let that stylish lady know... I wonder how she'll react?

events/mirafan.html.speaker: Stylish One
events/mirafan.html.dialogue: Big hat... Impossibly warm looking cloak...

events/mirafan.html.speaker: Stylish One
events/mirafan.html.dialogue: You must be one of the people traveling with Mirabelle!

events/mirafan.html.speaker: Stylish One
events/mirafan.html.dialogue: She's pretty well known around here. The chosen one, you know. Blessed by the Change God with the power to save Vaugarde.

events/mirafan.html.speaker: Stylish One
events/mirafan.html.dialogue: Plus, before all this, she was a housemaiden at the House of Change nearby. She'd take classes, help out with chores, help the other housemaidens with their studies and craft. Little perfect Mirabelle.

events/mirafan.html.speaker: Stylish One
events/mirafan.html.dialogue: Hmf... As for me...

events/mirafan.html.speaker: Stylish One
events/mirafan.html.dialogue: I THINK SHE'S THE MOST WONDERFUL BEING ON EARTH.

events/mirafan.html.speaker: Stylish One
events/mirafan.html.dialogue: No wonder the Change God blessed her, when she's this wonderful!!!

events/mirafan.html.speaker: Stylish One
events/mirafan.html.dialogue: I used to go to the House a lot for my classes, and she was always there, taking the class with me!
(You tell her what Mirabelle thinks of her.)

events/mirafan.html.speaker: Stylish One
events/mirafan.html.dialogue: SHE THINKS I'M SCARY?!?

events/mirafan.html.speaker: Stylish One
events/mirafan.html.dialogue: But wait, you said she also liked my style?
(You nod.)

events/mirafan.html.speaker: Stylish One
events/mirafan.html.dialogue: Oh... Oh Change... Oh yes. Oh wonderful. I know exactly what to do.

events/mirafan.html.speaker: Stylish One
events/mirafan.html.dialogue: Give me three seconds, hatted one.

events/mirafan.html.speaker: Stylish One
events/mirafan.html.dialogue: YES. OKAY. LET'S GO. Can you give this to Mirabelle?

events/mirafan.html.speaker: Stylish One
events/mirafan.html.dialogue: I, um, I hope she likes it.
(You got the FANMAIL!)
(It's a package and a letter addressed to Mirabelle...)
(You'd better give it to her before tomorrow.)
(You put the mail in your pocket along with your Souvenirs.)

events/mirafan.html.speaker: Stylish One
events/mirafan.html.dialogue: Thank you... Please give it to her... Please... I don't want to scare her... Please.
A gift for Mirabelle. It's lovingly wrapped.
A gift for Mirabelle. It can't be gifted anymore.
(A gift for Mirabelle from the stylish woman.)
(It has a package and a letter.)
(Opening either would be rude, so you leave them alone.)
(A gift for Mirabelle from the stylish woman.)
(It has a package with the Stylish Bow inside, and a letter.)
(Mirabelle didn't tell you the contents of the letter.)
(If you open the letter now, you won't be able to give Mirabelle her gift.)
(Open the letter?)
(You open the letter.)
(It's many pages long. The stylish woman wrote about how she met Mirabelle, how much she admires her, and how she hopes the bow will fit her well...)
(The last page only has one sentence written on it.)
(It just says: "None of us blame you, Mirabelle.")
(It just says: "None of us blame you, Mirabelle.")
(You leave the letter alone.)
(Did it satisfy your curiosity?)

events/mirafan.html.speaker: Siffrin
events/mirafan.html.dialogue: "Mira has a fan..."

events/mirafan.html.speaker: Loop
events/mirafan.html.dialogue: Yes, and the stylish woman gave you a gift for your Housemaiden!

events/mirafan.html.speaker: Loop
events/mirafan.html.dialogue: Give it to her! Do it! Do it!!!
(You give her the gift.)

events/mirafan.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/mirafan.html.dialogue: F-Fanmail?!? From a stylish lady?!?

events/mirafan.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/mirafan.html.dialogue: Okay... Oh, it's from one of my classmates...? I...

events/mirafan.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/mirafan.html.dialogue: Oh... Oh!!!

events/mirafan.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/mirafan.html.dialogue: That's from, um, a scary classmate of mine...!

events/mirafan.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/mirafan.html.dialogue: Or at least, I thought she was scary! She has a very intense look, you know!!!

events/mirafan.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/mirafan.html.dialogue: But... She's gifting me a bow she made...

events/mirafan.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/mirafan.html.dialogue: She thought it would fit me well, and she says... She says...
(Suddenly, Mirabelle starts tearing up!!!)

events/mirafan.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/mirafan.html.dialogue: S-She's such a nice person... I'm so glad that...

events/mirafan.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/mirafan.html.dialogue: So glad that...

events/mirafan.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/mirafan.html.dialogue: A-Anyway, look!!! Look at this bow! Isn't it pretty?
(She's crying, but she must not want you to mention it...)
(You look at the bow.)
(It's a very bright shade, and seems to sparkle in the light.)
(It would probably fit Mirabelle very well...)

events/mirafan.html.speaker: Siffrin
events/mirafan.html.dialogue: "It looks wonderful."

events/mirafan.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/mirafan.html.dialogue: It does!
(You got the STYLISH BOW!)
(Mirabelle keeps it safe.)

events/mirafan.html.speaker: Stylish One
events/mirafan.html.dialogue: You gave her my gift? You did??? What did she say???

events/mirafan.html.speaker: Siffrin
events/mirafan.html.dialogue: "She really liked it!"

events/mirafan.html.speaker: Stylish One
events/mirafan.html.dialogue: SHE REALLY LIKED IT.......................

events/mirafan.html.speaker: Stylish One
events/mirafan.html.dialogue: Thank you for giving it to her!!! Now, no matter what happens tomorrow...

events/mirafan.html.speaker: Stylish One
events/mirafan.html.dialogue: . . .

events/mirafan.html.speaker: Stylish One
events/mirafan.html.dialogue: A-actually!!! Please make sure to win, tomorrow!

events/mirafan.html.speaker: Stylish One
events/mirafan.html.dialogue: I want to tell her tomorrow how much she means to me, after she beats the King!

events/mirafan.html.speaker: Stylish One
events/mirafan.html.dialogue: So she and I... can become friends!!!

events/mirafan.html.speaker: Stylish One
events/mirafan.html.dialogue: Make sure to win tomorrow!!!!!
(You nod.)

events/mirafan.html.speaker: Siffrin
events/mirafan.html.dialogue: "Mira has a fan..."

events/mirafan.html.speaker: Loop
events/mirafan.html.dialogue: And you gave that fan's gift to your Housemaiden!!!

events/mirafan.html.speaker: Loop
events/mirafan.html.dialogue: That was sweet. That was nice. Makes my heart grow warm.

events/mirafan.html.speaker: Loop
events/mirafan.html.dialogue: You got a pretty bow for your Housemaiden too!

events/mirafan.html.speaker: Loop
events/mirafan.html.dialogue: It's too bad you shouldn't give that gift to your Housemaiden again. Can't give her something she already owns, huh?

events/mirafan.html.speaker: Loop
events/mirafan.html.dialogue: And that's the end of this quest! Good job, stardust!
(You give her the gift.)

events/mirafan.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/mirafan.html.dialogue: F-Fanmail?!? From a stylish lady?!?

events/mirafan.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/mirafan.html.dialogue: Okay... Oh, it's from one of my classmates...? I...

events/mirafan.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/mirafan.html.dialogue: Oh... Oh!!!

events/mirafan.html.speaker: Mirabelle
