events/mirafan.html.dialogue: That's from, um, a scary classmate of mine...!

events/mirafan.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/mirafan.html.dialogue: Or at least, I thought she was scary! She has a very intense look, you know!!!

events/mirafan.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/mirafan.html.dialogue: But... She's gifting me a bow she made...

events/mirafan.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/mirafan.html.dialogue: She thought it would fit me well, and she says... She says...
(Mirabelle starts tearing up.)

events/mirafan.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/mirafan.html.dialogue: S-She's such a nice person... I'm so glad that...

events/mirafan.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/mirafan.html.dialogue: So glad that...

events/mirafan.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/mirafan.html.dialogue: A-Anyway, look!!! Look at this bow! Isn't it--
(You already have the Stylish Bow.)
(The bow disappeared from Mirabelle's hands.)

events/mirafan.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/mirafan.html.dialogue: What... What happened?

events/mirafan.html.speaker: Siffrin
events/mirafan.html.dialogue: (Huh?) "Mirabelle?"

events/mirafan.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/mirafan.html.dialogue: She mentioned... A bow, in her letter, but...

events/mirafan.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/mirafan.html.dialogue: The bow... Wasn't I... Wasn't I just holding it...?

events/mirafan.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/mirafan.html.dialogue: I... I can't remember... I...

events/mirafan.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/mirafan.html.dialogue: Urgh!!! My head... My head hurts...!!!
(Oh, no.)

events/mirafan.html.speaker: Siffrin
events/mirafan.html.dialogue: (You have to do something!!!) "I-It's right here, see???"
(You point at the bow Mirabelle is wearing.)
(You point at Mirabelle's pockets.)

events/mirafan.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/mirafan.html.dialogue: Right the--right there... It's right there...

events/mirafan.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/mirafan.html.dialogue: It's right there! Look at this bow! Isn't it pretty?

events/mirafan.html.speaker: Siffrin
events/mirafan.html.dialogue: (. . .) "I-It looks wonderful!"

events/mirafan.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/mirafan.html.dialogue: It does!

events/mirafan.html.speaker: Siffrin
events/mirafan.html.dialogue: "You have a stylish bow!"
(You point at the bow Mirabelle is wearing.)
(You point at Mirabelle's pockets.)

events/mirafan.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/mirafan.html.dialogue: I do! Look at this bow! Isn't it pretty?

events/mirafan.html.speaker: Siffrin
events/mirafan.html.dialogue: "It looks wonderful!"

events/mirafan.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/mirafan.html.dialogue: It does!

events/odilesus.html.speaker: Odile
events/odilesus.html.dialogue: Time Craft, and Wish Craft, huh...?

events/odilesus.html.speaker: Odile
events/odilesus.html.dialogue: Ah, Siffrin. I'm just thinking, don't mind me...
(She's looking at you weird. Did you do something wrong...?)

events/odilesus.html.speaker: Odile
events/odilesus.html.dialogue: Do you have anything you'd like to tell me, Siffrin?

events/odilesus.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/odilesus.html.dialogue: Huuuuh? You think so? But strange how?

events/odilesus.html.speaker: Odile
events/odilesus.html.dialogue: This crush of yours shouldn't make you this stupid, Isabeau.

events/odilesus.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/odilesus.html.dialogue: But isn't that normal? To be acting weird?

events/odilesus.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/odilesus.html.dialogue: We're all... pretty stressed out, aren't we?

events/odilesus.html.speaker: Odile
events/odilesus.html.dialogue: Better to at least do something, rather than watching things happen and hoping for the best, Isabeau.

events/odilesus.html.speaker: Odile
events/odilesus.html.dialogue: I'll wait until after we beat the King to talk to Siffrin.

events/odilesus.html.speaker: Odile
events/odilesus.html.dialogue: In the meantime, let me know if you notice anything.

events/odilesus.html.speaker: Odile
events/odilesus.html.dialogue: A lot of emotions being expressed right now, aren't there?

events/odilesus.html.speaker: Odile
events/odilesus.html.dialogue: ...I feel bad that I didn't notice Mirabelle wasn't doing well. I should've paid more attention...

events/odilesus.html.speaker: Odile
events/odilesus.html.dialogue: Yes. Neither of us is very good at this "feelings" thing, and Boniface is a child still learning how to manage theirs...

events/odilesus.html.speaker: Odile
events/odilesus.html.dialogue: So. In the spirit of being a person good at this "feelings" thing...

events/odilesus.html.speaker: Odile
events/odilesus.html.dialogue: How are you feeling right now?
(Why is she asking you this again?)

events/odilesus.html.speaker: Odile
events/odilesus.html.dialogue: Are you? Because you look a bit out of it to me.

events/odilesus.html.speaker: Odile
events/odilesus.html.dialogue: You've been acting weird since yesterday, actually.

events/odilesus.html.speaker: Siffrin
events/odilesus.html.dialogue: (You try not to flinch.) "I'm all fine, I swear!"

events/odilesus.html.speaker: Odile
events/odilesus.html.dialogue: And if you think everyone hasn't noticed how weird you've been acting...

events/odilesus.html.speaker: Odile
events/odilesus.html.dialogue: That dumb smile isn't as convincing as you think it is.

events/odilesus.html.speaker: Loop
events/odilesus.html.dialogue: That Researcher of yours is pretty perceptive. Better not act weird, or interact with stuff that makes you act weird too often in one loop.

events/odilesus.html.speaker: Loop
events/odilesus.html.dialogue: Or do! What does it matter? She won't be able to figure anything out anyway.

events/odilesus.html.speaker: Loop
events/odilesus.html.dialogue: Figuring out you're looping in time just because you're "acting weird" would be quite an achievement!

events/odilesus.html.speaker: Odile
events/odilesus.html.dialogue: Woop woop, we did it, we won, etc.

events/odilesus.html.speaker: Odile
events/odilesus.html.dialogue: This was... quite a workout. My entire body is screaming.

events/odilesus.html.speaker: Odile
events/odilesus.html.dialogue: Savior of Vaugarde, huh? That's something to add to my list of accomplishments.

events/odilesus.html.speaker: Odile
events/odilesus.html.dialogue: But now I can finally go back to traveling. I'd be curious to visit some more Vaugardian cities and hear what they have to say after an event like this.

events/odilesus.html.speaker: Odile
events/odilesus.html.dialogue: It'll be weird to travel alone now, but I'll get used to it again.

events/odilesus.html.speaker: Odile
events/odilesus.html.dialogue: Or I could just go home to Ka Bue... Hm...

events/odilesus.html.speaker: Odile
events/odilesus.html.dialogue: Are you hoping I'll tell you now that our journey is over?

events/odilesus.html.speaker: Odile
events/odilesus.html.dialogue: Oh, so you figured it out, did you?

events/odilesus.html.speaker: Odile
events/odilesus.html.dialogue: Don't tell anyone. I'd like to see Isabeau try to figure it out for a little longer.

events/odilesus.html.speaker: Odile
events/odilesus.html.dialogue: Very excited to hear what he comes up with next. Spoonology? Bananalogy?

events/odilesus.html.speaker: Siffrin
events/odilesus.html.dialogue: (Say the line, Siffrin.) "Bananalogy would be quite aPEELing."

events/odilesus.html.speaker: Odile
events/odilesus.html.dialogue: You're a little strange, but you're a good kid. Maybe try letting down your walls every once in a while, huh?

events/odilesus.html.speaker: Odile
events/odilesus.html.dialogue: And come to Ka Bue anytime. Maybe we'll meet again during your travels.

events/odilesus.html.speaker: Bonnie
events/odilesus.html.dialogue: AH!!!!!! I HAVE EVEN MORE PINEAPPLE SLICES IN MY POCKET!!!!!!

events/odilesus.html.speaker: Odile
events/odilesus.html.dialogue: I don't know, Siffrin. You've felt off since yesterday. More withdrawn, mostly.

events/odilesus.html.speaker: Odile
events/odilesus.html.dialogue: ...It's okay if you don't want to tell me, you know.

events/odilesus.html.speaker: Odile
events/odilesus.html.dialogue: ...I'm missing something. I must be...

events/odilesus.html.speaker: Odile
events/odilesus.html.dialogue: Just know I'm here if you want to talk.

events/odilesus.html.speaker: Odile
events/odilesus.html.dialogue: Well, not for much longer. So you better tell me soon.

events/odilesus.html.speaker: Odile
events/odilesus.html.dialogue: I don't know, Siffrin. You've felt off since yesterday. More withdrawn, mostly.

events/odilesus.html.speaker: Odile
events/odilesus.html.dialogue: ...It's okay if you don't want to tell me, you know.

events/odilesus.html.speaker: Odile
events/odilesus.html.dialogue: So Time Craft has nothing to do with you?

events/odilesus.html.speaker: Odile
events/odilesus.html.dialogue: And the fact that you knew how to read that book about Wish Craft... Knew how to wish correctly, when no one else did...

events/odilesus.html.speaker: Odile
events/odilesus.html.dialogue: And the way you're acting, doing that stupid smile like nothing's wrong...

events/odilesus.html.speaker: Odile
events/odilesus.html.dialogue: If I find something strange, I can do nothing except give it my full attention.

events/odilesus.html.speaker: Odile
events/odilesus.html.dialogue: There were so many signs... I did not understand them, but now I do!

events/odilesus.html.speaker: Odile
events/odilesus.html.dialogue: You've been acting strange since you woke up from your nap, yesterday!

events/odilesus.html.speaker: Odile
events/odilesus.html.dialogue: When we talk to you, you act out of it, almost bored...

events/odilesus.html.speaker: Odile
events/odilesus.html.dialogue: And the way you reacted to the rocks falling...

events/odilesus.html.speaker: Odile
events/odilesus.html.dialogue: We all jumped, but you just looked at them fall, calmly.

events/odilesus.html.speaker: Odile
events/odilesus.html.dialogue: And there's so many other things, the way you reacted to so many things throughout our entire journey through the House!

events/odilesus.html.speaker: Odile
events/odilesus.html.dialogue: And how every time you found the keys we needed to proceed, you didn't seem surprised, like you knew exactly where they were.

events/odilesus.html.speaker: Odile
events/odilesus.html.dialogue: Even that key hidden in the classroom.

events/odilesus.html.speaker: Odile
events/odilesus.html.dialogue: . . .  Like you had found them before, maybe?
(No no no no no no--)

events/odilesus.html.speaker: Siffrin
events/odilesus.html.dialogue: (Say something!!!) "B-But that'd be impossible, though!"

events/odilesus.html.speaker: Siffrin
events/odilesus.html.dialogue: "How could I have known where the keys were when it's my first time here?!?"

events/odilesus.html.speaker: Odile
events/odilesus.html.dialogue: I don't know, Siffrin, why don't you enlighten me?!

events/odilesus.html.speaker: Odile
events/odilesus.html.dialogue: Don't think I believed that whole "I wished croissants would disappear~" thing, too.

events/odilesus.html.speaker: Odile
events/odilesus.html.dialogue: So, if you lied about your wish...

events/odilesus.html.speaker: Odile
events/odilesus.html.dialogue: What did you wish for, then?

events/odilesus.html.speaker: Odile
events/odilesus.html.dialogue: Did something happen? To you, to us? Did we die against the King, maybe?

events/odilesus.html.speaker: Odile
events/odilesus.html.dialogue: Is that why  you're repeating the same events, Siffrin?

events/odilesus.html.speaker: Siffrin
events/odilesus.html.dialogue: "Even if you figure it out, Odile..."

events/odilesus.html.speaker: Siffrin
events/odilesus.html.dialogue: "It's too late! It's too late! It's always too late!!!"

events/odilesus.html.speaker: Siffrin
events/odilesus.html.dialogue: "Did you have to figure it out now, when it's all about to end?"

events/odilesus.html.speaker: Siffrin
events/odilesus.html.dialogue: "You can't help me, Odile!!! No one can!!!"

events/odilesus.html.speaker: Bonnie
events/odilesus.html.dialogue: What's happening? Why are you yelling?

events/odilesus.html.speaker: Siffrin
events/odilesus.html.dialogue: "And I think, weirdly, I don't even want you to help me?"

events/odilesus.html.speaker: Siffrin
events/odilesus.html.dialogue: "Why don't I want you to help me?"

events/odilesus.html.speaker: Siffrin
events/odilesus.html.dialogue: "Maybe because I know that if you help me, you'll start hating me!!!"

events/odilesus.html.speaker: Siffrin
events/odilesus.html.dialogue: "Because I don't know why this is all happening, but--"

events/odilesus.html.speaker: Siffrin
events/odilesus.html.dialogue: "It must be because of me, that we're repeating the same events!!!"

events/odilesus.html.speaker: Siffrin
events/odilesus.html.dialogue:
"And if you knew that, you'd hate me"
<!--no punctuation sic-->

events/odilesus.html.speaker: Siffrin
events/odilesus.html.dialogue:
"And I don't want you to hate me"
<!--no punctuation sic-->

events/odilesus.html.speaker: Odile
events/odilesus.html.dialogue: ...It's okay if you don't want to tell me, you know.

events/odilesus.html.speaker: Odile
events/odilesus.html.dialogue: Alright, well, if that was all...

events/odilesus.html.speaker: Odile
events/odilesus.html.dialogue: I don't know, Siffrin. You've felt off since yesterday. More withdrawn, mostly.

events/odilesus.html.speaker: Odile
events/odilesus.html.dialogue: ...It's okay if you don't want to tell me, you know.

events/odilesus.html.speaker: Odile
events/odilesus.html.dialogue: Alright, well, if that was all...

events/odilesus.html.speaker: Loop
events/odilesus.html.dialogue: ...And she figured it out, didn't she?

events/odilesus.html.speaker: Loop
events/odilesus.html.dialogue: I had something similar happen to me, once.

events/odilesus.html.speaker: Loop
events/odilesus.html.dialogue: Someone figuring out I was hiding something.

events/phone.html.speaker: Odile
events/phone.html.dialogue: I'm sorry, why are we back here?

events/phone.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/phone.html.dialogue: M'dame! Are you saying Sif was wrong to bring us all the way back to a room we already searched top to bottom because there's only one thing here?

events/phone.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/phone.html.dialogue: M'dame, you're so weird.
(An intact statue of the Change God.)
(This is the only intact statue in the House, so you can see its face clearly.)
(You look at it a little closer...)
(You stick your tongue out in disgust.)
(This statue's face looks awful.)
(Mirabelle's intact statue of the Change God.)
(You look at it a little closer...)

events/phone.html.speaker: Bonnie
events/phone.html.dialogue: Can noses look like that?

events/phone.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/phone.html.dialogue: Wow, that left eye is somehow above the right brow.

events/phone.html.speaker: Odile
events/phone.html.dialogue: I can't tell if they're supposed to be smiling or frowning...

events/phone.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/phone.html.dialogue: . . . Mira?
(Oh no.)

events/phone.html.speaker: Odile
events/phone.html.dialogue: Ah...

events/phone.html.speaker: Bonnie
events/phone.html.dialogue: Uh oh.

events/phone.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/phone.html.dialogue: ...I was trying to make them look gentle and nice...

events/phone.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/phone.html.dialogue: MIRA WE'RE SO SORRY!!!!!!!!!!!!

events/phone.html.speaker: Bonnie
events/phone.html.dialogue: SORRY WE SAID YOUR STATUE SUCKED!!!!!!!!!!

events/phone.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/phone.html.dialogue: N-no, no, it's fine...

events/phone.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/phone.html.dialogue: ...I'll get my revenge against you all someday.
(So Mirabelle made this statue...)
(Interesting that it's the only one that wasn't destroyed.)
(You know very little about the Change God, and the statues of them you can find everywhere in Vaugarde.)
(Maybe you should look at the statues inside the House, when you have the time...)
(You always found the Change Belief a little weird.)
(Mirabelle especially seems to think it's perfect, or something.)
(You're kind of curious. Maybe you should check this statue again later, once you know more about her thoughts on the Change Belief...)
"Mirabelle's statue..."

events/phone.html.speaker: Loop
events/phone.html.dialogue: Huh?

events/phone.html.speaker: Loop
events/phone.html.dialogue: Oh, the Change God's statue where you get the KeyKnife!

events/phone.html.speaker: Loop
events/phone.html.dialogue: I didn't know your Housemaiden made it. Explains why it looks so bad, teehee!
(It's true, sadly.)

events/phone.html.speaker: Loop
events/phone.html.dialogue: I don't know much about the Change belief...

events/phone.html.speaker: Loop
events/phone.html.dialogue: But maybe if you looked at a bunch of statues in the House, you might learn something about them!
(A statue of the Change God.)
(It's been destroyed.)

events/phone.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/phone.html.dialogue: Siffrin? Are you curious about the Change God's statues, perhaps...?

events/phone.html.speaker: Odile
events/phone.html.dialogue: That's the King's doing, isn't it?

events/phone.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/phone.html.dialogue: They're statues of the Change God, and the King wants to freeze Vaugarde in time, so... Maybe the King wanted to make a statement.

events/phone.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/phone.html.dialogue: "Look how useless your god is!!!" That sorta thing.

events/phone.html.speaker: Odile
events/phone.html.dialogue: But only the faces are destroyed... Normally, you'd destroy the whole statue, right?

events/phone.html.speaker: Bonnie
events/phone.html.dialogue: The face is important, Dile.

events/phone.html.speaker: Odile
events/phone.html.dialogue: Oh?

events/phone.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/phone.html.dialogue: Yes! Um, so, every statue we've seen so far is made by a different Crafter, or artist!

events/phone.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/phone.html.dialogue: It's kind of a cultural thing to Craft your own Change God.

events/phone.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/phone.html.dialogue: The Change God is always changing, always different... And we all have our own version of the Change God in our brains!

events/phone.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/phone.html.dialogue: The Change God is always depicted wearing the same clothes, so they're at least recognizable in that way...

events/phone.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/phone.html.dialogue: But their face is always changing!

events/phone.html.speaker: Bonnie
events/phone.html.dialogue: I think the Change God has like a thousand eyes!!! That's how they can see everything!

events/phone.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/phone.html.dialogue: I've heard someone say the Change God had sewn their own mouth shut... Unable to tell us how to change, and leaving it to us poor humans to figure it out!

events/phone.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/phone.html.dialogue: I had a dream they had dimples!

events/phone.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/phone.html.dialogue: And, and! Since it's Crafted by us, it's supposed to represent our connection to the Change God!

events/phone.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/phone.html.dialogue: The Change God, by their very nature, doesn't interact with humans much...

events/phone.html.speaker: Bonnie
events/phone.html.dialogue: Except for when they blessed Mirabelle!

events/phone.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/phone.html.dialogue: Ah... Y-Yes...

events/phone.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/phone.html.dialogue: B-But by Crafting the Change God's face, we get linked to them in some small way!

events/phone.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/phone.html.dialogue: And some people even get to communicate with the Change God through the statues they made, as well!

events/phone.html.speaker: Odile
events/phone.html.dialogue: Oh, really?

events/phone.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/phone.html.dialogue: Nah, not really.

events/phone.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/phone.html.dialogue: Yes, really!!! I've met someone who's talked to the Change God, when they finished their statue!!!

events/phone.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/phone.html.dialogue: Was it in a dream, maybe? Because you know that doesn't count.

events/phone.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/phone.html.dialogue: A-Anyway, that's why all the statues are different from one another!

events/phone.html.speaker: Odile
events/phone.html.dialogue: Interesting... So it's a cultural tradition to make your own statue.

events/phone.html.speaker: Odile
events/phone.html.dialogue: And it's a connection between you and the Change God...

events/phone.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/phone.html.dialogue: How do you connect with your gods, m'dame?

events/phone.html.speaker: Odile
events/phone.html.dialogue: We make shrines for our gods, and everyone shares the shrines.

events/phone.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/phone.html.dialogue: SHARING GODS............
(Interesting.)
(Now that you know more about the statues and the Change belief, maybe you could check Mirabelle's statue once more...)
(Not right now, though. You have a King to beat.)

events/phone.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/phone.html.dialogue: Ah... Okay...

events/phone.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/phone.html.dialogue: W-Well, let me know if you ever want to know more about them, okay?!?
"Mirabelle's statue..."

events/phone.html.speaker: Loop
events/phone.html.dialogue: Ah, so believers make a statue to connect with the Change God, even in a small way...

events/phone.html.speaker: Loop
events/phone.html.dialogue: And some people might have talked to the Change God through their statues?

events/phone.html.speaker: Loop
events/phone.html.dialogue: Kinda cute! And it's a nice way to feel closer to your faith.

events/phone.html.speaker: Loop
events/phone.html.dialogue: Not that you know much about the Change belief still, don't you? Maybe that'll come later...

events/phone.html.speaker: Loop
events/phone.html.dialogue: You should look at your Housemaiden's statue again! Maybe you'll find out something more about it.
(Mirabelle's intact statue of the Change God.)
(You look at it a little closer...)

events/phone.html.speaker: Bonnie
events/phone.html.dialogue: Can noses look like that?

events/phone.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/phone.html.dialogue: Wow, that left eye is somehow above the right brow.

events/phone.html.speaker: Odile
events/phone.html.dialogue: I can't tell if they're supposed to be smiling or frowning...

events/phone.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/phone.html.dialogue: . . . Mira?

events/phone.html.speaker: Odile
events/phone.html.dialogue: Ah...

events/phone.html.speaker: Bonnie
events/phone.html.dialogue: Uh oh.

events/phone.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/phone.html.dialogue: ...I was trying to make them look gentle and nice...

events/phone.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/phone.html.dialogue: MIRA WE'RE SO SORRY!!!!!!!!!!!!

events/phone.html.speaker: Bonnie
events/phone.html.dialogue: SORRY WE SAID YOUR STATUE SUCKED!!!!!!!!!!

events/phone.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/phone.html.dialogue: N-no, no, it's fine...

events/phone.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/phone.html.dialogue: ...I'll get my revenge against you all someday.
(But, hm...)
(The statue is a link between the Change God and the Crafter, right?)
(You wonder what would happen if Mirabelle touched it right now.)

events/phone.html.speaker: Siffrin
events/phone.html.dialogue: "Mira, can you put your hand on the statue?"

events/phone.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/phone.html.dialogue: Hm? Um, sure?
(As soon as Mirabelle touches the statue, you hear something.)
fipchoooooooo

events/phone.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/phone.html.dialogue: WAH!!!!!!!!

events/phone.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/phone.html.dialogue: Huh?!? What?!? Where are--
(Mirabelle and you got transported somewhere...)

events/phone.html.speaker: Siffrin
events/phone.html.dialogue: "Someone's there, Mira!"

events/phone.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/phone.html.dialogue: Huh?!?

events/phone.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/phone.html.dialogue: Th... The Head Housemaiden...?

events/phone.html.speaker: Bonnie
events/phone.html.dialogue: ... *buzzer sound* ( *｀з´)

events/phone.html.speaker: Bonnie
events/phone.html.dialogue: mirabelle!!! i can't believe u can't recognize me ಠ_ಠ

events/phone.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/phone.html.dialogue: Th-They changed shapes?!?

events/phone.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/phone.html.dialogue: yea!!! i did!!! don't you know who i am??? ヽ(・∀・)ﾉ

events/phone.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/phone.html.dialogue: Someone... Who changes shapes...

events/phone.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/phone.html.dialogue: No... This can't be?! You're--

events/phone.html.speaker: Odile
events/phone.html.dialogue: aaand she got it!!! ٩(◕‿◕｡)۶ it's me

events/phone.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/phone.html.dialogue: THE CHANGE GOD. ＠＾▽＾＠

events/phone.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/phone.html.dialogue: WAAAAAAAAAAAAAAH!!!!!!

events/phone.html.speaker: Euphrasie
events/phone.html.dialogue: oh no oh no oh no!!! └（★ｏ★）┐

events/phone.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/phone.html.dialogue: i didnt mean to make u cry!!! i messed up ¯_༼ ಥ ‿ ಥ ༽_/¯

events/phone.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/phone.html.dialogue: Oh, Change God... I...

events/phone.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/phone.html.dialogue: I'm so sorry!!!

events/phone.html.speaker: Odile
events/phone.html.dialogue: sorry? but for what? (￣ヘ￣)

events/phone.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/phone.html.dialogue: For so many things!!!

events/phone.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/phone.html.dialogue: For being useless, for not being willing to change enough, for lying and making everyone believe you blessed me, for...

events/phone.html.speaker: Bonnie
events/phone.html.dialogue: oh, that!

events/phone.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/phone.html.dialogue: i dont care ＼(￣▽￣)／ its fine dont worry about it

events/phone.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/phone.html.dialogue: ...Huh?

events/phone.html.speaker: Odile
events/phone.html.dialogue: if i was mad about it i wouldnt have helped u earlier right?

events/phone.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/phone.html.dialogue: but i did it bc im rooting for u! (*¯︶¯*)

events/phone.html.speaker: Siffrin
events/phone.html.dialogue: (Helped us earlier...?) "Do you mean... The knife?"

events/phone.html.speaker: Odile
events/phone.html.dialogue: the KEYKNIFE, okay. it has a name and you should use it

events/phone.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/phone.html.dialogue: but yes that was me ヽ(>∀<)ノ

events/phone.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/phone.html.dialogue: It was...? So...

events/phone.html.speaker: Euphrasie
events/phone.html.dialogue: aw, housemaiden mirabelle... (ಥ_ʖಥ)

events/phone.html.speaker: Odile
events/phone.html.dialogue: im about to tell you something really important. for many reasons, you won't remember it after i send you back to your quest.

events/phone.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/phone.html.dialogue: well, ur brain wont remember, but your heart will  (ﾉ◕ヮ◕)ﾉ*:･ﾟ✧ so listen!!!

events/phone.html.speaker: Odile
events/phone.html.dialogue: its true that as the change god i cant help humans much

events/phone.html.speaker: Bonnie
events/phone.html.dialogue: (mostly because i dont want to ♡( ◡‿◡ ))

events/phone.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/phone.html.dialogue: i cant help with your petty struggles for survival and stuff

events/phone.html.speaker: Euphrasie
events/phone.html.dialogue: but it doesnt matter, because even my little god powers are nothing next to yours!!!

events/phone.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/phone.html.dialogue: the real power comes from you, mirabelle!!! ლ(ಠ益ಠ)ლ

events/phone.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/phone.html.dialogue: if you decide you can change, thats enough power and belief to do anything

events/phone.html.speaker: Bonnie
events/phone.html.dialogue: (dont even need some silly rituals or anything like SOME OTHER BELIEF OUT THERE (ಠuಠ))

events/phone.html.speaker: Euphrasie
events/phone.html.dialogue: and look how far you’ve come!!! without me!!!

events/phone.html.speaker: Odile
events/phone.html.dialogue: but if thats not enough for u, then know this

events/phone.html.speaker: Change God
events/phone.html.dialogue: you are loved, mirabelle.

events/phone.html.speaker: Change God
events/phone.html.dialogue: i see you changing, even if you do not.

events/phone.html.speaker: Change God
events/phone.html.dialogue: you are always changing, always evolving.

events/phone.html.speaker: Change God
events/phone.html.dialogue: you are not stagnating in any way.

events/phone.html.speaker: Change God
events/phone.html.dialogue: and even if you were, that would be fine, because life is about changes  but it's also about staying right where you are, sometimes.

events/phone.html.speaker: Change God
events/phone.html.dialogue: i am proud of you

events/phone.html.speaker: Change God
events/phone.html.dialogue: and i love you!!!  σ(≧ε≦σ) ♡

events/phone.html.speaker: Change God
events/phone.html.dialogue: and i love the stupid ugly face you gave me and i wont ever let anyone destroy it!!!!!!! (((o(*°▽°*)o)))

events/phone.html.speaker: Change God
events/phone.html.dialogue: remember that ok!!!! (⁎˃ᆺ˂)

events/phone.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/phone.html.dialogue: ...Thank you, Change God.

events/phone.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/phone.html.dialogue: You are nothing like I was expecting, but...

events/phone.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/phone.html.dialogue: I would expect nothing else from you!

events/phone.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/phone.html.dialogue: hihihihihihi aw (⁄ ⁄>⁄ ▽ ⁄<⁄ ⁄)
(Mirabelle and the Change God giggle together.)
(Somehow, Mirabelle looks so much less burdened than before...)

events/phone.html.speaker: Bonnie
events/phone.html.dialogue: OH, OH, i wanna do this!!!!!!!

events/phone.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/phone.html.dialogue: you got a MEMORY of ME (*´台｀*)

events/phone.html.speaker: Odile
events/phone.html.dialogue: when equipped, it'll do... eh, who cares.

events/phone.html.speaker: Odile
events/phone.html.dialogue: i don't know why you need to remember things so much. weirdo!

events/phone.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/phone.html.dialogue: Um... What?
(Mirabelle tilts her head to the side, confused.)

events/phone.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/phone.html.dialogue: oh crab look at that head tilt!!!

events/phone.html.speaker: Bonnie
events/phone.html.dialogue: hihi... that head housemaiden of yours is right!

events/phone.html.speaker: Euphrasie
events/phone.html.dialogue: you really are so stinking cute, mirabelle!!!! (o´∀`o)

events/phone.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/phone.html.dialogue: Oh, um--

events/phone.html.speaker: Bonnie
events/phone.html.dialogue: alright thats it! that was your god call!!!

events/phone.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/phone.html.dialogue: good luck mirabelle!!! im rooting for u!!! i love u!!! bye!!! *beams you away!*

events/phone.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/phone.html.dialogue: Wai--
(Mirabelle disappeared!)
(Where did she--)

events/phone.html.speaker: Siffrin
events/phone.html.dialogue: siffrin no middle names no last name (✿´◉◞⊖◟◉｀✿)

events/phone.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/phone.html.dialogue: sorry for not talking to u

events/phone.html.speaker: Odile
events/phone.html.dialogue: this was all for mirabelle's sake, you understand. her sidequest~ .

events/phone.html.speaker: Bonnie
events/phone.html.dialogue: you know aaaaaaall about sidequests dont you

events/phone.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/phone.html.dialogue: plus i know you dont really care about me hihi ( ͡ຈ╭͜ʖ╮͡ຈ )

events/phone.html.speaker: Odile
events/phone.html.dialogue: but hey its not every loop you get to meet a god,

events/phone.html.speaker: King
events/phone.html.dialogue: (and its not like yours will ever REALLY talk to you)

events/phone.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/phone.html.dialogue: so i will give you some words too

events/phone.html.speaker: Loop
events/phone.html.dialogue: ill say them thru the face of your little sponsor buddy too, for the effect hihihihi
(Sponsor...?)

events/phone.html.speaker: Loop
events/phone.html.dialogue: and those words are...

events/phone.html.speaker: Loop
events/phone.html.dialogue: I HAVE SEEN IT ALL.

events/phone.html.speaker: Loop
events/phone.html.dialogue: PITIFUL TRAVELER, WALKING THROUGH TIME...

events/phone.html.speaker: Loop
events/phone.html.dialogue: GOING AGAINST THE VERY NATURE OF THIS WORLD.

events/phone.html.speaker: Loop
events/phone.html.dialogue: THIS RIDICULOUS, NEVER ENDING PLAY...

events/phone.html.speaker: Loop
events/phone.html.dialogue: IT GOES AGAINST EVERYTHING I STAND FOR.

events/phone.html.speaker: Loop
events/phone.html.dialogue: I AM THE CHANGE GOD. MY DOMAIN IS THE FUTURE ITSELF, THE POSSIBILITY OF IT!

events/phone.html.speaker: Loop
events/phone.html.dialogue: AND THIS... IS THIS WHAT I HAVE NOW?

events/phone.html.speaker: Loop
events/phone.html.dialogue: DORMONT, REPEATING! DORMONT, UNCHANGING! STAGNATING!

events/phone.html.speaker: Loop
events/phone.html.dialogue: A CRIME AGAINST LIFE ITSELF!
(But...)
(But you don't want to be here, either!!!)
(If you could change it, you would!!! So--)

events/phone.html.speaker: Loop
events/phone.html.dialogue: HIHIHI... YOU MISUNDERSTAND.
(What?)

events/phone.html.speaker: Loop
events/phone.html.dialogue: THE EVENTS UNFOLDING RIGHT NOW MAY GO AGAINST MY VERY NATURE...

events/phone.html.speaker: Loop
events/phone.html.dialogue: BUT IT DOESNT MEAN I'M NOT ENJOYING MYSELF IMMENSELY.

events/phone.html.speaker: Loop
events/phone.html.dialogue: THIS POCKET OF TIME MAY BE REWINDING, BUT YOU ARE NOT.

events/phone.html.speaker: Loop
events/phone.html.dialogue: IN THIS BUBBLE, WHERE EVERYTHING STAYS THE EXACT SAME... HOW WILL YOU BRING ABOUT CHANGE?

events/phone.html.speaker: Loop
events/phone.html.dialogue: HOW WILL YOU CHANGE?

events/phone.html.speaker: Siffrin
events/phone.html.dialogue: i just cant wait to see more!!! (ﾉ◕ヮ◕)ﾉ*

events/phone.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/phone.html.dialogue: ill keep giving you the knife every time, so dont worry!!! ( ´ ω ` ) keep going! keep changing!!!

events/phone.html.speaker: Euphrasie
events/phone.html.dialogue: and keep giving us a good show!!!

events/phone.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/phone.html.dialogue: bye!

events/phone.html.speaker: Siffrin
events/phone.html.dialogue: "Wait, wait--"

events/phone.html.speaker: Loop
events/phone.html.dialogue: nope! bye! *hangs up the phone.*
(You stumble.)

events/phone.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/phone.html.dialogue: Woah...

events/phone.html.speaker: Bonnie
events/phone.html.dialogue: HEY!!!

events/phone.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/phone.html.dialogue: Mira, Sif!!! Are you two okay?

events/phone.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/phone.html.dialogue: What... What happened?

events/phone.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/phone.html.dialogue: I don't know, you both started looking weird!

events/phone.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/phone.html.dialogue: Like... Like you were about to faint, or something!!!

events/phone.html.speaker: Odile
events/phone.html.dialogue: Are you both okay? Can you stand up?
(You and Mirabelle nod.)

events/phone.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/phone.html.dialogue: Yes, I...

events/phone.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/phone.html.dialogue: I feel like... I feel like I saw something incredible?

events/phone.html.speaker: Bonnie
events/phone.html.dialogue: Huh?

events/phone.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/phone.html.dialogue: I don't remember it anymore, though.
(You do, still.)

events/phone.html.speaker: Odile
events/phone.html.dialogue: ... If you're good, we should keep going.

events/phone.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/phone.html.dialogue: Yes... Yes, let's go.
"Mirabelle's statue..."

events/phone.html.speaker: Loop
events/phone.html.dialogue: You went to Mirabelle's statue, I saw that! I wanted to ask you about it!

events/phone.html.speaker: Loop
events/phone.html.dialogue: I couldn't see you very well... I saw you go to the statue, and ask your Housemaiden to touch it...

events/phone.html.speaker: Loop
events/phone.html.dialogue: And then poof! Nothing! I think you were talking to someone?

events/phone.html.speaker: Siffrin
events/phone.html.dialogue: (Heh.) "Yeah, the Change God."

events/phone.html.speaker: Loop
events/phone.html.dialogue: Hahaha!

events/phone.html.speaker: Loop
events/phone.html.dialogue: WHAT?!?
(You tell Loop about how you and Mirabelle talked to the Change God.)

events/phone.html.speaker: Loop
events/phone.html.dialogue: Well, um, putting aside the whole "the Change God knows you're looping and thinks it's funny to watch" aside...

events/phone.html.speaker: Loop
events/phone.html.dialogue: It's so nice that the Change God talked to your Housemaiden!

events/phone.html.speaker: Loop
events/phone.html.dialogue: She was thinking she was a bad believer because she doesn't feel romantic or sexual attraction...

events/phone.html.speaker: Loop
events/phone.html.dialogue: Isn't it nice to know some god out there doesn't care about that sorta thing?

events/phone.html.speaker: Loop
events/phone.html.dialogue: Especially the Change God! Kind of freeing! Your Housemaiden got some closure!

events/phone.html.speaker: Loop
events/phone.html.dialogue: Even if she doesn't remember.
(You nod.)

events/phone.html.speaker: Loop
events/phone.html.dialogue:
<small>
 So they think it's funny, huh...?
</small>
(Loop swears under their breath.)
(You're angry, too, but you just breathe and move on.)

events/phone.html.speaker: Loop
events/phone.html.dialogue: ...Well, neat! That's neat! And I guess that's the end of that!!!
(You make sure that Mirabelle doesn't come close to touching it.)

events/touchtherapy.html.dialogue: (WOW there's no place to pass through with everyone following you.)
(You try your best to pass through the tight space between your [allies/family members], the tables, and the wall.)
(You try your best to pass through the tight space between your [allies/family members], the tables, and the wall.)
(As you pass through, you realize, not for the first time in this situation, that everyone unconsciously makes sure to not touch you any more than necessary.)
(It's not the best feeling, but there must be a reason they're not touching you, so you leave it alone.)
(While passing through, you stumble and accidentally bump against Odile.)

events/touchtherapy.html.speaker: Odile
events/touchtherapy.html.dialogue: We are used to your weird aversion to touch.

events/touchtherapy.html.speaker: Loop
events/touchtherapy.html.dialogue: My turn, actually, my turn! I have a question!!!

events/touchtherapy.html.speaker: Loop
events/touchtherapy.html.dialogue: So, I've seen you don't like to be touched, huh? Why do you think that is?

events/touchtherapy.html.speaker: Siffrin
events/touchtherapy.html.dialogue:
(You flinch.)
						"I'm just too precious to touch!"

events/touchtherapy.html.speaker: Loop
events/touchtherapy.html.dialogue: No, but really. Ever thought of NOT flinching when someone touches you, though?
(As if it was that easy. You just can't help it.)
(You can't help but jump when people touch you. You think it's because you're just not used to it.)
(It's not like you wanted to be like this...)

events/touchtherapy.html.speaker: Loop
events/touchtherapy.html.dialogue: Maybe you could do some exposure therapy. Try to touch your allies. Like in that gardening room in the House!

events/touchtherapy.html.speaker: Loop
events/touchtherapy.html.dialogue: You have nothing but time, after all!
(Once again, you can tell that people make sure to give you some space.)
(Steeling yourself, you take a deep breath, and brush against everyone softly.)
(While passing through, you take a deep breath, and--)

events/touchtherapy.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/touchtherapy.html.dialogue: D-Don't poke my sides, Sif!!! I'm ticklish!!!
(While passing through, you take a deep breath, and--)
(As you gently poke her, she pokes you back.)
(While passing through, you take a deep breath, and--)
(Beyond throwing you a look, she doesn't react.)
(While passing through, you take a deep breath, and--)

events/touchtherapy.html.speaker: Bonnie
events/touchtherapy.html.dialogue: Poke my cheek again and die.

events/touchtherapy.html.speaker: Loop
events/touchtherapy.html.dialogue: My turn, actually, my turn! I have a question!!!

events/touchtherapy.html.speaker: Loop
events/touchtherapy.html.dialogue: So, so, so, how's your touch exposure therapy going?

events/touchtherapy.html.speaker: Loop
events/touchtherapy.html.dialogue: In the gardening room! You've been practicing to touch your party in that annoyingly cramped room, right?

events/touchtherapy.html.speaker: Siffrin
events/touchtherapy.html.dialogue:
(How does Loop know about this...)
						"It's going well."

events/touchtherapy.html.speaker: Loop
events/touchtherapy.html.dialogue: Touching people is so weird, right? At least you have all the time in the world to get used to it!

events/touchtherapy.html.speaker: Loop
events/touchtherapy.html.dialogue: Especially since they don't remember what you did if you loop, right? Removes all the yucky yucky ew vulnerability of it all.
(While passing through, you discreetly touch everyone.)
(As you pass through the tight space between the tables and the wall, you brush against everyone.)
(You try to get some human contact every loop, even if it's discreetly like this.)
(You've read somewhere that humans need a certain amount of skin-to-skin contact otherwise they go insane.)
(Asking for skin-to-skin contact would be weird, so you content yourself with clothes-to-clothes.)
(You poke everyone again, but this time no one reacts.)

events/touchtherapy.html.speaker: Loop
events/touchtherapy.html.dialogue: My turn, actually, my turn! I have a question!!!

events/touchtherapy.html.speaker: Loop
events/touchtherapy.html.dialogue: You know, poking all your party members in the gardening room.
(They used to react before, when you touched them.)
(You keep trying and trying, but nothing changes.)
(It's like you aren't even here anymore.)
(With some hesitation, Loop brings their hand forwards...)
(Loop seems to flash you a hesitant smile.)
(You poke everyone again, but this time no one reacts.)
(You rub your arms once, twice, thrice.)
(You feel like you're floating in your own body.)
(If only someone would touch you to make sure you're real! Someone, anyone!)

events/tutorial.html.speaker: Odile
events/tutorial.html.dialogue: A Sadness, huh? The house must be crawling with them...

events/tutorial.html.speaker: Odile
events/tutorial.html.dialogue: Come on... We've seen tons of those already.

events/tutorial.html.speaker: Bonnie
events/tutorial.html.dialogue: Don't worry, Belle! We can take care of them no problem!!!
(Maybe talking would make her feel better...?)
(Last time, she felt better after talking strategy...)
(You could do that again, or you could, you know. Save time.)
(For some reason, you decide to do the Tutorial time once more.)

events/tutorial.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/tutorial.html.dialogue: But, um, yes. I would like that.

events/tutorial.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/tutorial.html.dialogue: So, um, to start with, Siffrin should--
[Here's some basic stats about you and your party members to remember.]
[Can use Craft spells of any type]
(Mirabelle goes through everyone's strengths and weaknesses to reassure herself.)
(Everyone nods like it's very important information that none of you have considered before.)
(You don't really mind... As long as it makes her feel better.)
(You suppress the urge to tap your foot.)

events/tutorial.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/tutorial.html.dialogue: Sorry, Bonbon. The Sadnesses in here are too powerful for your tiny little arms!

events/tutorial.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/tutorial.html.dialogue: You can help out sometimes, as long as you make sure to keep your distance. But we know that's boring, so...

events/tutorial.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/tutorial.html.dialogue: ...That's why we also made you in charge of snacks!!! It's a super duper very important job, y'know? The super duper importantest.

events/tutorial.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/tutorial.html.dialogue: S-Sorry! I'll be okay! Let's go, everyone!!!
(If you're not careful, you might defeat this Sadness in one hit...)
(You make sure to not strike too hard.)

events/tutorial.html.speaker: Odile
events/tutorial.html.dialogue: Don't worry. You focus on healing, big guy over there can hit things...

events/tutorial.html.speaker: Odile
events/tutorial.html.dialogue: ...and you, Siffrin, keep the puns and one liners to a minimum, PLEASE.

events/tutorial.html.speaker: Odile
events/tutorial.html.dialogue: We should Examine this Sadness first to know what we're up against, so...

events/tutorial.html.speaker: Odile
events/tutorial.html.dialogue: Yes. Please slow down, everyone, and let me attack first for once.

events/tutorial.html.speaker: Odile
events/tutorial.html.dialogue: When it's my turn, I'll Examine the enemy by using a Craft Skill.

events/tutorial.html.speaker: Odile
events/tutorial.html.dialogue: Remnants of the people that were defeated by the King...

events/tutorial.html.speaker: Odile
events/tutorial.html.dialogue: Their grief and sadness is all that remains.

events/tutorial.html.speaker: Odile
events/tutorial.html.dialogue: They cannot tell friend from foe anymore. Defeating them is all we can do...

events/tutorial.html.speaker: Odile
events/tutorial.html.dialogue:
Every Sadness has a different resistance and weakness.
Maybe there's a way to figure it out from their appearance...

events/tutorial.html.speaker: Bonnie
events/tutorial.html.dialogue: We need to do certain hand signs when we Craft skills... So maybe we should look at their hands?

events/tutorial.html.speaker: Odile
events/tutorial.html.dialogue: Very well done, Boniface. So this Sadness must be...

events/tutorial.html.speaker: Bonnie
events/tutorial.html.dialogue: Yeah! It's doing a Scissors sign!

events/tutorial.html.speaker: Odile
events/tutorial.html.dialogue: So if this enemy is Scissors type, what's the best type of attacks we can use against it, Siffrin?

events/tutorial.html.speaker: Odile
events/tutorial.html.dialogue: Thankfully, even after examining this enemy, it is still my turn.

events/tutorial.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/tutorial.html.dialogue: And thankfully, you can use all three types of Craft!!!

events/tutorial.html.speaker: Odile
events/tutorial.html.dialogue: Yes. I am still Paper type, though, so hopefully this Sadness doesn't attack me...

events/tutorial.html.speaker: Odile
events/tutorial.html.dialogue: Let's go and attack it, now.

events/tutorial.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/tutorial.html.dialogue: Aw, Sif! Even I know that's wrong!

events/tutorial.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/tutorial.html.dialogue: You're not very good at this today, are you?
(You can see something in the corner of your vision...)
(This seems to show resistances and weaknesses.)
[Pst! You can turn this helpful little visual ON and OFF in the Options menu!]

events/tutorial.html.speaker: Bonnie
events/tutorial.html.dialogue: Um, what's that symbol that appeared on the right after you attacked, again?

events/tutorial.html.speaker: Bonnie
events/tutorial.html.dialogue: I know you've said it before, but I forget.

events/tutorial.html.speaker: Odile
events/tutorial.html.dialogue: Don't worry about that right now. Just remember it's there, for later. Let's finish beating up this Sadness, shall we?

events/tutorial.html.speaker: Odile
events/tutorial.html.dialogue: No need to slow down for me anymore.

events/tutorial.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/tutorial.html.dialogue: I-It's our turn to attack whenever our Attack Gauge is filled, right?

events/tutorial.html.speaker: Bonnie
events/tutorial.html.dialogue: It's that gauge that fills up automatically when no one is doing anything!

events/tutorial.html.speaker: Odile
events/tutorial.html.dialogue: Precisely. Let's defeat this Sadness, now.

events/tutorial.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/tutorial.html.dialogue: It was! Just look at the enemy's hands to find out their type, and attack accordingly!

events/tutorial.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/tutorial.html.dialogue: See, Mira? It wasn't that bad!

events/tutorial.html.speaker: Bonnie
events/tutorial.html.dialogue: Going through the house will be a piece of cake!!!
(It's fine, you're not annoyed or anything.)

events/tutorial.html.speaker: Odile
events/tutorial.html.dialogue: A Sadness, huh? The house must be crawling with them...
(You have ENOUGH of all those STUPID SADNESSES standing in your BLINDING WAY.)
(always HERE always GETTING IN YOUR WAY always SLOWING YOU DOWN)
(Not DEAD not DEAD not DEAD not DEAD not DEAD not DEAD THERE WE GO!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!)

events/tutorial.html.speaker: Odile
events/tutorial.html.dialogue: A Sadness, huh? The house must be crawling with them...

events/tutorial.html.speaker: Odile
events/tutorial.html.dialogue: Come on... We've seen tons of those already.

events/tutorial.html.speaker: Bonnie
events/tutorial.html.dialogue: Don't worry, Belle! We can take care of them no problem!!!

events/tutorial.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/tutorial.html.dialogue: S-Sorry! I'll be okay! Let's go, everyone!!!
(Don't kill it in one strike, or they'll notice.)

events/tutorial.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/tutorial.html.dialogue: See, Mira? It wasn't that bad!

events/tutorial.html.speaker: Bonnie
events/tutorial.html.dialogue: Going through the house will be a piece of cake!!!
(Take the lead, take the lead, take the lead.)
(Don't scare them by acting weird.)
[When equipped, Sadnesses will flee from you.]

events/tutorial.html.speaker: Odile
events/tutorial.html.dialogue: We'll have to fight them if we want to proceed... Or we could just run and make sure they don't touch us.

events/tutorial.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/tutorial.html.dialogue: Um, um... Could we keep talking about strategies for a bit, maybe?

events/tutorial.html.speaker: Odile
events/tutorial.html.dialogue: We'll enter battle if those Sadnesses touch you, Siffrin, so get ready.

events/tutorial.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/tutorial.html.dialogue: Oh...! I-I'm good too, actually! Don't worry about me!

events/tutorial.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/tutorial.html.dialogue: We can go!!! I'll be fine!!!
(You smile at Mirabelle, and keep walking.)

events/tutorial.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/tutorial.html.dialogue: Yay Sif, you did it Sif!

events/tutorial.html.speaker: Odile
events/tutorial.html.dialogue: And if it's Rock type, it is weak to...?

events/tutorial.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/tutorial.html.dialogue: Siffrin, you're so talented! You know so many things! Congrats, Siffrin!
(You stick out your tongue at her.)

events/tutorial.html.speaker: Odile
events/tutorial.html.dialogue: Alright, we went over attacks and types...

events/tutorial.html.speaker: Odile
events/tutorial.html.dialogue: So let's talk about Craft skills.

events/tutorial.html.speaker: Odile
events/tutorial.html.dialogue: Compared to normal attacks, Craft skills are more powerful, or may allow us to heal, or buff ourselves up.

events/tutorial.html.speaker: Odile
events/tutorial.html.dialogue: Enemies won't be shy about using Craft skills, so we shouldn't either.

events/tutorial.html.speaker: Odile
events/tutorial.html.dialogue: But using one Craft skill means it'll go into Cooldown. After using one, we won't be able to execute the same skill for a few turns.

events/tutorial.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/tutorial.html.dialogue: I-it's usually fine, but it might be dangerous with healing skills!

events/tutorial.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/tutorial.html.dialogue: I'll try to make sure to use my healing skills carefully, so I don't run out at a dangerous moment...

events/tutorial.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/tutorial.html.dialogue: But even if it happens, there's items to recharge our cooled down skills, and there might even be skills and equipment out there to help out!

events/tutorial.html.speaker: Odile
events/tutorial.html.dialogue: That is true. In the meantime, let's attack, shall we?

events/tutorial.html.speaker: Odile
events/tutorial.html.dialogue: Feel free to try things out.

events/tutorial.html.speaker: Bonnie
events/tutorial.html.dialogue: ...But really, what were those symbols that appeared when you did a Rock, Paper or Scissors attack...

events/tutorial.html.speaker: Odile
events/tutorial.html.dialogue: Let's see... Do you know this...?

events/tutorial.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/tutorial.html.dialogue: Well, um, it's Paper type, m'dame. And so it means it's weak to Scissors.

events/tutorial.html.speaker: Odile
events/tutorial.html.dialogue: And I have Scissors Skills at my disposal, as well.

events/tutorial.html.speaker: Bonnie
events/tutorial.html.dialogue: Since it's weak to Scissors, I think you should use Scissors attacks a bunch.

events/tutorial.html.speaker: Odile
events/tutorial.html.dialogue: Great idea, Boniface. I wonder what will happen if we use the same Type of Craft Skill multiple times in a row?

events/tutorial.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/tutorial.html.dialogue: Feels like you guys are on a roll with those Scissors attacks.

events/tutorial.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/tutorial.html.dialogue: I don't have any Scissors attacks... So how about I give my turn away to someone who does?

events/tutorial.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/tutorial.html.dialogue: Which is, like we've established earlier, literally everyone but me, I guess.

events/tutorial.html.speaker: Bonnie
events/tutorial.html.dialogue: Ha, that's what you get for being Rock type!

events/tutorial.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/tutorial.html.dialogue: Hey everyone, I'm being bullied by a preteen? Please advise?

events/tutorial.html.speaker: Odile
events/tutorial.html.dialogue: To make sure we keep using the same type right after the other, use that skill of yours to give your turn away, or you can guard if you want.
(The Sadness is about to attack Odile!!!)
(Isabeau will protect her again, won't he? They'll be fine, but--)
(You try not to flinch as Isabeau protects Odile.)

events/tutorial.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/tutorial.html.dialogue: Owie... I'll see you all... In a minute...

events/tutorial.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/tutorial.html.dialogue: Don't you need someone to be K.O.'d for your tutorial anyway?

events/tutorial.html.speaker: Odile
events/tutorial.html.dialogue: Very true. Let's keep this tutorial going then.

events/tutorial.html.speaker: Bonnie
events/tutorial.html.dialogue: Stop talking! You're K.O., and K.O.'d people can't talk, dummy!!!

events/tutorial.html.speaker: Odile
events/tutorial.html.dialogue: Anyway, when someone's Health Points, or HP, goes down to 0, they'll be out cold, and won't be able to fight anymore.

events/tutorial.html.speaker: Odile
events/tutorial.html.dialogue: There's multiple ways to wake him up, like using a Crafted Water, or if Mirabelle knew a Craft Skill to revive him...

events/tutorial.html.speaker: Odile
events/tutorial.html.dialogue: But how about we make this interesting? With...

events/tutorial.html.speaker: Bonnie
events/tutorial.html.dialogue: Oh!!! I remember what those Scissors symbols are for!!!

events/tutorial.html.speaker: Bonnie
events/tutorial.html.dialogue: IF WE DO A COMBO, AND HAVE FIVE OF THE SAME SYMBOL, WE CAN DO A "JACKPOT SKILL"!!!

events/tutorial.html.speaker: Odile
events/tutorial.html.dialogue: And see? We already have a combo of three right here.

events/tutorial.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/tutorial.html.dialogue: When we get five of the same symbol, whether Rock, Paper or Scissors, we'll be able to use a Jackpot Skill...

events/tutorial.html.speaker: Odile
events/tutorial.html.dialogue: Only Rock, Paper and Scissors attacks count for the Jackpot, by the way.

events/tutorial.html.speaker: Odile
events/tutorial.html.dialogue: We should be careful with how we use those skills, but we can use any other type of skill or item without breaking the combo.

events/tutorial.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/tutorial.html.dialogue: Yay... A combo will save me... Please do a combo...

events/tutorial.html.speaker: Odile
events/tutorial.html.dialogue: Let's add two more Scissors symbols to our lineup, shall we?

events/tutorial.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/tutorial.html.dialogue: AND I'M NOT OUT COLD ANYMORE!!!

events/tutorial.html.speaker: Odile
events/tutorial.html.dialogue: Every time we manage to use a Jackpot Skill, anyone who's out cold is revived, and we'll all get healed a little bit, as well.

events/tutorial.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/tutorial.html.dialogue: We should try to do combos as often as we can!

events/tutorial.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/tutorial.html.dialogue: Hm... That's cool and all, but...

events/tutorial.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/tutorial.html.dialogue: But what if you won without doing that Jackpot Skill?! Would you have just left me there?!?

events/tutorial.html.speaker: Mirabelle
events/tutorial.html.dialogue: N-No, of course not!!! We have some items... We would have revived you!!!

events/tutorial.html.speaker: Odile
events/tutorial.html.dialogue: We'll always revive anyone who's K.O. after a battle. Can't make unconscious people run around, can we?

events/tutorial.html.speaker: Odile
events/tutorial.html.dialogue: Are you really this upset that we left you alone for two minutes?

events/tutorial.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/tutorial.html.dialogue: Nah, not really, I'm just doing my part.

events/tutorial.html.speaker: Isabeau
events/tutorial.html.dialogue: Plus, the floor was nice and refreshing.

events/tutorial.html.speaker: Odile
events/tutorial.html.dialogue: It is, but you're not supposed to say it aloud, Boniface.

events/tutorial.html.speaker: Odile
events/tutorial.html.dialogue: And that's the end of this little refresher. All good, Mirabelle?

random/barrels.html.dialogue: (It says on the side: "DO NOT SHAKE!!!")
(You give it to Bonnie for safekeeping.)

random/barrels.html.speaker: Isabeau
random/barrels.html.dialogue: You okay, buddy? What's up with the barrels?

random/barrels.html.speaker: Isabeau
random/barrels.html.dialogue: That's not false, I guess? Anything could be in there.

random/barrels.html.speaker: Odile
random/barrels.html.dialogue: I don't think a barrel will hide a sword, Boniface.
(You just like looking into barrels, it's fun.)
(But Isabeau's right... You could find something interesting in those...)
[If you have Memory of Barrels equipped, examining barrels might give you some cool items!.]
[Huh?! Is that how barrels work?!? Well, I guess that's how they work now. Yay for you!]
(You give it to Bonnie for safekeeping.)

random/barrels.html.speaker: Isabeau
random/barrels.html.dialogue: You okay, Sif? I really don't think we'll have another switch inside a pillar.

random/barrels.html.speaker: Odile
random/barrels.html.dialogue: Yes, I think using the same tactic twice would be quite stupid...
(But what if one of those columns hides another switch?!?! You just can't take the chance.)
(And if not switches... They might have SOMETHING in them.)
[If you have Memory of Pillars equipped, examining pillars might give you some cool items!]
[Which is a little weird, I gotta say. Why would you find stuff in them? I don't get it, but that's how the world works now. Yay?]
(Something is keeping you from going back...)

random/brightflower.html.dialogue: A four-petal flower full of hidden meaning.
You can gift it to your [friends/allies/family members/actors].
(With your superior sense of smell, you smell the flower.)
(What if you gave it to someone important to you?)
(You missed the opportunity to give it to someone.)
(You remove the flower's petals, one at a time.)
(The flower doesn't look like anything recognizable now.)
(Bonnie hesitantly takes the flower, and stares at it intently.)
(Isabeau takes the flower and cradles it gently in his hands.)

random/brightflower.html.speaker: Mirabelle
random/brightflower.html.dialogue: Oh! For me? Thank you, Siffrin!

random/brightflower.html.speaker: Mirabelle
random/brightflower.html.dialogue: Hehehe, this is a nice gift... I'll make sure to press it in a book so I can keep it forever!

random/brightflower.html.speaker: Odile
random/brightflower.html.dialogue: For me? Where did that come from?

random/brightflower.html.speaker: Odile
random/brightflower.html.dialogue: It's not like you to be so thoughtful, so I'll definitely keep it as proof.
(You offer the Bright Flower to the King.)

random/brightflower.html.speaker: Isabeau
random/brightflower.html.dialogue: Uh, Sif, I don't know how it works where you're from...

random/brightflower.html.speaker: Isabeau
random/brightflower.html.dialogue: But in Vaugarde, we only give flowers to people we, um... Actually like.

random/brightflower.html.speaker: Siffrin
random/brightflower.html.dialogue: (...) "I remember that you can give flowers to whoever you want, as long as they're..."
(The King takes a step forward, and gently takes the flower from your hand.)

random/brightflower.html.speaker: King
random/brightflower.html.dialogue: Bright one...... No matter how this battle ends......

random/brightflower.html.speaker: King
random/brightflower.html.dialogue: Let us make this battle a moment truly worth remembering, then!

random/brightflower.html.speaker: King
random/brightflower.html.dialogue: I'll remember you after I defeat you, bright one.

random/brightflower.html.speaker: Euphrasie
random/brightflower.html.dialogue: Oh... Oh no. Oh no, no, no, no, no...

random/brightflower.html.speaker: Euphrasie
random/brightflower.html.dialogue: I'm so sorry! There's no way we can stop it now...!

random/brightflower.html.speaker: Euphrasie
random/brightflower.html.dialogue: I'm sorry! You'll be going back! Back when everything started!

random/brightflower.html.speaker: Euphrasie
random/brightflower.html.dialogue: I know you thought your quest was over, but it can't be!

random/brightflower.html.speaker: Euphrasie
random/brightflower.html.dialogue: I can't fix it on my own, not before it all ends... If only I had noticed sooner!!!

random/brightflower.html.speaker: Euphrasie
random/brightflower.html.dialogue: I should've seen it, prevented it!!!
(You feel a tug on your stomach.)

random/brightflower.html.speaker: Euphrasie
random/brightflower.html.dialogue: It's my fault that you have to suffer like this.

random/brightflower.html.speaker: Euphrasie
random/brightflower.html.dialogue: I just hope that one day...

random/brightflower.html.speaker: Loop
random/brightflower.html.dialogue: I don't want any of your stuff, stardust!
(This is where your gentle, giving heart gets you.)

random/brightflower.html.speaker: Loop
random/brightflower.html.dialogue: I don't want it, stardust! Give it to someone else!

random/brightflower.html.speaker: Loop
random/brightflower.html.dialogue: Really, stop. This is getting annoying, now.

random/brightflower.html.speaker: Loop
random/brightflower.html.dialogue: She'll never wear it, but it would fit her, I think.

random/brightflower.html.speaker: Loop
random/brightflower.html.dialogue: He'd like anything you'd give him, that sucker.

random/brightflower.html.speaker: Loop
random/brightflower.html.dialogue: It would surprise her, if nothing else.

random/brightflower.html.speaker: Loop
random/brightflower.html.dialogue: They're a kid, and what kind of kid doesn't like flowers?

random/brightflower.html.speaker: Loop
random/brightflower.html.dialogue: No, I won't, so stop trying.
(You bring the flower to Loop, and gently drop it in their hand.)
(You wave the flower towards Loop, asking them silently if they'll accept it again.)
(You gently drop the flower in their open palm, and act like nothing out of the ordinary happened.)

random/change_god_statues.html.dialogue: (A statue of the Change God.)
(It's been destroyed.)
(Change God.)
(A statue of the Change God.)
(A statue of the Change God.)
(It's been destroyed.)
(Broken, broken.)
(If it wasn't already destroyed, you'd do it yourself.)
(No gods here! Come back later!)
(A statue of the Change God.)
(It's been destroyed.)

random/change_god_statues.html.speaker: Mirabelle
random/change_god_statues.html.dialogue: Siffrin? Are you curious about the Change God's statues, perhaps...?

random/change_god_statues.html.speaker: Odile
random/change_god_statues.html.dialogue: That's the King's doing, isn't it?

random/change_god_statues.html.speaker: Isabeau
random/change_god_statues.html.dialogue: They're statues of the Change God, and the King wants to freeze Vaugarde in time, so... Maybe the King wanted to make a statement.

random/change_god_statues.html.speaker: Isabeau
random/change_god_statues.html.dialogue: "Look how useless your god is!!!" That sorta thing.

random/change_god_statues.html.speaker: Odile
random/change_god_statues.html.dialogue: But only the faces are destroyed... Normally, you'd destroy the whole statue, right?

random/change_god_statues.html.speaker: Bonnie
random/change_god_statues.html.dialogue: The face is important, Dile.

random/change_god_statues.html.speaker: Odile
random/change_god_statues.html.dialogue: Oh?

random/change_god_statues.html.speaker: Mirabelle
random/change_god_statues.html.dialogue: Yes! Um, so, every statue we've seen so far is made by a different Crafter, or artist!

random/change_god_statues.html.speaker: Isabeau
random/change_god_statues.html.dialogue: It's kind of a cultural thing to Craft your own Change God.

random/change_god_statues.html.speaker: Isabeau
random/change_god_statues.html.dialogue: The Change God is always changing, always different... And we all have our own version of the Change God in our brains!

random/change_god_statues.html.speaker: Mirabelle
random/change_god_statues.html.dialogue: The Change God is always depicted wearing the same clothes, so they're at least recognizable in that way...

random/change_god_statues.html.speaker: Mirabelle
random/change_god_statues.html.dialogue: But their face is always changing!

random/change_god_statues.html.speaker: Bonnie
random/change_god_statues.html.dialogue: I think the Change God has like a thousand eyes!!! That's how they can see everything!

random/change_god_statues.html.speaker: Mirabelle
random/change_god_statues.html.dialogue: I've heard someone say the Change God had sewn their own mouth shut... Unable to tell us how to change, and leaving it to us poor humans to figure it out!

random/change_god_statues.html.speaker: Isabeau
random/change_god_statues.html.dialogue: I had a dream they had dimples!

random/change_god_statues.html.speaker: Mirabelle
random/change_god_statues.html.dialogue: And, and! Since it's Crafted by us, it's supposed to represent our connection to the Change God!

random/change_god_statues.html.speaker: Mirabelle
random/change_god_statues.html.dialogue: The Change God, by their very nature, doesn't interact with humans much...

random/change_god_statues.html.speaker: Bonnie
random/change_god_statues.html.dialogue: Except for when they blessed Mirabelle!

random/change_god_statues.html.speaker: Mirabelle
random/change_god_statues.html.dialogue: Ah... Y-Yes...

random/change_god_statues.html.speaker: Mirabelle
random/change_god_statues.html.dialogue: B-But by Crafting the Change God's face, we get linked to them in some small way!

random/change_god_statues.html.speaker: Mirabelle
random/change_god_statues.html.dialogue: And some people even get to communicate with the Change God through the statues they made, as well!

random/change_god_statues.html.speaker: Odile
random/change_god_statues.html.dialogue: Oh, really?

random/change_god_statues.html.speaker: Isabeau
random/change_god_statues.html.dialogue: Nah, not really.

random/change_god_statues.html.speaker: Mirabelle
random/change_god_statues.html.dialogue: Yes, really!!! I've met someone who's talked to the Change God, when they finished their statue!!!

random/change_god_statues.html.speaker: Isabeau
random/change_god_statues.html.dialogue: Was it in a dream, maybe? Because you know that doesn't count.

random/change_god_statues.html.speaker: Mirabelle
random/change_god_statues.html.dialogue: A-Anyway, that's why all the statues are different from one another!

random/change_god_statues.html.speaker: Odile
random/change_god_statues.html.dialogue: Interesting... So it's a cultural tradition to make your own statue.

random/change_god_statues.html.speaker: Odile
random/change_god_statues.html.dialogue: And it's a connection between you and the Change God...

random/change_god_statues.html.speaker: Isabeau
random/change_god_statues.html.dialogue: How do you connect with your gods, m'dame?

random/change_god_statues.html.speaker: Odile
random/change_god_statues.html.dialogue: We make shrines for our gods, and everyone shares the shrines.

random/change_god_statues.html.speaker: Isabeau
random/change_god_statues.html.dialogue: SHARING GODS............
(Interesting.)
(Now that you know more about the statues and the Change belief, maybe you could check Mirabelle's statue once more...)
(Not right now, though. You have a King to beat.)

random/change_god_statues.html.speaker: Mirabelle
random/change_god_statues.html.dialogue: Ah... Okay...

random/change_god_statues.html.speaker: Mirabelle
random/change_god_statues.html.dialogue: W-Well, let me know if you ever want to know more about them, okay?!?

random/combat.html.dialogue: (A Sadness killed you earlier... But you feel a tiny bit stronger.)
(You gained a little bit of EXP[!/.])
(You didn't manage to beat the King earlier, but you feel a little stronger.)
(You managed to beat the King earlier...)

random/combat.html.speaker: Mirabelle
random/combat.html.dialogue: Isabeau, this is NOT the time!!!
(Mirabelle brings her hands to the sky!)

random/combat.html.speaker: Mirabelle
random/combat.html.dialogue: It's very weak... A slightly stronger blow would've done it!

random/combat.html.speaker: Isabeau
random/combat.html.dialogue: Wanna deal the final blow, Bonnie?

random/combat.html.speaker: Mirabelle
random/combat.html.dialogue: What would we have done without you!
[If an enemy is close to death, your little kiddo might deal the final blow!]
[Look at them. So proud. Like a little bird who flew for the first time.]

Not gonna be done anytime soon.

random/dagger.html.speaker: Loop
random/dagger.html.dialogue: Hi, stardust!

random/dagger.html.speaker: Loop
random/dagger.html.dialogue: Say, you've looped back a lot using tears, haven't you? Was it on purpose, or did you trip into them?

random/dagger.html.speaker: Siffrin
random/dagger.html.dialogue: (Well...)

random/dagger.html.speaker: Loop
random/dagger.html.dialogue: Hm...

random/dagger.html.speaker: Loop
random/dagger.html.dialogue: You sure are, teehee!

random/dagger.html.speaker: Loop
random/dagger.html.dialogue: I suppose it is useful! It's a fast way to loop back.

random/dagger.html.speaker: Loop
random/dagger.html.dialogue: Isn't it tiring though, having to walk back to find one? Are you tired? Are you annoyed yet???
(Are they trying to get on your nerves on purpose...)

random/dagger.html.speaker: Loop
random/dagger.html.dialogue: Not on purpose! Just trying to make conversation!
(It IS annoying to have to walk back every time, though.)

random/dagger.html.speaker: Loop
random/dagger.html.dialogue: Right??? Well, there's no faster way, and it's either this or die in a fight, so I'd say the Tears are better.

random/dagger.html.speaker: Siffrin
random/dagger.html.dialogue: (Is it the only way...?)

random/dagger.html.speaker: Siffrin
random/dagger.html.dialogue: "Those Tears are sure getting on my nerves though."

random/dagger.html.speaker: Loop
random/dagger.html.dialogue: Heheh, so annoying, right?

random/dagger.html.speaker: Loop
random/dagger.html.dialogue: Haha, you sure do!

random/dagger.html.speaker: Loop
random/dagger.html.dialogue: What do you mean, "I do have a dagger"...?

random/dagger.html.speaker: Loop
random/dagger.html.dialogue: Stardust, are you serious? You want to stab yourself and die so you can loop back?

random/dagger.html.speaker: Loop
random/dagger.html.dialogue: You shouldn't! Stabbing yourself isn't as easy as touching a Tear, you know! It'll hurt! A lot!!!
(That's quite a reaction from Loop...)

random/dagger.html.speaker: Siffrin
random/dagger.html.dialogue: (It'd definitely hurt, yeah...)

random/dagger.html.speaker: Loop
random/dagger.html.dialogue: ...So you won't think about it anymore?

random/dagger.html.speaker: Loop
random/dagger.html.dialogue: Okay. Good.

random/dagger.html.speaker: Loop
random/dagger.html.dialogue: ...Anyway! How can I help you this time, stardust?

random/dagger.html.speaker: Loop
random/dagger.html.dialogue: Stardust, I don't want you to!!!

random/dagger.html.speaker: Loop
random/dagger.html.dialogue: Listen to me and don't even think about it, for Universe's sake!!!

random/dagger.html.speaker: Siffrin
random/dagger.html.dialogue: (Loop seems REALLY against the idea...)

random/dagger.html.speaker: Loop
random/dagger.html.dialogue: Okay, GOOD!!!

random/dagger.html.speaker: Loop
random/dagger.html.dialogue: Stars. Such a stupid idea.

random/dagger.html.speaker: Loop
random/dagger.html.dialogue: Anyway! How can I help you this time, stardust?

random/dagger.html.speaker: Loop
random/dagger.html.dialogue: Stardust, don't--

random/dagger.html.speaker: Loop
random/dagger.html.dialogue: Ah--
(Loop suddenly freezes.)
(You see them clutch their head in their hands in pain, when suddenly--)

random/dagger.html.speaker: Loop
random/dagger.html.dialogue: [YOU CAN NOW USE YOUR DAGGER TO LOOP BACK WHENEVER YOU WANT.]

random/dagger.html.speaker: Loop
random/dagger.html.dialogue: [YOU CAN DO SO BY GOING INTO YOUR POCKETS, AND USING YOUR DAGGER, IN BATTLE OR ELSEWHERE.]

random/dagger.html.speaker: Loop
random/dagger.html.dialogue: [DOING SO WILL IMMEDIATELY END A LOOP, ALLOWING YOU TO LOOP BACK WHENEVER YOU PLEASE.]
(Loop won't look at you.)

random/dagger.html.speaker: Loop
random/dagger.html.dialogue: You should probably go now. I'd rather not see your face again this loop.
(...)
(You flee.)

random/dagger.html.speaker: Loop
random/dagger.html.dialogue: Think this is funny, don't you.
(Maybe not here.)
(Killing yourself is a very intimate act, teehee. You'd rather do it with less entire villages full of people around.)
(Not here.)
(No.)

random/dagger.html.dialogue: "What's the difference between looping with a Tear, and looping because of my dagger?"

random/dagger.html.speaker: Loop

random/dagger.html.speaker: Loop

random/dagger.html.speaker: Loop
random/dagger.html.dialogue: You begin to see your own body as unimportant. Disposable.

random/dagger.html.speaker: Loop
random/dagger.html.dialogue: Your possessions aren't yours. Whatever events happen to you aren't yours.

random/dagger.html.speaker: Loop
random/dagger.html.dialogue: All that's left is you.

random/dagger.html.dialogue: And...
