(...It doesn't seem to be getting sharper.)

random/souvenirs2.html.speaker: Isabeau
random/souvenirs2.html.dialogue: Huh? Is that how you sharpen knives now, Sif?

random/souvenirs2.html.speaker: Siffrin
random/souvenirs2.html.dialogue: (Huh?) What do you mean?

random/souvenirs2.html.speaker: Isabeau
random/souvenirs2.html.dialogue: I dunno! Feels like you usually say something when you sharpen your dagger.
(Do you?)
(You can't remember.)

random/souvenirs2.html.speaker: Odile
random/souvenirs2.html.dialogue: Yes, something's missing...

random/souvenirs2.html.speaker: Mirabelle
random/souvenirs2.html.dialogue: Doesn't Siffrin talk usually?

random/souvenirs2.html.speaker: Bonnie
random/souvenirs2.html.dialogue: They do!!! They mumble when they make things!!!

random/souvenirs2.html.speaker: Bonnie
random/souvenirs2.html.dialogue: Like, "mumble mumble mumble".

random/souvenirs2.html.speaker: Mirabelle
random/souvenirs2.html.dialogue: A few weeks ago, you were carving a little wooden Odile, remember? And you were saying...

random/souvenirs2.html.speaker: Mirabelle
random/souvenirs2.html.dialogue: ...Something? I can't remember.

random/souvenirs2.html.speaker: Isabeau
random/souvenirs2.html.dialogue: Hm... Can't remember either...

random/souvenirs2.html.speaker: Odile
random/souvenirs2.html.dialogue: Are we as forgetful as Siffrin now? This doesn't bode well...

random/souvenirs2.html.speaker: Bonnie
random/souvenirs2.html.dialogue: If I saw a piece of carving wood or some carving stuff I'd remember.

random/souvenirs2.html.speaker: Isabeau
random/souvenirs2.html.dialogue: Heheh, yeah!
(Could it be that easy?)
(Hm, carving, carving... Where can you find carving tools or something...)
(Gotta find carving wood, if only so you can remember what the stars you mumble when you're carving stuff.)
(Sharpening stone, apply to KeyKnife.)
(You take the KeyKnife and sharpening stone, and mumble repeatedly the first thing that comes to mind...)
(You take the KeyKnife and sharpening stone, and mumble repeatedly...)

random/souvenirs2.html.speaker: Isabeau
random/souvenirs2.html.dialogue: Please be sharp,

random/souvenirs2.html.speaker: Mirabelle
random/souvenirs2.html.dialogue: Please be sharp,

random/souvenirs2.html.speaker: Bonnie
random/souvenirs2.html.dialogue: Please be sharp!!!

random/souvenirs2.html.speaker: Odile
random/souvenirs2.html.dialogue: Well, it's sharp now.
(Woohoo!)
(You got the KNIFEKEY!)
(You put the Knifekey in your pocket to equip later.)
[Woohoo, you did it!]
[You are now the proud owner of a KnifeKey, a knife that can cut anything, ESPECIALLY the King.]
[Yes, you heard that correctly! When the KnifeKey is equipped, your ATTACK will be boosted when fighting against the King! Isn't that grand!!!]
[One thing though... This weapon isn't like the others. You can only equip it when you make it, which means you'll have to pick up the KeyKnife and sharpen it every time.]
[It's an important item, after all! You can't just HAVE it!!!]
[Unless...]
(You got a MEMORY OF KNIFEKEY!)
(You'll always remember this.)
[If you equip this memory, and loop back to the King, you will automatically have the KnifeKey equipped!!!]
[That's it, stardust! Bye!!!]
(You got the KNIFEKEY!)
(You put the Knifekey in your pocket to equip later.)
Shiny. Sharp. Use carefully.
(A vial, but it's broken.)
(The pieces of glass catch the light, making them almost sparkle.)
(Shiny...)
(But sharp! You leave the pretty glass alone.)
(You got the SHINY PIECE OF GLASS!)
(You discreetly put the piece of glass in your pocket along with your Souvenirs.)
(Got the SHINY PIECE OF GLASS.)
(You look at the glass shard.)
(The light of the frozen torches scatters through it.)
(Sparkly.)
(Sharp.)
(Oops.)

random/souvenirs2.html.speaker: Bonnie
random/souvenirs2.html.dialogue: Aaaaaaaah, your finger!!!

random/souvenirs2.html.speaker: Odile
random/souvenirs2.html.dialogue: Did you cut yourself?

random/souvenirs2.html.speaker: Odile
random/souvenirs2.html.dialogue: Here, give me your hand.
(She gently takes your hand and wraps a bandage around your finger.)
(So nice, even though she tries to pretend she is not.)
(Next to her, Bonnie carefully takes the glass shard from you...)
(...and throws it across the room.)

random/souvenirs2.html.speaker: Bonnie
random/souvenirs2.html.dialogue: Why do you have sharp things like this in your pocket anyway...?
(The cut on your finger is gone, like it never existed.)
(Not the time to be clumsy.)
(You pierce a tiny dot on the back of your arm with the point of the glass.)
(You make another, and another, and another.)
(Stars!!!!!!)
(You make more tiny stars.)
(hide it hide it hide it don't make them worry)
(Oh!)
(UH OH!)
(You should be careful with this.)
(You throw it away before you hurt yourself.)
It's a short gizmo-gadget. Doesn't get more descriptive than that.
(A closet filled with unsafe-looking potions.)

random/souvenirs2.html.speaker: Isabeau
random/souvenirs2.html.dialogue: Was your roommate making bombs? Because with all the materials she has in here, it looks like she was learning how to make Craft bombs.

random/souvenirs2.html.speaker: Mirabelle
random/souvenirs2.html.dialogue: What?! No!!! Was she???

random/souvenirs2.html.speaker: Isabeau
random/souvenirs2.html.dialogue: Hahaha!

random/souvenirs2.html.speaker: Isabeau
random/souvenirs2.html.dialogue: I'm just saying. She has the materials to make a Craft bomb.

random/souvenirs2.html.speaker: Isabeau
random/souvenirs2.html.dialogue: Looks like she didn't finish it though, if that makes you feel better?

random/souvenirs2.html.speaker: Odile
random/souvenirs2.html.dialogue: How... do you know... how to make a Craft bomb...

random/souvenirs2.html.speaker: Isabeau
random/souvenirs2.html.dialogue: I-I learned it while I was studying to become a Defender... B-But isn't that just common knowledge???

random/souvenirs2.html.speaker: Odile
random/souvenirs2.html.dialogue: I've never learned that.

random/souvenirs2.html.speaker: Mirabelle
random/souvenirs2.html.dialogue: I-I've never learned how to make a bomb!!!

random/souvenirs2.html.speaker: Bonnie
random/souvenirs2.html.dialogue: I know I'm a kid and you'd think I DEFINITELY know how to make bombs, but I've never learned either.

random/souvenirs2.html.speaker: Isabeau
random/souvenirs2.html.dialogue: O-oh...

random/souvenirs2.html.speaker: Isabeau
random/souvenirs2.html.dialogue: Um. Why?

random/souvenirs2.html.speaker: Bonnie
random/souvenirs2.html.dialogue: Za.

random/souvenirs2.html.speaker: Bonnie
random/souvenirs2.html.dialogue: We have to throw a bomb at the King.

random/souvenirs2.html.speaker: Bonnie
random/souvenirs2.html.dialogue: It'd be so funny.

random/souvenirs2.html.speaker: Mirabelle
random/souvenirs2.html.dialogue: WHAT?!!!?

random/souvenirs2.html.speaker: Isabeau
random/souvenirs2.html.dialogue: Yes. It would be funny.

random/souvenirs2.html.speaker: Odile
random/souvenirs2.html.dialogue: It would. What else do we need?

random/souvenirs2.html.speaker: Isabeau
random/souvenirs2.html.dialogue: Your roommate has some stuff already, so we just need...
(Isabeau starts explaining what you need with very confusing words!)

random/souvenirs2.html.speaker: Odile
random/souvenirs2.html.dialogue: ...What?

random/souvenirs2.html.speaker: Bonnie
random/souvenirs2.html.dialogue: Use simpler words, Za.

random/souvenirs2.html.speaker: Isabeau
random/souvenirs2.html.dialogue: Um...

random/souvenirs2.html.speaker: Isabeau
random/souvenirs2.html.dialogue: There's already a short gizmo-gadget here, so we just need a long thingy-thing, and a secret ingredient.

random/souvenirs2.html.speaker: Bonnie
random/souvenirs2.html.dialogue: Oh, okay. Makes sense.

random/souvenirs2.html.speaker: Odile
random/souvenirs2.html.dialogue: It doesn't--

random/souvenirs2.html.speaker: Bonnie
random/souvenirs2.html.dialogue: TIME TO FIND THOSE THINGS!!!
(You got the SHORT GIZMO-GADGET!)
(You put the short gizmo-gadget in your pocket along with your Souvenirs.)
(You look at the short gizmo-gadget.)
(What could this be for...?)
(If you had a long thingy-thing and a secret ingredient, you might be able to make a bomb...)

rooms/dormont/beautifulhouse.html.speaker: Beautiful One
rooms/dormont/beautifulhouse.html.dialogue: Oh... Hello, traveler!

rooms/dormont/beautifulhouse.html.speaker: Beautiful One
rooms/dormont/beautifulhouse.html.dialogue: I hope the smell in here isn't too overpowering... I'm cooking a lot of different things for tomorrow.

rooms/dormont/beautifulhouse.html.speaker: Beautiful One
rooms/dormont/beautifulhouse.html.dialogue: All of us in Dormont talked a few days back, and we decided that while you'll be exploring the House to fight the King...

rooms/dormont/beautifulhouse.html.speaker: Beautiful One
rooms/dormont/beautifulhouse.html.dialogue: Everyone in the village will be partying!

rooms/dormont/beautifulhouse.html.speaker: Beautiful One
rooms/dormont/beautifulhouse.html.dialogue: That way, if you win, we'll already have the party in full swing, but if you don't, and we all get frozen by the King's Curse...

rooms/dormont/beautifulhouse.html.speaker: Beautiful One
rooms/dormont/beautifulhouse.html.dialogue: We'll be frozen in time, but at least, we'll be happy.
(Still a weird thing to do, you think.)

rooms/dormont/beautifulhouse.html.speaker: Siffrin
rooms/dormont/beautifulhouse.html.dialogue: (A party...)

rooms/dormont/beautifulhouse.html.speaker: Siffrin
rooms/dormont/beautifulhouse.html.dialogue: (A party.)

rooms/dormont/beautifulhouse.html.speaker: Beautiful One
rooms/dormont/beautifulhouse.html.dialogue: Ha, I can tell you find that weird!

rooms/dormont/beautifulhouse.html.speaker: Beautiful One
rooms/dormont/beautifulhouse.html.dialogue: Even if the end is coming for us, it's still a new form of Change!

rooms/dormont/beautifulhouse.html.speaker: Beautiful One
rooms/dormont/beautifulhouse.html.dialogue: And any type of Change deserves to be celebrated!
(...Vaugarde is so weird.)

rooms/dormont/beautifulhouse.html.speaker: Beautiful One
rooms/dormont/beautifulhouse.html.dialogue: Ha! Well...

rooms/dormont/beautifulhouse.html.speaker: Beautiful One
rooms/dormont/beautifulhouse.html.dialogue: Yes. It is.
(...Vaugarde is so weird.)

rooms/dormont/beautifulhouse.html.speaker: Beautiful One
rooms/dormont/beautifulhouse.html.dialogue: Cowards?

rooms/dormont/beautifulhouse.html.speaker: Beautiful One
rooms/dormont/beautifulhouse.html.dialogue: Because we want to grasp whatever happiness we can, in the face of death?

rooms/dormont/beautifulhouse.html.speaker: Beautiful One
rooms/dormont/beautifulhouse.html.dialogue: We can't help you. None of us are skilled enough to fight.

rooms/dormont/beautifulhouse.html.speaker: Beautiful One
rooms/dormont/beautifulhouse.html.dialogue: Is it bad for us to want to find happiness in this last, final Change in our lives...?
(You need to ask...)

rooms/dormont/beautifulhouse.html.speaker: Beautiful One
rooms/dormont/beautifulhouse.html.dialogue: The Tree, huh...

rooms/dormont/beautifulhouse.html.speaker: Beautiful One
rooms/dormont/beautifulhouse.html.dialogue: I asked for everyone in Dormont to have a good time, tomorrow.

rooms/dormont/beautifulhouse.html.speaker: Beautiful One
rooms/dormont/beautifulhouse.html.dialogue: Ah... So much to cook still...

rooms/dormont/beautifulhouse.html.speaker: Beautiful One
rooms/dormont/beautifulhouse.html.dialogue: Oh, and you found the familytale book, too! I'm glad, I'm glad...
(Beautiful cutlery.)
(...Oh? There's a broken griddle pan in there... You didn't notice it before.)

rooms/dormont/beautifulhouse.html.speaker: Beautiful One
rooms/dormont/beautifulhouse.html.dialogue: Ah, this? I've been meaning to throw it out... Do you want it?
(Bonnie might like one of those, even if it's broken...)
(You nod.)
(You got a GRIDDLE PAN!)
(You put the Griddle Pan in your Pockets for Bonnie to equip later.)
(A kitchen station.)
(Whatever they're cooking, it smells heavenly.)
(Shelves filled with various foods.)
(Being near them makes your stomach grumble...)
(Some recipes.)

rooms/dormont/beautifulhouse.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/dormont/beautifulhouse.html.dialogue: Hm... Think we should look at those for Boniface?
(Some Crafted paintings of various meals.)
(Piles of plates.)

rooms/dormont/beautifulhouse.html.speaker: Beautiful One
rooms/dormont/beautifulhouse.html.dialogue: Oh... Hello!

rooms/dormont/beautifulhouse.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/dormont/beautifulhouse.html.dialogue: Antoine, is it?

rooms/dormont/beautifulhouse.html.speaker: Beautiful One
rooms/dormont/beautifulhouse.html.dialogue: That sure is me. And you're two of the saviors, aren't you...?

rooms/dormont/beautifulhouse.html.speaker: Beautiful One
rooms/dormont/beautifulhouse.html.dialogue: Thank you for all you're doing. Best of luck for tomorrow.

rooms/dormont/beautifulhouse.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/dormont/beautifulhouse.html.dialogue: ...Thank you. We had a favor to ask...

rooms/dormont/beautifulhouse.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/dormont/beautifulhouse.html.dialogue: Could we borrow the familytale you possess? For an hour, maybe?

rooms/dormont/beautifulhouse.html.speaker: Beautiful One
rooms/dormont/beautifulhouse.html.dialogue: ...Oh, the Paperasse familytale...

rooms/dormont/beautifulhouse.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/dormont/beautifulhouse.html.dialogue: ...  I know this means a lot to you, so--

rooms/dormont/beautifulhouse.html.speaker: Beautiful One
rooms/dormont/beautifulhouse.html.dialogue: Oh, no, that's not the problem, I'd be happy to lend it to you. But, well...

rooms/dormont/beautifulhouse.html.speaker: Beautiful One
rooms/dormont/beautifulhouse.html.dialogue: I think one of the kids next door stole it from me?
(What.)
(This would've been so much faster if you asked the daughter beforehand.)

rooms/dormont/beautifulhouse.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/dormont/beautifulhouse.html.dialogue: What.

rooms/dormont/beautifulhouse.html.speaker: Beautiful One
rooms/dormont/beautifulhouse.html.dialogue: O-oh, I'm not saying they're bad kids!!! They're very nice kids!!! Very nice!!!

rooms/dormont/beautifulhouse.html.speaker: Beautiful One
rooms/dormont/beautifulhouse.html.dialogue: They just. Well. You know the three kids outside?

rooms/dormont/beautifulhouse.html.speaker: Beautiful One
rooms/dormont/beautifulhouse.html.dialogue: A few weeks ago, they passed by to help me cook some things, and, well... The book is gone, now.

rooms/dormont/beautifulhouse.html.speaker: Beautiful One
rooms/dormont/beautifulhouse.html.dialogue: Good luck...?
(No point going in there.)
(You know where the familytale is.)

rooms/dormont/bonnietalk.html.dialogue: (Bonnie is here, looking morosely at the fields.)
(Do you think one day Bonnie will be able to look at you in the eye?)

rooms/dormont/bonnietalk.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/dormont/bonnietalk.html.dialogue: Are you okay? You look very very VERY tired.
[You don't need to talk to your allies about things you've already talked about, but the option is still here just in case you need a refresher!]

rooms/dormont/bonnietalk.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/dormont/bonnietalk.html.dialogue: You look bummed out. What's wrong?
(You have to go and see Loop.)

rooms/dormont/bonnietalk.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/dormont/bonnietalk.html.dialogue: Oh. Then it's a great idea, why didn't you come up with it?
(Stars, you do NOT know how to deal with Bonnie anymore.)

rooms/dormont/bonnietalk.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/dormont/bonnietalk.html.dialogue: And anyway, I don't need to worry about her.

rooms/dormont/bonnietalk.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/dormont/bonnietalk.html.dialogue: ...It's not like she's gonna move from her spot.
(Bonnie's sister is in Bambouche, a coastal village hundreds of kilometers from here.)
(A few months ago, the King froze their whole village in time.)
(Unless you manage to beat the King tomorrow, Bonnie's sister will never move again...)

rooms/dormont/bonnietalk.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/dormont/bonnietalk.html.dialogue: I'll go and see my sister in Bambouche, duh.

rooms/dormont/bonnietalk.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/dormont/bonnietalk.html.dialogue: And then I'll tell her I really really tried.

rooms/dormont/bonnietalk.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/dormont/bonnietalk.html.dialogue: And then you won't be here anyway, so you won't be here to ask me stupid questions, you crab!!!!

rooms/dormont/bonnietalk.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/dormont/bonnietalk.html.dialogue: What about you, anyway? What will you do?

rooms/dormont/bonnietalk.html.speaker: Siffrin
rooms/dormont/bonnietalk.html.dialogue: (What will you do...?) "I'll go to space."

rooms/dormont/bonnietalk.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/dormont/bonnietalk.html.dialogue: "Space" sounds lame. I bet you can't even go there anyway.

rooms/dormont/bonnietalk.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/dormont/bonnietalk.html.dialogue: ...This is why I don't like you, Siffrin.

rooms/dormont/bonnietalk.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/dormont/bonnietalk.html.dialogue: Just a second ago, I saw, like, the BIGGEST bee.
(Bonnie makes a fist, and points to it to show you that yeah, that's how big it was.)
(Oh, that's pretty good actually. Why didn't you come up with it.)
(You act as if you're sad you didn't come up with it.)
(Bonnie sees your crestfallen face and snickers.)

rooms/dormont/bonnietalk.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/dormont/bonnietalk.html.dialogue: What? Like a bee? This sucks. Your pun sucks.

rooms/dormont/bonnietalk.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/dormont/bonnietalk.html.dialogue: I don't want you to help me with anything!!!

rooms/dormont/bonnietalk.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/dormont/bonnietalk.html.dialogue: I don't! You're stupid and you don't know me, so I don't want you to help me!

rooms/dormont/bonnietalk.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/dormont/bonnietalk.html.dialogue: You really don't! Not even a little bit!

rooms/dormont/bonnietalk.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/dormont/bonnietalk.html.dialogue: You don't even know my three favorite foods, stupid!!!

rooms/dormont/bonnietalk.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/dormont/bonnietalk.html.dialogue: Wait, you're making fun of me!!!

rooms/dormont/bonnietalk.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/dormont/bonnietalk.html.dialogue: See, that's also why!!! Why I don't wanna talk to you!!!
(...   Okay, this is a silly idea, but what if you COULD prove you do know their favorite food...)

rooms/dormont/bonnietalk.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/dormont/bonnietalk.html.dialogue: Yeah, I bet you don't even know that!!! Which samosas are my favorite, stupid!!!!

rooms/dormont/bonnietalk.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/dormont/bonnietalk.html.dialogue: Y-Yeah...  That's all my favorite foods...

rooms/dormont/bonnietalk.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/dormont/bonnietalk.html.dialogue: If you remembered them all, you...

rooms/dormont/bonnietalk.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/dormont/bonnietalk.html.dialogue: You... Do... Pay attention to me...?

rooms/dormont/bonnietalk.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/dormont/bonnietalk.html.dialogue: No, that's stupid, of course you do.  Or else you wouldn't have...

rooms/dormont/bonnietalk.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/dormont/bonnietalk.html.dialogue: There's something you can help me with. Can you come with me?
[You don't REALLY have to go through this whole thing again. You can just zone through it, and skip it completely, if you'd like.]
[You'll even still get their cool skill! But if you do, the skill will be a tiny bit less useful. Your choice!]

rooms/dormont/bonnietalk.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/dormont/bonnietalk.html.dialogue: Okay. But come back soon, yeah?

rooms/dormont/bonnietalk.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/dormont/bonnietalk.html.dialogue: I don't want you to help me with anything.
(You don't think Bonnie will let you guess again this loop.)

rooms/dormont/bonnietalk.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/dormont/bonnietalk.html.dialogue: I don't want your help, stupid.
(You won't be able to help Bonnie this loop, it seems.)

rooms/dormont/bonnietalk.html.speaker: Siffrin
rooms/dormont/bonnietalk.html.dialogue: (Uh.) "Don't you want to play with them?"

rooms/dormont/bonnietalk.html.speaker: Siffrin
rooms/dormont/bonnietalk.html.dialogue: (Aren't they the same age as Bonnie...?)

rooms/dormont/bonnietalk.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/dormont/bonnietalk.html.dialogue: I'm not a baby, I'm a PRETEEN!!!!!
(You do not say a single word.)

rooms/dormont/bonnietalk.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/dormont/bonnietalk.html.dialogue: Well I heard you think it!!!!!
(Bonnie hesitantly takes the flower, and stares at it intently.)

rooms/dormont/bonnietalk.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/dormont/bonnietalk.html.dialogue: And why do you look so tired?

rooms/dormont/bonnietalk.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/dormont/bonnietalk.html.dialogue: Did you not take a nap like you said you would?

rooms/dormont/bonnietalk.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/dormont/bonnietalk.html.dialogue: Yeah? Like, two hours ago, you said you'd go and take a nap, and to come get you if we needed something.

rooms/dormont/bonnietalk.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/dormont/bonnietalk.html.dialogue: Then did you have a nightmare?

rooms/dormont/bonnietalk.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/dormont/bonnietalk.html.dialogue: How can you "guess" you got a nightmare?

rooms/dormont/bonnietalk.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/dormont/bonnietalk.html.dialogue: Either you had a nightmare or you didn't.

rooms/dormont/bonnietalk.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/dormont/bonnietalk.html.dialogue: Belle says it's better to talk about your nightmares so they're out there and not in your brain.

rooms/dormont/bonnietalk.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/dormont/bonnietalk.html.dialogue: Was it a someone or a something?

rooms/dormont/bonnietalk.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/dormont/bonnietalk.html.dialogue: If it's a something then there's nothing you can do.

rooms/dormont/bonnietalk.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/dormont/bonnietalk.html.dialogue: But if it's a someone you could've tried talking to it.
(Last time you talked to someone that scared you, something worse than a nightmare happened.)

rooms/dormont/bonnietalk.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/dormont/bonnietalk.html.dialogue: Then why do you look like how my sister did when I woke her up in the middle of the night to play a board game?

rooms/dormont/bonnietalk.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/dormont/bonnietalk.html.dialogue: Here, here, I have some peanuts!!!
(Bonnie gives you a massive amount of peanuts.)
(You feel just as hungry as before.)
(Bonnie ends this conversation the exact same way, whether or not you said had a nightmare.)
(You cross Bonnie from the Reminder Note.)

rooms/dormont/boulangerie.html.dialogue: (You'd like to, but can't buy much with only a silver coin...)

rooms/dormont/boulangerie.html.speaker: Big Boulanger
rooms/dormont/boulangerie.html.dialogue: With one of those, you can get... A third of a pastry.

rooms/dormont/boulangerie.html.speaker: Big Boulanger
rooms/dormont/boulangerie.html.dialogue: But. Aren't you one of the saviors? Traveling with little Mirabelle?

rooms/dormont/boulangerie.html.speaker: Big Boulanger
rooms/dormont/boulangerie.html.dialogue: Don't worry about a thing, then. Can I get you anything, on the house? A croissant, maybe?

rooms/dormont/boulangerie.html.speaker: Big Boulanger
rooms/dormont/boulangerie.html.dialogue: ...Incredible. Incredible. I've never seen anyone give such a look of disdain when offered a croissant.

rooms/dormont/boulangerie.html.speaker: Big Boulanger
rooms/dormont/boulangerie.html.dialogue: A pain au chocolat, then. Only monsters don't like pain au chocolat.

rooms/dormont/boulangerie.html.speaker: Big Boulanger
rooms/dormont/boulangerie.html.dialogue: Don't worry about a thing, then. Can I get you anything, on the house?
(Wait... He offered you a croissant last time, didn't he?!)
(No, no, no. You have to ask for a pain au chocolat, quick.)
(Not a croissant, not a croissant, not a croissant.)

rooms/dormont/boulangerie.html.speaker: Big Boulanger
rooms/dormont/boulangerie.html.dialogue: Sure, but... I'm actually known for my delicious buttery croissants, if you want one instead.
(You shake your head side to side furiously.)

rooms/dormont/boulangerie.html.speaker: Big Boulanger
rooms/dormont/boulangerie.html.dialogue: ...Incredible. Incredible. I've never seen anyone give such a look of disdain when offered a croissant.
(You just don't want to think about the last time you bought a croissant.)

rooms/dormont/boulangerie.html.speaker: Big Boulanger
rooms/dormont/boulangerie.html.dialogue: Ha. One pain au chocolat, coming up.
(You think about putting it in your pocket for later, but it smells so wonderful...)
(Still warm... It smells like butter and chocolate.)
(You try to control yourself and take only a small, dainty bite...)
(But it's too yummy!!! In two bites, you've already swallowed the pastry whole.)

rooms/dormont/boulangerie.html.speaker: Big Boulanger
rooms/dormont/boulangerie.html.dialogue: Not gonna lie. Seeing a tiny one like you eat this like a rabid beast... That was disturbing, but also weirdly satisfying.
(You don't even think about keeping it for later, and devour the pain au chocolat in two bites.)

rooms/dormont/boulangerie.html.speaker: Big Boulanger
rooms/dormont/boulangerie.html.dialogue: I asked the Tree to save my daughter.

rooms/dormont/boulangerie.html.speaker: Big Boulanger
rooms/dormont/boulangerie.html.dialogue: My little girl... I don't usually let her in here. Too many dangerous things.

rooms/dormont/boulangerie.html.speaker: Big Boulanger
rooms/dormont/boulangerie.html.dialogue: But she says it's her dream to work with me in the Boulangerie, and. She might not. Be able to.

rooms/dormont/boulangerie.html.speaker: Big Boulanger
rooms/dormont/boulangerie.html.dialogue: ...Sorry about earlier. I'm glad you ended up finding the book.

rooms/dormont/boulangerie.html.speaker: Big Boulanger
rooms/dormont/boulangerie.html.dialogue: But. Aren't you one of the saviors? Traveling with little Mirabelle?
(You point at a pain au chocolat.)

rooms/dormont/boulangerie.html.speaker: Big Boulanger
rooms/dormont/boulangerie.html.dialogue: And... Take care of yourself, alright?

rooms/dormont/boulangerie.html.speaker: Small Boulangère
rooms/dormont/boulangerie.html.dialogue: I asked for a pile of croissants!!!

rooms/dormont/boulangerie.html.speaker: Small Boulangère
rooms/dormont/boulangerie.html.dialogue: You look like you're hungry... You should buy something!!!
(A little figure of the Change God.)
(This one has clumsily drawn eyes, and a drawn baguette for a mouth.)

rooms/dormont/boulangerie.html.speaker: Small Boulangère
rooms/dormont/boulangerie.html.dialogue: I made it!!! I made it myself!!!
(You refuse to even look at them.)

rooms/dormont/boulangerie.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/dormont/boulangerie.html.dialogue: Croissants, huh... You really started hating them for no reason a few weeks ago, didn't you?

rooms/dormont/boulangerie.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/dormont/boulangerie.html.dialogue: ...Hello. We've heard you may have a familytale...?

rooms/dormont/boulangerie.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/dormont/boulangerie.html.dialogue: Of a family called Paperasse. If you'd be okay with it, I'd like to borrow it for a little bit...

rooms/dormont/boulangerie.html.speaker: Big Boulanger
rooms/dormont/boulangerie.html.dialogue: Ah, the one I borrowed for my girl before the House froze.

rooms/dormont/boulangerie.html.speaker: Big Boulanger
rooms/dormont/boulangerie.html.dialogue: I'm not a very good writer, ha... So I figured reading another one would give me some inspiration for stories to tell my little girl.

rooms/dormont/boulangerie.html.speaker: Big Boulanger
rooms/dormont/boulangerie.html.dialogue: Do you know Antoine, maybe? He lives at the east of town, in the house with no flowers, asked if he could borrow it.

rooms/dormont/boulangerie.html.speaker: Big Boulanger
rooms/dormont/boulangerie.html.dialogue: They knew the Paperasse family, you see.

rooms/dormont/boulangerie.html.speaker: Big Boulanger
rooms/dormont/boulangerie.html.dialogue: I couldn't really refuse. The Paperasse family died only a few years back, after all.

rooms/dormont/boulangerie.html.speaker: Big Boulanger
rooms/dormont/boulangerie.html.dialogue: I don't see why they wouldn't.

rooms/dormont/boulangerie.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/dormont/boulangerie.html.dialogue: ...I have a sudden bad feeling about this.

rooms/dormont/boulangerie.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/dormont/boulangerie.html.dialogue: The house to the east of the village, with no flowers, huh? Looks like we should go pay them a visit...

rooms/dormont/boulangerie.html.speaker: Big Boulanger
rooms/dormont/boulangerie.html.dialogue: My friend Antoine, who lives at the east of town, in the house with no flowers, asked if he could borrow that familytale.

rooms/dormont/boulangerie.html.speaker: Siffrin
rooms/dormont/boulangerie.html.dialogue: "What about you? Do you know where the book is?"

rooms/dormont/boulangerie.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/dormont/boulangerie.html.dialogue: Siffrin, we've just heard they don't have it. Let's go see this Antoine person alrea-

rooms/dormont/boulangerie.html.speaker: Small Boulangère
rooms/dormont/boulangerie.html.dialogue: This is the only book I have!
(She happily shows off the Paperasse familytale.)

rooms/dormont/boulangerie.html.speaker: Big Boulanger
rooms/dormont/boulangerie.html.dialogue: Well, I suppose you two can borrow it now.

rooms/dormont/boulangerie.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/dormont/boulangerie.html.dialogue: Thank you both. We'll give it back shortly.

rooms/dormont/boulangerie.html.speaker: Big Boulanger
rooms/dormont/boulangerie.html.dialogue: Hey.  Please do not scare my daughter, madame.
(You get in front of Odile, and smile at the girl.)

rooms/dormont/boulangerie.html.speaker: Small Boulangère
rooms/dormont/boulangerie.html.dialogue: Oh! Oh, oh, oh, yes!!! From Manon!!!

rooms/dormont/boulangerie.html.speaker: Small Boulangère
rooms/dormont/boulangerie.html.dialogue: Manon is so nice!!! She gave me the book!!! The book with the nice stories!!!

rooms/dormont/boulangerie.html.speaker: Small Boulangère
rooms/dormont/boulangerie.html.dialogue: Dad was reading it and now it's mine and I can read it all by myself!!!

rooms/dormont/boulangerie.html.speaker: Small Boulangère
rooms/dormont/boulangerie.html.dialogue: But it's boring. I want another book, Papa.

rooms/dormont/boulangerie.html.speaker: Big Boulanger
rooms/dormont/boulangerie.html.dialogue: ...Wait, which book are you talking about, Charline?
(She shows you all a book with "Paperasse Familytale" written across it.)

rooms/dormont/castlehouse.html.speaker: Castle-Loving One
rooms/dormont/castlehouse.html.dialogue: Y'know... The end of the world is fine and all... But I only have one regret...

rooms/dormont/castlehouse.html.speaker: Castle-Loving One
rooms/dormont/castlehouse.html.dialogue:
I WON'T BE ABLE TO KNOW WHAT HAPPENS
TO LORD JOSÉPHANDRE IN THE FINAL ISSUE OF "THE CURSING OF CHÂTEAU CASTLE"!

rooms/dormont/castlehouse.html.speaker: Castle-Loving One
rooms/dormont/castlehouse.html.dialogue: Did he manage to protect his castle to the very end?!? Did he finally find his friend Pierre-Jacques-Erneste, did he finally find more about himself?!?

rooms/dormont/castlehouse.html.speaker: Castle-Loving One
rooms/dormont/castlehouse.html.dialogue: Oh... I'll never know...
(Is that really what they're worrying about today...? A book series? Not their imminent death or anything?)
(Weird.)
(You didn't really care about their problem before, but...)
("The Cursing of Château Castle", is it? Interesting...)
(Maybe you could find the last issue for them?)
(The last one you've seen is...)

rooms/dormont/castlehouse.html.speaker: Castle-Loving One
rooms/dormont/castlehouse.html.dialogue: No... Of course not. Why would I be into a series with only three issues?!?

rooms/dormont/castlehouse.html.speaker: Castle-Loving One
rooms/dormont/castlehouse.html.dialogue: No... That's the issue where Pierre-Jacques-Erneste made his big appearance, though. What a great issue...

rooms/dormont/castlehouse.html.speaker: Castle-Loving One
rooms/dormont/castlehouse.html.dialogue: No... That's when Lord Joséphandre ate his whole weight in donuts, transporting him to another world as like, some kind of filler plot?

rooms/dormont/castlehouse.html.speaker: Castle-Loving One
rooms/dormont/castlehouse.html.dialogue: It wasn't very good.

rooms/dormont/castlehouse.html.speaker: Castle-Loving One
rooms/dormont/castlehouse.html.dialogue: No... That's when Lady Irene-Janine-Karine finally joined the party, though! She's such a good character...

rooms/dormont/castlehouse.html.speaker: Castle-Loving One
rooms/dormont/castlehouse.html.dialogue: It wasn't very good.

rooms/dormont/castlehouse.html.speaker: Castle-Loving One
rooms/dormont/castlehouse.html.dialogue: It sucks. No one likes it.

rooms/dormont/castlehouse.html.speaker: Castle-Loving One
rooms/dormont/castlehouse.html.dialogue: No... That's when Pierre-Jacques-Erneste betrayed the whole party!!! What a turn of events!!! Oh...

rooms/dormont/castlehouse.html.speaker: Castle-Loving One
rooms/dormont/castlehouse.html.dialogue:
No... That's when Pierre-Jacques-Erneste, in an act of self-sacrifice, destroyed his castle to save Lord Josephandre!!!
<!-- sic -->
Oh...

rooms/dormont/castlehouse.html.speaker: Castle-Loving One
rooms/dormont/castlehouse.html.dialogue: ...  Is it?

rooms/dormont/castlehouse.html.speaker: Castle-Loving One
rooms/dormont/castlehouse.html.dialogue: No, it's not. That was when Lord Joséphandre was about to reveal his true lineage.

rooms/dormont/castlehouse.html.speaker: Castle-Loving One
rooms/dormont/castlehouse.html.dialogue: And see!!! This is what I want!!! I want the rest!!! What IS his true lineage!!! Oh...

rooms/dormont/castlehouse.html.speaker: Castle-Loving One
rooms/dormont/castlehouse.html.dialogue: ...That's...

rooms/dormont/castlehouse.html.speaker: Castle-Loving One
rooms/dormont/castlehouse.html.dialogue: THAT'S IT!!!!! THAT'S THE ONE!!!!!!!!!!
(Oh!)

rooms/dormont/castlehouse.html.speaker: Castle-Loving One
rooms/dormont/castlehouse.html.dialogue: Oh, please tell me, what happens in this issue!!! Please, you have to tell me!!!!!!!!
(Oh.)
(You didn't read it.)
(You awkwardly smile.)

rooms/dormont/castlehouse.html.speaker: Castle-Loving One
rooms/dormont/castlehouse.html.dialogue: I will never forgive you for the emotional journey you've just given me.
(That's fair.)
(Time to go back and read it...)
(You know how it ends, though.)
(You can tell him in the next loop.)

rooms/dormont/castlehouse.html.speaker: Castle-Loving One
rooms/dormont/castlehouse.html.dialogue: What? No, that's a lie. I think you're lying to me right now.
(You explain the contents of issue #87, as best you can...)

rooms/dormont/castlehouse.html.speaker: Castle-Loving One
rooms/dormont/castlehouse.html.dialogue: What? Lord Joséphandre is just a guy?

rooms/dormont/castlehouse.html.speaker: Castle-Loving One
rooms/dormont/castlehouse.html.dialogue: That's...

rooms/dormont/castlehouse.html.speaker: Castle-Loving One
rooms/dormont/castlehouse.html.dialogue: THAT'S AN ENDING BETTER THAN MY WILDEST DREAMS!!!

rooms/dormont/castlehouse.html.speaker: Castle-Loving One
rooms/dormont/castlehouse.html.dialogue: He was just a guy... He was just a guy...!!!

rooms/dormont/castlehouse.html.speaker: Castle-Loving One
rooms/dormont/castlehouse.html.dialogue: He saved so many people, made the world a better place, and everyone thought it was because of who he was, of his past, but...

rooms/dormont/castlehouse.html.speaker: Castle-Loving One
rooms/dormont/castlehouse.html.dialogue: But he was just a guy...!!!
(Uh oh, tears are coming out!!!)
(Before you can try to figure out how to respond, they've already taken out a lovely handkerchief and blown their nose into it.)

rooms/dormont/castlehouse.html.speaker: Castle-Loving One
rooms/dormont/castlehouse.html.dialogue: Thank you. I... I'm so glad I got to know this, before...

rooms/dormont/castlehouse.html.speaker: Castle-Loving One
rooms/dormont/castlehouse.html.dialogue: Here, take this.
(You got the FIRST ISSUE!)
(You put the First Issue in your pocket for Odile to equip later.)

rooms/dormont/castlehouse.html.speaker: Castle-Loving One
rooms/dormont/castlehouse.html.dialogue: Here, take thi--

rooms/dormont/castlehouse.html.speaker: Castle-Loving One
rooms/dormont/castlehouse.html.dialogue: ...Huh?

rooms/dormont/castlehouse.html.speaker: Castle-Loving One
rooms/dormont/castlehouse.html.dialogue: Um, I wanted to give you something, but... I can't...

rooms/dormont/castlehouse.html.speaker: Castle-Loving One
rooms/dormont/castlehouse.html.dialogue: Knowing the final issue's contents must've shocked me more than I thought.

rooms/dormont/castlehouse.html.speaker: Castle-Loving One
rooms/dormont/castlehouse.html.dialogue: Now... Can you please leave? I need to lay in bed and think about this ending.
(You need to ask...)

rooms/dormont/castlehouse.html.speaker: Castle-Loving One
rooms/dormont/castlehouse.html.dialogue: What I asked the Favor Tree?

rooms/dormont/castlehouse.html.speaker: Castle-Loving One
rooms/dormont/castlehouse.html.dialogue: Ha... Do you even need to ask?
(You guess not.)

rooms/dormont/castlehouse.html.speaker: Castle-Loving One
rooms/dormont/castlehouse.html.dialogue: Oh, Lord Joséphandre... I hope you're okay...

rooms/dormont/castlehouse.html.speaker: Castle-Loving One
rooms/dormont/castlehouse.html.dialogue: Lord Joséphandre...

rooms/dormont/castlehouse.html.speaker: Castle-Loving One
rooms/dormont/castlehouse.html.dialogue: No... Just... "Joséphandre."
(The bookcase is filled with a series of novels called "The Cursing of Château Castle".)
(You've seen Mirabelle read one issue, so you assume the series is about romance  and also about terrible things happening to good people.)
(A pile of notes explaining the themes and hidden easter eggs in the series "The Cursing of Château Castle".)
(You can see even more books peeking from under the bed.)

rooms/dormont/center.html.dialogue: [Oh, also, also!]
[There's a lot of people to talk to and drawers to snoop inside of around here. You can interact with people and objects by pressing [button] when standing in front of them.]
[If you need to, you can always configure your button settings in the Options menu!]
(Ah... You heard the villagers talk about this.)
(A very dangerous fruit which, if approached, will spell your doom...)
(...This is just a banana peel. Do bananas even grow here...?)
(The banana peel lays here, menacingly.)
(The banana peels lays here.)
(The scent of the banana peel makes you want to throw up.)
(...But wait, instead of a banana peel, could it be...)
(A plantain peel...?)
(Whatever. Plantains are just bananas that taste bad.)
(This is a banana peel to you, now and forevermore.)
(Step closer?)
(You decide to step closer.)
(Here we go...)
(You take a step forward.)
(You do not step closer to the dangerous forbidden fruit.)
(You take a step back.)
(You would rather not die today, so you leave the banana peel alone.)
(Not right now.)
(You need to talk to Mirabelle first.)
(Not right now.)
(Stepping on it isn't in the stage directions.)

rooms/dormont/center.html.speaker: Daydreaming One
rooms/dormont/center.html.dialogue: Hm... Hu-hu-hum...
(The woman is daydreaming, singing softly under her breath.)
(She sings softly, her mind elsewhere.)
(Since everything got reset, you could ask her about someone else this time...?)
(Something's weird about her.)
(Some loops, she mentions her sister, and others, she says she's an only child...)
(You should ask her about Isabeau or Odile...)

rooms/dormont/center.html.speaker: Daydreaming One
rooms/dormont/center.html.dialogue: Oh, hi! You're one of the saviors, aren't you! I recognize you!

rooms/dormont/center.html.speaker: Daydreaming One
rooms/dormont/center.html.dialogue: And you traveled with a few people, right! You traveled with, um...

rooms/dormont/center.html.speaker: Daydreaming One
rooms/dormont/center.html.dialogue: Mirabelle!!! I know her, she's from here!!!

rooms/dormont/center.html.speaker: Daydreaming One
rooms/dormont/center.html.dialogue: What a wonderful young woman. I never talked to her much, though!

rooms/dormont/center.html.speaker: Daydreaming One
rooms/dormont/center.html.dialogue: Hm, I wonder though... Is she the younger or older sister of your group? She'd fit both, wouldn't she?
(You laugh awkwardly.)
(You smile awkwardly.)
(You don't react.)

rooms/dormont/center.html.speaker: Daydreaming One
rooms/dormont/center.html.dialogue: Isabeau!!!

rooms/dormont/center.html.speaker: Daydreaming One
rooms/dormont/center.html.dialogue: What a nice young man. And so full of energy, too!

rooms/dormont/center.html.speaker: Daydreaming One
rooms/dormont/center.html.dialogue: I'm an only child, but I feel like having an older brother like him would be fun.
(Something feels weird.)
(When you asked her about Odile, didn't she tell you she had a sister?)
(But this loop, she says she's an only child...?)

rooms/dormont/center.html.speaker: Siffrin
rooms/dormont/center.html.dialogue: (...) "Don't you have a sister?"

rooms/dormont/center.html.speaker: Daydreaming One
rooms/dormont/center.html.dialogue: I... I don't? I just said I'm an only child, silly!
(You want to ask her more, but she's already back to her daydream.)
(She can't remember her sister's name, but...)
(Isn't that because her sister went to...)
(...)
(You stop thinking about it.)

rooms/dormont/center.html.speaker: Daydreaming One
rooms/dormont/center.html.dialogue: Yes, Odile!

rooms/dormont/center.html.speaker: Daydreaming One
rooms/dormont/center.html.dialogue: She's from Ka Bue, yes? My sister visited Ka Bue, once.

rooms/dormont/center.html.speaker: Daydreaming One
rooms/dormont/center.html.dialogue: Did you know they call most people by their last names? Such a different culture!

rooms/dormont/center.html.speaker: Daydreaming One
rooms/dormont/center.html.dialogue: And this Odile, hm, I can tell...

rooms/dormont/center.html.speaker: Daydreaming One
rooms/dormont/center.html.dialogue: She's like the mom of the group, isn't she?
(Ew.)
(Isabeau called Odile "Mom" jokingly once.)
(As a result, she made sure none of you would ever call her "mom", even as a joke.)
(Although she's fine with Bonnie calling her a grandma, it seems.)
(You pull a face.)
(You smile awkwardly.)
(You don't react.)
(Something feels weird.)
(When you asked her about Isabeau, didn't she tell you she was an only child?)
(But this loop, she says she has a sister...?)

rooms/dormont/center.html.speaker: Daydreaming One
rooms/dormont/center.html.dialogue: What? No, I have a sister!

rooms/dormont/center.html.speaker: Daydreaming One
rooms/dormont/center.html.dialogue: She's a few years younger than me. A few years ago she decided to travel the world, all on her own!

rooms/dormont/center.html.speaker: Daydreaming One
rooms/dormont/center.html.dialogue: She lives in another country now. Isn't that so brave? Living in a foreign country, just like that?
(You want to ask her more, but she's already back to her daydream.)

rooms/dormont/center.html.speaker: Daydreaming One
rooms/dormont/center.html.dialogue: Ah, my sister?

rooms/dormont/center.html.speaker: Daydreaming One
rooms/dormont/center.html.dialogue: She's a few years younger than me. A few years ago she decided to travel the world, all on her own!

rooms/dormont/center.html.speaker: Daydreaming One
rooms/dormont/center.html.dialogue: She lives in another country now. Isn't that so brave? Living in a foreign country, just like that?
(...)

rooms/dormont/center.html.speaker: Siffrin
rooms/dormont/center.html.dialogue: "But which country?"

rooms/dormont/center.html.speaker: Daydreaming One
rooms/dormont/center.html.dialogue: Oh, sorry! My sister now lives in...  . . .

rooms/dormont/center.html.speaker: Daydreaming One
rooms/dormont/center.html.dialogue: She lives...  In...

rooms/dormont/center.html.speaker: Daydreaming One
rooms/dormont/center.html.dialogue: ......

rooms/dormont/center.html.speaker: Daydreaming One
rooms/dormont/center.html.dialogue: My sister...  My sister...  She's my younger sister, she's weird, she's brave, she likes to sing, and I...

rooms/dormont/center.html.speaker: Daydreaming One
rooms/dormont/center.html.dialogue: I...  can't...  remember...  her name...!!!!!!!

rooms/dormont/center.html.speaker: Daydreaming One
rooms/dormont/center.html.dialogue: My sister? What sister?

rooms/dormont/center.html.speaker: Daydreaming One
rooms/dormont/center.html.dialogue: I'm an only child, you know!
(What...)
(...)

rooms/dormont/center.html.speaker: Daydreaming One
rooms/dormont/center.html.dialogue: Bonnie!!! Oh, what a cutie.

rooms/dormont/center.html.speaker: Daydreaming One
rooms/dormont/center.html.dialogue: DEFINITELY the younger sibling of your group, there's no doubt about it.
(You laugh awkwardly.)
(You smile awkwardly.)
(You don't react.)

rooms/dormont/center.html.speaker: Siffrin
rooms/dormont/center.html.dialogue: (You have to mention it...) "We're not actually a family, you know."

rooms/dormont/center.html.speaker: Daydreaming One
rooms/dormont/center.html.dialogue: Oh, I know, I know.

rooms/dormont/center.html.speaker: Daydreaming One
rooms/dormont/center.html.dialogue: This is just a fun thought exercise! I just like to think about family dynamics, and just families in general! I think that's a normal thing to do!
(...Okay?)
(Families, huh...)

rooms/dormont/center.html.speaker: Siffrin
rooms/dormont/center.html.dialogue: (...) "Having people you consider family is nice."

rooms/dormont/center.html.speaker: Daydreaming One
rooms/dormont/center.html.dialogue: It really is, isn't it?

rooms/dormont/center.html.speaker: Daydreaming One
rooms/dormont/center.html.dialogue: I hope you all get to spend more time together!
(You need to ask...)

rooms/dormont/center.html.speaker: Daydreaming One
rooms/dormont/center.html.dialogue: ...Hm? Are you wondering what I asked the Favor Tree?

rooms/dormont/center.html.speaker: Daydreaming One
rooms/dormont/center.html.dialogue: Hehe... It's a secret!
(The woman is daydreaming, singing softly under her breath.)

rooms/dormont/center.html.speaker: Daydreaming One
rooms/dormont/center.html.dialogue: Hm... Hu-hu-hum...
(You don't want to talk to her.)
(She still doesn't remember a thing.)
(You almost envy her.)
(You walk away.)
(No point going in there.)
(Either she'll be able to ask her wife which necklace she prefers later tomorrow, or she won't.)
(No point going in there.)
(Either he'll be able to know what happens in the last issue on his own later tomorrow, or he won't.)
(No point going in there.)
(You've found all the information there was to find.)
(No point going in there.)
(You already have the Stylish Ribbon, after all.)

rooms/dormont/center.html.speaker: Fishing One
rooms/dormont/center.html.dialogue: Heheheee... I am fishing.

rooms/dormont/center.html.speaker: Fishing One
rooms/dormont/center.html.dialogue: You look like someone who would like fishing.

rooms/dormont/center.html.speaker: Fishing One
rooms/dormont/center.html.dialogue: Would you like to fish for a little bit?
(You didn't catch anything last time... But maybe this time?!?)

rooms/dormont/center.html.speaker: Siffrin
rooms/dormont/center.html.dialogue: (Why not.)

rooms/dormont/center.html.speaker: Fishing One
rooms/dormont/center.html.dialogue: Heheheeee...
(Fishing, huh...)
(You don't really know how to do this.)
(You take the fishing pole they're offering you, choose a lure the same shade as the water, check the fishing pole, throw it in the water, and sit down and wait.)
(Yeah, this feels right.)
(Fishing time.)
(You didn't catch anything.)
(That's too bad.)
(Alright. This time for sure.)
(You take the fishing pole, find the same lure you used before, check the fishing pole, throw it, and sit down and wait.)
(Fishing time.)
(You didn't catch anything.)
(How did you manage to mess it up a second time?!)
(Alright.)
(Fishing time.)
(You didn't catch anything.)
(Really?!?)
(Well. Not like that was surprising.)
(Alright.)
(Fishing time.)
(You didn't catch anything.)
(But it was restful, to sit here and let your mind wander for a little bit.)
(Somehow, even though you probably won't catch anything...)
(Fishing calms you down.)
(You feel at peace.)
(...Once again, you didn't catch anything, but you're fine with it.)
(You feel like you got the chance to put your thoughts in order.)
(You got a MEMORY OF FISHING!)
(You'll always remember this.)
[When equipped, Memory of Fishing gives you +2 ATTACK for every time you've gone fishing! At the cost of ATTACK SPEED, though. Can't have everything, stardust.]
(You do the usual fishing preparations, and sit down.)
(You haven't gone fishing for long, but it already feels like something you've done forever.)
(...Once again, you didn't catch anything.)
(But it was restful.)
(But it's fine.)
(But you got stronger.)

rooms/dormont/center.html.speaker: Fishing One
rooms/dormont/center.html.dialogue: No fish, huh?
(You jump.)
(They speak?!?)

rooms/dormont/center.html.speaker: Fishing One
rooms/dormont/center.html.dialogue: Heheheee...

rooms/dormont/center.html.speaker: Fishing One
rooms/dormont/center.html.dialogue: You just started fishing with such confidence, and yet you do not even look a little bit disappointed at not catching anything.

rooms/dormont/center.html.speaker: Fishing One
rooms/dormont/center.html.dialogue: So you must've guessed.

rooms/dormont/center.html.speaker: Siffrin
rooms/dormont/center.html.dialogue: (Urgh...) "That there's no fish in this river? Yeah, I noticed.

rooms/dormont/center.html.speaker: Fishing One
rooms/dormont/center.html.dialogue: Heheheee... Sorry. I'm surprised you noticed.

rooms/dormont/center.html.speaker: Fishing One
rooms/dormont/center.html.dialogue: This river used to be plentiful, a few months ago.

rooms/dormont/center.html.speaker: Fishing One
rooms/dormont/center.html.dialogue: And then, I noticed I was catching less and less fish...

rooms/dormont/center.html.speaker: Fishing One
rooms/dormont/center.html.dialogue: Of course, this coincided with the arrival of the King.

rooms/dormont/center.html.speaker: Fishing One
rooms/dormont/center.html.dialogue: My guess is that the King's Curse froze people, yes...

rooms/dormont/center.html.speaker: Fishing One
rooms/dormont/center.html.dialogue: But it froze rivers, and the fish inside it, too.

rooms/dormont/center.html.speaker: Fishing One
rooms/dormont/center.html.dialogue: The fish upstream of Dormont must all be frozen in time by now.

rooms/dormont/center.html.speaker: Fishing One
rooms/dormont/center.html.dialogue: We also have less bugs than usual, less birds than usual. Our ecosystem is dying slowly.

rooms/dormont/center.html.speaker: Fishing One
rooms/dormont/center.html.dialogue: So even if our village was somehow left untouched by the Curse forever, we would all starve to death eventually.

rooms/dormont/center.html.speaker: Fishing One
rooms/dormont/center.html.dialogue: I hope you manage to beat the King tomorrow, so the river fish come back.
(You know nothing will bite, and yet, you fish.)
(...Once again, you didn't catch anything.)
(But it was restful.)
(But it's fine.)
(But you got stronger.)
(You can't get stronger than this, though.)

rooms/dormont/center.html.speaker: Fishing One
rooms/dormont/center.html.dialogue: Heheheeee...
(You know nothing will bite, and yet, you fish.)
(Something is tugging on your line.)
(What?)

rooms/dormont/center.html.speaker: Siffrin
rooms/dormont/center.html.dialogue:
(OH STARS) "FISH"
<!--sic on the no punctuation-->

rooms/dormont/center.html.speaker: Fishing One
rooms/dormont/center.html.dialogue: FISH?!?!

rooms/dormont/center.html.speaker: Fishing One
rooms/dormont/center.html.dialogue: REEL IT IN, QUICK!!!
(You both struggle to reel in a fish you had no idea would come, but after a while--)
(You got A FISH!!!!!!!!!!)
(It's alive, still flapping its gills uselessly.)

rooms/dormont/center.html.speaker: Fishing One
rooms/dormont/center.html.dialogue: Oh crab... You... You actually caught something...

rooms/dormont/center.html.speaker: Fishing One
rooms/dormont/center.html.dialogue: In this river...?
(You both look at the fish.)
(It's pitifully trying to survive, trying to breathe in air.)
(You throw the fish back in the water.)
(You both look as the fish swims away downstream.)

rooms/dormont/center.html.speaker: Fishing One
rooms/dormont/center.html.dialogue: Interesting, heheheee...

rooms/dormont/center.html.speaker: Fishing One
rooms/dormont/center.html.dialogue: Thank you.
(You nod.)

rooms/dormont/center.html.speaker: Fishing One
rooms/dormont/center.html.dialogue: ...Good luck, tomorrow.
(You nod again, and walk away.)

rooms/dormont/center.html.speaker: Fishing One
rooms/dormont/center.html.dialogue: Of course. Come back whenever.
(You need to ask...)

rooms/dormont/center.html.speaker: Fishing One
rooms/dormont/center.html.dialogue: ...Hm? What I asked the Favor Tree?

rooms/dormont/center.html.speaker: Fishing One
rooms/dormont/center.html.dialogue: Heheheee... I asked for Vaugarde to be saved, so I can catch some more fish.

rooms/dormont/center.html.speaker: Fishing One
rooms/dormont/center.html.dialogue: Heheheee...

rooms/dormont/center.html.speaker: Fishing One
rooms/dormont/center.html.dialogue: Heheheee... I am fishing.

rooms/dormont/center.html.speaker: Fishing One
rooms/dormont/center.html.dialogue: You look like someone who would like fishing.

rooms/dormont/center.html.speaker: Fishing One
rooms/dormont/center.html.dialogue: Would you like to fish for a little bit?

rooms/dormont/center.html.speaker: Fishing One
rooms/dormont/center.html.dialogue: You look upset... It might calm you down. Heheheee...
(You're fine.)
(You walk away.)
(The door seems to be locked.)
(Interesting... You didn't think a welcoming village like Dormont knew how to lock doors.)
(The lock keeping it closed has an interesting shape... It doesn't have a hole for a key.)
(It's locked by one of those weird locks.)
(You need to know the openphrase to be able to open it...)
(Nothing happens.)
(Nothing happens.)
(Nothing happens.)
(You leave the door alone.)

rooms/dormont/center.html.speaker: Locked One
rooms/dormont/center.html.dialogue: ...Stop.

rooms/dormont/center.html.speaker: Locked One
rooms/dormont/center.html.dialogue: STOP!!! STOP TRYING TO UNLOCK MY DOOR!!! STOP BOTHERING ME!!!

rooms/dormont/center.html.speaker: Locked One
rooms/dormont/center.html.dialogue: I don't want you to come inside! I don't want you to talk to me!

rooms/dormont/center.html.speaker: Locked One
rooms/dormont/center.html.dialogue: I don't know who you are! You could be with someone dangerous, or you could be with the King, or...

rooms/dormont/center.html.speaker: Locked One
rooms/dormont/center.html.dialogue: I-I'm not like the rest of the village!!! Acting like nothing's wrong, and planning a party knowing we might all die!!!

rooms/dormont/center.html.speaker: Locked One
rooms/dormont/center.html.dialogue: I don't want to be frozen!!! If I lock myself in, I'll be safe!!! So I'll stay in here!!! So no one can hurt me!!!

rooms/dormont/center.html.speaker: Locked One
rooms/dormont/center.html.dialogue: SO GO AWAY!!!!!!!
(The King's Curse doesn't care about locks.)
(You decide to leave them alone.)
(Isabeau is probably at the tree.)
(You shouldn't bother him...)
(Better talk to Odile and Bonnie first.)
(You also need to check the Change God's statue... Just so you can tell Mirabelle you did it.)
(You need to see if Bonnie is okay.)
(Not yet.)
(Isabeau's up ahead.)

rooms/dormont/center.html.speaker: Running One
rooms/dormont/center.html.dialogue: Oof, look at you! So scrawny!

rooms/dormont/center.html.speaker: Running One
rooms/dormont/center.html.dialogue: Scrawny one, did you know you can press [button] to run? You should give it a try sometime!

rooms/dormont/center.html.speaker: Running One
rooms/dormont/center.html.dialogue: Oh! And did you know you can turn ON "Always Run" in your Options menu? So you can run all the time?

rooms/dormont/center.html.speaker: Running One
rooms/dormont/center.html.dialogue: Did you know? Did you know about this? Did you know pressing [button] makes you run? Did you know you can run all the time by going into the Options menu? Do you run? DO YOU LIKE RUNNING?
(You knew this already, but you suppose it doesn't hurt to get a refresher.)

rooms/dormont/center.html.speaker: Running One
rooms/dormont/center.html.dialogue: DISGUSTING.

rooms/dormont/center.html.speaker: Running One
rooms/dormont/center.html.dialogue: I, I mean, understandable! You look like you've never ran a day in your life!

rooms/dormont/center.html.speaker: Running One
rooms/dormont/center.html.dialogue: So you need to BUILD UP THOSE MUSCLES! GET FAST! GET SWOLE! AND PRESS [button] TO RUN!!!!!
(Rude...)
(You may look scrawny, but you're definitely the fastest one out of your group! Hmf!)

rooms/dormont/center.html.speaker: Running One
rooms/dormont/center.html.dialogue: Good, good!

rooms/dormont/center.html.speaker: Running One
rooms/dormont/center.html.dialogue: But you should do more figurative running, and less metaphorical running!

rooms/dormont/center.html.speaker: Running One
rooms/dormont/center.html.dialogue: What I mean is, you like to run from your problems! I can see it in your face! But you need to learn to face your problems head-on, scrawny one!

rooms/dormont/center.html.speaker: Siffrin
rooms/dormont/center.html.dialogue: (Okay you need to go.)

rooms/dormont/center.html.speaker: Running One
rooms/dormont/center.html.dialogue: Wise, very wise! Goodbye, scrawny one!

rooms/dormont/center.html.speaker: Running One
rooms/dormont/center.html.dialogue: What? Sorry, the sound of my feet hitting the ground made it impossible for me to hear you just now!

rooms/dormont/center.html.speaker: Running One
rooms/dormont/center.html.dialogue: Oh, I see you walk away! Going to run a bit, huh? I understand! I will also run around! Goodbye!

rooms/dormont/center.html.speaker: Running One
rooms/dormont/center.html.dialogue: I'm glad...! Running is very important.

rooms/dormont/center.html.speaker: Running One
rooms/dormont/center.html.dialogue: You can finish things faster. You can build up your endurance. You can avoid your problems. You can escape when a sadness runs after you.

rooms/dormont/center.html.speaker: Siffrin
rooms/dormont/center.html.dialogue: (Oh?)

rooms/dormont/center.html.speaker: Siffrin
rooms/dormont/center.html.dialogue: (Oh?)

rooms/dormont/center.html.speaker: Running One
rooms/dormont/center.html.dialogue: As you should!!!

rooms/dormont/center.html.speaker: Running One
rooms/dormont/center.html.dialogue: I'm glad I have found a like-minded person today. Best of luck running in the House tomorrow!

rooms/dormont/center.html.speaker: Running One
rooms/dormont/center.html.dialogue: My kid sibling didn't know how to run very fast.

rooms/dormont/center.html.speaker: Running One
rooms/dormont/center.html.dialogue: I'm pretty fast, but... not everyone is.

rooms/dormont/center.html.speaker: Running One
rooms/dormont/center.html.dialogue: So don't be afraid to use [button] to run, okay??? We're all counting on you!!!
(You need to ask...)

rooms/dormont/center.html.speaker: Running One
rooms/dormont/center.html.dialogue: Huh? If I asked the Favor Tree for anything?

rooms/dormont/center.html.speaker: Running One
rooms/dormont/center.html.dialogue: I asked for Vaugarde to be saved, of course!

rooms/dormont/center.html.speaker: Running One
rooms/dormont/center.html.dialogue: What an interesting question! The Head Housemaiden asked me the same thing, before the House fell!
(They mutter "run run run run run run run" repeatedly under their breath.)

rooms/dormont/center.html.speaker: Running One
rooms/dormont/center.html.dialogue: Oof, look at you! So scrawny!

rooms/dormont/center.html.speaker: Running One
rooms/dormont/center.html.dialogue: Scrawny one, did you know you can press [button] to run? You should give it a try sometime!

rooms/dormont/center.html.speaker: Running One
rooms/dormont/center.html.dialogue: Oh! And did you know you can turn ON "Always Run" in your Options menu? So you can run all the time?

rooms/dormont/center.html.speaker: Running One
rooms/dormont/center.html.dialogue: Did you know? Did you know about this? Did you know pressing [button] makes you run? Did you know you can run all the time by going into the Options menu? Do you run? DO YOU LIKE RUNNING?

rooms/dormont/center.html.speaker: Siffrin
rooms/dormont/center.html.dialogue: "Yes, I KNOW."

rooms/dormont/center.html.speaker: Running One
rooms/dormont/center.html.dialogue: Oof, someone woke up cranky from their nap!

rooms/dormont/center.html.speaker: Running One
rooms/dormont/center.html.dialogue: It's okay! Running is a great way to wake yourself up!
(You run away.)

rooms/dormont/center.html.speaker: Running One
rooms/dormont/center.html.dialogue: See? Hope you wake up soon! Good luck!!!
(The sign says: "East Dormont, Clocktower".)
(The sign says: "Favor Tree".)
(The sign says: "Shop".)
(The sign says: "Library".)

rooms/dormont/center.html.speaker: Smug One
rooms/dormont/center.html.dialogue: Oh, hey, traveler.

rooms/dormont/center.html.speaker: Smug One
rooms/dormont/center.html.dialogue: You're not from Vaugarde, are you? That's the rumor, at least.

rooms/dormont/center.html.speaker: Smug One
rooms/dormont/center.html.dialogue: I'm from Poteria myself. I came to Vaugarde to further my studies, a few months ago.
(Poteria, huh?)
(You've talked to them before.)
(Well, you've been to Poteria once, so...)

rooms/dormont/center.html.speaker: Smug One
rooms/dormont/center.html.dialogue: It's nice, right? Lots of scholars, good food, welcoming people.

rooms/dormont/center.html.speaker: Smug One
rooms/dormont/center.html.dialogue: Especially their Houses of Change. They let everyone in, and aren't shy about sharing their knowledge, even if you don't follow their belief.

rooms/dormont/center.html.speaker: Smug One
rooms/dormont/center.html.dialogue: It's strange, right? I've traveled a lot, but I've never been to a country with such welcoming people. I could move here, to be honest.

rooms/dormont/center.html.speaker: Smug One
rooms/dormont/center.html.dialogue: ...Well, it's a little awkward right now, with the King. I might actually be forced to move here. Permanently.

rooms/dormont/center.html.speaker: Smug One
rooms/dormont/center.html.dialogue: ...I should pick a good spot to be frozen in...

rooms/dormont/center.html.speaker: Smug One
rooms/dormont/center.html.dialogue: Ah, not that I think you won't win tomorrow, of course. I have faith you'll win, of course.
(Vaugarde IS very welcoming.)
(People always notice you're not from here, but they're more likely to ask if you'd like to stay at their home for a bit than anything else.)
(Vaugarde IS very welcoming.)
(You wish they'd stop mentioning you're clearly out of place, though.)
(Vaugarde IS very welcoming.)
(That's why the King wants to freeze it in time forever.)
(Rewarding kindness with death.)

rooms/dormont/center.html.speaker: Smug One
rooms/dormont/center.html.dialogue: Ah, is that so? How did you like it?

rooms/dormont/center.html.speaker: Smug One
rooms/dormont/center.html.dialogue: A fellow theater fan...

rooms/dormont/center.html.speaker: Smug One
rooms/dormont/center.html.dialogue: Nice.
(You give each other a nod, as fellow theater fans do.)
(You give each other a nod, as fellow actors.)
(Does it matter if one of you isn't aware of it?)
(You need to ask...)

rooms/dormont/center.html.speaker: Smug One
rooms/dormont/center.html.dialogue: ...The Favor Tree?

rooms/dormont/center.html.speaker: Smug One
rooms/dormont/center.html.dialogue: I asked to be able to go back to Poteria soon.

rooms/dormont/center.html.speaker: Smug One
rooms/dormont/center.html.dialogue: Good luck, from one traveler to another.

rooms/dormont/center.html.speaker: Smug One
rooms/dormont/center.html.dialogue: Oh, hey, traveler.

rooms/dormont/center.html.speaker: Smug One
rooms/dormont/center.html.dialogue: I'm from Poteria. I came to Vaugarde to further my studies, a few months ago.

rooms/dormont/center.html.speaker: Smug One
rooms/dormont/center.html.dialogue: And you, uh...

rooms/dormont/center.html.speaker: Smug One
rooms/dormont/center.html.dialogue: You must be from the frowny face country, huh? Haha...
(You clench your fists, and force yourself to walk away.)

rooms/dormont/center.html.speaker: Smug One
rooms/dormont/center.html.dialogue: ...That was so rude... Why did I say that...

rooms/dormont/changegod.html.dialogue: (You approach the Change God's statue.)
(It's still here, looking down at you...)
(Would the Change God be mad if you got a blessing again?)
(...Would it know?)
(The Change God's blessing has been reset now that you're back in Dormont, so time to get a new one.)
(This is not working.)
(You don't feel like going to the Change God's statue is actually doing anything.)
(Are you doing it wrong...?)
(... Maybe you're not putting enough into it.)
(So instead... Maybe you should...)
(You look at all the statues, looking at each of them carefully.)
(This one.)
(You tap the one you like the most on its head, and breathe.)
(You breathe in...  And out...)
(New loop, new blessing.)
(You touch the statue you like the most, and close your eyes.)
(You breathe in... And out...)
(You... "believe strongly", or whatever...)
(Best defense is a good offense. If you hit hard, no one will hurt you or your friends.)
(You repeat under your breath "super powerful, super powerful, super powerful.")
(...You actually feel a little more powerful???)
(You do a little flourish with your dagger.)
(...You dropped your dagger.)
(Embarrassing!)
(You and your friends's ATK got a tiny bit better!)
(Best offense is a good defense. You win if you and your friends are the only ones standing.)
(You repeat under your breath "super strong, super strong, super strong.")
(...You actually feel a little stronger???)
(You pinch yourself.)
(Ouch. Okay then, not that much more powerful.)
(You and your friends's DEF got a tiny bit better!)
(Always attack first. Don't leave the enemy a chance to touch you.)
(You repeat under your breath "super fast, super fast, super fast.")
(...You actually feel a little faster???)
(You jump in place, trying to notice if anything changed.)
(You jump right on a pointy rock.)
(You don't tear up.)
(Not that much agile then, huh.)
(You and your friends's ATKSPD got a tiny bit better!)
[Once per loop, you can go to the Change God's statue and boost one of your stats!]
[The effects of the statue will be reset every time you go back to Dormont. So, every time you loop back here, don't forget to go to the Change God's statue, okay?]
(Wow! Okay, that's enough for this loop.)
(You thank the Change God for its blessing and quickly run away.)
(Crouching down, you whisper to the statue, and ask...)
(Your hand still on the statue, you whisper "strength, strength, strength".)
(You want you and your [friends/allies/family members] to be strong enough to defeat anything.)
(It's  what  you  want.)
(...You actually feel a little more powerful.)
(You do a little flourish with your dagger.)
(You and your [friends/allies/family members]'s ATK got boosted.)
(Your hand still on the statue, you whisper "protection, protection, protection".)
(You want you and your [friends/allies/family members] to be protected, to survive.)
(It's  what  you  want.)
(...You actually feel a little stronger.)
(You pinch yourself.)
(Barely hurts!)
(You and your [friends/allies/family members]'s DEF got boosted.)
(Your hand still on the statue, you whisper "speed, speed, speed".)
(You want you and your [friends/allies/family members] to be fast enough to attack first.)
(It's  what  you  want.)
(It's  what  you  want.)
(...You actually feel a little faster.)
(You do some sidesteps, and can tell they come easier than usual.)
(You and your [friends/allies/family members]'s ATKSPD got boosted.)
(This whole time... Were you...)
(Doing Wish Craft?)
(Hm!)
(You nod at the statue, and turn back.)
(You approach the Change God's statue.)
(You thank the Change God for its blessing and quickly run away.)
(Statues, big and small, all with different faces.)
(Some of them have sad eyes, others a bright smile.)
(A few are animated by Craft, and one jumps around and bumps gently into your foot.)
(The Change God, deity worshipped by all of the country of Vaugarde, stands before you.)
(You have trouble believing you're finally here, almost at the end of your journey.)
(It was only a few months ago that you met Mirabelle.)
(So much has happened since then.)
(It was almost a year ago now that the King appeared, seemingly out of nowhere.)
(Possessing immense Craft power, he spread his Curse across the country of Vaugarde, freezing in time everything in its path.)
(With Dormont's House of Change in his control, he patiently waits, for he knows his Curse can only be reversed if he is defeated.)
(His victory would be all but determined, if not for Mirabelle.)
(Your friend Mirabelle is the only survivor of the House of Dormont, after the King froze everyone inside in time and locked the gates.)
(Everyone says she was blessed by the Change God themselves with the power to fight back the King's Curse...)
(...making her the only one able to save Vaugarde.)
(When you met her, she was already traveling with Isabeau and Odile, trying to get the orbs necessary to open the House's gates and defeat the King.)
(You helped them defeat a particularly strong Sadness, and, seeing your strength, they asked for your help.)
(You had nothing better to do, so you decided to accompany them.)
(A few weeks later, you met Bonnie, completing your little team.)
(You saw a lot of Vaugardian cities during your travels, some frozen, some not, and did your best to sidestep the slowly encroaching Curse.)
(But still, you all kept going.)
(Mirabelle kept going to honor the Change God's blessing, save her beloved House, and save Vaugarde.)
(Isabeau came with her after Vaugarde's Defenders themselves refused to help.)
(Odile came to satisfy her curiosity about Vaugarde...)
(...and because, she said, "leaving the fate of a country to a bunch of young ones would give me an ulcer".)
(Bonnie came to save their sister, frozen by the Curse.)
(You're here because there's nothing else for you to do.)
(What else are you supposed to do except travel with them?)
(Once, Mirabelle asked you if you were okay, following them on a journey to save the country.)
(She felt guilty, felt like she was forcing everyone to follow her on a hopeless quest.)
(You wanted to put her at ease, so you said easily and truthfully that traveling with everyone was the happiest you could remember being.)
(She looked upset.)
(You cringe just thinking about it, truth be told. Maybe not the most considerate thing you could've said to someone with her problems at that moment.)
(But tomorrow, one way or another, your journey will end.)
(...You should believe something very strongly at the Change God.)
(That's how those work, right? Mirabelle and Isabeau taught you before.)
(Can't just ask for things because the Change belief considers this lazy. It's the Change God, only pure belief and confidence in yourself will do, with the Change God only providing a little nudge.)
(If anyone is lazy here, it must be the Change God, you think.)
(Oh well.)
(You... "believe strongly", or whatever...)
(Best defense is a good offense. If you hit hard, no one will hurt you or your friends.)
(You repeat under your breath "super powerful, super powerful, super powerful.")
(...You actually feel a little more powerful???)
(You do a little flourish with your dagger.)
(...You dropped your dagger.)
(Embarrassing!)
(You and your friends's ATK got a tiny bit better!)
(Best offense is a good defense. You win if you and your friends are the only ones standing.)
(You repeat under your breath "super strong, super strong, super strong.")
(...You actually feel a little stronger???)
(You pinch yourself.)
(Ouch. Okay then, not that much more powerful.)
(You and your friends's DEF got a tiny bit better!)
(Always attack first. Don't leave the enemy a chance to touch you.)
(You repeat under your breath "super fast, super fast, super fast.")
(...You actually feel a little faster???)
(You jump in place, trying to notice if anything changed.)
(You jump right on a pointy rock.)
(You don't tear up.)
(Not that much agile then, huh.)
(You and your friends's ATKSPD got a tiny bit better!)
