rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.dialogue: Siffrin... Did you forget already? I wrote a note for you...

rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.dialogue: You need to go into your pockets to find it... You can, um, just put your hand right in there?

rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.dialogue: Ah! Not that I think you've even forgotten how to put your hand in your pocket!

rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.dialogue: Oh no! I sound so condescending! I don't mean to! Sorry!
(Okay, your pride is a little hurt there.)
(It IS a little funny to see her bury herself deeper.)
[Have you forgotten how to open your menu? Wow!]
[To open the menu, press [menu button].]
[Through there, you can look at your items, and a bunch of other things. Give it a looksee!]
[You can interact with most items in your pockets by hovering over them and pressing [interact button]!]
(You don't actually say that. You know where everyone is.)

rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.dialogue: How I'm feeling...? Oh, being in Dormont, you mean?

rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.dialogue: It's nostalgic... This is where I lived before, after all. I mean, when I wasn't studying or working at the House.

rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.dialogue: Dormont itself hasn't changed much, but the House...

rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.dialogue: ...We can see it from the village, you know. How distorted it has become.

rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.dialogue: I was the only one who managed to escape the House when the King attacked... So many people must be hurt...

rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.dialogue: Or... Maybe they're all...

rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.speaker: Siffrin
rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.dialogue: (Mira...)

rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.speaker: Siffrin
rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.dialogue: (Just say the same thing...?)

rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.dialogue: ...Yes. You're right. I should stay positive... Sorry.

rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.dialogue: After? W-won't it jinx us to talk about this?!

rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.dialogue: Well... I'll need to make sure everyone in the House is okay... Beating the King should make their time flow again, and they won't be frozen anymore!

rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.dialogue: And... I need to talk to the Head Housemaiden and apologize for taking so long...

rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.dialogue: She was the one supposed to beat the King. She would've done a better job than I did, if only the King didn't freeze her in time...

rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.dialogue: But after I apologize... I was thinking of traveling again?

rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.dialogue: You know, you know, as a Housemaiden of the House of Change, I'm supposed to keep striving for change! Even more than a normal believer!

rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.dialogue: ...And part of it means I have to go on a pilgrimage. Which I haven't done yet.

rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.speaker: Siffrin
rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.dialogue: (...Um.) "Didn't this whole journey count as a pilgrimage?"

rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.dialogue: No? I mean, I don't think so???

rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.dialogue: The pilgrimage is all about learning new things! And seeing new places! And changing yourself and other people you meet!

rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.dialogue: This journey could've been that, but... I haven't changed at all. I'm still the same old Mirabelle.
(You feel like she's changed a lot since you've met her, but who are you to judge.)

rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.dialogue: What about you, Siffrin? What will you do?

rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.speaker: Siffrin
rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.dialogue: (What will you do...?) "Go on a pilgrimage too, maybe."

rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.dialogue: Oh?!? That's great!!! But I thought-- Oh Change!

rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.dialogue: Are you thinking of converting to the House of Change?!? The House would be delighted!!! I have some pamphlets!!!

rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.speaker: Siffrin
rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.dialogue: "Nah, I'm fine staying the same person forever."

rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.dialogue: You're fine with it...? Oh... Okay...

rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.dialogue: Something weird? U-um...
(She looks at the papers she's holding, as if you just accused her papers of being weird.)

rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.dialogue: N-Nothing! Nothing's weird! Definitely not my papers!!!
(Suspicious.)

rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.dialogue: D-DON'T LOOK AT THEM!!!
(You bring your index finger up.)

rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.dialogue: NO!
(You slowly move your finger closer to her papers...)

rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.dialogue: No no no no no no no...
(Closer...)
(Mirabelle is so worried at the idea of you seeing her papers that she froze.)
(Your finger gets closer...)
(...And pokes one of the papers.)

rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.speaker: Siffrin
rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.dialogue: "Poke."

rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.dialogue: ...Stop poking my papers...
(You feel a little bad.)
(You stop poking the papers.)

rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.dialogue: ...Apart from that, I haven't seen anything weird.
(You are still curious, but you'll let it go for now.)

rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.dialogue: ...Phew.

rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.dialogue: Help? Me? With anything?
(She hugs the papers she was looking at closer to her.)

rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.dialogue: I, um. Do not need help with anything. And definitely not those papers.
(Sounds like you need to figure out what those papers are.)
(She said she had more in her dorm room in the House, didnt she?)

rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.dialogue: Hm? Sorry?
(You point at her pile of papers.)

rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.dialogue: Wha--

rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.dialogue: !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.dialogue: WHAT

rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.dialogue: HOW

rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.dialogue: WHAT DO YOU KNOW

rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.dialogue: ANSWER ME!!!!!!!
(She has her hand on her rapier!!!)

rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.speaker: Siffrin
rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.dialogue: "Y-you're choosing someone for something, right?!"

rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.speaker: Siffrin
rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.dialogue: "It seems important!!!"

rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.speaker: Siffrin
rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.dialogue: "Maybe I can help?"
(She gets her hand on her rapier.)

rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.dialogue: Hm.

rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.dialogue: I... I suppose you must have more experience than I do...

rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.dialogue: Alright. I would like your help, if you'll give it.
(Experience...?)
(Experience.)
(You laugh silently.)
(Experience in fighting, sure.)

rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.dialogue: Th-thank you, Siffrin!

rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.dialogue: But, um, this might take some time!!! So, um... Make sure you have time?

rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.dialogue: Oh! Okay!!!

rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.dialogue: Okay, how to do this... Sit down next to me, maybe?
[Wow, you're here again!]
[You don't REALLY have to go through this whole thing again. You can just zone through it, and skip it completely, if you'd like.]
[You'll even still get their cool skill! But if you do, the skill will be a tiny bit less useful. Your choice!]
(Zone out?)

rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.dialogue: Oh, it's fine... Let me know when you have time, alright?
(She drew a thick, flowing line on the Reminder Note... What's that about?)

rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.dialogue: What I drew on the note...?

rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.dialogue: It's a flowing ribbon, silly! Like the one in my hair, see?
(Oh!)
(There was nothing you could do against the King's last attack...)
(But maybe Mirabelle would know something?)

rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.dialogue: Huh? A skill to save us against the King? Just in case?

rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.dialogue: Uuuh... Feels like we could find something like this in a book... Did you check the library?
(The library, huh... You should check the one in the village.)

rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.dialogue: Oh! For me? Thank you, Siffrin!

rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.dialogue: Hehehe, this is a nice gift... I'll make sure to press it in a book so I can keep it forever!
(She seems happy.)

rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.dialogue: I... I do?
(You nod and point at the stylish woman's house.)

rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.dialogue: I... don't know whose house it is. A stylish lady?
(You describe the stylish lady as best you can.)

rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.dialogue: Um... I'm sorry to tell you this, but stylish ladies aren't very rare in Vaugarde, haha.

rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.dialogue: And I see a lot of people during classes... I'm not smart enough to remember everyone I see...
(Welp.)
(Maybe eventually you'll find a way to jog her memory...)
(You give her the gift.)

rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.dialogue: F-Fanmail?!? From a stylish lady?!?

rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.dialogue: Okay... Oh, it's from one of my classmates...? I...

rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.dialogue: Oh... Oh!!!

rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.dialogue: That's from, um, a scary classmate of mine...!

rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.dialogue: Or at least, I thought she was scary! She has a very intense look, you know!!!

rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.dialogue: But... She's gifting me a bow she made...

rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.dialogue: She thought it would fit me well, and she says... She says...
(Suddenly, Mirabelle starts tearing up!!!)
(Mirabelle starts tearing up.)

rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.dialogue: S-She's such a nice person... I'm so glad that...

rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.dialogue: So glad that...

rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.dialogue: A-Anyway, look!!! Look at this bow! Isn't it pretty?
(She's crying, but she must not want you to mention it...)
(You look at the bow.)
(It's a very bright shade, and seems to sparkle in the light.)
(It would probably fit Mirabelle very well...)

rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.speaker: Siffrin
rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.dialogue: "It looks wonderful."

rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.dialogue: It does!
(You got the STYLISH BOW!)
(Mirabelle keeps it safe.)

rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.dialogue: A-Anyway, look!!! Look at this bow! Isn't it--
(You already have the Stylish Bow.)
(The bow disappeared from Mirabelle's hands.)

rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.dialogue: What... What happened?

rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.speaker: Siffrin
rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.dialogue: (Huh?) "Mirabelle?"

rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.dialogue: She mentioned... A bow, in her letter, but...

rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.dialogue: The bow... Wasn't I... Wasn't I just holding it...?

rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.dialogue: I... I can't remember... I...

rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.dialogue: Urgh!!! My head... My head hurts...!!!
(Oh, no.)

rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.speaker: Siffrin
rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.dialogue: (You have to do something!!!) "I-It's right here, see???"
(You point at the bow Mirabelle is wearing.)
(You point at Mirabelle's pockets.)

rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.dialogue: Right the--right there... It's right there...

rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.dialogue: It's right there! Look at this bow! Isn't it pretty?

rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.speaker: Siffrin
rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.dialogue: (. . .) "I-It looks wonderful!"

rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.dialogue: It does!

rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.dialogue: A-Anyway, look!!! Look at this bow! Isn't it--
(You already have the Stylish Bow.)
(The bow disappeared from Mirabelle's hands.)

rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.dialogue: What... What happened?

rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.speaker: Siffrin
rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.dialogue: "You have a stylish bow!"
(You point at the bow Mirabelle is wearing.)
(You point at Mirabelle's pockets.)

rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.dialogue: I do! Look at this bow! Isn't it pretty?

rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.speaker: Siffrin
rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.dialogue: "It looks wonderful!"

rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.dialogue: It does!

rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.dialogue: Are you okay, Siffrin?

rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.dialogue: You did look tired, when I went to wake you up...

rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.speaker: Siffrin
rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.dialogue: "Nope, I'm fine!"

rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.dialogue: Hm, okay...

rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.dialogue: Do you need help with anything, though...?

rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.speaker: Siffrin
rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.dialogue: "Nope!"

rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.dialogue: Okay...

rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.dialogue: Well, let me know if you ever do, okay?
(You nod.)

rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/dormont/miratalk.html.dialogue: Okay! I'll see you later!

rooms/dormont/north.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/dormont/north.html.dialogue: Hi again, Sif! What's up?
(Isabeau is here, looking towards the House.)

rooms/dormont/north.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/dormont/north.html.dialogue: Hi again, Sif?

rooms/dormont/north.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/dormont/north.html.dialogue: You looked like you were in a hurry earlier, so I left you alone, but... Is everything okay?
(You smile and nod.)

rooms/dormont/north.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/dormont/north.html.dialogue: Sure, I'll believe you.

rooms/dormont/north.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/dormont/north.html.dialogue: What's up?

rooms/dormont/north.html.speaker: Old One
rooms/dormont/north.html.dialogue: Hello young lad! Sit down next to me.

rooms/dormont/north.html.speaker: Old One
rooms/dormont/north.html.dialogue: You can sit on benches and stools by walking into them.

rooms/dormont/north.html.speaker: Old One
rooms/dormont/north.html.dialogue: Yes, I know. Just walk into them! Very intuitive!

rooms/dormont/north.html.speaker: Siffrin
rooms/dormont/north.html.dialogue: "Thank you for teaching me."

rooms/dormont/north.html.speaker: Old One
rooms/dormont/north.html.dialogue: Oh, you're so sweet. It's no problem at all, sweetie.
(You know, you know, you know.)
(You need to ask...)

rooms/dormont/north.html.speaker: Old One
rooms/dormont/north.html.dialogue: The Favor Tree...?

rooms/dormont/north.html.speaker: Old One
rooms/dormont/north.html.dialogue: I asked it... That if the end was coming, to make it fast.

rooms/dormont/north.html.speaker: Old One
rooms/dormont/north.html.dialogue: Hello young lad! Sit--
(You know, you know, you know.)
(You don't want to look at it anymore.)

rooms/dormont/north.html.speaker: Old One
rooms/dormont/north.html.dialogue: ...Horrifying, isn't it?

rooms/dormont/north.html.speaker: Old One
rooms/dormont/north.html.dialogue: Our beautiful House of Change, warped into such a terrible shape...

rooms/dormont/north.html.speaker: Old One
rooms/dormont/north.html.dialogue: ...The King waits inside, waits for the entire country to finally be frozen in time.

rooms/dormont/north.html.speaker: Old One
rooms/dormont/north.html.dialogue: I shall pray for your victory tomorrow.
(You suppose the King will have to wait a little longer.)
(You have enough of this view.)
(You look at the House for a very long time.)

rooms/dormont/odiletalk.html.dialogue: (Odile is here, looking at what the shop has to offer.)

rooms/dormont/odiletalk.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/dormont/odiletalk.html.dialogue: Oh, Siffrin.

rooms/dormont/odiletalk.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/dormont/odiletalk.html.dialogue: Oh, Siffrin.

rooms/dormont/odiletalk.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/dormont/odiletalk.html.dialogue: Oh, Siffrin.

rooms/dormont/odiletalk.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/dormont/odiletalk.html.dialogue: Oh, Siffrin? I didn't see you there...

rooms/dormont/odiletalk.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/dormont/odiletalk.html.dialogue: You look rested. Glad to see you this laidback on the day before the end of the world.

rooms/dormont/odiletalk.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/dormont/odiletalk.html.dialogue: Anyway. How can I help you?
[You don't need to talk to your allies about things you've already talked about, but the option is still here just in case you need a refresher!]

rooms/dormont/odiletalk.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/dormont/odiletalk.html.dialogue: What is it, Siffrin?

rooms/dormont/odiletalk.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/dormont/odiletalk.html.dialogue: What's wrong? You look terrible.

rooms/dormont/odiletalk.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/dormont/odiletalk.html.dialogue: Siffrin?

rooms/dormont/odiletalk.html.speaker: Siffrin
rooms/dormont/odiletalk.html.dialogue: (Questions...)

rooms/dormont/odiletalk.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/dormont/odiletalk.html.dialogue: A sleepover? Urgh... You guys really are kids.

rooms/dormont/odiletalk.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/dormont/odiletalk.html.dialogue: I suppose so.

rooms/dormont/odiletalk.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/dormont/odiletalk.html.dialogue: There sure are. I would've thought you wouldn't mind any occasion to slack off though.

rooms/dormont/odiletalk.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/dormont/odiletalk.html.dialogue: Nonetheless, I'll be there. Poor Boniface probably needs it. Maybe we all do.

rooms/dormont/odiletalk.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/dormont/odiletalk.html.dialogue: But the room only has three beds, right? I better get a whole bed to myself.

rooms/dormont/odiletalk.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/dormont/odiletalk.html.dialogue: Mirabelle and Bonnie? So who'll sleep on the ground, you or Isabeau?

rooms/dormont/odiletalk.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/dormont/odiletalk.html.dialogue: ...Fascinating.

rooms/dormont/odiletalk.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/dormont/odiletalk.html.dialogue: Poor man.

rooms/dormont/odiletalk.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/dormont/odiletalk.html.dialogue: ...Anyway, I'll be there. You know, since we already decided earlier we'd meet at the Clocktower and all.
(Yeah... You already all planned to meet up at the Clocktower, so was there a need for you to let everyone know?)
(You could've just met everyone at the Clocktower...)
(Oh well. Not like you have anything better to do.)
(Hm... Guess you don't have to talk to everyone again.)
(You REALLY don't have to talk to everyone again.)

rooms/dormont/odiletalk.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/dormont/odiletalk.html.dialogue: ...Anything else?
(You suppose you don't need to tell her every time...)

rooms/dormont/odiletalk.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/dormont/odiletalk.html.dialogue: We are. I hope you're prepared.

rooms/dormont/odiletalk.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/dormont/odiletalk.html.dialogue: The King, and the Sadnesses his destruction creates... They possess Crafts capable of slowing us down, or even freezing us in time completely.

rooms/dormont/odiletalk.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/dormont/odiletalk.html.dialogue: So, as always, we're counting on you and your speed to keep us out of trouble.

rooms/dormont/odiletalk.html.speaker: Siffrin
rooms/dormont/odiletalk.html.dialogue: (Didn't work so well the first time...)

rooms/dormont/odiletalk.html.speaker: Siffrin
rooms/dormont/odiletalk.html.dialogue: (You're kind of glad it's your job...)

rooms/dormont/odiletalk.html.speaker: Siffrin
rooms/dormont/odiletalk.html.dialogue: (It's your role, after all.)

rooms/dormont/odiletalk.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/dormont/odiletalk.html.dialogue: Leading everyone, if possible. You've already proven good at preventing traps and keeping us alive, so I don't see why that has to change.

rooms/dormont/odiletalk.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/dormont/odiletalk.html.dialogue: And as always, you can count on me to provide everyone with intel on any enemies we encounter.

rooms/dormont/odiletalk.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/dormont/odiletalk.html.dialogue: Everyone except Boniface will be on battle duty... But I might ask Boniface to do something as well.

rooms/dormont/odiletalk.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/dormont/odiletalk.html.dialogue: It might be good for everyone to give the kid something to do...

rooms/dormont/odiletalk.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/dormont/odiletalk.html.dialogue: ...Boring tactics talk, I know. I'll shut up and buy items for our journey to the top of the House.

rooms/dormont/odiletalk.html.speaker: Siffrin
rooms/dormont/odiletalk.html.dialogue: (Ho? Have you found it?!?)

rooms/dormont/odiletalk.html.speaker: Siffrin
rooms/dormont/odiletalk.html.dialogue: (You know that's not it, but...)

rooms/dormont/odiletalk.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/dormont/odiletalk.html.dialogue: Oh gems. Are you still trying to figure out what I'm researching?

rooms/dormont/odiletalk.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/dormont/odiletalk.html.dialogue: NO, my field of research ISN'T tactics.

rooms/dormont/odiletalk.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/dormont/odiletalk.html.dialogue: Isabeau actually proposed that one last week, late one.

rooms/dormont/odiletalk.html.speaker: Siffrin
rooms/dormont/odiletalk.html.dialogue: (Yeah...)

rooms/dormont/odiletalk.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/dormont/odiletalk.html.dialogue: Give it up already. None of you will ever figure out what I'm studying.

rooms/dormont/odiletalk.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/dormont/odiletalk.html.dialogue: It will stay a secret forever.

rooms/dormont/odiletalk.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/dormont/odiletalk.html.dialogue: After tomorrow, if we survive? I wish I had your confidence.

rooms/dormont/odiletalk.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/dormont/odiletalk.html.dialogue: ...Maybe I'll just go home to Ka Bue. I haven't seen my country in many years...

rooms/dormont/odiletalk.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/dormont/odiletalk.html.dialogue: Before I met Mirabelle and Isabeau, my main goal was to travel to Vaugarde and see its many different places, sights, cultures.

rooms/dormont/odiletalk.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/dormont/odiletalk.html.dialogue: I've already accomplished this by traveling with Mirabelle, so...

rooms/dormont/odiletalk.html.speaker: Siffrin
rooms/dormont/odiletalk.html.dialogue: "Was it all for your research?"

rooms/dormont/odiletalk.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/dormont/odiletalk.html.dialogue: ...Yes.

rooms/dormont/odiletalk.html.speaker: Siffrin
rooms/dormont/odiletalk.html.dialogue: ("Your research into...")

rooms/dormont/odiletalk.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/dormont/odiletalk.html.dialogue: "Travel-ology" isn't a field of research, Siffrin.

rooms/dormont/odiletalk.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/dormont/odiletalk.html.dialogue: "Sights-ology" isn't a field of research, Siffrin.

rooms/dormont/odiletalk.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/dormont/odiletalk.html.dialogue: "Cultures-ology" isn't a field of research, Siffrin.

rooms/dormont/odiletalk.html.speaker: Siffrin
rooms/dormont/odiletalk.html.dialogue: "But it is the field of research you spent your life trying to create..."

rooms/dormont/odiletalk.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/dormont/odiletalk.html.dialogue: Stop inventing a backstory for me.

rooms/dormont/odiletalk.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/dormont/odiletalk.html.dialogue: What about you, what will you do? If we beat the King, that is.

rooms/dormont/odiletalk.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/dormont/odiletalk.html.dialogue: Will you go back to your own country, maybe?

rooms/dormont/odiletalk.html.speaker: Siffrin
rooms/dormont/odiletalk.html.dialogue: (What will you do...?) "Come up with my own field of research."

rooms/dormont/odiletalk.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/dormont/odiletalk.html.dialogue: Urgh.

rooms/dormont/odiletalk.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/dormont/odiletalk.html.dialogue: Weird...?   Like what?

rooms/dormont/odiletalk.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/dormont/odiletalk.html.dialogue: I didn't see anything weird. Did YOU see anything weird?

rooms/dormont/odiletalk.html.speaker: Siffrin
rooms/dormont/odiletalk.html.dialogue: (Too perceptive...!)

rooms/dormont/odiletalk.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/dormont/odiletalk.html.dialogue: ...Okay.

rooms/dormont/odiletalk.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/dormont/odiletalk.html.dialogue: I'll keep an eye out. I do hope you'll also let me know if you see "something weird".

rooms/dormont/odiletalk.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/dormont/odiletalk.html.dialogue: For me? Where did that come from?

rooms/dormont/odiletalk.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/dormont/odiletalk.html.dialogue: Well, nonetheless... Thank you, Siffrin.

rooms/dormont/odiletalk.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/dormont/odiletalk.html.dialogue: It's not like you to be so thoughtful, so I'll definitely keep it as proof.
(Proof of what...?)
(Well, anyway... She seems happy.)

rooms/dormont/odiletalk.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/dormont/odiletalk.html.dialogue: Do I need help with anything? Are you THIS bored, Siffrin?
(Odile seems to realize you're genuinely asking.)

rooms/dormont/odiletalk.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/dormont/odiletalk.html.dialogue: Ah, well. . .

rooms/dormont/odiletalk.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/dormont/odiletalk.html.dialogue: ...I'm looking for a certain type of book.

rooms/dormont/odiletalk.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/dormont/odiletalk.html.dialogue: No, not a specific book.

rooms/dormont/odiletalk.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/dormont/odiletalk.html.dialogue: It's... It's a type of book called a "familytale". Have you heard of those?

rooms/dormont/odiletalk.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/dormont/odiletalk.html.dialogue: It's a book filled with tales written by a single family, through generations. It's a tradition, in Vaugarde.

rooms/dormont/odiletalk.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/dormont/odiletalk.html.dialogue: I've always wanted to read one. But, since each family has theirs, and it's something you're supposed to keep in one family and not show others...

rooms/dormont/odiletalk.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/dormont/odiletalk.html.dialogue: I was never able to touch, let alone read one.

rooms/dormont/odiletalk.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/dormont/odiletalk.html.dialogue: But I've heard that when a family dies off, the familytale might be taken by Houses. As a way to save those pieces of history.
(Huh, you didn't know that.)
(And so...)
(And so.)

rooms/dormont/odiletalk.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/dormont/odiletalk.html.dialogue: Yes.
(Huh!)
(You never knew she was interested in that.)

rooms/dormont/odiletalk.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/dormont/odiletalk.html.dialogue: ...Of a sort.
(Ha.)

rooms/dormont/odiletalk.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/dormont/odiletalk.html.dialogue: ...So, will you help me?

rooms/dormont/odiletalk.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/dormont/odiletalk.html.dialogue: ...Thank you, Siffrin.

rooms/dormont/odiletalk.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/dormont/odiletalk.html.dialogue: Ha. Okay.

rooms/dormont/odiletalk.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/dormont/odiletalk.html.dialogue: I was planning to look in Dormont's library, but I have to buy some supplies.

rooms/dormont/odiletalk.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/dormont/odiletalk.html.dialogue: And I want to look inside Dormont's House, but... Who knows if we'll have time to search, so...
(...So you should check the libraries at your disposal, and see if you can find a familytale.)
(So that makes... Dormont's library, the House's, and the House's secret library, at least.)
(Better start looking!)

rooms/dormont/odiletalk.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/dormont/odiletalk.html.dialogue: Wh-what?

rooms/dormont/odiletalk.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/dormont/odiletalk.html.dialogue: What? What? Huh? Really?
(She doesn't seem to know how to react.)
(You wait a bit for her to calm down.)
(You look at her repeat the same words over and over.)

rooms/dormont/odiletalk.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/dormont/odiletalk.html.dialogue: ...Siffrin.

rooms/dormont/odiletalk.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/dormont/odiletalk.html.dialogue: Will you come with me? To ask them if I can borrow it?

rooms/dormont/odiletalk.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/dormont/odiletalk.html.dialogue: It might... Take some time. So make sure you have time to help me.

rooms/dormont/odiletalk.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/dormont/odiletalk.html.dialogue: ...Thank you.

rooms/dormont/odiletalk.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/dormont/odiletalk.html.dialogue: Let's go, then.
[Wow, you're here again!]
[You don't REALLY have to go through this whole thing again. You can just zone through it, and skip it completely, if you'd like.]
[You'll even still get their cool skill! But if you do, the skill will be a tiny bit less useful. Your choice!]
(Zone out?)
(You and Odile are now hanging out!)
(You should head to the boulangerie...)

rooms/dormont/odiletalk.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/dormont/odiletalk.html.dialogue: O-oh, of course... Well, let me know when you have time.

rooms/dormont/odiletalk.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/dormont/odiletalk.html.dialogue: Very silent today, aren't we?

rooms/dormont/odiletalk.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/dormont/odiletalk.html.dialogue: Is something the matter?
(You shrug.)

rooms/dormont/odiletalk.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/dormont/odiletalk.html.dialogue: I'm too busy to help you with your problems right now. Go talk to Isabeau for that sort of thing.

rooms/dormont/odiletalk.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/dormont/odiletalk.html.dialogue: You can help me buy some supplies for tonight, though, if you'd like to be distracted.
(You nod.)
(You spent some time with Odile, following her silently as she chose supplies.)

rooms/dormont/odiletalk.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/dormont/odiletalk.html.dialogue: I will see you later, Siffrin.
(You nod.)

rooms/dormont/odiletalk.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/dormont/odiletalk.html.dialogue: Okay. I'll see you at the clocktower later then.
(You talked to Odile!)
(You cross Odile from the Reminder Note.)

rooms/dormont/stylishhouse.html.dialogue: (Books about a variety of subjects, from woodworking to psychology.)
(Some are written in Mwudu... You wonder if the stylish lady is from there.)
(A little figure of the Change God.)
(It's been Crafted to dance slightly.)
(This one looks very stylish.)
(It's a closet.)
(It's filled with many beautiful dresses.)
(A desk.)
(There's a half-written letter on it, along with a pile of blank paper.)

rooms/dormont/stylishhouse.html.speaker: Stylish One
rooms/dormont/stylishhouse.html.dialogue: I'm trying to write a letter... Don't look, please!

rooms/dormont/stylishhouse.html.speaker: Stylish One
rooms/dormont/stylishhouse.html.dialogue: Oh, those are my drafts for Mirabelle's letter... Don't look, please!
(You look away.)
(A dresser.)

rooms/dormont/stylishhouse.html.speaker: Stylish One
rooms/dormont/stylishhouse.html.dialogue: DO NOT TOUCH! My unmentionables are inside.
(You leave the dresser alone.)

rooms/dormont/stylishhouse.html.speaker: Stylish One
rooms/dormont/stylishhouse.html.dialogue: Big hat... Impossibly warm looking cloak...

rooms/dormont/stylishhouse.html.speaker: Stylish One
rooms/dormont/stylishhouse.html.dialogue: You must be one of the people traveling with Mirabelle!

rooms/dormont/stylishhouse.html.speaker: Stylish One
rooms/dormont/stylishhouse.html.dialogue: She's pretty well known around here. The chosen one, you know. Blessed by the Change God with the power to save Vaugarde.

rooms/dormont/stylishhouse.html.speaker: Stylish One
rooms/dormont/stylishhouse.html.dialogue: Plus, before all this, she was a housemaiden at the House of Change nearby. She'd take classes, help out with chores, help the other housemaidens with their studies and craft. Little perfect Mirabelle.

rooms/dormont/stylishhouse.html.speaker: Stylish One
rooms/dormont/stylishhouse.html.dialogue: Hmf... As for me...

rooms/dormont/stylishhouse.html.speaker: Stylish One
rooms/dormont/stylishhouse.html.dialogue: I THINK SHE'S THE MOST WONDERFUL BEING ON EARTH.

rooms/dormont/stylishhouse.html.speaker: Stylish One
rooms/dormont/stylishhouse.html.dialogue: No wonder the Change God blessed her, when she's this wonderful!!!

rooms/dormont/stylishhouse.html.speaker: Stylish One
rooms/dormont/stylishhouse.html.dialogue: I used to go to the House a lot for my classes, and she was always there, taking the class with me!

rooms/dormont/stylishhouse.html.speaker: Stylish One
rooms/dormont/stylishhouse.html.dialogue: I've never had a class I didn't share with her. She's so cool. So helpful. So driven. Honestly, we're kind of best friends.

rooms/dormont/stylishhouse.html.speaker: Stylish One
rooms/dormont/stylishhouse.html.dialogue: ...Even though I've never had a single conversation with her...
(Talking to people is hard, you get it.)
(You hope she'll get to talk to Mirabelle before tomorrow!)
(You wonder if she managed to talk to Mirabelle before you went to the House...)
(Talking to people is hard, you get it.)
(You don't think she managed to talk to Mirabelle last time... Mirabelle would've mentioned it.)
(You should go and tell Mirabelle yourself!)
(You tell her what Mirabelle thinks of her.)

rooms/dormont/stylishhouse.html.speaker: Stylish One
rooms/dormont/stylishhouse.html.dialogue: SHE THINKS I'M SCARY?!?

rooms/dormont/stylishhouse.html.speaker: Stylish One
rooms/dormont/stylishhouse.html.dialogue: But wait, you said she also liked my style?
(You nod.)

rooms/dormont/stylishhouse.html.speaker: Stylish One
rooms/dormont/stylishhouse.html.dialogue: Oh... Oh Change... Oh yes. Oh wonderful. I know exactly what to do.

rooms/dormont/stylishhouse.html.speaker: Stylish One
rooms/dormont/stylishhouse.html.dialogue: Give me three seconds, hatted one.

rooms/dormont/stylishhouse.html.speaker: Stylish One
rooms/dormont/stylishhouse.html.dialogue: YES. OKAY. LET'S GO. Can you give this to Mirabelle?

rooms/dormont/stylishhouse.html.speaker: Stylish One
rooms/dormont/stylishhouse.html.dialogue: I, um, I hope she likes it.
(You got the FANMAIL!)
(It's a package and a letter addressed to Mirabelle...)
(You'd better give it to her before tomorrow.)
(You put the mail in your pocket along with your Souvenirs.)

rooms/dormont/stylishhouse.html.speaker: Stylish One
rooms/dormont/stylishhouse.html.dialogue: Thank you... Please give it to her... Please... I don't want to scare her... Please.
(You need to ask...)

rooms/dormont/stylishhouse.html.speaker: Stylish One
rooms/dormont/stylishhouse.html.dialogue: Oh, oh, I asked the Favor Tree to help Mirabelle on her journey!

rooms/dormont/stylishhouse.html.speaker: Stylish One
rooms/dormont/stylishhouse.html.dialogue: I don't really believe in that stuff, but the Head Housemaiden does, so I thought I'd give it a shot!

rooms/dormont/stylishhouse.html.speaker: Stylish One
rooms/dormont/stylishhouse.html.dialogue: You gave her my gift? You did??? What did she say???

rooms/dormont/stylishhouse.html.speaker: Siffrin
rooms/dormont/stylishhouse.html.dialogue: "She really liked it!"

rooms/dormont/stylishhouse.html.speaker: Stylish One
rooms/dormont/stylishhouse.html.dialogue: SHE REALLY LIKED IT.......................

rooms/dormont/stylishhouse.html.speaker: Stylish One
rooms/dormont/stylishhouse.html.dialogue: Thank you for giving it to her!!! Now, no matter what happens tomorrow...

rooms/dormont/stylishhouse.html.speaker: Stylish One
rooms/dormont/stylishhouse.html.dialogue: . . .

rooms/dormont/stylishhouse.html.speaker: Stylish One
rooms/dormont/stylishhouse.html.dialogue: A-actually!!! Please make sure to win, tomorrow!

rooms/dormont/stylishhouse.html.speaker: Stylish One
rooms/dormont/stylishhouse.html.dialogue: I want to tell her tomorrow how much she means to me, after she beats the King!

rooms/dormont/stylishhouse.html.speaker: Stylish One
rooms/dormont/stylishhouse.html.dialogue: So she and I... can become friends!!!

rooms/dormont/stylishhouse.html.speaker: Stylish One
rooms/dormont/stylishhouse.html.dialogue: Make sure to win tomorrow!!!!!
(You nod.)

rooms/dormont/stylishhouse.html.speaker: Stylish One
rooms/dormont/stylishhouse.html.dialogue: Oh, Mirabelle... She'll save us all, I'm sure of it!

rooms/dormont/stylishhouse.html.speaker: Stylish One
rooms/dormont/stylishhouse.html.dialogue: Make sure to win, tomorrow!!!

rooms/dormont/thingyhouse.html.dialogue: (A letter is laying on the barrel.)
(...You can only describe the item inside the letter as... A long thingy-thing.)
(You put the thingy-thing in your pocket along with your Souvenirs.)
(Don't you need this to make a bomb...?)

rooms/dormont/tutokid.html.speaker: Tutorial Kid
rooms/dormont/tutokid.html.dialogue: Hey!!!! You!!! The strange adult with a hat!!!

rooms/dormont/tutokid.html.speaker: Tutorial Kid
rooms/dormont/tutokid.html.dialogue: My name...... is Tutorial Kid.
(Tutorial Kid has the name "Agathe" sewn into her clothes.)

rooms/dormont/tutokid.html.speaker: Tutorial Kid
rooms/dormont/tutokid.html.dialogue: My mom says you're very strong and you're gonna help save us all.

rooms/dormont/tutokid.html.speaker: Tutorial Kid
rooms/dormont/tutokid.html.dialogue: But I need to challenge you to know your strength. So......

rooms/dormont/tutokid.html.speaker: Tutorial Kid
rooms/dormont/tutokid.html.dialogue: Let's play Rock Paper Scissors!!!
(So the Tutorial Kid knows all about battles, huh...?)
(You already know a lot, but it won't hurt to get a refresher...)
(And maybe this kid knows things you don't.)

rooms/dormont/tutokid.html.speaker: Tutorial Kid
rooms/dormont/tutokid.html.dialogue: Hm... I may have advice for you... What do you need?

rooms/dormont/tutokid.html.speaker: Tutorial Kid
rooms/dormont/tutokid.html.dialogue: Normal attacks, huh...

rooms/dormont/tutokid.html.speaker: Tutorial Kid
rooms/dormont/tutokid.html.dialogue: Well... Any fighter worth their salt knows that normal attacks are weaker than Craft Skills.

rooms/dormont/tutokid.html.speaker: Tutorial Kid
rooms/dormont/tutokid.html.dialogue: BUT!!! It does NOT mean they are useless!!!

rooms/dormont/tutokid.html.speaker: Tutorial Kid
rooms/dormont/tutokid.html.dialogue: Unlike Craft Skills, they do not go into Cooldown... And... Most importantly...

rooms/dormont/tutokid.html.speaker: Tutorial Kid
rooms/dormont/tutokid.html.dialogue: YOUR ATTACK GAUGE FILLS A LITTLE BIT FASTER AFTER YOU USE A NORMAL ATTACK!!!

rooms/dormont/tutokid.html.speaker: Tutorial Kid
rooms/dormont/tutokid.html.dialogue: Which makes them very good to quickly get those Jackpot combos your heart craves.

rooms/dormont/tutokid.html.speaker: Tutorial Kid
rooms/dormont/tutokid.html.dialogue: Guarding, huh...

rooms/dormont/tutokid.html.speaker: Tutorial Kid
rooms/dormont/tutokid.html.dialogue: It goes without saying that... If an enemy attacks you while you're guarding, the damage you take will be halfed. H-HalVed! Making it quite literally the difference between LIFE AND DEATH!!!

rooms/dormont/tutokid.html.speaker: Tutorial Kid
rooms/dormont/tutokid.html.dialogue: It also makes your Attack Gauge fill a little slower, because you're waiting for a hit, y'know.

rooms/dormont/tutokid.html.speaker: Tutorial Kid
rooms/dormont/tutokid.html.dialogue: Only losers don't guard.

rooms/dormont/tutokid.html.speaker: Tutorial Kid
rooms/dormont/tutokid.html.dialogue: Buffs and debuffs, huh...

rooms/dormont/tutokid.html.speaker: Tutorial Kid
rooms/dormont/tutokid.html.dialogue: They're pretty self-explanatory, aren't they?

rooms/dormont/tutokid.html.speaker: Tutorial Kid
rooms/dormont/tutokid.html.dialogue: There is one thing... A "tool of the trade", if you will...

rooms/dormont/tutokid.html.speaker: Tutorial Kid
rooms/dormont/tutokid.html.dialogue: Crafting a buff twice won't actually make the buff twice as powerful, so you can forget about that.

rooms/dormont/tutokid.html.speaker: Tutorial Kid
rooms/dormont/tutokid.html.dialogue: What it DOES do... Is reset the amount of time it will be effective!!! WOW!!!

rooms/dormont/tutokid.html.speaker: Tutorial Kid
rooms/dormont/tutokid.html.dialogue: So if you only have one turn left with an ATTACK buff, and you craft it again... Instead of lasting only one turn, it will last three.

rooms/dormont/tutokid.html.speaker: Tutorial Kid
rooms/dormont/tutokid.html.dialogue: Bet you didn't know that, huh?!?

rooms/dormont/tutokid.html.speaker: Tutorial Kid
rooms/dormont/tutokid.html.dialogue: Escaping battles, huh...

rooms/dormont/tutokid.html.speaker: Tutorial Kid
rooms/dormont/tutokid.html.dialogue: You can escape most battles by pressing [cancel button] when it's any of your friends' turn.

rooms/dormont/tutokid.html.speaker: Tutorial Kid
rooms/dormont/tutokid.html.dialogue: You won't get any experience, but... As I have heard... No experience is better than being defeated!!!

rooms/dormont/tutokid.html.speaker: Tutorial Kid
rooms/dormont/tutokid.html.dialogue: You won't always be able to escape battles, though. Some enemies won't let you.

rooms/dormont/tutokid.html.speaker: Tutorial Kid
rooms/dormont/tutokid.html.dialogue: That's just how it is!!!

rooms/dormont/tutokid.html.speaker: Tutorial Kid
rooms/dormont/tutokid.html.dialogue: Because... It is our fate to fight.

rooms/dormont/tutokid.html.speaker: Tutorial Kid
rooms/dormont/tutokid.html.dialogue: Um, because it's the basis of everything? The basis of creation, of Craft?

rooms/dormont/tutokid.html.speaker: Tutorial Kid
rooms/dormont/tutokid.html.dialogue: Ah... It seems like I really must teach you everything...

rooms/dormont/tutokid.html.speaker: Tutorial Kid
rooms/dormont/tutokid.html.dialogue: YEAAAAAAAAAAAAAAH!!!!!!!!!!!!!

rooms/dormont/tutokid.html.speaker: Tutorial Kid
rooms/dormont/tutokid.html.dialogue: Let us see each other again... In the arena!!!
(You need to ask...)

rooms/dormont/tutokid.html.speaker: Tutorial Kid
rooms/dormont/tutokid.html.dialogue: Huh? What I asked the big tree?

rooms/dormont/tutokid.html.speaker: Tutorial Kid
rooms/dormont/tutokid.html.dialogue: I asked... To win my next Rock Paper Scissors fight.
(Of course.)

rooms/dormont/tutokid.html.speaker: Tutorial Kid
rooms/dormont/tutokid.html.dialogue: Rock Paper Scissors... The only fight there is.

rooms/dormont/tutokid.html.speaker: Tutorial Kid
rooms/dormont/tutokid.html.dialogue: You know how to play Rock Paper Scissors, right?

rooms/dormont/tutokid.html.speaker: Tutorial Kid
rooms/dormont/tutokid.html.dialogue: Of course you do. What kind of person doesn't know Rock Paper Scissors, considering it's the basis of combat, of war, of LIFE.

rooms/dormont/tutokid.html.speaker: Tutorial Kid
rooms/dormont/tutokid.html.dialogue: You don't know how to play Rock Paper Scissors???

rooms/dormont/tutokid.html.speaker: Tutorial Kid
rooms/dormont/tutokid.html.dialogue: Is it because of the hat?

rooms/dormont/tutokid.html.speaker: Tutorial Kid
rooms/dormont/tutokid.html.dialogue: I knew it...

rooms/dormont/tutokid.html.speaker: Tutorial Kid
rooms/dormont/tutokid.html.dialogue: I think you're lying to save face. It's okay. Adults are allowed to not know things.

rooms/dormont/tutokid.html.speaker: Tutorial Kid
rooms/dormont/tutokid.html.dialogue: I'll teach you then! It's a simple game.

rooms/dormont/tutokid.html.speaker: Tutorial Kid
rooms/dormont/tutokid.html.dialogue: We're gonna yell "Rock Paper Scissors", and at "Scissors" we throw our hands like this!

rooms/dormont/tutokid.html.speaker: Tutorial Kid
rooms/dormont/tutokid.html.dialogue: This one with your fist closed, thats Rock! This one with your hand flat is Paper! And this one with your index and middle fingers up is Scissors!

rooms/dormont/tutokid.html.speaker: Tutorial Kid
rooms/dormont/tutokid.html.dialogue: Rock beats Scissors because rocks break scissors! Scissors beats Paper because you cut paper with scissors! Paper beats Rock just because!

rooms/dormont/tutokid.html.speaker: Tutorial Kid
rooms/dormont/tutokid.html.dialogue: Yeah! Ok, you know the rules now.

rooms/dormont/tutokid.html.speaker: Tutorial Kid
rooms/dormont/tutokid.html.dialogue: Let's!!!! Play!!!!

rooms/dormont/tutokid.html.speaker: Tutorial Kid
rooms/dormont/tutokid.html.dialogue: ROCK... PAPER...
(Tutorial Kid throws Paper first.)
TUTORIAL KID throws Paper!
(The Tutorial Kid threw Paper.)

rooms/dormont/tutokid.html.speaker: Tutorial Kid
rooms/dormont/tutokid.html.dialogue: YEAH!!!! I threw Paper!!!!

rooms/dormont/tutokid.html.speaker: Tutorial Kid
rooms/dormont/tutokid.html.dialogue: Paper wins against Rock... Which means...

rooms/dormont/tutokid.html.speaker: Tutorial Kid
rooms/dormont/tutokid.html.dialogue: Fufufu... I win this round.

rooms/dormont/tutokid.html.speaker: Tutorial Kid
rooms/dormont/tutokid.html.dialogue: Oh... We both threw the same thing! That's a draw!

rooms/dormont/tutokid.html.speaker: Tutorial Kid
rooms/dormont/tutokid.html.dialogue: Ngh...! Looks like I shouldn't underestimate you...

rooms/dormont/tutokid.html.speaker: Tutorial Kid
rooms/dormont/tutokid.html.dialogue: NGH!!! I threw Paper!!! How could I... lose to someone like you...

rooms/dormont/tutokid.html.speaker: Tutorial Kid
rooms/dormont/tutokid.html.dialogue: Ok, let's do it again!!! Rock, Paper....
(Next, Tutorial Kid throws Rock...)
TUTORIAL KID threw Rock!
(The Tutorial Kid threw Rock.)

rooms/dormont/tutokid.html.speaker: Tutorial Kid
rooms/dormont/tutokid.html.dialogue: Oh... We both threw Rock!!! When we throw the same thing that's a draw!!!

rooms/dormont/tutokid.html.speaker: Tutorial Kid
rooms/dormont/tutokid.html.dialogue: Ho ho ho... You're a truly powerful opponent.

rooms/dormont/tutokid.html.speaker: Tutorial Kid
rooms/dormont/tutokid.html.dialogue: NO!!!! I threw Rock...!!! I've lost this round...

rooms/dormont/tutokid.html.speaker: Tutorial Kid
rooms/dormont/tutokid.html.dialogue: But... It's not over yet!!!

rooms/dormont/tutokid.html.speaker: Tutorial Kid
rooms/dormont/tutokid.html.dialogue: YEAH!!! My hands have thrown a Rock Shape... Victory is mine this round.

rooms/dormont/tutokid.html.speaker: Tutorial Kid
rooms/dormont/tutokid.html.dialogue: Ok, last round!!! Rock, Paper...
(And finally, Tutorial Kid throws Scissors.)
TUTORIAL KID throws Scissors!
(The Tutorial Kid threw Scissors.)

rooms/dormont/tutokid.html.speaker: Tutorial Kid
rooms/dormont/tutokid.html.dialogue: ...You threw Rock?

rooms/dormont/tutokid.html.speaker: Tutorial Kid
rooms/dormont/tutokid.html.dialogue: No... I threw Scissors... Why this...

rooms/dormont/tutokid.html.speaker: Tutorial Kid
rooms/dormont/tutokid.html.dialogue: HOHA!!!! I HAVE THROWN SCISSORS!!! Victory is mine...

rooms/dormont/tutokid.html.speaker: Tutorial Kid
rooms/dormont/tutokid.html.dialogue: THIS CAN'T BE...!!! A draw, on the last round...

rooms/dormont/tutokid.html.speaker: Tutorial Kid
rooms/dormont/tutokid.html.dialogue: NGH...!!! You won every round... How could this... happen...
(Tutorial Kid puts one knee to the ground, clearly acting as if they're wounded.)

rooms/dormont/tutokid.html.speaker: Tutorial Kid
rooms/dormont/tutokid.html.dialogue: I can do nothing but... accept my defeat.

rooms/dormont/tutokid.html.speaker: Tutorial Kid
rooms/dormont/tutokid.html.dialogue: Anyway here's your reward!
(You got five SOUR TONICS!)
(You got three SUPER SOUR TONICS!)
(You got one SUPER SWEET TONIC!)
(You put them all in your Pockets.)
(Beating a kid to get some items...)

rooms/dormont/tutokid.html.speaker: Tutorial Kid
rooms/dormont/tutokid.html.dialogue: According to the laws of this village... You have won  the Rock Paper Scissors game.

rooms/dormont/tutokid.html.speaker: Tutorial Kid
rooms/dormont/tutokid.html.dialogue: This was an intense battle... Thank you for fighting with me.
(You got one SWEET TONIC!)
(You put it in your Pockets.)

rooms/dormont/tutokid.html.speaker: Tutorial Kid
rooms/dormont/tutokid.html.dialogue: No!!! This can't be... A DRAW?!?

rooms/dormont/tutokid.html.speaker: Tutorial Kid
rooms/dormont/tutokid.html.dialogue: ...You're quite powerful, hat adult. I'll give you that.

rooms/dormont/tutokid.html.speaker: Tutorial Kid
rooms/dormont/tutokid.html.dialogue: Wow I really kicked your butt.

rooms/dormont/tutokid.html.speaker: Tutorial Kid
rooms/dormont/tutokid.html.dialogue: How does it feel to be beaten at Rock Paper Scissors by a little kid?

rooms/dormont/tutokid.html.speaker: Tutorial Kid
rooms/dormont/tutokid.html.dialogue: Mwahaha... MWAHAHAHAHAHA!!!!!

rooms/dormont/tutokid.html.speaker: Tutorial Kid
rooms/dormont/tutokid.html.dialogue: Now you know the basics of Rock Paper Scissors, so you're invincible.

rooms/dormont/tutokid.html.speaker: Tutorial Kid
rooms/dormont/tutokid.html.dialogue: Our training... has come to an end. Farewell!

rooms/dormont/tutokid.html.speaker: Tutorial Kid
rooms/dormont/tutokid.html.dialogue: Ohoho... Are you finally ready to face me...?

rooms/dormont/tutokid.html.speaker: Tutorial Kid
rooms/dormont/tutokid.html.dialogue: Good luck, old one...

rooms/dormont/tutokid.html.speaker: Tutorial Kid
rooms/dormont/tutokid.html.dialogue: Hey!!!! You!!! The strange adult with a hat!!!

rooms/dormont/tutokid.html.speaker: Tutorial Kid
rooms/dormont/tutokid.html.dialogue: My name...... is--

rooms/dormont/tutokid.html.speaker: Siffrin
rooms/dormont/tutokid.html.dialogue: "Tutorial Kid."

rooms/dormont/tutokid.html.speaker: Tutorial Kid
rooms/dormont/tutokid.html.dialogue: Oho?!? My name has spread far and wide, it seems...

rooms/dormont/tutokid.html.speaker: Tutorial Kid
rooms/dormont/tutokid.html.dialogue: Hey, do you wanna--
(You walk away.)

rooms/dormont/tutokid.html.speaker: Tutorial Kid
rooms/dormont/tutokid.html.dialogue: Oh... Okay...

rooms/dormont/tutokid.html.speaker: Siffrin
rooms/dormont/tutokid.html.dialogue: "Let's play Rock Paper Scissors."

rooms/dormont/tutokid.html.speaker: Tutorial Kid
rooms/dormont/tutokid.html.dialogue: Oho?!? You read my mind!!! Let's--
(You play Paper, Rock, and Scissors, in order.)

rooms/dormont/tutokid.html.speaker: Tutorial Kid
rooms/dormont/tutokid.html.dialogue: Wh--How?!

rooms/dormont/tutokid.html.speaker: Tutorial Kid
rooms/dormont/tutokid.html.dialogue: HOW COULD I BE SO EASILY DEFEATEEEEEEEED?!?

rooms/dormont/tutokid.html.speaker: Tutorial Kid
rooms/dormont/tutokid.html.dialogue: Oh, um, wait--
(You walk away.)

rooms/dormont/tutokid.html.speaker: Tutorial Kid
rooms/dormont/tutokid.html.dialogue: Oh... Okay...

rooms/dormont/tutokid.html.speaker: Tutorial Kid
rooms/dormont/tutokid.html.dialogue: No one wants to play with me...

rooms/end/bonnieend.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/end/bonnieend.html.dialogue: Like, for real for real? It's over? The King is gone?

rooms/end/bonnieend.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/end/bonnieend.html.dialogue: ...For real for real? It's over? The King is gone?

rooms/end/bonnieend.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/end/bonnieend.html.dialogue: So I can go back to Bambouche and see my sister again? She'll be okay? She'll move around?
(Bonnie doesn't seem to believe it yet...)

rooms/end/bonnieend.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/end/bonnieend.html.dialogue: Wait, that's such a long journey though!!! I'm not gonna go find you just so I can punch you if you're wrong!!! That's dumb!!!

rooms/end/bonnieend.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/end/bonnieend.html.dialogue: Okay, then I'll believe you!!! Hopefully I won't have to walk forever to punch you!!!

rooms/end/bonnieend.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/end/bonnieend.html.dialogue: We found that book about Craft smells, right?
(Ah, yes, you did that this loop, didn't you...?)

rooms/end/bonnieend.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/end/bonnieend.html.dialogue: Dile said that if it smelled sweet, it might be because of Time Craft...

rooms/end/bonnieend.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/end/bonnieend.html.dialogue: Do you think the King is really gone if it still smells like Time Craft?

rooms/end/bonnieend.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/end/bonnieend.html.dialogue: He's the only one that can use it, right?
(Bonnie mentioned they started smelling sugar yesterday, didn't they...?)

rooms/end/bonnieend.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/end/bonnieend.html.dialogue: Oh, I-I only have a croissant left. Do you still want it?
(The half-eaten apple has a massive bite mark on it.)
(You take it and eat it in three bites, core and all.)

rooms/end/bonnieend.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/end/bonnieend.html.dialogue: But if you say you're okay, then it's true, I guess.

rooms/end/bonnieend.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/end/bonnieend.html.dialogue: WAIT I HAVE SOME PINEAPPLE SLICES LEFT???

rooms/end/bonnieend.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/end/bonnieend.html.dialogue: I won't give them to you, I'm super hungry.
(They just looked through their pockets, but they check again.)

rooms/end/bonnieend.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/end/bonnieend.html.dialogue: WAIT I HAVE SOME PINEAPPLE SLICES LEFT???

rooms/end/bonnieend.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/end/bonnieend.html.dialogue: I know you're hungry too, but I'll keep those for myself, sorry.

rooms/end/bonnieend.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/end/bonnieend.html.dialogue: That way I'll survive until I eat dinner!!! See, aren't I so smart?
(You should make sure to talk to everyone you need to before talking to Isabeau...)
(Bonnie stares at you without saying anything.)

rooms/end/bonnieend.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/end/bonnieend.html.dialogue: You saved me that time, against the Sadness.

rooms/end/bonnieend.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/end/bonnieend.html.dialogue: And you saved me, when we met.

rooms/end/bonnieend.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/end/bonnieend.html.dialogue: You're the one who saw me, back then, right?
(When you first met Bonnie, forever ago...)
(Bonnie was out of it. They'd been walking away from their village for days, when you saw them.)
(Crying, barely hanging on, walking to escape the slowly encroaching King's Curse.)
(They fainted as soon as you got to their side.)

rooms/end/bonnieend.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/end/bonnieend.html.dialogue: I was really really tired then, so I don't remember well...

rooms/end/bonnieend.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/end/bonnieend.html.dialogue: But you saw me, right? You made everyone notice I was there?

rooms/end/bonnieend.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/end/bonnieend.html.dialogue: And I never said thank you for that. Or for protecting me.
(Bonnie runs into you, pressing their face against your left side.)
(Their arms are still at their sides, though...)
(Without raising your arms, you gently lean back against them.)
(Bonnie runs into you, doing the weird no-arms hug again.)
(You lean back, forcing yourself to not raise your arms.)

rooms/end/bonnieend.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/end/bonnieend.html.dialogue: I know you'll leave soon, but, um...

rooms/end/bonnieend.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/end/bonnieend.html.dialogue: Y-You should come by Bambouche one day! So you can meet my sister!!!

rooms/end/bonnieend.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/end/bonnieend.html.dialogue: So I can say...   "That's Frin! They helped me a bunch! They're really cool!!!"

rooms/end/bonnieend.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/end/bonnieend.html.dialogue: So come and see me sometime, yeah?

rooms/end/bonnieend.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/end/bonnieend.html.dialogue: I'll be waiting for you, Frin!!!

rooms/end/endrooms.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/end/endrooms.html.dialogue: Everyone, we did it!!! He's gone!!! The King is gone!!!

rooms/end/endrooms.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/end/endrooms.html.dialogue: HOLY CRAB THAT WAS SCARY!!! WE DID IT?!??! WE DID IT!!!

rooms/end/endrooms.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/end/endrooms.html.dialogue: Hahahahaha!!! Oh, it was close for a second there!

rooms/end/endrooms.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/end/endrooms.html.dialogue: The people around us, I can... I can feel them coming back to normal, all over Vaugarde!!!

rooms/end/endrooms.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/end/endrooms.html.dialogue: Ah, I can feel her, she's okay, she's okay! She's okay!!!

rooms/end/endrooms.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/end/endrooms.html.dialogue: She's just ahead, come on!!! We have to tell her that everything's fine!!! Come on, let's go!!!
[When equipped, Memory of Victory automatically boosts everyone's ATTACK at the start of a battle.]
(You put yourself in front of Odile and hope your hat protects her from the view.)
(You put yourself in front of Odile so she doesn't have to see how impossibly high you are.)

rooms/end/endrooms.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/end/endrooms.html.dialogue: I-I'm fine... Siffrin protected me from the worst of it...

rooms/end/endrooms.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/end/endrooms.html.dialogue: Look at the ground and take my hand, m'dame! I won't let you fall!

rooms/end/endrooms.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/end/endrooms.html.dialogue: The Head Housemaiden is just ahead, come on!!!

rooms/end/endrooms.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/end/endrooms.html.dialogue: One step at a time, m'dame! Let's go!

rooms/end/endrooms.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/end/endrooms.html.dialogue: Siffrin, I will kill you with my bare hands if you bring us closer.

rooms/end/endrooms.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/end/endrooms.html.dialogue: Ooooh how high are we? I wanna--

rooms/end/endrooms.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/end/endrooms.html.dialogue: Please stop the kid from coming closer to the edge I'm gonna faint I'm seriously going to faint if i see the kid gets any closer to the CRABBING EDGE
(You both take a few steps back to reassure Odile.)

rooms/end/endrooms.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/end/endrooms.html.dialogue: Fear of heights is no joke, huh m'dame?

rooms/end/endrooms.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/end/endrooms.html.dialogue: You're too cool. You needed one weakness.

rooms/end/endrooms.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/end/endrooms.html.dialogue: She's so tall... She might have three heads on you, Isabeau.

rooms/end/endrooms.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/end/endrooms.html.dialogue: I-The house, and when- The King--

rooms/end/endrooms.html.speaker: Euphrasie
rooms/end/endrooms.html.dialogue: I'm so proud of you! Look at you! The savior of Vaugarde!!!

rooms/end/endrooms.html.speaker: Euphrasie
rooms/end/endrooms.html.dialogue: You saved the House, and the whole country of Vaugarde. We all owe you a great debt.

rooms/end/endrooms.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/end/endrooms.html.dialogue: Of course. Don't worry, just another day saving a whole country, you know how it is.

rooms/end/endrooms.html.speaker: Euphrasie
rooms/end/endrooms.html.dialogue: Oh, I did not think the King would be so strong...

rooms/end/endrooms.html.speaker: Euphrasie
rooms/end/endrooms.html.dialogue: When he attacked the House, everyone was counting on me... But there was nothing I could do.

rooms/end/endrooms.html.speaker: Euphrasie
rooms/end/endrooms.html.dialogue: Hearing young Mirabelle, who was so shy and reserved, was the one to save all of Vaugarde... You look much more confident in yourself now!

rooms/end/endrooms.html.speaker: Euphrasie
rooms/end/endrooms.html.dialogue: I'm so glad I managed to give you some power before the King's Curse took over me!

rooms/end/endrooms.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/end/endrooms.html.dialogue: Ah, Head Housemaiden, just so you know, everyone thinks the Change God blessed me...

rooms/end/endrooms.html.speaker: Euphrasie
rooms/end/endrooms.html.dialogue: Oh! But why would everyone think that?

rooms/end/endrooms.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/end/endrooms.html.dialogue: People started saying it, and I... I couldn’t say otherwise...

rooms/end/endrooms.html.speaker: Euphrasie
rooms/end/endrooms.html.dialogue: Oh, well that’s a rather silly thing for them to think.

rooms/end/endrooms.html.speaker: Euphrasie
rooms/end/endrooms.html.dialogue: I thought we all knew that the Change God is a pretty lazy deity!

rooms/end/endrooms.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/end/endrooms.html.dialogue: Isn't that a sacrilegious thing to say...?

rooms/end/endrooms.html.speaker: Euphrasie
rooms/end/endrooms.html.dialogue: Oh, my dear Mirabelle... Did you think people would lose hope if they thought the Change God wasn’t the one who blessed you?

rooms/end/endrooms.html.speaker: Euphrasie
rooms/end/endrooms.html.dialogue: I do not blame you, Mirabelle. You acted in a way you thought was right.

rooms/end/endrooms.html.speaker: Euphrasie
rooms/end/endrooms.html.dialogue: I knew I was right to bless you!

rooms/end/endrooms.html.speaker: Euphrasie
rooms/end/endrooms.html.dialogue: Well, I only had the strength to bless one person, and I was already toast, and you were almost out of the House when the King attacked...

rooms/end/endrooms.html.speaker: Euphrasie
rooms/end/endrooms.html.dialogue: So, really, you were the only logical choice!

rooms/end/endrooms.html.speaker: Euphrasie
rooms/end/endrooms.html.dialogue: You have always been the most hardworking Housemaiden in the House. Always striving to learn new things. To better yourself.

rooms/end/endrooms.html.speaker: Euphrasie
rooms/end/endrooms.html.dialogue: Always meeting challenges head on, even if you didn't think you'd succeed.

rooms/end/endrooms.html.speaker: Euphrasie
rooms/end/endrooms.html.dialogue: You were the only logical choice, yes, but you were also the only RIGHT choice!

rooms/end/endrooms.html.speaker: Euphrasie
rooms/end/endrooms.html.dialogue: You are still so stinking cute, Mirabelle!!!

rooms/end/endrooms.html.speaker: Euphrasie
rooms/end/endrooms.html.dialogue: And you, Mirabelle's companions... Thank you for helping her get this far.

rooms/end/endrooms.html.speaker: Euphrasie
rooms/end/endrooms.html.dialogue: You have my gratitude, and the entire country of Vaugarde's...!

rooms/end/endrooms.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/end/endrooms.html.dialogue: No problem at all, m'dame Head Housemaiden! It was an honor!

rooms/end/endrooms.html.speaker: Euphrasie
rooms/end/endrooms.html.dialogue: ...Soon, you'll be able to go back to your normal lives. Away from battle and strife.

rooms/end/endrooms.html.speaker: Euphrasie
rooms/end/endrooms.html.dialogue: Finally, you'll all be able to go home!!!

rooms/end/endrooms.html.speaker: Euphrasie
rooms/end/endrooms.html.dialogue: If there's anything the House of Dormont can do to thank you... Please do not hesitate.

rooms/end/endrooms.html.speaker: Euphrasie
rooms/end/endrooms.html.dialogue: But for now... Bask in the feeling of a job well done!!!
(You managed to defeat the King, and brought peace back to Vaugarde...)
(...Before your journey ends, you should talk to everyone!)
(Last time you got here, you looped right back to the start after talking to the Head Housemaiden, didn't you?)
(Is the loop breaking, when you talk to her? Does she know why?)
(If you talk to her... Will time loop back again...?)
(If you talk to the Head Housemaiden... Will the loop break, and will you loop back once more...?)
(You'll loop back once you talk to the Head Housemaiden.)
(It's all over if you talk to her.)
(Here again, at the end of the world.)
(Time won't ever go farther than this.)
(You can talk to everyone, stretch this moment out as long as you can, but...)
(It's all over if you talk to her.)
(It's all over if you talk to her.)
(It's all over if you talk to her.)
(You managed to beat the King, didn't you? Together with your family?)
(You didn't think helping them the day before would amount to anything, but time changed a little, didn't it?)
(Even if it wasn't much, it changed!)
(It changed! You know them, now! You're a family!)
(Isn't it just like the books Bonbon reads?)
(And so, if you talk to everyone again... Talk to the Head Housemaiden again... Maybe...)
(This is the end of your journey, it has to be!!!)
(She knows about the loops, she knows about Wish Craft, so she must know...)
(She must know how to save you!!!)
(You can ask her about it this loop, and finally bring it all to an end, or...)
(You have to ask the Head Housemaiden about Wish Craft...)
(But maybe it can wait a little longer...?)
(In the distance, way up north, you see it.)
(You look away, before The Universe leads you to.)

rooms/end/euphrasie.html.speaker: Euphrasie
rooms/end/euphrasie.html.dialogue: Oh, traveling one... Siffrin, was it?

rooms/end/euphrasie.html.speaker: Euphrasie
rooms/end/euphrasie.html.dialogue: I cannot thank you enough for what you've done.

rooms/end/euphrasie.html.speaker: Euphrasie
rooms/end/euphrasie.html.dialogue:
I'm sure you and your companions have a lot to talk about... Why
                        don't you talk to them, and come back to me?

rooms/end/euphrasie.html.speaker: Euphrasie
rooms/end/euphrasie.html.dialogue:
I'd love to have a conversation with one of Vaugarde's saviors,
                        after all!

rooms/end/euphrasie.html.speaker: Siffrin
rooms/end/euphrasie.html.dialogue: "But I'd like to talk to you now--"

rooms/end/euphrasie.html.speaker: Euphrasie
rooms/end/euphrasie.html.dialogue: Now? But you and your friends had such a wonderful journey together!

rooms/end/euphrasie.html.speaker: Euphrasie
rooms/end/euphrasie.html.dialogue: And it's about to end! You should go and talk to them!

rooms/end/euphrasie.html.speaker: Euphrasie
rooms/end/euphrasie.html.dialogue:
Don't worry about me! I'll be right here for when you're done
                        talking to them!

rooms/end/euphrasie.html.speaker: Siffrin
rooms/end/euphrasie.html.dialogue: "I have to talk to you about--"

rooms/end/euphrasie.html.speaker: Euphrasie
rooms/end/euphrasie.html.dialogue: Tut tut tut!

rooms/end/euphrasie.html.speaker: Euphrasie
rooms/end/euphrasie.html.dialogue:
This can wait, can't it? I'm sure you and your friends have a lot to
                        talk about, and so little time left to do so!

rooms/end/euphrasie.html.speaker: Euphrasie
rooms/end/euphrasie.html.dialogue: Go on, go on!

rooms/end/euphrasie.html.speaker: Siffrin
rooms/end/euphrasie.html.dialogue: "But you might know something about--"

rooms/end/euphrasie.html.speaker: Euphrasie
rooms/end/euphrasie.html.dialogue: Ohohoho!

rooms/end/euphrasie.html.speaker: Euphrasie
rooms/end/euphrasie.html.dialogue: Sorry, I know nothing until you talk to your friends!

rooms/end/euphrasie.html.speaker: Euphrasie
rooms/end/euphrasie.html.dialogue:
And quite honestly, it is a little funny to see you get steamed
                        about this, ohoho!
(You want to cry.)

rooms/end/euphrasie.html.speaker: Siffrin
rooms/end/euphrasie.html.dialogue: "Can you PLEASE talk to me?"

rooms/end/euphrasie.html.speaker: Euphrasie
rooms/end/euphrasie.html.dialogue: Traveling one... Siffrin... Can't you feel it?
(Huh?)

rooms/end/euphrasie.html.speaker: Euphrasie
rooms/end/euphrasie.html.dialogue: If you talk to me... REALLY talk to me...

rooms/end/euphrasie.html.speaker: Euphrasie
rooms/end/euphrasie.html.dialogue: It's all over.

rooms/end/euphrasie.html.speaker: Euphrasie
rooms/end/euphrasie.html.dialogue: What "it" is, I have no idea...

rooms/end/euphrasie.html.speaker: Euphrasie
rooms/end/euphrasie.html.dialogue:
I know... I can feel that... I couldn't change whatever comes next,
                        even if I wanted to.

rooms/end/euphrasie.html.speaker: Euphrasie
rooms/end/euphrasie.html.dialogue: But I know it is the will of the Change God.

rooms/end/euphrasie.html.speaker: Euphrasie
rooms/end/euphrasie.html.dialogue: Or, no, perhaps... The will of something even bigger...

rooms/end/euphrasie.html.speaker: Euphrasie
rooms/end/euphrasie.html.dialogue: Something will end, once you talk to me.

rooms/end/euphrasie.html.speaker: Euphrasie
rooms/end/euphrasie.html.dialogue:
But before this "something" ends... Don't you want to talk to your
                        companions?

rooms/end/euphrasie.html.speaker: Euphrasie
rooms/end/euphrasie.html.dialogue: So go! Go! Go and talk to everyone!!!
(...)

rooms/end/euphrasie.html.speaker: Euphrasie
rooms/end/euphrasie.html.dialogue: Go on and talk to your companions!

rooms/end/euphrasie.html.speaker: Euphrasie
rooms/end/euphrasie.html.dialogue: I shall wait right in this very spot!
(This is the end.)
(Just a little longer...)
(Just a moment longer, a minute, a second longer...)
(Before the curtain falls.)

rooms/end/euphrasie.html.speaker: Euphrasie
rooms/end/euphrasie.html.dialogue: Traveling one!

rooms/end/euphrasie.html.speaker: Euphrasie
rooms/end/euphrasie.html.dialogue:
Are you done talking with your companions? Yes, wonderful,
                        wonderful!

rooms/end/euphrasie.html.speaker: Euphrasie
rooms/end/euphrasie.html.dialogue:
I'd like to thank you for accompanying young Mirabelle this far. I'm
                        very grateful.

rooms/end/euphrasie.html.speaker: Euphrasie
rooms/end/euphrasie.html.dialogue:
Siffrin, yes? If there's anything I can do to thank you, please
                        don't hesitate to let me know!

rooms/end/euphrasie.html.speaker: Euphrasie
rooms/end/euphrasie.html.dialogue:
I know you will go back on your travels soon, but I do hope you'll
                        keep in touch, if only for young Mirabelle...

rooms/end/euphrasie.html.speaker: Euphrasie
rooms/end/euphrasie.html.dialogue:
But no matter what, know that Dormont will always be open to you!
                        Please come back... any... time...

rooms/end/euphrasie.html.speaker: Euphrasie
rooms/end/euphrasie.html.dialogue: ...!!!!!

rooms/end/euphrasie.html.speaker: Euphrasie
rooms/end/euphrasie.html.dialogue: Oh... Oh no. Oh no, no, no, no, no...

rooms/end/euphrasie.html.speaker: Euphrasie
rooms/end/euphrasie.html.dialogue: Oh...   Siffrin...!

rooms/end/euphrasie.html.speaker: Euphrasie
rooms/end/euphrasie.html.dialogue: I'm so sorry!   There's no way we can stop it now...!

rooms/end/euphrasie.html.speaker: Euphrasie
rooms/end/euphrasie.html.dialogue: I'm sorry! You'll be going back! Back when everything started!
(The air around you feels weird...)
(You taste burnt sugar in the back of your throat.)

rooms/end/euphrasie.html.speaker: Siffrin
rooms/end/euphrasie.html.dialogue: "What do you mean? What's happening?!?"

rooms/end/euphrasie.html.speaker: Euphrasie
rooms/end/euphrasie.html.dialogue: I know you thought your quest was over, but it can't be!

rooms/end/euphrasie.html.speaker: Euphrasie
rooms/end/euphrasie.html.dialogue: Something's broken, something's failing, rotting!!!

rooms/end/euphrasie.html.speaker: Euphrasie
rooms/end/euphrasie.html.dialogue:
I can't fix it on my own, not before it all ends... If only I had
                        noticed sooner!!!

rooms/end/euphrasie.html.speaker: Euphrasie
rooms/end/euphrasie.html.dialogue: I should've seen it, prevented it!!!
(You feel a tug on your stomach.)

rooms/end/euphrasie.html.speaker: Euphrasie
rooms/end/euphrasie.html.dialogue: It's my fault that you have to suffer like this.

rooms/end/euphrasie.html.speaker: Euphrasie
rooms/end/euphrasie.html.dialogue: I just hope that one day...

rooms/end/euphrasie.html.speaker: Euphrasie
rooms/end/euphrasie.html.dialogue: You might learn to for
(It's the same so far...)

(You should ask her something, quickly, in case the loops restarts
                        on its own again.)
(Something like...)

rooms/end/euphrasie.html.speaker: Siffrin
rooms/end/euphrasie.html.dialogue: "You said something was broken, what was it?"

rooms/end/euphrasie.html.speaker: Euphrasie
rooms/end/euphrasie.html.dialogue: Broken...? What do you...

rooms/end/euphrasie.html.speaker: Euphrasie
rooms/end/euphrasie.html.dialogue: ...!!!!!

rooms/end/euphrasie.html.speaker: Euphrasie
rooms/end/euphrasie.html.dialogue: Oh... Oh no. Oh no, no, no, no, no...
(Huh...? Something's weird...)
(Is... Is she...)

rooms/end/euphrasie.html.speaker: Euphrasie
rooms/end/euphrasie.html.dialogue: Oh... Siffrin...!

rooms/end/euphrasie.html.speaker: Euphrasie
rooms/end/euphrasie.html.dialogue: I'm so sorry! There's no way we can stop it now...!

rooms/end/euphrasie.html.speaker: Euphrasie
rooms/end/euphrasie.html.dialogue: I'm sorry! You'll be going back! Back when everything started!

(You inhale sharply, almost choking on the smell of burnt sugar
                        around you.)
(Stars, no, no, no, no, no...)
(She is. You're not imagining it.)
(She's repeating the exact same thing as the first time...!!!)

rooms/end/euphrasie.html.speaker: Siffrin
rooms/end/euphrasie.html.dialogue: "Don't just repeat it, say something...!!!"

rooms/end/euphrasie.html.speaker: Euphrasie
rooms/end/euphrasie.html.dialogue: I know you thought your quest was over, but it can't be!

rooms/end/euphrasie.html.speaker: Euphrasie
rooms/end/euphrasie.html.dialogue: Something's broken, something's failing, rotting!!!

rooms/end/euphrasie.html.speaker: Euphrasie
rooms/end/euphrasie.html.dialogue:
I can't fix it on my own, not before it all ends... If only I had
                        noticed sooner!!!

rooms/end/euphrasie.html.speaker: Euphrasie
rooms/end/euphrasie.html.dialogue: I should've seen it, prevented it!!!
(No, no, no, she could've answered your questions, why?!?)

(Even though you asked for something different at the start of this
                        conversation...)
(WHY IS SHE REPEATING THE EXACT SAME THING?!?)

rooms/end/euphrasie.html.speaker: Siffrin
rooms/end/euphrasie.html.dialogue: "JUST TALK TO ME!!!"
(You feel a tug on your stomach.)

rooms/end/euphrasie.html.speaker: Euphrasie
rooms/end/euphrasie.html.dialogue: It's my fault that you have to suffer like this.

rooms/end/euphrasie.html.speaker: Euphrasie
rooms/end/euphrasie.html.dialogue: I just hope that one day...

rooms/end/euphrasie.html.speaker: Euphrasie
rooms/end/euphrasie.html.dialogue: You might learn to for
(Same as usual, it seems...)

(Maybe if you start with something else, still? Surprise her
                        somehow?)

rooms/end/euphrasie.html.speaker: Siffrin
rooms/end/euphrasie.html.dialogue: "Will you repeat the same lines again?"

rooms/end/euphrasie.html.speaker: Euphrasie
rooms/end/euphrasie.html.dialogue: The same lines...? What do you...

rooms/end/euphrasie.html.speaker: Euphrasie
