rooms/end/euphrasie.html.speaker: Euphrasie
rooms/end/euphrasie.html.dialogue: Traveling one!

rooms/end/euphrasie.html.speaker: Euphrasie
rooms/end/euphrasie.html.dialogue:
Are you done talking with your companions? Yes, wonderful,
                                        wonderful!

rooms/end/euphrasie.html.speaker: Euphrasie
rooms/end/euphrasie.html.dialogue:
I'd like to thank you for accompanying young Mirabelle this
                                        far. I'm very grateful.

rooms/end/euphrasie.html.speaker: Euphrasie
rooms/end/euphrasie.html.dialogue:
Siffrin, yes? If there's anything I can do to thank you,
                                        please don't hesitate to let me know!

rooms/end/euphrasie.html.speaker: Euphrasie
rooms/end/euphrasie.html.dialogue:
I know you will go back on your travels soon, but I do hope
                                        you'll keep in touch, if only for young Mirabelle...

rooms/end/euphrasie.html.speaker: Euphrasie
rooms/end/euphrasie.html.dialogue:
But no matter what, know that Dormont will always be open to
                                        you! Please come back--

rooms/end/euphrasie.html.speaker: Siffrin
rooms/end/euphrasie.html.dialogue: "I know about Wish Craft!"

rooms/end/euphrasie.html.speaker: Euphrasie
rooms/end/euphrasie.html.dialogue: Wish Craft...?

rooms/end/euphrasie.html.speaker: Euphrasie
rooms/end/euphrasie.html.dialogue:
Oh, Wish Craft! Yes, it just so happened that a lot of
                                        people in Vaugarde wished for our country to be saved!

rooms/end/euphrasie.html.speaker: Euphrasie
rooms/end/euphrasie.html.dialogue:
I did not think it would work, but if you're here, perhaps
                                        it... Did...

rooms/end/euphrasie.html.speaker: Euphrasie
rooms/end/euphrasie.html.dialogue: Oh... Oh no. Oh no, no, no, no, no...

rooms/end/euphrasie.html.speaker: Euphrasie
rooms/end/euphrasie.html.dialogue: Oh... Siffrin...!

rooms/end/euphrasie.html.speaker: Euphrasie
rooms/end/euphrasie.html.dialogue: I'm so sorry! There's no way we can stop it now...!

rooms/end/euphrasie.html.speaker: Euphrasie
rooms/end/euphrasie.html.dialogue:
I'm sorry! You'll be going back! Back when everything
                                        started!

rooms/end/euphrasie.html.speaker: Siffrin
rooms/end/euphrasie.html.dialogue: "But you can fix it, can't you?!"

rooms/end/euphrasie.html.speaker: Euphrasie
rooms/end/euphrasie.html.dialogue: I know you thought your quest was over, but it can't be!

rooms/end/euphrasie.html.speaker: Euphrasie
rooms/end/euphrasie.html.dialogue: Something's broken, something's failing, rotting!!!
(No, no, no, she's repeating the same things still!!!)

(Why is she always repeating the same thing, over and over
                                        and over?!)

rooms/end/euphrasie.html.speaker: Siffrin
rooms/end/euphrasie.html.dialogue: (You just wish she would ANSWER YOU!!!!!! ) "Now that you know, now that I know, you can fix it!!!"

rooms/end/euphrasie.html.speaker: Euphrasie
rooms/end/euphrasie.html.dialogue: Fix it?

rooms/end/euphrasie.html.speaker: Euphrasie
rooms/end/euphrasie.html.dialogue: No. It's too late, Siffrin. It's always been too late.

rooms/end/euphrasie.html.speaker: Siffrin
rooms/end/euphrasie.html.dialogue:
(What? But...) "But if you know about Wish Craft... You must
                                        know how to--"

rooms/end/euphrasie.html.speaker: Euphrasie
rooms/end/euphrasie.html.dialogue: Oh, Siffrin...!

rooms/end/euphrasie.html.speaker: Euphrasie
rooms/end/euphrasie.html.dialogue:
It's true. All of Vaugarde wished to the Favor Tree, wished
                                        for us to be saved.

rooms/end/euphrasie.html.speaker: Euphrasie
rooms/end/euphrasie.html.dialogue:
We wished for a savior. A way for us to win against the
                                        King.

rooms/end/euphrasie.html.speaker: Euphrasie
rooms/end/euphrasie.html.dialogue:
And Wish Craft gave us the means to do it, didn't it? Made
                                        sure it'd work?

rooms/end/euphrasie.html.speaker: Euphrasie
rooms/end/euphrasie.html.dialogue:
Somehow, Wish Craft gave us a savior, able to use Time
                                        Craft... Able to retry, as many times as it took! So you
                                        could beat the King!!!

rooms/end/euphrasie.html.speaker: Siffrin
rooms/end/euphrasie.html.dialogue: "Right! So--"

rooms/end/euphrasie.html.speaker: Euphrasie
rooms/end/euphrasie.html.dialogue: But... But something went wrong, didn't it?

rooms/end/euphrasie.html.speaker: Euphrasie
rooms/end/euphrasie.html.dialogue: Something goes wrong, every time!!!

rooms/end/euphrasie.html.speaker: Euphrasie
rooms/end/euphrasie.html.dialogue:
If you're here now, asking about Wish Craft, then something
                                        must be wrong, isn't it? This isn't the first time you've
                                        gotten this far, isn't it?!?

rooms/end/euphrasie.html.speaker: Euphrasie
rooms/end/euphrasie.html.dialogue:
It shouldn't be like this... Why does time loop back, even
                                        though the King has been defeated?!?

rooms/end/euphrasie.html.speaker: Euphrasie
rooms/end/euphrasie.html.dialogue:
The only answer I can find... Is it's because we did it
                                        wrong.

rooms/end/euphrasie.html.speaker: Euphrasie
rooms/end/euphrasie.html.dialogue: I don't know what happened! But we must've done it wrong!!!

rooms/end/euphrasie.html.speaker: Euphrasie
rooms/end/euphrasie.html.dialogue:
None of us in Vaugarde knew the exact ritual, but-- But we
                                        must have done it so wrong, it broke, and it doesn't answer
                                        to us at all anymore!!!

rooms/end/euphrasie.html.speaker: Euphrasie
rooms/end/euphrasie.html.dialogue:
Or maybe-- Maybe someone wished for it, wished for our wish
                                        to fail!!! Wished for this!!!

rooms/end/euphrasie.html.speaker: Euphrasie
rooms/end/euphrasie.html.dialogue: Something made our wish break, made it fail, made it rot!!!

rooms/end/euphrasie.html.speaker: Euphrasie
rooms/end/euphrasie.html.dialogue:
O-Or maybe the wish can't come true anymore, somehow!!!
                                        Maybe the King wasn't defeated the right way-- It'll forever
                                        remain incomplete, and Wish Craft, the world, will not abide
                                        it!!!

rooms/end/euphrasie.html.speaker: Euphrasie
rooms/end/euphrasie.html.dialogue: I don't know, I don't know, I don't know!!!
(You can't move.)
(You can't breathe.)
(The wish... Is broken?)
(She can't help you, even now?)
(You're stuck here forever?)

rooms/end/euphrasie.html.speaker: Euphrasie
rooms/end/euphrasie.html.dialogue:
If only... If only we had fought back against the King,
                                        instead! If only we didn't wish for such a thing!

rooms/end/euphrasie.html.speaker: Euphrasie
rooms/end/euphrasie.html.dialogue:
If only I knew this would happen, if I had noticed it
                                        sooner, I would never have let people wish at all!!!

rooms/end/euphrasie.html.speaker: Euphrasie
rooms/end/euphrasie.html.dialogue:
To know you'll be trapped for all eternity, Siffrin... I am
                                        so sorry!!!

rooms/end/euphrasie.html.speaker: Euphrasie
rooms/end/euphrasie.html.dialogue:
It's our fault, all of Vaugarde, that you have to suffer
                                        like this!!!

rooms/end/euphrasie.html.speaker: Euphrasie
rooms/end/euphrasie.html.dialogue: I just hope that one day...

rooms/end/euphrasie.html.speaker: Euphrasie
rooms/end/euphrasie.html.dialogue: You might learn to forgive us!!!!!!
(Just a little longer...)
(Just a moment longer, a minute, a second longer...)
(Before the curtain falls.)

rooms/end/isaend.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/end/isaend.html.dialogue: We did it, Sif, we did it! We did it! We stopped the King! We can finally go back to our normal lives! Isn't it great???

rooms/end/isaend.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/end/isaend.html.dialogue: ...We did it! We stopped the King! We can finally go back to our normal lives! Isn't it great???

rooms/end/isaend.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/end/isaend.html.dialogue: I... Uh. I said. Do you remember what I said? At the Clocktower?
(He wanted to tell you something after you beat the King, didn't he...)

rooms/end/isaend.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/end/isaend.html.dialogue: ARE YOU GUYS DONE TALKING ALREADY?????? CRAB!!!!!

rooms/end/isaend.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/end/isaend.html.dialogue: I wanna go so I can eat dinner!!! I'm super duper hungry!!!!!

rooms/end/isaend.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/end/isaend.html.dialogue: So are you done? Are you done talking?
(He didn't get to tell you what he wanted... That's too bad.)

rooms/end/isaend.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/end/isaend.html.dialogue: But, Sif, I'm glad this is over!

rooms/end/isaend.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/end/isaend.html.dialogue: I can't wait to go back to my old job, you know? Make sure to say hi when you're near Jouvente, 'kay?

rooms/end/isaend.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/end/isaend.html.dialogue: I'm so glad we managed to win!!! Can you believe it?

rooms/end/isaend.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/end/isaend.html.dialogue: I think this calls for a group hug!!!

rooms/end/isaend.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/end/isaend.html.dialogue: Of course you'll pass. You and Frin never join group hugs.
(You watch Mirabelle, Isabeau and Bonnie hug.)

rooms/end/isaend.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/end/isaend.html.dialogue: Doesn't matter at all, it wasn't that important!

rooms/end/isaend.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/end/isaend.html.dialogue: Come on, go talk to everyone! I have... Some thinking to do.

rooms/end/isaend.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/end/isaend.html.dialogue: But, Sif, I'm glad this is over!

rooms/end/isaend.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/end/isaend.html.dialogue: I can't wait to go back to my old job, you know? Make sure to say hi when you're near Jouvente, 'kay?

rooms/end/isaend.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/end/isaend.html.dialogue: Are you both finished? Please wrap it up so we can go.

rooms/end/isaend.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/end/isaend.html.dialogue: There's so much we have to do before we can go back to our lives. You two can talk later, okay?

rooms/end/isaend.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/end/isaend.html.dialogue: It's fine. It's fine. It's all good.

rooms/end/isaend.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/end/isaend.html.dialogue: No problem! Don't worry about it!

rooms/end/isaend.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/end/isaend.html.dialogue: There has to be a better moment later. A better moment than... Saving the country...

rooms/end/isaend.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/end/isaend.html.dialogue: But, Sif, I'm glad this is over!

rooms/end/isaend.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/end/isaend.html.dialogue: I can't wait to go back to my old job, you know? Make sure to say hi when you're near Jouvente, 'kay?

rooms/end/isaend.html.speaker: Siffrin
rooms/end/isaend.html.dialogue: "Nothing! What did you want to tell me?"

rooms/end/isaend.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/end/isaend.html.dialogue: No, it doesn't matter right now. You don't look good at all.

rooms/end/isaend.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/end/isaend.html.dialogue: Are you hungry, maybe? I can tell Bonnie to--
(Oooooooooooooh, you want to scream. You just want to scream right now.)
(You did everything right. And he won't say it. He can't say it. The Universe won't let him say it!)
(You're not stupid. You know what it is! What he wants to tell you! You know!)
(But it doesn't count if he doesn't say it! It doesn't exist if it's not said!)
(In fact, you can't trust it even if he did say it! Maybe it's not even true! Maybe it is! Maybe it is and it's because you forced him to!)
(You did, didn't you? You forced him, you're forcing him right now!)
(Looping forwards and backwards, making sure no one can interrupt, making sure everything is perfect! Making sure you're perfect!)
(It's because you're looping, you're forcing him, manipulating him to say it! To think it!)
(Making sure he has to say it! Making sure he has no recourse!)
(It's not good! It's awful! He can't feel this way about someone like you!)

rooms/end/isaend.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/end/isaend.html.dialogue: --frin, Siffrin! Please stop gripping your hair, you're going to hurt yourself--
(You feel a tug on your stomach--)

rooms/end/isaend.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/end/isaend.html.dialogue: Anyway, Sif, I'm glad this is over!

rooms/end/isaend.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/end/isaend.html.dialogue: I can't wait to go back to my old job, you know? Make sure to say hi when you're near Jouvente, 'kay?
(You nod, smile fixed on your face.)
[When equipped, Memory of Confession makes your Fighter immune to Rock attacks.]
(You try to keep your face neutral.)
(Or will a neutral face make him stop--)
(Oh, wait, you remembered. It doesn't matter what you do.)

rooms/end/isaend.html.speaker: Siffrin
rooms/end/isaend.html.dialogue: "I should go talk with everyone else."

rooms/end/isaend.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/end/isaend.html.dialogue: It wasn't important anyway! Go talk to everyone!

rooms/end/isaend.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/end/isaend.html.dialogue: But, Sif, I'm glad this is over!

rooms/end/isaend.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/end/isaend.html.dialogue: I can't wait to go back to my old job, you know?

rooms/end/isaend.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/end/isaend.html.dialogue: Okay, go talk to everyone! Shoo!

rooms/end/isaend.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/end/isaend.html.dialogue: I don't know, you've had a weird vibe since yesterday, so I just wanna make sure you're good now.

rooms/end/isaend.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/end/isaend.html.dialogue: I mean, "Okay, good", as in "I don't believe you for a second but we'll have time to talk about it tonight", you know.

rooms/end/isaend.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/end/isaend.html.dialogue: Come on, go and talk to everyone else!
(He doesn't seem to be able to meet your gaze for some reason...)

rooms/end/isaend.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/end/isaend.html.dialogue: Sif!!! We did it!!! We beat the King!!!

rooms/end/isaend.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/end/isaend.html.dialogue: OH! HAHA! Yes! I did! Um. Okay.

rooms/end/isaend.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/end/isaend.html.dialogue: INDEED IT IS, BUDDY!!! HAHAHA!!!!! Okay.

rooms/end/isaend.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/end/isaend.html.dialogue: Okay, so. The thing. I said I would tell you. Is...

rooms/end/isaend.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/end/isaend.html.dialogue: Nah, I just... It doesn't really matter that much.

rooms/end/isaend.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/end/isaend.html.dialogue: I really want us to have a feelings talky-talk about YOUR feelings, before we go our separate ways...

rooms/end/isaend.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/end/isaend.html.dialogue: And I can always tell you my thing after that!

rooms/end/isaend.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/end/isaend.html.dialogue: So, nevermind! Sorry! I'll tell you later!

rooms/end/isaend.html.speaker: Siffrin
rooms/end/isaend.html.dialogue: (It didn't work the first time, but...)

rooms/end/isaend.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/end/isaend.html.dialogue: Wow, you're really curious about it, huh?

rooms/end/isaend.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/end/isaend.html.dialogue: But nope! I will not say a thing!

rooms/end/isaend.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/end/isaend.html.dialogue: Oh! But I will say something, though.
(Somehow, you feel a little let down that he didn't try the usual thing.)
(In this moment, you can tell, he means it.)
(You, on the other hand, always mean it.)

rooms/end/isaend.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/end/isaend.html.dialogue: Oh crab, I think I might cry. Haha!

rooms/end/isaend.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/end/isaend.html.dialogue: I hope you'll at least visit sometime, Sif.

rooms/end/isaend.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/end/isaend.html.dialogue: Our journey is over, but don't be a stranger, okay?

rooms/end/miraend.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/end/miraend.html.dialogue: I... I'm not dreaming, am I?

rooms/end/miraend.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/end/miraend.html.dialogue: We won, didn't we? Are you sure? We really won?

rooms/end/miraend.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/end/miraend.html.dialogue: I don't think I can believe it just yet, to be honest???

rooms/end/miraend.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/end/miraend.html.dialogue: W-We fought the King, and, and the last attack I dealt did the trick and defeated him, but...

rooms/end/miraend.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/end/miraend.html.dialogue: It's been... It's been such a long journey, you know?

rooms/end/miraend.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/end/miraend.html.dialogue: I... I can't believe it's over... I...
(Oh no, she's shaking!!! She's crying!!! Do something!!!)
(You both breathe slowly, in, and out.)

rooms/end/miraend.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/end/miraend.html.dialogue: Heh, you don't look like you believe it, but it's true!

rooms/end/miraend.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/end/miraend.html.dialogue: Um!!! I know we haven't known each other for that long...

rooms/end/miraend.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/end/miraend.html.dialogue: B-But I hope you know I really treasure your company! I do! I really really do!!!

rooms/end/miraend.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/end/miraend.html.dialogue: And so...   Thank you! Thank you for accompanying me on this journey!
(You smile so hard, your cheeks start to hurt.)
(You smile so hard, your cheeks start to hurt.)

rooms/end/miraend.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/end/miraend.html.dialogue: ...I'm sure you're excited to go back to traveling on your own...

rooms/end/miraend.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/end/miraend.html.dialogue: Come see me at Dormont anytime! I'd love to hang out!
(You all might have to hang out for a little bit longer.)
("I'm sorry, Mira!", you think. "We'll never be able to hang out together in Dormont!")

rooms/end/miraend.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/end/miraend.html.dialogue: M-Me? Well, I'm better now, but...

rooms/end/miraend.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/end/miraend.html.dialogue: Siffrin... Do you remember, a few weeks ago... When I asked you if you liked being on this journey?

rooms/end/miraend.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/end/miraend.html.dialogue: You said... That being on this journey was the happiest you could remember being.

rooms/end/miraend.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/end/miraend.html.dialogue: Okay. If that's the truth, then I'm glad.

rooms/end/miraend.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/end/miraend.html.dialogue: Oh, would you be okay with it??? I'd love to!!!
(You should make sure to talk to everyone before talking to Isabeau...)

rooms/end/miraend.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/end/miraend.html.dialogue: Hehe... I know you may be tired of hearing this by now...

rooms/end/miraend.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/end/miraend.html.dialogue: But I'm glad we talked yesterday!

rooms/end/miraend.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/end/miraend.html.dialogue: ...   I've always thought Change was about changing yourself, and only yourself.

rooms/end/miraend.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/end/miraend.html.dialogue: If I couldn't be how I thought I had to be... Clearly the fault was mine, you know?

rooms/end/miraend.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/end/miraend.html.dialogue: It's my responsibility to Change. Even if I don't want to.

rooms/end/miraend.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/end/miraend.html.dialogue: But... If even you, Siffrin, can understand what I'm going through... If you're the same, even in a small way...

rooms/end/miraend.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/end/miraend.html.dialogue: Then I must believe that I'm not the only one feeling this way about the Change belief, either!

rooms/end/miraend.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/end/miraend.html.dialogue: And if I'm not the only one feeling restricted by the Change belief... If there's more people out there, feeling the same as I do...

rooms/end/miraend.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/end/miraend.html.dialogue: Then shouldn't the belief change, instead of us?

rooms/end/miraend.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/end/miraend.html.dialogue: I have a lot ahead of me, still.

rooms/end/miraend.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/end/miraend.html.dialogue: But I never would have realized this without you, Siffrin!

rooms/end/miraend.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/end/miraend.html.dialogue: S-So, whenever you're done traveling, or you'd like to stay someplace for a little bit...

rooms/end/miraend.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/end/miraend.html.dialogue: Maybe think about coming to visit Dormont? Just to say hi?

rooms/end/miraend.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/end/miraend.html.dialogue: B-But you don't have to!!! It's just an idea!!!

rooms/end/miraend.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/end/miraend.html.dialogue: D-Don't forget about me on your journey, okay!

rooms/end/odileend.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/end/odileend.html.dialogue: Woop woop, we did it, we won, etc.

rooms/end/odileend.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/end/odileend.html.dialogue: This was... quite a workout. My entire body is screaming.

rooms/end/odileend.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/end/odileend.html.dialogue: Savior of Vaugarde, huh? That's something to add to my list of accomplishments.

rooms/end/odileend.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/end/odileend.html.dialogue: But now I can finally go back to traveling. I'd be curious to visit some more Vaugardian cities and hear what they have to say after an event like this.

rooms/end/odileend.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/end/odileend.html.dialogue: It'll be weird to travel alone now, but I'll get used to it again.

rooms/end/odileend.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/end/odileend.html.dialogue: Or I could just go home to Ka Bue... Hm...

rooms/end/odileend.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/end/odileend.html.dialogue: Are you hoping I'll tell you now that our journey is over?

rooms/end/odileend.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/end/odileend.html.dialogue: Oh, so you figured it out, did you?

rooms/end/odileend.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/end/odileend.html.dialogue: Don't tell anyone. I'd like to see Isabeau try to figure it out for a little longer.

rooms/end/odileend.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/end/odileend.html.dialogue: Very excited to hear what he comes up with next. Spoonology? Bananalogy?

rooms/end/odileend.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/end/odileend.html.dialogue: You're a little strange, but you're a good kid. Maybe try letting down your walls every once in a while, huh?

rooms/end/odileend.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/end/odileend.html.dialogue: And come to Ka Bue anytime. Maybe we'll meet again during your travels.

rooms/end/odileend.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/end/odileend.html.dialogue: AH!!!!!! I HAVE EVEN MORE PINEAPPLE SLICES IN MY POCKET!!!!!!

rooms/end/odileend.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/end/odileend.html.dialogue: I don't know, Siffrin. You've felt off since yesterday. More withdrawn, mostly.

rooms/end/odileend.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/end/odileend.html.dialogue: ...It's okay if you don't want to tell me, you know.

rooms/end/odileend.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/end/odileend.html.dialogue: ...I'm missing something. I must be...

rooms/end/odileend.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/end/odileend.html.dialogue: Just know I'm here if you want to talk.

rooms/end/odileend.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/end/odileend.html.dialogue: Well, not for much longer. So you better tell me soon.

rooms/end/odileend.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/end/odileend.html.dialogue: I have to say I'm surprised, Siffrin. I thought you didn't know--
(Back to looking around curiously, like always.)
(She sees you stare, and flashes you a smile.)

rooms/end/odileend.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/end/odileend.html.dialogue: Well, we did it! We won.

rooms/end/odileend.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/end/odileend.html.dialogue: It was fun. Traveling with everyone.

rooms/end/odileend.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/end/odileend.html.dialogue: I... I suppose everyone will go back to their homes, now...

rooms/end/odileend.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/end/odileend.html.dialogue: Mirabelle will probably stay here, Isabeau will probably go back to Jouvente, and we'll ask someone to accompany Bonnie back to Bambouche...

rooms/end/odileend.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/end/odileend.html.dialogue: And what about you, Siffrin? Will you be going back home?

rooms/end/odileend.html.speaker: Siffrin
rooms/end/odileend.html.dialogue: (Why not say it, in the end?)

rooms/end/odileend.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/end/odileend.html.dialogue: No. Sorry, this isn't any of my business.

rooms/end/odileend.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/end/odileend.html.dialogue: ...I'll probably be going back to Ka Bue soon.

rooms/end/odileend.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/end/odileend.html.dialogue: Our paths will diverge soon... But if you ever come towards Ka Bue...

rooms/end/odileend.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/end/odileend.html.dialogue: Please come by, and say hello, won't you?

rooms/end/odileend.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/end/odileend.html.dialogue: Let's at least eat together tonight, hm?

rooms/end/odileend.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/end/odileend.html.dialogue: I don't know, Siffrin. You've felt off since yesterday. More withdrawn, mostly.

rooms/end/odileend.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/end/odileend.html.dialogue: ...It's okay if you don't want to tell me, you know.

rooms/end/odileend.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/end/odileend.html.dialogue: So Time Craft has nothing to do with you?

rooms/end/odileend.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/end/odileend.html.dialogue: And the fact that you knew how to read that book about Wish Craft... Knew how to wish correctly, when no one else did...

rooms/end/odileend.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/end/odileend.html.dialogue: And the way you're acting, doing that stupid smile like nothing's wrong...

rooms/end/odileend.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/end/odileend.html.dialogue: If I find something strange, I can do nothing except give it my full attention.

rooms/end/odileend.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/end/odileend.html.dialogue: There were so many signs... I did not understand them, but now I do!

rooms/end/odileend.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/end/odileend.html.dialogue: You've been acting strange since you woke up from your nap, yesterday!

rooms/end/odileend.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/end/odileend.html.dialogue: When we talk to you, you act out of it, almost bored...

rooms/end/odileend.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/end/odileend.html.dialogue: And the way you reacted to the rocks falling...

rooms/end/odileend.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/end/odileend.html.dialogue: We all jumped, but you just looked at them fall, calmly.

rooms/end/odileend.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/end/odileend.html.dialogue: And there's so many other things, the way you reacted to so many things throughout our entire journey through the House!

rooms/end/odileend.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/end/odileend.html.dialogue: And how every time you found the keys we needed to proceed, you didn't seem surprised, like you knew exactly where they were.

rooms/end/odileend.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/end/odileend.html.dialogue: Even that key hidden in the classroom.

rooms/end/odileend.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/end/odileend.html.dialogue: . . .  Like you had found them before, maybe?
(No no no no no no--)

rooms/end/odileend.html.speaker: Siffrin
rooms/end/odileend.html.dialogue: (Say something!!!) "B-But that'd be impossible, though!"

rooms/end/odileend.html.speaker: Siffrin
rooms/end/odileend.html.dialogue: "How could I have known where the keys were when it's my first time here?!?"

rooms/end/odileend.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/end/odileend.html.dialogue: I don't know, Siffrin, why don't you enlighten me?!

rooms/end/odileend.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/end/odileend.html.dialogue: Don't think I believed that whole "I wished croissants would disappear~" thing, too.

rooms/end/odileend.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/end/odileend.html.dialogue: So, if you lied about your wish...

rooms/end/odileend.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/end/odileend.html.dialogue: What did you wish for, then?

rooms/end/odileend.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/end/odileend.html.dialogue: Did something happen? To you, to us? Did we die against the King, maybe?

rooms/end/odileend.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/end/odileend.html.dialogue: Is that why  you're repeating the same events, Siffrin?

rooms/end/odileend.html.speaker: Siffrin
rooms/end/odileend.html.dialogue: "Even if you figure it out, Odile..."

rooms/end/odileend.html.speaker: Siffrin
rooms/end/odileend.html.dialogue: "It's too late! It's too late! It's always too late!!!"

rooms/end/odileend.html.speaker: Siffrin
rooms/end/odileend.html.dialogue: "Did you have to figure it out now, when it's all about to end?"

rooms/end/odileend.html.speaker: Siffrin
rooms/end/odileend.html.dialogue: "You can't help me, Odile!!! No one can!!!"

rooms/end/odileend.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/end/odileend.html.dialogue: What's happening? Why are you yelling?

rooms/end/odileend.html.speaker: Siffrin
rooms/end/odileend.html.dialogue: "And I think, weirdly, I don't even want you to help me?"

rooms/end/odileend.html.speaker: Siffrin
rooms/end/odileend.html.dialogue: "Why don't I want you to help me?"

rooms/end/odileend.html.speaker: Siffrin
rooms/end/odileend.html.dialogue: "Maybe because I know that if you help me, you'll start hating me!!!"

rooms/end/odileend.html.speaker: Siffrin
rooms/end/odileend.html.dialogue: "Because I don't know why this is all happening, but--"

rooms/end/odileend.html.speaker: Siffrin
rooms/end/odileend.html.dialogue: "It must be because of me, that we're repeating the same events!!!"

rooms/end/odileend.html.speaker: Siffrin
rooms/end/odileend.html.dialogue:
"And if you knew that, you'd hate me"
<!--no punctuation sic-->

rooms/end/odileend.html.speaker: Siffrin
rooms/end/odileend.html.dialogue:
"And I don't want you to hate me"
<!--no punctuation sic-->

rooms/end/odileend.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/end/odileend.html.dialogue: ...It's okay if you don't want to tell me, you know.

rooms/end/odileend.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/end/odileend.html.dialogue: Alright, well, if that was all...

rooms/end/odileend.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/end/odileend.html.dialogue: I don't know, Siffrin. You've felt off since yesterday. More withdrawn, mostly.

rooms/end/odileend.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/end/odileend.html.dialogue: ...It's okay if you don't want to tell me, you know.

rooms/end/odileend.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/end/odileend.html.dialogue: Alright, well, if that was all...

rooms/entrance/circlekey.html.dialogue: (Could it be the key to open the door? Probably, right?)
(The Circle Key is laying on the floor...)
(The keychain dangling from it is shaped like a circle inside a circle inside a circle...)

rooms/entrance/circlekey.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/entrance/circlekey.html.dialogue: The design on the keychain, you mean?

rooms/entrance/circlekey.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/entrance/circlekey.html.dialogue: It's one of the symbols of the House of Change belief!

rooms/entrance/circlekey.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/entrance/circlekey.html.dialogue: It's to show that we are all part of something bigger! The first circle is inside the bigger circle, which is also inside a bigger circle!

rooms/entrance/circlekey.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/entrance/circlekey.html.dialogue: It's also part of a Housemaiden's uniform!

rooms/entrance/circlekey.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/entrance/circlekey.html.dialogue: Yes! This is how I decided to wear it, but you can wear it however you want- as a necklace, a design on your clothes...

rooms/entrance/circlekey.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/entrance/circlekey.html.dialogue: Or not at all! Breaking traditions is also part of the Change belief!

rooms/entrance/circlekey.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/entrance/circlekey.html.dialogue: And the teardrops on your brooch?

rooms/entrance/circlekey.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/entrance/circlekey.html.dialogue: Pretty. Goes "ding ding" when I walk.

rooms/entrance/circlekey.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/entrance/circlekey.html.dialogue: Don't you love it when things go "ding ding" when you walk...

rooms/entrance/circlekey.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/entrance/circlekey.html.dialogue: Which is inside the House, which is inside Dormont, inside Vaugarde, inside this world...
(She points at the smallest circle on the keychain.)

rooms/entrance/circlekey.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/entrance/circlekey.html.dialogue: It's to remind us that as much as we change, we are still a part of this world... And we must all do our part to make it a wonderful place!

rooms/entrance/circlekey.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/entrance/circlekey.html.dialogue: No, silly! What would it be inside of?

rooms/entrance/circlekey.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/entrance/circlekey.html.dialogue: Well, thank you for this little art lesson. Let's get going.
(You put the Key in your Pocket.)
(The Circle Key is laying on the floor.)
(You pick up the Circle Key and put it in your Pockets.)

rooms/entrance/deathcorridor.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/entrance/deathcorridor.html.dialogue: Sorry for screaming, sorry, sorry! Um, I, um...

rooms/entrance/deathcorridor.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/entrance/deathcorridor.html.dialogue: I... don't know if this is relevant, but...

rooms/entrance/deathcorridor.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/entrance/deathcorridor.html.dialogue: I, um... I recognize this corridor.

rooms/entrance/deathcorridor.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/entrance/deathcorridor.html.dialogue: I recognize it... The Head Housemaiden of this House used to warn us about it...

rooms/entrance/deathcorridor.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/entrance/deathcorridor.html.dialogue: I think... I think she called it the "Death Corridor"!!!

rooms/entrance/deathcorridor.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/entrance/deathcorridor.html.dialogue: The House is supposed to be a safe building, but with the King here, some traps might be activated... Is this what you mean?
(Not the first time you've had to reassure Mirabelle.)

rooms/entrance/deathcorridor.html.speaker: Siffrin
rooms/entrance/deathcorridor.html.dialogue: (Bonnie is looking intently at the wall...) "Found anything interesting?"

rooms/entrance/deathcorridor.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/entrance/deathcorridor.html.dialogue: Keep looking kiddo, I'm sure you'll find something.

rooms/entrance/deathcorridor.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/entrance/deathcorridor.html.dialogue: Not to tell you how to do your job, but make sure to check everything!

rooms/entrance/deathcorridor.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/entrance/deathcorridor.html.dialogue: ...Which is just those six pillars, I guess.

rooms/entrance/deathcorridor.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/entrance/deathcorridor.html.dialogue: I'm resting my legs while you look around. Have fun.
(You look around, trying to find something, anything...)
(You look around, trying to find something, anything...)
(This is the way to the previous room.)
(This probably leads further into the House.)
(But you have to put Mirabelle at ease and check this room...)
(You can't find any switches or traps, so...)

rooms/entrance/deathcorridor.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/entrance/deathcorridor.html.dialogue: So? So??? Are we safe? We're not safe, are we, this is the Death Corridor...

rooms/entrance/deathcorridor.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/entrance/deathcorridor.html.dialogue: The older housemaidens kept saying people died there!!!

rooms/entrance/deathcorridor.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/entrance/deathcorridor.html.dialogue: So there must be a trap-- Something weight-sensitive, or something!

rooms/entrance/deathcorridor.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/entrance/deathcorridor.html.dialogue: Or, or!!! Maybe it's time-sensitive! If we spend too long here...!

rooms/entrance/deathcorridor.html.speaker: Siffrin
rooms/entrance/deathcorridor.html.dialogue: (Oh come on now.) "There's nothing weird in here."

rooms/entrance/deathcorridor.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/entrance/deathcorridor.html.dialogue: Belle, Belle, don't worry about it.

rooms/entrance/deathcorridor.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/entrance/deathcorridor.html.dialogue: Frin isn't good at many things, but they know stuff about traps.

rooms/entrance/deathcorridor.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/entrance/deathcorridor.html.dialogue: Right. If we can't trust the one who's supposed to lead us THIS early, this won't bode well for later...

rooms/entrance/deathcorridor.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/entrance/deathcorridor.html.dialogue: We HAVE been in this room for a while...

rooms/entrance/deathcorridor.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/entrance/deathcorridor.html.dialogue: And Siffrin has been walking everywhere, so if it was weight-sensitive, something would have killed him by now.

rooms/entrance/deathcorridor.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/entrance/deathcorridor.html.dialogue: Sorry... for worrying... I'm a little on edge...
(As you live through the novel experience of having your body crushed by a giant rock,)
(You feel   a tug   on  your  stomach)
(Oh, wait, that's the room you died in because you didn't check for traps.)
(There MUST be a switch or something somewhere that can stop the trap from activating.)
(You didn't feel it last time, but...)
(You can feel something... different in this room.)
(Hidden unless you're looking at the right angle, you can see a switch hidden between the rocks.)

rooms/entrance/deathcorridor.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/entrance/deathcorridor.html.dialogue: OH, WAIT!!! Siffrin, I just remembered, this room, it's--
(Okay, the rock fell!!! And not on your head!!! Woohoo!!!)
(So you CAN change things. You can fix things.)
(You're feeling a lot more confident about this "killing a monarch" business!)

rooms/entrance/deathcorridor.html.speaker: Siffrin
rooms/entrance/deathcorridor.html.dialogue: (You give a thumbs up!!!) "Trap taken care of!"

rooms/entrance/deathcorridor.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/entrance/deathcorridor.html.dialogue: Um, no! That's the only one! I promise!!!

rooms/entrance/deathcorridor.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/entrance/deathcorridor.html.dialogue: This hallway had a trap, which Siffrin just activated... But I don't think there's any other ones in the House...

rooms/entrance/deathcorridor.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/entrance/deathcorridor.html.dialogue: Good to know. Let's get going then...

rooms/entrance/deathcorridor.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/entrance/deathcorridor.html.dialogue: OH, WAIT!!! Siffrin, I just remembered, this room, it's--

rooms/entrance/deathcorridor.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/entrance/deathcorridor.html.dialogue: N-not even phased, huh? So cool, Sif!

rooms/entrance/deathcorridor.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/entrance/deathcorridor.html.dialogue: ARE WE NOT TALKING ABOUT THE BIG ROCK?
(You can say from experience that a rock like this falling on you would kill you near instantly.)

rooms/entrance/storageroom0.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/entrance/storageroom0.html.dialogue: A storage room! Let's look around!

rooms/entrance/storageroom0.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/entrance/storageroom0.html.dialogue: I see a few tonics on those tables... Make sure to pick them up and give them to Bonnie before we leave.

rooms/entrance/storageroom0.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/entrance/storageroom0.html.dialogue: Check that closet too, there might be some cool stuff in there!
(You should check those out...)

rooms/entrance/storageroom0.html.speaker: Siffrin
rooms/entrance/storageroom0.html.dialogue: (Urgh, items to pick up again.) "Do we REALLY need items?"

rooms/entrance/storageroom0.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/entrance/storageroom0.html.dialogue: Oh? I'm surprised to hear this from you, since you just love to pick up random things.

rooms/entrance/storageroom0.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/entrance/storageroom0.html.dialogue: Of course we need those items. Tonics, juices... Those items will keep our health up, and are integral to our survival.

rooms/entrance/storageroom0.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/entrance/storageroom0.html.dialogue: We can't always count on Mirabelle to heal us. Don't hesitate to use tonics or items in battle if you get overwhelmed.
(This seems important... You decide to remember those words.)
(It'd be bad to be beaten in battle because you forgot about the items you carry...)
(You got a MEMORY OF TONICS!)
(You'll always remember this.)
[When Memory of Tonics is equipped, any tonic the Researcher uses will recover more HP!]
(You don't say anything.)
(Some small glass containers.)
(You look around...)
(You found a SOUR TONIC!)

rooms/entrance/storageroom0.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/entrance/storageroom0.html.dialogue: T-Tonics are good to keep your HP up so you don't get knocked out in battle!

rooms/entrance/storageroom0.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/entrance/storageroom0.html.dialogue:
They're very sour...
But the sourness is sure to make you more awake and ready for anything!
(The table has nothing else interesting on it.)
(Some small glass containers.)
(You look around...)
(You got a SUPER SOUR TONIC!)

rooms/entrance/storageroom0.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/entrance/storageroom0.html.dialogue: Oh! Sour tonics for everyone to share!

rooms/entrance/storageroom0.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/entrance/storageroom0.html.dialogue: Y'know, I always wondered why they're more powerful than regular sour tonics when they're the same size.

rooms/entrance/storageroom0.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/entrance/storageroom0.html.dialogue: They're just that concentrated.

rooms/entrance/storageroom0.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/entrance/storageroom0.html.dialogue: I tried drinking a full Super Sour Tonic once!

rooms/entrance/storageroom0.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/entrance/storageroom0.html.dialogue: And... What happened?

rooms/entrance/storageroom0.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/entrance/storageroom0.html.dialogue: I couldn't taste anything for weeks!!!
(The table has nothing else interesting on it.)
(You look at what's on the table...)
(You found a CRAFTED WATER!)

rooms/entrance/storageroom0.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/entrance/storageroom0.html.dialogue: Um, this is a Crafted Water!

rooms/entrance/storageroom0.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/entrance/storageroom0.html.dialogue:
If someone gets Knocked Out during battle...
Just a drop of it is enough to wake them right up!

rooms/entrance/storageroom0.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/entrance/storageroom0.html.dialogue: Someone at school told me it was just coconut water!

rooms/entrance/storageroom0.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/entrance/storageroom0.html.dialogue: Wait... is it?
(The table has nothing else interesting on it.)
(You look at what's on the table...)
(You found one GINGER JUICE!)
(You found one PEPPER JUICE!)
(You found one THYME JUICE!)

rooms/entrance/storageroom0.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/entrance/storageroom0.html.dialogue: Still, that's a lot of spices you found there...

rooms/entrance/storageroom0.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/entrance/storageroom0.html.dialogue:
Oh, oh, I know this one!
Pepper raises your ATTACK, ginger raises your DEFENSE, and thyme makes you faster!

rooms/entrance/storageroom0.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/entrance/storageroom0.html.dialogue: Because spicy stuff makes people angry, ginger makes you not sick, and thyme...

rooms/entrance/storageroom0.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/entrance/storageroom0.html.dialogue: Well... I don't actually know why thyme makes you faster.

rooms/entrance/storageroom0.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/entrance/storageroom0.html.dialogue: Me neither...
(The table has nothing else interesting on it.)
(Someone just took the bottle from you.)

rooms/entrance/storageroom0.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/entrance/storageroom0.html.dialogue: ...Dile said I'm on [tonics/water/spices] duty.

rooms/entrance/storageroom0.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/entrance/storageroom0.html.dialogue: Dile said I'm on [tonics/water/spices] duty!
(Someone just took the bottle from you.)

rooms/entrance/storageroom0.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/entrance/storageroom0.html.dialogue: ...Dile also said I'm on [tonics/water/spices] duty.

rooms/entrance/storageroom0.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/entrance/storageroom0.html.dialogue: Dile also said I'm on [tonics/water/spices] duty!
(You just give it all to them.)

rooms/entrance/storageroom0.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/entrance/storageroom0.html.dialogue: Heh, you learn fast, Frin.

rooms/entrance/storageroom0.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/entrance/storageroom0.html.dialogue: YAHOO!!!

rooms/entrance/storageroom0.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/entrance/storageroom0.html.dialogue: Be careful with those items, Boniface. Guard them well.

rooms/entrance/storageroom0.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/entrance/storageroom0.html.dialogue: Be ready to throw those at us if we need them during battle. It's probably safer than making all of us carry some...

rooms/entrance/storageroom0.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/entrance/storageroom0.html.dialogue: But Sif found those! You don't trust Sif to keep our items safe?

rooms/entrance/storageroom0.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/entrance/storageroom0.html.dialogue: The person who a few weeks ago mixed up all the items we had to make a so-called "Super Potion"?

rooms/entrance/storageroom0.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/entrance/storageroom0.html.dialogue: No. I don't trust Siffrin with items.

rooms/entrance/storageroom0.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/entrance/storageroom0.html.dialogue: HA!
(You cutely bat your eyes.)
(A lifetime ago for you now.)
(You open the closet.)
(It's full of boxes and paper, and...)
(A pendant shaped like a bell.)
(You got a BELL PENDANT!)
(You put the pendant in your pocket along with your Souvenirs.)

rooms/entrance/storageroom0.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/entrance/storageroom0.html.dialogue: Well. That closet was useless.

rooms/entrance/storageroom0.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/entrance/storageroom0.html.dialogue: Pretty pendant though.

rooms/entrance/storageroom0.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/entrance/storageroom0.html.dialogue: Can the pendant heal me when I'm hurt?

rooms/entrance/storageroom0.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/entrance/storageroom0.html.dialogue: Maybe it can! You don't know!
(You look at the pendant closely...)
(It's just a pendant shaped like a bell.)
(But you like it, so you put it in your pocket along with your Souvenirs.)
(Tonics and any useful items will usually be visible, but you might get some useless but interesting things if you check everything in an room...)
(You got the bell pendant back.)
(Hm... You wonder if you could find a chain for it somewhere!)
(Ding ding!)
(Ding ding.)
(You hold it tightly in your hand.)
(The closet doesn't have anything interesting left in it.)
(You open the useless closet.)
(Got the Bell Pendant.)
(Some flyers.)
(They say: "House of Change open! Come and see what you can do for the community, and what the community can do for you!!!" )

rooms/floor1/armory.html.speaker: Odile

rooms/floor1/armory.html.speaker: Mirabelle

rooms/floor1/armory.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor1/armory.html.dialogue: This is just one of the many classes the House gives! It's very popular with young adults, in a few weeks you can learn how to make your very own weapon!

rooms/floor1/armory.html.speaker: Isabeau

rooms/floor1/armory.html.speaker: Isabeau

rooms/floor1/armory.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor1/armory.html.dialogue: My sister took a class like this! She made a MASSIVE hammer and tried to hang it to the wall in her room.

rooms/floor1/armory.html.speaker: Bonnie

rooms/floor1/breakroom1.html.speaker: Isabeau

rooms/floor1/candleroom.html.speaker: Isabeau

rooms/floor1/candleroom.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor1/candleroom.html.dialogue: Sniff sniff.

rooms/floor1/candleroom.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor1/candleroom.html.dialogue: Apples and cinnamon.

rooms/floor1/candleroom.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor1/candleroom.html.dialogue: Pie smell.

rooms/floor1/candleroom.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor1/candleroom.html.dialogue: Oooh, is this a craftology book?

rooms/floor1/candleroom.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor1/candleroom.html.dialogue: Piercing Craft, Creative Craft... Where's the Protecting Craft chapt--

rooms/floor1/candleroom.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor1/candleroom.html.dialogue: It's a craftONOMY book, not a craftOLOGY book.

rooms/floor1/candleroom.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor1/candleroom.html.dialogue: This one is about the study of Craft, not your fortune.
(A book about the study of Craft?)
(Could it have any information about Time Craft, maybe...?)

rooms/floor1/candleroom.html.speaker: Siffrin
rooms/floor1/candleroom.html.dialogue: (You know this already.)

rooms/floor1/candleroom.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor1/candleroom.html.dialogue: Time Craft? What for?

rooms/floor1/candleroom.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor1/candleroom.html.dialogue: Hm... It is related to our situation, isn't it? With the King?

rooms/floor1/candleroom.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor1/candleroom.html.dialogue: We don't have ti--

rooms/floor1/candleroom.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor1/candleroom.html.dialogue: What's Time Craft? I dunno what that is.

rooms/floor1/candleroom.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor1/candleroom.html.dialogue: ...Should we have a crash course on Time Craft, then?

rooms/floor1/candleroom.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor1/candleroom.html.dialogue: Urgh, fine.
(Odile flips through the book.)

rooms/floor1/candleroom.html.speaker: Odiled
rooms/floor1/candleroom.html.dialogue: ...It does have a section on Time Craft.

rooms/floor1/candleroom.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor1/candleroom.html.dialogue: Alright. So, Time Craft is, as the name implies, the power to wield and craft time itself.

rooms/floor1/candleroom.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor1/candleroom.html.dialogue: It's a type of craft that's been hypothesized to exist for decades, but its existence has never been proven.

rooms/floor1/candleroom.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor1/candleroom.html.dialogue: Until now, right?

rooms/floor1/candleroom.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor1/candleroom.html.dialogue: Stopping time... That's what the King does, right?

rooms/floor1/candleroom.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor1/candleroom.html.dialogue: So the King is using Time Craft?

rooms/floor1/candleroom.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor1/candleroom.html.dialogue: The King most likely is, yes. Which would make it the first time in history someone managed to harvest that power.

rooms/floor1/candleroom.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor1/candleroom.html.dialogue: Outside of stories told in familytales, that is.

rooms/floor1/candleroom.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor1/candleroom.html.dialogue: I've heard scholars outside of Vaugarde are really excited right now! Time Craft, confirmed to be real!

rooms/floor1/candleroom.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor1/candleroom.html.dialogue: ...So they're happy because he froze people in time?

rooms/floor1/candleroom.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor1/candleroom.html.dialogue: W-well, it's more complicated than that!!!

rooms/floor1/candleroom.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor1/candleroom.html.dialogue: Morals aside, it does change everything we knew about Time Craft.

rooms/floor1/candleroom.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor1/candleroom.html.dialogue: Think about how Time Craft could be used. The King is only stopping people's time... But it could be used for many other things.

rooms/floor1/candleroom.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor1/candleroom.html.dialogue: It could be used to hasten or slow people's time, too. Maybe make people's bodies younger or older. Maybe make buds grow into trees in an instant.

rooms/floor1/candleroom.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor1/candleroom.html.dialogue: Worst case scenario, it could be used to change history itself! Crafting time to go back in time, and change history!

rooms/floor1/candleroom.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor1/candleroom.html.dialogue: Woah!
(Woah.)
("Worst case scenario".)

rooms/floor1/candleroom.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor1/candleroom.html.dialogue: The possibilities are endless... And terrifying.

rooms/floor1/candleroom.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor1/candleroom.html.dialogue: Definitely not the kind of power you want in someone's hands!

rooms/floor1/candleroom.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor1/candleroom.html.dialogue: And definitely not someone like the King.

rooms/floor1/candleroom.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor1/candleroom.html.dialogue: And, correct me if I'm wrong... But crafting time wouldn't be like crafting clay to a specific shape, or crafting a sword.

rooms/floor1/candleroom.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor1/candleroom.html.dialogue: Those are easy enough to do and won't tire you out, but crafting time? Something as basic and essential as time?

rooms/floor1/candleroom.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor1/candleroom.html.dialogue: Wouldn't it ask for immense amounts of power?

rooms/floor1/candleroom.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor1/candleroom.html.dialogue: Exactly. Crafting clay barely asks for any power from the user... But crafting time...

rooms/floor1/candleroom.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor1/candleroom.html.dialogue: It was theorized that crafting time, even to pause time for a single second... Would probably kill the user immediately.

rooms/floor1/candleroom.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor1/candleroom.html.dialogue: KILL THEM DEAD?!?

rooms/floor1/candleroom.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor1/candleroom.html.dialogue: Kill them dead.

rooms/floor1/candleroom.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor1/candleroom.html.dialogue: And yet, the King is still alive...

rooms/floor1/candleroom.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor1/candleroom.html.dialogue: So it raises the question...

rooms/floor1/candleroom.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor1/candleroom.html.dialogue: What gave him enough power to use Time Craft without dying? And how did he learn how to use it?

rooms/floor1/candleroom.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor1/candleroom.html.dialogue: Good questions, Isabeau. You have pretty smart insights sometimes.

rooms/floor1/candleroom.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor1/candleroom.html.dialogue: I sure do!

rooms/floor1/candleroom.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor1/candleroom.html.dialogue: Hm...

rooms/floor1/candleroom.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor1/candleroom.html.dialogue: Time Craft is what the King uses and it's dangerous. Got it.

rooms/floor1/candleroom.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor1/candleroom.html.dialogue: I suppose talking about this was useful. I'm surprised you're curious about this, though... Siffrin.
(You shrug.)
(Time Craft, a type of Craft that allows the user to control time...)
(Isn't that what you and the King have been using?)
(But neither of you should be able to use it... Using it would ask for immense amounts of power.)
(So then... What gave you this power?)
(...Maybe you should ask the King about this.)
(And... You still need to go talk to the Head Housemaiden.)
(She seemed aware that you were looping in time... Maybe she knows why you're able to use Time Craft?)
(You need to talk to her.)
(But what if it isn't enough? What if he doesn't want to tell you anything about Time Craft?)
(You've talked to the King, and the Head Housemaiden... Are those really the only two people that would know anything about the loops you're stuck in?)
(Who else could you talk to about the loops? To theorize?)
(Oh, wait.)
(There is ONE person.)

rooms/floor1/candleroom.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor1/candleroom.html.dialogue: Heheheh.

rooms/floor1/candleroom.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor1/candleroom.html.dialogue: Aww... I wanted to know my horoscope today...

rooms/floor1/candleroom.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor1/candleroom.html.dialogue: This place has been frozen for a few months now... I don't think it'd be up to date...

rooms/floor1/candleroom.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor1/candleroom.html.dialogue: Hehehe, you really like that sort of stuff, don't you Isabeau?

rooms/floor1/candleroom.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor1/candleroom.html.dialogue: Yes I do!!!

rooms/floor1/candleroom.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor1/candleroom.html.dialogue: It's absolutely useless and has no basis in reality, but I like it when some letters tells me I'm gonna have a good day.

rooms/floor1/candleroom.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor1/candleroom.html.dialogue: You're Protector Craft, aren't you, Isabeau... People who use it are patient, honest, loyal...

rooms/floor1/candleroom.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor1/candleroom.html.dialogue: ...and very gullible.

rooms/floor1/candleroom.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor1/candleroom.html.dialogue: That sure is me!!!

rooms/floor1/candleroom.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor1/candleroom.html.dialogue: Haha, you're very gullible!!!

rooms/floor1/candleroom.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor1/candleroom.html.dialogue: Bonnie, you're laughing, but... Aren't you... also using Protector Craft?

rooms/floor1/candleroom.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor1/candleroom.html.dialogue: Yes, I do seem to remember this being the case, kiddo.

rooms/floor1/candleroom.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor1/candleroom.html.dialogue: NO!!!!!!! IT'S NOT THE SAME!!!!! I'M NOT GULLIBLE!!!

rooms/floor1/candleroom.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor1/candleroom.html.dialogue: Heheheheheh...
(You like being able to be near them and not have to contribute to the conversation.)
(Being silent and surrounded by people you like is nice!)
(It's like watching a play you've seen a dozen times.)
(It's comforting.)
(Before this all happened, you'd never noticed how you could just stay silent and they'd all talk around you like nothing's wrong.)
(Sometimes you wonder if you really exist.)
(If THEY really exist.)
(Real people wouldn't say the exact same thing over and over and over, wouldn't they...?)
(You can come back and read this again later if you need to.)
(You're Piercing Craft!)
(Determined! Brave! Honest!)
(Or so people say.)
(You   are Piercing Craft.)
(Callous. Aimless. Manipulative.)
(Or so people say.)

rooms/floor1/candleroom.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor1/candleroom.html.dialogue: Aww... I wanted to know my horoscope today...

rooms/floor1/hallways1.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor1/hallways1.html.dialogue: Did you drink a special tonic or something? You seem, well...

rooms/floor1/hallways1.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor1/hallways1.html.dialogue: So graceful, right? I knew I wasn't imagining it!

rooms/floor1/hallways1.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor1/hallways1.html.dialogue: You're walking in a cool way... Like a dancer or something!

rooms/floor1/hallways1.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor1/hallways1.html.dialogue: You usually feel like a tiny fennec fox, but you feel more like a panther right now.

rooms/floor1/hallways1.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor1/hallways1.html.dialogue: And the way you defeated the last few Sadnesses we've seen... That was... Impressive.

rooms/floor1/hallways1.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor1/hallways1.html.dialogue: "I will show the King my true power... I will show them all..."

rooms/floor1/hallways1.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor1/hallways1.html.dialogue: "And then... No one will ever make fun of me again for being barely taller than a preteen!!!"

rooms/floor1/hallways1.html.speaker: Siffrin
rooms/floor1/hallways1.html.dialogue: "I'm the same height as you, Mira."
(Mirabelle looks at your heeled shoes, then at her flat boots.)

rooms/floor1/hallways1.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor1/hallways1.html.dialogue: Yeah, Belle! Hit him where it hurts!!!
(Come to think of it... Your [allies/family members] do feel slower to you now. Clumsier.)
(How long have you been in there compared to them...?)
(You purposefully trip on a small rock.)
(You're clumsy and not at all threatening and overpowered compared to them.)

rooms/floor1/hallways1.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor1/hallways1.html.dialogue: I've heard about it from people in Dormont! They call those "Tears"!

rooms/floor1/hallways1.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor1/hallways1.html.dialogue: If you touch one you'll be frozen in time, that's what they told me. There were a few outside the village too...
(There might be a lot of those around the House.)
(...You know that dying of natural causes will bring you back...)
(But what about being frozen in time? Is it different? Would it stop you from looping back?)
(You step forward and bring your hand up to the Tear.)
(As you do, you feel a weird sensation in your stomach,)
(You should just go ahead and move on...)

rooms/floor1/hallways1.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor1/hallways1.html.dialogue: Okay we get it let's stop looking at it! Can we go already?!
(You ignore everyone's confused looks at the Tear, and keep walking.)

rooms/floor1/hallways1.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor1/hallways1.html.dialogue: You know, usually I'd be worried about this, but Sif doesn't seem worried at all!
(The lock keeping it closed has an interesting shape... It doesn't have a hole for a key..)

rooms/floor1/hallways1.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor1/hallways1.html.dialogue: I think it may be a storage room...?

rooms/floor1/hallways1.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor1/hallways1.html.dialogue: I often saw Dormont's shopkeeper go there, he might know the openphrase for it!

rooms/floor1/hallways1.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor1/hallways1.html.dialogue: If we... Had remembered to ask.
(It's locked by one of those weird word locks.)

rooms/floor1/hallways1.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor1/hallways1.html.dialogue: I am DEFINITELY not looking around me and I'm admiring the view instead so tell me if I'm about to run into something dangerouuuuuus!
(You keep Isabeau from running into the life-ending tears.)
(For a second, you forget what you're supposed to do, until your body takes over on its own.)
(You almost forgot to catch Isabeau before he runs right into the Tears.)

rooms/floor1/hallways1.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor1/hallways1.html.dialogue: WAH! Wh-what? What is it???

rooms/floor1/hallways1.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor1/hallways1.html.dialogue: Is it the water? Should I... not touch the weird floating water?
(You're still thinking about what would've happened if you didn't catch Isabeau.)
(You have trouble breathing, but you can't let them notice--)

rooms/floor1/hallways1.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor1/hallways1.html.dialogue: The same weird water as before...

rooms/floor1/hallways1.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor1/hallways1.html.dialogue: Oh, wait, I've heard about those!

rooms/floor1/hallways1.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor1/hallways1.html.dialogue: The villagers in Dormont call them Tears, and if you touch them you get frozen in time!!!
(Oh, right, they haven't talked about it before...)

rooms/floor1/hallways1.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor1/hallways1.html.dialogue: Wait, so I almost DIED?!?
(Mirabelle wouldn't have been able to revive him.)
(Tears are different than the Time Stop skills enemies can hit you with, aren't they?)

rooms/floor1/snackbreak1.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor1/snackbreak1.html.dialogue: I ask again, would you like half of this cookie?
(Isabeau gave you half of his cookie!!!)
(Isabeau was so surprised by what you said he destroyed the cookie he was holding into a thousand crumbs!!!)
(Why did you say it again!!! The cookie!!!)
(You look at the cookie crumbles on the floor.)
(You feel powerful, and, immediately after, disgusting.)

rooms/floor1/snackbreak1.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor1/snackbreak1.html.dialogue: SIF!!! Y-you can't just say that!!!

rooms/floor1/snackbreak1.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor1/snackbreak1.html.dialogue: I-I really have the heart of a delicate maiden, you know. You have to be careful with me.
(Isabeau seems to have trouble looking you in the eye.)

rooms/floor1/snackbreak1.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor1/snackbreak1.html.dialogue: Hm... I hope I didn't make Bonnie upset earlier.

rooms/floor1/snackbreak1.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor1/snackbreak1.html.dialogue: Time Craft, and Wish Craft, huh...?

rooms/floor1/snackbreak1.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor1/snackbreak1.html.dialogue: Ah, Siffrin. I'm just thinking, don't mind me...
(She's looking at you weird. Did you do something wrong...?)

rooms/floor1/snackbreak1.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor1/snackbreak1.html.dialogue: Leave me be, now. I need some alone time.

rooms/floor1/snackbreak1.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor1/snackbreak1.html.dialogue: Okay! We can stay here a bit longer.
(You thought you saw something, but it was just you.)
(You just need to defeat the king on your own.)

rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.dialogue: (The door is locked tight.)
(The lock keeping it closed has an interesting shape... It doesn't have a hole for a key..)

rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.dialogue: What's this room, though?

rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.dialogue: I think it may be a storage room...?

rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.dialogue: I often saw Dormont's shopkeeper go there, he might know the openphrase for it!

rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.dialogue: If we... Had remembered to ask.

rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.dialogue: Oh.

rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.dialogue: Well, too late now, right?
(The door is locked tight.)
(It's locked by one of those weird word locks.)
(You say the word "Change" aloud.)
(Nothing happens.)

rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.dialogue: Worth a try!
(...The door unlocked.)

rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.dialogue: What.

rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.dialogue: Well, let's go inside, then...
(You say the sentence "Openphrase123" aloud.)
(Nothing happens.)

rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.dialogue: Worth a try!
(The door is locked tight.)
(You say the openphrase.)
(You leave the door alone.)
(The bookcase is filled with many books written in many different languages. Vaugardian, Poterian, Mwudu...)
(One of them is written in a language you cannot read.)
(Just looking at it is giving you a headache...)
(But you could read it, if you remembered the Memory of it, wouldn't you?)
(The bookcase is filled with many books written in many different languages. Vaugardian, Poterian, Mwudu...)
(One of them is written in your language.)
(You can read it, now...)
(It seems to be a theoretical essay about how to use Wish Craft...!)
(Wish Craft! So it is real...!)
(...This essay seems too complicated for you to understand right now.)
(You should find more information about Wish Craft elsewhere, and come back to this later...)
(Since the King is the one who told you about Wish Craft... You don't want to ask him anything, but is there someplace that's related to him?)
(One of them is written in your language.)
(You can read it, now...)
(It seems to be a theoretical essay about how to use Wish Craft...!)
(Wish Craft! So it is real...!)
(You've read the Wish Craft book before, but it wouldn't hurt to get a refresher...)
(You start flipping through it.)

rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.dialogue: Siffrin? What are you looking at?

rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.dialogue: Wish Craft? What's that?

rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.dialogue: Do we really have time for this right now?

rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.dialogue: Oh crab!!!

rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.dialogue: This would be... Very very very useful to know, wouldn't it?!

rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.dialogue: Interesting... May I see?

rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.dialogue: ...How are you even reading this.

rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.dialogue: Letters bad.

rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.dialogue: I can't read it at all...

rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.dialogue: I've never even heard of Wish Craft. Are you sure it's even real?

rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.dialogue: Worth a try! Since you can read it, can you translate what you can, Sif?
(You nod furiously.)
(You start reading, and translate as best you can...)
(You translate again...)

rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.dialogue: ...I'll leave the thinking to you all.

rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.dialogue: I am a child. I have a lot on my mind. I cannot help.

rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.dialogue: Understandable.
(Isabeau and Odile listen intently, while Mirabelle and Bonnie start playing some kind of game in a corner.)
(You keep translating...)
(After a bit, Odile nods.)

rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.dialogue: Hm, I think I understand.

rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.dialogue: Wish Craft, as the name implies, is the art of Crafting wishes. Of making whatever you desire come true.

rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.dialogue: According to this, there seems to be no clear limit on what kind of wish you can make come true...

rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.dialogue: A big part of it seems to come through just believing very strongly that you wish will come true, huh?

rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.dialogue: So by Crafting some specific rituals, in conjunction with a powerful will for your wish to come true, people can seemingly make any kind of wish come true...

rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.dialogue: Um... Okay...

rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.dialogue: You used the word "congestion", so now I'm confused.

rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.dialogue: "Conjunction". It means--

rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.dialogue: The same way we use Craft and certain knowledge and will to make figurines move, there's a way to use Craft to make your wishes come true!
(You nod, you nod.)
(Bonnie raises their hand.)

rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.dialogue: You have a question, Boniface?

rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.dialogue: Um, so, um...

rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.dialogue: Can it make any wish come true if you ask?

rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.dialogue: Yes, but the way the wish comes true seems a little more complicated than that, from what Siffrin translated.

rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.dialogue: Yeah, depending on what you ask, your wish might not come true, but you might get the MEANS to make your wish come true!

rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.dialogue: So like, let's say... Let's say you wished to win a Rock Paper Scissors tournament.

rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.dialogue: Instead of just having it come true through pure luck... You might get SOMETHING to help make it come true.

rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.dialogue: Like, maybe you'd get better at reacting, and you could see your opponent's hand in slow motion as it falls, so you can change your own hand!

rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.dialogue: Or maybe you'd get the insight to tell what they'd be playing, based on their body language...

rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.dialogue: Or you'd just get the power to see the future, so you know what hand your opponent will play beforehand.

rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.dialogue: Oh! Or maybe, you could meet a powerful Rock Paper Scissors master, who'd be willing to teach you through the goodness of their heart!

rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.dialogue: Maybe!!!

rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.dialogue: But what if your opponent also made a wish to win? What do you think would happen?

rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.dialogue: Hm... Maybe the wishes would cancel each other out, and the match would end in a draw.

rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.dialogue: Or maybe their wishes would both be considered null, and it'd be anyone's game.

rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.dialogue: Or maybe the wishes can't work because it's two opposite wishes, so they'd both explode!!!!! And destroy the whole world!!!!!

rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.dialogue: Oh no!!!

rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.dialogue: But neither of the wishes would come true, then! So maybe...

rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.dialogue: Maybe they'd both get to win somehow. Maybe they'd go to different tournaments.

rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.dialogue: Or share a medal!

rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.dialogue: Cute.

rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.dialogue: Hehehe!

rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.dialogue: ...This is fascinating.

rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.dialogue: Makes you wanna go into wish-ology, huh?

rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.dialogue: Hah! Almost.

rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.dialogue: So, if Wish Craft is how the King got his powers...

rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.dialogue: ...What did he wish for, then?

rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.dialogue: ...I don't know, but...

rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.dialogue: Maybe his power to freeze people in time might not be what he wished for, but it's the means to make his wish come true.
(To make Vaugarde perfect.)
(A perfect picture.)

rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.dialogue: OH!!! But then...

rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.dialogue: Um, question, I have a question!!!

rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.dialogue: Yes, Mira! I give you permission to speak!!!

rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.dialogue: Thank you!!! Um, Siffrin, you think the King could've gotten Time Craft powers by just wishing for them, right?
(You nod.)
(Considering he's the one who told you about Wish Craft in the first place...)

rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.dialogue: So then... If wishes can be that powerful...

rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.dialogue: Wouldn't anyone making a wish at any time be... Kind of dangerous?!

rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.dialogue: We'd be living in a very different world, wouldn't we?! If someone wished to be the strongest person alive... Or a kid wished for a million ponies!!!

rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.dialogue: We can do that...? Wish for a million ponies...?

rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.dialogue: OH NO!!!

rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.dialogue: To answer your question, my dear Mira...

rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.dialogue: It seems that just wishing for things does hold a little bit of power, but like, not enough to actually make anything come true.

rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.dialogue: But like Sif said, over time, people figured out specific ways to do Wish Craft, to increase their chances of the wish coming true!

rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.dialogue: And it depends on the wish, too. Some wishes are easier to make come true.

rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.dialogue: It also depends on the strength of the wish! Like, how much you want it to come true!

rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.dialogue: Although, it seems the strength of the wish isn't as important as the whole ritual part.

rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.dialogue: You can wish as hard as you want for something, but if there's no ritual, it's very likely that nothing will happen.

rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.dialogue: Hm... "I wish I won this single game" wouldn't ask for much belief, or for a lot of rituals...

rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.dialogue: But in theory, you could prepare rituals and wish for something much larger, like "I wish I could win this world tournament"...

rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.dialogue: ...Or "I wish to get enough power so I can freeze a whole country in time", right?
