rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.dialogue: ...Right.

rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.dialogue: So the King knew how to do Wish Craft, then? That's what this means?

rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.dialogue: Wish Craft could account for his mastery over Time Craft... And so, he must have known specific rituals to make his wish come true...

rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.dialogue: Where could he have learned them...?
(Does it matter?)
(Because that's it, isn't it! That's it!!!)
(Wish Craft is the art of making wishes come true... Wishes that could bestow immense power...)
(A wish must be what is trapping you here!)
(That's it, that's it, that's it!!!)
(You can't help but smile widely.)
(Finally, a hint! Finally, a real path you can follow!)
(Something you can do!!!)
(You try and calm your breathing.)
(Phew...)
(Okay.)
(...Specific rituals, huh...)
(It's a long shot, but there might be another book about Wish Craft somewhere... Something you couldn't read before...)
(The bookcase is filled with many books written in many different languages. Vaugardian, Poterian, Mwudu...)
(The bookcase is filled with many books written in many different languages. Vaugardian, Poterian, Mwudu...)
(One of them is written in your language.)
(You couldn't read it now even if you tried.)
(It's a Poterian-Vaugardian translation dictionary.)
(It's open to a page of Vaugardian words starting with a T.)

rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.dialogue: "Taciturn".

rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.dialogue: What does "taciturn" mean?

rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.dialogue: It's someone who doesn't speak up very often, Boniface.

rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.dialogue: Oh, like Frin, okay.

rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.dialogue: Yes, just like Siffrin.

rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.speaker: Siffrin
rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.dialogue: (Hey!)

rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.dialogue: Um...

rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.dialogue: Not really, Sif.

rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.dialogue: My teacher always says we gotta speak up more.

rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.dialogue: You're an adult, so why don't you speak up more, stupid?

rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.dialogue: You're an adult, so why don't you speak up more?
(Why don't you?)
(You just don't have much to say.)
(It's simpler to just let people talk.)
(Heheh...)
(Because why would you?)
(Because you're tired.)
(Tired of repeating the same blinding lines over and over and OVER again.)

rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.dialogue: Hm.

rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.dialogue: Oh.

rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.dialogue: Awwwwwww!!!

rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.dialogue: That's cute.

rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.dialogue: That's a lovely thing to say, Siffrin!
(Oh, stars.)

rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.dialogue: It feels like we tamed a wild animal, doesn't it?

rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.dialogue: Perfect analogy.

rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.dialogue: Maybe soon we'll even be able to pet them.

rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.dialogue: Oh crab, stop, just imagining it makes me emotional!!!
(Are they making fun of you?)
(Aaaaaaah...)
(You don't like it when they see you.)
(You hide your face under your hat.)

rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.dialogue: See, now he went back to a shy, skittish animal.

rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.dialogue: All this hard work... Wasted...
(Face warm, you walk away.)

rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.dialogue: Hehehe!

rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.dialogue: Yes, yes, we're coming!

rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.dialogue: Oh, sorry... Are we making you uncomfortable?

rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor1/stostorageroomoom.html.dialogue: We'll stop, Sif! Sorry, Sif!
(You walk away.)
(It's a dictionary.)
(It's open to a page of words starting with a T.)
(Not so taciturn anymore, are you?!?)
(It's a dictionary.)
(Some vials.)
(You got one GINGER JUICE!)
(You got one SWEET TONIC!)
(You got two SALTY BROTHS!)
(You give it to Bonnie to safekeeping.)
(Nothing else here.)
(A stool.)
(A stool.)
(But you're fine, so it'd be a waste of time to sit down.)

rooms/floor1/writingdorm.html.dialogue: (They seem to be various newspaper articles about the King.)
(...You should keep those in mind for later.)
(You never looked at them very closely before, have you?)

rooms/floor1/writingdorm.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor1/writingdorm.html.dialogue: Oh... So many articles about the King!

rooms/floor1/writingdorm.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor1/writingdorm.html.dialogue: His conquest was slow enough that the Vaugardian press had time to write about him, I remember that...

rooms/floor1/writingdorm.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor1/writingdorm.html.dialogue: But there's no one to write them now.

rooms/floor1/writingdorm.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor1/writingdorm.html.dialogue: This article is about his slow march to Dormont's House...

rooms/floor1/writingdorm.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor1/writingdorm.html.dialogue: This one is about him probably being from another country than Vaugarde...

rooms/floor1/writingdorm.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor1/writingdorm.html.dialogue: This article says there's no record of him anywhere... Up until he appeared out of thin air sometime in his adulthood.

rooms/floor1/writingdorm.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor1/writingdorm.html.dialogue: Looks like he lived in the city of Corbeaux for a few years before he became the King...

rooms/floor1/writingdorm.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor1/writingdorm.html.dialogue: So he was a traveler? Like Frin and Dile?

rooms/floor1/writingdorm.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor1/writingdorm.html.dialogue: Please don't compare us to him, thank you.
(That's right... He did talk about "Vaugardians" before.)
(The way he phrased it... It did seem like he thought of Vaugardians as people other than himself.)
(And...  He said he thought of Vaugarde as "welcoming".)
(Always willing to welcome people in, even someone with no name, no home to speak of...)
(You should go and ask the King where he's from, later.)

rooms/floor1/writingdorm.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor1/writingdorm.html.dialogue: This article is about his fashion sense.

rooms/floor1/writingdorm.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor1/writingdorm.html.dialogue: From what I've heard, he does have a very distinctive hairstyle.

rooms/floor1/writingdorm.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor1/writingdorm.html.dialogue: This article is more about his armor, actually!

rooms/floor1/writingdorm.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor1/writingdorm.html.dialogue: They even included a sketch, look.
(There's something that caught your attention though...)

rooms/floor1/writingdorm.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor1/writingdorm.html.dialogue: That IS a very tall crown!

rooms/floor1/writingdorm.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor1/writingdorm.html.dialogue: The pauldrons are big, and he is also very big... One pauldron might be bigger than all of us combined!

rooms/floor1/writingdorm.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor1/writingdorm.html.dialogue: The patterns? On his chest and gauntlets, you mean?

rooms/floor1/writingdorm.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor1/writingdorm.html.dialogue: It's just a weird losange. What's so weird about that?

rooms/floor1/writingdorm.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor1/writingdorm.html.dialogue: The dots in the sky, correct?

rooms/floor1/writingdorm.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor1/writingdorm.html.dialogue: The dots in the sky! Sif and I were looking at them yesterday, remember?

rooms/floor1/writingdorm.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor1/writingdorm.html.dialogue: This article here does mention his speech mannerisms...

rooms/floor1/writingdorm.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor1/writingdorm.html.dialogue: Stars and sky-related things seem to be something he comes back to often.

rooms/floor1/writingdorm.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor1/writingdorm.html.dialogue: What could be interesting about them?
(Is there somewhere in the House where you could find out more about them?)
(They seem to be various newspaper articles about the King.)
(The handwriting is so terrible, you can barely read what's on it.)
(It's a bunch of sketches of landscapes.)
(Will you ever get to see anything other than Dormont and this House ever again?)
(A closet haphazardly filled with art notebooks and art supplies.)
(There's a crumpled pile of hand-drawn cards.)
(This card has a drawing of a man carrying six swords on a boat.)
(It's a card with a drawing of a star with an upside down face...?)
(Oops, you're holding the card upside down.)
(This card has a drawing of a hand holding a piece of wood.)
(This card has a drawing of someone making some plates.)
(The card has a drawing of a pair of scissors.)
(It's a card with a drawing of someone walking on the sky and offering flowers to sky people.)
(The man is touching the ground, and giving flowers to normal people.)
(The card has a drawing of a hooded person in a cave.)
(The card has a drawing of five women fighting with spears.)
(The card has a drawing of a trapped, blindfolded man.)
(You pick the card upside down. You can tell from the design on the back.)
(You turn it around and look at the design.)
(Dozens of swords stabbed them in the back.)
(The card has a drawing of someone surrounded by empty glasses.)
(The card has a drawing of someone hanging upside down.)
(They look like they're about to die, but they're smiling.)
(You put the card in your pocket along with your Souvenirs.)
(You pick up a card at random.)
(A closet haphazardly filled with art notebooks and art supplies.)
(They must've been crafted to move, but they've been frozen in time...)
(A dresser with art books on top of it.)
(The keychain dangling from it is shaped like an egg broken in half...)
(You put the Key in your Pocket.)
(You now know where the Broken Egg Key is located.)
(...Sounds like keys will be in your future, huh.)
(You should probably try to remember their location, just in case...)
[When equipped, Memory of Keys helps you remember where keys are.]
[When looking at a locked door, you'll get a sense of where its key is. If you've already found the key in a previous loop, you'll get directions as to where to go.]
[Pretty useful if you're the forgetting type, huh?]

rooms/floor1/writingdorm.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor1/writingdorm.html.dialogue: In someone's drawer? What a weird place for a key...

rooms/floor1/writingdorm.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor1/writingdorm.html.dialogue: Definitely not a very king-like place, huh!!! That's pretty stupid of him!!!

rooms/floor1/writingdorm.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor1/writingdorm.html.dialogue: I'm not sure... Hiding keys in places like drawers isn't very King-like, yeah, but it means they're harder to find since it's not a very expected place...

rooms/floor1/writingdorm.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor1/writingdorm.html.dialogue: But thankfully we have our good ol' Sif to help us find them!

rooms/floor1/writingdorm.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor1/writingdorm.html.dialogue: Thank you, Siffrin! Good job, Siffrin!
(She claps sarcastically, which makes everyone join her enthusiastically.)
(But you know that the King didn't...)
(Everyone is clapping, so you take a bow.)
(The paper is filled with sketches of naked people doing fun things.)
(You're kind of grossed out by them.)
(You don't want to look at them.)

rooms/floor1/writingdorm.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor1/writingdorm.html.dialogue: Show me, I can't see what it is!
(Mirabelle hurriedly covers Bonnie's eyes and makes them take two steps back.)

rooms/floor1/writingdorm.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor1/writingdorm.html.dialogue: No no no no no, it's not allowed!!! You're not allowed!!!

rooms/floor1/writingdorm.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor1/writingdorm.html.dialogue: Yeah, it's not for little ones, Boniface.

rooms/floor1/writingdorm.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor1/writingdorm.html.dialogue: Yep, can't let you do that, Bonbon!

rooms/floor1/writingdorm.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor1/writingdorm.html.dialogue: Oh! So it's REALLY not allowed!

rooms/floor1/writingdorm.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor1/writingdorm.html.dialogue: Why did it take Siffrin saying it for you to realize...

rooms/floor1/writingdorm.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor1/writingdorm.html.dialogue: Frin lets me do things when you guys say no sometimes.

rooms/floor1/writingdorm.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor1/writingdorm.html.dialogue: But if even Frin says it's not allowed... Then it must be something really not allowed.

rooms/floor1/writingdorm.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor1/writingdorm.html.dialogue: What the CRAB did you let Bonnie do when we said no!!!

rooms/floor1/writingdorm.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor1/writingdorm.html.dialogue: He let me drink some vodka once!
(You make sure to look like you're about to flee.)

rooms/floor1/writingdorm.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor1/writingdorm.html.dialogue: I don't really get why Odile likes it though.

rooms/floor1/writingdorm.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor1/writingdorm.html.dialogue: It tasted just like boring water.

rooms/floor1/writingdorm.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor1/writingdorm.html.dialogue: Sorry. That sounds like an amazing practical joke to play on a kid, actually.
(The paper is filled with sketches of naked people doing fun things.)
(The bed itself doesn't seem very comfy, but that pillow...)

rooms/floor1/writingdorm.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor1/writingdorm.html.dialogue: Why does that pillow look so comfy...

rooms/floor1/writingdorm.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor1/writingdorm.html.dialogue: It has a strange shape, though, doesn't it?

rooms/floor1/writingdorm.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor1/writingdorm.html.dialogue: Wait, that's not a pillow! THAT'S A HAT!!! JUST LIKE MINE!!!
(You give the Pillow Hat to Bonnie to equip later.)

rooms/floor1/writingdorm.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor1/writingdorm.html.dialogue: Why does that pillow look so--

rooms/floor1/writingdorm.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor1/writingdorm.html.dialogue: Some people like to sleep with no pillows, or so I've heard...
(Your face is just dark, dark, dark.)

rooms/floor2/admin.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/admin.html.dialogue: WAIT!!!

rooms/floor2/admin.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/admin.html.dialogue: A-ah! Sorry, Siffrin...

rooms/floor2/admin.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/admin.html.dialogue: It's just, over there, that's the Head Housemaiden's office!

rooms/floor2/admin.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/admin.html.dialogue: The Head Housemaiden, huh...

rooms/floor2/admin.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor2/admin.html.dialogue: Someone like her definitely has some good stuff, right? Like keys! Like snacks!!!

rooms/floor2/admin.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/admin.html.dialogue: ...Like information.

rooms/floor2/admin.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/admin.html.dialogue: Let's go, then!
(You follow along.)
(You let yourself be led.)

rooms/floor2/admin.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/admin.html.dialogue: That door sure is locked.

rooms/floor2/admin.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor2/admin.html.dialogue: Yep.

rooms/floor2/admin.html.speaker: Siffrin
rooms/floor2/admin.html.dialogue: Sucks.

rooms/floor2/admin.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/admin.html.dialogue: Mirabelle, any idea where the key for this would be?

rooms/floor2/admin.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/admin.html.dialogue: I'm not sure, I. . .

rooms/floor2/admin.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/admin.html.dialogue: Oh...  Oh no.

rooms/floor2/admin.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor2/admin.html.dialogue: Uh oh.

rooms/floor2/admin.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/admin.html.dialogue: I remember... The key...  The key is in the Head Housemaiden's office, in her desk drawer...!!!
(What?!?)
(How did you miss it?!)

rooms/floor2/admin.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor2/admin.html.dialogue: Uh oh!!!

rooms/floor2/admin.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/admin.html.dialogue: Urgh...

rooms/floor2/admin.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/admin.html.dialogue: I'm sorry!!! I'm sorry!!! I should've remembered, why didn't I remember--

rooms/floor2/admin.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/admin.html.dialogue: Hey, don't worry about it, Mira.

rooms/floor2/admin.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/admin.html.dialogue: Yes, you're not to blame here. If anything, it's Siffrin's job to look out for things, so...

rooms/floor2/admin.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/admin.html.dialogue: Can we break it down?

rooms/floor2/admin.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor2/admin.html.dialogue: It looks really solid...

rooms/floor2/admin.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/admin.html.dialogue: And the fact that it's frozen in time doesn't help.

rooms/floor2/admin.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/admin.html.dialogue: So... Are we stuck?

rooms/floor2/admin.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/admin.html.dialogue: W-Well we could keep exploring this floor, but I'm...  I'm pretty sure the key for this door was in the office...

rooms/floor2/admin.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/admin.html.dialogue: If we can't access it... What should we do...?
(You could...)
(You could loop back to before the room collapsed, couldn't you? And explore the Admin room more?)
(You could also stay here, but... You don't think there's any point...)
[Hey stardust! Sorry to interrupt, but I am here in your head to beam you some amazing advice.]
[See this little icon on the top right? This is a helpful little icon to inform you that you are stuck in time.]
[No matter what, you won't be able to progress further in the House in this loop. Only thing you can do is find a way to loop back. Woopsies!]
[Say, though...  Didn't you see some tears on the way there? They MIGHT do the trick if you need to loop back easily...]
[(Come say hi sometime! I'm so lonely... Sob sob... Do you feel sorry for me yet...)]

rooms/floor2/admin.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/admin.html.dialogue: Mirabelle, any idea where the key for this would be?

rooms/floor2/admin.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/admin.html.dialogue: I'm not sure, I--
(Oops. You forgot to check the drawer in the Head Housemaiden's office.)
(The door is locked tight.)
(The key for it was in the Head Housemaiden's office, but it's inaccessible now...)

rooms/floor2/admin.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/admin.html.dialogue: Oh, that's the Head Housemaiden's office!

rooms/floor2/admin.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor2/admin.html.dialogue: Someone like her definitely has some good stuff, right? Like keys! Like snacks!!!

rooms/floor2/admin.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/admin.html.dialogue: ...Like information. Let's look around...
(Ok REALLY look for a switch, a key, ANYTHING this time.)
(A desk.)
(Most of this side of the desk is taken by a single, massive drawer.)
(Woah! It's completely stuffed full.)
(You start looking through it while everyone talks.)
(The Head Housemaiden's massive desk drawer.)
(Mirabelle said the key should be in the drawer...)
(You start looking for the key.)
(The Head Housemaiden's massive desk drawer.)
(You start looking for the key.)

rooms/floor2/admin.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/admin.html.dialogue: So this is the office of...

rooms/floor2/admin.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/admin.html.dialogue: The Head Housemaiden of Dormont! She's wonderful!

rooms/floor2/admin.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/admin.html.dialogue: She manages the House and makes sure everyone is happy and fulfilled! She organizes a lot of events too!

rooms/floor2/admin.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/admin.html.dialogue: She's also a great Crafter! She always creates wonderful items that makes everyone's lives easer!

rooms/floor2/admin.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/admin.html.dialogue: She taught me so much... Most of the Craft skills I know, I learned from her.

rooms/floor2/admin.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/admin.html.dialogue: She was the one, wasn't she? The one who was supposed to...

rooms/floor2/admin.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/admin.html.dialogue: Yes...

rooms/floor2/admin.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/admin.html.dialogue: She's the one who was supposed to defeat the King.

rooms/floor2/admin.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/admin.html.dialogue: But the King was too strong, and attacked out of nowhere, and now... I don't know what happened to her.

rooms/floor2/admin.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/admin.html.dialogue: When I fled the House... The King might've already... ...

rooms/floor2/admin.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/admin.html.dialogue: ...Don't worry, Mira...

rooms/floor2/admin.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/admin.html.dialogue: If she's that strong, I'm sure we'll find her safe and sound eventually!

rooms/floor2/admin.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/admin.html.dialogue: Y-yeah!!!

rooms/floor2/admin.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/admin.html.dialogue: Positive... I have to stay positive.
(The drawer was full of notes and boring administrative papers.)
(No key.)
(But why is it shining, then...?)
(You should look elsewhere...)
(Aw stars.)
(There WAS a key hidden in there.)
(It was taped to the underside, so you missed it before... You blinding idiot...)
(The Head Housemaiden...)
(She knew something about whatever's happening to you.)
(Maybe you could try and ask her what she knows...)
(You pick up the key.)
(You pick up the key taped to the underside of the drawer.)
(You found the ROCK KEY!)
(The keychain dangling from it is shaped like a hand in the Rock position...)
(How fitting.)
(You put the Key in your Pocket.)
(You now know where the Rock Key is located.)
(The Head Housemaiden's massive desk drawer.)
(There's nothing important there.)
(There REALLY is nothing else important in there.)
(Here, here, here!)
(Got the ROCK KEY.)
(A pile of papers.)
(You take one at random...)
(Boring papers!)
(Some paper and ink.)
(On the paper, you can see a spreadsheet of some kind.)
(There's two columns, one filled with names, while the other only has one or two.)
(The first, full column is titled "Save Vaugarde".)
(The second, near empty column is titled "Other".)
(What could this be about...?)
(And then, you realize...)
(This is... A list of people who wished to save Vaugarde!!!)
(You look around her desk, trying to find out more.)
(Why would she record the people who wished to save Vaugarde?)
(It's a little notebook, jammed between random boring paperwork...)
(In it, the Head Housemaiden talks about Wish Craft... How in the days before the King attacked, she noticed everyone was wishing to the Favor Tree for the same thing:)
(To save Vaugarde.)
(And she started wondering if this wish could be the key to the King's defeat, somehow...)
(So the Head Housemaiden knew about Wish Craft!!!)
(...A wish for Vaugarde to be saved...)
(Reading this... You start to wonder whether this wish could be related to your loops.)
(Have you been looping this whole time... To save Vaugarde?)
(If you think about it... It somewhat fits.)
(You and your friends are the only ones who can save Vaugarde, so if you died...)
(The wish could activate then, making sure to loop you back to before your death, so you could try again?)
(Maybe the wish manifested itself by giving you the power to loop back in time?)
(Without this power, you would've failed and died, and the King would never have been defeated...)
(Making the wish impossible to fulfill.)
(So maybe that's it...? You're here because of this wish?)
(But Vaugardians shouldn't know the correct rituals to wish... And rituals are the most important part. The wish shouldn't have come true without them.)
(Could their belief in this wish be enough for it to come true? If a lot of people wished, on a country-wide scale?)
(And... Why is this wish centered on you? Why not everyone in your party?)
(And, and! If that's the case, if this wish is why you're here, then why are you still here?)
(You've beaten the King already, haven't you?)
(If that wish is why you're here, the loop would've stopped after you beat the King, right?)
(Did you do something wrong...?)
(The pieces don't completely fit yet, but...)
(There's no doubt in your mind that Vaugardians' wish to "save Vaugarde" is why you're trapped in this loop.)
(You're getting closer.)
(You smile.)

rooms/floor2/admin.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/admin.html.dialogue: Siffrin, is something wrong? You've been staring at this notebook for a while...

rooms/floor2/admin.html.speaker: Siffrin
rooms/floor2/admin.html.dialogue: "Just lost in thought!"

rooms/floor2/admin.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/admin.html.dialogue: O-oh, okay! Shall we get going, then?
(You nod.)
(...The Head Housemaiden...)
(She's the one who wrote this. She knows about Wish Craft.)
(She knew something was wrong, this whole time.)
(She might know... How to...)
(You should go and talk to her as fast as you can!)
(But first, you have to go talk to Loop! You have to tell them what you've found!!!)
(It's the number of people who wished to save Vaugarde.)
(Everyone's wishes.)
(You'll make them all come true!!!!!!)
(This part of the desk has nothing interesting on it whatsoever.)
(You can see the desk has some drawers you could look into on the other side, though...)
(The key's not here, stupid!!!)
(Childish drawings of a tall bright woman.)
(Childish drawings of the Head Housemaiden.)
(Childish drawings of the Head Housemaiden.)
(If only you had a pencil! Scribble scribble scribble!)
(A closet.)
(It's full of boring administrative papers.)
(Some notes about the King.)
(The Head Housemaiden must've been looking for more information about him...)

rooms/floor2/admin.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/admin.html.dialogue: Why do you even call the King "the King"? Vaugarde isn't a monarchy...

rooms/floor2/admin.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/admin.html.dialogue: Isn't "King" just a title he chose?

rooms/floor2/admin.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/admin.html.dialogue: Yes, but he chose it... Calling him something else would be rude?

rooms/floor2/admin.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/admin.html.dialogue: Yeah, that's just basic manners.
(Vaugarde is so weird.)
(You wonder if calling him "King" might've given him more notoriety than he should have.)
(Does he even remember his name...?)
(So the King is a name that he chose...?)
(Maybe that's something you could ask him about...)
(Some notes about the king.)
(Rrrrrrrrip! Nothing there!)
(The bookcase is filled with books about various subjects.)
(Various BORING subjects. You leave the bookcase alone.)
(You leave the bookcase alone.)
(Boring bookcase full of useless books!)

rooms/floor2/admin.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/admin.html.dialogue: There was nothing important in there, right? So this is fine?

rooms/floor2/admin.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/admin.html.dialogue: What a waste of time. At least we didn't get squashed, though...
(Need the key.)
(A big rock.)
(At least this one didn't fall right on you or anyone else...)

rooms/floor2/admin.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/admin.html.dialogue: Could we maybe break it down?

rooms/floor2/admin.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/admin.html.dialogue: We could try... But--

rooms/floor2/admin.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/admin.html.dialogue: SMASH!!!!!

rooms/floor2/admin.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/admin.html.dialogue: ow
(The rock did not flinch.)

rooms/floor2/admin.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/admin.html.dialogue: How's your fist?

rooms/floor2/admin.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/admin.html.dialogue: I'm okay... I'm okay... I'm okay...
(A big rock.)
(There doesn't seem to be a way to pass through.)
(The blinding big rock!)

rooms/floor2/breakroom2.html.dialogue: (The pieces of glass catch the light, making them almost sparkle.)
(But sharp! You leave the pretty glass alone.)
(You got the SHINY PIECE OF GLASS!)
(You discreetly put the piece of glass in your pocket along with your Souvenirs.)

rooms/floor2/breakroom2.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/breakroom2.html.dialogue: We took a grape-stomping class together, a few years ago.

rooms/floor2/breakroom2.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/breakroom2.html.dialogue: A grape-stomping class, so you can make wine, m'dame.

rooms/floor2/breakroom2.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/breakroom2.html.dialogue: They must've thought it would protect them from the King...

rooms/floor2/breakroom2.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/breakroom2.html.dialogue: But sadly, the King's Curse doesn't care about locks...

rooms/floor2/breakroom2.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/breakroom2.html.dialogue: Oh... I don't know them personally, but I've seen them around...

rooms/floor2/breakroom2.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/breakroom2.html.dialogue: I...   I don't know anything about them...!!!

rooms/floor2/breakroom2.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/breakroom2.html.dialogue: I'm trying so hard to remember something, anything, about each person I see, but...

rooms/floor2/breakroom2.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/breakroom2.html.dialogue: But there's so many people I know nothing about...!!!

rooms/floor2/breakroom2.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/breakroom2.html.dialogue: All we need to do is beat the King to break the Curse, and you'll be able to get to know each of them as much as you want.
(You can feel your face scrunch in distaste.)
(You want to throw up just looking at them, but you force yourself to make a funny disgusted face.)

rooms/floor2/breakroom2.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/breakroom2.html.dialogue: But you liked them when we first met, didn't you?

rooms/floor2/breakroom2.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/breakroom2.html.dialogue: I feel like one day you just did a 180 and decided you hated them. What happened?

rooms/floor2/breakroom2.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/breakroom2.html.dialogue: Did you eat a bad croissant, somehow?

rooms/floor2/breakroom2.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/breakroom2.html.dialogue: Did it have a hair in it.

rooms/floor2/breakroom2.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor2/breakroom2.html.dialogue: Did someone beat you up using a croissant as a weapon?

rooms/floor2/breakroom2.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/breakroom2.html.dialogue: No??? I try very hard to not eat Sif's food, so I wouldn't...

rooms/floor2/breakroom2.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/breakroom2.html.dialogue: ...And that was enough to swear off croissants forever?

rooms/floor2/breakroom2.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor2/breakroom2.html.dialogue: Y-You know, I wouldn't burn a croissant!!! I'm good at baking!!!
(You clench the silver coin in your pocket.)

rooms/floor2/breakroom2.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor2/breakroom2.html.dialogue: I'll make the best croissant ever, and you won't have to think about the bad memories anymore because the croissant is gonna be Too Good.

rooms/floor2/breakroom2.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/breakroom2.html.dialogue: Oh, Bonnie, that's a lovely idea!
(You force yourself to smile and nod.)
(You can't look at them can't look can't look can't look--)
(Odile gives it to Bonnie for safekeeping.)

rooms/floor2/breakroom2.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor2/breakroom2.html.dialogue: As the adults say, "I'm going to take this."
(Bonnie puts the vials in their pockets.)
(You mumble under your breath "I'm going to take this.")

rooms/floor2/classroom.html.dialogue: (The bookcase is filled with some books about many, many random things.)
(There's a book about something called "bonding earrings".)
(You wonder what that's about, but not enough to pick up the book.)
(The bookcase is filled with some books about many, many random things.)
(There's a book about something called "bonding earrings".)
(Bonding earrings... Isn't that what the frozen person on the way to the library was wearing?)
(You pick up the book and flip through it.)
(...It's pretty dry. You'd rather not read it, actually.)
(You pick up the book and flip through it, waiting for Mirabelle to comment.)

rooms/floor2/classroom.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/classroom.html.dialogue: Siffrin? Are you curious about bonding earrings?
(You nod.)

rooms/floor2/classroom.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/classroom.html.dialogue: Do you not have those, where you're from?

rooms/floor2/classroom.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/classroom.html.dialogue: You don't? We have bonding earrings in Ka Bue as well.

rooms/floor2/classroom.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/classroom.html.dialogue: Let me explain it for you, Sif.

rooms/floor2/classroom.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/classroom.html.dialogue: You see, Sif, when people love each other very much...

rooms/floor2/classroom.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor2/classroom.html.dialogue: Oh, oh, I wanna know what happens when people love each other very much, no one's ever told me!

rooms/floor2/classroom.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/classroom.html.dialogue: ISABEAU.

rooms/floor2/classroom.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/classroom.html.dialogue: ...Many things happen, and then maybe they'll decide to get bonded, and spend a very long time together.

rooms/floor2/classroom.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/classroom.html.dialogue: When they do, they'll start making a pair of bonding earrings! They're supposed to symbolize the other person, so the design is very, very important.

rooms/floor2/classroom.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/classroom.html.dialogue: And if the bonding is between three or more people, you'd make as many earrings as there are people!

rooms/floor2/classroom.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/classroom.html.dialogue: And then you exchange earrings! So they'd each carry one of the earrings!

rooms/floor2/classroom.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/classroom.html.dialogue: I know it's not practiced everywhere, but it definitely is in Vaugarde.

rooms/floor2/classroom.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/classroom.html.dialogue: Not everyone does in Ka Bue, but it's popular there as well.

rooms/floor2/classroom.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/classroom.html.dialogue: Not my kind of thing, though.

rooms/floor2/classroom.html.speaker: Siffrin
rooms/floor2/classroom.html.dialogue: (Oh! So...)

rooms/floor2/classroom.html.speaker: Siffrin
rooms/floor2/classroom.html.dialogue: (Well.)

rooms/floor2/classroom.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/classroom.html.dialogue: Huh? What do you mean?
(You point at Mirabelle, Isabeau and Bonnie's ears.)

rooms/floor2/classroom.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/classroom.html.dialogue: NO?!?! THAT'S NOT WHY WE WEAR EARRINGS?!??! THOSE ARE JUST REGULAR EARRINGS!!!!

rooms/floor2/classroom.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/classroom.html.dialogue: Yeah, um, that's...

rooms/floor2/classroom.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor2/classroom.html.dialogue: My sister said I had to wear them.

rooms/floor2/classroom.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/classroom.html.dialogue: Well, it IS very common for people to wear earrings, but it's not... Related...
(Mirabelle, Isabeau and Bonnie all look at each other.)

rooms/floor2/classroom.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/classroom.html.dialogue: Is it related? I'm suddenly worried.

rooms/floor2/classroom.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor2/classroom.html.dialogue: I haven't met a lot of people without earrings, even if they're not bonding earrings!

rooms/floor2/classroom.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/classroom.html.dialogue: It's true that I know very few Vaugardians without earrings...

rooms/floor2/classroom.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/classroom.html.dialogue: Is this why we wear them? As, like...

rooms/floor2/classroom.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/classroom.html.dialogue: A way to get us used to the idea at a young age?

rooms/floor2/classroom.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor2/classroom.html.dialogue: A thing we gotta do because adults said so?

rooms/floor2/classroom.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/classroom.html.dialogue: EVIL MANIPULATION TO FORCE US TO GET BONDED AS WE AGE?!??!

rooms/floor2/classroom.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/classroom.html.dialogue: Hah. I suppose every country has its weird antiquated traditions...

rooms/floor2/classroom.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/classroom.html.dialogue: I guess so! It's kinda funny!

rooms/floor2/classroom.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/classroom.html.dialogue: EW EW EW EW EW EW!!!!!!!!!
(Mirabelle seems genuinely upset at the idea!)
(Maybe you shouldn't have brought it up...)

rooms/floor2/classroom.html.speaker: Siffrin
rooms/floor2/classroom.html.dialogue: (Say something!)

rooms/floor2/classroom.html.speaker: Siffrin
rooms/floor2/classroom.html.dialogue: (Say it again.)

rooms/floor2/classroom.html.speaker: Siffrin
rooms/floor2/classroom.html.dialogue: (Follow the script.)

rooms/floor2/classroom.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/classroom.html.dialogue: Aw, you think so...?
(You nod.)
(Isabeau hides his face.)

rooms/floor2/classroom.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/classroom.html.dialogue: A-Anyway, your earrings ARE nice, Mira! They make you look cute!!!

rooms/floor2/classroom.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor2/classroom.html.dialogue: I like my earrings because I can hang things on them.

rooms/floor2/classroom.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/classroom.html.dialogue: ...  Yes.

rooms/floor2/classroom.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/classroom.html.dialogue: My earrings do look nice.

rooms/floor2/classroom.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/classroom.html.dialogue: And they were expensive. I'll throw them away dramatically another time.

rooms/floor2/classroom.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/classroom.html.dialogue: That's the spirit.
(Maybe you could go see that frozen person again, in a future loop.)
(The bookcase is filled with some books about many, many random things.)
(The bookcase is filled with some books about many, many, many, many, many, many random things.)
(A board with some doodles in the corner.)

rooms/floor2/classroom.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/classroom.html.dialogue: It's a nice classroom, isn't it? Wonder what classes were taught here.

rooms/floor2/classroom.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/classroom.html.dialogue: Hnrgh... I have bad memories of this classroom.

rooms/floor2/classroom.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor2/classroom.html.dialogue: Why? Did you have a bad class in this room, Belle?

rooms/floor2/classroom.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/classroom.html.dialogue: Ah, no, not... Um...

rooms/floor2/classroom.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/classroom.html.dialogue: It's... I gave a class here, not too long before the King attacked.

rooms/floor2/classroom.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor2/classroom.html.dialogue: YOU'RE A TEACHER?

rooms/floor2/classroom.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/classroom.html.dialogue: Gasp! You never said!

rooms/floor2/classroom.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/classroom.html.dialogue: N-no!!! It was just one lecture, I, um...

rooms/floor2/classroom.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/classroom.html.dialogue: The Head Housemaiden... She said it would be good for me, to give a lecture...

rooms/floor2/classroom.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/classroom.html.dialogue: A lecture on...?

rooms/floor2/classroom.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/classroom.html.dialogue: I'm... I'm well known in Dormont's House for being the Housemaiden who has taken... The most classes?

rooms/floor2/classroom.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/classroom.html.dialogue: Taken the most classes? Like, as a student?

rooms/floor2/classroom.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor2/classroom.html.dialogue: How many is that?

rooms/floor2/classroom.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/classroom.html.dialogue: Haha... Since I came to live here, I think I registered for...

rooms/floor2/classroom.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/classroom.html.dialogue: ...A little more than a hundred and fifty classes...?

rooms/floor2/classroom.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/classroom.html.dialogue: HUH?!?

rooms/floor2/classroom.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/classroom.html.dialogue: MIRABELLE?!

rooms/floor2/classroom.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor2/classroom.html.dialogue: YOU WENT TO SCHOOL THAT LONG?!????!??!?!?!?!

rooms/floor2/classroom.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/classroom.html.dialogue: So she wanted me to do a lecture... On what taking all those classes taught me...

rooms/floor2/classroom.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/classroom.html.dialogue: ...And?

rooms/floor2/classroom.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/classroom.html.dialogue: And...

rooms/floor2/classroom.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/classroom.html.dialogue: ...Should we drop it?

rooms/floor2/classroom.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/classroom.html.dialogue: Yes, please...

rooms/floor2/classroom.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/classroom.html.dialogue: And I messed it up. I just didn't know what to say...

rooms/floor2/classroom.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/classroom.html.dialogue: I didn't think taking all those different classes taught me anything worthwhile, to be honest.

rooms/floor2/classroom.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/classroom.html.dialogue: I liked taking them! And I liked learning those things!

rooms/floor2/classroom.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/classroom.html.dialogue: But... I didn't do anything with what I learned. And I wasn't even good at any of it.

rooms/floor2/classroom.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/classroom.html.dialogue: So... Wasn't it all just a waste of time?

rooms/floor2/classroom.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/classroom.html.dialogue: And that's what I ended up saying during the class...

rooms/floor2/classroom.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/classroom.html.dialogue: And everyone was just... Silently looking at me. Judging me...

rooms/floor2/classroom.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/classroom.html.dialogue: So, um, I ran away from the class and stayed in my room for a week, haha.

rooms/floor2/classroom.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor2/classroom.html.dialogue: Oh no!

rooms/floor2/classroom.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/classroom.html.dialogue: Oh gems.

rooms/floor2/classroom.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/classroom.html.dialogue: To evade judgement and wait for it to blow over, I get it.

rooms/floor2/classroom.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/classroom.html.dialogue: But taking all those classes doesn't seem like it was a waste of time, though?

rooms/floor2/classroom.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/classroom.html.dialogue: It's fine to learn things just for learning's sake!

rooms/floor2/classroom.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/classroom.html.dialogue: And you never know when that knowledge might come in handy.

rooms/floor2/classroom.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/classroom.html.dialogue: Hm... That's true!

rooms/floor2/classroom.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/classroom.html.dialogue: But... Thinking about it now, I felt like I HAD to do something with that knowledge.

rooms/floor2/classroom.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/classroom.html.dialogue: Everyone else in the classes felt like they were learning about their passion, you know?

rooms/floor2/classroom.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/classroom.html.dialogue: Artists taking art classes, getting better at their craft, that sort of thing.

rooms/floor2/classroom.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/classroom.html.dialogue: But I was just... Not using those skills outside of class...

rooms/floor2/classroom.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/classroom.html.dialogue: But... Just because everyone was doing their way... Means I can do things my way, too.

rooms/floor2/classroom.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/classroom.html.dialogue: And I can just take a lot of classes because I like to learn!

rooms/floor2/classroom.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor2/classroom.html.dialogue: Yeah!

rooms/floor2/classroom.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/classroom.html.dialogue: Maybe this is what the Head Housemaiden wanted you to realize, when she asked you to prepare this class.

rooms/floor2/classroom.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/classroom.html.dialogue: Heh, maybe!
(You got a MEMORY OF LEARNING!)
(You'll always remember this.)
[When Memory of Learning is equipped, all of your Housemaiden’s Craft Skill Cooldowns will be lowered by 1!]
(A board with some doodles in the corner.)
(Someone wrote on the board "Don't stay with your mistakes! Don't be afraid to start over!")
(You nod! What a true little fact!)
(Okay, board.)
(You discreetly erase what's written, making sure nothing remains.)
(A board with some doodles in the corner.)
(A board with some doodles in the corner.)
(Someone wrote on the board "Don't stay with your mistakes! Don't be afraid to start over!")
(Various school supplies.)
(A pile of students' papers.)
(A list of students' names for a month long class.)
(...Some of the students have more than their first and last name listed...)
(Some of the students have more than their first and last name listed.)

rooms/floor2/classroom.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/classroom.html.dialogue: Huh, this student has one, two... Five names?

rooms/floor2/classroom.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/classroom.html.dialogue: This is a Vaugardian practice, as I recall.

rooms/floor2/classroom.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/classroom.html.dialogue: Having more than one name? Yeah!

rooms/floor2/classroom.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/classroom.html.dialogue: A lot of Vaugardians have more than one name! Usually it's one masculine name, one feminine name, and a free one for good measure!

rooms/floor2/classroom.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/classroom.html.dialogue: But some parents just go wild and give more than that. I had a coworker with ten names!

rooms/floor2/classroom.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/classroom.html.dialogue: The many names represent our capacity for change, our power to evolve, to become someone new at a moment's notice...

rooms/floor2/classroom.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/classroom.html.dialogue: ...And if you decide to change genders, or become someone different than who you were before, you already have a name ready to pick out!

rooms/floor2/classroom.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/classroom.html.dialogue: This is... lovely, actually. How Vaugarde's goal of change goes even as deep as names...

rooms/floor2/classroom.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/classroom.html.dialogue: I have another name too, so I feel a little closer to Vaugarde at this moment.

rooms/floor2/classroom.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor2/classroom.html.dialogue: You do?! I wanna know, I wanna know!!!

rooms/floor2/classroom.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/classroom.html.dialogue: I'm curious as well... If that's okay!

rooms/floor2/classroom.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/classroom.html.dialogue: Hm... If you tell me yours, I might. Unless that's frowned upon?

rooms/floor2/classroom.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/classroom.html.dialogue: Not really frowned upon... But some people might keep it secret for personal reasons!

rooms/floor2/classroom.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/classroom.html.dialogue: That's why not everyone on the student list wrote down every name, see?

rooms/floor2/classroom.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/classroom.html.dialogue: I wouldn't mind telling you though, madame Odile!

rooms/floor2/classroom.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor2/classroom.html.dialogue: I'd tell you, but I forgot mine. My sister is the one who remembers.

rooms/floor2/classroom.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/classroom.html.dialogue: Hm...

rooms/floor2/classroom.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/classroom.html.dialogue: I'm gonna pass! I wanna keep them secret.

rooms/floor2/classroom.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/classroom.html.dialogue: Because if I do change again, I don't want you to already know how to call me! I want it to be a surprise!

rooms/floor2/classroom.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/classroom.html.dialogue: Oh... Of course.

rooms/floor2/classroom.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/classroom.html.dialogue: Then let us keep our names secret for a little while longer.
(Vaugarde is so weird.)
(You only have the one name.)
("Siffrin", no other names, no last name.)
(A list of students' names.)
(A list of students' names for a month long class.)
(Some of the students have more than their first and last name listed.)
(Good for them!)
(A note stuck to the wall.)
(It says: "NO SNACK EATING IN THIS ROOM")
(Out of the corner of your eye, you see Bonnie chomp on an apple.)
(A note stuck to the wall.)
(It says: "NO SNACK EATING IN THIS ROOM")
(Out of the corner of your eye, you see Bonnie chomp on an apple.)
(But Bonnie isn't here.)
(A note stuck to the wall.)
(Some school books.)
(Mathematics, geography, Crafting, art, sewing, cooking...)
(Some school books.)
(Some vials.)
(Let's see...)
(You pick them up.)
(You got one SUPER SWEET TONIC!)
(You give it to Bonnie for safekeeping.)
(Nothing else here.)
(A desk.)
(On it is a notebook titled: "Marc's Super Awesome Great Amazing Super Duper Cool Notebook (DO NOT TOUCH!)")
(Out of respect, you leave the Super Duper Cool notebook alone.)
(A desk.)
(On it is a notebook titled: "Marc's Super Awesome Great Amazing Super Duper Cool Notebook (DO NOT TOUCH!)")
(Out of disrespect, you open the Super Duper Cool notebook wide.)
(Oh thank the stars it's here.)
(You found the CRYING KEY!)
(The keychain dangling from it is shaped like a crying mask...)

rooms/floor2/classroom.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor2/classroom.html.dialogue: A key, here???

rooms/floor2/classroom.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/classroom.html.dialogue: A mask, huh... This feels out of place. I was expecting a keychain shaped like scissors or something.
(You put the Key in your Pocket.)
(You now know where the Crying Key is located.)

rooms/floor2/classroom.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/classroom.html.dialogue: ...Sif?
(Looking at the key in your hand is making you realize...)
(The trap at the entrance, the key in the admin room, this key that you had to backtrack for...)
(You're not very good at your job, are you.)
(It's your job to look for traps, your job to see hidden things, and you've failed at those multiple times.)
(If you weren't looping, there's no way you would have been able to get this far. You'd have died for good right away. And possibly brought everyone down with you.)
(You can't help but sigh.)
(Someone pokes your hip gently.)

rooms/floor2/classroom.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor2/classroom.html.dialogue: Hey.

rooms/floor2/classroom.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor2/classroom.html.dialogue: Have a peach.
(Peach time?)
(You take the peach and silently nibble on it.)
(YOU WERE SILENT FOR TOO LONG AND MADE THE MOOD AWKWARD...!!!)

rooms/floor2/classroom.html.speaker: Siffrin
rooms/floor2/classroom.html.dialogue: (SAY SOMETHING...) "Th-thank you Bonnie..."

rooms/floor2/classroom.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor2/classroom.html.dialogue: It's fi--

rooms/floor2/classroom.html.speaker: Siffrin
rooms/floor2/classroom.html.dialogue: "...You're a peach."

rooms/floor2/classroom.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor2/classroom.html.dialogue: Okay, no--

rooms/floor2/classroom.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/classroom.html.dialogue: Ew.

rooms/floor2/classroom.html.speaker: Siffrin
rooms/floor2/classroom.html.dialogue: "I feel peachy again."

rooms/floor2/classroom.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/classroom.html.dialogue: YEAH!!!

rooms/floor2/classroom.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/classroom.html.dialogue: Hahaha...

rooms/floor2/classroom.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor2/classroom.html.dialogue: ...I don't know why I even worry about you sometimes.
(What?)
(Anyway, key! Better get back to Floor 3.)
(You could walk around and get some experience... Or you could just find a tear somewhere and loop forwards...)
(You pick up the key, and do not think about how bad you are at your job.)
(A desk.)
(On it is a notebook titled: "Marc's Super Awesome Great Amazing Super Duper Cool Notebook (DO NOT TOUCH!)")
(Got the CRYING KEY.)
(You think about snacks for some reason.)
(A fruit, maybe? Why would you think about a fruit now?)
(That's weird. You're so weird.)
(A desk.)
(A desk with an open notebook.)
(It has very lovely handwriting.)

rooms/floor2/classroom.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/classroom.html.dialogue: Oh! I recognize this handwriting...

rooms/floor2/classroom.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/classroom.html.dialogue: This is the seat of a very stylish very scary lady with amazing fashion sense!

rooms/floor2/classroom.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/classroom.html.dialogue: She often wore this very cool dress, and she always has her dark hair in a bun...

rooms/floor2/classroom.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/classroom.html.dialogue: We often had the same classes, but she probably doesn't know I exist. I'm a little sad about it, I always wanted to ask her for fashion tips...
(This vaguely rings a bell...)
(You should maybe tell Mirabelle about her when you're in Dormont.)

rooms/floor2/classroom.html.speaker: Siffrin
rooms/floor2/classroom.html.dialogue: (Wait, this sounds like...) "That's the stylish lady I was talking to you about."

rooms/floor2/classroom.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/classroom.html.dialogue: Who?

rooms/floor2/classroom.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/classroom.html.dialogue: THE STYLISH LADY NEXT DOOR IN DORMONT

rooms/floor2/classroom.html.speaker: Siffrin
rooms/floor2/classroom.html.dialogue: (...) "Yes, her. Your fan."

rooms/floor2/classroom.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor2/classroom.html.dialogue: You have a fan, Belle?!

rooms/floor2/classroom.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/classroom.html.dialogue: Mira... Remember us when you're famous...

rooms/floor2/classroom.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/classroom.html.dialogue: So that's who you meant... Yes, I know her!!!

rooms/floor2/classroom.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/classroom.html.dialogue: But see, if you said she was scary, I would've known who you meant.

rooms/floor2/classroom.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/classroom.html.dialogue: She has a very intense glare, and she talks in a way where I never know if she's making fun of people or not...
(You make a face.)
(The stylish lady didn't look very scary when you talked to her...)

rooms/floor2/classroom.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/classroom.html.dialogue: If you see her again, look into her eyes. You'll know what I mean.
(You might try that.)
(Either way, you should go talk to the stylish lady and let her know that Mirabelle knows her...)
(A desk with an open notebook.)
(It has very lovely handwriting.)
(A desk with an open notebook.)
(An empty desk.)
(A desk.)
(On it is an open issue of "The Cursing of Château Castle", issue #32.)
(...Issue #32? You should remember this number.)
(A desk.)
(Frozen flowers.)
(Why do they smell so sweet?)

rooms/floor2/garden.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/garden.html.dialogue: That's one of the House's cooks. She was in the gardening class with me...

rooms/floor2/garden.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/garden.html.dialogue: She was taking the class to learn how to grow tasty vegetables! She often made soup with the veggies she made...

rooms/floor2/garden.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/garden.html.dialogue: Hehe, once, she said she needed some help breaking apart a turnip she grew, to make it into a soup, so we told her to bring it to class and we'd all help her.

rooms/floor2/garden.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/garden.html.dialogue: And next class, she brought the biggest turnip I'd ever seen! She had trouble even fitting it through the door!

rooms/floor2/garden.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/garden.html.dialogue: We spent the entire class trying to cut it, it was that big!

rooms/floor2/garden.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/garden.html.dialogue: But since she's a cook and really particular about taste, we had to act as if it was delicious.

rooms/floor2/garden.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/garden.html.dialogue: Thank Change I was taking an acting class too!
(The closet is filled with gardening supplies.)
(You put the Garden Scissors in your pocket to equip later.)
(There's some gardening books about rare and powerful plants.)
(Powerful plants... Somehow, you're reminded of the Favor Tree.)
(...One of the books has a section on Favor Trees, but it's pretty useless.)
(The bottom of the page says "For more information on this topic, check out...")
(You can't read the title they're recommending.)
(They do mention the cover of the book they're recommending has a picture of a big, sparkly tree.)
(The closet is filled with gardening supplies.)
(The closet is, as always, filled with gardening supplies.)
(...And some tonics? This room is a mess.)
(You give them to Bonnie for safekeeping.)
(They look healthy... Whoever took care of them before they got frozen did a good job.)
(And there's four of them! Ha, ha, ha, ha, ha, ha!!!)

rooms/floor2/garden.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/garden.html.dialogue: Very sad. Very mistreated. Who would do this.

rooms/floor2/garden.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/garden.html.dialogue: I-it's mine... I was taking a gardening class before the King attacked...

rooms/floor2/garden.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/garden.html.dialogue: No, no, I see what Sif means! There's a certain charm to it!

rooms/floor2/garden.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/garden.html.dialogue: It's cute. I hope it grows up to be big and strong.

rooms/floor2/garden.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor2/garden.html.dialogue: You hear me, plant? I believe in you! Grow big and strong!!!
(Reminds you of someone, ha, ha, ha!!!)
(WOW there's no place to pass through with everyone following you.)
(You try your best to pass through the tight space between your [allies/family members], the tables, and the wall.)
(You try your best to pass through the tight space between your [allies/family members], the tables, and the wall.)
(As you pass through, you realize, not for the first time in this situation, that everyone unconsciously makes sure to not touch you any more than necessary.)
(It's not the best feeling, but there must be a reason they're not touching you, so you leave it alone.)
(While passing through, you stumble and accidentally bump against Odile.)

rooms/floor2/garden.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/garden.html.dialogue: We are used to your weird aversion to touch.
(Once again, you can tell that people make sure to give you some space.)
(Steeling yourself, you take a deep breath, and brush against everyone softly.)
(While passing through, you take a deep breath, and--)

rooms/floor2/garden.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/garden.html.dialogue: D-Don't poke my sides, Sif!!! I'm ticklish!!!
(While passing through, you take a deep breath, and--)
(As you gently poke her, she pokes you back.)
(While passing through, you take a deep breath, and--)
(Beyond throwing you a look, she doesn't react.)
(While passing through, you take a deep breath, and--)

rooms/floor2/garden.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor2/garden.html.dialogue: Poke my cheek again and die.
(While passing through, you discreetly touch everyone.)
(As you pass through the tight space between the tables and the wall, you brush against everyone.)
(You try to get some human contact every loop, even if it's discreetly like this.)
(You've read somewhere that humans need a certain amount of skin-to-skin contact otherwise they go insane.)
(Asking for skin-to-skin contact would be weird, so you content yourself with clothes-to-clothes.)
(You poke everyone again, but this time no one reacts.)
(You poke everyone again, but this time no one reacts.)
(You rub your arms once, twice, thrice.)
(You feel like you're floating in your own body.)
(If only someone would touch you to make sure you're real! Someone, anyone!)

rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.dialogue: (You can feel someone in the distance...)

rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.dialogue: Someone?!? Please, let's go!!!

rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.dialogue: Ah!!!

rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.dialogue: Is that... Someone from the House?

rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.dialogue: They've been frozen by the King's Curse...

rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.dialogue: That's-- That's another Housemaiden!

rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.dialogue: She... She often helped me with chores...

rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.dialogue: I can't believe she's...

rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.dialogue: ...  What was she like?

rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.dialogue: Tell us a bit about her!

rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.dialogue: Oh, she... She started working at the House before me, so she often had to teach me how to do basic things, ha...

rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.dialogue: Like what?

rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.dialogue: Like... How to cut veggies without cutting my fingers too?

rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.dialogue: BELLE!!!!!!

rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.dialogue: I-I know how to do it now!!! You go "meow meow, cat's paw, can't cut my fingies nya"!!!!
(Cute!!!)
(Cute.)

rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.dialogue: What.

rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.dialogue: CUTE???

rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.dialogue: It's cute, right? That's how I remember!!!

rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.dialogue: She... taught me how to do it...

rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.dialogue: And she always helped bandage my hands after I hurt myself...

rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.dialogue: Shaking her head, telling me to be more careful next time...

rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.dialogue: She was...   Such a nice person...

rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.dialogue: ...She never hurt anyone. The King... Why would the King do this...

rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.dialogue: And I can't even do anything to save her!!! She's been under the curse for too long... I can't reverse it!

rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.dialogue: I... I'm so...
(Mirabelle...)
(You wonder if she got to move again, for the brief period of time between beating the King and looping back.)

rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.dialogue: The King is powering the Curse... So if we manage to beat him, everyone should go back to normal.

rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.dialogue: But every new floor, the Sadnesses are getting stronger... At some point, we might end up being frozen in time ourselves.

rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.dialogue: If it happens...

rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.dialogue: ... I'll be here.

rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.dialogue: I'm the only one who can't get frozen in time, thanks to the Change God's blessing...

rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.dialogue: And if you get frozen, I have the power to save you.

rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.dialogue: Yeah, Mira! Our amazing chosen!!!

rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.dialogue: We're counting on you, Mirabelle.
(You smile at her.)

rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.dialogue: Hehehe...

rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.dialogue: I... I don't have the power to save anyone from being frozen yet...

rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.dialogue: But, but I'm close!!! I'm close to getting it!!! I swear!!!
(Sounds like you should fight some Sadnesses and get some experience to make sure Mirabelle can protect you during battle...)
[Hey, stardust!]
[Just like your researcher said, Sadnesses are getting stronger. Some of them have the same power as the King, the power to freeze you in time.]
[Your Housemaiden is immune to such attacks, but if you're frozen in time, you won't be able to act! If everyone is frozen in time and your Housemaiden is out cold, you lose!]
[So if someone is frozen, make sure to use her Lovely Moving Cure skill, okay? Okay! Bye!!!]
[(Well, when she learns the skill, of course. Make sure to level her up a bit, huh?)]
(A housemaiden, frozen in time.)
(She looks scared.)
(Someone frozen in time.)

rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.dialogue: WAIT!!!

rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.dialogue: A-ah! Sorry, Siffrin...

rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.dialogue: It's just, over there, that's the Head Housemaiden's office!

rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.dialogue: The Head Housemaiden, huh...

rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.dialogue: Someone like her definitely has some good stuff, right? Like keys! Like snacks!!!

rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.dialogue: ...Like information.

rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.dialogue: Let's go, then!
(You follow along.)
(You let yourself be led.)

rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.dialogue: There was nothing important in there, right? So this is fine?

rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.dialogue: What a waste of time. At least we didn't get squashed, though...
(A big rock.)
(At least this one didn't fall right on you or anyone else...)

rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.dialogue: Could we maybe break it down?

rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.dialogue: We could try... But--

rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.dialogue: SMASH!!!!!

rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.dialogue: ow
(The rock did not flinch.)

rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.dialogue: How's your fist?

rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.dialogue: I'm okay... I'm okay... I'm okay...
(A big rock.)
(There doesn't seem to be a way to pass through.)
(The blinding big rock!)

rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.dialogue: That door sure is locked.

rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.dialogue: Yep.

rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.speaker: Siffrin
rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.dialogue: Sucks.

rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.dialogue: Mirabelle, any idea where the key for this would be?

rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.dialogue: I'm not sure, I. . .

rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.dialogue: Oh...  Oh no.

rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.dialogue: Uh oh.

rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.dialogue: I remember... The key...  The key is in the Head Housemaiden's office, in her desk drawer...!!!
(What?!?)
(How did you miss it?!)

rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.dialogue: Uh oh!!!

rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.dialogue: Urgh...

rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.dialogue: I'm sorry!!! I'm sorry!!! I should've remembered, why didn't I remember--

rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.dialogue: Hey, don't worry about it, Mira.

rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.dialogue: Yes, you're not to blame here. If anything, it's Siffrin's job to look out for things, so...

rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.dialogue: Can we break it down?

rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.dialogue: It looks really solid...

rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.dialogue: And the fact that it's frozen in time doesn't help.

rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.dialogue: So... Are we stuck?

rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.dialogue: W-Well we could keep exploring this floor, but I'm...  I'm pretty sure the key for this door was in the office...

rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.dialogue: If we can't access it... What should we do...?
(You could...)
(You could loop back to before the room collapsed, couldn't you? And explore the Admin room more?)
(You could also stay here, but... You don't think there's any point...)
[Hey stardust! Sorry to interrupt, but I am here in your head to beam you some amazing advice.]
[See this little icon on the top right? This is a helpful little icon to inform you that you are stuck in time.]
[No matter what, you won't be able to progress further in the House in this loop. Only thing you can do is find a way to loop back. Woopsies!]
[Say, though...  Didn't you see some tears on the way there? They MIGHT do the trick if you need to loop back easily...]
[(Come say hi sometime! I'm so lonely... Sob sob... Do you feel sorry for me yet...)]

rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.dialogue: Mirabelle, any idea where the key for this would be?

rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.dialogue: I'm not sure, I--
(Oops. You forgot to check the drawer in the Head Housemaiden's office.)
(The door is locked tight.)
(The key for it was in the Head Housemaiden's office, but it's inaccessible now...)
(Someone frozen in time.)
(Someone looking for their partner, frozen in time.)

rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.dialogue: Oh! This is...

rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.dialogue: I don't know. I've seen them around, sometimes. I think they're someone's partner...?

rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.dialogue: Someone's bonded partner, even.

rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.dialogue: Look at their earrings. Aren't they bonding earrings?
(You look at them.)
(Their left ear has a beautiful dark dangling earring, and the right ear, a simple transparent one.)
(Are those bonding earrings? You're not familiar with what that is...)

rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.dialogue: The earrings have different, but complimentary designs... How romantic!

rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.dialogue: I wonder which half is theirs! I feel like the clear one represents them better, so maybe that's the one their partner made...

rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.dialogue: Do you think we'll see their partner somewhere in the House?

rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.dialogue: Yes... They might've been looking for each other when the King attacked.

rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.dialogue: If we manage to beat the King, they'd get back to normal, and look for their partner...

rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.dialogue: They'd start running, trying to find them...

rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.dialogue: Flower petals in their wake...

rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.dialogue: And then, they'd see each other from across a hallway, eyes locking...

rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.dialogue: They'd take one step forward, hesitantly, wondering if this is real...

rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.dialogue: And then...!!!

rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.dialogue: And then they'd trip on a brick and BREAK THEIR NOSE!

rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.dialogue: And their partner, seeing the blood, would faint in horror...

rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.dialogue: And then they'd feel so bad they made their partner faint, they would exile themselves in shame!

rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.dialogue: Ah, yes... How romantic...

rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.dialogue: IT'S NOT!!!

rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.dialogue: STOP CRUSHING OUR DREAMS!!!
(What's a bonding earring? You suppose it's not very important, but...)
(Ok, now you understand the context of this conversation.)
(Their fist is closed, as if they're holding something.)
(Could it be...?)
(You try to get it out...)

rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.dialogue: Sif? What are you...
(Their hand is frozen in time, but you manage to get the item out.)
(...It's a dark earring, same design as the one they're wearing on their left ear.)
(You get the earring from their closed fist.)
(You got the BONDING EARRING!)
(You put the earring in your pocket along with your Souvenirs.)

rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.dialogue: Oh my.

rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.dialogue: OH!!!

rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.dialogue: OH CRAB!!! THAT'S THE OTHER HALF!!!

rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.dialogue: Th-They didn't give it to their partner yet?!

rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.dialogue: We have to find their partner.

rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.dialogue: And give them the earring...!!!
(Time to find their partner!)
(Time to find their partner.)
(Sure, not like you have anything to do anyway.)

rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.dialogue: Two rows of tears...

rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.dialogue: BUT ONLY ONE CREST!!!

rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.dialogue: I think. We haven't found one of those yet, right?

rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.dialogue: We have not.
(You should come back here once you've found a Crest...)
(Go find the Star Crest.)

rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.dialogue: So we have to decide which way to go, huh... Why don't we--

rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.dialogue: I vote this way!

rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.dialogue: Why this way?

rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.dialogue: Manly man's intuition.

rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.dialogue: Ah...

rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.dialogue: That's stupid. You're stupid.

rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.dialogue: I vote this way!

rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.dialogue: ... Why this way?

rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.dialogue: Smart kid's intuition.

rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.dialogue: And also it's the way Za didn't choose, so.

rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.dialogue: I'm with the kid. It's been a while since we teamed up, hasn't it?

rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.dialogue: Yeah, yeah!

rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.dialogue: We're the, um... Opposite Sides Of The Age Specter Allies!

rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.dialogue: It was "Opposite Sides of the Age Spectrum Alliance", but I understand there's big words in there.

rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.dialogue: Opposite Sides of the Age Specterm Alliance!!!

rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.dialogue: Awww...

rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.dialogue: Um...
