rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.dialogue: Mira...!!!

rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.dialogue: Mirabelle, my friend, my sister from another mother!!! Please!!!

rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.dialogue: No, Belle's with us!!!

rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.dialogue: Um, um!!!

rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.dialogue: I- I'm with Isabeau!!!

rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.dialogue: Yes...

rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.dialogue: Belle and Beau! Beauty Alliance!!!

rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.dialogue: Beauty Alliance!!!

rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.dialogue: Ha, what kind of name is that?! Do you guys spend the day looking pretty?

rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.dialogue: How dare you!!!

rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.dialogue: Also, yes??? Just look at us.
(Isabeau strikes a pose, and Mirabelle follows suit a beat later.)
(They both look striking.)

rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.dialogue: Ew.

rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.dialogue: We have all chosen a side. So that only leaves...
(Oh no.)

rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.dialogue: Siffrin. You're the tie-breaker.

rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.speaker: Siffrin
rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.dialogue: (But you hate being the tie-breaker!!!)

rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.dialogue: No. They insulted the Beauty Alliance. All that's left is war.

rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.dialogue: Woah.

rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.dialogue: Unless you bring peace to the Alliances by choosing a side...

rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.speaker: Siffrin
rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.dialogue: (You're the only one that can bring peace to this land...)
(Okay, you know which way to go now.)
(Since going with the Age Alliance didn't give you a key... Hopefully the other side should have one...?)
(Since going with the Beauty Alliance brought you to a room with a key...)
(But you could also pick wrong on purpose and see what the other side has to offer?)

rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.dialogue: CRAB YEAH!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.dialogue: Sif, no... How could you...

rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.dialogue: I thought we were friends, Siffrin...

rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.dialogue: Betrayer!!! Traitor!!!

rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.dialogue: Let them eat a thousand needles!!!

rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.dialogue: ...Okay we have to stop, Siffrin looks very distraught.

rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.dialogue: Hehehe, you're so cute, Siffrin! We didn't mean it, promise!
(You hide your face under the brim of your hat.)

rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.dialogue: Heh. Let's use this Crest then, shall we?

rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.dialogue: ...Okay, they actually look sad.

rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.dialogue: Oh no! W-we didn't mean it, Siffrin!
(You force yourself to pout exaggeratedly, then wink cutely at them.)

rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.dialogue: Ew.

rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.dialogue: Hm. Let's use this Crest then, shall we?

rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.dialogue: ...No reaction...?

rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.dialogue: You're no fun, Siffrin. Let's use this Crest then, shall we?

rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.dialogue: YES

rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.dialogue: ...  We will not forget such a terrible slight, Siffrin.

rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.dialogue: We will not forget!!! We will not forgive!!!!

rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.dialogue: May you eat only potatoes for the rest of your life!!!

rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.dialogue: May your house fall down on your horrified face.

rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.dialogue: Yeah!!! What she said!!!

rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.dialogue: ...We're kidding, Siffrin. Don't look so distraught.

rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.dialogue: I'm not kidding. I'll put potatoes in Frin's pockets.

rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.dialogue: Shh, don't tell them. I'll help you later.
(You assume a guarding stance.)
(Bonnie immediately assumes an attacking stance.)

rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.dialogue: Alright, kids. Let's use this Crest then, shall we?

rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.dialogue: Uh oh.

rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.dialogue: ...We're kidding, Siffrin. Don't look so sad.
(You blink, and wink at them cutely.)

rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.dialogue: You know you can't wink at us with only one eye, right. I feel like you forget sometimes.

rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.dialogue: Alright, alright. Let's use this Crest then, shall we?

rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.dialogue: ...Let's use this Crest then, shall we?

rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.dialogue: Let's gooooooo~!
(The door is locked tight.)
(The lock keeping it closed has an interesting shape... You can't even describe it.)
(The door is locked tight.)
(It's locked by one of those weird word locks.)
(You say the word "Change" aloud.)
(Nothing happens.)

rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.dialogue: Worth a try!
(Nothing happens.)

rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.dialogue: Worth a try!
(You say the word "Openphrase123" aloud.)
(...The door unlocked.)

rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.dialogue: Oh Change.

rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.dialogue: Was the openphrase for this door really just "openphrase" and then "123"?

rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.dialogue: That's...

rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.dialogue: SO SMART!!!

rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.dialogue: It's NOT. Let's just go in...
(You leave the door alone.)
(A little dog.)
(It's frozen in time.)

rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.dialogue: The King freezing humans in time for all eternity wasn't great, but him freezing a dog really is the last straw for me.

rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.dialogue: I can't believe this. Why would he attack a little dog. I'll never forgive him.

rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.dialogue: And such a cute dog, too...

rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor2/hallways2.html.dialogue: Urgh... The King is the worst!!! I can't wait to see him and punch him in the face!!!
(Odile reaches out and roughly ruffles Bonnie's hair.)
(You kneel down and all take turns petting the dog.)
(It's just like touching a statue.)
(Since it's frozen, you can't even feel the texture of its fur...)
(A little dog, frozen in time.)
(You kneel, and pet it for a little bit.)
(Isn't petting an animal supposed to calm you down?)
(Your heart is beating too fast still.)

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: (Someone frozen in time.)
(The librarian, frozen in time.)

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: That's the librarian...!

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: Were they a good one, Mira?

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: O-oh, yes! They always had good recommendations if you're looking for something...

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: And they have a sixth sense for knowing exactly what kind of book you'd like to read at any given time!

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: They're the one who recommended "The Cursing of Château Castle" to me! And, well, to everyone else in the House, hehe.

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: Oh, that book series you're a fan of...

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: Yes!!! I'm incredibly thankful to them for that!

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: Uh huh...

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: ...It's a good series, madame Odile.

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: ...Uh huh.

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: I'll make you read it one day, madame Odile.

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: Try to convince the others instead.

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: ... Isab--

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: It has romance, right?

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: Yes!

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: Sold!!!
(The librarian, frozen in time.)
(Someone frozen in time.)
(The bookcase is filled with theater scripts.)
(No familytales.)
(You gently touch the back of a Vaugardian comedy you remember liking.)
(The Vaugardian comedy you remember liking is still here.)

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: Aw, don't worry Sif, you'll be able to see some plays soon!

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: So, there's... There's something I've always wondered.

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: What is it, Bonnie?

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: Well, um... You know that stage play Frin brought us to, before we got the last Orb to open the House?

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: In it... The main characters...

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: The two men kissed on the mouth, right?

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: Ah...

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: Oh gems.

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: Shush, I want to hear this.

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: And so, um... When people kiss on the mouth. In plays.

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: They don't REALLY kiss, right? They have some transparent paper in between so their lips don't touch, right???

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: ...What?

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: What.

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: UH HUH, WHAT?

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: Huh!

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: Yeah, I knew it! No one would ever kiss someone on the mouth in a play! Not in front of everyone!

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: Not in front of everyone!!!!

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: Hehehe...

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: Oh, that's really good.

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: Boniface, this is why you're my favorite.

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: Woohoo!
(Vaugardian plays are okay, but you REALLY like Poterian plays!)
(You think. It's been a little bit since you've seen one.)
(Not that you remember a single one, right now!!!)
(The bookcase is filled with theater scripts.)
(What's the point of reading them? Aren't you in one right now?)
(Stop going off-script and keep going!!!)
(The bookcase is filled with various novels.)
("How To Not Make A Fool Of Yourself: A Journey", "Tick", "Soul Emperor IV: The Soulempering", and "The Cursing of Château Castle", issues #40 to #48.)
( ...Issue #48? You should remember this number.)
(No familytales.)
(The bookcase is filled with various novels.)
(The bookcase is filled with random books, from novels to picture books to massive research essays.)
(You see this side of the bookcase shine slightly.)
(There must be a key somewhere... Maybe inside one of the books?)
(Which book should you examine?)
(You open the book...)
(No key.)
(The book falls open on a recipe for some kind of Ka Buan dumplings.)

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: DUMPLINGS!!!!!!

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: Ah, those are called "gyozas", Boniface.

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: GYOZAS!!!!!!

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: HOW DO YOU MAKE THEM?!??!!??

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: Please stop screaming.

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: SORRY!!!! Sorry.

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: How do you make them?
(Bonnie looks intently at the recipe.)

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: Huh... Oh, okay... Oh, that's crabbing easy...

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: Our tiny little adorable chef's at it again.

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: What? Oh, sorry! We can go, I can look at it later...

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: No, it's fine, you might as well look at it now.

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: Okay!!!

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: My sister, she...

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: ...What about your sister, Bonnie...?

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: It...

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: It doesn't matter. Can we go now?
(You all look sadly at Bonnie, and try to keep moving...)
(Bonnie...)
(Why did you pick that book?)

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: My sister doesn't let me cook often even though she sucks at cooking, so it's nice I can cook with you guys.
(Oh!)

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: She doesn't...? Why not?

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: 'Cuz I blew up our kitchen once.

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: HUH?!?

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: I was trying to craft a meal spicy enough to explode!!!

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: A feat also known as a "bomb", Boniface.

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: That's what 'Nille said, yeah.

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: So I'm not allowed to cook Crafted meals anymore. Just regular ones where I follow the recipe.

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: But it's not fair!!! I wanna get better at Crafted cooking!!! I wanna Craft a meal that makes you fart all the bad feelings out!!!

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: HUH?!?

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: A... Noble goal...
(You're glad Bonnie felt comfortable enough to tell you this story.)
(You open the book...)
(Yep.)
(Inside the book titled "Effort: The Key To Meaningful Change", there's a key.)
(Pretty on-the-nose...)
(You found the PAPER KEY!)
(The keychain dangling from it is shaped like a hand in the Paper position...)
(You put the Key in your Pocket.)
(You now know where the Paper Key is located.)
(You open the book.)
(You found the PAPER KEY!)
(The keychain dangling from it is shaped like a hand in the Paper position...)
(You put the Key in your Pocket.)
(You open the book.)
(No key.)

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: This book seems to be about how to get a better running posture, and better endurance...

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: M'dame Odile could use this book, huh?

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: What does THAT mean.

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: J-Just that you're not very fast, is all?

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: And you get tired easily, too...

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: Maybe if you kids could stop running everywhere you go...

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: Huh, Siffrin.
(You quickly look away from her glare.)
(You smile cutely.)
(You smile.)

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: It's okay, Dile. I can teach you how to run good.

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: Yes m'dame, take lessons from the kid who puts their arms straight behind them while running! I want to see you do it!

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: It IS a very interesting way to run, Bonnie... But why...?

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: Another kid in Bambouche said running like that was air-no-no-mic!

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: Airnonomic...?

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: ...I don't know that Vaugardian word.

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: Me neither.

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: What's it mean?

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: Um... It means...

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: It means the wind doesn't matter and I can go fast. It's air-no-no-mic.

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: Ah! Do you mean "ergonomic"?

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: Do I?

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: I hope not. That's not how you use that word.

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: It's not?

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: Nope.

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: But running like that makes me faster.

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: Does it?

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: It does.

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: Okay.

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: So Dile should run like this too.

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: I'd rather not.

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: Hehehe...
(You leave the books alone.)
(Getting close...)
(Believe it or not, this side of the bookcase is irrelevant.)
(You open the book.)
(Got the PAPER KEY.)
(Forgotten again?!)
(Nothing here!!!)
(The bookcase is filled with books about the House of Change.)
(No familytales.)

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: So, "The House of Change" is the name of the belief, but "The House" is the name of the place...

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: And there's more than one House in Vaugarde.

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: And a "house" is where people live!

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: Such a confusing language.

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: N-no, it's not so bad!!! It makes sense!!!

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: Hm...

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: I-If you'd like to know more about the House of Change...

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: Yes, recommend me a book. But let's be quick about it...

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: Okay!!! Okay!!! Yes!!! Alright, I think you should try this one...

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: "The Life-Changing Magic of Changing Yourself!"

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: This one is a little abstract, but it is all about our beliefs and the Change God!

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: Living while striving for change within ourselves, while keeping our ever-changing god in our thoughts...

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: This book explains pretty well the belief that a lot of the people of Vaugarde live by!

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: Hm... Interesting that you only have one deity. Easy to keep track of, I suppose...

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: Oh yeah, what do you have in Ka Bue then?

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: We have... gods? Spirits? Expressions? The nuance gets a little lost in Vaugardian...

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: Expressions for everything.

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: So how many Expressions do you have then? A dozen?

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: A few thousand.
(Huh!)
(You're not sure how many deities you worship.)
(Does the Universe count Expressions and the Change God within it?)

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: WHAT

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: SO MANY!!!

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: DO YOU HAVE TO KEEP TRACK OF ALL OF THEM???

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: Of course not! You only have to pray to the ones that you need.

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: So for me... The Expression of Search, the Expression of Writing, the Expression of Creator Craft...

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: And lately, the Expressions of Battle and Victory, I suppose.

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: Cool...

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: That's pretty neat!

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: I hope the Expressions and the Change God bless us in our journey...
(The bookcase is filled with books about the House of Change.)
(The bookcase is filled with books about the House of Change.)
(Absolutely irrelevant, as usual!)
(The bookcase is filled with notebooks of all shapes and sizes.)
(They look kind of out of place here...)
(You point at them and look at Mirabelle.)

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: Oh! They're diaries, Siffrin!

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: Diaries, in a library?

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: Oh yeah, you guys do that in Dormont too! It's popular in Jouvente as well!

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: So, so, you know how our belief encourages change, right?

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: Sometimes, when people change, they might not feel any attachment to the people they were before...

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: ...Or they might want any trace of who they were to just disappear from their sight!

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: And so some Houses let it widely known that you can give away items that remind you too much of who you were...

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: Like diaries!

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: But those items... Aren't they given away to be disposed of?

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: Most items are, but diaries in particular are usually kept by Houses. I-It's common knowledge though!!!

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: I personally find it weird... Even if I changed that much, I wouldn't want people to read my thoughts...

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: It's more of a gesture, right? Letting go of your past self! Names and any obvious signifiers are erased by the House anyway. But mostly...

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: It's about history! Isn't it fun to be able to pick up a diary written by someone a very long time ago? See big historical events from their perspective?

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: More than "giving away a part of who you were", I think a lot of people actually give their diaries away so it's like.

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: "Look mom, I wrote a book that's in a library".

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: Ha! I can understand that, then,
(The idea of anyone reading your deepest thoughts, even years in the future, completely removed from you...)
(Gross!!!)
(Again, Vaugarde is weird.)
(But also you love drama, so you happily pick the gaudiest, sparkliest diary you see.)

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: Oh, this one looks fairly recent!

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: We could read a little bit... Like, a tiny bit.
(The bookcase is filled with notebooks of all shapes and sizes.)
(You look at the sparkly diary.)
(Mirabelle catches you looking.)

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: Oh, this one looks fairly recent!

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: We could read a little bit... Like, a tiny bit.
(You probably should, right now.)

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: Aw, boo...
(You get away from the diary.)
(No familytales.)

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: We do not have time...

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: ...Is what I would usually say, but I'd also love to think about boring, mundane, everyday problems for a bit.

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: Dear diary, save us from thinking about our problems!

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: Belle, pick a page!!!

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: One page, and then we're going.

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: I, I'm reading again? Okay, hmmm...
(Everyone huddles around her.)
(Mirabelle takes a deep breath, and opens it straight in the middle.)

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: Okay...

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Diary
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: "Mom told me to clean my room today."

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Diary
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: "I HATE CLEANING MY ROOM!!! MY ROOM ISN'T EVEN DIRTY!! WHY DOESN'T SHE UNDERSTAND!!!!!!!"

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Diary
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: "Urgh. Also, Dad noticed no one can say the name of the island north of here anymore?"

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Diary
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: "I tried to say it yesterday and I got like the WEIRDEST headache for HOURS."

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Diary
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: "Might trick my friends into saying it tomorrow."
(The rest is just doodles of a little girl laughing uproariously.)

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue:
Ah, the island north of Vaugarde...
I remember when it happened.

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: Well... "Remember" isn't the right word, is it? We all just know something happened.

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: An entire stretch of land disappearing from people's minds doesn't happen often, does it?

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: I think, I think my village was really close to it!!! My sister said it was all everyone could talk about for weeks!!!

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: That's so frightening... I'm glad that whatever happened, she didn't get caught up in it!

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: Oh... yeah...

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: Still...

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: That country's name... What was it's name again?

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: Oh, I think it was something like--

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: DON'T

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: SAY IT!!!!

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: CRAB!!!!

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: NYEHEHEHEHEHEHEHEH!!!!!!!!!!
(Huh! What an interesting diary entry!)
(You open your mouth, but no sound comes out.)
(The name of this country...)
(You try to remember, remember, remember.)
(Only silence answers you.)
(Is this... What the King wanted you to remember?)
("Just remember it... Say it... Make it real...")
(You can't say it, you don't even want to try, but...)
(You turn to Isabeau.)
(You turn to Isabeau.)
(Maybe this time?)

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: Huh, but whyyyyyyyyyy ? It's just gonna give me a heada--
(Isabeau looks at you.)
(Something about your expression makes him reconsider.)

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: Well... Sure, Sif! I'll say it!

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: That country's name was. . .

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: Was. . .

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: You know, I had it before, but now that I'm actively trying to remember it, nothing comes to mind?

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: Huh, is that so?

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: You're dumb, Za, I know it! It's. . .

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: Weh? But...

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: Wait...

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: Huh?! What's...

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: Can't remember it either, yeah?

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: When you asked me, answering you felt automatic, like if you asked me what 1 plus 1 makes, but trying to remember it now is more like...

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: Like calculating 72 times 89!!!

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: Nah, that's 6408, I have a brain and I know how to use it.

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: WHAT?

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: ISABEAU?

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: Nah, it felt more like...

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: Asking me to remember my first steps.

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: How can I remember that!!! I can't remember that!!! How can you expect me to remember that!!!

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: What a terrible analogy.

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: But I can't seem to remember it either... When we were talking about it, I could think it clearly, but trying to remember it now, let alone say it...

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: I can't remember the country itself, either! I just remember it was an island, north of Vaugarde...

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: And... And it had a different belief than the Change belief, didn't it? Something about the sky...?

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Siffrin
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: (You know.)

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Siffrin
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: (You know, you know, you know.)

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: That's right! The Universe!

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: Oh yeah... Like, stars and stuff.

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: We also know that people could remember that country clearly, before.

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: And. . .

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: Urgh, my head is killing me.

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: And we know that trying to remember stuff makes our brains hurt.

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: Let's stop here. It'd be bad to fight the King with a raging migraine...

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: Yeah...

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: Sorry we couldn't say it, Sif!
(You don't respond.)
(Stars...)
(So the King is from that country as well.)
(The country no one can remember.)
(Your country. The country you were born in, raised in, spent your entire childhood in.)
(And yet...)
(Even now, thinking about it, what it may have looked like...)
(You can't even imagine it.)
(For a long time now, you haven't been able to remember anything about it. You forget it even exists, half the time.)
(Anything linked to that country has just stopped existing for you.)
(Your childhood, your parents, your life, your language, your culture, your faith, the stars, the constellations, the Universe.)
(It's all gone, forgotten.)
(The King... He was from there, you're sure of it.)
(And then, something happened, and the country disappeared without a trace, unable to be remembered by anyone.)
(No one can remember what made everyone forget about its very existence... But something must've, right?)
(But... If it happened... If he's so attached to it, he asks you if you remember it every single time you see him...)
(If he's so attached to that country... Why would he be so obsessed with Vaugarde, then?)
(Why would he decide to freeze it all in time?)
(You can't figure it out quite yet, but there must be something somewhere... Something that's similar to his goal...)
(Who cares, who cares, who cares.)
(That was fascinating !)
(You try to think of that country's name...)
(Nope! Nothing comes to mind.)
(You can't even think its name anymore.)
(What kind of person can't even say their country's name.)
(No no no no no no--)
(You try and say it over and over and over again but nothing comes out!!!)
(Stupid blinding idiot can't even say their country's name!!! Hahahahaha!!!)
(Stop looking at it!!!)
(A list of books that have been checked out of the library.)
(Odile is looking intently at the list...)
(You take a look, too.)
(...No one here seems to have checked out a familytale.)
(A pile of lists of books that have been checked out of the library.)
(Odile is looking intently at the list...)
(You take a look, too.)
(...Looks like one person checked out every single available issue of "The Cursing of Château Castle".)
(No one here seems to have checked out a familytale.)
(A list of books that have been checked out of the library.)
(Odile is looking intently at the list...)
(But Odile isn't here, stupid!!!!!!)
(A list of books that have been checked out of the library.)
(A book that seems a little too heavy for the table it's on.)

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: This book is massive!

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: It's called... "The Complete History of Fishing."

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: Hm...
(Odile takes the book with two hands...)
(...And hits the table with it.)

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: Do that again.

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: . . . Please!

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: CRAB YEAH

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: Ha, indeed.

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: I'll take this one.
(Odile got the HEAVY BOOK!)
(She puts it in her pocket to equip later.)

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: A fishing book... . . .

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: FISHING-OLO--

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: It's called "Ichthyology", and I am not studying it.

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: BOO.

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: This boo--

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: ... That was a very weak "boo", Isabeau...

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: Haha, yeah! I'm a spooky prankster!
(An empty table.)
(You look at the book.)
(An empty table, as always, as always, as always.)
(There's a crumpled poem on the ground...)
(You pick it up.)
(You got the CRUMPLED POEM!)
(You put the poem in your pocket along with your Souvenirs.)
(Got the CRUMPLED POEM!)
(You put the poem in your pocket along with your Souvenirs.)
(This wall feels different somehow...)
(But you don't see any switches or anything, so you leave it alone.)
(The librarian in Dormont mentioned a secret library, didn't they?)
(Yeah, hidden switch.)
(This one was very well hidden... If you weren't certain there was a switch there, you never would've noticed it.)
(You press the switch.)

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: WHAT?!?

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: What the gems--?!

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: SECRET PASSAGE!!!

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: But how-- How did you--

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: That's so weird?! Was it here all this time?!?
(You go ahead.)

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: Nice one, but you're the one who found it, buddy.
(You wink.)

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: Isabeau, don't let the wink distract you.

rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/houselibrary.html.dialogue: CRAB, WAIT,
(You've already moved on.)
(Some vials.)
(Let's see...)
(You pick them up.)
(You got two SWEET TONICS!)
(You give it to Bonnie for safekeeping.)
(Nothing else here.)

rooms/floor2/infirmary.html.dialogue: (You don't feel like there's a key there... But you could be wrong?)
[You're not! You picked the wrong way, stardust!]
(A closet. There's a porcelain doll in it.)
(It's cracked, with half of its face missing. Someone probably threw it away.)
(You put the doll in your pocket along with your Souvenirs.)
(This doll will never see the end.)
(A closet. There's a porcelain doll in it.)
(It's cracked, with half its face missing. Someone probably threw it away.)
(You put the doll in your pocket along with your Souvenirs.)
(You'll see the end this time, broken doll!)
(Even if it's the last thing you do!!!)
(There's a bunch of things on the bed, like... Oh?)
(You give the Drop Earring to Isabeau to equip later.)
(There's a bunch of things on the bed, but none catch your eye.)
(You look at everything that's on the bed.)
(Someone is laying on the bed, frozen in time.)

rooms/floor2/infirmary.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/infirmary.html.dialogue: Um. I don't actually know who that is.

rooms/floor2/infirmary.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/infirmary.html.dialogue: They look Poterean, don't they? Look at those clothes.

rooms/floor2/infirmary.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/infirmary.html.dialogue: A traveler, perhaps? Trying to escape from something?

rooms/floor2/infirmary.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor2/infirmary.html.dialogue: They left their home and then went right back to Vaugarde, right to the King! And got frozen!
(Someone is laying on the bed, frozen in time.)
(Someone is laying on the bed, frozen in time.)
(Gasp! It's a tiny bottle with a label saying "Grape Juice For Adults".)
(It's a tiny bottle with a label saying "Grape Juice For Adults".)

rooms/floor2/infirmary.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor2/infirmary.html.dialogue: Can you not drink grape juice in an infirmary???

rooms/floor2/infirmary.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/infirmary.html.dialogue: No, Boniface, it's against the law.

rooms/floor2/infirmary.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/infirmary.html.dialogue: Ah... Have you drank grape juice in an infirmary before, Bonnie?

rooms/floor2/infirmary.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/infirmary.html.dialogue: You know you can get severely punished for that, right?

rooms/floor2/infirmary.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor2/infirmary.html.dialogue: Aaaah... Thank you... I'm sorry I'm a criminal...
(Inside the drawer is a tiny bottle with a label saying "Grape Juice For Adults".)
(You hate the taste of alcohol, but you take a swig anyway.)
(It tastes like normal, non-alcoholic grape juice.)
(Can't get drunk in peace around here!!!)
(It says, in big bold letters: "WASH YOUR CRABBING HANDS.")
(This is why you wear gloves, haha!)

rooms/floor2/infirmary.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/infirmary.html.dialogue: You should wash your gloves too.
(A little note is attached to them.)
("Get well soon so we can go PARTY!!!!!!!", with a lot of hearts.)
(...And a volume of "The Cursing of Château Castle", issue #10.)
(You give it to Bonnie for safekeeping.)

rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.dialogue: (The bookcase is filled with some books about Craft Skills.)
(The librarian said you might find something here to protect you against the King...)
(You look closely at the books in this section.)

rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.dialogue: Siffrin? Are you looking for something in particular?

rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.speaker: Siffrin
rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.dialogue: (Might as well get the book lovers on this too...) "How do you craft shields?"

rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.dialogue: Like, shields in battle? To protect ourselves?

rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.dialogue: It would be useful, wouldn't it... We have skills to boost our defense, but a shield would be cool.

rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.dialogue: I-I was thinking about learning! And I feel like I'm close to getting it!!!

rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.dialogue: But... I'm not there yet. Sorry.

rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.dialogue: This book here is just called "Shields", and it's super dusty.

rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.dialogue: Dusty books are good, right?
(Bonnie gives Mirabelle the book.)

rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.dialogue: Well, that's not how it works, but... . . .

rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.dialogue: Wait... Wait a second.

rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.dialogue: THAT'S ALL?!?!? THAT'S HOW YOU DO IT?!??!

rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.dialogue: Ah.

rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.dialogue: Oh, this sounds fun.

rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.dialogue: So then, if I do this, and keep this in mind, and don't forget about this...
(Mirabelle mumbles under her breath for a long time...)

rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.dialogue: Okay, so...

rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.dialogue: Siffrin, do NOT move. I'm about to try a highly volatile Craft Skill on you that I've never tried before.
(UM,)
(You slowly open your eye.)
(Your body feels like it's covered in a warm blanket...)
(Suddenly, Bonnie punches you in the stomach.)

rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.dialogue: Owie.

rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.dialogue: Siffrin, did you feel something...?
(You didn't feel a thing!)
(You give Mirabelle a thumbs up.)

rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.dialogue: CRAB YEAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAH!!!!!!!!!
(Mirabelle learned ADORABLE MOVING SHIELD!)
[Stardust! You did it!]
[Your little Housemaiden now knows Adorable Moving Shield! When crafted, it creates a SHIELD that protects your allies from TIMESTOP and SLOW for three turns. It also boosts DEFENSE!]
[You can try to beat the King again now... Make sure to use this skill to survive, okay?]

rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.speaker: Siffrin
rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.dialogue: (Well, that's nice and all, but...)

rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.dialogue: Hey, Sif...

rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.dialogue: Sorry! Sorry!!! But it just, it didn't make any sense before...

rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.dialogue: Sometimes things need to click, you know?
(It's annoying, but she knows it now.)

rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.speaker: Siffrin
rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.dialogue: (There IS something you need to ask though...) "What made it click, then?"

rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.dialogue: Oh, that's easy! It's all about--
(Mirabelle suddenly bombards you with technical terms!!!)

rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.dialogue: --and that's how you do it!!!

rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.dialogue: I did not understand even a little bit of this.

rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.dialogue: Hm, I couldn't craft a skill like that myself, but...

rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.dialogue: But it's just about using the CARROT method, right?

rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.dialogue: Is it? I guess that makes some sort of sense...

rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.dialogue: It is! They actually mention it in here too!
(What's the CARROT method.)

rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.dialogue: What's the CARROT method.

rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.dialogue: If you don't know the CARROT method, you don't need to know the CARROT method.
(You sure feel stupider than usual this loop.)

rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.speaker: Siffrin
rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.dialogue: (So, uh...) "So, hypothetically, someone reminding you of the CARROT method would make it click for you?"
(Well there you go.)
(The bookcase is filled with books about Craft Skills.)

rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.dialogue: Wow, look at how old this book just called "Shields" looks!
(Bonnie is pointing at a book.)
(...That's the book that made Mirabelle learn her skill.)
(Bonnie is pointing at that "Shields" book.)

rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.dialogue: Sniff sniff.

rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.dialogue: Smells weird.

rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.dialogue: I'm taking it!!!
(Bonnie takes the book off the shelf and opens it to a random page.)

rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.dialogue: Oh, it's a cooking book. It's talking about carrots and stuff.

rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.dialogue: What? Let me see...

rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.dialogue: Ah, no, that's the CARROT method, Bonbon, not carrots.

rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.dialogue: Oh, the CARROT method!

rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.dialogue: Siffrin reminded me of it yesterday... That's how I figured out that nice new shield skill!

rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.dialogue: ...Is that so...?
(You smile awkwardly.)
(You smile.)

rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.dialogue: Ah, your new shield skill!

rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.dialogue: They show it in this book too, look!

rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.dialogue: Oh... They do!!!

rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.dialogue: If Siffrin didn't teach me yesterday, this could've been useful...

rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.dialogue: But I already know it, book! Siffrin taught me, book! And it'll protect us against the King, book!
(Odile is staring at you.)
(You look away. Maybe you shouldn't have looked at that bookcase...)

rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.dialogue: Ah, this book mentions shields that reflect attacks, too!

rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.dialogue: Those are so complicated... I wish I could figure it out someday.
(The bookcase is filled with books about Craft Skills.)
(The bookcase is filled with moldy old books.)
(No familytales.)
(One of them is written in a language you cannot read.)
(It has a big, sparkly tree on the cover.)
(Just looking at the title is giving you a headache...)
(But you could read it, if you remembered the Memory of it, wouldn't you?)
(The bookcase is filled with moldy old books.)
(One of them is written in your language.)
(You can read it, now...)
(...Actually, you can't.)
(There's a lot of hard words in there... You don't know what this is even about.)
(Maybe you should go back to it later...)
(One of them is written in your language.)
(You can read it, now...)
(...It seems to be a book on different rituals to Craft wishes!)
(You could read it now, but you haven't read the previous Wish Craft book with everyone, back on Floor 1.)
(You might miss some precious insights, if they don't understand what you're talking about... You should come back after reading the first book again.)
(One of them is written in your language.)
(You can read it, now...)
(...It seems to be a book on different rituals to Craft wishes!)
(You flip through it...)
(You've read the Wish Craft rituals book before, but it wouldn't hurt to get a refresher...)

rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.dialogue: Oh, another wiggly headachy book.

rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.dialogue: Is this another book on Wish Craft?
(You nod.)
(You start translating as best you can...)
(The book talks about many different rituals to Craft wishes, from the correct way to pick up 4 leaf clovers, to calling out to shooting stars the right way, to...)

rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.dialogue: Favor Tree what now?

rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.dialogue: THE FAVOR TREES CAN GRANT WISHES?!?!?

rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.dialogue: FAVOR TREES LIKE THE ONE IN DORMONT?!?!

rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.dialogue: THE ONE EVERYONE ASKED THINGS TO?!?
(It makes sense, it makes sense!!!)
(You even vaguely remember thinking about it, a long time ago!!!)
(Asking a higher power for a favor is no different than making a wish, isn't it? Isn't it???)
(So, could someone's wish to the Favor Tree have trapped you here? Whose?)
(What)
(What did you wish for, at the Favor Tree, again?)
(You think and think and think, trying to remember what you even wished for.)
(It was so far back!!! Such a long time ago...)
(You wished...)
(You wished... to visit more places with Mirabelle.)
(You wished... to wear clothes Isabeau has made.)
(You wished... to see Odile's country with your own eyes.)
(You wished... to be here when Bonnie reunites with their sister.)
(Was that all?)
(You think so.)
(Oh.)
(It can't... It can't be because of your wish, then.)
(You haven't even gotten farther than beating the King, let alone leaving the House to make that wish come true.)
(Your wish can't come true until you escape the loops...)
(So then, maybe...)
(Your wish isn't what's trapping you here.)
(You know what they all wished for, but might as well ask again...)

rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.dialogue: To the Favor Tree, you mean?

rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.dialogue: Well, I mentioned it earlier, but I... Wished... To win a coin flip.

rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.dialogue: A wish that didn't come true, by the way.

rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.dialogue: Well, I might have done the correct ritual, but I didn't put any belief in it, did I?

rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.dialogue: A wish that came true, now that I think about it.

rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.dialogue: I didn't put any belief in it, but the rituals are supposed to be the important part, aren't they?
(But you know her wish doesn't come true on every loop...)
(Some loops she wins the coin flip, some loops she doesn't.)

rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.dialogue: I... I asked for my sister to be okay.

rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.dialogue: I-I wished for all of Vaugarde to be safe from the King!

rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.dialogue: ...What about you, Isabeau?

rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.dialogue: I, um, didn't wish for anything.

rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.dialogue: What.

rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.dialogue: What?

rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.dialogue: WHAT?!?!?

rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.dialogue: LISTEN!!! I just didn't know what to wish for!!! I'm an indecisive guy!!! Leave me alone!!!

rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.dialogue: I can't believe this...

rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.dialogue: Oh, m'dame "I'm gonna wish to win my next coin flip" is gonna judge me now?!

rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.dialogue: I didn't think anything would happen!!! At least I wished for something!!!

rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.dialogue: That's too bad...

rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.dialogue: Haaah... Yeah, I'm kinda bummed I didn't wish for anything now.

rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.dialogue: Why didn't I clap my hands and wish for something...

rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.speaker: Siffrin
rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.dialogue: (Huh?)

rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.speaker: Siffrin
rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.dialogue: (Follow the script...)

rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.dialogue: Uh, yeah?

rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.dialogue: That's how you ask a favor to the Favor Trees.

rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.dialogue: You look at the tree, and clap your hands once, and say aloud whatever you ask for.

rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.dialogue: Um...
(Isabeau looks at everyone else.)

rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.dialogue: Is that... Not correct?

rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.dialogue: No, it's what I did.

rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.dialogue: Me too. This is how you taught me, Isabeau.

rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.dialogue: That's also how I learned it at school?

rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.dialogue: Siffrin, did you... Not do it like that?

rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.dialogue: What?
(They're all looking at you!!!)
(You've only wished at a Favor Tree that one time, but it just makes sense!!!)
(You try to explain...)

rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.dialogue: Uh huh.

rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.dialogue: So, a link between you and the Tree?

rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.dialogue: So, the stars and stuff? They're the ones who make your wish come true?

rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.dialogue: ...What's a--

rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.dialogue: Keep going, Siffrin.

rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.dialogue: Three times?
(It's about which number feels right.)
(They're all staring at you!!!)
(They all stare at you.)

rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.dialogue: ...I suppose so???

rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.dialogue: That... Kind of makes sense, I suppose.

rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.dialogue: But that's so many details to remember...

rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.dialogue: And that's not how we were taught at all... It's something we learn as Vaugardians, and I've never heard anyone do it differently...

rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.dialogue: But then, the Favor Trees are more of a superstition, aren't they? No one really takes it seriously.

rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.dialogue: Well, except lately, where everyone started taking it super seriously just in case.

rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.dialogue: So... So...

rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.dialogue: So did everyone in the country mess up their wish?!?
(Odile starts laughing.)

rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.dialogue: Wh-Why are you laughing???

rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.dialogue: Sorry, sorry. It's just funny.

rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.dialogue: This could have been a way to save Vaugarde if everyone somehow wished for it, but no one knew how to do it correctly, so... Ha!

rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.dialogue: Hmf...

rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.dialogue: And the only person who knew how to do it wished for... ...

rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.dialogue: What DID you wish for, Siffrin?

rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.speaker: Siffrin
rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.dialogue: (It's embarrassing, so...) "I wished for croissants to be eradicated."

rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.dialogue: What.

rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.dialogue: What!!! No!!! Not croissants!!!

rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.dialogue: And since Siffrin knew the ritual, croissants might actually be...!!!

rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.dialogue: Oh nooo. I sure hope this specific wish doesn't come true.

rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.dialogue: But yeah, no one except Sif knew the right ritual, but...

rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.dialogue: Rituals are only one part of it, right? Belief is another!

rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.dialogue: If enough people wish for the same thing, maybe it can make a difference!

rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.dialogue: Heh... A drop of belief in an ocean of nothing.

rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.dialogue: Boo.
(So... Mirabelle wished for Vaugarde to be saved, Odile wished to win a coin flip, Bonnie wished for their sister to be okay, and Isabeau didn't wish for anything.)
(You don't think any of those wishes could've trapped you here.)
(So... Maybe someone else's?)
(The King probably wished for Vaugarde to be perfect or something, so you don't think it's related to you...)
(Is there a way to know what people in Vaugarde wished for?)
(You should ask the villagers in Dormont what they wished for...)
(The bookcase is filled with moldy old books.)
(The bookcase is filled with books about something called "Colors".)
(None of those catch your eye.)
(No familytales, but...)
(You need any help you can get.)
(You pick one at random...)
("Color Theory: What It Means For Us And Our Past".)
(Looks boring and dense...)

rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.dialogue: Oh yes, color theory! Are you interested, Siffrin?
(You shrug.)

rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.dialogue: Huh...

rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.dialogue: What's a color?

rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.dialogue: Hahaha, Za doesn't know what a color is!!!

rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.dialogue: I really don't! Tell me!

rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.dialogue: It's, um... Um...

rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.dialogue: It's like weird shades.

rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.dialogue: I learned it at school, but it wasn't very interesting so I crafted a drawing on my table instead.

rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.dialogue: Wow Bonbon, you're so hardcore.

rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.dialogue: They ARE weird shades, yes. This is a relatively new discovery, so I'm not surprised you haven't heard, Isabeau...

rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.dialogue: ...But a very long time ago, we could apparently see shades called "colors".

rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.dialogue: Yeah! They had a shade called "Bloo" and that's the sky's real shade, and one named "Grin" and that's what the grass looked like!

rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.dialogue: I think the world around us still are those "colors", but we just, um, forgot how to see them?

rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.dialogue: Or so researchers say... I think the House over in Corbeaux was researching it.

rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.dialogue: That's...

rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.dialogue: THAT'S SUCH BIG NEWS?!?! HOW DID I NOT KNOW THIS?!??!

rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.dialogue: I FAILED YOU ALL...

rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.dialogue: Oh, don't worry. We don't usually count on you to know things.

rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.dialogue: ...Oh yeah! That's true!!!
("Colors"... Shades people can't see anymore...)
(It seems silly, but somehow, this knowledge feels familiar to you.)
(The bookcase is filled with books about "Colors".)
(A pile of lists of checked out books.)
(Odile is looking intently at the list...)

rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.dialogue: ...Madame Odile? We should get going...

rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.dialogue: Oh, so now that I'M looking at something we should hurry up?
(Huh?)

rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.dialogue: Woah?

rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.dialogue: Ah, I'm, I'm sorry? We, um...

rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.dialogue: Dile... Are you mad at us?

rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.dialogue: No, no, I...

rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.dialogue: Sorry. We can keep going.
(You take a look, too.)

rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.dialogue: Um, you two? We should get going...

rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.dialogue: Give us a second, Mirabelle.
(You look through the titles, mumbling each one under your breath.)
("Lost Inland", "The History of Pepper", "What To Do When You're Sad And There's No Chocolate Around"...)

rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.speaker: Siffrin
rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.dialogue: (Ah! Here, at the very bottom...) "Paperasse Familytale..."

rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.dialogue: Where.

rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.dialogue: Pape-what now???

rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.dialogue: Who checked it out?
(Someone called "Charles Chouquette"...)

rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.dialogue: Charles Chouquette? Oh, that's the boulanger in Dormont!

rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.dialogue: Does he have a book you want, madame Odile?

rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.dialogue: So he has it...
(The boulangerie in Dormont, huh? They sold croissants, if you remember correctly...)

rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.dialogue: Hm...

rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.dialogue: ...Well, I'll have to check after we beat the King, and before I go away...

rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.dialogue: Hm?

rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.dialogue: What? What are we talking about?

rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.dialogue: Hah...

rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.dialogue: What about you, Siffrin? You were looking around... Did you find the book you were looking for?

rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.dialogue: Huh? A book? Are you both looking for a book?

rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.speaker: Siffrin
rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.dialogue: "I was, but it's fine."

rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.dialogue: Hey, are you ignoring us? What's happening? Is this another secret quest?!?

rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.dialogue: If you say it's fine, then it is. Let's get going everyone.
(Mirabelle and Isabeau look at each other, and sigh.)
(So the boulanger in Dormont might have checked out a familytale...)
(You should go back to Dormont and let Odile know!)

rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.dialogue: ...Paperasse familytale, huh?

rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.dialogue: Interesting.

rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/secret_library.html.dialogue: Very interesting.
(You look away.)
(A pile of lists of checked out books.)
(Books with no titles.)

rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.dialogue: This room feels safe too, doesn't it?

rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.dialogue: Maybe not. We might still have a lot to--

rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.dialogue: How hungry are you for it to be this loud...?

rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.dialogue: I don't get this swole by skipping meals!!!

rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.dialogue: Urgh. Anyway, let's take a break for now...

rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.dialogue: Bonbooooon, how much longer until the snacks are dooooone?

rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.dialogue: So, um... We haven't brought it up yet, so um... I have a question?

rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.dialogue: Ah, a secret adult conversation for adults no kids allowed?

rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.dialogue: Do you not want Boniface to hear?

rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.dialogue: Yeah... If we're sure they won't hear, then yeah...

rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.dialogue: Oh gems, they actually did forget. Someone better tell them later...

rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.dialogue: If any of you bites the dust, what should we do with your body?

rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.dialogue: I'm sorry! I'm sorry to ask!!! I know it's not the best moment!!!

rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.dialogue: B-but most of us have different beliefs, don't we? So, well...
