rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.dialogue: In case, Change forbid, one of us dies today, and the others are able to honor your body...

rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.dialogue: ...Like, m'dame Odile, is there a Ka Buan way, or...

rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.dialogue: Well... In Ka Bue, you'd burn the body and take the ashes to a Gemmaker to transform them into a diamond, but that won't be easily feasible, will it...

rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.dialogue: But if that's not doable, you can donate my body to any House in Vaugarde. If Vaugarde is saved, I'm sure they'd have a use for the body of a savior...

rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.dialogue: W-well, the House of Change recommends burying your body under a tree, so our body can nurture the nature around it.. Be part of Change and all that...

rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.dialogue: Is it the same for you, Isabeau?

rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.dialogue: I mean, I'd be dead, right? So I don't really... care that much about later.

rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.dialogue: And for, well, Bonnie, what should--

rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.dialogue: We won't allow Bonnie to die.

rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.dialogue: Even if we're about to die, there are ways to use Craft to make sure Bonnie will survive.
(You nod slightly out of sync with everyone.)
(You try to breathe deeply, in, and out.)
(You make sure to not look in Bonnie's direction.)
(Will there even be a time this will apply to you?)
(You won't die for good, so it doesn't matter!)
(You kind of wish this conversation would apply to you.)

rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.dialogue: Oh, this is new to me!

rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.dialogue: Is it, perhaps, common, where you come from?

rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.dialogue: But a journey to bury someone you know... I don't know how good of a journey that would be...

rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.dialogue: I suppose you won't mind if I throw your ashes to the nearest latrines, then?

rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.dialogue: Ha, like, cut your ashes in equal parts like a pizza?

rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.dialogue: We'd each get a part of you...

rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.speaker: Siffrin
rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.dialogue: "That way we can still have fun!"

rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.dialogue: A ghost Siffrin to play pranks on me at all times? I'm not so sure about that...

rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.speaker: Siffrin
rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.dialogue: "You can leave me behind for two hours a day."

rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.dialogue: How generous of you. I may have to take you up on that offer then.

rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.dialogue: Oh, it's a serious business snack time. I'm listening.

rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.dialogue: Snack times are always serious business, dummy.

rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.dialogue: We won't allow Bonnie to die.

rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.dialogue: Even if we're about to die, there are ways to use Craft to make sure Bonnie will survive.
(You all talked about your possible deaths, and then you saw Bonnie read a book about burial rituals... You didn't want to be right, but...)
(...But still, you have to make sure... Maybe... Maybe Bonnie isn't...)

rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.speaker: Siffrin
rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.dialogue: "Were you listening to us just now?"

rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.dialogue: ...  I don't wanna talk about it...

rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.dialogue: I don't wanna talk about it!!! I don't wanna talk about any of us dying!!!
(Oh no, why did you have to say anything.)
(Yeah, you had to say something, but they were listening all this time before and they were fine, right?!? Why did you have to say something?!)
(You should do something, you have to fix this--)

rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.dialogue: You're all stupid for talking about this!!! Stupid, stupid, stupid!!!
(You remember that touch is useful to make people less upset, or so you've heard.)
(You approach Bonnie, and try to pat their head.)
(You don't even get close before Bonnie slaps your hand away, and--)

rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.dialogue: Curse you, Frin!!! Don't come near me!!!

rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.dialogue: I don't want you to touch me, I don't want you to talk to me, I don't want you to even LOOK AT ME!!!

rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.dialogue: I don't want to think about ANY OF THIS!!!
(You know this isn't about you. They need your help right now.)

rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.dialogue: NO!!! STOP, STOP!!! DON'T COME NEAR ME!!!

rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.dialogue: If you like to talk about how everyone will die then you should just get it over with and die, Frin!!!!!! I don't care!!! I HATE YOU!!!!!!

rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.dialogue: I hate you I hate you I hate you I hate you I hate you I hate you I hate you I hate you IhateyouIhateyouIhateyou I HAAAAATE YOUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUU!!!!!!!!!

rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.speaker: Siffrin
rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.dialogue: "Bury me somewhere. Can we talk about something else?"

rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.dialogue: Oh, it's a serious business snack time. I'm listening.

rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.dialogue: Snack times are always serious business, dummy.

rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.dialogue: I mean, I'd be dead, right? So I don't really... care that much about later.

rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.dialogue: And for, well, Bonnie, what should--

rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.dialogue: Why are you all even talking about what will happen if we lose?

rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.dialogue: I'm a master cooker, so I can cook AND listen to you guys talk.

rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.dialogue: And I think it's stupid to worry about what's gonna happen if we lose!!!

rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.dialogue: Frin promised he wouldn't get hurt protecting people anymore...

rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.dialogue: And I promised I'd protect Frin!

rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.dialogue: So if I protect Frin, I protect all of you, so...!

rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.dialogue: So if I'm here, no one will get hurt! That's a Bonnie promise!!!
(Bonnie looks at you and offers you a big smile...)

rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.dialogue: Am I... Really getting reassured by a kid right now...?

rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.dialogue: Ha! Well, if Bonbon is saying it, I believe it!!!

rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.dialogue: You and Bonnie will protect us...?

rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.dialogue: I... I won't accept such a one sided promise!

rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.dialogue: If you both will protect us, we'll protect you both, too!

rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.dialogue: Don't worry, Bonbon! Don't worry, Sif! We'll all fight, and we'll all live!!!
(But can you really keep such a promise?)

rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.dialogue: So, to make sure we have enough energy to protect each other...

rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.dialogue: Madeleines... Thank you for making some, Boniface.

rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.dialogue: Some pineapple slices. They have some sugar on them.

rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.dialogue: Some pineapple slices...? They have some sugar on them.

rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.dialogue: With sugar, Za. That's what makes them good.

rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.dialogue: And pineapple's really good, you know!!!

rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.dialogue: It is, it's just not very exciting is all.

rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.dialogue: Fish heads are yummy and the textures are different and good!!!

rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.dialogue: SO WHICH SNACK DO YOU GUYS WANT?!
(They were good while they lasted though...)

rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.dialogue: Wait, you like pineapples too??? I didn't know!!!

rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.dialogue: Pineapples are one of my three favorite foods! Sounds like you have good taste sometimes, Frin!!!
(So pineapple is one of Bonnie's favorite foods, huh...?)
(You bite into it, chewing on the fruit.)

rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.dialogue: I have another if someone wants one.

rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.dialogue: Do I eat the whole thing?

rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.dialogue: But, like, not the eyes, right.

rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.dialogue: No, you can eat the eyes too.
(The taste is familiar to you, somehow.)
(You used to find them disgusting, but someone you knew loved them, so you tried them.)
(After eating your snacks, everyone's health has been restored[!/.])
(Have you tried every single one of Bonnie's snacks?)
(Plantain chips, cookies, malanga fritters...  Yes, you have.)
(Just the fact that you've tasted them all... Means you've been looping for a while...)
(And even though you might be tired of some of them, they're all so different and delicious still.)
(How long did it take Bonnie to prepare all those snacks for today...?)

rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.dialogue: W-Well, of course I am!!! Stupid!!!!!!!!!!!!

rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.dialogue: SOMEONE has to make sure you eat good things so you can be happy and not sad!!!

rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.dialogue: Hehe, thank you for taking care of us, Bonnie!

rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.dialogue: Thanks Bonbon! You're the best, Bonbon!!!
(You got a MEMORY OF SAFE ROOMS!)
[When equipped, Memory of Safe Rooms lets you recover all your HP after a battle ends.]
(Bonnie seems to be thinking hard about something...)

rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.dialogue: Frin, do you see me? I'm gonna touch you now!
(Bonnie sloooooowly raises their hand, and sloooooowly moves it towards your hand, and sloooooowly pats your hand.)

rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.dialogue: You didn't even jump that time! Good job, you did such a good job.
(You don't know what to say to Bonnie, right now.)
(Bonnie was listening to you all talk about burial rituals, earlier...)

rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.speaker: Siffrin
rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.dialogue: "We like to think about every possible thing that could happen..."

rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.dialogue: I don't know what you're talking about. I wasn't listening, earlier.
(AND YET, YOU LET BONNIE DIE.)

rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.dialogue: I won't let anything happen, either!
[If the Kid has Memory of Promise equipped, they'll be more likely to buff everyone's stats during battle!]
(Bonnie seems ready for the journey ahead.)
(Mirabelle tends to bite her nails when she's anxious...)
(She should wear gloves, like you do.)
(She should wear gloves, like you do.)
(You wish you could bite yours, but you'll stay strong.)
(You have other ways to deal with stress, now.)

rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.dialogue: Hehehe... Sorry. I just wanted to say your name.

rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.dialogue: Sif is MY Siffrin nickname, Mira.

rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.dialogue: You HAVE to pick another one. I'm sorry. I won't budge on that.

rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.dialogue: What? B-But you and Siffrin share "Mira"!

rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.dialogue: Alright, in the spirit of fairness, we can get joint custody on "Sif", then!

rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.dialogue: ...You know, I think I'll pick another nickname for Siffrin after all.

rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.dialogue: I'm still mad. Your pun was too easy. It was bad.
(She wouldn't be this mad if it didn't get to her.)

rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.dialogue: But Isabeau picked "Sif", and Bonnie picked "Frin"...

rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.dialogue: I... I have no letters left...!!!

rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.dialogue: You know you look like a hamster when you eat?

rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.dialogue: I'm so sorry to be the one to tell you this, but you do.

rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.dialogue: Your cheeks get all big and round! Like a cute hamster!

rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.dialogue: ...That was a real scary face you just made, though.

rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.dialogue: Did you train in the mirror?

rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.dialogue: Thank you for talking to Bonbon, yesterday!

rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.dialogue: Why? Well, because they managed to look you in the eye earlier, that's why.

rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.dialogue: Didn't think it was gonna happen any time soon, after the whole... Incident, I guess.

rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.dialogue: I always felt like you didn't really care about what happened, but... Bonbon's little, you know?

rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.dialogue: Even if they felt like you didn't blame them for it, it's still a lot of emotions for a kid to handle.

rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.dialogue: But, knowing you, you probably thought Bonbon started hating you for no reason, yeah?

rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.dialogue: I guess I should've talked to you about it, but it didn't feel like my place...?

rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.dialogue: ...So that's why I'm glad you two talked, yesterday! Good job, Sif, good job!!!
(Isabeau eats a whole cookie at once and makes a hamster face.)

rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.dialogue: Aw, Sif, want another madeleine? For doing such a good job? Yes they do, yes they do!
(You stick your hand out for a second madeleine.)

rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.dialogue: Oh, I actually gave you my last one earlier.

rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.dialogue: Sorry. I promise you did a good job still. Take my word for it.

rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.dialogue: Oh well. I've had a good life.

rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.dialogue: Keep that sort of speech for the younger ones.

rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.dialogue: I'm sure Isabeau would love it.

rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.dialogue: Nevermind, I think the sad face was better.

rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.dialogue: There's a high chance we'll die, yes, but I still don't intend to die today.

rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.dialogue: I still have some things I want to do.

rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.dialogue: Why are you putting quotes around "research".

rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.dialogue: Do you have anything you'd like to tell me, Siffrin?

rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.dialogue: This journey has made me feel really older than my years.

rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.dialogue: Having a preteen say they'll do their best to protect me... Am I really this useless...?

rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.dialogue: I'll protect you 'cuz you're old and I'm young, but you can protect me 'cuz you're old and I'm young.

rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.dialogue: Go away, now. I need my alone time.

rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.dialogue: Old people need their alone time.

rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.dialogue: Okay! We can stay here a bit longer.

rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.dialogue: You took so long to get here, we started eating our snacks without you.

rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor2/snackbreak2.html.dialogue: Come here, Frin! I have some snacks for you to eat!!!
(You just need to defeat the King on your own.)
(You just need to defeat the King on your own.)
(You just need to defeat the King on your own.)
(You just need to defeat the King on your own.)

rooms/floor2/traproom.html.dialogue: (Looks like someone liked to carve during their break...)
(You wonder where your own carving tools went.)
(You haven't tried carving wood in forever.)
(Everyone mentioned you usually mumble when you sharpen your dagger, or carve wood...)
(Will you be able to sharpen the KeyKnife, if you remember how you usually do it?)
(You pick up the carving wood, looking at it from all angles, trying to remember--)

rooms/floor2/traproom.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/traproom.html.dialogue: "Please don't look bad please don't look bad please don't look bad"...

rooms/floor2/traproom.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/traproom.html.dialogue: That's what you were saying! Last time you were carving something!

rooms/floor2/traproom.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/traproom.html.dialogue: You were carving a little Odile, and Odile said that if it looked bad...

rooms/floor2/traproom.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor2/traproom.html.dialogue: ...She'd ask me to cover your dinner with potatoes!

rooms/floor2/traproom.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/traproom.html.dialogue: So you were mumbling "please don't look bad" the whole time!

rooms/floor2/traproom.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/traproom.html.dialogue: You usually mumble things like this under your breath when you carve or sharpen your dagger or do something similar.

rooms/floor2/traproom.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/traproom.html.dialogue: "Please look at least a little bit like a wolf..."

rooms/floor2/traproom.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor2/traproom.html.dialogue: "Please don't stab me in the hand while I carve!!!"

rooms/floor2/traproom.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/traproom.html.dialogue: Feels like you're talking to whatever you're making, or to your tools. Did you never realize you were doing it?

rooms/floor2/traproom.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/traproom.html.dialogue: And also when you do mumble, whatever you're carving does look really nice.

rooms/floor2/traproom.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor2/traproom.html.dialogue: It's when you're not mumbling that your stuff looks awful.
(Well. Sounds like you should try this sharpening thing again.)

rooms/floor2/traproom.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/traproom.html.dialogue: ...By the way, I still have the little wood carving of me you made, Siffrin.

rooms/floor2/traproom.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/traproom.html.dialogue: You know, I'm still so jealous Sif made you a wood figurine, I could curse you and your entire family name.

rooms/floor2/traproom.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/traproom.html.dialogue: I will one day. And then you'll be sorry.
(If you did, you'd like to carve the King.)
(The keychain dangling from it is shaped like a hand in the Scissors position...)
(You put the Key in your Pocket.)
(You now know where the Scissors Key is located.)

rooms/floor2/traproom.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/traproom.html.dialogue: N-No, that's, uh, sorry, I mean--!!!

rooms/floor2/traproom.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/traproom.html.dialogue: This man is another housemaiden, he's a scholar... He's working really hard on a project! It--

rooms/floor2/traproom.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/traproom.html.dialogue: Should we... Do something to him?

rooms/floor2/traproom.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/traproom.html.dialogue: He is... A human man. That exists.

rooms/floor2/traproom.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/traproom.html.dialogue: I think he stole one of my priceless issues of "The Cursing of Château Castle".

rooms/floor2/traproom.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/traproom.html.dialogue: N-No!!! Forget I said that! I have no concrete proof! B-but...

rooms/floor2/traproom.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/traproom.html.dialogue: ...But my issue disappeared shortly after he came to my dorm room to ask me something, that's all.
(The title reads "The Cursing of Château Castle", issue #3.)

rooms/floor2/traproom.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/traproom.html.dialogue: Well, what do we have here.

rooms/floor2/traproom.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/traproom.html.dialogue: SO I WAS RIGHT!!! THIS... THIS...!!!
(Mirabelle got back her priceless copy of "The Cursing of Château Castle"!)
(She angrily stuffs it in her pocket.)

rooms/floor2/traproom.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor2/traproom.html.dialogue: ...  Sorry for badmouthing him while he's frozen in time. He is a very talented scholar, also.

rooms/floor2/traproom.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor2/traproom.html.dialogue: This was fun, Mirabelle. You should show your ruthless side more often.
(A book about traps and how they work.)
(Does it say anything about the traps you've seen so far?)
(Ah! One of the bookmarks is labelled "Death Corridor".)
(This is where you first died, but you're still not sure why the trap activated when it did...)
(But that other time, it got you immediately as you were walking through the corridor, so time wasn't an issue, was it?)
(...The type of trap in the Death Corridor is apparently called...)

rooms/floor2/traproom.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor2/traproom.html.dialogue: Woah Sif, that's one hell of a disgusted face you're pulling.
(A book about traps and how they work.)
(Two of them seem to be missing...)
(Could they be for various traps in the House...?)
(But there's only one, so it'd be rude to sit down.)

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: Wait... Over there, isn't that...

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: A bathroom...?

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: The same bathroom we already went to already?

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: Seems so!!!

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: Wait... Over there, isn't th

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: thaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaat

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: Oh!

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: Um.
(He squirms uncomfortably.)
(Better make a small detour to the bathroom.)
(Bathroom.)

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: Bathroom!

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: Bathroom!

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: Bathroom...!

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: So... Does anyone need to go? Raise your hand.

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: Just so you know, if you DO need to go...

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: When they make books about this moment, I'll be sure to mention how we needed to stop for a bathroom break.

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: Does anyone need to go, again...?

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: Just so you know, if you DO need to go...

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: When they make books about this moment, I'll be sure to mention how we needed to stop for TWO bathroom breaks.
(A few people raise their hands...)
(You might as well go too.)

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: Alright. Let's meet back here once everyone's done powdering their nose.
(You close the bathroom cell door.)
(You don't really need to go, but there is something you need to do, away from everyone...)
(You fistbump the air and whisper yell yes, yes, yes under your breath.)
(You're all doing it!!! You're all getting so close to the King!!!)
(And it's all thanks to you and this blessing!!!)
(Whoever, whatever blessed you with this, thank you, you think!)
(Whether it's the Universe, the Change God, that tree, the stars, the moon, anyone, thank you!!!!)
(Ah, stars, can you imagine if you only had one life? You'd have died right at the start!)
(And if not then, one of you might've been frozen in time forever by touching one of those tears because you're all a bunch of curious idiots!)
(Or worse, any of you could've died against a Sadness for good!!!)
(But you have this power! This Craft! You'll never die for good! You'll always be able to start again!!!)
(You quietly jump in place with a big grin on your face.)
(One, two, three, four jumps!)
(You jump a final time, out of breath, and try to take a deep breath in, and out.)
(Phew. . .)
(Alright.)
(You're so close to the King, you can almost taste it. You need to stay focused.)
(...   Or do you? You can always loop back, start over, make sure nothing bad happens to you or the people you care about!)
(The King will never know what hit him.)
(You fistbump the air one final time for good measure.)
(You exit the bathroom.)
(You close the bathroom stall door.)
(Well.   That didn't go as well as you'd hoped.)
(The King is much stronger than you thought, isn't he...?)
(Or, well. He might be strong, but maybe he'll be easy to defeat once you manage to survive his first strike.)
(Not like you had much time to try things out.)
(. . .   One hit, huh...)
(What his attack did... Yes, it hit hard, but you saw something when he attacked.)
(A vision.)
(The vision was so powerful, it alone might've been enough to knock you out.)
(How can you get past his first attack? That's what you have to figure out right now.)
(You don't want to die against him again. More importantly, you don't want to see everyone defeated.)
(...   They died soon after you did, didn't they? They must've. Bonnie might've been able to escape, but none of you could do anything.)
(Does a loop go on, after you die...?)
(Maybe time stops, and rewinds back with you?)
(So they didn't actually die?)
(It must be how it works.)
(You can't imagine that time continues after you die. That's the whole point of this time loop thing, isn't it? Time goes with you?)
(Yes.   As long as you die before your allies, they're okay.)
(You're okay.)
(Alright... You have to find a way to protect yourself against the King.)
(That's your first priority, and then, you get endless tries to defeat the King!)
(Thanks Universe, Change God, someone, anyone! Thank you for this blessing!)
(You'll be okay.)
(You exit the bathroom.)
(You close the bathroom stall door.)
(Well, you have a way to defend yourself against the King, but you're still having trouble, aren't you?)
(The King is so much stronger than you anticipated.)
(Why is he so powerful? What made him this way?)
(You've seen him a couple times, now. A couple more, and you might know his opening dialogue by heart.)
(He keeps asking... if you remember.)
(Remember what?)
(Is there something you've forgotten, that he knows about? Does it have something to do with the loops, perhaps?)
(Does he remember you?)
(Doesn't matter right now. You just need to find a way to beat him.)
(Maybe you could find ways to get stronger inside the House? Battle more Sadnesses?)
(That KeyKnife you got... If you managed to keep it intact, it might help you against the King.)

(And tonics, can't forget tonics... If you went from the first floor of the House and walked all the way to the top, picking up items as you went through, it might help you survive a little bit longer.)
(Just a tiny bit more.)
(One hit more, one hit more, until you win.)
(Endless   tries.)
(Thanks Universe, Change God, someone, anyone.   Thank you for this blessing.)
(You'll be okay.)
(You exit the bathroom.)
(You close the bathroom stall door, and sit on the dirty floor.)
(You breathe out, slowly.)
(Okay.)
(So, you're trapped in time, and that's not great.)
(But you have goals you can strive towards, so you're fine.)
(You know what to do.)
(Help your friends, find out more about the loops, talk to the King.)
(As long as you have goals, you will be fine.)
(Why did you loop back?)
(Why isn't it over?)
(Why did it even start in the first place?)
(It was naïve, to not even think about why you're even looping.)
(You got the power to help everyone, and you just accepted it?)
(Who did you think you were? The hero of this story?)
(That was silly.)
(If only you'd used your brain sooner, maybe you wouldn't be in this situation.)
(If only you'd thought about why you got those powers.)
(If you'd looked inside the classroom more attentively.)
(If you'd searched the Head Housemaiden's office better.)
(If you'd looked closer at the pillar in the Death Corridor.)
(What are you missing now, that you'll feel stupid for not seeing earlier?)
(Stupid.)
(But it's fine. You're seeing clearly, now.)
(You won't miss a thing anymore.)
(You'll save everyone, save Vaugarde, and escape from this loop.)
(You will.)
(You exit the bathroom.)
(You close the bathroom stall door.)
(You like coming here, because you know you'll be able to be alone for a bit...)
(But... You almost feel like going outside right away, right now.)
(Huh!)
(Why?)
(You feel weird.)
(Even though you're stuck in this time loop, and you don't know how to escape yet...)
(You feel  happy?)
(You feel happy!)
(Why do you feel happy?)
(Is it because you're helping everyone, right now? Hearing them out, helping them with their problems?)
(You talked to each one of them. Learned more about them as people. Talked about things with them you've never talked about with anyone.)
(It was embarrassing, a bit, but it made you feel so warm.)
(It was nice.)
(Even though you're not friends.)
(Even though you're just allies.)
(But that's how you become closer to people, right? By helping them out?)
(So maybe right now, they like you better than in previous loops, because you helped them!)
(And, and... Okay, this will sound silly...)
(But maybe that's all you need?)
(To break the loop?)
(That's stupid.)
(You're stupid. Don't even think about it, or it won't come true.)
(You smack the side of your head, focusing on the pain.)
(Stay focused!)
(Stop thinking about best case scenarios, stop thinking about your allies, stop thinking about how they don't see you as a friend or anything, stop thinking, stop it, stop it.)
(You breathe slowly in, and out, and think about nothing.)
(You exit the bathroom.)
(You close the bathroom stall door.)
(Once again, you find yourself here.)
(Helping your family members be the best version of themselves.)
(Mirabelle, who's starting to accept her unchanging self.)
(Odile, who's learning more about her history.)
(Bonnie, who's starting to understand they were never, ever at fault.)
(Isabeau, who just wanted to talk to you.)
(It's the same as before, isn't it?)
(This is as far as their change goes.)
(They will never change more than they do now.)
(Worse: you won't let them.)
(But it's comforting, isn't it? It's nice, isn't it?)
(You could do this forever, and it wouldn't be so bad, wouldn't it?)
(You used to think it would be perfect, to remember everything that happened to you.)
(You don't think you were right, but it's nice, still.)
(You'll remember it all, now. You won't forget a thing.)
(Even if you're the only one who remembers this time, you're fine.)
(It's better than the alternative, isn't it?)
(It's fine, it's fine.)
(You're fine.)
(You exit the bathroom.)
(You close the bathroom stall door.)
(You clench and unclench your fists, not knowing what to do with yourself.)
(You try not to breathe too loudly.)
(Sometimes you feel so  much  anger.)
(Why do they not remember? Why are you the only one living like this?)
(You're the only one living and knowing and experiencing the same moments over and over again.)
(Why is it just you? Why shouldn't everyone feel this pain?!?)
(Why should you be the only one stuck here when you've done nothing wrong?!?)
(Is this some kind of curse?)
(You always felt awful about not remembering, and now you have to live your life, knowing you're the only one who remembers this time?)
(Remembering every single moment, every single sentence, every single battle, wound, death, everyone unaware?!?)
(You grab fistfuls of your hair and tug!!! )
(It's not fair!!! It's not fair, not fair, not fair, it's not!!! Fair!!!)
(You want it all to be over!!! This loop, this life!!!)
(You're caught between a sequence of life and death and life again, going through the motions until the next time the loop restarts!!!)
(It's torture!!! Every second of it!!!)
(And everyone is acting like nothing's wrong!!!)
(Why do they get to ignore it?! Get to keep acting, like actors in a play they don't know the ending to?!?)
(You hate them all!!!)

(Your [allies/family members],
the whole country,
the whole world should know this pain!!!!!!)
(THE WHOLE WORLD SHOULD SUFFER AS YOU HAVE SUFFERED!!!!!!)
(Sometimes     you understand the King more than you'd like to.)
(You breathe out, trying to keep your anger close to your body.)
(You'll shake from it, but it's fine.)
(You dust yourself off, and exit the bathroom.)
(You close the bathroom stall door, and inhale sharply.)
( Oh no~! That was too loud, someone might hear you~!!! Try again.)
(Your eye stings.)
(Your stomach hurts.)
(Your head feels like it's about to split in two.)
(You try to breathe silently, in, and out, but it won't go in, or out--)
(Oh!)
(Do you want to cry? Is that it?)
(Oh yeah! You've always thought crying was just a waste of time, but you remember reading once that just the act of crying DOES help making you feel better!!!)
(Okay then!!! Tears, come on out~!!! )
(No tears are coming out!!! Okay!!!)
(Hahaha!!! Sounds like you don't want to cry right now after all!!!)
(Stars!!! You're finally someplace no one will see you, you spent this whole loop wanting to cry, and now that you're safe and hidden, the tears won't come?!?)
(You won't get a chance to be alone for a while! You need to cry now! Stars!!!)
(You can't cry from your dead eye, but you should be able to cry from the other, can't you?!? Or are you broken on both blinding sides!!!)
(Just cry, stupid body!!! Cry!!!!!!)
(Your nose burns and your eye stings but no tears are coming out.)
(It's not working!!! This is a losing battle!!!)
(Oh!!! Maybe pain will do the trick? That's why people usually cry, right?)
(You put a finger in your mouth and bite as hard as you can.)
(Nope, not working.)
(It's apparently not time to cry yet!!!!!! Hahahahahaha!!!!!!)
(Okay, stop, stop, stop, and calm down. You're fine.)
(You're fine.)
(You just   need to keep going.)
(You have to find out more about how the loops work. That's the only path you have left!!!)
(Learn more about the loops, about why you're here, about why the loop breaks down when you talk to the Head Housemaiden.)
(And act better!!!)
(Your family members... You can tell they feel something's wrong, you need to get your act together.)
(If they know something's wrong, it'll only get harder for you.)
(Especially if she knows.)
(Especially if. . .)
(The... The tall one, with the glasses... The Researcher, she...)
(She's the coldest, but she can get so curious sometimes it makes her seem almost childish, she's too perceptive for her own good, and you--)
(You can't... Remember... Her name...!!!)

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: Siffrin, are you okay? You've been in there a while.

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Siffrin
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: (OH!!!) ODILE!

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: ...  Yes?

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Siffrin
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: Odile.

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: That is my name, yes.

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: ... Is everything--

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Siffrin
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: There's no toilet paper in this stall.

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: Oh.

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: HA!

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: I'll go and get you some. Give me a second.
(You hear her walk away.)
(Odile. Mirabelle. Isabeau. Bonnie.)
(It's okay, you remember. You still remember.)
(You bite your gloved fingers, and try to breathe deeply, in, and out.)
(You remember. You haven't forgotten them. They're still here. Traveling together with you. You're still here.)
(You're okay. You're okay.)
(You're okay.)
(You flinch.)
(Something fell on your lap.)

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: I found you some paper, Siffrin.

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Siffrin
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: Thank you, Odile.

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: Hn. See you in a second.
(You hear her walk away.)
(You take the toilet paper, and hold it between your hands.)
(You press your face against it, breathing.)
(Thinking about nothing.)
(Wow, this toilet paper is really nice and soft, actually.)
(You wonder where she found it.)
(Teehee!)
(See? Even stuck in a time loop, and even though you've been stuck for a long time, there are still things you can find out about the world around you.)
(This roll of toilet paper   is giving you hope!)
(HOW BLINDINGLY WONDERFUL, FOR A ROLL OF TOILET PAPER TO BE THE ONLY HOPE YOU HAVE LEFT RIGHT NOW!!!)
(You exit the stall.)
(Enough monologuing.)
(Enough monologuing!)
(Urgh!!! Fine!!!)
(You know you can get a little obsessed with monologues sometimes, but a little spiralling never hurt nobody!!!)
(You're sad.)
(You're alone.)
(Everyone left you behind because you're such a horrible terrible disgusting person you thought it'd be fine to make them get cool skills faster.)
(As if they were nothing more than characters in a play.)
(Because that's what they are at this point, aren't they? That's what they've been to you, since you managed to beat the King.)
(You won't let them be anything else.)
(Because otherwise you'll have to deal with the fact that because of this loop, you are denying them agency, change, a future.)
(But it's not your fault, is it? That you're stuck here? So why do you have to deal with anything?)
(But you feel like it's your fault, because you've wished for something like this for a while, haven't you?)
(A chance to always remember your adventures with them.)
(To continue.)
(For--)
(End of monologue.)
(You are in the bathroom!)
(You do what needs to me done.)
(MISSION. ACCOMPLISHED.)
(You don't really need to go.)
(You sit on the throne and think about nothing.)
(You just need to be alone for a second.)
(You lean against the door and breathe slowly, silently.)
(You don't really need to go.)
(You're starving.)
(Your stomach hurts.)
(Bonnie's snacks haven't managed to fill your stomach for loops now.)
(You have nothing to monologue about, right now.)
(You just feel empty.)
(You breathe harshly.)
(You can't seem to take a deep breath.)
(You're okay. You're okay. You're okay.)
(You're okay.)
(You hear voices outside the bathroom.)
(Listen in, or stay here to make time go faster?)
(You stand next to the bathroom door, and listen.)
(You stay in the bathroom a few minutes longer, and then exit the bathroom.)

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: ...And that's why you should be careful when jumping into battle.

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: Uh huh, uh huh, thank you for this impromptu lesson, m'dame. Very sorely needed.

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: Urgh. See if I give you more stunning advice next time, Isabeau.

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: Aw!!!

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: ...   Remember when you thought Sif was an assassin sent by the King to kill Mira?

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: Don't remind me. I was drunk. I can't be held responsible.

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: I miss drunk Odile... She has the best theories...

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: Shut your mouth. I will never allow her to come out again.

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: Not after last time.

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: Oh, last time...

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: It's too bad I was the only one still awake. I'll remember last time for the rest of my days. I'm keeping that story for a rainy--

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: Stop talking.

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: Or would you rather we talk about the time you were so drunk you--

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: NO IT'S FINE SORRY I'M SORRY M'DAME SHUSH!!!! Sif could come out at any--
(There's a silence...   Then you hear two palms smacking into each other as they shake hands.)
(...You exit the bathroom.)

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: ...   Belle...

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: Yes?

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: Can I have a hug?

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: Oh!

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: 'M sorry, I promise I won't hug you long, I just, um--

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: Oh, oh sweetheart, come here...

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: ...

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: Oh Bonnie, you're doing such an amazing job helping us. You're so brave.

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: It must be so scary for you...

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: I'm really proud of you, you know?

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: With you by our side, I'm sure we'll be able to save your sister soon!

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: Mmm... I dunno...

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: I do know! I-I'm the Change God's chosen, after all!

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: And so I know that everything will be fine!

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: Okay?

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: Okay.

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: ...Can you stop squeezing my head so hard though...

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: Ah! S-sorry!!!
(...You exit the bathroom.)

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: Mi-ra-belle~

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: I-sa-beau~

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: Heh! How you holding up, Mira?

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: M-me? I'm, uh. okay...

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: ...   Well, no, I'm not... But it'd be useless to think about all the ways I'm not okay right now.

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: Hm...

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: What about you, Isabeau?

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: Huh? Me?

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: Yes, you! You, um. You've been with me since the start, you know?

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: If you didn't agree to come with me when I ran to Jouvente for help, I probably wouldn't have gotten this far... And I wouldn't have met everyone else, too!

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: You always made sure I'm okay, and even now you keep everyone going by making sure we're doing fine, but... I just wanted to make sure that... That you were okay, too...

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: I'm a pretty simple guy, Mira! I don't have a big enough brain to worry about things!

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: Isabeau...

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: Oh, not convincing enough? Eeeeh...

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: I'm good, Mira. Making sure everyone is okay makes me feel better, you know!

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: So as long as you tell me if you need any help, I'm okay!

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: Is it that simple...?

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: It's that simple!

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: Aw crab, Mira, just come here already.

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: Oh, wow... I didn't think I needed a hug this badly... Sorry...

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: Nothing like a big strong man hugging your worries away, huh?

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: Ha, funny, I think I really needed a hug too...

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: Hehehe!

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: You know, I love you, Isabeau!

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: And I love you, Mira!!!
(...After waiting for a bit, you exit the bathroom.)

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: --And I just feel like i'm not helping, I dunno.

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: I'm not useful at all.

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: Uuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuurgh.   Okay.

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: What should you do if someone's defense is lowered?

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: ...Jump around and help them build back their defenses...

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: What if their health is low?

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: I have snacks... And I know everyone's favorites...

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: And if you get an opening?

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: Throw a rock at the enemy, distract them, that sort of stuff.

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: See? That seems pretty useful to me.

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: It's not--

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: It is, Boniface. Just because you're not fighting with us doesn't mean you're not a valuable member of this team.

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: ...   We were all split about this, but we all agreed to bring you with us to fight the King, because at the time we thought this would be the best way to keep you safe from the Curse.

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: But, if you'd rather we bring you back to Dormont--

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: NO!

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: No, you can't! I'm coming! It's too late! I'm staying with you guys!!!

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: Good. Only strong useful allies can come, anyway.

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: Hehehe!

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: Hey wait, the way back is blocked anyway! You can't bring me back to Dormont even if you wanted!

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: We could throw you out a window.

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: NO?!?
(...You exit the bathroom.)
(You hear a smack.)
(Then another smack.)
(Then multiple smacks, like two people slapping each other repeatedly.)
(And then--)

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: Stop, stop, stop, I yield, I yield!

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: NYEHEHEH!!!

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: How can such a small hand do that much damage...

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: I don't have small hands, shut up!!!

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: You sure do, look!

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: WHY IS YOUR HAND SO BIG?

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: Adult privileges. And also, I Crafted my body to have big hands.

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: But hey, Bonbon, how are you doing? Doing okay? Want a snack? Want a hug?

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: If I want a snack I'll eat one, if I want a hug I'll get one. From Belle and not you.

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: Good! And how are you doing?

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: I want a ride on your shoulders.

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: Ha, okay!

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: ...   I'm so tall now.

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: You are.

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: I can touch the top of the wall if I wanted.

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: Do it.

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: Crab yeah.

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: You think everyone will be fine if we beat the King?

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: Oh yeah.

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: Even my sister?

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: Yep.

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: Even Belle?

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: For sure.

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: Even Dile?

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: Absolutely.

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: Even Frin?

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue:
Without a doubt.
<!-- (← LYING) -->

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: And you too?

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: Of course.

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: You promise?

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: I super duper promise.

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: Hm.

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: Pat, pat.

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: Huh, huh, what?!?

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: Oh!!! I was trying to pat your head. Where's your head? Is that your head?

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: Not here, that's my chin.

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: Is it here?

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: No, that's my ears.

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: It HAS to be here.

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: No, that's my nose!!! Hehehe!!!

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: Look, my head is here.

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: There we go.

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: Pat, pat, pat.

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: Hm.

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: Now get me down, you're too tall, it's weird.

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: Maybe you're just too small, Bonbon.

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: Maybe. But one day, I'll be taller than you.

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: And YOU'll be the one getting a ride on my shoulders.

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: I would love nothing more, Bonbon.
(...You exit the bathroom.)

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: Mirabelle, how are you doing?

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: ...If it's okay with you, madame...

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: I just wanna talk about anything other than how I'm doing right now.

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: Of course.

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: ...What about you, madame?

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: Oh, I'm not fine at all, but what can we do about it.

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: No matter what happens, the next few hours will solve all my problems.

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: One way or another.

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: Hnrgh...

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: So.

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: You may not know this, but in some countries, two women together would be expected to talk about men, and love, and nothing else.

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: Would you like to talk about the men in our lives, and love, and nothing else?

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: We've only got the one man, madame.

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: And also, ew.

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: Ha!

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: Hehehe!

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: But, you know...   Anything to get our lives off things.

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: Quite right. But speaking of the one man in our lives...

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: Do you think Isabeau will finally do it?

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: Do what?

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: Confess.

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: Confess?

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: To whomst?

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: ...Mirabelle.

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: To whomst?

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: AAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAH?!?!?!?! OH CHANGE?!??!??!!

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: Mirabelle.

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: I CAN'T BELIEVE THIS?!??!!

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: Mirabelle.

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: OH CHANGE!!!! BUT IT MAKES SO MUCH SENSE!!!!!!!

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: Mirabelle-- Pft, hahaha---

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: HOW LONG HAS THIS BEEN GOING ON?!

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: Weeks! Me and Boniface have been placing bets.

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: Boniface gets a piggyback ride from me if Isabeau confessess before we beat the King.

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: I get a full course meal if he confesses after.

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: What? Bonnie will definitely lose. Isabeau would only confess after.

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: It's the most romantic option!

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: That's what I said. He is a very romantic lad.

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: He is!

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: Oh, I can't believe I didn't notice. I feel very stupid.

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: Why didn't he tell me! I could've helped!!!

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: I did ask him why he wouldn't talk to you about it instead of bothering me with his woes, and he said something like...

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: "Mira likes romance books, but I think talking about actual real life romance makes her uncomfortable."

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: Oh...

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: W-Well, that's true, but Isabeau is my friend!!! My romance book friend!!!

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: I should be the only one he'd talk to about this, and no one else!!!

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: I think he'd like that. To talk about it with you, I mean.

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: He didn't want to bother you with it, But I think he wanted to. You should talk to him.

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: So he doesn't have to talk to me.

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: I'm surprised, madame. I thought you liked gossip, hehehe!

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: No one can know I love to gossip, Mirabelle.

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: Hehehe! I'll never tell!!!
(...You exit the bathroom.)

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: Something wrong, m'dame? You're frowning.

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: Siffrin is acting strange.

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: Huuuuh? You think so? But strange how?

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: This crush of yours shouldn't make you this stupid, Isabeau.

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: Yeah, Sif's acting weird.

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: Since yesterday.

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: But isn't that normal? To be acting weird?

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: We're all... pretty stressed out, aren't we?

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: ...   Don't do anything stupid, Odile.

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: Better to at least do something, rather than watching things happen and hoping for the best, Isabeau.

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: Hey.

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: ...Sorry.

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: I'll wait until after we beat the King to talk to Siffrin.

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: In the meantime, let me know if you notice anything.

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: ... Alright...
(...You exit the bathroom.)

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: Alright, everyone refreshed? Noses powdered up? Bodies emptied?

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: Emptied...

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: Haha, emptied!!!

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: Za, she's asking if you pooped.

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: All refreshed, nose powdered, and bodies emptied over here, m'dame!

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: Siffrin?
(You nod.)

rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/bathroom_monologues.html.dialogue: Good. Let's get going then, shall we?
(Nothing else to do in here.)

rooms/floor3/breakroom3.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/breakroom3.html.dialogue: ...And an actual human, also standing right there.

rooms/floor3/breakroom3.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/breakroom3.html.dialogue: They have a massive bow, too. Looks cute!

rooms/floor3/breakroom3.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/breakroom3.html.dialogue: OH, that's my friend!!! I gave them that bow!!! AND THAT'S THEIR DOG!!!

rooms/floor3/breakroom3.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/breakroom3.html.dialogue: You can never tell them you noticed their dog before them.

rooms/floor3/breakroom3.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/breakroom3.html.dialogue: No, never ever ever. They'd make fun of me for days.

rooms/floor3/breakroom3.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/breakroom3.html.dialogue: At least they'd think it's funny, it seems.

rooms/floor3/breakroom3.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/breakroom3.html.dialogue: If you did that to me, Mirabelle... My revenge would be swift and absolute.

rooms/floor3/breakroom3.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/breakroom3.html.dialogue: I would never, madame Odile. Never ever. This was a one time mistake.

rooms/floor3/breakroom3.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/breakroom3.html.dialogue: ...I'm glad they're with their dog, at least... They're not alone...
(Someone and their dog, frozen in time.)
(The closet contains some bandages, painkillers, and...)

rooms/floor3/breakroom3.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor3/breakroom3.html.dialogue: These look ugly. Frin's is better.

rooms/floor3/breakroom3.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/breakroom3.html.dialogue: Does your eyepatch fit still, Sif? I can adjust it if you ever need me to!
(Isabeau made your eyepatch when you lost your eye.)
(He apparently Crafted it so it wouldn't bother you, or itch, or anything.)
(Isabeau made your eyepatch, a long time ago.)
(You're glad it loops back with you.)
(The closet contains some bandages, painkillers, and eyepatches.)
(The closet contains some bandages, painkillers, and eyepatches.)
(Your stomach hurts, you feel cold, you keep shaking, and you have a headache from thinking too hard on all your mistakes.)
(You look at the recommended amount of painkillers you should take, and swallow one more.)
(The closet contains some bandages, painkillers, and eyepatches.)
(Oh? There's a Ka Buan book here...)
(The Ka Buan craftonomy book is here.)

rooms/floor3/breakroom3.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/breakroom3.html.dialogue: We don't really have time to read about Craft of any kind. Let's keep going.

rooms/floor3/breakroom3.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/breakroom3.html.dialogue: But, m'dame, maybe it'll teach us something about Time Craft!

rooms/floor3/breakroom3.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/breakroom3.html.dialogue: Nothing in there is useful to us at all.

rooms/floor3/breakroom3.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/breakroom3.html.dialogue: Nothing at all. Unless you think the fact that some Crafts have a distinct smell would be useful to us somehow.

rooms/floor3/breakroom3.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/breakroom3.html.dialogue: Well now I'm kind of curious.

rooms/floor3/breakroom3.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/breakroom3.html.dialogue: Just things we could've figured out ourselves. Rock Craft smells like wet rocks, Paper Craft like wood or leaves...

rooms/floor3/breakroom3.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/breakroom3.html.dialogue: Exactly. They all smell like you'd expect.

rooms/floor3/breakroom3.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/breakroom3.html.dialogue: ...Oh. There's apparently another Craft smell they're trying to figure out, which smells... Very sweet?

rooms/floor3/breakroom3.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor3/breakroom3.html.dialogue: IT'S BEEN SMELLING LIKE SUGAR FOR A WHILE NOW!!!

rooms/floor3/breakroom3.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/breakroom3.html.dialogue: So this mysterious sweet smelling Craft might be Time Craft, I see.

rooms/floor3/breakroom3.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/breakroom3.html.dialogue: This place has been frozen in time for a while, hasn't it?

rooms/floor3/breakroom3.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/breakroom3.html.dialogue: It wouldn't be weird to think it smelled like Time Craft.

rooms/floor3/breakroom3.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/breakroom3.html.dialogue: I can't smell anything, though... Are you sure?

rooms/floor3/breakroom3.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/breakroom3.html.dialogue: ...Now that Bonnie mentioned it, I can kind of smell it.

rooms/floor3/breakroom3.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/breakroom3.html.dialogue: It's very slight, though! You really have a great sense of smell, Bonbon!

rooms/floor3/breakroom3.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/breakroom3.html.dialogue: No wonder you're so good at cooking.

rooms/floor3/breakroom3.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/breakroom3.html.dialogue: Do you smell it some places more than others? Could you smell sugar before we went into the House?

rooms/floor3/breakroom3.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor3/breakroom3.html.dialogue: No, not really? I only noticed it yesterday afternoon, I think...

rooms/floor3/breakroom3.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor3/breakroom3.html.dialogue: But I smell it super strong near those Sadnesses that give us those crests thingies.
(But you haven't been using Time Craft that much. So.)
(There's a chain on the table, probably for a pendant.)
(You put the massive chain in your pocket along with your Souvenirs.)
(A cooking book all about stupid croissants.)
(Don't want to even think about croissants.)
(Odile is smiling, which means they're probably done.)

rooms/floor3/breakroom3.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/breakroom3.html.dialogue: ... You have something to say, perhaps?
(You slap your hand right on Mirabelle's mouth.)
(You shake your head at her, and remove your hand.)

rooms/floor3/breakroom3.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/breakroom3.html.dialogue: What?! I wasn't going to say anything bad!!! I was just going to say that...

rooms/floor3/breakroom3.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/breakroom3.html.dialogue: Thaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaat this torch over there is wonderful, right??? The design of it is very nice!!!
(Oh... Your glove now has a trace of lipstick on it.)

rooms/floor3/breakroom3.html.speaker: Mirabelle
