rooms/floor3/breakroom3.html.dialogue: Hehe! Sorry about your gloves, then.

rooms/floor3/breakroom3.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/breakroom3.html.dialogue: Yes!!! It's cute!!! Your eyes light up and everything when you're learning things! It's cute!!!

rooms/floor3/breakroom3.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/breakroom3.html.dialogue: No, Boniface... They have a point... I AM very cute, aren't I?

rooms/floor3/breakroom3.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/breakroom3.html.dialogue: I wonder how cute you'll think I am when I put wasabi in your sandwiches when you least expect it.

rooms/floor3/breakroom3.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/breakroom3.html.dialogue: You'd help me out, wouldn't you, Boniface?

rooms/floor3/breakroom3.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor3/breakroom3.html.dialogue: I'm always up for putting spicy stuff into people's lunches, so yeah.

rooms/floor3/breakroom3.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/breakroom3.html.dialogue: Sorry, madame!!! W-we didn't say anything!!!

rooms/floor3/breakroom3.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/breakroom3.html.dialogue: Ah, looks like Siffrin wants a sandwich as well. Would you like me to offer you one of my sandwiches, Siffrin?

rooms/floor3/breakroom3.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor3/breakroom3.html.dialogue: I'll put twice as many peppers in theirs, Dile.
(You got a MEMORY OF FIRST STRIKE!)
[When equipped, Memory of First Strike makes everyone FASTER at the start of a battle!]
(A cooking book all about stupid croissants.)
(You grip your coin you grip your coin you grip your
(There's a hole here, hidden between some supplies.)
(It doesn't bring you any...  Wait a second.)

rooms/floor3/breakroom3.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/breakroom3.html.dialogue: Somehow, I feel like we're wasting our time... But I suppose we might as well see where it leads.
(You can see Mirabelle in some of them.)
(Why does your stomach hurt so much?)
(You feel like you've been hungry for years!)
(You feel like you could eat the whole world, and still not feel full!)
(You give it to Bonnie for safekeeping.)
(A broken figurine of the Change God.)

rooms/floor3/centralrooms.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/centralrooms.html.dialogue: Alri--

rooms/floor3/centralrooms.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/centralrooms.html.dialogue: YOWCHIE!!!

rooms/floor3/centralrooms.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor3/centralrooms.html.dialogue: Did you just--

rooms/floor3/centralrooms.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/centralrooms.html.dialogue: No...

rooms/floor3/centralrooms.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor3/centralrooms.html.dialogue: --RUN INTO THE DOOR???

rooms/floor3/centralrooms.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/centralrooms.html.dialogue: NO I DIDN'T!!!! YOU IMAGINED IT!!!!

rooms/floor3/centralrooms.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/centralrooms.html.dialogue: Oh no... I didn't think it'd be locked...

rooms/floor3/centralrooms.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor3/centralrooms.html.dialogue: The King's scared of us, right?

rooms/floor3/centralrooms.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor3/centralrooms.html.dialogue: He has to be, since he's putting locked doors in our way!!!

rooms/floor3/centralrooms.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/centralrooms.html.dialogue: Hopefully the key won't be hard to find... Let's take a look around.
(Looking at the door, you notice a symbol over the keyhole.)
(It looks like a circle, inside a circle, inside a circle...)

rooms/floor3/centralrooms.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/centralrooms.html.dialogue: Alri--
(You try to open the door before Isabeau runs into it.)

rooms/floor3/centralrooms.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/centralrooms.html.dialogue: Oh, the door is locked?

rooms/floor3/centralrooms.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/centralrooms.html.dialogue: I was just about to run into it, haha!
(You know.)
(The door is still locked.)
(The symbol over the keyhole is shaped like a circle, inside a circle, inside a circle...)
(The door is locked.)
(The symbol over the keyhole is shaped like a circle, inside a circle, inside a circle...)
(Key time.)
(You insert the key into the keyhole, and open the door.)

rooms/floor3/centralrooms.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/centralrooms.html.dialogue: Alright! Let's goooo!!!
(You take a step forward, when suddenly...)

rooms/floor3/centralrooms.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/centralrooms.html.dialogue: Is something wrong, Siffrin?

rooms/floor3/centralrooms.html.speaker: Siffrin
rooms/floor3/centralrooms.html.dialogue: (Huh?) "Did you see that light?"

rooms/floor3/centralrooms.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/centralrooms.html.dialogue: A light?
(Here.)
(You should take a look at this...)
(Before going any farther, you should look at the glowing light.)

rooms/floor3/centralrooms.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/centralrooms.html.dialogue: Something wrong, Sif?
(You point towards the light.)

rooms/floor3/centralrooms.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/centralrooms.html.dialogue: ...The...hallway...?
(So they can't see it...)
(Reaching out, you touch the light...)
(Everyone was healed.)
[You can save your progress by touching the Star!]
(Save your progress?)
(You close your eyes.)
(Well, that seems useful.)
(You smile and turn back towards everyone.)

rooms/floor3/centralrooms.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor3/centralrooms.html.dialogue: ...What was that about?

rooms/floor3/centralrooms.html.speaker: Siffrin
rooms/floor3/centralrooms.html.dialogue: "Received a good omen."

rooms/floor3/centralrooms.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/centralrooms.html.dialogue: Oh yeah?

rooms/floor3/centralrooms.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/centralrooms.html.dialogue: Oh?! That's great news!!! What was--

rooms/floor3/centralrooms.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/centralrooms.html.dialogue: Don't know, don't care. Let's PLEASE get going.
(You nod.)
(The gate is locked.)

rooms/floor3/centralrooms.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/centralrooms.html.dialogue: Well, this one I expected would be locked.

rooms/floor3/centralrooms.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/centralrooms.html.dialogue: Where does it bring us? Farther into the House?

rooms/floor3/centralrooms.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/centralrooms.html.dialogue: Yes... This is the only way to the second floor. No wonder the King would make sure we couldn't go in...

rooms/floor3/centralrooms.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor3/centralrooms.html.dialogue: I'm telling you!!! The King is scared of us!!!

rooms/floor3/centralrooms.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/centralrooms.html.dialogue: Maybe he is, but in the meantime, we should find a way to open this door...
(You look at the gate a little bit closer.)
(The keyhole is shaped like an egg, broken in half.)
(Maybe you should explore the left side of this floor...?)
(The key for it was on the left side, in the middle dorm room, wasn't it?)
(Where could the key be...)
(Just go get the key.)
(The gate is shut tight. On it, you see the keyhole is shaped like an egg, broken in half.)
(Sounds like you're going to have to look for the corresponding key...)
(Maybe you should explore the left side of this floor...?)
(The key for it was on the left side, in the middle dorm room, wasn't it?)
(That light again...)
[Stardust, listen, listen, I forgot to explain something!]
[As you know, you can save your progress here. But there's two things you might not know about recording your progress!]
[Number 1: Those Stars are all linked to a spot you can loop back to.]
[So right now, you can loop back to Dormont, and to the First Floor of the House.]
[Number 2: Remember how you'll keep your Experience and Craft Skills no matter what, but your party's progress is reset every time you loop?]
[So, to make it easier for you... Every time you save your progress, your party's Craft Skills and Experience will be saved for this specific spot as well!]
[So, your Fighter is level [number] now, and when you'll record your progress in a second, he will be level [number] again if you loop back here!]
[And don't worry! If, for example, you had him recorded as level 52 before, but then he only gets to level 46 next time you save your progress here...]
[His level will still be recorded as 52! No going back! He will stay strong!!!]
[It's the same for the number of Tonics and other battle items you're holding, too.]
[Alright, that's it from me, stardust! Goodbye~!!!]
(So if you save your progress here, your friends' Experience and Skills will be recorded here, as well.)
(So if you loop back here, you won't have to keep fighting so they can be stronger. Okay!)
(The gate is locked.)
(The keyhole is shaped like a hand in the Scissors position...)
(There's also a note stuck on the gate.)
( "The key is located in the Trap Building Room." )

rooms/floor3/centralrooms.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/centralrooms.html.dialogue: The King is leaving notes now?

rooms/floor3/centralrooms.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor3/centralrooms.html.dialogue: He must be forgetful! What an idiot!!!

rooms/floor3/centralrooms.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/centralrooms.html.dialogue: Hey, it happens. We have our own little forgetful one with us, don't we?
(Everyone looks at you.)
(You pout.)
(You look back.)
(You don't react.)

rooms/floor3/centralrooms.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/centralrooms.html.dialogue: I-it's okay, Siffrin! We'll remember things for you!!! You have many other talents, I'm sure!!!

rooms/floor3/centralrooms.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/centralrooms.html.dialogue: Not sure it helps, Mira.
(The gate is locked.)
(The keyhole is shaped like a hand in the Scissors position...)
(There's also a note stuck on the gate.)
( "The key is located in the Trap Building Room." )
(Where could this Trap Room be...)
(Trap room, trap room.)
(Just go get the key.)
(Maybe you should explore the right side of this floor...?)
(The key for it was on the right side, where they made the traps, wasn't it?)
(The gate is locked.)
(You have the key, but you just noticed there's a note stuck to the gate...)
("The key is located in the Trap Building Room.")

rooms/floor3/centralrooms.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/centralrooms.html.dialogue: The King is leaving notes now?

rooms/floor3/centralrooms.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor3/centralrooms.html.dialogue: He must be forgetful! What an idiot!!!

rooms/floor3/centralrooms.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/centralrooms.html.dialogue: Hey, it happens. We have our own little forgetful one with us, don't we?
(Everyone looks at you.)
(You pout.)
(You look back.)
(You don't react.)

rooms/floor3/centralrooms.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/centralrooms.html.dialogue: I-it's okay, Siffrin! We'll remember things for you!!! You have many other talents, I'm sure!!!

rooms/floor3/centralrooms.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/centralrooms.html.dialogue: Not sure it helps, Mira.

rooms/floor3/centralrooms.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor3/centralrooms.html.dialogue: Why didn't we check the gate though... Maybe we could've found the key faster...

rooms/floor3/centralrooms.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/centralrooms.html.dialogue: What's done is done.

rooms/floor3/centralrooms.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor3/centralrooms.html.dialogue: What's done is done!!!
(...You could open the gate now, but...)
(You should probably pick up the key in the classroom first, shouldn't you?)
(Backtracking it is.)
(You decide to go pick up the key in the classroom.)
(You won't be able to progress very far on Floor 3, but who cares.)

rooms/floor3/centralrooms.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/centralrooms.html.dialogue: Wait!  Do you hear that?

rooms/floor3/centralrooms.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/centralrooms.html.dialogue: That sound, that's...

rooms/floor3/centralrooms.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/centralrooms.html.dialogue: That's the King...

rooms/floor3/centralrooms.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/centralrooms.html.dialogue: He's...crying.
(There's a key on the floor...)
(You pick it up.)
(You found the EMPTY KEY!)
(The keychain dangling from it is shaped like a mask of some kind...)
(You put the Empty Key in your Pocket.)

rooms/floor3/centralrooms.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/centralrooms.html.dialogue: Well, judging by its location, I'm guessing this is the key for the gate just ahead, but...
(The gate is covered in some sort of... thread?)
(It doesn't seem locked, but...)
(You're not sure the key you picked up would be useful here.)
(The gate is covered in the King's Hair.)

rooms/floor3/centralrooms.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/centralrooms.html.dialogue: This thread is so strange... I can't seem to move it aside...

rooms/floor3/centralrooms.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/centralrooms.html.dialogue: Frozen thread? It seems to be covering the rest of the floor too.

rooms/floor3/centralrooms.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/centralrooms.html.dialogue: Can we cut it?
(Woah!)
(Bonnie flipped your cape up, grabbing your dagger.)
(Ah, stars.)
(You didn't remember to stop them in time, and now the kid has a knife.)

rooms/floor3/centralrooms.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor3/centralrooms.html.dialogue: AYAAAAAAAA--

rooms/floor3/centralrooms.html.speaker: Siffrin
rooms/floor3/centralrooms.html.dialogue: (. . .) "Did you break my dagger, darling Bonnie?"

rooms/floor3/centralrooms.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor3/centralrooms.html.dialogue: No! I promise!!!

rooms/floor3/centralrooms.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/centralrooms.html.dialogue: Oh, it actually isn't! That's good news.

rooms/floor3/centralrooms.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/centralrooms.html.dialogue: So scary, Sif!

rooms/floor3/centralrooms.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/centralrooms.html.dialogue: His dagger isn't broken, but it didn't seem to have done anything to the thread...

rooms/floor3/centralrooms.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/centralrooms.html.dialogue: Oh, wait, look, it did something!

rooms/floor3/centralrooms.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/centralrooms.html.dialogue: The thread is slightly dented, here.

rooms/floor3/centralrooms.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/centralrooms.html.dialogue: So, a sharper knife could do the trick, maybe?

rooms/floor3/centralrooms.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/centralrooms.html.dialogue: I suppose. Either way, we should explore this floor more...
(Before you start walking, Bonnie tugs on your cloak.)

rooms/floor3/centralrooms.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor3/centralrooms.html.dialogue: S-sorry, Frin...

rooms/floor3/centralrooms.html.speaker: Siffrin
rooms/floor3/centralrooms.html.dialogue: (Wow, they must really feel bad.) "An apology? From you, Bonnie? That's..."

rooms/floor3/centralrooms.html.speaker: Siffrin
rooms/floor3/centralrooms.html.dialogue: "Mag-knife-icent."

rooms/floor3/centralrooms.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor3/centralrooms.html.dialogue: Hehehe...

rooms/floor3/centralrooms.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor3/centralrooms.html.dialogue: I-I mean, NOT FUNNY, SIFFRIN!!!!! YOU CRAB!!!!!
(A knife, huh...)
(You keep Bonnie from taking your knife, and try to slice the door yourself.)

rooms/floor3/centralrooms.html.speaker: Siffrin
rooms/floor3/centralrooms.html.dialogue: "Aw, it didn't work!"

rooms/floor3/centralrooms.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/centralrooms.html.dialogue: Attacking out of nowhere like that... So scary, Sif!

rooms/floor3/centralrooms.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/centralrooms.html.dialogue: Indeed, it didn't seem to have done anything to the thread...

rooms/floor3/centralrooms.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/centralrooms.html.dialogue: Oh, wait, look, it did something!

rooms/floor3/centralrooms.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/centralrooms.html.dialogue: The thread is slightly dented, here.

rooms/floor3/centralrooms.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/centralrooms.html.dialogue: So, a sharper knife could do the trick, maybe?

rooms/floor3/centralrooms.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/centralrooms.html.dialogue: I suppose. Either way, we should explore this floor more...
(Just go get the knife.)
(Where could you find a knife to cut this door open...)
(Just go get the knife.)
(Maybe you should explore the bottom left side of this floor...?)
(The Keyknife was on the left side, all the way to the end, wasn't it...?)
(The gate stands in front of you.)

rooms/floor3/centralrooms.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor3/centralrooms.html.dialogue: . . .You know, I was wondering...

rooms/floor3/centralrooms.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor3/centralrooms.html.dialogue: Like, the King clearly closed this door, and put the Tears in our way...

rooms/floor3/centralrooms.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor3/centralrooms.html.dialogue: But the... But the locked doors, weren't they...

rooms/floor3/centralrooms.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/centralrooms.html.dialogue: Yes... We were wrong.

rooms/floor3/centralrooms.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/centralrooms.html.dialogue: They were most likely locked by residents of the House.

rooms/floor3/centralrooms.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/centralrooms.html.dialogue: When the House was attacked, no one knew what the King's powers were...

rooms/floor3/centralrooms.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/centralrooms.html.dialogue: So they must've thought locking him in would have been enough to stop him.

rooms/floor3/centralrooms.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/centralrooms.html.dialogue: But by that time he'd already made sure Vaugarde would start slowly freezing in time...

rooms/floor3/centralrooms.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/centralrooms.html.dialogue: So... People in the House... Were trying to save Vaugarde, at the risk of their own lives...

rooms/floor3/centralrooms.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/centralrooms.html.dialogue: But it was all for nothing!!!

rooms/floor3/centralrooms.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/centralrooms.html.dialogue: It did get in our way more than anything else. But there's no way they could've known...

rooms/floor3/centralrooms.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/centralrooms.html.dialogue: ...They tried, and yet the King...

rooms/floor3/centralrooms.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/centralrooms.html.dialogue: This... This once-changed King!!! I'll... I'll--!!!

rooms/floor3/centralrooms.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor3/centralrooms.html.dialogue: Belle...

rooms/floor3/centralrooms.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/centralrooms.html.dialogue: We should get going.

rooms/floor3/centralrooms.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/centralrooms.html.dialogue: I'm predicting there will be a strong Sadness in the next room for you to cut into ribbons, Mirabelle.

rooms/floor3/centralrooms.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/centralrooms.html.dialogue: ...  Okay.

rooms/floor3/centralrooms.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/centralrooms.html.dialogue: Let's get going, everyone.
(You get ready, and slice the door.)
(The KeyKnife broke on impact.)
(Maybe it wasn't sharpened enough...?)
(That's too bad... You're sure you could've found a use for it elsewhere.)
(But at least the gate is opened.)

rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.dialogue: (A closet.)
(You open it...)
(You found the ANGRY KEY!)
(You put the Angry Key in your Pocket.)
(You now know where the Angry Key is located.)
(The keychain dangling from it is shaped like an angry mask...)
(That's a different face than the key you've gotten before.)
(Why are the faces different...?)

rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.dialogue: Oh, every keychain will probably have a different mask!

rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.dialogue: Huh... So every mask will have a different emotion? Is this what it's trying to represent?

rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.dialogue: Oh, I know this one!!!

rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.dialogue: That's the Change God! No matter what emotion it has, if it has a mask, that's the Change God!

rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.dialogue: The Change God always has a mask, and never has the same expression! Or art style, for that matter.

rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.dialogue: It's to show the Change God is ever-changing...

rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.dialogue: But also to show us that emotions are fleeting!

rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.dialogue: No matter how wonderful or awful you're feeling, this feeling will fade in time.

rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.dialogue: ...Why do good emotions have to fade too?

rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.dialogue: Why can't we keep being happy forever?

rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.dialogue: That'd be boring!!!

rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.dialogue: Can you imagine? It'd be, like, hm... Like being forced to eat your favorite food forever.

rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.dialogue: I'd like that though.

rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.dialogue: Are you sure? REALLY imagine it.

rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.dialogue: Eating only your favorite food, all the time...

rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.dialogue: Can I stop eating it when I'm full?

rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.dialogue: Nope. Can't do anything expect eat.

rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.dialogue: I can't go to the bathroom?!?

rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.dialogue: Nope!!!

rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.dialogue: That would suuuuuuuuuuuck...

rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.dialogue: Indeed. Just like feeling terrible forever would suck too.

rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.dialogue: And some of those feelings might stay for a while, make their home here...

rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.dialogue: But knowing they'll eventually go away, isn't it a relief?
(There's a House to explore.)
(There's nothing else in the closet.)
(Got the ANGRY KEY.)
(But you could loop back, if you wanted, couldn't you?)
(Loop back to before you talked to Mirabelle yesterday.)
(Make sure everything happens the way it always did.)
(Make sure you didn't say all those things to them.)
(Make sure they didn't hate you.)
(But you can't, you can't, you can't go through it all even one more time, your heart feels like it's splitting in two just thinking about it, you can't, you can't, you won't!!!)
(The closet is filled with many different types of clothes.)

rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.dialogue: Oh, look at this shirt! It has the same material as your cloak, right Sif?

rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.dialogue: This also looks incredibly warm. I still don't know how you managed to wear your cloak this whole summer...

rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.dialogue: Really?

rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.dialogue: ...Sif, can I look at your cloak for a sec?
(You nod.)
(Taking care to not touch you, Isabeau kneels and takes a hold of your cloak...)

rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.dialogue: Ah!

rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.dialogue: Your cloak's been sewn with some kind of temperature regulation spell crafted into the stitching, that's kind of cool.

rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.dialogue: No wonder you always look comfortable no matter the weather.
(HUH?)

rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.dialogue: WHAT...

rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.dialogue: Isn't that... Really really advanced crafting???

rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.dialogue: Aw, it's also been crafted to make the cloak grow with you!

rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.dialogue: It must've been incredibly expensive, unless it was handmade? How long have you had this?
(You try to remember.)
(Nothing comes to mind.)
(You shrug.)

rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.dialogue: Urgh... I'm really jealous... Sorry...

rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.dialogue: Yeah, if you ever sold this, you'd be set for a few months if not a whole year, you know?

rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.dialogue: The craftsmanship alone... Crafting stuff into the stitching is really interesting, actually... Hm...

rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.speaker: Siffrin
rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.dialogue: (Heh!) "Spoken like a true clothing designer, huh?"

rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.dialogue: Heheh, well.

rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.dialogue: ...Did I tell you about that? Hm...
(OOPS.)

rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.speaker: Siffrin
rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.dialogue: (QUICK SAY SOMETHING) "Just, just because, your clothes are so cool, haha."

rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.dialogue: Aw, thanks!!!!!
(You shrug.)
(Still can't remember.)

rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.dialogue: Urgh... I'm really jealous... Sorry...

rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.dialogue: Yeah, if you ever sold this, you'd be set for a few months if not a whole year, you know?

rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.dialogue: The craftsmanship alone... Crafting stuff into the stitching is really interesting, actually... Hm...
(You stay silent.)
(You shrug.)
(No point even trying to remember.)

rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.dialogue: Urgh... I'm really jealous... Sorry...

rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.dialogue: Yeah, if you ever sold this, you'd be set for a few months if not a whole year, you know?

rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.dialogue: The craftsmanship alone... Crafting stuff into the stitching is really interesting, actually... Hm...
(You stay silent.)
(You think.)
(You think and think and think.)
(Something has to come to mind, anything!)
(How can you not remember something as simple as this!!!!!!)
(Something as simple as where you got your blinding cloak you've been carrying for as long as you can remember!!!!!!!!!!)
(WAH!)
(You felt wind on your face?!)
(...Isabeau shook your cloak sharply, making a wave of wind blow on your face.)

rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.dialogue: Uh, see, and your cloak is so solid, too! It's really cool!!!

rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.dialogue: And look, everyone, come closer, look at this.
(Everyone looks at where Isabeau's pointing, away from your face.)
(You look, too.)

rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.dialogue: So right here, right, that's super interesting stitching.

rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.dialogue: It's backstitching, right, which is a very solid kind of stitching, and it's used in a lot of different places...

rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.dialogue: But Vaugardian clothing in general is moving away from backstitching, because, well, we think it's boring.

rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.dialogue: Like here, my clothing here has something called chainstitching, and also it's in a zigzag shape, because it looks cuter I guess.

rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.dialogue: But backstitching is just more durable. Now that I look at it, your hat has the same stitching too... I wonder if they were a set?
(Isabeau raises his head, and looks at your face.)

rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.dialogue: And, um, look at the way the cloak is weaved, too!

rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.dialogue: It's wool, and it goes one thread up, one thread down, et cetera...

rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.dialogue: But, again, Vaugardian clothing likes to be more interesting visually, so if you look at Mira's cloak--

rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.dialogue: Are you saying Frin's cloak is boring?

rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.dialogue: No, no, I'm not saying it's boring!!!!! I'm just saying it's like...

rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.dialogue: It's clothing that's less like Vaugarde, or even Ka Bue's artistic clothing...

rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.dialogue: It's less clothing that's to make you look pretty, or make you stand out, and more clothing that's here to keep you comfy and warm.

rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.dialogue: Function over form, you know?

rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.dialogue: Oh, okay...

rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.dialogue: Uh huh.

rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.dialogue: So, um, what I'm SAYING is...

rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.dialogue: Considering the Craft that came into it... The temperature regulation and how it grows with you...

rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.dialogue: Whoever gave you this cloak wanted to make sure you're gonna be nice and comfy for a long time, Sif!
(You try not to cry.)
(You bite your lip and breathe slowly, in, and out.)
(You walk away from the closet.)

rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.speaker: Siffrin
rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.dialogue: "Let's look at something else."

rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.dialogue: ...Okay.
(You look away from the closet, shrug, and smile.)

rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.dialogue: Urgh... I'm really jealous... Sorry...

rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.dialogue: Yeah, if you ever sold this, you'd be set for a few months if not a whole year, you know?

rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.dialogue: The craftsmanship alone... Crafting stuff into the stitching is really interesting, actually... Hm...
(The closet is filled with many different types of clothes.)
(The closet is filled with many different types of clothes.)

rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.dialogue: Oh, look at this shirt! It has the same material as your cloak, right Sif?

rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.dialogue: This also looks incredibly warm. I still don't know how you managed to wear your cloak this whole summer...

rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.speaker: Siffrin
rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.dialogue: (YOU'VE HAD THIS CLOAK FOREVER) "I never really get hot with it though?

rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.dialogue: Really?

rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.dialogue: ...Sif, can I look at your cloak for a sec?
(You nod.)
(Taking care to not touch you because you're too disgusting to touch, Isabeau kneels and takes a hold of your cloak...)

rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.dialogue: Ah!

rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.dialogue: Your cloak's been sewn with some kind of temperature regulation spell crafted into the stitching, that's kind of cool.

rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.dialogue: No wonder you always look comfortable no matter the weather.
(but you feel cold right now)

rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.dialogue: WHAT...

rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.dialogue: Isn't that... Really really advanced crafting???

rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.dialogue: Aw, it's also been crafted to make the cloak grow with you!

rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.dialogue: It must've been incredibly expensive, unless it was handmade? How long have you had this?
(You think, and think, and think, and think for so long that when you open your mouth to answer, you realize that you've been talking to thin air.)
(Closet.)
(Pictures of different people.)
(Some of them are covered in bandages, but they're all smiling.)
(Pictures of different people.)
(The bookcase is filled with books about Body Craft.)

rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.dialogue: Interesting. Can you tell me more about this?

rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.dialogue: Oh, well--

rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.dialogue: Hey, hey, Dile.

rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.dialogue: Don't you already know all this stuff?

rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.dialogue: Hm? What do you mean?

rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.dialogue: Um, you're always asking questions about Vaugarde and change and stuff...

rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.dialogue: But don't you already know about it?
(Huh, you never thought about it...)

rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.dialogue: Yeah, I was wondering about this too! You're always asking questions, which is fun...

rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.dialogue: ...But I can't believe you'd go to another country and not learn all about it beforehand.

rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.dialogue: If only because it'd make you look stupid.

rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.dialogue: ...How insightful, you two.

rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.dialogue: Wh-what?! Do you already know about the things you ask about???

rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.dialogue: Hm, I do know some of the things I ask you about...

rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.dialogue: But I also believe there's a difference between knowledge learned in books, and knowledge learned by talking to people.

rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.dialogue: Knowledge is important, but the meaning behind it, the emotional piece... That's important too.

rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.dialogue: Books don't tell me anything about how it feels to be surrounded by Vaugardian culture, to be bathed in it.

rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.dialogue: But the three of you do. And you clearly love your country, love the Change belief...

rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.dialogue: And it's making me like it too, I suppose.

rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.dialogue: Oh!

rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.dialogue: Aww, m'dame Odile!

rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.dialogue: I don't get it.

rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.dialogue: Ha! It's okay. You don't need to understand.

rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.dialogue: I just want to know all I can about Vaugardian culture, that's all.
(Odile...)
(The bookcase is filled with books about Body Craft.)
(Bookcase.)
(A book detailing how to craft your body.)

rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.dialogue: Wow, this book looks simpler than the one I've studied.

rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.dialogue: Apparently they've made some big strides in Body Craft recently!

rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.dialogue: Before, it took close to a year to make big changes... But now you can Change in a month or so!

rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.dialogue: It's interesting. Crafting your body is so... accepted, here in Vaugarde.

rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.dialogue: In Ka Bue, using Craft on yourself would be grounds for prison.

rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.dialogue: PRISON!?!

rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.dialogue: But why???

rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.dialogue: Because if you can craft your body to your liking, where's the limit?

rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.dialogue: Take the King for example. They say he crafted his body to become so massive, he can destroy houses in a single gesture.

rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.dialogue: And that's without mentioning his mastery over Time Craft, too.

rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.dialogue: ...But, that's...

rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.dialogue: I'm not saying Ka Bue is correct. I'm just telling you their point of view.

rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.dialogue: Plus...

rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.dialogue: It's not like there aren't ways to do Body Craft in Ka Bue, if you know where to look.

rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.dialogue: Oh my, m'dame Odile... Were you part of the underground resistance?

rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.dialogue: I'll never tell.

rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.dialogue: ...Resistance-ology...
(You've always wondered about crafting your body to something else, but it seems like a lot of work.)
(You don't mind inhabiting this meat prison for the time being.)
(You're thinking about crafting your body.)
(You seem to have all the time in the world now.)
(Candles.)

rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.dialogue: Sniff sniff.

rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.dialogue: Lavender!
(Lavender candles.)
(Candles.)

rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.dialogue: Sniff sniff.

rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.dialogue: Sugar, just like everything else around here!
(Sugar candles.)
(Candles.)

rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.dialogue: Sniff sniff.

rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.dialogue: Pomme de granate!

rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.dialogue: Pomegranate.

rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.dialogue: Pommegranite.

rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.dialogue: Pah-muh-gra-nuht.

rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.dialogue: Pah-muh-gra-nuht!!!

rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.dialogue: Yeah!!!

rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.dialogue: You did it!
(Everyone claps proudly.)

rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.dialogue: Hehehe...
(Pomegranate candles.)
(Candles.)

rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.dialogue: Sniff sniff.

rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.dialogue: Burnt sugar, just like when Frin loops back in time!
(Burnt sugar candles.)

rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.dialogue: Oh, that's...!

rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.dialogue: I... don't know who that is, actually.

rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.dialogue: They have a cool necklace, though.

rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.dialogue: Let me see...

rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.dialogue: Oh!!! I know them, that's another Housemaiden!

rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.dialogue: I hadn't seen them in a while... I didn't know they were Changing!

rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.dialogue: Come to think of it, I hadn't seen them for a little bit before the King... Maybe they were close to done crafting their body.

rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.dialogue: If we can beat the King, you can see them and meet them again!

rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.dialogue: Yes!
(A housemaiden.)
(They're frozen in time.)
(Someone frozen in time.)
(Paper and a pen.)
(Looks like someone was in the middle of writing down their Change.)

rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.dialogue: Hey, don't look, it's private!

rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.dialogue: Just because everything's frozen doesn't mean we should look at everything, you know?

rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.dialogue: Oh... I wasn't aware, my apologies.
(He's right...)
(You look away.)

rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.dialogue: Nah, it's fine, it's fine, you two didn't know.

rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.dialogue: But still, this brings back memories!

rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.dialogue: Ah, I would love to craft my body more...

rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.dialogue: I would love to be two centimeters taller!!!

rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.dialogue: Why two centimeters? Aren't you tall enough already?

rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.dialogue: I think you're too tall and you should cut it out.

rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.dialogue: Cut what out...?!?

rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.dialogue: Anyway, Mira, you don't understand.

rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.dialogue: With two more centimeters, I'll pass the threshold.

rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.dialogue: With two more centimeters, I'll finally be Tall with a capital T!!!!

rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.dialogue: Hahaha! I support you and your tall dreams!

rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.dialogue: What a simple reason...
(Crafting your body, huh...)

rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.dialogue: And, you know, instead of crafting your body itself, maybe there are easier ways to gain height.

rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.dialogue: Oh?! Like what?

rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.dialogue: You could wear high heels!!!

rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.dialogue: High heels hurt my feetsies...

rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.dialogue: Milk makes me sick sometimes.

rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.dialogue: We could tie your hands to a pillar and tug on your feet really hard?

rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.dialogue: Worth a try. Anyone have rope?

rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.dialogue: I'm sorry I brought us to this point. Let's stay focused, PLEASE.
(Paper and a pen.)
(An empty, clean bed.)
(There's something on it.)
(It's an animal, but not real. It's made out of fabric and other things. It's usually for kids. Those things have a name. It's a...)

rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.dialogue: IT'S A STUFFED ANIMAL, DUMMY!!!!!!

rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.dialogue: GUYS!!! FRIN FORGOT AN EASY WORD AGAIN!!!

rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.dialogue: SIFFRIN!!!

rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.dialogue: Sif...

rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.dialogue: We really have to do something about this, Siffrin.

rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.dialogue: Did you really forget a basic word like "stuffed animal"?

rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.dialogue: Things other than remembering the word "stuffed animal"?

rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.dialogue: What do you use the space in your brain for, anyway? Puns?

rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.dialogue: Well, that's fine, but--

rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.dialogue: HAHAHAHAHAHA YES!!!!!!!
(An empty, clean bed.)
(There's a stuffed animal laying on it.)

rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.dialogue: IT'S A STUFFED ANIMAL, DUMMY!!!!!!

rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor3/changeroom.html.dialogue: FRIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIN
(There's a stuffed animal there.)
(Some vials.)
(You got one PEPPER JUICE!)
(You got one THYME JUICE!)
(You got one GINGER JUICE!)
(You give them to Bonnie for safekeeping.)
(You got two SALTY BROTHS!)
(You give them to Bonnie for safekeeping.)
(Nothing else here.)
(Flowers.)
(Why does everything around you smell so sweet?)

rooms/floor3/hallways3.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/hallways3.html.dialogue: She's another Housemaiden... I always wanted to talk to her.

rooms/floor3/hallways3.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/hallways3.html.dialogue: She's so cool. Her crafted pieces are always so perfect!

rooms/floor3/hallways3.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/hallways3.html.dialogue: I want to be just like her when I grow up...

rooms/floor3/hallways3.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor3/hallways3.html.dialogue: Huh? But you're an adult, Belle. You're already grown.

rooms/floor3/hallways3.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/hallways3.html.dialogue: Oh no, she's realizing she's a real actual grown adult.

rooms/floor3/hallways3.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/hallways3.html.dialogue: We all go through this realization, Mira. It'll be okay.

rooms/floor3/hallways3.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/hallways3.html.dialogue: Oh! No, sorry, it's not that, it's just...

rooms/floor3/hallways3.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/hallways3.html.dialogue: He pushed me away, so the Curse wouldn't get me, and it hit him instead.
(The symbol over the keyhole is shaped like a crying mask.)

rooms/floor3/hallways3.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/hallways3.html.dialogue: Hm... We don't have the key for this one yet, do we?
(There's a piece of paper stuck to the door...)
( "We closed as many doors as we could, but if SOMEHOW you need the key to this one..." )
( "...I hid the key in room 403, in little Marc's notebook. )

rooms/floor3/hallways3.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/hallways3.html.dialogue: The classrooms do! We've only seen a couple, but the House has way more.

rooms/floor3/hallways3.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/hallways3.html.dialogue: Room 403 though... I'm pretty sure we've at least passed it, it's where... . . .

rooms/floor3/hallways3.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/hallways3.html.dialogue: I-it's, um... It's currently on the second floor...

rooms/floor3/hallways3.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor3/hallways3.html.dialogue: But... We can't go to previous floors, can we? The big doors close behind us, don't they?
(The classroom on the second floor, though... That's such a long way back...)
(The key is in the classroom on the second floor... Better loop back and get going.)
(Oh thank the stars you're back here.)
(You try not to audibly sigh in relief.)
(You insert the key into the keyhole, and open the door.)

rooms/floor3/hallways3.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/hallways3.html.dialogue: Isn't that the key you found in the classroom?

rooms/floor3/hallways3.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/hallways3.html.dialogue: ...If you didn't pick it up, Siffrin... Wouldn't we...

rooms/floor3/hallways3.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/hallways3.html.dialogue: WOULDN'T WE BE SUPER STUCK RIGHT NOW?!?

rooms/floor3/hallways3.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/hallways3.html.dialogue: Hm? There was a piece of paper stuck to the door.
(Mirabelle is looking at the note intently...)
(It's the one that said to look inside of that kid's notebook to find the key, wasn't it?)

rooms/floor3/hallways3.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor3/hallways3.html.dialogue: Are we going? Let's go, let's go!!!
(There's a hole here, hidden between some supplies.)
(It doesn't bring you any...  Wait a second.)

rooms/floor3/hallways3.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/hallways3.html.dialogue: Somehow, I feel like we're wasting our time... But I suppose we might as well see where it leads.

rooms/floor3/hallways3.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/hallways3.html.dialogue: Someone, this far inside the House? Who--

rooms/floor3/hallways3.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/hallways3.html.dialogue: That's my roommate, Claude...! Oh, no, how could this happen...

rooms/floor3/hallways3.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/hallways3.html.dialogue: I hate my roommate, she's annoying and always bothers me for stupid reasons, but...   But...

rooms/floor3/hallways3.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/hallways3.html.dialogue: I... used to think she should've become a Defender, because she was always helping people, and trying out weird experiments to solve their problems...

rooms/floor3/hallways3.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/hallways3.html.dialogue: And she would always, ALWAYS help the Head Housemaiden with hers.

rooms/floor3/hallways3.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/hallways3.html.dialogue: Always trying new ways to organize her desk... To help her finish tasks... To make sure she'd get some free time...

rooms/floor3/hallways3.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/hallways3.html.dialogue: She'd do it with a smug smile, saying it wasn't that big of a deal, that she'd do it for anyone, but...

rooms/floor3/hallways3.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/hallways3.html.dialogue: If she knew that the Head Housemaiden was in danger... She would've ran anywhere, everywhere, so she could help her.

rooms/floor3/hallways3.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/hallways3.html.dialogue: Not only because the Head Housemaiden would've solved anything, would've beaten the King if she could, but because...

rooms/floor3/hallways3.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/hallways3.html.dialogue: If Claude is this far into the House, she must've... tried to stop the King herself, so he wouldn't get to the Head Housemaiden.

rooms/floor3/hallways3.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/hallways3.html.dialogue: And so...   If she's like this...   He must've...   Aaah!
(You don't know what you should say.)
(What can you say in a moment like this...!)
(If you could skip this part, you would.)
(Mirabelle gently wipes dust away from her roommate's brow.)

rooms/floor3/hallways3.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/hallways3.html.dialogue:
If you can hear me...   I'll be back for you soon.
<!--there's a line break btwn the wait i think? i don't know how we handle those-->

rooms/floor3/hallways3.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/hallways3.html.dialogue: Someone, this far inside the House? Who--

rooms/floor3/hallways3.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/hallways3.html.dialogue: No, it's okay, I... I figured it'd be the case.

rooms/floor3/hallways3.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/hallways3.html.dialogue: If she was in the House... She'd be as close to the Head Housemaiden as she could get...

rooms/floor3/hallways3.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/hallways3.html.dialogue: But you couldn't get to her in time, could you, Claude...?

rooms/floor3/hallways3.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/hallways3.html.dialogue: Mirabelle...   Are you okay to continue on?

rooms/floor3/hallways3.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/hallways3.html.dialogue: Like I said... I was prepared for it. And...

rooms/floor3/hallways3.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/hallways3.html.dialogue: We still have a King's butt to kick, so we can save everyone, don't we?

rooms/floor3/hallways3.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/hallways3.html.dialogue: Let's go ahead, and kick that crabbing King's butt!!!

rooms/floor3/hallways3.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor3/hallways3.html.dialogue: He won't know what hit him!!!
(She was the one who was getting ready to make a bomb in Mirabelle's dorm room, wasn't she?)
(...She's holding something tightly in her fist.)
(You put the vial in your pocket along with your Souvenirs.)

rooms/floor3/miradorm.html.dialogue: (The closet has a lot of different dresses that look similar to Mirabelle's.)
(You haven't worn a dress in forever!)
(You wonder if you'll ever wear different clothes again.)
(There's "The Cursing of Château Castle" issue #68, "Death Die Dice Maker", "One Hundred Ways to Die Horribly", "The Meat Slicing"...)
(Ah. That last one's actually a cooking book.)

rooms/floor3/miradorm.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/miradorm.html.dialogue: A lot of horror books in there. Is this one about a group of young adults being forced to kill each other for someone's entertainment?

rooms/floor3/miradorm.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/miradorm.html.dialogue: We should have a book club sometime, just the two of us.

rooms/floor3/miradorm.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/miradorm.html.dialogue: We should!!! We could exchange letters and recommendations after we beat the King!

rooms/floor3/miradorm.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/miradorm.html.dialogue: Whaaaaat, just you two? The rest of us aren't invited?

rooms/floor3/miradorm.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/miradorm.html.dialogue: Being told to back off by Mirabelle herself... I feel blessed somehow.

rooms/floor3/miradorm.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/miradorm.html.dialogue: Again, give me your recommendations at some point.
(You hope they get to have their book club soon.)
(Why read when you can have people recite things instead?)
(It'd be rude to look inside, so you don't.)
(It'd be rude to look inside, so you don't.)
(Back in Dormont, she seemed worried about whatever was inside, wasn't she?)
(You won't be able to look inside as things are now...)
(Is there something in this room that could distract her somehow...?)
(She must be thinking about her roommate.)
(You feel bad taking advantage of this moment, but...)
(There's some pens, a brooch, anti-anxiety medication...)
(Each paper seems to be a file about a different person...)
(Each has a picture of someone, their name, and what seems to be their answers to questions like "Where do you imagine yourself in ten years?" and "Do you want kids?")
(What are those papers...? She must've been looking at similar papers in Dormont. Is she choosing one person to do something...?)
(Either way, this seems to be what Mirabelle is worried about.)
(You should go and talk to her about it...)
(You look behind you, but there's no one there.)

rooms/floor3/miradorm.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/miradorm.html.dialogue: Yes, um... What gave it away?

rooms/floor3/miradorm.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor3/miradorm.html.dialogue: It smells fruity, just like your name!!!

rooms/floor3/miradorm.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/miradorm.html.dialogue: Hehehe! My roommate gifted me some mirabelle plums scented soap a while back!

rooms/floor3/miradorm.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/miradorm.html.dialogue: She may never clean her room and she may keep me from sleeping by muttering formulas to herself in the middle of the night, but she does give great gifts.

rooms/floor3/miradorm.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/miradorm.html.dialogue: She may never clean her room and she may keep me from sleeping by muttering formulas to herself in the middle of the night, but she... does give great gifts...
(Some flowers Mirabelle is trying to grow.)

rooms/floor3/miradorm.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/miradorm.html.dialogue: I'm trying to grow them out!!! They haven't died yet!!!

rooms/floor3/miradorm.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/miradorm.html.dialogue: Even though I haven't been here for months now...

rooms/floor3/miradorm.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/miradorm.html.dialogue: I suppose that's something I can thank the King for.

rooms/floor3/miradorm.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/miradorm.html.dialogue: That's my roommate's... Don't ask me what she's researching.

rooms/floor3/miradorm.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/miradorm.html.dialogue: What is she like, this roommate of yours?

rooms/floor3/miradorm.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/miradorm.html.dialogue: She's the worst I really don't like her.

rooms/floor3/miradorm.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor3/miradorm.html.dialogue: I didn't know Belle could hate people...

rooms/floor3/miradorm.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/miradorm.html.dialogue: She doesn't clean her side of her room ever, and she leaves her experiments and weird potions around everywhere, and she always sings way too loud!!!

rooms/floor3/miradorm.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/miradorm.html.dialogue: And when I ask her to maybe change songs and sing something I might like, she always tells me "No can do, princess"!!!

rooms/floor3/miradorm.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/miradorm.html.dialogue: She's mean and has no respect towards others!!!

rooms/floor3/miradorm.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/miradorm.html.dialogue: Not seeing her around... It really worries me...
(Mirabelle looks sad... She seems to be lost in thought.)
(One of them is broken, but the others seem intact...)
(You give them to Bonnie for safekeeping.)

rooms/floor3/miradorm.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/miradorm.html.dialogue: Was your roommate making bombs? Because with all the materials she has in here, it looks like she was learning how to make Craft bombs.

rooms/floor3/miradorm.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/miradorm.html.dialogue: I'm just saying. She has the materials to make a Craft bomb.

rooms/floor3/miradorm.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/miradorm.html.dialogue: Looks like she didn't finish it though, if that makes you feel better?

rooms/floor3/miradorm.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/miradorm.html.dialogue: How... do you know... how to make a Craft bomb...

rooms/floor3/miradorm.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/miradorm.html.dialogue: I-I learned it while I was studying to become a Defender... B-But isn't that just common knowledge???

rooms/floor3/miradorm.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/miradorm.html.dialogue: I-I've never learned how to make a bomb!!!

rooms/floor3/miradorm.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor3/miradorm.html.dialogue: I know I'm a kid and you'd think I DEFINITELY know how to make bombs, but I've never learned either.

rooms/floor3/miradorm.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor3/miradorm.html.dialogue: We have to throw a bomb at the King.

rooms/floor3/miradorm.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/miradorm.html.dialogue: It would. What else do we need?

rooms/floor3/miradorm.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/miradorm.html.dialogue: Your roommate has some stuff already, so we just need...
(Isabeau starts explaining what you need with very confusing words!)

rooms/floor3/miradorm.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/miradorm.html.dialogue: There's already a short gizmo-gadget here, so we just need a long thingy-thing, and a secret ingredient.
(You put the short gizmo-gadget in your pocket along with your Souvenirs.)
(You need to get a long thingy-thing, a short gizmo-gadget and a secret ingredient to make a bomb...)
(This way must lead to a shared bathroom.)

rooms/floor3/mirrorroom.html.dialogue: (A mirror.)
(You and your [allies/family members/actors] are reflected in it.)

rooms/floor3/mirrorroom.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor3/mirrorroom.html.dialogue: That's a big mirror.

rooms/floor3/mirrorroom.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/mirrorroom.html.dialogue: Massive, even... And there's not really anything else of interest in this room.

rooms/floor3/mirrorroom.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/mirrorroom.html.dialogue: I don't know anything about it... Before the house shifted around because of the King, it was in a part of the House I didn't often walk by...

rooms/floor3/mirrorroom.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/mirrorroom.html.dialogue: Hm.

rooms/floor3/mirrorroom.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/mirrorroom.html.dialogue: If it is what I think it is, then... It should be...

rooms/floor3/mirrorroom.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/mirrorroom.html.dialogue: Ah HA!

rooms/floor3/mirrorroom.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/mirrorroom.html.dialogue: Everyone, say "FROMAGE"!

rooms/floor3/mirrorroom.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor3/mirrorroom.html.dialogue: Froma--

rooms/floor3/mirrorroom.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor3/mirrorroom.html.dialogue: Wh-WHAT WAS THAT?!?

rooms/floor3/mirrorroom.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/mirrorroom.html.dialogue: Oh, look! Something's on the ground...

rooms/floor3/mirrorroom.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/mirrorroom.html.dialogue: A piece of paper...?

rooms/floor3/mirrorroom.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/mirrorroom.html.dialogue: Ehehehe... BEHOLD!!!

rooms/floor3/mirrorroom.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/mirrorroom.html.dialogue: Oh!!!
(It's a picture of all of you.)

rooms/floor3/mirrorroom.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/mirrorroom.html.dialogue: It's us!!!

rooms/floor3/mirrorroom.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/mirrorroom.html.dialogue: This is lovely.

rooms/floor3/mirrorroom.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/mirrorroom.html.dialogue: Isn't it? It's a crafted mirror that takes pictures!!!

rooms/floor3/mirrorroom.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/mirrorroom.html.dialogue: I heard rumors that someone was creating one, but I didn't know this someone lived in Dormont's House!

rooms/floor3/mirrorroom.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor3/mirrorroom.html.dialogue: We look so surprised!

rooms/floor3/mirrorroom.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/mirrorroom.html.dialogue: Hehe, only Isabeau knew this was coming!

rooms/floor3/mirrorroom.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/mirrorroom.html.dialogue: Pictures are so rare... It's nice to have one of us.

rooms/floor3/mirrorroom.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/mirrorroom.html.dialogue: Thank you for telling us about it, and for taking a picture, Isabeau!

rooms/floor3/mirrorroom.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/mirrorroom.html.dialogue: Oh!

rooms/floor3/mirrorroom.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/mirrorroom.html.dialogue: Hehe... It's nothing!
(You got a MEMORY OF REFLECTION!)
(You'll always remember this.)
[When MEMORY OF REFLECTION is equipped, your DEFENSE will be automatically boosted at the start of a battle!]

rooms/floor3/mirrorroom.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/mirrorroom.html.dialogue: What should we do with it?

rooms/floor3/mirrorroom.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/mirrorroom.html.dialogue: Hm...
(Odile looks at you.)

rooms/floor3/mirrorroom.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/mirrorroom.html.dialogue: Would you keep it safe, oh one with all the secret pockets?
(You got the MIRROR PICTURE!)
(You put the picture in your pocket along with your Souvenirs.)
(Yay!)
(You and the picture are finally reunited.)
(You're glad to have the picture back. It's proof.)
(Proof that you're here on this journey, proof that you were with your [allies/family members], proof that you love them.)
(Even if you forget, and you forget a lot... It's proof that you and your friends existed.)
(Proof that you were happy.)
(Proof that this moment happened...)
(Perfectly frozen in time.)
(After the country was forgotten, the King was welcomed by Vaugarde, wasn't he?)
(Welcomed, helped, and loved.)
(To the point where he sees Vaugarde as "perfect".)
(But... No one knows why the country was forgotten.)
(What's keeping Vaugarde from being forgotten the exact same way?)
(Wasn't it his duty, as thanks for welcoming him, to make sure such a fate would never befall Vaugarde?)
(What else could he do  but make sure this perfect country was preserved in amber forever?)
(How could he ever let go?)
(. . . You understand the King more than you'd like to.)
(But... But still, he's...)
(You want to talk to him again.)
(You smile at the picture.)
(It's you and your [allies/family members][!/.])
(It's you.)
(Oh!)
(The flash of the mirror somehow made something appear...)
(You reach down and pick it up.)
(Now that you can see the key, you pick it up.)
(You found the SMILING KEY!)
(The keychain dangling from it is shaped like a smiling mask...)
(You put the Smiling Key in your Pocket.)
(You now know where the Smiling Key is located.)
(Got the SMILING KEY.)
(You try not to think about them.)
(Even if it was the same lines every time, it was nice, wasn't it? To listen to the same thing?)
(It was restful, wasn't it? To know, to remember exactly what happens next?)
(Is it worth it to try to break the loop by whatever means necessary?)
(You like knowing what happens next! You don't have to think about anything!)
(And even if you manage to break the loop, what will you come back to?)
(Allies that hate you?)
(don't think about it don't think about it don't think about it)
(You keep going.)
(Little paintings of people looking at the artist.)
(They look very realistic...)
(Photos.)
(Photos.)
(...  One of the photos is of the King, standing alone.)
(He looks lonely.)
(Photos.)
(One of them is of the King.)
(It's like looking in a mirror.)
(Photos of you and your friends.)

rooms/floor3/observatory.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/observatory.html.dialogue: There's a big window over there, see?

rooms/floor3/observatory.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/observatory.html.dialogue: What...? Was there a room like this in the House?

rooms/floor3/observatory.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/observatory.html.dialogue: Y-yeah, I remember! Someone was working here... Studying... They looked like...

rooms/floor3/observatory.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor3/observatory.html.dialogue: That's stars! Those are stars, right?
[Good news: there's no key or knife in here, stardust!]

rooms/floor3/observatory.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor3/observatory.html.dialogue: Those are... Stars, right? I remembered just now.

rooms/floor3/observatory.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/observatory.html.dialogue: But don't they only appear at night...?

rooms/floor3/observatory.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/observatory.html.dialogue: We left early in the morning, so it should still be light outside...

rooms/floor3/observatory.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/observatory.html.dialogue: I've heard it's always night time, near the King. Maybe this is his influence?

rooms/floor3/observatory.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/observatory.html.dialogue: It was dark around the House yesterday too, remember?
(Stars, like the King's armor. Stars, like the King keeps mentioning.)
(You should remember them. Something in you tells you you should.)
(Every time you raise your head and look up at them, you feel like it's something you've done dozens, hundreds, thousands of times.)
(But you can't remember any of it.)
(You can't remember what you were even trying to see, looking up at them.)
(The King... Every time you face him, he asks you the same question.)
(Remembering is not something you're very good at.)
(You're a very forgetful person, after all.)
(You forget where you're going half the time.)
(You've noticed you're starting to forget whole loops.)
(You can barely remember anything that happened before you started looping in time.)
(You can  barely  remember  anything  that  happened  before)
(You   breathe out, and unclench your fists.)
(What you can and can't remember doesn't matter much now, does it.)
(The King... Does he want you to remember something?)
(You should go and ask the King what he wants you to remember, later.)
(You open your eyes, smile, and shake your head.)

rooms/floor3/observatory.html.speaker: Siffrin
rooms/floor3/observatory.html.dialogue: "Can we look at the stars for a second?"

rooms/floor3/observatory.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/observatory.html.dialogue: Sure. We have time, don't we?
(You can see stars, but find no meaning.)
(It has to, right? There has to be a point to all this, right?)

("Please enjoy the show", you think, and "Curse you for clapping, for watching, for not doing anything to help, why aren't you helping me, why aren't you leading me, please tell me what to do, please, please, please".)

rooms/floor3/observatory.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/observatory.html.dialogue: Oh, I've seen one of those before! That's a "telescope".

rooms/floor3/observatory.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/observatory.html.dialogue: I think you watch the sky with it?

rooms/floor3/observatory.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/observatory.html.dialogue: Like stars, I think. During the night, since they're not here during the day.

rooms/floor3/observatory.html.speaker: Siffrin
rooms/floor3/observatory.html.dialogue: (Okay, you have to say something.) "Stars aren't boring."

rooms/floor3/observatory.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor3/observatory.html.dialogue: B-but they are... They're just dots in the sky.

rooms/floor3/observatory.html.speaker: Siffrin
rooms/floor3/observatory.html.dialogue: "They're not just dots, they're big balls of fire and gas and light."

rooms/floor3/observatory.html.speaker: Siffrin
rooms/floor3/observatory.html.dialogue: "Most are bigger than our planet, they're just really far."

rooms/floor3/observatory.html.speaker: Siffrin
rooms/floor3/observatory.html.dialogue: "And they don't 'appear' at night, they're here during the day too."

rooms/floor3/observatory.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/observatory.html.dialogue: Okay, that was interesting, but stop telling the kid lies.

rooms/floor3/observatory.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/observatory.html.dialogue: I almost believed you, Siffrin, but that one is too much!

rooms/floor3/observatory.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/observatory.html.dialogue: I mean, if stars are also here during the day, then why can't we see them?
(You don't want to explain stars to them again.)
(You tried before, way before this all happened, you remember that.)
(You can't understand not caring about stars.)
(You take a step back, and look at the walls.)

rooms/floor3/observatory.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/observatory.html.dialogue: What's this drawing for? This looks pretty good!

rooms/floor3/observatory.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor3/observatory.html.dialogue: Not really. It's just dots on lightless paper.

rooms/floor3/observatory.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/observatory.html.dialogue: The dots on the map look like the sky we can see through the window... Could it be some kind of drawing of the stars...?

rooms/floor3/observatory.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/observatory.html.dialogue: A map of the stars...? But what for?
(For some reason, you can feel yourself frowning.)
(There's a book in Ka Buan open on the table.)

rooms/floor3/observatory.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/observatory.html.dialogue: A Ka Buan book here in Vaugarde, how rare...

rooms/floor3/observatory.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/observatory.html.dialogue: The title translates to... "Colors Through Time"?

rooms/floor3/observatory.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/observatory.html.dialogue: It seems to be an essay about color theory.

rooms/floor3/observatory.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/observatory.html.dialogue: WE DON'T HAVE TIME FOR THIS.
(You can go and reread the book about colors in the secret library if you're so curious.)
(Colors... What you saw, when you talked to the King...)
(What's a color? Maybe you should look around the House for another book on colors...)
(Maybe you should reread the color book in the secret library first...)
(You should reread the book in the secret library first.)

rooms/floor3/observatory.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/observatory.html.dialogue: Ah, I know this face, Sif...
(Odile sighs and picks up the book.)

rooms/floor3/observatory.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/observatory.html.dialogue:
<small>
 Yes, I'm not the one reading this time...
</small>

rooms/floor3/observatory.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/observatory.html.dialogue: ...This book seems to go into detail about what could've caused colors to disappear...

rooms/floor3/observatory.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor3/observatory.html.dialogue: Something big must've happened, right? For everyone to not be able to see them anymore!

rooms/floor3/observatory.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/observatory.html.dialogue: And it was a very long time ago, so there's probably no records of why...

rooms/floor3/observatory.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/observatory.html.dialogue: There seem to be a lot of theories... A Craft experiment gone horribly wrong, the side effect of a Craft war...

rooms/floor3/observatory.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/observatory.html.dialogue: Whatever happened then, all colors disappeared from this world.

rooms/floor3/observatory.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/observatory.html.dialogue: It'd be like... Like if everyone stopped seeing shades all of a sudden.

rooms/floor3/observatory.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/observatory.html.dialogue: I do wonder what could've made that happen, yes.

rooms/floor3/observatory.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/observatory.html.dialogue: Ah yes... If Wish Craft can really make the impossible come true, maybe that is what happened.
(You're still wondering about that weird shade you saw, while... Talking to the King.)

rooms/floor3/observatory.html.speaker: Siffrin
rooms/floor3/observatory.html.dialogue: "Is there a way to see colors now?"

rooms/floor3/observatory.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/observatory.html.dialogue: Funny you should mention it... People have been known to see a "weird shade" during...

rooms/floor3/observatory.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/observatory.html.dialogue: They described this shade as... "Scary"? "Dangerous"? "Visceral", maybe?

rooms/floor3/observatory.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/observatory.html.dialogue: Historians think this "weird shade" could've been a color.

rooms/floor3/observatory.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/observatory.html.dialogue: "Times of immense trouble"? What does that mean?

rooms/floor3/observatory.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/observatory.html.dialogue: Sorry, it's a little tough to translate... Moments before something "breaks", maybe?

rooms/floor3/observatory.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/observatory.html.dialogue: Like, during the end of something? Or something gets destroyed?

rooms/floor3/observatory.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor3/observatory.html.dialogue: Like the end of the world?

rooms/floor3/observatory.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/observatory.html.dialogue: If colors were an integral part of the world... Then the world rights itself right before the end...

rooms/floor3/observatory.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/observatory.html.dialogue: How poetic! Someone should write a novel about this!
(When the King tried so hard to say your country's name... Did something "break" then?)
(There's a book in Ka Buan open on the table.)
(You can go and reread the book about colors in the secret library if you're so curious.)
(What's a color? Maybe you should look around the House for another book on colors...)
(Maybe you should reread the color book in the secret library first...)
(You should reread the book in the secret library first.)
(There's a book in Ka Buan open on the table.)
(You look back at Odile, but there's no one there.)
(There's a book in Ka Buan open on the table.)
(Just looking at them gives you a headache.)
(They're books about space, the stars, the Universe.)
(Isabeau points to where you are, on the lower half of the globe.)
(Odile points to a big country, far from Vaugarde.)
(Ka Bue, a country you've visited at least once.)
(Bonnie points to a spot almost on the edge of Vaugarde.)
(You spin the globe, and jab your finger on a random spot.)

rooms/floor3/observatory.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/observatory.html.dialogue: Oh!!! Is that... Is that where you're from, Sif?
(You see a spot on the globe where the paint has started wearing out, like someone kept dragging their finger on it.)
(Erased. You almost want to look for lightless paint.)
(Island, North of Vaugarde, name unknown, name unknown, name unknown, )

rooms/floor3/observatory.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/observatory.html.dialogue: Looks like a child tried to write down their first word!

rooms/floor3/observatory.html.speaker: Odile
