rooms/floor3/observatory.html.dialogue: That sure is some awful handwriting.

rooms/floor3/observatory.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/observatory.html.dialogue: And a determined child... Looks like they tried to write the same word on all those papers.
(BUT YOU ARE NOT ABLE TO READ IT.)
(But you can't read it but you can't read it but you can't read it but you can't read it)
(You follow the lines as best you can but you can't read what's written why can't you read it?)
(It looks like someone was trying to write your country's name.)
(WHY DO YOU KEEP READING? WHY DO YOU KEEP TRYING?!?)
(No no no you wouldn't you wouldn't wish for anything ever again because you know that somehow somehow somehow Wish Craft brought you here)

rooms/floor3/potteryroom.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/potteryroom.html.dialogue: She doesn't like me. I broke the whole class' work during the last class I had with her.

rooms/floor3/potteryroom.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/potteryroom.html.dialogue: Everyone's finished work goes on the shelf over here... And...

rooms/floor3/potteryroom.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/potteryroom.html.dialogue: And it was fine, but then I tried to jump away, so I wouldn't break anything, but...

rooms/floor3/potteryroom.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/potteryroom.html.dialogue: Who bumped into someone else, who bumped into someone else, and so on...

rooms/floor3/potteryroom.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/potteryroom.html.dialogue: Until someone bumped into the table, flipping it over...
(Isabeau is pointing at a dark earring with the same design as the person from before.)

rooms/floor3/potteryroom.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/potteryroom.html.dialogue: AND THEY ONLY HAVE ONE EARRING!!!

rooms/floor3/potteryroom.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/potteryroom.html.dialogue: WE HAVE TO GIVE THEM THE EARRING!!!!

rooms/floor3/potteryroom.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/potteryroom.html.dialogue: AND A NOTE SO THEY CAN FIND EACH OTHER!!!!

rooms/floor3/potteryroom.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/potteryroom.html.dialogue: SORRY!!! THIS IS JUST SO ROMANTIC!!!!

rooms/floor3/potteryroom.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/potteryroom.html.dialogue: Wait, where should we put the note.

rooms/floor3/potteryroom.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/potteryroom.html.dialogue: Spear the note to their ear with the earring, maybe?
(They make a note earring, telling the frozen person where to meet their partner.)
(...They look a little silly, with their nice earring and a piece of paper attached to their ear.)

rooms/floor3/potteryroom.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/potteryroom.html.dialogue: ...  I'm getting a little emotional over here.

rooms/floor3/potteryroom.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/potteryroom.html.dialogue: Me too... I hope they'll find the note... And get to meet...!!!

rooms/floor3/potteryroom.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/potteryroom.html.dialogue: Considering how the note is attached to their ear, I think they'll notice.

rooms/floor3/potteryroom.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/potteryroom.html.dialogue: Looking stupid is nothing, in the face of true love.
(You hope you can beat the King, so they can meet again.)
(You wonder if they had time to meet each other, before everything around them looped back.)
(They probably never get to meet, do they?)
(An oven for clay. It has a name, but you can't remember right now.)
(An oven for clay you've seen those before you've used those before and yet you can't remember its name neither in Vaugardian nor in--)
(Some weird tools to make pots. You forget what they're called.)
(Some weird tools to make pots you can't remember what they're called in neither blinding language who cares who cares who cares)
(The closet contains some tools to make pottery.)
(You give them to Bonnie for safekeeping.)
(The closet contains some tools to make pottery.)
(A shelf filled with little Change Gods.)
(They're all different shapes and sizes, some smiling, some crying, some with no face at all.)
(The box is filled with crafting materials and finished art pieces that no one liked.)

rooms/floor3/potteryroom.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/potteryroom.html.dialogue: They're massive! They were not made for a kid, that's for sure.
(You take the gloves and put them near Isabeau's hands.)

rooms/floor3/potteryroom.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/potteryroom.html.dialogue: My dear Siffrin... Would you do me the honor...
(You laugh and try to put the gloves on him.)
(The stiff papier-mâché makes it hard, but after some effort, you succeed in your task.)

rooms/floor3/potteryroom.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/potteryroom.html.dialogue: NOT EVEN A LITTLE BIT
(The Papier-mâché Hands are equipped to Isabeau. That's just how it is now.)
[The PAPIER-MÂCHÉ HANDS are very special! When equipped, they turn Isabeau's basic Attack from Rock to Paper!]
(...Actually, now that the papier-mâché hands are gone, there's some tonics in there.)
(You give them to Bonnie for safekeeping.)
(A shelf filled with little Change Gods.)
(A shelf filled with little Change Gods.)
(You ignore the Universe rewriting itself and take one of the gods and squeeze)
(A shelf filled with one less little Change God.)
(You put the clay in your pocket along with your Souvenirs.)
(An open book, stained by clay and dirty hands.)
(It's an issue of "The Cursing of Château Castle", issue #87.)

rooms/floor3/potteryroom.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/potteryroom.html.dialogue: Oh! The last issue of the Something Something book series?

rooms/floor3/potteryroom.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/potteryroom.html.dialogue: Do we finally get to learn about Lord Joséphandre's true lineage? What about Pierre-Jacques-Erneste, will he survive?! And most importantly...

rooms/floor3/potteryroom.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/potteryroom.html.dialogue: DOES THE SIDE CHARACTER WHO APPEARED ONLY IN ISSUE #43 APPEAR AGAIN?!??!?!??!?

rooms/floor3/potteryroom.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/potteryroom.html.dialogue: I'll give you ten minutes to read it. See how generous I am?

rooms/floor3/potteryroom.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/potteryroom.html.dialogue: SO GENEROUS, MADAME ODILE!!!!!!!!!!! I WILL FINISH IT IN THE ALLOTTED TIME!!!!!!!!!
(You all patiently wait while Mirabelle reads, and makes high pitched sounds every once in a while...)

rooms/floor3/potteryroom.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/potteryroom.html.dialogue: Isn't a Lord at all? His parents were normal everyday people?

rooms/floor3/potteryroom.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/potteryroom.html.dialogue: This whole time, he was... Just a guy?

rooms/floor3/potteryroom.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/potteryroom.html.dialogue: He wasn't chosen by fate, he didn't actually have a title, and he was... Just a guy?

rooms/floor3/potteryroom.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/potteryroom.html.dialogue: They kept talking about how magnificent and incredible his family was, and how he was chosen for a reason, and he was... Just a guy?

rooms/floor3/potteryroom.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/potteryroom.html.dialogue: Didn't this guy like, save castles or whatever? So, like, he saved people also, I'm guessing?

rooms/floor3/potteryroom.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/potteryroom.html.dialogue: He was a hero to everyone he met! And yet he was... Just a guy?

rooms/floor3/potteryroom.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor3/potteryroom.html.dialogue: And he wasn't a chosen one or an important person or maybe a prince?

rooms/floor3/potteryroom.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/potteryroom.html.dialogue: No??? He was just a guy?????????

rooms/floor3/potteryroom.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/potteryroom.html.dialogue: Is this a letdown for you or not? I can't tell.

rooms/floor3/potteryroom.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/potteryroom.html.dialogue: I don't know??? I think I just need time??? To process this???

rooms/floor3/potteryroom.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/potteryroom.html.dialogue: Well, you can process while we walk. Let's go, everyone.
(So Lord Joséphandre was just a guy.)
(You should let the castle-loving one in Dormont know...)
(An open book, stained by clay and dirty hands.)
(It's an issue of "The Cursing of Château Castle", issue #87.)
(A broken figurine of the Change God.)
(But there's only one, so it'd be rude to sit down.)

rooms/floor3/prayerroom.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/prayerroom.html.dialogue: ...Well, I thought there'd be something in this room, but...

rooms/floor3/prayerroom.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor3/prayerroom.html.dialogue: BUT IT'S A CRABBING DEAD END!!!!!!!!!

rooms/floor3/prayerroom.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/prayerroom.html.dialogue: Language.

rooms/floor3/prayerroom.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/prayerroom.html.dialogue: But there's an intact statue of the Change God over there... Isn't it the first we've seen in the House?

rooms/floor3/prayerroom.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/prayerroom.html.dialogue: I'm sorry, why are we back here?

rooms/floor3/prayerroom.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/prayerroom.html.dialogue: M'dame! Are you saying Sif was wrong to bring us all the way back to a room we already searched top to bottom because there's only one thing here?

rooms/floor3/prayerroom.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/prayerroom.html.dialogue: M'dame, you're so weird.
(Their face obscured, Their silhouette shrouded, Their expression hidden...)
(An intact statue of the Change God stands before you.)
(Everyone is lost in thought... Most likely sending their wishes to the Change God.)
(Join them?)
(Better than nothing.)
(You wish for victory.)
(You wish for victory.)
(You wish for rest.)
(You wish for eternity.)
(You thank the Change God for always giving you the KeyKnife.)
(Nothing to wish for.)
(Not yours, not yours, not yours.)
(He's looking at your clenched fists.)
(You  relax, and flash him an embarrassed smile.)

rooms/floor3/prayerroom.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/prayerroom.html.dialogue: ...Sif, are you--
(Wuh?)
(You're holding something...)
(You're holding the KEYKNIFE! (??????))
(You found the KEYKNIFE!)

rooms/floor3/prayerroom.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/prayerroom.html.dialogue: Siffrin??? Wh-what are you holding there???

rooms/floor3/prayerroom.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor3/prayerroom.html.dialogue: A KNIFE!!!!!!!!!!

rooms/floor3/prayerroom.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/prayerroom.html.dialogue: Did, did the Change God give it to us???

rooms/floor3/prayerroom.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/prayerroom.html.dialogue: Huh??? No, it can't--

rooms/floor3/prayerroom.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/prayerroom.html.dialogue: I think th-they did!!! With it, we can--

rooms/floor3/prayerroom.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/prayerroom.html.dialogue: WAH!!!!!

rooms/floor3/prayerroom.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/prayerroom.html.dialogue: What the--

rooms/floor3/prayerroom.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/prayerroom.html.dialogue: That's... Floor 3's entrance???

rooms/floor3/prayerroom.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor3/prayerroom.html.dialogue: The Change God beamed us there!!!

rooms/floor3/prayerroom.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/prayerroom.html.dialogue: That's...

rooms/floor3/prayerroom.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/prayerroom.html.dialogue: Well, at least we don't have to backtrack. I'm not gonna ask questions.

rooms/floor3/prayerroom.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/prayerroom.html.dialogue: Th-thank you Change God for this boon!!!

rooms/floor3/prayerroom.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/prayerroom.html.dialogue: Thanks Change God!

rooms/floor3/prayerroom.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor3/prayerroom.html.dialogue: Thank you!!!
(You and Odile look at each other, and shrug.)

rooms/floor3/prayerroom.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/prayerroom.html.dialogue: Thank you Change God, or Expressions, or whichever deity gave us this knife.
(You don't want to say thanks to it aloud.)
(An intact statue of the Change God.)
(This is the only intact statue in the House, so you can see its face clearly.)
(You look at it a little closer...)
(You stick your tongue out in disgust.)
(This statue's face looks awful.)
(Mirabelle's intact statue of the Change God.)
(You look at it a little closer...)

rooms/floor3/prayerroom.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor3/prayerroom.html.dialogue: Can noses look like that?

rooms/floor3/prayerroom.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/prayerroom.html.dialogue: Wow, that left eye is somehow above the right brow.

rooms/floor3/prayerroom.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/prayerroom.html.dialogue: I can't tell if they're supposed to be smiling or frowning...

rooms/floor3/prayerroom.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/prayerroom.html.dialogue: . . . Mira?
(Oh no.)

rooms/floor3/prayerroom.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/prayerroom.html.dialogue: Ah...

rooms/floor3/prayerroom.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor3/prayerroom.html.dialogue: Uh oh.

rooms/floor3/prayerroom.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/prayerroom.html.dialogue: ...I was trying to make them look gentle and nice...

rooms/floor3/prayerroom.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/prayerroom.html.dialogue: MIRA WE'RE SO SORRY!!!!!!!!!!!!

rooms/floor3/prayerroom.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor3/prayerroom.html.dialogue: SORRY WE SAID YOUR STATUE SUCKED!!!!!!!!!!

rooms/floor3/prayerroom.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/prayerroom.html.dialogue: N-no, no, it's fine...

rooms/floor3/prayerroom.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/prayerroom.html.dialogue: ...I'll get my revenge against you all someday.
(So Mirabelle made this statue...)
(Interesting that it's the only one that wasn't destroyed.)
(You know very little about the Change God, and the statues of them you can find everywhere in Vaugarde.)
(Maybe you should look at the statues inside the House, when you have the time...)
(You always found the Change Belief a little weird.)
(Mirabelle especially seems to think it's perfect, or something.)
(You're kind of curious. Maybe you should check this statue again later, once you know more about her thoughts on the Change Belief...)
(But, hm...)
(The statue is a link between the Change God and the Crafter, right?)
(You wonder what would happen if Mirabelle touched it right now.)

rooms/floor3/prayerroom.html.speaker: Siffrin
rooms/floor3/prayerroom.html.dialogue: "Mira, can you put your hand on the statue?"

rooms/floor3/prayerroom.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/prayerroom.html.dialogue: Hm? Um, sure?
(As soon as Mirabelle touches the statue, you hear something.)
fipchoooooooo

rooms/floor3/prayerroom.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/prayerroom.html.dialogue: WAH!!!!!!!!
(You make sure that Mirabelle doesn't come close to touching it.)
(An intact statue of the Change God.)
(Their face obscured, Their silhouette shrouded, Their expression hidden...)
(An intact statue of the Change God stands before you.)
(You wait.)
(You got the KEYKNIFE.)
(Why go all the way back?)
(The Change God won't help you.)

rooms/floor3/secret_room.html.dialogue: (It's a letter addressed to the writer's mother.)
(Sounds like someone ran away from home and had to reassure their mother they were doing okay.)

rooms/floor3/secret_room.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor3/secret_room.html.dialogue: They ran away from home?! Why would they do that?!

rooms/floor3/secret_room.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor3/secret_room.html.dialogue: Home is where the snacks are!

rooms/floor3/secret_room.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/secret_room.html.dialogue: You've never ran away from home, Bonbon? I'll have to take back that cool kid certificate from you.

rooms/floor3/secret_room.html.speaker: Siffrin
rooms/floor3/secret_room.html.dialogue: (You don't even have to think about it.) "I just didn't want to eat my veggies."

rooms/floor3/secret_room.html.speaker: Siffrin
rooms/floor3/secret_room.html.dialogue: "Got to the beach, rowed away from the shore a bit."

rooms/floor3/secret_room.html.speaker: Siffrin
rooms/floor3/secret_room.html.dialogue: "I was going to come back right away, I just wanted to scare my parents a bit!"

rooms/floor3/secret_room.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/secret_room.html.dialogue: A-And then, and then? What happened when you got back?

rooms/floor3/secret_room.html.speaker: Siffrin
rooms/floor3/secret_room.html.dialogue: "I started to row back towards the shore..."

rooms/floor3/secret_room.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/secret_room.html.dialogue: Um... You were telling us how you ran away from home?

rooms/floor3/secret_room.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor3/secret_room.html.dialogue: DID YOU FORGET WHAT YOU WERE TALKING ABOUT WHILE TALKING ABOUT IT?!?

rooms/floor3/secret_room.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/secret_room.html.dialogue: Seriously Sif, we have GOT to do something about your awful memory.

rooms/floor3/secret_room.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/secret_room.html.dialogue: Anyway, people who run away from home are... People who don't like their family, maybe.

rooms/floor3/secret_room.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/secret_room.html.dialogue: Um, sometimes parents can be meanies, and someone might decide to just... Leave?

rooms/floor3/secret_room.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor3/secret_room.html.dialogue: Oh... You can run away from home if your parents are meanies?

rooms/floor3/secret_room.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor3/secret_room.html.dialogue: Oh! That's what Nille did! I think!

rooms/floor3/secret_room.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor3/secret_room.html.dialogue: My sister! I think she told me about it once.

rooms/floor3/secret_room.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor3/secret_room.html.dialogue: But I wasn't listening very well because I was sleepy.
(No one really knows how to respond to that.)

rooms/floor3/secret_room.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor3/secret_room.html.dialogue: Huh? What? What? What did I say?

rooms/floor3/secret_room.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/secret_room.html.dialogue: N-Nothing at all, Boniface. Should we look at something other than an old letter?
(You give them all to Bonnie for safekeeping.)
(This bookcase is filled with romance novels.)

rooms/floor3/secret_room.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/secret_room.html.dialogue: I understand the kid's reaction, but why "urgh", m'dame?

rooms/floor3/secret_room.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/secret_room.html.dialogue: Don't sound so disgusted, madame!!! Romance novels are good!!!

rooms/floor3/secret_room.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/secret_room.html.dialogue: I'm just the kind of person who has decided romantic love is not very important to me, Mirabelle.

rooms/floor3/secret_room.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/secret_room.html.dialogue: Ha-have you...Have you never been in love before, madame Odile?"

rooms/floor3/secret_room.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/secret_room.html.dialogue: Huh? Oh, no, of course I've been in love before.

rooms/floor3/secret_room.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/secret_room.html.dialogue: It'd be weirder if I didn't, at my age.

rooms/floor3/secret_room.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/secret_room.html.dialogue: Hm... I did fall in love for the first time later than most... Maybe in my twenties?

rooms/floor3/secret_room.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/secret_room.html.dialogue: And even then, it took me a while to realize what I was feeling.

rooms/floor3/secret_room.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/secret_room.html.dialogue: At the time, I genuinely didn't know you could get crushes on people you hate, heh.

rooms/floor3/secret_room.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/secret_room.html.dialogue: Crushes can be annoying like that.

rooms/floor3/secret_room.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/secret_room.html.dialogue: My heart has been good to me though, so it hasn't happened to me in a long time!

rooms/floor3/secret_room.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/secret_room.html.dialogue: Why are you so surprised? You recommended me a romance novel that was about bitter enemies becoming lovers!

rooms/floor3/secret_room.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/secret_room.html.dialogue: A-AND I NEVER UNDERSTOOD WHY THEY WOULD DO THAT BUT THE STORY WAS WELL WRITTEN AND INTERESTING AND I JUST FIGURED IT WAS THEM BEING WEIRD!!!

rooms/floor3/secret_room.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/secret_room.html.dialogue: But...Isn't there a whole genre of romance books about... Enemies becoming lovers?

rooms/floor3/secret_room.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/secret_room.html.dialogue: I THOUGHT IT WAS A LOVE TROPE THAT DIDN'T HAVE ANY BASIS IN REALITY JUST LIKE HOW YOUR HEART DOESN'T ACTUALLY BEAT FASTER WHEN YOU SEE SOMEONE YOU LIKE!!!
(Isabeau puts a hand on Mirabelle's shoulder.)

rooms/floor3/secret_room.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/secret_room.html.dialogue: Conversations like these are why I hope we'll stay friends for a very long time, Mira.

rooms/floor3/secret_room.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/secret_room.html.dialogue: Oh! Isabeau, I'm so glad, I feel the sa--
(Wait, can you not choose who you get a crush on? It just happens?)
(Crushes feel like a disease to you, sometimes.)
(You want to tear those feelings out.)
(He probably can't help having a crush on you.)

rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.dialogue: I can't wait, we can't wait!!! We have to move on!!!

rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.dialogue: They can wait a little longer. Let's calm down and--

rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.dialogue:
The Head Housemaiden... She's so close! I can feel her! I need to
						help her!!!

rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.dialogue: She needs my help... Everyone in Vaugarde needs my help!!!
(She's upset, she's upset, you need to help--)
(You know it'll be fine, but you're still scared for her.)

(Isabeau takes a deep breath in, and out, and Mirabelle follows a
						beat later.)

rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.dialogue: The Head Housemaiden... I have to save her...

rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.dialogue: The Head Housemaiden... She's such a wonderful person.

rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.dialogue:
She helped me out so much! I couldn't do anything before I came to
						the House, I could barely sew my own clothes, and she helped me, she
						taught me...

rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.dialogue: I wouldn't be the person I am without her!

rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.dialogue: And when the King attacked...  She protected me.

rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.dialogue: Everyone... Everyone was being frozen in time around me...

rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.dialogue:
And the Head Housemaiden made sure I could escape! Made sure I
						lived!!!

rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.dialogue:
Do you mean... The power to survive the King's Curse? But wasn't
						that...

rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.dialogue: The Change God rarely does anything.

rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.dialogue:
The Change God just pushes us to greater heights, but rarely helps
						us themselves.

rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.dialogue:
The KeyKnife we got earlier... It was the first time I felt their
						help...

rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.dialogue:
But the Head Housemaiden Crafted a blessing so I'd survive. So I'd
						save her. Save everyone.

rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.dialogue:
Why wouldn't she use it herself? Why didn't she save Vaugarde
						herself? Why didn't she give her blessing to someone else?

rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.dialogue:
I don't know! I don't know!!! She shouldn't have used it... Not on
						someone like...!

rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.dialogue: I'm glad you're here with us!

rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.dialogue: Don't leave us behind! We're here! We want to help you!

rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.dialogue: Don't be stupid and run off ahead...

rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.dialogue: I'm sorry. I shouldn't have run off ahead...

rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.dialogue: Now it's m'dame Odile's turn to talk.

rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.dialogue: What? But you all were doing so well.

rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.dialogue: I want an emotional speech from you too, madame Odile!

rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.dialogue: Yeah, don't you see her tears? How can you say no to this face?

(To prove Isabeau's point, you make a grand gesture towards
						Mirabelle as if presenting a marvelous art piece.)

(You, Isabeau and Bonnie point at Mirabelle and look at Odile
						silently.)
(Without turning your head, you look at Odile silently.)

(Isabeau and Bonnie follow suit, with an exaggerated disappointed
						face.)

rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.dialogue:
Okay.  I think it's silly for you to wonder if you were the
						"right choice" this late in the game.

rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.dialogue:
You're the one that was chosen. You're the one that found the Orbs.
						You're the one that made it this far.

rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.dialogue:
So we can spend our very valuable time wondering if So-and-so
						could've saved Vaugarde better...

rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.dialogue:
But we're here.  You're here. And now, the King is the only
						thing standing in our way.

rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.dialogue:
So you can have your little breakdown after we kick him where it
						hurts and spit on his grave.

rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.dialogue:
A little too dry maybe. I'll give you an eight out of ten for
						effort.

rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.dialogue: Whose tummy is grumbling this time?

rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.dialogue: Well, your not-tummy seems hungry. Bonbon?

rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.dialogue: Oh, I still have snacks!!! And they're ready now!!!

rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.dialogue: Okay then ALL OF YOU SIT THE CRAB DOWN!!!!!!!!!

rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.dialogue:
Let's rest a bit, shall we? This might be our last chance to
						breathe...

(You all quietly look Mirabelle's way, trying to make sure she's
						alright...)

(Everyone quietly look Mirabelle's way, trying to make sure she's
						alright...)

rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.dialogue:
Oh! Um, yes. I got a little fired up, fighting that big Sadness,
						earlier...

rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.dialogue: But I feel better, now. I...

rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.dialogue: Hehehe, I'm doing breathing exercises! To stay calm!

rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.dialogue: Ah yes, the fabled Siffrin breathing exercises.

rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.dialogue: Told you he wasn't doing it for no reason! It had to help, somehow!

rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.dialogue:
And thank you for yesterday, too! I don't think I'd be this calm if
						we hadn't talked...

rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.dialogue: Ah, when you two spent some time together.

rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.dialogue: Yes! We had a good talk... It helped me realize some things.

rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.dialogue:
Aw, I'm glad! Nothing like a good talk between friends to feel
						better!

rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.dialogue:
And it seems you were hard at work yesterday, weren't you, Siffrin?
						Helping me out, along with Bonnie and madame Odile...

rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.dialogue:
I suppose that's what friends are for, isn't it? To help with
						important things.

(You traveled together, ate together, laughed together, so you
						thought it made you friends...)
(But Odile says the same thing every time, doesn't she?)

(It's pathetic, to come back here and hear the same thing over
						again.)
(Every time you stop for a snack break on Floor 1!)
(You know it's not the case, but you still have to say your lines.)
(You don't want to risk anything by changing the script, do you?)

rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.dialogue:
I don't remember her saying that, but sadly, this does sound like
						something Odile would say.
(But she says it every time, every blinding time--)
(Did she even say it, this loop?)

(When you stopped for a snack on the second floor... It was all
						different, so maybe it was different then, too...)
(Because she does say it, most of the time.)
(It's nice, to see them make sure you're not sad.)

rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.dialogue: Well. That does sound like something I'd say, yes.

rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.dialogue: I... don't know if I consider you all friends, per se.

rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.dialogue:
The five of us are just very different people, with different goals
						and thoughts. Our age difference makes it difficult for me to see
						you as "friends".

rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.dialogue: After all, why would an old lady be friends with a preteen?

rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.dialogue:
It's just strange. So no, to me, we aren't friends. The mere thought
						is absurd to me.

rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.dialogue: Way to bring down the morale, m'dame...

rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.dialogue: I don't think we're friends, but...

rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.dialogue:
But I would do anything to protect all of you. Horrible things, to
						be honest, as long as I could be sure you were all safe.

rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.dialogue:
And I think you'd all do the same for me. For anyone in our little
						group.

rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.dialogue: So... So "friends" doesn't fit, to me, but. . .

rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.dialogue: Like me and Nille! We stay together! We eat together! We say good morning and good night!

rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.dialogue: I have a difficult relationship with that word, but...

rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.dialogue: Family! What a lovely word to describe our relationship to each other!

rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.dialogue: I already thought of us like that, but it's kind of awkward to say it aloud, isn't it?

rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.dialogue: It is, a little bit. But we don't know what tomorrow, or even the next few hours have in store...

rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.dialogue: So while we are still together on this journey, we might as well say it. Say the unsaid.

rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.dialogue: Especially since Siffrin over here seemed to think I didn't care about him.
(All this time... You were trying to keep in mind what she said.)
(That you were just... Allies, to each other.)
(You hide your face under the rim of your hat.)
(You don't want to think about anything.)
(You still think it's the truth, to be honest.)
(No, it is, it is! It's real!)

(You're standing here right now, in front of them, they exist, you
						exist.)

(Just because you know what happens next doesn't mean it's not
						real.)
(Odile reaches over and ruffles your hair.)

rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.dialogue: Quite honestly, it doesn't seem to work out very well for you.

rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.dialogue: Hehe, Siffrin's hat is all lopsided now!

rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.dialogue: You look funny like this, Frin!!!
(You readjust your hat, and hide your face.)

rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.dialogue: Um, I'll start with the worst one.

rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.dialogue: Yeah... They're the ones I burnt...

rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.dialogue:
But I thought I should still keep them in case we get super duper
						hungry.

rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.dialogue: Don't be mean to the burnt samosas, they were delicious!

rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.dialogue: They really were. They're not the "worst" of anything.

rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.dialogue:
We all know palmiers. They're yummy, they're crunchy, they get
						crumbs everywhere. MOVING ON!

rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.dialogue: Okay, I've never tried it before, but--

rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.dialogue: So? So?! What do you think? I followed a recipe in a book!!!

rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.dialogue:
They're fried malanga and giraumon! Malanga is some kinda root and
						giraumon is some kinda pumpkin!

rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.dialogue: So, which one do you guys--
(Bonnie hands you the delectable yummy wonderful malanga fritters.)

(They might be your favorite fried food ever. Favorite food period,
						maybe.)

(You want to eat them whole so badly, but you HAVE to pace
						yourself.)
(They're so good so good so good so good!!!!!!)
(You can't help but flail your arms around.)

rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.dialogue: Okay, I've never tried it before, but I think I cooked them well!
(Bonnie sees you smile and puffs their chest proudly.)
(Bonnie sees you smile and puffs their chest proudly.)
(For some reason, Bonnie looks a little disappointed.)

rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.dialogue:
They're fried malanga and giraumon! Malanga is some kinda root and
						giraumon is some kinda pumpkin!

rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.dialogue: So, which one? Which snack do you guys want?!

(Bonnie hands you and Isabeau some of the burnt samosas, and
										keeps some for themself.)

rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.dialogue: Those have potatoes in them, right?

rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.dialogue: Yeah, because I LOVE potatoes in samosas.

rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.dialogue:
Hm... I seem to remember Sif saying the samosas they're used
										to didn't have potatoes in them...

rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.dialogue: Different recipes depending on cultures, I suppose.

rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.dialogue:
Yeah... I love samosas a whole whole WHOOOOLE lot, but some
										places make them with cheese in them...

rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.dialogue:
Gross. Why would you dirty a perfectly good samosa with
										cheese.
(You're more of a potatoes-in-samosas hater, but whatever.)

(The novelty has faded a bit, but you're happy to find them
										again.)

(They're still delicious, but now that you're not
										distracted, you can tell they taste different than how you
										remember.)

rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.speaker: Siffrin
rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.dialogue: (Maybe...) "You didn't add any spicy peppers, right?"

rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.dialogue: The recipe I found didn't say so, so I didn't...

rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.dialogue: Why? Is it bad? Did I mess it up?

(You just feel like they're missing some spicy peppers for
										some reason.)
(Still, you get ready to eat them all.)

(You used to eat an entire bowl of them in a heartbeat,
										giving yourself a tummy ache.)

(Your parents used to gently make fun of you for it, and. .
										.)
(After eating your snacks, everyone's health has been restored[!/.])

rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.dialogue: Being upset now... I shouldn't have... I should've kept it together.

rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.dialogue: We're all different kinds of upset right now! It's a stressful day!

rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.dialogue: Do you feel better now that you're eating?

rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.dialogue: And I'm less upset now, more...  Angry.

rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.dialogue: Yes. I feel more confident, too.

rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.dialogue: We'll definitely kick the King where it hurts.
(You got a MEMORY OF BUTT KICKING!)

[When equipped, Memory of Butt Kicking will make your Housemaiden
						revive one K.O.'d party member during a fight, once!]
(After eating your snacks, everyone's health has been restored[!/.])
(As you eat, you look at everyone.)
(Sometimes one of them sees you looking at them, and smiles at you.)
(This is nice. Even now, you're enjoying this.)
(It's perfect, this path. It's a lot of work, but it's real.)
(This is nice. Even now, you're enjoying this.)
(It's perfect, this path. It's a lot of work, but it's real.)

rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.dialogue: We'll definitely kick the King's butt!!!

rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.dialogue: Alright everyone, let's finish eating our snacks.

rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.dialogue: We have a King's butt to kick.
(Have you tried every single one of Bonnie's snacks?)
(Plantain chips, cookies, malanga fritters...  Yes, you have.)

(Just the fact that you've tasted them all... Means you've been
						looping for a while...)

(And even though you might be tired of some of them, they're all so
						different and delicious still.)

(How long did it take Bonnie to prepare all those snacks for
						today...?)

rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.dialogue: W-Well, of course I am!!! Stupid!!!!!!!!!!!!

rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.dialogue:
SOMEONE has to make sure you eat good things so you can be happy and
						not sad!!!

rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.dialogue: Hehe, thank you for taking care of us, Bonnie!

rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.dialogue: Thanks Bonbon! You're the best, Bonbon!!!
(You got a MEMORY OF SAFE ROOMS!)

[When equipped, Memory of Safe Rooms lets you recover all your HP
						after a battle ends.]

rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.dialogue: Is Belle okay? Is she okay?

rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.dialogue: I think she's okay because she ate some snacks.

rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.dialogue: It's when you can't eat that you're not doing well at all.
(That hasn't been your experience so far.)
(You feel like it's about to cave in on itself.)

rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.dialogue: . . .  Did you like those malanga thingies?

rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.dialogue:
I made them for you, you know!!! I saw you look at a recipe book for
						a very long time and you were looking at that recipe!!!

rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.dialogue:
And I didn't know if you were staring at it because you really liked
						it or really hated it...

rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.dialogue: So I'm glad you actually really...  Liked... it...

rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.dialogue:
F-for Dile!!! I made them for Dile!!! Because she likes to try out
						new foods!!!

rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.dialogue: I made them for Dile. Not for you.

rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.dialogue: Go away now!!! Don't look at me!!! Make like a crab and go!!!

rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.dialogue: What? What is it? Are you still hungry?

rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.dialogue: Here, have some more malanga fritters.
(Bonnie fills your cupped hands with fritters.)

rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.dialogue: Eat them, 'kay? You look weird. I think you're out of keylories.

rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.dialogue: I think you're out of calories.

rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.dialogue: You know, you know, I made them for you!!!

rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.dialogue: JUST GO!!!!!! DON'T LOOK AT ME!!!!!!

rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.dialogue: Let me know if you're still hungry, okay?

rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.dialogue: Would you, perhaps, accept a comb?
(You nod, and get your hand out to receive the comb.)
(You nod, and get your hand out again.)

rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.dialogue: Would you, perhaps, allow me to brush your hair?

rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.dialogue: Oh, that's completely fine! I just thought I'd ask, since--

rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.dialogue:
WAIT YOU SAID YES TO
GETTING YOUR HAIR BRUSHED
(Slightly farther, you hear someone gasp and curse.)

rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.dialogue: Quick, quick, sit down in front of me, do it, do it!!!
(Mirabelle slowly and methodically starts combing your hair.)

rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.dialogue: Finally... I can repay the favor!

rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.dialogue:
You did my hair so wonderfully a few weeks ago, so I'm glad I get to
						brush your hair in return...

rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.dialogue: I was surprised you had experience taking care of kinky hair, too!

rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.dialogue:
Ah... Look, your hair is split everywhere! You should take better
						care of it!!!

rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.dialogue: Such a shame... It's such a nice bright shade, too.

rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.dialogue:
Will you dye your hair again? I think you should let it grow out.
						Light hair suits you so well!
(You can barely hear what she's saying.)

(You can feel your tension, and Mirabelle's, fade as she takes care
						of you.)
(Mirabelle chatters on for a few minutes... Until...)
(You close your eyes, and don't think about anything.)
(...Isn't it strange, that you know how to style kinky hair?)
(Did you use to style someone's hair?)

rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.dialogue: All good! You're all ready for the King, now!

rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.dialogue: Yes, we do have to be beautiful to appear in front of him.

rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.dialogue: We do, m'dame. Gotta appear fierce.

rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.dialogue: She's strong, but this situation must be super stressful for her.

rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.dialogue: We gotta stay at her side, okay, Sif?

rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.dialogue: Um, well, it's just something me and Mira noticed.

rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.dialogue:
Sometimes, when you're taken off guard, or when we get out of battle
						or something, you always take a deep breath in and out!

rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.dialogue: It's to calm yourself down, right? The breathing?

rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.dialogue: You always do it the exact same way, too! You go like this...
(Isabeau puts his hand on his chest, and breathes.)

rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.dialogue:
Mira and I wondered what that was all about, and we talked about it
						and realized it kinda seemed to calm you down, and we thought it was
						cool...

rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.dialogue:
And that one time a few days ago, Bonnie was upset and you told them
						to do that, so we remembered.
(How weird! To be noticed, and known!)
(You've had to do that more often lately.)
(Breathing doesn't seem to make anything better anymore.)

rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.dialogue:
Was telling you weird? I think that was weird. I shouldn't have said
						that because now you might get self-conscious.

rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.dialogue: Yeah, Isabeau... You should be careful...

rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.dialogue: You might make Siffrin self-conscious about breathing... Hehehe...

rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.dialogue:
Oh, okay, we're ignoring that whole thing, sure, that's fine, we can
						do this if you want.

rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.dialogue:
We can also ignore how you're acting weird and how you stop smiling
						every time you think we're not looking.

rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.dialogue:
I'll give you one last chance though, would you like to sit down and
						have a talky-talk? About what just happened?

rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.dialogue:
But when we're done, and we've won... And we eat dinner tonight,
						having beaten the King... Before we go our separate ways...

rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.dialogue: We will have. The feelings talky-talk.
(For better or worse, you'll never have that talk.)

rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.dialogue: OH! You said "sure"! We are gonna have this talk!

rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.dialogue: Caught you! You're stuck now! You WILL be emotionally vulnerable!
(But don't you have another talk with Isabeau planned?)
(Oh, so now HE'S asking you to be emotionally vulnerable?)
(Isabeau freezes in the middle of his sentence.)

rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.dialogue:
Y-Yes! That other talk. The one I said I would have with you last
						night in the Clocktower after we went back. Yes. That talk. Yes. Uh
						huh.

rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.dialogue: T-Two talks, Sif!!! One talk each!!! We can get through this!!!
(Isabeau gives you a shaky thumbs up.)
(Isabeau seems to be thinking about the fight ahead...)

rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.dialogue: Please don't get self-conscious about breathing, though.

rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.dialogue:
Oh crab... I forgot all about that... I can't go through a feelings
						talky-talk AFTER that... That'd be impossible...

rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.dialogue:
You're still here, hahaha! Want a snack? Here's a palmier,
						bye!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

(Isabeau gives you a palmier, which you eat whole immediately, and
						looks away from you.)

rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.dialogue:
A lot of emotions being expressed right now,
						aren't there?

rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.dialogue:
...  I feel bad that I didn't notice
						Mirabelle wasn't doing well. I should've paid more attention...

rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.dialogue:
Yes. Neither of us is very good at this "feelings" thing, and
						Boniface is a child still learning how to manage theirs...

rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.dialogue:
So it's good we have at least one person who knows what they're
						doing, emotions-wise.

rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.dialogue:
So.  In the spirit of being a person good at this "feelings"
						thing...

rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.dialogue: How are you feeling right now?
(You don't know if you'll ever beat the King, but...)
(Why is she asking you this again?)
(You open your mouth to ask how she is, but...)

rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.dialogue: Feelings check over, go away now.

rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.dialogue:
Well, as long as it doesn't get in the way of our victory, I
										suppose you can feel however you want.

rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.dialogue: Are you? Because you look a bit out of it to me.

rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.dialogue: You've been acting weird since yesterday, actually.

rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.speaker: Siffrin
rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.dialogue: (You try not to flinch.) "I'm all fine, I swear!"

rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.dialogue:
And if you think everyone hasn't noticed how weird you've
										been acting...

rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.dialogue: That dumb smile isn't as convincing as you think it is.

rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.dialogue:
Sorry for messing up your hair, earlier. I know you don't usually
						like to be touched.

rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.dialogue: But I think you needed it this time, right?
(You stay silent, and readjust your hat.)

rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.dialogue: ... If I can help with anything, Siffrin, just let me know.

rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.dialogue:
You and I are very private people, but we need to learn to open up
						every once in a while, don't you think?

rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.dialogue:
Hm. Of course not. As I've said, it's not a skill we're very good
						at.

rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.dialogue:
But... Know that I'll always be here, if you decide to do so before
						we part ways.

rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.dialogue: Go away. I need a break from talking.

rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/snackbreak3.html.dialogue: The King must be up ahead...
(No, wait, you can't let them go--
(Your head is splitting in two)
(The smell of sugar surrounding you is making you want to throw up)
(y o u j u  s t  n e e d t o d ef e a t  t h e K i n g o n  y o u  r   o    w   n)

rooms/floor3/starroom.html.dialogue: (This gate is locked...)
(It looks different than the gates you've seen so far.)
(The lock keeping it closed has an interesting shape... It doesn't have a hole for a key..)
(The door has a sentence written above the lock, too.)
(But you can't read it.)

rooms/floor3/starroom.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/starroom.html.dialogue: Such an imposing door, though... I don't remember ever seeing it before!

rooms/floor3/starroom.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/starroom.html.dialogue: Hm... There's some text written above the door, though, look.

rooms/floor3/starroom.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/starroom.html.dialogue: It says... Yyyyyyeoooooowch.

rooms/floor3/starroom.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/starroom.html.dialogue: "Yeowch"?

rooms/floor3/starroom.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/starroom.html.dialogue: No, no, it's just... My head hurts.
(You could read it, if you equipped the Memory for it.)
(This gate is locked...)
(It's locked by one of those weird word locks.)
(There's something written above the lock, too.)
(Maybe you should take a closer look...)
(You cannot read what is written above the lock.)

rooms/floor3/starroom.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/starroom.html.dialogue: Just trying to read this makes my head hurt.
(You could read it, if you equipped the Memory for it.)
(You can read it, now.)
(It's asking a question.)
(You answer it aloud.)
(The door unlocks.)

rooms/floor3/starroom.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/starroom.html.dialogue: Huh...? What did you say, Sif?

rooms/floor3/starroom.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/starroom.html.dialogue: I couldn't hear it either... Did you say something...?
(You open the door.)
(You say the word "Change" aloud.)
(Nothing happens.)

rooms/floor3/starroom.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/starroom.html.dialogue: Worth a try!
(You say the sentence "Stostorage roomoom" aloud.)
(Nothing happens.)

rooms/floor3/starroom.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/starroom.html.dialogue: Worth a try!
(You say the sentence "Openphrase123" aloud.)
(Nothing happens.)

rooms/floor3/starroom.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/starroom.html.dialogue: Worth a try!
(Star charts.)

rooms/floor3/starroom.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/starroom.html.dialogue: What is this?

rooms/floor3/starroom.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor3/starroom.html.dialogue: It has lots of balls attached to it.

rooms/floor3/starroom.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/starroom.html.dialogue: And there's a lever, here... If we turn it, it seems the balls will move around this big middle ball.

rooms/floor3/starroom.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/starroom.html.dialogue: Does it represent something? It looks familiar somehow...

rooms/floor3/starroom.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/starroom.html.dialogue: Yes, I feel like I've seen something like this before...

rooms/floor3/starroom.html.speaker: Siffrin
rooms/floor3/starroom.html.dialogue: "It's called an orrery."

rooms/floor3/starroom.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/starroom.html.dialogue: An orrery...?

rooms/floor3/starroom.html.speaker: Siffrin
rooms/floor3/starroom.html.dialogue: "It's a machine to calculate the positions of astronomical objects!"

rooms/floor3/starroom.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor3/starroom.html.dialogue: Astro-what?

rooms/floor3/starroom.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor3/starroom.html.dialogue: Oh, you mean like...

rooms/floor3/starroom.html.speaker: Siffrin
rooms/floor3/starroom.html.dialogue: "Like, stars and planets and stuff!"

rooms/floor3/starroom.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/starroom.html.dialogue: Hm... Interesting...

rooms/floor3/starroom.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/starroom.html.dialogue: How do you know this, Siffrin?

rooms/floor3/starroom.html.speaker: Siffrin
rooms/floor3/starroom.html.dialogue: "Like, stars and planets and stuff!"

rooms/floor3/starroom.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/starroom.html.dialogue: Who would need to calculate this?

rooms/floor3/starroom.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/starroom.html.dialogue: Hehehe...

rooms/floor3/starroom.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/starroom.html.dialogue: For once, Siffrin hasn't forgotten something, but we all have!
(This is an orrery.)
(You remember this, at least.)
(You try to keep the word close to your heart.)
(You don't know when you'll start forgetting it again, so you might as well enjoy it while you can.)
(But there must be a reason why the world forgot it all, right?)
(The Universe wanted it this way? What was that saying, again?)
("The Universe leads, you can only follow".)
(Ooooooh, you followed, you follow, you will follow, but you are tired!)
(You are bound to the Universe's will the same way the moon is bound to this planet, the same way this planet is bound to the sun, the same way a puppet is bound to its strings!!!!!!)
(You suffer, and you suffer, and you suffer, and you have to believe it is for it, for its entertainment, but you know, don't you?)
(The Universe is empty! No one is watching!)
(Nothing matters in this world, not even your own grief!)
(You're nothing, your pain is nothing, and no one is watching!)
(You've forgotten what this is, already, again, once more.)
(A telescope.)
(It's broken.)
(Broken telescope.)
(But it's still part of the Universe, even if it can't see it!)
(Aaah, are you still part of the Universe, even if you're broken, too?)
(Does the Universe still see you, even when you can't see It?)
(The Universe is infinite and always growing, so isn't its compassion infinite as well?!)
(Hello! Hello! Hello! You're here! You said it three times, so the Universe must hear!)
(But the only thing that answers is silence, as always!)
(Broken telescope.)
(A drawer.)
(You open it...)
(There's a beautiful hat inside.)
(It's very similar to yours.)
(You got the STARRY HAT!)
(You put the hat in your Pockets to equip later.)
(There's--)
(--Nothing inside.)
(But the Starry Hat was here before. You remember.)
(A drawer.)
(It's empty now.)
(A drawer.)
(It's empty now.)
(A journal with a star on its cover.)
(It looks very old. Feels like it'd break apart in one touch...)

rooms/floor3/starroom.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/starroom.html.dialogue: I want to read it so bad.

rooms/floor3/starroom.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/starroom.html.dialogue: Please, let's stop wasting time and reading every book we come across.

rooms/floor3/starroom.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/starroom.html.dialogue: NO.
(You'd rather not have to read anything about stars right now.)
(Thinking about the stars right now is like touching a hot stove.)
(Maybe after you finish helping your [allies/family members].)
(If the book has a star on it, it must be important, right?)
(You get closer to the book.)

rooms/floor3/starroom.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/starroom.html.dialogue: Urgh, fine.

rooms/floor3/starroom.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/starroom.html.dialogue: Let's do it! Be careful handling it, though...
(Mirabelle carefully takes the book in her hands, and flips through the pages.)

rooms/floor3/starroom.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/starroom.html.dialogue: Hm...

rooms/floor3/starroom.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/starroom.html.dialogue: It's a little long. Seems like it's the diary of a very sad person...

rooms/floor3/starroom.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor3/starroom.html.dialogue: Why sad? What happened to them?

rooms/floor3/starroom.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/starroom.html.dialogue: They don't actually say... It just feels like they lived through some hard times, and everyone around them seems to brush their worries aside...

rooms/floor3/starroom.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/starroom.html.dialogue: Everyone is acting as if everything's fine, when this person continues to suffer.

rooms/floor3/starroom.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/starroom.html.dialogue: Bummer.

rooms/floor3/starroom.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor3/starroom.html.dialogue: More like "boring". Read a passage!

rooms/floor3/starroom.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/starroom.html.dialogue: Um, sure... Well...

rooms/floor3/starroom.html.speaker: Sad Diary
rooms/floor3/starroom.html.dialogue: "No one can understand what I've been through. Not my friends, not my family, no one."

rooms/floor3/starroom.html.speaker: Sad Diary
rooms/floor3/starroom.html.dialogue: "If no one can understand me, if I'm doomed to never be truly seen by another..."

rooms/floor3/starroom.html.speaker: Sad Diary
rooms/floor3/starroom.html.dialogue: "If I'm the only one who can understand what I've gone through..."

rooms/floor3/starroom.html.speaker: Sad Diary
rooms/floor3/starroom.html.dialogue: "Then, couldn't I just create another self? Another me?"

rooms/floor3/starroom.html.speaker: Sad Diary
rooms/floor3/starroom.html.dialogue: "Someone I could talk to, who could understand?"

rooms/floor3/starroom.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor3/starroom.html.dialogue: Huh?!

rooms/floor3/starroom.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/starroom.html.dialogue: Oh, interesting! NOW we're getting somewhere!

rooms/floor3/starroom.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/starroom.html.dialogue: Talking to another self, to come to terms with what they've gone through...

rooms/floor3/starroom.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor3/starroom.html.dialogue: But in the end, they'd still be alone, right?

rooms/floor3/starroom.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/starroom.html.dialogue: Sometimes, you just need a voice that answers back, Bonbon!

rooms/floor3/starroom.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor3/starroom.html.dialogue: Hm...

rooms/floor3/starroom.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/starroom.html.dialogue: It would just be an echo chamber, though. You'd never get to any good conclusion, talking to yourself endlessly...

rooms/floor3/starroom.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/starroom.html.dialogue: I suppose they felt so alone they saw no other recourse, though.

rooms/floor3/starroom.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/starroom.html.dialogue: But tell me, Mirabelle... Do they get a rude wake up call, as they realize creating another self is absolutely impossible?

rooms/floor3/starroom.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/starroom.html.dialogue: Yeah... Using Craft to change a body is already hard enough...

rooms/floor3/starroom.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/starroom.html.dialogue: Creating a whole new one, AND identical to another, AND one able to talk back? That's just impossible.

rooms/floor3/starroom.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/starroom.html.dialogue: Um, they spend a good chunk here trying to figure out how to do it...

rooms/floor3/starroom.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/starroom.html.dialogue: It's a lot of complicated theory. Their writing seems to be getting more frantic, too... It's barely legible, in places.

rooms/floor3/starroom.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/starroom.html.dialogue: Of course. Realizing this can't be done.

rooms/floor3/starroom.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/starroom.html.dialogue: That's kinda sad.

rooms/floor3/starroom.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/starroom.html.dialogue: Oh...? This page... It only has a few words, but...

rooms/floor3/starroom.html.speaker: Sad Diary
rooms/floor3/starroom.html.dialogue: "I've figured it out. How to create another me."

rooms/floor3/starroom.html.speaker: Sad Diary
rooms/floor3/starroom.html.dialogue: "Body Craft didn't work. Crafting clay didn't work. Nor wood, or marble. Nothing worked."

rooms/floor3/starroom.html.speaker: Sad Diary
rooms/floor3/starroom.html.dialogue: "But one thing could."

rooms/floor3/starroom.html.speaker: Sad Diary
rooms/floor3/starroom.html.dialogue: " Wish Craft ."

rooms/floor3/starroom.html.speaker: Sad Diary
rooms/floor3/starroom.html.dialogue: "Wish Craft will make my wish come true."

rooms/floor3/starroom.html.speaker: Sad Diary
rooms/floor3/starroom.html.dialogue: "I just have to do it."

rooms/floor3/starroom.html.speaker: Sad Diary
rooms/floor3/starroom.html.dialogue: "I just have to ask."
(Wish Craft!!!)
(The King mentioned Wish Craft before, didn't he?!)
(He seemed to imply it was used to trap you in this time loop, didn't he!!!)
(So it IS real...)
(It's real, it's real.)
(You hide your smile by covering your mouth.)

rooms/floor3/starroom.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/starroom.html.dialogue: Siffrin?

rooms/floor3/starroom.html.speaker: Siffrin
rooms/floor3/starroom.html.dialogue: "And then? And then?"
(Wish Craft...)

rooms/floor3/starroom.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/starroom.html.dialogue: Oh, and then...
(Mirabelle turns the page.)

rooms/floor3/starroom.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/starroom.html.dialogue: Oh!

rooms/floor3/starroom.html.speaker: Sad Diary
rooms/floor3/starroom.html.dialogue: "My wish came true."

rooms/floor3/starroom.html.speaker: Sad Diary
rooms/floor3/starroom.html.dialogue: "I will always be understood, now."

rooms/floor3/starroom.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/starroom.html.dialogue: Huh!

rooms/floor3/starroom.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/starroom.html.dialogue: Happy for them, I suppose.

rooms/floor3/starroom.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor3/starroom.html.dialogue: So they did it? They created another them?

rooms/floor3/starroom.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor3/starroom.html.dialogue: Wish... "Wish Craft"? What's Wish Craft?

rooms/floor3/starroom.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/starroom.html.dialogue: Surely a type of Craft they invented for this tale.

rooms/floor3/starroom.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/starroom.html.dialogue: As we've said, it's impossible to create a copy of yourself.

rooms/floor3/starroom.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/starroom.html.dialogue: Interesting premise, though!

rooms/floor3/starroom.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/starroom.html.dialogue: And making this fictional tale look like an old diary was interesting.

rooms/floor3/starroom.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/starroom.html.dialogue: Too bad Wish Craft isn't real, though. I'd wish for stuff, too!

rooms/floor3/starroom.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/starroom.html.dialogue: With Wish Craft... Interesting that there's another book mentioning it, here.

rooms/floor3/starroom.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/starroom.html.dialogue: It is, isn't it?
(But it is real. It has to be.)
(It has to be!!!)
(You have to tell Loop about this!!!)
(But it is real. It has to be.)
(You smile.)
(This journal looks older than you are.)
(This room is very dusty, too... You're probably the only ones to enter it in years.)
(You wonder who wrote this.)
(The journal with a star on its cover.)
(The journal is old, old, far older than you are.)
(You've heard that story before, you remember now. Before this play even started.)
(It was a story told to you, when you were a child. To make you fall asleep.)
(A cautionary tale of some kind, even if you could never remember the moral of the story)
(but you loved that story, the idea of finding someone that's just like you, that would understand all of you, because they ARE you)
(you thought it would be so nice)
("A story told to you, when you were a child"...?)
(Back to it.)
(The journal with a star on its cover.)
(A bookcase.)
(All the books are so old they'd probably disintegrate in a single touch.)
(Bookcase.)
(Why are you alone, again? Why did you leave on your own, again?)
(You're here because you wanted to stay with everyone, didn't you?)
(Why are you the only one standing here, in this House?)
(This isn't it.)
(This isn't what you wanted.)
(This isn't what you--
(Bookcase.)

rooms/floor3/writing_room.html.dialogue: (There's a space in between two books, like someone removed it.)
(...Ah, Bonnie seems to be reading it intently.)
(It has a very striking cover of a Mwudu clay figurine with large, sunken eyes and a screaming mouth.)
(Bonnie hides the book in their pocket.)

rooms/floor3/writing_room.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor3/writing_room.html.dialogue: N-nothing!!! It's nothing!!! Nothing at all!!!

rooms/floor3/writing_room.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor3/writing_room.html.dialogue: Shut up!!! It's fine!!! I'm fine!!!

rooms/floor3/writing_room.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor3/writing_room.html.dialogue: ...S-stop looking at it, stop looking at me!!! Shut up!!!
(There's a space in between two books, like someone removed it.)
(Bonnie took the book with the weird figurine on the cover with them, like they did the first time.)
(The cover with a Mwudu clay figurine with large, sunken eyes, and a screaming mouth...)
(You're curious. Can you find that book elsewhere?)
(You know which book Bonnie is reading, but...)
(You don't look at them, or at Bonnie.)
(Bonnie hasn't taken the book this time.)

rooms/floor3/writing_room.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor3/writing_room.html.dialogue: I know, I'm very strong and cool, aren't I? I am! I really am!!!
(It's a poem about lovers on a bridge.)
(It's a poem about someone going to a grave.)
(It's a poem about a fox and a crow.)
(There's a note with the word "openphrase123" written on it.)
(What's an openphrase? You leave the note alone.)
(You look at it a little closer...)

rooms/floor3/writing_room.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/writing_room.html.dialogue: Is that... An openphrase for something?

rooms/floor3/writing_room.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/writing_room.html.dialogue: That sounds very safe and not at all stupid.
(There's a note with the word "openphrase123" written on it.)
(You give it to Bonnie for safekeeping.)
(You find an anthology of horror stories.)
(On the cover, a handsome young man looks into the night fearfully but longingly.)

rooms/floor3/writing_room.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/writing_room.html.dialogue: Oooh, Mira, looks like the kinda books you like, yeah?

rooms/floor3/writing_room.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/writing_room.html.dialogue: Horror books... This one looks massive! What's this one ca--

rooms/floor3/writing_room.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/writing_room.html.dialogue: THAT'S THE "HANDSOME YOUNG MEN FALLING INTO BEAUTIFUL HEARTBREAKING MADNESS" HORROR ANTHOLOGY!!!
(You don't jump this time. You're prepared.)

rooms/floor3/writing_room.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/writing_room.html.dialogue: DID... DID SOMEONE IN THE HOUSE HAVE IT ALL THIS TIME?

rooms/floor3/writing_room.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor3/writing_room.html.dialogue: Did someone keep it from you???

rooms/floor3/writing_room.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/writing_room.html.dialogue: It's a full anthology all about pure-hearted boys being subjected to awful monsters and horror situations!!!

rooms/floor3/writing_room.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/writing_room.html.dialogue:
Seeing them screaming in fright...
I cannot help but root for them, and at the same time be happy I am not in their situation!!!

rooms/floor3/writing_room.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/writing_room.html.dialogue: There is something lovingly touching about those tales, something wonderfully hopeful!!!

rooms/floor3/writing_room.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/writing_room.html.dialogue: I cannot help but read them and pray for their survival!!!

rooms/floor3/writing_room.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor3/writing_room.html.dialogue: So... So do they usually survive? Or do the monsters catch them?

rooms/floor3/writing_room.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/writing_room.html.dialogue: B-but also...! The catharsis that fills my whole being when they get caught... There is something very wonderful about that, too!!!

rooms/floor3/writing_room.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/writing_room.html.dialogue: Don't worry about it, Bonbon. I too am also lost.

rooms/floor3/writing_room.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/writing_room.html.dialogue: It's just, it's very good!!! Very moving!!!! Makes me feel like I went on a run!!!

rooms/floor3/writing_room.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/writing_room.html.dialogue: And also sometimes the heroes end up bonding with the monsters, too...

rooms/floor3/writing_room.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/writing_room.html.dialogue: Oh, romance!!! I understand the romance part!!!

rooms/floor3/writing_room.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/writing_room.html.dialogue: Books about terrible things happening to good people, huh...

rooms/floor3/writing_room.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/writing_room.html.dialogue: When we finally get our book club going, I would love to know if you have more books like this one.
(You hope they get to have their book club soon.)

rooms/floor3/writing_room.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/writing_room.html.dialogue: I understand all those parts, actually... Any books you'd recommend?

rooms/floor3/writing_room.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/writing_room.html.dialogue: Absolutely!!! I'll lend you some of my favorites once we...

rooms/floor3/writing_room.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/writing_room.html.dialogue: Well... Once we finally escape a horror tale of our own, I suppose...

rooms/floor3/writing_room.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/writing_room.html.dialogue: Haha... I'm looking forward to it.
(The horror anthology isn't on the shelves anymore.)
(As always, Mirabelle took it with her.)
(Haha, and you remembered this scene by heart, didn't you?)
(Aren't you happy? Isn't this what you wanted, from the very beginning?)
(There's a bunch of unfinished poems on the desk.)
(Isabeau slaps his hand on one of them.)

rooms/floor3/writing_room.html.speaker: Unfinished Poem
rooms/floor3/writing_room.html.dialogue: "When you look at me   I feel   like one."

rooms/floor3/writing_room.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/writing_room.html.dialogue: No, it's just someone's unfinished poem.

rooms/floor3/writing_room.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/writing_room.html.dialogue: Do we have time? Do we really have time to do this right n--

rooms/floor3/writing_room.html.speaker: Bonnie
rooms/floor3/writing_room.html.dialogue: The person who wrote this is the orange, right?

rooms/floor3/writing_room.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/writing_room.html.dialogue: That seems to be one interpretation, yes.

rooms/floor3/writing_room.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/writing_room.html.dialogue: Hm, hm, very literal, very nice...

rooms/floor3/writing_room.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/writing_room.html.dialogue: Blood oranges...? Something with that... Something bloody but poetic...

rooms/floor3/writing_room.html.speaker: Odile
rooms/floor3/writing_room.html.dialogue: I haven't heard a single good idea yet.

rooms/floor3/writing_room.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/writing_room.html.dialogue: M'dame, do you have something then?

rooms/floor3/writing_room.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/writing_room.html.dialogue: Yeah, yeah, leaving us young people to do the job, I get it.

rooms/floor3/writing_room.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/writing_room.html.dialogue: In poetry, they call that a cliffhanger!

rooms/floor3/writing_room.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/writing_room.html.dialogue: Bloody AND poetic!!! I like it!

rooms/floor3/writing_room.html.speaker: Mirabelle
rooms/floor3/writing_room.html.dialogue: I just... didn't think this would be the type of writing you navigated towards, though?

rooms/floor3/writing_room.html.speaker: Isabeau
rooms/floor3/writing_room.html.dialogue: ...That's the power of writing for you!!!
(A note for a festival that was supposed to take place...)
(...You don't know what today's date is, so you're not sure when this festival is supposed to take place.)

rooms/king/kingfight-act5.html.speaker: King
rooms/king/kingfight-act5.html.dialogue: I am surprised to see you alone, facing me......

rooms/king/kingfight-act5.html.speaker: King
rooms/king/kingfight-act5.html.dialogue: I was expecting at least that that Housemaiden would come.

rooms/king/kingfight-act5.html.speaker: King
rooms/king/kingfight-act5.html.dialogue: And yet, you, bright one, are the only one before me......

rooms/king/kingfight-act5.html.speaker: King
rooms/king/kingfight-act5.html.dialogue: Are you sure you want to do this......?

rooms/king/kingfight-act5.html.speaker: King
rooms/king/kingfight-act5.html.dialogue: I can tell, young one......

rooms/king/kingfight-act5.html.speaker: King
rooms/king/kingfight-act5.html.dialogue: I can tell we hail from the same country.

rooms/king/kingfight-act5.html.speaker: King
rooms/king/kingfight-act5.html.dialogue: I don't want to fight you.

rooms/king/kingfight-act5.html.speaker: King
rooms/king/kingfight-act5.html.dialogue: WE COULD GET IT ALL BACK, BRIGHT ONE!

rooms/king/kingfight-act5.html.speaker: King
rooms/king/kingfight-act5.html.dialogue: But perhaps the time for talking is long past.
